description:
What a fine place to get an evening snack. I have to say, for a city that's always got me teetering on the brink of chilly and sweaty, the folks here know ice cream really well.

Humphry Slocombe has an exemplary staff that makes the best treats. I love that half their case rotates with the seasons. Being able to purchase pints of their most iconic flavors is also a plus. And honestly, who doesn't feel happy nibbling on mouthfuls of sugary delight while sitting on an old-timely stool?

This is one of the best places to take family and friends in town. It's got decent variety in dairy-free flavors, and all their ice cream is ultra-pasteurized, making it safe for pregnant women (we asked). Everyone who works here is courteous and knowledgeable about the products, so it's an excellent introduction into artisanal ice cream. 

The best flavors (in my humble opinion) are the Vietnamese coffee and blueberry boy bait. Both are delightfully sweet without causing a toothache. Plus, they're twists on classic ice cream flavors that speak volumes to how creamy good ice cream can become, and they fill the need for comforting flavors when you're having a bad day. It's the best pick for scooped ice cream in this part of town.
author: Gwen W.

description:
I wish I could have Secret Breakfast for breakfast every day. I swear mom, all detrimental effects to physical health would be more than offset by the benefits to my mental health.

This flavor is remarkably well-balanced: the boozy bourbon flavor cuts through the richness and sweetness while the cornflake clusters inside add great textural contrast. I've shelled out $10 for an entire pint of this and happily devoured it in a single sitting.

Detracting one star for being pretty pricey, but I guess this is the Ferry Building after all.
author: Harry X.

description:
Humphry Slocombe's Ice Cream Truck (Big Betty) was a huge success amongst our wedding guests, who beared chilly evening San Francisco weather to queue outside for ice cream.  Some guests triple-fisted (carrying 2-3 scoops) while others went back for second helpings.

The best parts:
1) Flavorful local ice cream was a hit amongst our guests.

We included a dairy-free POG Sorbet option as part of our 5 flavors (Tahitian Vanilla, Dark Chocolate Smoked Sea Salt, Matchadoodle, Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee), which seemed to be sufficiently diverse options for our guests.  

2) Great staff:
We loved working with Abria, who was responsive to our logistical questions - ranging from flavor selection and deposits to parking the big truck on the day-of event.  

The day-of serving staff at our event were also awesome, and kept a 10+ person line moving.

3) The truck was free-standing, and didn't require separate external electricity sources.

Cons: None!

Would highly recommend a Humphry's ice cream truck for future private & special events.
author: Tiffany K.

description: Demolished the fudge brownie delite with blue bottle Vietnamese cold brew ice cream, which has a warm brownie and hot fudge sauce. ($8.50) DELICIOUS! I highly highly recommend it!
author: Guneet K.

description:
Cute little ice cream parlor near where I was staying. This was recommended to me by my airbnb host. Humphry sells unique flavors of ice cream. My boyfriend and I got the secret breakfast to share. Very strong flavor of bourbon and the corn flakes in it were kind of annoying since it was soggy but it was still pretty good. We also sampled the blue bottle viet ice coffee flavor which was good as well.
It's a small place, probably only 6 seats available. A good place to stop by after dinner to get a quick dessert!
author: Flora L.

description: I liked the ice cream and the interior. I do honestly think it's slightly overrated though (don't hate me). Over $4.00 for one scoop of ice cream is very steep in my opinion. But they do have some really unique flavors here that make it worth it! It's a small shop so be ready to wait in line.
author: Robby T.

description:
I consider myself a premium ice cream snob. Along with Bi-Rite Creamery, Humphry Slocombe is my favorite ice cream shop in San Francisco.  I came on a weekday afternoon in August and there was no crowd.

I always get two scoops, and one of them has to be Secret Breakfast. On my most recent visit, I had the Malted Milk Chocolate as my second scoop. Both were out of this world!
author: Don A.

description:
You can never go wrong with the Secret Breakfast! Best flavor here!

I live within a few blocks from Humphry Slocombe and it's always such a challenge trying to fight the temptation when I'm craving something sweet. I love the ambiance of this location and the Christmas lights hanging outside adds a nice charming feel. I must admit that this is a pretty romantic date spot and a good way to end a nice evening out. Just a hint to all those fellows out there. :)

If you don't know what to order, then try the Secret Breakfast and Blue Bottle Coffee. You can't go wrong with those 2 flavors and they taste remarkable together!
author: MyTien P.

description:
They still have wonderful flavors and such, but the girls that helped me the other day just did not have any smiles and nothing at all to say to me other than, "what do you want to try?"
and "that'll be $4.75"
I said thank you and received no reply. I said thank you again, and the two girls just kept talking to each other and made no eye contact and no smiles. 
There are a lot of great ice cream places in this town, so these things matter.
author: Adrian M.

description:
Yes, yes, yes and more yes! 

Any place that is named after characters from "Are Your Being Served?" feels like my foodie soulmate. My interest was piqued by the unique flavors, that have equally as interesting names, so I decide to ordered 6 pints from Humphry Slocombe Ice Cream off Goldbely. Considering the ice cream was shipped to me, I was surprised by how wonderful the texture and flavors were! 

Here's the scoop (pun intended) on what I got...

Matchadoodle: Not as matcha-y as I had hoped but I'm a matcha-holic.
The snickerdoodle cookie overwhelmed the subtle amount of matcha but not in a bad way. It was just not what I had imagined. Still delightful but mellower than I had hoped. 

Secret Breakfast: The signature flavor that is not-so-secret anymore. It's amazing and delicious! I never knew I wanted bourbon and cornflake ice cream but now that I've had it I can't imagine not having it. If you only try one make it this one!!

Dirty Chai: Being a chai tea fan I thought this pint would be one of my favorites, but turns out the opposite was true. The spices were just too overwhelming for me. Obviously they need to be prominent because of the espresso but it was just not my cup of tea...literally. Ha! 

Blueberry Boy Bait: This flavor was interesting. Lately, I've become more of a blueberry fan but the ice cream had a different taste that I couldn't pinpoint. I looked at the ingredients list and the last two listed are red wine vinegar and balsamic vinegar. Perhaps they are for color but the curious flavor I couldn't discern probably comes from the vinegars. 

Honey Graham: My second favorite of the bunch. Subtle enough to please vanilla fans out there but different enough to please more adventurous flavor lovers too! Tastes kind of like teddy graham cookie or a delicious graham cracker pie crust mixed throughout a good solid flavored honey base. 

Tahitian VN!LL@*: It's vanilla but not thanks to a little extra pop from malt powder. This one is great on top of pie or a fresh baked crumble hot out of the oven! 

It is easy to see why Humphry Slocombe wins award after award in the gourmet ice cream world! I would gladly order from them again!
author: Chris H.

description:
If everyone in the world could sit back and have a come or two, maybe we can stop the chaos and violence. Who can you resist such a delightful treat. An irresistible frozen custard made for a child's appetite. Oh glorious dessert, why though make my belly look so barbaric...

This one of the last three creamery shops in S.F that my friends and I were planning to visit. I enjoyed Smitten's and Bi-Rite, but I will have to say that Humphry's has its own speciality that differentiates themselves between the other two. 

One of the reason why I like this place was because they have a variety of exotic flavors. Flavors that you can't find at anywhere else. Some of the options that they come up with are mind boggling but if it sells then something is definitely worth mentioning. 

I opted for a flavor that had coconut in it. I wasn't sure what it was called but I remembered I loved the taste of it. The texture was light, airy and wasn't too sweet. I licked it all up!

I will definitely be back to try it again! A great experience at such a cool shop!
author: Anthony N.

description: I consider their ice cream among the best in SF. I know that there is a debate between Humphry and Bi-Rite, I'm on Team Humphry. Why? Well it boils down to flavor. I leave feeling like my palate is saying thank you. The creativity of flavors that Humphry Slocombe brings to the table is just an added bonus.
author: Michelle M.

description: They have special/limited edition flavors all the time. There's currently the blueberry boy bait, strawberry aqua Fresca, matcha doodle and concannon viognier + stone fruit (yes contains wine!) and Jesus juice (a wine and cola sorbet). Lines can be long but move quickly. Some outdoor and indoor seating available
author: Weich Y.

description: Finally made it here!!! I tried the Foie Gras and Cherry Ice cream. Explosive flavors. It's good. But then it's savory and sweet. And I'm confused. So I settled for the Vietnamese coffee ice cream in a cup. Should have ordered it with the waffle cone. Should have tried more flavors. Should have....okay I'll just have to come back for more!
author: Leilani V.

description: They have unique flavors, chill vibe inside, and the ice cream is pretty creamy. Great texture and waffle cone is fantastic. Normally this isn't  my type of waffle cone but it was actually pretty crispy/crunchy in a nice, satisfying way. I also usually don't like chocolate ice creams but I thoroughly enjoyed the fudge (vegan) ice cream because it had this really smooth , thick, slightly chewy texture and it wasn't so sweet that my teeth/gums would tingle.
author: Rachelle C.

description:
This place is overrated. The ice cream is okay, but it's not great. The 12 flavors are mostly unique and very unusual, but nothing sounded good. 

It's $4.50 for a rather small scoop. I got the peanut butter chocolate one, it wasn't too heavy on peanut butter nor chocolate, and the ice cream is on the lighter side of not being creamy.

I think it's only popular because the alcoholics like the bourbon flavored ice cream.
author: Spencer H.

description:
Humphrey Slocombe is amazing I love this place! The ice cream is super creamy and every flavor is fun and innovative. The service is superior and I love visiting this shop! They are very generous with their samples, which is perfect for an ice cream fanatic like me. 

I got a four scoop ice cream sundae (in my defense, the scoops are small!) of Secret Breakfast, Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee, Peanut Butter Fudge, and the Brown Sugar Kitchen Apple Pie, topped with whipped cream, hot fudge, and whiskey caramel. My favorites were the Vietnamese Coffee (flavors are spot on), Secret Breakfast, and the whiskey caramel topping. 

The only gripe I have is the same one I have with all San Francisco ice cream places - why are the scoop sizes so small? As an Los Angeleno, I'm used to the huge scoops of ice cream of the likes from Afters and Salt and Straw. 

I can't wait to come back to Humphrey Slocombe!
author: Dorothy T.

description:
I tried:
* Harvey Milk & Honey Graham - 3 stars, sweet, a little generic, tastes literally as described.
* Chocolate! Chocolate! Chocolate! - 4 stars, super intense chocolate.
* Malted Milk Chocolate - 3.5 stars, a lighter sweet chocolate.
* Salt & pepper - 4 stars, more for its uniqueness, a little shocking to taste salt & pepper in ice cream but it works decently well!

I got:
* Dark Chocolate Sea Salt (pint) - 4 stars
I usually don't like sweet & savory (I wouldn't normally choose sea salt caramel, for example) but the intense dark chocolate worked with the sea salt for me.
(We were considering the Matcha & Black Sesame pints as well. Note the pints came in completely different flavors than the display, except Secret Breakfast)

My boyfriend go:
* Secret Breakfast Float - 3 stars
My bf liked the ice cream, but didn't enjoy it in the float. It leaves behind bits of cereal in the soda.
author: Ziyan C.

description:
Friendly service, delicious ice cream, and a chill place to come with a friend and bond about life problems/stuff. 

Why I was here // My friend and I were craving dessert after having some dinner down the street. 

Ice cream shop // quaint little parlor shop with a blue awning. Some bar stool seating by the window, cute containers of sweets available for purchase. 

Service // super friendly and honestly made my night! She did a fabulous job telling us about the ice cream and letting us sample the flavors. 

Ice cream // 
-my friend and I both got single scoops (4.50 each) in a cup because we're clumsy and also I don't eat ice cream fast enough for a cone. 
- I got the secret breakfast (bourbon ice cream with cornflakes) 
-my friend got the Christmas story (Tahitian vanilla ice cream with sugar cookies and peppermint bark) 

Overall// LOVE this place! Really satisfies that ice cream craving on a freezing San Francisco night.
author: Emily T.

description:
The best ice cream I had in SF!! I tried "Secret Breakfast" and it was the best flavor with not too overpowering and the texture was just so creamy it literally tasted like heaven.
They have a wide variety of Flavours to try so I would recommend to try few of them before going for the scoop.
author: Vinod A.

description:
Excellent ice cream that's one of my two favorites in the West Bay. Although the offerings here aren't quite as thick and creamy as Bi-Rite's, I find they have the right balance of flavor, texture, and consistency. 

On the subject of flavors, they're quite yummy and creative enough without being too offbeat. The secret breakfast (bourbon ice cream with cornflakes) is wildly popular, while the peanut butter fudge ripple (peanut butter ice cream with fudge swirled in) provides richer, thicker contrast.

Service is fairly engaging and helpful here as far as explaining the flavors and enabling samples are concerned. Just don't go overboard with the sampling if folks are waiting behind you.
author: Vincent L.

description:
Highly recommend the "DUCK YEAH! Sundae" aka housemade Duck Fat Pecan Pie a la mode. Although it's traditionally topped with a scoop of decadent Brown Butter, you can pair it with a scoop of whatever tickles your fancy.

Secret Breakfast is my shiz... if loving bourbon with cornflakes is wrong, then I don't wanna be right! 

Vietnamese Iced Coffee partnered with local Blue Bottle Coffee is my other go-to. If you like coffee with a pep in your step, this is for you. 

It's easy to feel overwhelmed by the plethora of locally sourced unique flavors offered. But don't be shy - ask to sample what ever piques your palate til you find your flavorite.

Get your scrumptious on! 

As they say at Costco: "Try and try, before you buy!".
author: Geminyna J.

description:
Great little ice cream shop with nice waffle cones and quick service. Sampling is allowed, although it's a little hard to know what flavors are available prior to trying them.

Really though, if i could leave a shorter review it would be this:

Holy *%#^!...Secret breakfast.
author: Terry L.

description:
TL;DR mmmmmm so good, so many flavors

So many unique and interesting flavors... alcohol flavors!!!

Staff were nice, let us try so many flavors and was patient.

Inside is small, go on a walk with your ice cream.

Parking is brutal, take public transportation or walk. 

What to get:
-Milk & Honey
author: Sophia L.

description:
I stopped by their store on their 9th birthday and they were handing out free scoops of ice cream! I appreciate how they were trying to raise money for Project Open Hand and props to the friendly service that was provided. Even though the line was super long, the servers were nice and they allowed everyone to try a few samples.

I got to sample a few flavors - McEvoy Olive Oil + Rhubarb, Toast + Jam, Persian Lime + Curry, and Mary Berry's Victoria Sponge. 

I thought the Persian Lime + Curry ice cream tasted sort of weird and the Toast + Jam wasn't too flavorful. But, the McEvoy Olive Oil + Rhubarb and Mary Berry's Victoria Sponge were pretty good. Both had a nice creamy texture and were super tasty!
author: Victor L.

description:
Came by for ice cream the other night and it was a mediocre experience. As it was a relatively warm evening in SF that evening, the interior of the ice cream shop was very warm and humid...

Ordered the Blue Bottle Iced Vietnamese Coffee single scoop in a cone for $4.5 and it was mediocre. Flavoring was ok and ice cream wasn't super soft. There was a minimal line in what looked to be residential neighborhood.

Staff www offering samples for those that couldn't make up their mind. 

...I think I'm a fan of Bi-Rite instead...where their ice cream is very flavorful, fresh, and soft!
author: Derek S.

description:
This is THE BEST ICE CREAM in the Bay Area hands some - me, an ice cream fanatic. It is rich and creamy and perfectly textured and full of flavor. They've really perfected the science and art of ice cream here. Their flavors are unique and impossible to replicate by anyone else. As an ice cream lover (and maker myself), I am in awe of Humphrey Slocombe. 

Please try Harvey Milk Graham and Secret Breakfast. And go all out by trying so many flavors bc they're so generous with letting you try samples. I've also loved the Golden Milk/Turmeric flavor!!!

Go all out here!
author: Sela B.

description:
Looking for creative ice cream flavors?  Try this place!  Their combination of flavors is very unique.  They also serve sundaes, floats, cakes, pies, and cookies.  The popular flavors are Secret Breakfast, Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee, Malted Milk Chocolate, and Tahitian V*n!ll@ etc.  The floats are also interesting because they serve it with Bourbon Coke, Blue Bottle, or Cold Brew.  If you want to take some home, there is a fridge filled with pints of ice creams.  

::Ice Cream::
It took me a while to figure out what to get because I'm used to seeing the usual ice cream flavors.  I sampled the following:  Secret Breakfast which is a very well known item, Honey Graham, and Peanut Butter Fudge Ripple.  Our final decisions were:  Malted Milk Chocolate & Tahitian V@n!ll@ with toasted almonds, Chamoy (cayenne and mango) with whipped cream, and Avocado Toast & Peanut Butter Fudge Ripple.

::Cookie::
I tried the Squirrel Friend.  It has peanut butter, oatmeal, chocolate chips, peanuts, and "ruffles" chips!  The cookie was crispy and tasty.  I should have bought two.  

:: Customer Service::
Very friendly and helpful.  We told her it was our first time and she told us the popular flavors.  

::M's Notes::
-Street parking
-Inside and outside seating
author: MarVy S.

description: Went here for some late night dessert, solid recommendation from a friend! They have a lot of eclectic flavors. It reminds me of flavors available at some of the ice cream shops we'd visited in Japan. The ice cream itself was pretty good, price was decent.
author: Sunita T.

description: I knew I had to come here when I saw they had hong kong milk tea as an ice cream flavor! Sadly, it was not meant to be because it is only sold in pints. I ended up going with matchadoodle, an unexpectedly delightful marriage of matcha and snickerdoodle. This combination is honestly genius because matcha is not a very sweet flavor, so the snickerdoodle gives it that extra kick. I also love the custom Jackson Pollock-style tomato soup can wall art with Humphrey Slocombe flavors emblazoned on them.
author: Naomi J.

description:
Literally the best icecream I had in SF!! The sweetness of the viet coffee flavor was not too overpowering and the texture was just so creamy it literally lasted like heaven. Also, the flavor originated from Blue Bottle so you know it's going to be some good sh-t. I ate this icecream on a full stomach yet I still managed to eat it all without feeling sick. 

They also give you a cute, metal sample spoons if you're hesitant to buy which icecream like me!! (:
author: Sindy C.

description:
Hands down my favorite ice cream shop in town! I've tried Garden and others, but this place is still my favorite and top choice. Nothing beats their Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee ice cream. I know some swear by their Secret Breakfast. I used to get it too, but to be honest, their BBVC is the way to go!!!!

Best coffee ice cream, EVER! #yummmm
author: Jade F.

description: How can any place at the Ferry Building be beat? Humphry Slocombe delivers fresh ice cream with innovative flavors. Dirty Chai was delicious! Love their Milk Tea and Coffee flavor too. Each visit offers new culinary delight.
author: Danielle Y.

description: A San Francisco favorite. When I got off the airplane I drove straight to Humphry Slocombe for Secret Breakfast (bourbon and corn flakes ice cream). Every other flavor is delicious, but Secret Breakfast is the flavor that I typically order. The location is relatively small - there are a few tables outside which is a nice option when the weather is good.
author: Alan L.

description:
Reviewer #3199
Due to diet restrictions I didn't actually taste any of the ice cream, but three people of my party did and they thought it was delicious. I got to order whatever I wanted for my boyfriend and I ordered him two scoops of ice cream. One scoop of raw homey and the other was peanut butter and Jelly. He only liked one, but that was his flavor pallet not anything Humphreys did. 

I couldn't tell you where it;s located because I just used Yelp to find an Ice Cream shop closest to the Look out point (Twin Peak) that we were basking in the beauty. Side note-- I love how Yelp takes us on an adventure! 

There was sitting on the inside and on the outside. The person behind the counter was super nice and helpful. Feel free to SAMPLE!  I took some good pics so check em out!
author: Greg D.

description: Love the unique flavors - excited to find a seasonal pumpkin with white chocolate pretzels! Also had a scoop of the golden milk with gingersnap (cold use more snap). Woman working was not friendly and could hardly manage to utter a few words of acknowledgment.
author: Melissa P.

description:
REVIEWER # 3184

My milkshake brings all the boys to the yard,
And they're like
It's better than yours,
Damn right,
It's better than yours,
I can teach you,
But I have to charge

Okay, Okay..Just when I thought I had the best milkshake in town, Humphry's decided to pop RIGHT up and introduce everyone to all the flavors they offer. I mean, I have some sweet flavors, but Humphry's offers some scrumptious savors.  When people mention 'Best Ice Cream in San Francisco', you cannot help but think of Humphry's. Those irreplaceable flavors like: Peanut Butter Curry, Brown Sugar Fennel, and that good ol' Secret Breakfast! OMG, need I say anymore? 

I always seem to find Humphry's on special occasions. Like, the Fillmore Festivals or the North Beach Festival. You would rarely see me at their actual locations because I am just WAY to inpatient to be waiting in those lines. 

The Humphry's on Harrison is a small ice cream shop tucked around the corner of 24th and Harrison. I came in to try some of their samples (as they don't offer samples when they are in the food trucks). Besides the Secret Breakfast, the bourbon and corn flakes is another exotic flavor that tickles my taste buds. I always stick with getting their single scoop which usually comes out to $5, but it's totally worth it. 

Humphry's definitely is bringing more than the boys to their yard! They have something that I cannot compete with. Known for their usual flavors. Some of which sound not worth eating...but are actually very scrumptious and worth every taste! The flavors are so unique and inventive, this is a must-visit when in SF!
author: Porsche C.

description:
With massive apologies to the owners, staff and especially the adoring fans of this beloved SF ice cream shop...it's just not for me.  I find their ice cream not as creamy and not as flavorful as my faves*.   I've come in a few times and tried their Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee, Honey Thyme, Malted Milk Chocolate and Turkish Delight and, although certainly good and quality ingredients, never seems to totally hit the spot for me -- although obviously does for quite a lot of people (see other reviews).  But maybe my taste is a bit too discerning.

This might come across as more a 3-star review except I give them major kudos for, at least, high creativity in their flavor creation, a wonderful staff serving up the scoops, and the best interior I've seen (so far) for an ice cream shop in SF -- seats at separate counter, brilliant.

*Mitchell's; Bi-Rite
author: Merrick W.

description:
Humphry Slocombe is a cool name. The name actually comes from a 1970's British sitcom called "Are You Being Served?"

They have many offbeat flavors of ice cream here yet unfortunately they don't have any vegan ice cream. They did have one sorbet though that was vegan & it was quite alright.

I had the Lemon Ice sorbet & had a sharp bite of lemon to it so if you are a fan of lemon would recommend it. 

The whole thing of a vegan going to a vegan or vegetarian restaurant having too much choice so making it hard to decide what to order. Well at Humphry Slocombe Ice Cream it is opposite for vegans as you only have one choice & that is sorbet.

Well the sorbet is good & will set you back just over $4 for a cup yet would love it if Humphry Slocombe took some of their creativity as there isn't a lack of it making some creative ice cream flavors to create a vegan ice cream so us vegans can indulge on occasion. 

Otherwise the sorbet is quite alright & would be great if there were two sorbets on offer. Great location right near 24th St Mission BART station.
author: Shane S.

description: Humphry Slocombe, you do things to me.  With certainty I can say this is the best ice cream I have ever had.  I have this unhealthy addictive relationship with Humphry's.  Their ice cream is pure bliss.  They have monthly flavors that are always amazing, I've never been disappointed.  There's a plethora of flavors to choose from, you just can't go wrong with any of the flavors.  My absolute favorite is Secret Breakfast, bourbon and corn flakes.  TO DIE FOR.  It's about $4.50 a scoop, but hey...worth every penny.  It's not something you eat everyday, so treat your self and go get a scoop..or two.
author: Adrianna P.

description:
Highly addicting but totally heavenly.  The crowd here is a hoot.  We've been to a thousand ice cream places but the Mission Humphry Slocombe is alive like no other, it's sort of a whirlwind, the staff is super vivacious .  

Of course the ice cream's phenomenal too lol, but the energy at this place and the PEOPLE running the show there make it an experience--
author: Penny F.

description:
Delicious!! Secret breakfast (rum with some cereal mixed in, but I wouldn't have guessed it was cereal!) on top of psychedelic city on a cone. No complaints (except don't put those two together haha, my bad). 

I can't say enough about the secret breakfast. I would say it's a MUST if you come to the city because it's so flipping unique!! The rum is subtle and adds depth. The ice cream itself is delicious, but on the lighter side (unlike bi-rite and salt&straw). The ice cream is perfect in texture.... when you bite into it you still have to lick it because it runs the tiniest bit. Get the cone- super crunchy and, dare I say, flavorful.
author: Deborah C.

description:
My friend went to the location at the Embarcadero Center and raves about it, so I went in with high expectations. 

Firstly, the ice cream was great. I got the tea-flavored one, and it tasted smooth, creamy, and like tea. The small size was a good portion. My friend got half and half.

The service was not good. The other server with dark hair and who was shorter was nice, but ours, blonde and unsmiling,  snottily, condescendingly, and forcefully gave us samples even after we said we were ready to order. My friend dropped spoons and ice cream because her hands were so full and we couldn't eat that fast. She smirked and insisted we try them all, but she handed them to us so quickly we didn't know what we were being given.
author: Lizzie S.

description:
Top notch classic flavor as usual but what got me this last trip was their seasonal flavors

For their spr/smr line they are focusing flavors based on the neighborhood the shop is in, so in this case, Mexico inspired. Across the board, my two favorites were the chamoy (spiced mango) and the strawberry margarita. As strange as it sounds, the lime tortilla chip actually tasted as such and was surprisingly good

Also note, they have a special flavor called Hong Kong Milk Tea (forgot who the collaboration was with)

Overall Thoughts

Humphry continues to demonstrate why they are easily one of the top 3 best ice cream shop in SF
author: Eddie W.

description:
This ice cream is definitely one of a kind, and delicious. They have around 8-10 flavors - all unique like Toast & Jam, Dirty Chai, Honey & Blackberry, etc. Their strawberry ice cream was so perfect, and the Dirty Chai was a new twist on the classic coffee flavor.

For sure not the place for someone who prefers plain flavors. Also small servings for the price, but still very tasty.
author: Ariana R.

description:
so this is the place i take a lot of out of town guests. they have great, unique flavors and it's usually a good walk from restaurants in the mission district. 

they change their flavors pretty regularly, and i'm pretty picky about my ice cream flavors, but there's always at least one flavor that i will want to try. 

i came here because boba guys lost the battle for a second round location. but what flavor did i find when i walked in? milk tea. it was a sign. and i learned they do half scoops so you can get 2 flavors for the price of one. the other flavor was the color purple which i really liked. i think it was a limited edition flavor, but i would totally get it again. 

their secret breakfast and vietnamese coffee flavors are also very excellent.
author: Enoch C.

description:
I've been to the Humphry Slocombe Ice Cream Site in the Ferry Building, but never here. One thing I like about the Mission location is that it is nearby Balmy Street Murals. So this is a great spot to bring visitors and family coming from afar if they have a thing for art and California modified Mexican food!

Though I was looking for secret breakfast (corn flakes and bourbon), the ice cream that I had was Peach/Blackberry Cobbler. It was a treat for me and I enjoyed it very much. I had a taste of the Pear Brandy, thinking I would like it, but nah... total opposite. Lol

Humphrey's here on Mission was pretty small, you can walk in and to the left are tiny tables that fit maybe 2 people. Outdoor seating, benches are available. I think it's more of a order and enjoy your ice cream outside type a joint since there art so many places and things to do and see nearby. Directly ahead inside, one restroom. Definitely bigger than the one in the Ferry Building, which is like a lemonade booth.
author: Jray M.

description: I think Humphry S is my fav. ice cream joint in SF. I've been coming here over the past 5 years; the secret breakfast is a staple as is the Vietnamese coffee. If you're feeling adventurous, the olive oil has a delicious bite to it.
author: Pranava A.

description:
West Coast is just spoiled with all these artisan ice cream parlors aren't we? It's pretty difficult to decide on a flavor but eventually I narrowed it down to two.

Secret breakfast - What's the secret? You've gotta be above drinking age. There's a bit of rum in it but it's mashed with cereal.

Baker's wife - Cookie mashed vanilla base ice cream. 

Both flavors were pretty similar in taste. 

Worth checking out if you're looking for unique invented flavors.

Check back often because they rotate flavors according to the season. I heard foie gras ice cream is back in August!
author: Virginia Y.

description:
Humphry Slocombe Ice Cream

My first time going here was an easy, like every other ice cream experience that I've had. The workers are nice and friendly and allowed me to try their unique flavours. While I hung out in the shop with my friends on that Saturday night, I ended up choosing the Harvey Milk & Honey. Which was great when I sampled it. But, when I had it as a single scoop in a cup, it was too sweet to handle and I ended up not finishing it. Disappointed in myself that I had wasted food, I decided to purchase a pint of Black Sesame to take home.  I didn't fulfill my ice cream craving. When I got home, I scooped two scoops of the ice cream  to share with my partner and was immediately terrified to find strips of hair in the ice cream.
author: Liza H.

description:
This place can only get 5 stars!  Here's why:
- Great variety of unique flavors.  Have you ever had Persian Lime and Curry Ice Cream? I thought not.  Come here to get some tastes that you can barely imagine exist.
- The not so secret Secret Breakfast. Bourbon and cornflakes.  Makes sense.  Who doesn't put bourbon in their cornflakes?
- Brown butter ice cream
- Brown butter ice cream
- Brown butter ice cream
- Sorry needed to say Brown butter ice cream three times (I guess four actually) because it is really that good.
- Amazing sundaes.  
- Great service
- Brown butter ice cream

Between Bi-Rite, Mitchell's and Smitten, this city already has very rich and creamy options to satiate your ice cream craving but Humphry Slocombe rivals or beats all of them. World class.
author: Tarek S.

description: There large ice cream selection was so flavorful and creamy. Just so happened to stumble upon this gem. Will definitely going back when in town.
author: kathryn s.

description: Unique, creative, and tasty flavors! Selection, service, quality, and taste are outstanding. Toss a coin and awaken your taste buds! I got a scoop of secret breakfast (bourbon and caramelized cornflakes) ice cream and a scoop of the Vietnamese coffee (Blue Bottle coffee with sweetened condensed milk and chicory) ice cream. The staff was very accommodating for a first-timer like me and gave me samples of practically every flavor. To be fair, the names of the flavors are so strange sounding but they were all delicious! From my observation, secret breakfast was the most popular flavor. And I really love coffee ice cream. This might be the best ice cream I've ever had!
author: Rose I.

description: One of THE best ice cream places I've been to! The Secret Breakfast flavor is a must try. If you're going to with two or more people, consider getting a pint from the fridge to skip the usually long lines.
author: Jim X.

description:
I had the secret breakfast and rhubarb ice cream. So damn tasty! 

The place is small, but there is plenty of seating just outside on the benches.
author: Dean T.

description:
I've been to this location twice! I really like that the flavors are rich--not the texture of the ice cream itself, but the taste. There is more dimension than sweetness which I really enjoy about Humphry Slocombe's ice cream. The Secret Breakfast was most memorable for me from my first visit, and I got it as a sample this time. I love that it has a crunch to it from the corn flakes they add. Apparently it's like eating cereal and milk for breakfast, but I feel like it's more than that, and it's something you just have to experience rather than read about it from a review. I opted to pass on Secret Breakfast this time. The first flavor my friend and I chose was the Oatlandish, which has a beer-y finish to it. There was also a fat cookie piece in the ice cream which made it hard to bite, but it was still good. The ice cream itself was a bit on the icy side, but I enjoyed the taste. My favorite of the two flavors I got had to be the the Harvey milk and honey. The honey taste was pretty strong, and it was almost like having a honey stick dissolved into milk. It was very pleasant and almost refreshing. 

Service was very friendly, and the lady helping us was very accommodating in letting us try as many flavors as we pleased. The store itself is small, but there are seats both inside and out. Since it was a weekday, it wasn't too crowded. I love that you can take home pints of ice cream--it would definitely be cheaper that way. Our two scoops cost $6.50, which is pretty pricey, but worth it. I would definitely come back if I'm in the area to try their other interesting flavors!
author: Cindy M.

description:
Cute, small spot. To be honest though, we prefer having it delivered to our home. Secret Breakfast, the perfect blend of bourbon and cornflakes, is our favorite. Dark Chocolate Smoked Sea Salt, is a close second.

There are no words I can offer, to do this ice cream justice. Creamy, silky, party in ya' mouth, break yo' mouth, don't even come close to capturing it's explicit level of greatness. 

Mama gonna go have some now. Buh-bye.
author: Gabriela W.

description:
Secret Breakfast (corn flakes + bourbon) ice cream at Humphry Slocombe Ice Cream is delicious. I didn't fully appreciate it during my previous visit some years ago as I wasn't as much into bourbon. That's changed and the ice cream is incredibly delightful!  The price is the only difficult part to palate, $4.50 for a small child's size scoop on sugar cone (or in a cup).

I couldn't part with that kind of money on a regular basis for one small scoop, but once in a great while, it's a wonderful treat. Maybe they have it in a more reasonably priced mini pack pint in their freezer, that would be a good compromise if you live locally or want to share a pint with someone. Enjoy!
author: Gisele X.

description:
Went here on their birthday when they were offering a scoop of ice cream for free.  I tried a couple of the flavors they had available and none of them really impressed me.  I ended up getting a scoop of the Toast and Jam, which was definitely a step up from grocery shop ice cream, but it wasn't anything really special to me either.  The jam pieces didn't seem really well mixed in with the actual ice cream, which led to some bites being ridiculously sweet and some bites being well-balanced.  If I had to actually pay for my scoop, I don't think I would be too happy with my purchase to be honest.  

On the other hand, service here was great and everyone was super friendly!
author: Tim L.

description:
They have interesting flavors that infuse coffee, beer and tea. Im hoping to come back and try the milk tea ice cream!

The ice cream was the usual house made price. My husband got the secret cereal ice cream. It was very sweet. Reminded me of afters ice cream. I tried the blue coffee Vietnamese coffee ice cream... it tasted like typical coffee ice cream.
author: Elaine W.

description:
TL;DR: Amazing ice cream. 

I came at prime time, about 5PM on a Saturday afternoon. The line for Humphry was extremely long, but the employees were time-efficient and the line moved quickly. 

Flavor selection: The flavors were very creative, and they weren't unique simply to stand out. The ingredients in the flavors I tried paired well together to form an amazing tasting experience. I tried a couple different flavors (Duet and McEvoy Olive Oil & Rhubarb) before I ultimately settled on the Cinnamon Tres Leches, single scoop in a cone. 

Cinnamon Tres Leches: The ice cream was delicious. It was jam-packed with cinnamon and had chunks of yellow cake, which added some texture to the dessert. It was sweet, but not overpowering. The cone was crunchy and tasty as well; not your standard cone from the grocery aisle. 

Environment: It's a little difficult to find an area to sit down and enjoy the ice cream, but my friends and I found a couple empty spots on a bench behind the Ferry Building, overlooking the bay and the ferries. 

Price: The price was a little steep for ice cream, it's $4.50 for a single scoop. But for the specialty flavor and the location, it just might be worth it. Next time I visit San Francisco, I'll be sure to come back for more. 

PS. I thought that it was cool that they also sold ice cream starters, for those who would like to make their own batch of Humphry's at home.
author: Cindy W.

description: I love coming here when in SF. They have the most creative flavors. We got the beet was delicious but I always end up having the "secret breakfast" it's so darn good with that hint of bourbon. Always friendly  workers and love the benches outside to sit and lick away!
author: Claudia S.

description:
Humphry Slocombe still has some of the most solid selection of ice cream flavor combos in the city. I've never checked out this location before but since it was rainy and cloudy yesterday, I of course needed to get some ice cream and Humphry Slocombe was right there to answer my cravings!

This location has it's own seating (6 seats at a counter) and restroom which is a plus. Since it was beer week I got the Mango Sour and a Rye beer flavor. Neither flavor was as strong as the beer flavors from last year but still very tasty. The mango sour was a little sour with a kick of salt. It was a nice pairing with the Rye beer that was a bit sweeter almost chocolatey w/ almost a grain aftertaste (not in texture). They were both delicious. The only reason I knocked off a star is cause the texture was pretty bad. Not inedible bad but definitely nowhere near the creamy, smooth ice cream I was hoping for.

Overall, I still adore Humphry Slocombe. Their flavor choices are still one of the best in the city.
author: Vivian C.

description: This place tries to be a bit too fancy for its own good.  The ice cream is well-made, rich and creamy with good texture, but the flavor selection tends towards weirdness just for the sake of being unique, with flavors like corn flakes, cinamon and peanut butter, etc.  I've gone there a couple of times when they had a normal-ish flavor that looked alright.  Most recently I tried a caramel and vanilla with chocolate-covered potato chips.  The ice cream was alright, but why the potato chips instead of, I don't know, cookie bits or chocolate chips?  Like I said, they try too hard to be unique.  They seem to be fairly popular, but I for one just don't get it.
author: John F.

description:
First time HSC customer and I'm a fan.  WOW!!! delicious ice cream.  Granted it is a bit pricy for what you get, but it is worth the money.  I always find dessert as a treat not regular food so once in a while it is ok to pay a little more for good ice cream.

I'm very glad HSC does not have a location in the South Bay....I'd be in trouble.  Although I just found my local Whole Foods carries a pint for $10.00.  $$$$.  I bought the Vietnamese Coffee and it is DEEEELICIOUS.  Can't afford to buy this at that price all the time.  But when i do, i savor every bite.
author: G K.

description:
This place is AWESOME!! I'm not sure how long it's been here but I've been in this neighborhood for over a year and have just now discovered it!! 

I love their flavors. It's not overly sweet or drowned with vanilla. It's perfect!!
author: Brian S.

description:
Very unique flavors, but hella pricey. I encourage you to sample the flavors before you make a decision. The Secret Breakfast is popular, but I didn't think it was all that.

They also have limited time offers, like the Coffee Ice Cream and Chocolate Cookie Sammie that I got ;)
author: Vasiliy M.

description:
My math skills may not be too polished. But I do know for $8.50 I get:

A can of whoop ass can of Blue Bottle cold brew + a scoop of Tahitian Vanilla + a warm drizzle of chocolate syrup= 

A Blue Bottle iced brew float that adds sweetness and ultimate caffeine in your system rapidly.

Hallelujah!
author: Matt G.

description: What do people see from this place that I dont?? I wanted to like this place, but everything I tried had no flavor or creaminess. Especially compared to Bi-Rite Creamery, I cant see myself wanting to eat here again.
author: Gill S.

description: Best ice cream I've ever had! And all of their flavors are so unique. You can split a one scoop serving between two flavors. I picked salted caramel cocoa nib and Harvey milk & honey graham
author: Chris M.

description: Been here twice. Once about 6 years ago and once recently. Both times I was very let down with this place. The ice cream is incredibly sweet and the flavors are nothing to write home about. When I most recently went, I got a dirty chai scoop that had formed that ice-sugar-crystal thing you find in old Safeway ice cream. It's also so expensive. How does everywhere in the city get away with these prices. Such a shame- as Talk Talk would say.
author: David G.

description: I've been here before but didn't review it. I was with friends post SF Symphony Soundbox Saturday and we wanted ice cream at 11:45 pm Saturday night. Humphrey Slocombe was OPEN. We happily enjoyed scoops of the deliciously rich peanut butter chocolate and the chocolate cassis...along with at least a dozen others who were happy to find them open at that hour!
author: Sharon S.

description:
They know they are good, so they don't even tell you they're there...

No real outward signage may have you a little confused if you've found the location. Especially if you have trust issues with Maps like I do. They have a royal blue awning with white piping and the words 'ice cream' fairly small, but no logo screaming their name anywhere.

As you approach you see the smallest real estate style sign with their logo. Then right near the door you see a sandwich board with their logo and a handwritten list of the current flavors. But, uh, skip that and just head in to try them ALL. Well, don't be that a-hole if there are a lot of customers. Luckily for us there weren't a lot people when we went during dinner time on a Saturday.

Parking is annoying, but that's basically SF. So I don't think I really need to discuss that, do I?

The flavors. Oh my, the flavors. Just like most ice cream slangers in SF, they have a variety of very trendy flavors. These are among some of the best. They are known for their Secret Breakfast. I enjoyed it, the bite I tried had some huge chunk of crunchy stuff, which I'm assuming was cereal. It was good, but the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee stole my taste buds. I did try almost all of the flavors and they were delish. I'm still weirded out by the mini real life spoons, I prefer wood or plastic. Yes, I realize this isn't green of me :/

The counter is such of any ice cream shop. You can peek through the glass to see the tubs of ice cream. Their labeling system is a little out of wack, but who cares. They have a menu of offerings, but I only go for ice cream in its traditional state. You could add cherries and other syrup toppings if you prefer. Sorry, nothing to note of regarding that since I didn't go for it.

I went with the cone, they only offer one option. That option is fresh and tasty.

They have traditional, old school ice cream shop stool seating that faces towards their windows. Three on each side of a to-go freezer, stocked with pints of their ice cream. Did you know they sell their ice cream at Whole Foods too? Pro tip!

Also, I didn't try it on this occasion. But they made a special batch of Rose All Day for Domaine Carneros for #NationalRoseDay and it was amazing. If you can get your hands on that, try it...you're welcome!

The staff was nice, the line was short, and the product was delish! I couldn't have asked for a better treat to end our day trip to the City. 

Trendy ice cream is a thing AND it's delicious!
author: Steph G.

description: I was craving a milkshake... something other than a McDs milkshake or BK milkshake.  My first ice cream shop had too long of a line and Humphry wasn't too far away.  Again I thought there were milkshakes when I queued but but when I finally had my tastings I settled on milk and graham, which would've been soooo good as a milkshake but was shot down when I asked.  Not sure why I had it in my head that they made them but I was wrong.  Either way the ice cream was still good... I'd come back. Yummmmm!
author: Nyla K.

description:
Good ice cream and unique flavours, but needs more selection! There was plenty of icecream in each scoop as well.

When you go, get the Vietnamese coffee icecream and the thyme and honey! I liked the thyme flavour because it is unique and something you can't find anywhere else.
author: Lesley Y.

description:
If you come to Mission District and are searching of a creamy, flavorful, interesting sweet treat...you HAVE to visit this place! 
There are so many type of ice cream there that you probably have never heard of. 

This was my first time at the store and I tried the Togarashi Tea flavor ice cream. Oh my gosh my taste buds were having a party in my mouth. This flavor is an oolong tea ice cream with spiced caramel and sesame seeds. I have no idea how all of this flavors work together but it's a genius combination. It was sweet and a bit spicy. The sesame was a nice touch and you can definitely taste the hint of tea as well. I highly recommend!
author: Suthida K.

description:
I was actually surprised by the decor and ambiance of this location based on the marketing and advertising (as well as the very hip reputation) of Humphry Slocombe. The vibe is very much old school ice cream shop, but that's just fine. We stopped for a couple of scoops on our way out of the area from dinner down the street. It's hard to say no to Secret Breakfast, but they have so many options it can be tempting to switch it up. 

If you're in the mood for a super-solid scoop, get over there and get one!
author: Siobhan F.

description: I didnt like the service i got here. I'd give 4 stars to the guy working but 0 to the lady working here so the average is 2 stars. Let me state this right now, i wouldnt return here if they were giving this stuff away thats how bad i felt after leaving. I drove here from Antioch, based on what i saw from a tv show this was like top 10 icecream parlors in the USA so i being the foodie that i am said I'll take my girlfriend here as a cute little date. Turned out to be a complete and uttter failure based on the customer service from a lady that was kind of on the huskier side if im not mistaken she had like red hair. So there's 2 or 3 tables you basically get your cone and go since theres no real room inside. Theres like 2 to 4 tables outside for seating im not too familiar with this area of sf but parking wasnt hard to find at least it wasnt for me. We saw some unique flavors which we wanted to try but i knew what I'd come for. The birthday cake flavor, not sure if thats what it's actually called but you know what i mean. The lady was first to ask how could she help us we werent sure so she dished us off to the gentlemen standing to her right as she aggressively proceeded to handle us but the caucasian hetero couple behind us she seemed nice and sincere. My initial thought was she didn't like black people, i then thought maybe she doesnt like gay people. Maybe she doesnt like indecisive people, maybe it was the end of her shift and she was ready to go, maybe she had a rough day... its ok people have them. I then thought maybe she hates her job, or maybe she's menstruating, or maybe just maybe she doesnt like working with that particular coworker. Either way i should never have to feel unwelcomed to some where i drove over an hour to just to indulge in 5 min worth of icecream. This would be the first time i say this ever but i hope shes no longer there. Its been about a year since ive come here and when my girlfriend said they've opened up a new one in oakland it just left a bad taste in my mouth and i could careless. The icecream was tasty but my experience was a waste of time. Wish I'd never come here its like $5 for a cone with single scoop which is standard SF pricing so i cant complain about that. Its cool that they make their own ice creams there but to hell with the lady with bad vibes. Thats a no on the Slocombe for me!
author: Adriana B.

description:
Who DOESN'T love Humphry Slocombe? I came here to grab some pints of ice cream for a work party (birthday) the next day and they had a much larger selection than what you would normally find at Whole Foods or something, and this place is great. 

I ended up getting 
Vietnamese coffee- super creamy, great taste, no bitter after taste (that can happen sometimes)
Honey Graham- this one is my favorite-- like having the crust of a delicious pie with ice cream
Secret Breakfast- Can you ever say no to that?
Cocoa nib + salted caramel- so amazing. I don't usually like cocoa flavored things but this was great!

Couldn't recommend more- they even gave me a little ice pack to keep it cold until I could get it home to the freezer.
author: Lai-Nin W.

description: My last two trips to Humphry Slocombe have been disappointing.  The ice cream is still delicious but the service is so poor.  The same woman has served me the last two times.  She is rude and sarcastic and acts like it is such a bother to give me ice cream.  She gives generous samples but she literally shoved them at my husband, my son and me and we could hardly taste them before she handed over another sample and then asked if we wanted anything in a really rude tone of voice.  HS has been my favorite ice cream shop since it opened but I'm now searching for a new spot.  It also seems like the price may have gone up.
author: Ashley S.

description:
After living in SF for 4 years, I FINALLY had a chance to come to this location. I've tried many times to grab a cone at their Ferry Building location but that place ALWAYS has a line and is way more touristy than this site. So +1 for being less crowded and being easier to get to and park! 

If you like really rich and creamy style ice cream then this is your jam. I had the "Here's Your Damn Strawberry" and the Black Sesame and the flavors were amazingly rich and fresh and full of heavy cream decadence. I personally prefer ice cream with less of a heavy taste...but I feel that the ingredients used are high quality here.

A single scoop will set you back $4.50 while 2 scoops will cost $6.75. This is cheaper than if you order from their mobile truck. Pints go for $10. $10?! Definitely the most expensive pint of ice cream IMO. It'll cost you $11 if you order it online for delivery.

We ended up sampling like most of their flavors but the gal helping us out was very helpful and exuded good customer service. 

Overall, convenient location, great flavors, fresh ingredients, but pricey. It's an SF institution though so I don't think the price is going to deter anyone. Definitely a place for dessert if you're walking around the Mission after dinner!
author: Sam L.

description:
If you're a first timer definitely try the Secret Breakfast. Wasn't sure how I felt about having flakes folded into my ice cream, but once I tried it I couldn't stop craving it for weeks after! 

If you want something that's not too sweet and you're a coffee lover, go for the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee you will probably like it more than the Secret Breakfast.
author: Nimeela D.

description:
Growing up with a sister a year younger than me, we both developed an addiction of Haagen Daaz Coffee Ice Cream. Having a sister and loving this brand flavor of ice cream has been our 2 constants throughout my 23 year old life and her 22 year old life. Until Humphrey Slocombe came around and knocked Haagen Daaz out of the park with their Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee Ice Cream. 

WHICH... I now understand after several iterations of me raving about it can very easily be called blue bottle coffee ice cream but also IT'S NOT THE SAME. Vietnamese ice coffee is always another level up of sweetness and goodness. 

This ice cream is so good I actually finished my small cup ($4.50 steep I know.. but get try some samples while youre at it!). I know a small cup aint a lot for people but im not a huge sweet tooth gyal!. 

It is so good I bought a $10 pint of it to savor at home everyday. One spoon a day. (But.. I must say the one in the pint is not as creamy and delicious! But still amazing... hahaha)

It is so good I considered sending my addict sister some in an ice box! But settled on going with her when she visits me in San Francisco.

LONG STORY SHORT. Humphrey Slocombe is worth the visit and their steepish prices for ice cream cus it's just that good.
author: Sara S.

description: Cute little gourmet ice cream shop. Unique and creative ice cream flavors. Service is friendly as well. Shout out to the friendly worker who helped me. He was patient and even gave his opinions on the ice cream. If you're into something sour, then I would recommend getting the rose. I ended up getting secret breakfast and something parallel? Those two were my favorites. It was rich and scrumptious. I wonder if they normally change up the flavors? I would definitely come back!
author: John N.

description: I really don't get the hype. It's okay. But not worth 5 Min wait not to mention the hours on warm weekends. I've had the secret breakfast. It was a novelty. But you could get the same effect if you pour real bourbon on your ice cream...
author: Xiu L.

description:
Oh yeah!! So good. 

Came in on a slow day and there was absolutely no line. Lit. And the flavors were hella good. Super lit. Tried all the flavors, don't remember but they were golden. 

Ending up ordering Harvey Milk Graham Cracker in a bowl & a cone with Secret Breakfast. Both were the perfect mix of soft and hard, didn't melt fast, and the cone of was fresh. Man if I could eat ice cream everyday I would.
author: John M.

description: This is a nice and popular ice cream place to visit. I came here with some friends to grab dessert. We got the peanut butter flavor and the earl grey plum sorbet. I definitely love the earl grey one a lot. It was very light and fragrant; opens up appetite and not heavy after a full dinner. The price was more expensive than other ice cream shops in SF but there's still a lot of customers.
author: Jovy C.

description:
Great boutique ice cream shop with well developed flavors. I had the raw blackberry honey with dirty chai and bananas. There don't make their ice cream too sweet which is how I like it. The cream is smooth not icy. I also tried the blueberry boy which tasted like a blue berry cheese cake. Their breakfast special is spectacular to give you a traditional breakfast pairing with an other scoop. 
I highly recommend this place. Although bi-rite creamery does have more selections and flavors I like this place more
author: George L.

description: One of my favorite ice cream spots in town. They have more then one location but this is my preferred spot cause it's chill. There's also a little bit of space to sit indoors or outside if you don't want your ice cream on the run. Also far fewer tourists then at the ferry building. The flavor combinations are where it's at. Very creative and tasty. I'm a coffee nerd so my favorite is the blue bottle Vietnamese coffee flavor but pretty much everything else is good. From the milk and honey graham, horchata rose, secret breakfast, and many more their flavors are amazing. If you're not sure definitely make use of trying samples
author: Peter P.

description:
We were here hours ago and I'm still thinking about this place! After sampling most of the flavors, which were all really, really good, I settled on brown butter which was my favorite! 

I had two scoops and now I wish I had bought more to bring home. I don't believe I have ever had ice cream so satisfying to my palate. Such a creamy, sweet and unique taste. 

Service was excellent, the guy at the counter was friendly, chipper, and generous with the portions. It was a little pricey for two scoops but well worth it. Plenty of parking in the area was another plus.
author: Ash K.

description:
I love ice cream

Their space is nice and quaint and I can see it being a great spot on a warm day for some good snacks. Their display case has a variety of flavors to choose from that they will gladly let you sample. I sampled a few then ended up choosing a single scoop in a cup of Halavaloo (or however you spell that). The service was fast and easy. The flavor of ice cream was great too. I want to think there was some sort of arrangement of caramel, peanut butter, something chewy, and the actual ice cream part, but I don't actually know what it's made of fully other than goodness. I feel like the pricing is a bit expensive too but that might just be me and thinking about how I can also get a tub for around the same price. But hey! How often are you going to an actual ice cream store and getting ice cream there??
author: Timothy D.

description: Amazing ice cream with unique flavors!! I came here with my friend on a Wednesday at around 7pm, and the place wasn't too crowded. The server was super nice and attentive, and was easy to talk to. She allowed us to try many different flavors where it didn't clearly state what was in it by the title, and she explained each flavor well. I got the Christmas story (since I am also a fan of the movie), and I was feeling a little festive. The flavor consists of vanilla ice cream, peppermint bark chunks, and sugar cookie bits! It was delicious and amazing, and very holiday-esque. The restaurant is kind of small, with some bar seats, but it is definitely not big enough for a big group of people. Overall, this place is amazing and I would definitely come back to try the other flavors!!
author: Lisa C.

description: Did someone say Cinnamon tres leches ice cream, Oh yes they did. For some reason today I strayed off the norm of my Blue Bottle Vietnamese coffee flavor. Honestly I dont think you can wrong with any flavor. The staff is super friendly. I love this location because I get to walk around the mission a little. The Ferry Building location is also worth trying.
author: Manny G.

description: I'm always looking for new ice cream. This place been reviewed 'hella' times, so not much to say here. Its located smack dab in the middle of the Mission, tacquerias galore. Its actually sort of out of place. But the line was still long. They have only a few flavors a day, and usually pretty funky. But in a good way. I had a mocha something, I forget. It was nice and creamy, but a tad too sweet for my taste. Good, but I still prefer Mitchells.
author: Kris P.

description: Great flavors! innovative flavors. some could  be tooo sweet for my liking though...
author: Chloe Z.

description:
So GOOD! My friends and I were visiting from So Cal and we all agree that Humphry should open a shop in So Cal! My top 2 flavors were Secret Breakfast and havabaloo. The downside of this place was that a scoop was $4.50 ... but a pint is $10... 
Flavor wise, I liked Humphry more than Bi-rite.
author: Cindy N.

description: No line. No wait. Ice cream is BOMB. Parking can be a hassle since it's on a busy street but considering it's the city. Can't really complain. I got the 'secret breakfast' which had cereal in it. Hands down my favorite. I'll be back to try more flavors. Although I'll probably end up getting yhe same flavor. :)
author: Misty T.

description:
Love the fact that is only a block away from where I live, But was disappointed,  it was not what I expected. went there with my son, and got 2 of their chocolate ice cream cups and a root beer float. when I asked the young lady for the root beer float, she asked if I wanted blue bottle?? I said you don't have Root Beer?? So she said she'd have to check. she asked another girl and came back with a root beer can and gave me my float.  $24 for 2 cups of malted choc and the a bourbon coke float. I was not happy, The root beer was flat, and warm, so when it was poured it totally melted the ice cream down.  it was pretty nasty. 
Not coming back, It was not to my liking...
author: Claudia E.

description:
Best standalone coffee ice cream available in SF. No mix-ins, all flavor. Their Vietnamese Iced Coffee is super strong, but not bitter or overly sweet. Really nice depth of flavor.

I also like their Hong Kong Style Milk Tea flavor - available in their freezer and at participating Whole Foods markets!  Very delicate tea flavor, with yummy bits of cookies. Only downside - make sure to freeze it right away. I've noticed when portions of it melt and refreeze (toward the top and sides of the container), the ice cream gets icy and super sweet. There's nothing like it though, so I hope they keep making this! The Whole Foods on Ocean seems to run out of this all the time.
author: Drea P.

description:
I am so in love with their Vietnamese Blue Bottle Coffee flavor! It's not too bitter, and has the right amount of creaminess. I really like pairing this with their Harvey's Milk flavor, which is more on the sweeter side. Perfect combo! 

I have also tried their Secret Breakfast flavor as well and thought the bourbon taste was way too strong. After a few licks, the alcohol taste became too overwhelming for me and I wasn't able to finish my scoop ): Felt like I needed a chaser haha.
author: Nancy C.

description:
I love ice cream, so we decided to check out this place after already having ice cream at another place just minutes before. This shop has fewer flavors, so it was less overwhelming to choose from. Some of the names of the flavors aren't straightforward, so you'll have to ask what's in it and sample them all LOL. 

I like that they have some unique and weird flavors too. Some of the interesting flavors they had on that day were secret breakfast, carrot mango, salted black licorice, and fluffer nutter. I usually don't go for coffee flavored ice cream, but I really liked the taste of the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee. The texture was really creamy, rich, and smooth. Out of the two ice cream places I tried, I think this one was a little better.
author: Dung N.

description: Humphrey's is the place to go if you like booze in your ice cream. Personally, I do not, but they still had some pretty good flavors. One of which is their peanut butter ice cream, which is probably one of the best peanut butter ice cream's I've had. The yuzu flavor is a Japanese fruit flavor which is definitely worth trying.
author: Ryan M.

description: Waited in line 45 min on free ice cream day (9th birthday) and enjoyed a choco taco cup, olive oil and rhubarb, and pear brandy. Cones are standard sugar, ice cream is quality with lots of unique, adult flavors. My toddler didn't like it her choco taco, it just wasn't classic tasting enough for her. My olive oil and rhubarb was good but not special tasting either, the flavors were there but didn't leave a lasting positive or negative impression. Pear brandy was good too, but similarly just ok. Glad we got to try it out.
author: Debora L.

description: Good. I'd like to give another try though bc i wasn't as wowwed as I hoped to be.  Maybe too much hype?
author: Keriena T.

description: One of my favorite ice cream shops in the city! Their flavors are so unique and the ones I got to try were so yummy. It was such a tough choice which one to choose, but I ended up choosing the Secret Breakfast.... Omg must try!!
author: Carrie L.

description:
Bi-rite, be damned - I think Humphry Slocombe is the best ice cream in SF (I do reserve the right to change my mind though). Although some of their ice creams have crazy names and seemingly crazy flavors, they do what they do well and their flavors will resonate with both hipster and non-hipster palates alike. 

My husband hates driving in the city - the parking, the lines, the high concentration of people, but we're always wiling to make the trek for Humphy Slocombe. My go-to fave is the Secret Breakfast that everyone knows and raves about, but the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee and Harvey Milk and Honey Graham are a few recent faves. Lines go by quick enough and there is some seating indoors and outdoors. Lazy? It looks like you can have your ice cream delivered by Postmates or you can pick up a pre-packed pint. 

PRO TIP - be efficient with your money and treat yo' self to 3 delicious scoops in a bowl to share.
author: Ghia G.

description:
YUM! 

I'm a huge fan of ice cream so i've been wanting to try this place for a while and sure wasn't disappointed. 

Service: Very quick service and they let you sample as many flavors as you'd like. 

What to get: Secret Breakfast & Tahitian Vanilla in a cone! I was a little skeptical about the secret breakfast flavor at first but it sure didn't disappoint. Pair that with your not so plain old vanilla and BAM a taste sensation. 

All in all, Humphry's does a great job of incorporating new flavors while adding a twist to the classics. Definitely will come back to try other flavors!
author: Keizzel C.

description: Yummy flavors at a cute tiny place.
author: Khushboo B.

description: Coming to Humphrey Slocombe has taught me what I value in ice cream. I appreciate high quality ingredients, fun/interesting flavors, and texture. Humphrey Slocombe delivers on all three. On a recent visit, I tried a flavor called A Christmas Story. This was a vanilla ice cream with sugar cookie pieces and chocolate peppermint bark chunks. It was so yummy! The cookie and bark pieces together provided just enough texture without being too much. The vanilla ice cream itself was obviously of high quality - not too icy or melty and not too frozen. I don't remember the cone being anything special, but ice cream should be eaten in a cone. Some of their flavors aren't my favorite and I think do have too much going on, but the flavors I do enjoy more than make up for it. The sweet cream and Vietnamese coffee are really good!
author: Terren W.

description: First time trying this ice-cream spot and it was so delicious! Creamy, light, and refreshing! I ordered the double scoop of ACT's golden milk: honey tumeric, ginger and Matchadoodle: green tea ice cream with snickerdoodle cookies. So good!
author: Anh N.

description:
I've only had Humphry's once while I visited SF but I can honestly say that it's one of the best ice cream places I've been to. 

Secret Breakfast: a combination of bourbon and cornflakes. Bourbon wasn't too overpowering and complimented the milky ice cream really well along with the slight crunch of the cornflakes

The Duet (i think is available seasonally) featured their Tahitian V*n!ll@ with limoncello sorbet and biscotti. It was really good! The sorbet and milky ice cream actually paired really well together 

Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee was really strong and good. Tasted like Lee's Vietnamese iced coffee to me. 

The only downside was the price but I'd gladly spend the money for great ice cream!
author: Nicole K.

description:
While others are out spending their hard-earned paychecks on what my grandfather called "giggly-juice," I'm usually avoiding the booze and going for something that legitimately makes me giggle: ice cream. I wander the streets of SF seeking that cold cream and creative flavors.

No conversation about ice cream in the city can be had without discussing Humphry Slocombe. It's not quite on the same level of notoriety as *that other* ice cream spot in The Mission, but it certainly must be discussed in the same conversation. 

Having been to this town and this neighborhood several times in my life and never trying HS, I felt like I wasn't really, truly living my potential as an urban explorer of the lacto-dessert order. July was my conquest, and a date with destiny was set.

I love how modest the location is. No bright lights, no flashing billboard, just a small ice cream shop with almost no seating. When I arrived, there was only one couple in front of me. Shortly thereafter, a small party of three arrived in line behind me, but I actually let them go first so I could look at the selection.

Everyone will talk about Secret Breakfast and you should probably get that (it's whiskey and cereal) but I didn't. It just wasn't my night to try a whiskey ice cream. Instead, I went with three flavors: Elotes, Brulee Fig & Creme Fraiche, and Peach & Blackberry Cobbler. Right off the bat, I knew the fig would be the winner. It had big enough chunks to understand it was true fig, but it was the best texture and the best flavor composition. Really well done. The cobbler was good, but probably needed a little more punch to offset the sweetness. I love berries for that reason, so maybe a little more berry would have kicked it up. And I swung hard and missed on Elotes. I wish it had more flavor. I would have welcomed a rich corn flavor, but instead got the light dusting of chili and not much else. Not every ice cream needs to knock you out and with a creative flavor like elote there's a real risk of overdoing it, but it came off and underdone. These are the risks you take as a nighttime conechaser, and I don't regret trying it. But I'd for sure try new flavors next time.

After I had been there a bit and was about halfway through my dish, a line did start to form. They're quick about it, but I realize that I must have been pretty lucky in my timing. It wasn't around the corner, but it was an influx of people. 

Check this one off the list!
author: Jeffrey S.

description: Probably the worst "ice cream" I have ever had. I tried the lemonade sorbet and it was basically ice with lemon flavor over it. Terrible. I was very disappointed that this was the only non-dairy option they had available. Do not recommend.
author: Nataly M.

description:
I must be living under a rock since moving to the bay area, that I did not discover Humphry Slocombe until a scavenger hunt involving the Ferry building a few months ago. 

Our group shared a salted caramel cocoa nib - a safe choice for all. There are so many layers to the decadent experience, the rich and intense cocoa flavor contrasting with the silky flavor of the caramel; the saltiness complementing the sweet and bitterness of the cocoa. At the end, we were fighting over scooping up the last bits of this delicacy. 

I was later told that the secret breakfast is the signature flavor and a must-try. Imagine my excitement when I stumbled upon the mission Humphry Slocombe. I don't like alcohol or the taste of unless it's in desserts like tiramisu and ice cream. The bourbon adds a layer of mysterious nature and complexity to the rainbow and sunshine flavors of the corn flakes cereal and rustic textured ice cream,  the crunchiness is a bonus treat to the taste buds. 

Perfect prelude to our day at the Museum of Ice Cream!
author: Sharon Z.

description:
When in SF, try as many ice cream shops as possible! I came here one day with my Dad while running errands in SF and recommended we get ice cream at Humphry's. He's a foodie like me so it's always fun taking him on a food adventure! After sampling many of their flavors I decided to get a scoop of their Secret Breakfast (I believe it's their most well known flavor). I don't really remember which flavor my dad got but it was one of their alcohol infused ones. I remember him enjoying it quite a bit. 

The server was super friendly and patient with us as we asked to sample different flavors. I would definitely come back to try more of their flavors since they seem to change every so often. I really enjoy and appreciate the more "adult" flavors because while yes Cookie n' Cream and Mint Chip are yummy, it's fun to be adventurous at times and try special artisan ice cream shops. Can't wait for my next visit! 
.
author: Jessica N.

description:
I've been pondering about the idea of why must I wait in lines that wrap around blocks for ice cream. All ice cream are made equal I thought. WRONG! Humphrey Slocombe is SUPERIOR! Nitro and all is cool but their flavor choices resonated with my taste. So much that I went in to share some ice cream with a friend over lunch break and then in an hour I was there with my whole team at work again. (I have issues). 

Vietnamese coffee is not too intensely coffee-ish but not too subtle for a coffee lover like me. Worth the hype!

We also shared a cinnamon something flavor. I liked that it wasn't very cinnamon-y but it was nothing to write home about. 

Had the Victorian sponge cake second time around and the solid bits truly reminded me of sponge cake I had in London, only sweeter as ice cream! 

They also have reasonable pricing so going to have to go back for the secret breakfast and maybe the other fancy stuff on their menu. But really, they do their ice cream so well, no need for the fluff!
author: Sadia I.

description: It's never a bad experience here. The employees are so kind to help you make the perfect Ice cream decisions. Every time I drop by for a scoop of ice cream, I really have to grab a pint for the house.
author: Diana S.

description: Overrated ice cream they want to be too weird and unique instead of just making good ice cream I order chocolate and vanilla and the flavors just seems very water down or something and for the price is not worth it rather go up to Mitchell's
author: Jonathan E.

description:
This mission gem features the ultimate in gourmet, artisan, small batch ice cream. HSIC has some of the most unique and delicious flavors you've never heard of before and won't find anywhere else. 
The hipster staff is always attentive; sampling the flavors before committing is encouraged. 
Pricing is what you'd expect for a cone and pints are $7.50.
I taste the exotics from time to time and usually stick with my all time favorite flavor, here or anywhere else... Secret Breakfast... bourbon ice cream with caramelized corn flakes. Ridiculous.
author: Bryan L.

description:
Their good flavors are really good, but it seemed like the case had a lot of filler flavors that weren't as finely-tuned. Tried a few fruity options that "didn't resonate with my palate" as Chris V put it, and really liked the Blue Bottle Coffee, but ended up settling for their renowned Secret Breakfast flavor- even the single scoop gradually just became entirely too sweet for me (as in we didn't finish a shared single scoop) but I initially liked the Bourbon sweetness before it overwhelmed, and the texture contrast of the corn flakes (which seemed more hearty, like granola) was my favorite aspect of this flavor.

Location is small with an old-fashioned counter and stools. Our duo was joined by another couple but it was otherwise pretty slow for a weekday afternoon. Didn't really care for the overflowing trash or constant flies. Good option to cool down on a hot day.
author: Stefany V.

description:
San Francisco is famous for its small, innovative ice cream shops like Bi-Rite, Mitchell's, and Smitten. Humphry Slocombe falls into the same category as these places, but unfortunately falls short in a few regards.

Let's start with the good. They have a wonderful rotating selection of some unique flavors, including sesame, cinnamon tres leches, vietnamese blue bottle coffee, dirty chai, tahitian vanilla and more. You're free to sample as many as you'd like.

One scoop will run you $4.50, which I have a hard time swallowing no matter how good ice cream is.
