Compare this with similar ice cream shops in the area and you'll find that Humphry Slocombe is one of the most pricy, if not the most expensive outright. Furthermore, the service is incredibly slow when the line gets long. I've seen longer lines at Bi-Rite move much more quickly than shorter ones here. 

While the flavors here are certainly nice, I'd prefer to stop by nearby Xanath, Mitchell's, or Bi-Rite for more selection and more bang for my buck.
author: Tim X.

description:
This place sucks . . . because it's so good it makes me weep that I can't come here EVERY DAY and eat a different flavor EVERY DAY and just be fat and happy.  

You're evil, with your sumptuous, mouth-watering flavors, the rice, unbearably delicious taste of your ice cream, your quirky favors and fun-sounding names.  

I'm hooked.  Amazing.  Lives up to the hype.
author: Karen r.

description: Humphry Slocombe manages to recreate all the fun of going to the ice cream parlor as a kid, but like in a cool hipster way that will impress your bougie date. I've been here twice now and both times was a great experience​ with great ice cream. The secret breakfast is a favorite here
author: Matthew W.

description: Friendly service and very good, flavorful ice cream. I especially liked the secret breakfast and the cinnamon  tres leches.
author: Todd P.

description: I LOVE ice cream and surprised myself by ordering sorbet instead. No regrets. I think about the earl grey plum and salted watermelon flavors more than a year later. The entire menu was intriguing and I can't wait to return and try more.
author: Alyssa M.

description:
My friends and I took a detour from Bi-Rite's ridiculously long lines to satisfy our ice cream cravings here. We arrived around 4:30 on a Sunday and there was a 5 minute wait. After sampling a few flavors, I opted for a single scoop of HARVEY MILK & HONEY in a cup:

Pros:
-Short wait, unlike most other "famous" ice cream places in San Francisco
-They let you sample a variety of flavors! Some standouts: BLUE BOTTLE VIETNAMESE COFFEE, SECRET BREAKFAST
-...saving the best for last. The HARVEY MILK & HONEY is undoubtedly the best ice cream I've ever had. Luscious chunks of honey graham interwoven into milky ice cream, with a hint of salt. The perfect blend of sweet, savory, creamy, and chunky... I even finished half my friend's ice cream because he doesn't have a sweet tooth

Cons:
-$4.25 a scoop
author: Patricia Z.

description: When Mitchell's had a crowd, we rolled by this place in hopes there would be less of a wait. The ice cream did not disappoint and the lines moved fast. Customer service was friendly and free samples were welcomed. They also have benches outside for seating which was nice.
author: W A.

description:
You gotta lick it. Before we kick it. 
You gotta get it soft and wet so we can kick it. 

Boom-ba-da-da-da-da

I really like the prominent lavender flavor of their Roasted White Chocolate Lavender ice cream. Best type of cream I've had in my mouth, I must say. Sorry Johnny!  

Unique flavors. I'll definitely be back because I want to try the highly revered Secret Breakfast flavor. Bourbon and cornflakes?!
author: Merica S.

description:
Ice cream is too sweet and not creamy. Service lady was snotty. She ROLLED HER EYES at me! I was afraid to try anything. 

Right when we walked into the empty store I accidentally put a can in the compost because when I looked into the trash, there were plastic bottles in it. She loudly let me know it was compost. I took it out though. 

She didn't press the ice cream very had onto the cone and it fell off. Luckily, I caught it in my hand. 

Also, it's expensive. Way too sweet and melted quickly. We ended up COMPOSTING it a block away.
author: Justine L.

description:
I've been here a couple times. Cute little ice cream shop, and I've never seen it too busy. Staff have always been very friendly. 

They are known for their Secret Breakfast, which is certainly good. But my favorite was the malted milk chocolate. I usually don't like chocolate ice cream, but this was DELICIOUS. Would definitely come back just for that. 

When compared to Bi-Rite, I would say this place is definitely not as heavy/creamy, which, depending on your preference could be good or bad. And its nice that you don't have to wait in an excessively long line like at bi-rite. If I'm in the area, I would certainly come again!
author: Trusha S.

description: Unusual and nice place, delicious ice cream.  They carry interesting flavors, excellent for after dinner, hot day or just to treat yourself. Service is fast, servers (the time I went) are courteous and polite. Definitely recommend the place. Expect to be relatively pricey ($4.5 a scoop 08/2017). But I believe worse it.
author: Doriana B.

description: I really appreciate how they are open late in the mission. They have really unique and interesting flavors. I tasted about half of their selection and they didn't mind at all. It's not the best ice cream in the city, but it's local and quirky--just how SF should be.
author: Laurisha C.

description:
Thanks to SF Yelper, Stephanie T., for mentioning (with enthusiasm) this place at the dinner table last night!  Yuri and I stumbled across this treasure as we walked back to the car after dinner!   

I got the Caramel Coconut Sorbet (a bit on the tart side) because Yuri got the Secret Breakfast (super yummy flavor with corn flakes).  ARG!  Her ice cream was way better than mine!  I need to go back and fix that!  Hahaha!  I'm interested in the Jesus Juice and Bourbon Coke Float!  :D

Parking was on the street - it's free in the residential areas. Ambiance is simple - on the edge of feeling country or Early American. Interior is small with several stools for customers (we sat at the window where there is a ledge). Service was efficient since they were getting ready to close for the day. 

Mahalo to Nelson Q. of LV, Danny N. of LA, and Ann S. of SF, for their great reviews!  That's when you know to go to a certain place: when your friends write about it!
author: Nadine C.

description: Service was great! Very welcoming. Parking can be difficult on weekends. Small shop. Ice cream choices are A1! They let you try all of them. Highly suggest Vietnamese iced coffee and special breakfast. I also tried the milk & honey and the horchata rose, but I just had to get the first 2 I mentioned. Those were the 2 I've seen all over yelp. Definitely a 10/10!
author: Kimberly D.

description:
I sampled the malted milk chocolate, the peanut butter ripple, and kumquat poppyseed. Malted milk chocolate had a really malty-sweet base with chocolate as the second strongest flavor, and the peanut butter ripple didn't taste that unique to me (mostly vanilla and cold peanut butter-y chunks). I didn't really like the kumquat poppyseed but I wanted something not too sweet or plain. 

I realized after a few bites that there was a strong salty aftertaste and after that aftertaste there was the nutty poppyseed taste. WEIRD. Maybe my tastebuds were numb but I didn't taste any kumquat so I was disappointed. Good serving size and melting rate though.
author: Lydia Z.

description:
Whenever I'm in the Mission, it's hard for me to walk by Humphry Slocombe and not take a look at what they are selling that day.  Located on Harrison by 24th St, this location carries a great selection of ice creams and sorbets for your enjoyment!  There's a mixture of flavors that they carry year round (including their famous Secret Breakfast) and selections that vary over time.  Most recently, I was intrigued by their Halvabaloo, which included both halva and black vinegar.

It's a relatively small location, so I tend to pick up my ice cream to go.  There's some limited seating inside along with some places to sit right outside of the shop.  Staff are friendly and are generous with their samples.  If you are looking for an ice cream shop with unique flavor combinations, Humphry Slocombe is your place!
author: Keith H.

description: Friday 5/18 at about 7 pm. Hey Surly girl! If you like expensive so so Ice cream served by surly pretentious liberal school dropouts look no further. If you want a better experience head to Mitchell's will they will be glad to serve you.
author: Wesley S.

description:
The bay is saturated with artisan ice cream places - how do they all survive? I'll tell ya - unique, tasty flavors. But what does that even mean now? Flavors that almost terrify you like  like Black vinegar and Halva and Red Hot Banana. And that's exactly what you'll find at Humphry Slocombe! 

Although I tried some safer alcohol-y flavors, I was so food'ed out by the end of my SF trip that I just wanted something simple. So, I opted for "Here's Your Damn Strawberry." And it was damn good strawberry ice cream - no icy morsel in sight! 

That's what I really enjoy about Humphry - there's something for everyone! 

I wish I lived in the bay so I could get ice cream delivered to me via Uber on the daily.
author: Tiffany H.

description: Amazing icecream! Changing menu of exotic flavors. Prices start at 4.50 a scoop and they let you pick 2 flavors per scoop you order and offer free samples to help you decide. I ordered 2 scoops with the secret breakfast(bourbon with mixed in frosted flakes), earl grey plum sorbet, blue bottle Vietnamese coffee, and blackberry peach cobbler. They were all delicious in their own ways no regrets on my order but my favorites were the cobbler with the sorbet as runner up. I believe they have locations all over town so no reason not to treat yoself and try it out.
author: Sean G.

description:
Bummed that we picked the day the store was replacing their ice cream freezer. They didn't open until 1:00. It was okay because it gave us a chance to walk around and explore. We came back about 15 minutes before they were set to open. Us and another couple sat outside waiting. It wasn't quite 1:00, but other folks just walked right in and suddenly they were open and we had to stand in line when... well, we'd been there a while. So we had to wait and we also lost our outside table. I was annoyed at the process, but it didn't keep me from enjoying my ice cream! We ended up grabbing two of the six ice cream parlor stools inside the store to enjoy our dessert.

I had one scoop of Surprise Breakfast. I didn't know until later it was bourbon ice cream with corn flakes. All I knew was it was delicious. It melted beautifully and had the perfect feel in my mouth... not to mention a delectable sweet taste. 

In the store there is one garbage can marked 'compost only'. I wondered what we would do with our ice cream cup and spoon. Well, the spoon was made out of something (I don't remember, but it actually said on the spoon and it was clear to me the spoon was biodegradable). And the cup was too, so both went into the compost only can. Very earth friendly.

I'm from Cincinnati and I couldn't help but think of Graeters as I was eating my Surprise Breakfast. As good as Humphry Slocombe is, it (and most any other ice creamery) pales in comparison to Graeters. 

But since I'm not in Cincinnati, I am a definite fan of Humphry Slocombe!
author: Scott N.

description: Unreasonably good ice cream. Get the malted milk and secret breakfast. Done. I ordered for you. You're welcome. Too expensive tho. Sadly I would run out of $$$
author: Alanna A.

description: This place has some of the best ice cream I've ever had. I brought one of my nieces and nephews here during the middle of a weekday afternoon and there was no line! Woohoo! so we all 3 tried all the flavors. Most of them, are really outstanding. A few were just ok, but overall, we were really happy. Their breakfast special is no joke, it's really amazing.
author: Dang N.

description: This is usually my go-to place for ice cream. The malted milk chocolate is my favorite followed by the Harvey Milk at a close second. With the exception of today, the employees are usually really nice. We popped in this afternoon and was greeted by a very unenthusiastic employee. Since there was no one else in line, we decided to sample 2 or 3 flavors. Each sample was accompanied by an eye roll and a mutter under her breath. It was almost funny considering how blatantly rude she was. My 6 year old even commented that she was in bad need of a nap.
author: Carmen D.

description:
Tried out the Malted milk chocolate with butterscotch. 
Creamy good ice cream nothing much else to say. Definitely a must try when you're in the Ferry building!

From, an ice cream lover Canadian.
author: Sally W.

description:
Mediocre experience. The salted licorice ice cream was icy with a one-noted flavor; it seemed like it was poorly mixed (consistency reminded me of cheap store-bought ice cream that you buy in bulk). Great experience with the malted milk chocolate which was rich with a nice balance of sweet, creamy, and a touch of chocolate. The portion sizes are lacking and frankly extremely disappointing given the steep price range for the area and a rather dismal ambiance which was heightened by the uncomfortable and limited seating options. 

4* for the malted milk chocolate
1.5* for the salted licorice
1* for the portion size relative to price
author: Brendan Edwin C.

description:
I really don't understand what all the hype is about. I tried at least about 8 flavors and I couldn't even pick one I was slightly satisfied with. Their special "secret breakfast" flavor has a weird taste and is overall too sweet, as with most of their other flavors. Yes, some flavors are really unique such as "miso pear," but a lot of them I really didn't think had flavors that complimented other flavors in the ice cream.

If you are not from the area and are just visiting SF (like me), I would just skip over this place. Maybe if I was a local I would come here to try some of their other flavors, but I wouldn't have such high expectations. I'm curious if all of SF ice cream tastes like this and everyone there has a particularly different palate for ice cream?
author: Helen T.

description:
This was my first time getting HS somewhere other than the ferry building, so I was vaguely surprised at the lack of a long line...but hey, that's nothing to complain about, lol! A friend had forwarded me the news about their black sesame flavor coming back for a limited time via instagram so I was super stoked to try it out.... I was certainly not at all disappointed!!!

Black sesame- The characteristic "roasted" scent of the black sesame really came through taste-wise... This is EXACTLY what I had been craving! You can still see the flecks of black mixed into the ice cream so you know you've definitely gotcher self the read deal. What really brings this one above and beyond for me was the fact that the base ice cream was not some plain vanilla...but rather a mellowed out version of something like salted caramel! The almost savory/salty hint from the "salted caramel" background truly paired with the black sesame like a charm. If I could buy this flavor on the regular.......man, oh, MAN! 

Jasmine lychee- Strong on the tea at first. So much so that it feels almost like it's going to stay a really heavy flavor (like some chai)...but then it turns around back into the realm of lychee...great soft tropical finish!

Am I the only one that is vaguely surprised (in a happy way) that they don't charge extra for a waffle cone? Can't wait to come back to try the other flavors!
author: Yen D.

description:
"Tainted Love" - Soft Cell 
"I'm Too Sexy" - Right Said Fred
"Ice Ice Baby" - Vanilla Ice 
"Secret Breakfast" - Humphry Slocombe
author: Rachel R.

description: Small ice cream store with interesting flavors. The flavor names were all creative but most didn't give too much of a clue as to how it tasted. I guess that's what sampling is for! I'm very adventurous when it comes to food and ice cream flavors and so I enjoyed tasting the flavors they offer here. Their flavors are not basic and different from your original ice cream. I believe I even tried one with bacon in it. After trying a few, I settled on the oolong flavor. Really sweet and tasted just like tea! I liked it a lot. Definitely willing to come back and see what other flavors they have to offer.
author: Annie H.

description:
Decided to go here on a whim just because of the different flavors that they have on their website and I was not disappointed at all. Went on a Monday night so there were plenty of street parking. 

The workers are really friendly there. I pretty much sampled all the flavors that they had out. I was hoping to try the sorbet flavors but there weren't any out, oh well. The ice cream is really creamy and they had some pretty different flavors. The most popular one is Secret Breakfast. I actually ended up buying a pint of White Chocolate Lavender (10$) and the Double Happiness Ice Cream Sandwich (5.50$). 

I would rather get a pint of ice cream just because a scoop is gonna cost you $4.50. 

Honestly, the ice cream sandwich is BOMBBBB. The oolong tea ice cream was really subtle and the gingersnap cookie was so soft and moist. Probably one of the best ice cream sandwich/cookie I have had so far.
author: Jenn L.

description:
Loved how creative and original these flavors are! When you're feeling like more than just vanilla and strawberry ice cream, come here to get your cream fix.

Got a scoop of Secret Breakfast on a cone. It's a bourbon and corn flake ice cream. Like... What?! Sounds weird or gross? Nope! It was a delicious balance of alcohol and sweet cereal milk flavor. Your mouth expects the after taste/burn of alcohol in your mouth, but you're pleasantly surprised when you get sweetness instead. Also loved that there were bits of crunchy corn flavors in the ice cream for texture! 

I want to go back to try ALL the flavors!
author: Venus F.

description: Yum! You can't go wrong with any of the ice creams here! My new favorite is the secret breakfast and the peanut butter fudge ripple! Some of the flavors sounds strange but end up tasting amazing!
author: Mandy B.

description:
So I swooped by their Mission location for their free scoop day. I was bummed that they weren't serving Secret Breakfast, but I suppose it allowed me to try other flavors. 

I mean, it could only get better, right? All the flavors were pretty new to me. They all had clever names coupled with interesting flavors and what have you: Jesus Juice, Dollywood, Persimmon Lychee sorbet, Thai Lime Chili, White Miso Pear, etc.

But I'll be honest here. I truly believe that Humphry Slocombe has jumped the shark with their flavors. Sure, they SOUND amazing, but they taste incredibly basic, or they have flavor profiles that just don't work well with my palette. Even the mouth-feel with many of the flavors are not very desirable IMO. 

In the end, I picked white miso pear. Not because I loved it, but because it was literally the least unsatisfying. I was totally underwhelmed by everything I tried that night. How can this even happen with ice cream?

But the service is really good and everyone behind the counter is friendly. Even when my indecisive ass asks for 4 samples (apologies for the folks waiting behind me!).

The next time I visit, I hope HS includes Secret Breakfast or some flavors that actually taste good instead of sounding spectacular. 

Back to the basics, y'all.
author: Aren A.

description: Got the secret breakfast. Boozey bourbon base with nice big chunks of salted cereal studded throughout. My favorite ice cream in all of SF
author: Song K.

description: Came here after dinner with a group of people. My cousin recommended this place to me. They have a variety of ice creams that are crafted and infused to hit your sweet tooth. The best flavors has got to be the Vietnamese coffee and the secret breakfast! They are open a little later than most of the other ice cream places.
author: Mylo D.

description: I didn't like any of the ice cream choices they had. Everything tasted overly sweet to me just for the sake of being sweet. There wasn't much "flavor". I did buy one scoop of ice cream. I can't remember the name but it has blueberries in it. It was white and blueish. I felt a bit pressured to get it cause the guy helping me gave me great customer service and there was a line forming behind me. Wouldn't come back. Just didn't match with my taste buds.
author: Carmen L.

description: Wow, wow, and did I say wow?! This may have been the best ice cream I have ever had and at 300lbs, I have had some ice cream. This was different. Unique flavors, salt, it was sooo awesome! I was a complete pig (and didn't want to be outdone by my son) and got a Tin Roof Sunday(3 scoops, hot fudge, nuts, and salt). I got something called breakfast surprise with rum...delicious, peanut butter fudge ripple, and salted caramel cocoa nib. It was a taste explosion. If you are in the mission in San Francisco, do not miss this place. Best ever...no lie!
author: Richard W.

description:
Was always on the border about the secret breakfast but finally ordered a scoop of it and 2 mins later... Gone. The ice cream is decent. Generally I think the flavors are strange but there's always at least one that's delicious. 

I like to come here when I'm craving ice cream at night and the line at Mitchell's is too long. Usually pretty easy to find street parking and there's rarely more than 4 or 5 other people in the shop. 

Come with no expectations. The flavors change often so I like to sample a few and then make an executive decision.
author: Steph D.

description: Definitely an SF classic. Their famous Secret Breakfast is definitely good, but I much prefer the Toast and Jam. It is so good, and the chunks of toast are different and add a really wonderful texture to the ice cream. It also wasn't as crowded as Bi-Rite the few times I have been. If you are looking for a fun place for some dessert after dinner in the city, this is definitely a great option. The ice cream is really good quality, and they have fun unique flavors. Not much else to say there!
author: Anila Y.

description:
Humphrey Slocombe is my favorite ice cream shop in the city. Compared to other spots, I would describe their flavors as experimentally artisan. As other reviewers mention they have interesting flavors such as strawberry margarita, salt & pepper, olive oil, and more. The surprising thing is that they actually taste good even while being weird! 

The ice cream also maintains a natural sweet milk flavor and their ice cream has a kind of hard texture that allows you to lather it in your mouth longer than places like Salt & Straw or Bi-Rite who have 'softer' textured ice creams. Humphrey Slocombe also has a nice bit of creaminess as well making it a pleasure to eat.
author: Chad S.

description: Right in the middle of Pier 1, Slocombe offered amazing variety of flavors. I wished I can try them all but only have one mouth and one stomach. I really enjoyed it, great location.
author: John K.

description: I only had the blue bottle Vietnamese coffee, very decent. I haven't had a chance to try other flavors but I will definitely come back soon.
author: Jason L.

description:
I've always seen the lines at the Humphry Slocombe at the ferry building and only ever braved that once or twice when I'm with guests. Finally I got over to this location of theirs in the city, on a day and at a time where there isn't many people around.

Their ice cream is solid, and the flavours are the winning factor here. Consider the secret breakfast which has bourbon and cornflakes, or any of the weird seasonal sweet and savory flavours they have, and something like the Blue Bottle Vietnamese coffee sounds quaint. 

When it comes to the basic flavours, I strongly prefer Bi-Rite (I found the taste purer and the texture smoother), but I'm always delighted at the creativity at this place and how they manage to pull it off time and time again. 

If you can't make it to their locations, keep in mind that some other local places do sell their ice cream in their stores. Keep an eye out for them!
author: Alice C.

description: Oh my. So good. So many unique ice cream flavors to choose from. First time at their original location (I've been to their Ferry Building location before multiple times) and was pretty standard. You really can't go wrong with any of them.
author: Leana L.

description: The creative flavors during the holiday season such as Christmas story or gingerbread Guinness brings out so much joy for me. I sampled some of their fancy flavors such as miso pear and persimmon. I love the various flavors and with the cold city it's a nice warm shop to hang and enjoy your ice cream !
author: Sheree C.

description: Yummy!  I had the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee ice cream, my son had the peanut butter fudge ripple, and my cousin had the Harvey Milk & Gram cracker ice cream.  They were all DELICIOUS!  But if you get the Harvey Milk & Graham Cracker ice cream, get it with hot fudge and marshmallow... s'mores style!
author: Melissa W.

description: The secret breakfast flavor is the only flavor that would cause me to come back. Other than that I wasn't too excited about this place. I tried the peanut butter ripple, fig, malted milk chocolate, they were just ok.
author: Nicole J.

description: I had the secret breakfast ice cream and it was just ok. It lacked texture, the taste wasn't unique and the ice cream wasn't creamy enough. I ended up throwing half of my small cup away despite the tiny size, because I had no motivation to finish it. The prices are high but that's fine for being by the waterfront if the ice cream were better. I'd say go for it if you're in the area and craving ice cream. After all, the waterfront is one of the most ideal places to enjoy an ice cream! But don't expect it to blow your mind and it's not really worth the trip if you're more than 10 minutes away.
author: Nancy W.

description:
It took a wedding for me to get a chance to try one of San Francisco's vaunted ice cream shops at last.

Well, that's not entirely true. Here's the deal: I did visit Polly Ann's in 2009. My faint recollection is that it was good, but not truly excellent. I also drove up in 2012 to help some foodie friends tour the City by the Bay. They didn't plan an ice cream stop though, and I didn't object because I figured that I would get a chance to go back sooner or later. Unfortunately, it was more of a later, and it was an opportunity created by heading up a little early before attending some other friends' wedding reception.

I arrived at Humphry Slocombe at about 4:40pm on a Saturday. Considering the praise that they get, the line was shockingly short! Five minutes (after the drive and such) to get to the counter is such a huge plus. I don't know whether it was the time of day, the speed of service, the lack of a huge sign with their name on it, or some criminal underrating by the residents of SF, but I was so happy. This was amplified when I realized how long some of the lines at other top-notch spots can be, reportedly at all times of day too.

Seeing that one scoop is $4 and two are $6, I found that the $7.50 option for three scoops would provide the best value and variety (other than going pint-sized for $9, which is kinda ridiculous even for me). I didn't sample every last flavor on the menu because I felt the eyes of those behind me in line, but I tried enough flavors to make three choices confidently.

The Nectarine and Plum Yogurt didn't resonate with my palate, so I left it unordered. I probably should have had a scoop of the toast and jam, which was actually fantastic, but I went for the White Miso Peach instead. It was pretty interesting with its slightly savory flavor and peachy accent, but it didn't hit all the right spots for me. The Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee was an obvious choice, and I loved the strong coffee flavor that was not masked by the restrained addition of sugar. Finally, I had to get the renowned Secret Breakfast, and I see why everybody likes it. Although it melted a bit too quickly for my liking, it definitely had a strong bourbon flavor with a "soft crunch" from the corn flakes.

The textures in general are not as thick as some ice creams (in technical terms, there's more overrun), but I'll write it off as a stylistic choice. There weren't unexpected ice crystals or anything else off-putting, although the Coffee flavor did seem to have an evenly distributed icy texture.

I'd easily get the latter two flavors again, but then I'd have to skip out on new experiences. They only have perhaps 16 of their 100+ flavors (listed on their web site) available at once, and I'm sure that they rotate them the time. Now that I've had a lot of experience trying not-so-traditional flavors of frozen dessert, I'm really interested in some of the flavors that I haven't heard of elsewhere. Glenlivet? Prosciutto? Count me in!

San Franciscans should feel so lucky to have Humphry Slocombe. I'll be back some day, even if I have to skip the other well-known shops. Nah, that's ridiculous - I'll visit multiple shops and include this one. An ice cream tour! That will be the best day ever.
author: Chris V.

description:
I like this location more than the the Ferry Building. It's their original shop and has a more intimate, mom and pop feel. Plus, the two times I've stopped by this winter there's very few or no customers at all so we could take our time to try flavors.

I tried three flavors:
- Roasted White Chocolate Rose: white chocolate and rose water flavors really came through. Interesting but not for me.
- Beer Nut: Guinness flavored ice cream with roasted peanuts. I got this and it was really good. Love beer flavored ice cream.
- Poached Pear: really, really good. I wanted to get this, but ended up sharing a scoop of Beer Nut to save room for the next ice cream stop. Next time..

Definitely recommend stopping by to try their creative and delicious flavors!
author: Lindsey C.

description: I got the secret breakfast flavor and my boyfriend got the coffee flavor. I really liked both flavors and the variety of unique flavors they had. The atmosphere of the shop was also nice and had cute touches. I didn't care for the texture of the ice cream at all though, I prefer a creamier texture and this was closer to crunchy.
author: Courtney L.

description: Secret Breakfast. Best ice cream I've ever had. This isn't an exaggeration. So good. Period.
author: Connor J.

description: Just visited this location this past weekend and it was raining out so there was literally no line. When we walked in there was a family paying for their ice cream and Joy Division was playing in the background so I danced a little while waiting my turn.  I had already decided that I wanted one scoop of the Secret Breakfast long before I came to visit this place. Well I got exactly that and it was pretty good (nothing to write home about), the ice cream was a little icier than I like my ice cream to be but it still had good flavor and is certainly the first time I've ever had cornflakes in my ice cream. My husband of course got what I suppose is the BEST thing on the menu. They had a duck fat pecan pie with brown butter, ice cream sundae. I took one bite and I was in heaven. The brown butter ice cream totally exceeded my expectations. It was super creamy and I could taste actual brown butter, definitely worth a try! The service was just so-so, the girl serving had little to no personality which was NOT what I was expecting from seeing this place on tv and all, but I wasn't there for her, I was there for the ice cream!
author: Cassandra A.

description:
I have tried Bi-Rite in SF, but I found myself on the other side of the mission and decided to try out Humphrey Slocombe. The quirky decor caught our attention! 

I shared three scoops with four other friends: peanut butter ripple, blue bottle coffee, and secret breakfast. I'm not a huge fan of peanut butter ice cream, so that was my least favorite. The peanut butter flavor was very strong! The coffee was pretty good, but I prefer coffee ice cream with something else mixed in for texture, like Tin Pot's four barrel coffee with cacao nibs. My favorite was secret breakfast, which had a distinguishable kick of bourbon. Very unique! All three flavors were too sweet for my taste.

It cost $8.00 for three scoops. I'd definitely recommend sharing to sample more flavors and save money. Service was really slow - I think they'd benefit from hiring one or two more workers on weekends. 

Overall, I thought Humphrey Slocombe was alright. I like Bi-Rite better but HS's unique flavors are definitely worth trying if you're in the area.
author: Anna H.

description:
Definitely one of the best ice cream places in SF to go to. Went in today w/no line and had a very helpful server help me get samples of various ice cream I wanted to try. 

I tried various flavors they had, but just ended up getting the secret breakfast and the blue bottle Vietnamese coffee which = complete breakfast! :)

The place is quite small and parking is hard to find so its best to go during a weekday or off peak hours.
author: Eric T.

description:
One of my favorite ice cream spots and I'd say the best I've tried. The flavors they offer are unique and the quality of the ice cream is excellent. 

For coffee lovers and those who love Vietnamese coffee..it's a MUST to try the Vietnamese coffee. Best coffee ice cream I've had. 
I also get the secret breakfast which my tastebuds fell in love with!!
author: Ivan P.

description:
Definitely my favorite ice cream in all of SF, and that's saying something. Their XXX Chocolate and peanut butter flavors are good, but my favorite is the dark sea salt chocolate. It isn't too salty and sweet, perfect balance! 

Had to take off one star because it is quite expensive, but for me it's worth it :)
author: Lili L.

description:
After working around here for 6 months, I finally had a chance to try this place, and I have to say I've been addicted since. First of all, you got to be an adventurous foodie. They only often the weirdest ice cream over. 

My favorite is the harvey milk and honey graham! The secret breakfast was a bit too sweet for me. They had a few sorbet that were pretty decent, but when I love something, I like to stick with it for awhile.
author: Josie H.

description:
I know that I'm going to say what most people have said already, but Oh. My. Goodness. 

The Secret Breakfast is to die for. I am not a huge alcohol fan because I just don't like the taste of alcohol (and I get a real bad Asian glow with the slightest alcohol), but this ice cream is ahmazing! It's the perfect amount of Bourbon and sweetness. Ugh. I love it. Also, I love the Vietnamese Blue Bottle ice cream! Not too sweet and good coffee flavor! 

Other flavors may be good too, but I once got Harvey's Milk (honey, milk, and graham crackers) and it was wayy too sweet. What I really like about this place is that they have unique flavors that are not offered anywhere else. Although I love, love, love Bi-rite ice creams as well, these are a different kind of ice cream flavors that I enjoy just as much. 

Things I don't like: it's quite pricey. $4 for a scoop and $6 for 2 scoops, but I guess they can do whatever they want since no other ice cream shops really offer their type of flavors. Also, the couple of times I have gotten The Secret Breakfast, the ice cream seems to melt very quickly and is very soft. Perhaps this is due to the alcohol in the ice cream, but that's just my logic (don't quote me). It's not a huge deal cause I eat it up so quickly, but it's noticeable. 

All in all, I love this place!
author: Christina C.

description:
It was not a good experience so I did not leave  my money with that company.
The chunky white chick was so disrespectful with her microaggressions.
Lost my appetite.
author: Karen G.

description:
I'm always down for a new gelato discovery. Particularly if the gelateria is throwing some mad flavour combos my way. Humphry Slocombe is doing just that, and the name is pretty darn cute too.

They're really good about you sampling a few before you buy, which is nice of them. I tried the Matilda (a mix of cake biscuits and chocolate), Thai tea which was very unique (mmm condensed milk goodness) and the Vietnamese Coffee, which had quite a punch to it. The range isn't huge compared to other gelaterias I have visited though.

Definitely a great place for something quite unique and sweet when you're next in The Mission.
author: Laura D.

description: At all hours, expect a line (even late hours).  The good thing though it does move fast. There isn't much sitting or room inside, few bar stools and high bar. They do have some seating outside, one or two patio tables.  I ordered their secret breakfast, great flavors, very unique and top of the list for favorites.  It was good, but not sure if it was worth the 30 minute wait in line.
author: Abby C.

description:
I love the cultish rarity of HS.  I love the really bizarre flavors.  I go out of my way to stop by and make a pilgrimage. I stopped by with for a dish of cinnamon tres leches and a pint of blue bottle coffee.  While I enjoyed both, I have to say that I was not blown away by either.  The tres leches did not have enough of that dairy finish that tres leches should have, there was really no there there.   And I found the blue bottle to be somewhat unbalanced, nice strong coffee kick but nothing else to round the edges.  Both, in particular the pint, lacked elasticity which might indicate a lower fat content than I enjoy.   

My favorite ice cream that can be easily found is Haagen-Dazs Dulce de Leche.  Neither was as good as that.  I will be back to HS, but their product is 4 not 5 stars.
author: Andrew B.

description:
I know everyone has already talked about it, but the secret breakfast is one of my best ice cream flavors I've ever had. The texture is really soft and fluffy with random delicious crunchy bits hidden within. I would come back just for this.

Unfortunately, I can't speak for any of the other flavors because I didn't really try much else other than secret breakfast. I don't remember any of them standing out, but it doesn't matter because secret breakfast is all you need to get!!
author: Ellen M.

description:
First of all, customer service was terrible. The girl had such an attitude. 

And perhaps they don't allow tasters, because when I asked if I could "try" the strawberry margarita sorbet, she came back with a bowl of it. That's fine, misunderstandings happen. (Though if my place didn't offer tasters, I'd clarify for the customer.) Regardless, the sorbet was horrible. I can't even explain the texture, except that sorbet shouldn't be like that. It was slimy, and stretchy and goopy.

My husband got the malted chocolate and it was alright. And when he asked her if there were milkshakes she rolled her eyes and condescendingly replied "we have what's on the menu."

Editing to say we went to the food truck.
author: Samantha E.

description:
10/10 Ice cream, easy parking, and convenient location. 

Slightly on the pricey side but that is to be expected for this kind of quality+the mission.

No bad attitudes from the staff. All is so very well here.

Their malted chocolate ice cream is my favorite ice cream of all time.

Flavor: 10
Service: 10
Miscellaneous: 10

Overall, 10/10 worth writing home to mom about.
author: Bryce M.

description: Gone here a couple times everyone is awesome, ice cream is mediocre, have had wonderful interactions with staff there.
author: James R.

description:
How have i not already written a review for what I think could be the best ice cream in the world? Seriously, it's that good. It isn't about lots of flavors or weird flavors. It's the taste and texture. They absolutely nail it. Smooth ice cream, no greasy or foamy texture, and amazingly well done flavors.

Fluffernutter is my favorite. The worst thing about it is that it's not always on the menu BUT that forces me to try other things and I'm never disappointed.

Humphry Slocombe - never change...but please open a shop somewhere in NOPA.
author: Ryan B.

description:
This is one of the most interesting ice cream spots in the city.  At first glance the flavours can be kind of WTF but at first taste it's all about yum. 

Only issue for me: some of the flavors are a little too sweet.  No problem though, since they let you sample as much as you want before you take the plunge. 

Stop thinking about it. Trust me, you should just go.
author: Shoole S.

description:
This past Sunday I ordered a scoop, finished it, then went back later to buy an entire pint of the best flavor in the entire universe: Secret Breakfast. As of yesterday (Tuesday), I'm finished with the pint. Yes, I'm an absolute pig when it comes to ice cream, but this is also a testament to the greatness of Humphry Slocombe! 

Seriously, though -- the Secret Breakfast flavor is the biggest draw for ice cream lovers from all around the city (and the bay area!). It's a delicious creamy bourbon concoction with cornflake cookie clusters inside.

The staff here is really nice, to the point where I even decided to tip an additional dollar on top of the steep $4-for-one-scoop price tag. Like the other reviews have said, they're very open to letting customers try as many flavors as they'd like.

Compared to Bi-Rite, the line was nothing. Granted, it was a cold windy Sunday evening, but still: Even rainy days bring hordes of ice cream fanatics to Bi-Rite, whereas Humphry Slocombe is like Bi-Rite's humble and underrated Mission ice cream brother. Equally tasty, much shorter line. 

Tip: There's a cute little park called Garfield Square at Harrison & 25th if you prefer eating with some green scenery. Grab a seat on the bleachers and people-watch some randos playing soccer.
author: Christine L.

description:
Just got a free scoop of the Golden Girls flavour. This month only: chocolate cherry cheesecake. Delicious!!!
The cast of the Golden Girls was there to celebrate this honor.
author: Michele F.

description: Am I the only one that thinks the ice cream is too salty? I guess it's suppose to be that way, but I like my ice cream sweet and creamy. I know ice cream has some salt but for me hs has too much. That with higher than average prices makes me want to never come here again. I thought maybe it was an accident. But this is like 4 different times I have tried it so I guess it's not for me. Counter people are friendly.
author: Debbie M.

description: Had the duck fat pecan pie. It was awesome. Would go back and recommend this place to others. They just need more people to help behind the counter.
author: Gerald M.

description: My family said we had to try this place and man, was it good. They let us sample a variety of the awesome flavors, and I have say the Secret Breakfast is what's up. Bourbon-infused with bits of corn flakes. The only thing that would make it even more decadent would be to make a coke float with it. Oh, they did?! So we had to try it! And it's delicious but must be shared if you value having a semi-stable insulin level. Very good all around.
author: Adam K.

description:
I was so anxious to eat my ice cream I forgot to take a picture...

Secret Breakfast

Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee

After School Special..

I didn't taste them all but the cone of Vietnamese Coffee I ordered was a beautiful ending to our afternoon in the city. It's not hard to describe how uniquely fresh the ice cream was.

The young ladies behind the counter were very professional and handled the crowd with ease.

No doubt that is some of the best ice I have tasted, shout out to my homegirl Dana that suggested the place, it pays to go to the city with a SF Native!!

I will be back, I will taste more than 2 flavors and I will order a double scoop...
author: Theresa L.

description:
Secret breakfast ftw!
They have very unique flavor here!
Service is always nice also!
author: Candice L.

description: This ice cream shop is honestly an abomination to ice cream, literally the nastiest thing I've ever had... please close down and open when ice cream actually taste decent..
author: Jason M.

description: Great spot for a treat on a sunny day. My favorite ice cream flavor in the world is their Secret Breakfast! Makes me actually want to pour some whiskey into my morning bowl of cereal.
author: Jean L.

description: Ice cream is every girl's weakness. I only got one scoop on my visit of the Secret Breakfast and loved every bite of it. It's flavors are unique and not overwhelmingly sweet. The flavor is bourbon ice cream with streams of corn flakes in it. You would think it would be crunchy bits since it has been mixed it, but it surprisingly caramel-y chewy texture. It wasn't soggy at all. Would love to return to try other unique fun flavors!
author: Tracy N.

description: Great stop in mission - staff was friendly and the flavors were great. Enjoyed ours (Vietnamese Coffee and Horchata Rose) on waffle cones!
author: Caitlin B.

description:
As soon as I tried my first sample I thought to myself, Why the f*** did I wait so long to make it over here??? 

All of my lofty, ice cream snob expectations were completely blown. Humphry Slocombe surpasses Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous for me in terms of creativity and taste. Though I prefer the texture at the latter.

Secret Breakfast (bourbon and cornflakes) - Definitely my favorite. Just wow.
Matchadoodle (matcha with snickerdoodle bits) -  Loved the matcha, needed more snickerdoodle!
POG (passionfruit, orange, guava) sorbet - Light and refreshing.
Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee - The best coffee ice cream ever.
Elvis the Fat Years (banana ice cream, bacon peanut brittle) - This sounded like overkill, but I loved it. My inner fat kid burst with happiness. Though I wish the bacon were more obvious.
Thai Chili Lime sorbet - Intense! A bit spicy and tangy.

Other notes:
-Everything was really, REALLY sweet. A-okay by me, but it was definitely noticeable.
-Walked in at 3 PM on a Saturday. There was a line of three people. SCORE!
-Also got lucky and found easy street parking a few blocks away.
author: Adrienne H.

description:
After sampling a few flavors (secret breakfast, blue bottle vietnamese coffee, and malted milk chocolate), I ended up with the coffee, since I'm a sucker for blue bottle. 

The line went quickly, and the people who work there are saints, given every customer samples at least 2-3 flavors. Smooth ice cream, with inventive flavors. Definitely satiated my sweet tooth. Foie gras sammies were on the menu last night. I was intrigued, but not enough to try it.
author: Jonelle T.

description:
Consider me lucky to come to this establishment with a decent short line on a Sunday night! :)

Ice cream is pretty amazing with out of the ordinary flavors such as Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee, Salt & Pepper, and Pumpkin 5 Spice (my fave). Reminds me of Penny's in Santa Cruz.

Not loads of seating inside but who cares when you've got all of Mission to roam around?

Pricer than elsewhere at $4 a scoop, but worth trying at least once.
author: Connie H.

description: Soooo good. Got the secret breakfast and the brown butter on a sugar cone and they mixed well. I sampled multiple flavors and they were good as well and really hard to narrow down. Probably couldn't go wrong with any flavor choice.
author: Ryan H.

description:
I creamed their counter.
They said 'thank you'.
Actually a pretty typical daily interaction for me. 

Is there a more tactful way to say I dropped ice cream on their stuff? Suuure. 
Am I going to go the tactful route? Nevahhh!

The truth is, I was really only minor-ly invested in getting ice cream when my roomie suggested coming here. I was mostly excited just to not be driving and to not have to be the one to make a plan... which is basically the greatest gift I can be given. 

I'd made the mistake of over-ice creaming the weekend before so I went shy with a single scoop in a cone and I definitely have some regrets about holding back at Humphry Slocombe. 

The flavor I chose was Miso Fuji Apple and it was basically the same sensation you'd get from petting a thousand kittens, but in my mouth and maybe with a slightly sexual tinge to it. And I don't care if that sounds gross, if you tried it you'd feel the same way so don't try that ice cream shaming sh*t on me. I would get this again in a heartbeat and pair it with their After School Special flavor that was a bunch of ooey gooey rich flavors that I love with chocolate covered potato chips mixed in. A part of my heart dies a little each time I think about the moment when I did not also order that.
author: Candice G.

description: DELICIOUS ice cream. Humphry Slocombe offers a variety of unique flavors, so you'll never be bored with their selection. I got the blue bottle Vietnamese coffee and I was not disappointed. I don't normally order coffee flavored desserts, but I couldn't say no when they told me it was one of their best sellers. The Vietnamese coffee was wonderful. It wasn't too overwhelming in coffee flavor and was sweeter than I anticipated. Most coffee flavors I have had have been somewhat bitter, but they're doing it right! I would definitely come back to work my way through their more adventurous flavors.
author: Rachel A.

description:
Truly one of my favorite ice cream places ever. Even better than Ici's in Berkeley IMO!

I've been to this place twice and even though it's not cheap, the quality of the ice cream and the service is phenomenal. 

ICE CREAM
Every time I go, I ALWAYS get the vietnamese coffee. The coffee is really strong but the creaminess and sweetness helps counteract that coffee bitterness. It's the perfect flavor if you like coffee and you don't want something that's overly sweet.

This time I also got the chocolate which was a bit TOO sweet for my liking but nevertheless it was still good and super rich and creamy! HEAVEN!

SERVICE
Their service is just phenomenal. Usually places limit it to about 3-4 samples but I'm a creature of variety and I like trying all the flavors that sound appealing to me (which essentially is 3/4 of the menu) and the guy serving us was super willing to let me try everything! Very kind of him. The line wasn't long when I went so I was in and out of the line within 3 min. Sampled everything, immediately greeted by the cashier to pay and was done. SIMPLE.

Love this place and whenever I'm around the ferry building, I will 100% be sure to stop here.
author: Cynthia H.

description: Very good ice cream with some unique flavors, but not the most pronounced flavors I've had. The way to go is definitely a sundae (especially the secret breakfast sundae or the brownie sundae - which has a homemade brownie that is delicious. The staff is very friendly too
author: Susanna G.

description: After seeing the atrocious line at Mitchell's on a random Friday night, my husband and I decided to take our talents to Humphry Slocombe for a late night treat.  Having been to their outpost at the Ferry Building, I was so happy to finally make it to their Mission shop.  As always, their Secret Breakfast is a no-brainer, but the Peanut Butter Fudge Ripple was also nothing to bat an eye at.  I can't stress how happy good ice cream makes me, so having a scoop of Humphry Slocombe after a long week makes everything better!
author: Lisa I.

description: The chocolate malt ice cream is amazing! Normally all ice cream for the most part tastes the same to me but this place put extra cream or something in it cuz it was so delicious
author: Leslie H.

description:
Some of the best ice cream I've ever eaten and my personal favorite in SF. This hipster shop creates really cool flavors like peanut butter curry, Vietnamese coffee, and other exotic ones that cater to the SF/Bay crowd. 

Secret breakfast is their most popular, with bourbon and cornflakes in a delicious vanilla bean. Every time I get it the flavor is on point, the texture is perfect with the crunchy cornflakes contrasting with the smooth vanilla bean, and it's not too sweet and surprisingly refreshing. I'm always amazed at how fast I can finish a scoop. I've sampled other flavors such as horchata and Harvey milk and graham cracker with honey, and those are good as well. 

While the Mission diner setting offers the most flavors, there is also a stand in the Ferry building as well as at the Yard at Mission rock. A SF staple and solid, amazing ice cream.
author: Steven V.

description:
this ice cream shop is probably my second favorite one in San Francisco. (absolute favorite is Mr. & Mrs. Miscellaneous. they weren't open that day. : /) this shop has become so popular for their radical combination of flavors that they have also opened a booth in the Ferry Building. 

this location only has street parking like most of the shops in the city. if u drive around the area for a while, it's not hard to find one. 

for ppl who don't often go into the city n love them, their ice cream can also b found at Bitter + Sweet in Cupertino. (their scoop is quite small tho. I'm into places where they scoop with a heavy hand. : )) 

Christmas Story : this is probably their seasonal flavor. it's so good n refreshing cuz of the large pieces of peppermint bark mixed in. 

Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee : this has a very concentrated coffee flavor from the popular Blue Bottle Coffee. lots o' caffeine. : )

Malted Milk Chocolate : tasted so rich n creamy. just like Maltesers! 

Tahitian Vanilla : smooth n not overly sweet. can't go wrong with this flavor.
author: Julie W.

description: Definitely some of the best ice cream I have ever had. I'm a lover of coffee ice cream, so of course I got the blue bottle Vietnamese flavor, it was delicious! My friend got the black sesame and loved it. The ice cream server wasn't the friendliest, hence the four stars. It was clear she was just trying to get through her shift, and not really enjoying what she was doing. It would be great (and would have gotten her a tip) if she was more enthusiastic.
author: Mollie H.

description: The hype was real for this place and I'm a huge believer in the power of yelp. The shop is cute enough and offers a variety of flavors . I went for the Secret Breakfast while my friend had the Chamoy. Like I said there are a ton of flavors to choose from and I think this is why this place has a cult following . The flavors were OK but the consistency of the ice cream was not appealing ; gritty and not thick or creamy in any way that Ice cream should be . I've had far better ice cream from a grocery store.
author: Frankie G.

description:
Ice cream is thick & rich, flavors were ok. Taste tested a few flavors but nothing really stood out so just opted for pumpkin five spice and Vietnamese coffee. They were out of black sesame, the main reason we drove out to try Humphry Slocombe. 

The employees left much to be desired, the cashier was really impatient and seemed like he wanted to be anywhere but there. No expressions, no smiles, no thank you's. We stood outside to eat our ice creams and were startled by this loud noise; one of the employees decided to throw down a pile of card boxes just a feet or two from where we were standing. 

Glad there was no line at 9pm on a Friday but line or no line, I doubt I'll return. I'd rather stand 20min in line at Bi-Rite for ice cream flavors that are divine and to support businesses with happier employees.
author: Ruby C.

description:
One of my favorite craft ice cream places. On  the expensive side, but worth it. 

I wish they'd hose down the sidewalk before opening. It's hard to enjoy my ice cream when the sidewalk smells like urine...
author: Angelica C.

description:
I still remember the first time I heard about Humphry and Secret Breakfast...oh, about five years ago? I remember my reaction being along the lines of "Bourbon in ice cream? And corn flakes?? That sounds...disgusting...." 

Fast forward to present day. Guess who's absolutely addicted? Guess who's so addicted, she wound up eating six pints of Secret Breakfast in seven days? Yep. Me.

You read that right. 6 pints in 7 days. 

I had mistakenly thought that if I just gorged myself on the ice cream and made myself sick, I could rid myself of this addiction forever (hey, it worked with Oreos). However, after waking up from sugar comas enhanced by bourbon, I just shuffled into the kitchen, grabbed a new spoon, and got to work on a new pint.

Worst (best?) addiction ever. Secret Breakfast has ruined all other ice cream for me. Forever.
author: Evelyn C.

description:
OH MY GOD! 

If Heston were to open up an ice creamery, this place would definitely sums up all the crazy flavors he would create. Foie Gras ice cream? Peanut Butter Curry? Blue Bottle Vietnamese Blend? Secret Breakfast? These are some of the flavors the creative genius behind Humpry Slocombe can create. 

I tried Peanut Butter Curry and it was damn good. But I decided to go for a more subtle flavor after a crazy tacos feast at La Taqueria in the south Mission district. I ordered Jasmine Lychee while my friend ordered Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee flavor. Both were good and not overly sweet. One thing that ice cream parlor in Singapore needs to learn is to go easy on the sugar or syrup content in the ice cream and concentrate on its texture and flavor. 

The ice cream were sold for $4 a scoop in a cup. Perfect for a post lunch treat as you explore the interesting mission neighbourhood.
author: Tzeko M.

description: It is very good, I will admit. But the price is too steep. In a blind taste taste there is barely any difference between Trader Joe's coffee ice cream and this high-priced brand. In fact, I would say that Trader Joe's version is even creamier and one-fourth the price as it is is less than $5 for 8 servings while Humphry's brand is $10 for 4 servings!  And I am a big coffee ice cream fan, so I do know a good coffee ice cream!!
author: Charmaine L.

description: Had the duck fat pecan pie with the honey and graham crackers ice cream. Not bad, a bit too sweet for my liking but overall a solid choice. I should have stuck to my go to secret breakfast flavor.
author: Kai A.

description: Just enjoyed a Caviar delivery of the Viet coffee ice cream. No complaints about the ice cream, but $11 + fees probably means this place should have more than one dollar sign on Yelp. I wonder if their delivery prices are marked up.
author: Paulina F.

description:
Haven't been here in a few years but I finally made it back today. I tried a few flavors and picked the milk chocolate passion fruit and the Candy Cap, a maple flavored ice cream, which were so delicious!! Two scoops is a bit much (was feeling kinda sick after) but I tried the Candy Cap after ordering a single scoop and deciding I needed another flavor. 

Can't complain, other than the ice cream is served at a pretty soft stage. My chocolate ice cream was almost like soft serve. It's good ice cream and they have interesting flavors. But man, $6 is a bit crazy for ice cream. Good thing I normally just eat my own. Expensive ice cream because San Francisco. ¯\_(ツ)_/¯
author: Christina K.

description: I love their ice cream- I particularly like the Vietnamese coffee, a true classic flavor of theirs.  Their vanilla is also quite delicious.  Definitely check it out!
author: Laleh J.

description:
In my opinion, this is the best ice cream in SF.  Flavors are nuanced and amazing. Texture is the creamiest I've experienced.  

Skip the lines at Bi-Rite, go to Humphry's!
author: Nick G.

description: Wow! Absolutely amazing ice cream. Literally felt my brain being flooded with dopamine as I slowly ate the combination of Vietnamese Coffee and Raw Honey and Blackberry (I think that's the name) I am bit of an ice cream snob and this is hands down my absolute favorite ice cream. The consistency, temperature (very cold) and flavors make it ridiculously pleasurable as it melts in your mouth. I can't believe some people gave it any less than a 5. Hurts my feelings. Go and sample away. There are so many tasty flavors, which does make choosing difficult. I recommend sitting down, closing your eyes and truly being present with the sensations that come with each bite/lick. ENJOY Ice Cream Heaven!
author: Brian H.

description:
I was actually a little surprised at how good humphry slocombe was. I'm personally not much of a big ice cream eating kind of guy, but some of the points were spot on.

I got the breakfast cereal and horchata flavor because I figured the 2 cinnamon flavors would compliment each other once they melted part way down the cup as I was eating.

Some things I noticed: the creaminess was a pretty good consistency and didn't lack, while the texture was soft. That's probably the most important aspect with ice cream to me, I just can't really eat it when it's frozen rock hard and lacking. But on the other side, the density of it was a little too light, at times leaving me feeing like I eating air and having it melt way too fast.

I liked the flavor a lot, it wasn't too sweet or have that artificial taste. That's kind of a deal breaker in the end when a good ice cream has a weird tang aftertaste because of artificial or too much sweetener. I also really liked some of their innovative flavors, it was different.

I do wish though that they had more options though. It definitely isn't on the top of my to do list when I visit San Francisco but I don't mind returning back again or bringing some friends with me.
author: Alex A.

description:
Humphry Slocombe is kind of a big deal in SF. Whenever I ask about the best ice cream in the city, it's Humphry or Bi-Rite. (As a reference point, Ample Hills Creamery in NY is my all-time favorite.)

And yet, Humphry didn't knock it out of the park for me. Their ice cream has a great texture, and there are some unique flavors available (like Hibiscus Beet and Red Hot Banana), but doesn't have me shouting from the rooftops.

I ended up choosing Secret Breakfast (their signature flavor, bourbon ice cream with cornflakes) and Harvey Milk and Honey Graham. The Secret Breakfast was a bit of a disappointment for me -- although I enjoyed the first few bites, it wasn't anything too special. Since it's one of their most popular flavors, I thought it would be a spiritual experience of sorts. The Harvey Milk was perfectly fine, but again, not very memorable.

The shop itself is not much to look at, and there's limited seating, so you may be better off taking it to-go.

Worth trying, it just didn't do it for me. The search continues!
author: Valerie L.

description:
Humphrey Slocombe's is daring with their creations. They set themselves apart with alcohol flavored ice cream, unique to what I've ever tried. 
They let you try before you buy. One afternoon, I tried jasmine lychee, beer nut, and harvey milk with graham cracker. Jasmine lychee is tasty. The ice cream tastes exactly as it sounds, no subtlety here. Beer nut REALLY tastes like beer. Whatever they do, they have prime ice cream making skills. I had the harvey milk ice cream which was creamy and rich. However, my favorite here is their signature Secret Breakfast.
author: Jaime F.

description:
Oh, Humphry Slocombe, you have my heart. You warm that large part of my heart dedicated to ice cream, gelato, and other creamy frozen dairy products.

I will simply dedicate my review to their secret breakfast. Why don't all breakfasts taste like this? Why doesn't my heart healthy oatmeal taste like this? And who thought of the combination of Bourbon and corn flakes and why does it work so well? This is definitely one you must try if not order when coming to HS. I love the texture that comes through from the cornflakes and the unique sweet, liqueur tastes from the bourbon.

And just when you thought it couldn't get better, it does. I've essentially cut out all soda from my life, but I do make an exception for a Bourbon and Coke float. Coke from a glass bottle (makes a difference that it is glass) over 2 scoops secret breakfast equals your best friend on a warm SF day.

The ice cream scene is a pretty plentiful party, but Humphry Slocombe definitely holds one of the top spots for me. Plus they have locations now in the Ferry building and at the Yard by AT&T Park.
author: Danielle G.

description: For all the hype around this place I was pretty disappointed! The flavors were pretty tasty, but the ice cream was way too soft to be in a cone- they had to give me a bowl and a spoon to catch since it was going to fall off. Maybe I came on an off day? I would probably try it again because the Secret Breakfast flavor is really tasty.
author: Kayla B.

description: Secret Breakfast. Oh my goodness. What a combo! I haven't had a chance to try other flavors but, gosh, does this hit the spot! It's delicious.
author: Belinda L.

description: Yummy ice cream :) The secret breakfast and blue bottle coffee are my favorites but many runner ups too.
author: Jenny H.

description:
After lunch at Pier 39, my boyfriend and I decided to stop by the market place to see what was going on. It seemed like they were having a farmers market. This led to us adventuring inside the building and we found a huge array of specialty food places. After researching on yelp, we decided to try this ice cream parlor because it was hot outside. 

The first thing we noticed were that they ran out of cones! It was only about 2pm in the afternoon so this place must be really good. The lines were also very long but it did not take a very long before we were first in line. The service is amazing; they are very patient with new customers and were able to answer any questions. 

We ordered:

- The matchadoodle (single scoop): It was my boyfriend's favorite! However, I thought that it was okay. I was able to taste the matcha but not the snickerdoodle part of the ice cream. 

- The vietnamese coffee (single scoop): I thought this flavor was okay too. For me, the ice cream was overly sweet and it was not as creamy and soft as I thought it would be. 

I had really high expectations for this place because of all the awesome yelp reviews. 
However, I would like to give this place another try though! I am hoping that it was just the flavors that I tried.
author: Helen P.

description:
Hehe love the mission! So when I found out this ice cream shop was here I was so excited ^-^ I got the cream cheese chocolate chip. It reminded me of a greek yogurt chocolate chip ice cream. It has a sour kick to it so I enjoyed it.

The overall texture of it was definitely creamy. Has that thick texture that doesn't melt easily. I would say it's less milky tasting than bi-rite. But both are the same level of goodness. They both have their good flavors and weird tasting flavors. They are all super unique so you'll have a wide range of choices.
author: Frances T.

description:
After having dinner in the Mission in May of last year, our group of four decided to drop by Humphry slocombe for dessert. We each tried a different flavor.

-Blue bottle Vietnamese coffee
-Hibiscus beet sorbet
-Malted milk chocolate
-Secret breakfast

Yum! I love that they have unique flavors like Blue bottle and Secret breakfast! Can you tell those were my picks?! I love coffee so the Blue bottle was perfect! And a boozy ice cream?! Sold on secret breakfast!

The staff is also super nice! Since my gf was in from out of town, we asked if they could take a couple of pix! They happily obliged.

Will definitely be back to try more flavors!
author: Elena N.

description:
Modern Art = I Could Do That + Yeah, But You Didn't 
Craig Damrauer

Ever go to a modern art museum?  This place is like that.  I'm use to the classics like vanilla but this place has for the most part moved on past the classics into mind blowing flavors!  Luckily they still serve Tahitian Vanilla here for old timers like me.  :-)  This classic flavor is awesome!  Full of rich creamy vanilla flavor it is among the best I have ever had.  Some of the more modern flavors I've tried and loved include:

POG sorbet - Flavor just like POG I had in Maui by Meadow Gold.  :-)
Cinnamon Brittle - amazing cinnamon flavor

This is one of the finest ice cream shops I've ever been to.  You never know what flavor you will find here.  Also this is the only ice cream shop you can show up at 9:30pm on a cold windy night and there is a line of hipsters out the door...
author: Soo H.

description:
Very unique flavors. If you are looking for regular stuff don't come here. Their sorbets were way too sweet and weird. Asians may like the sweet and sour tamarind agave.. reminds me of chinese candy. 

I ended up getting some type of cobbler.. maybe berry and figs.. anyway it was good not memorable. Might come back here to try other flavors as they seem to rotate 

A little more pricey than other places.
author: Michael T.

description:
Continuing my hunt for the best ice cream in SF!

Think the people here really make the place great. The owner or manager (not sure which) was there when my group arrived and was very helpful in getting us oriented with the flavors. He was super friendly, and you can tell he was very passionate about ice cream and proud about the store. The flavors are pretty unique with Secret Breakfast probably being their most popular item (bourbon and corn flake). I opted for a more traditional flavor: Blue Bottle Vietnamese Iced Coffee. Because it was Vietnamese Iced Coffee rather than just coffee, it was much sweeter. It was a little too sweet for my liking but that's my own fault for getting a whole scoop after sampling 4 other delicious flavors. Overall, great shop, great people, great flavors!
author: Denise L.

description: Matchadoodle is bomb, try it! This place has not only unique flavors, but great tasting ice cream. If you're craving ice cream you can't go wrong here.
author: Kartik S.

description: Super bummed the experience we just had. Humphrey's had only 2 customers in front of us that were together. They were waiting for her to get off the phone to order which was no biggie. The big deal was that they began a conversation for over 7 minutes without even acknowledging the presence of other customers. I have worked in over 10 restaurants and we always at least address the presence of other customers to let them know we see them. They even began to talk about how some people want to taste every flavor to only get vanilla in the end. This is all very funny except we are still not being acknowledged or asked if we knew what we wanted since they did not. They continued to joke around while we fiddled our thumbs salivating. They then apologized for taking so long to her, and they all laughed and she said no worries we are open until 11! Didn't once look at us; And the customer turns around and says, "Don't worry, he probably won't take until 11 to order." I'm sorry but we stood there for at least another 2 minutes suggesting our patience & desire to wait for ice cream to be ignored further and jokes to continue amongst them. It is one of the nicest days in SF and it shouldn't take 10 minutes for an order to be made or the next customers to be addressed. We were the only other people in there patiently waiting to be pompously teased about it. Horrible customer service, I don't care if these people are neighbors. We are too. Won't be coming back as there are tons of other places we would rather support that address our presence. Good luck with your pompous attitudes. Our last experience was really good and the experience today was just ridiculous.
author: Brea K.

description: Good does not begin to describe the elegant, elevated, delectable flavors here at Humphry Slocombe. I am lactose-intolerant and so loved the carrot-mango sorbet. Creamy and amazingly delicious... not at all what you'd expect. My friends had the Vietnamese Blue Bottle Coffee and the chocolate-peanut butter flavors. Oh wow. Good, great, better than just about anywhere.
author: Deb S.

description:
Choosing your favorite ice cream place in San Francisco is like choosing a gang affiliation.  People swear by Mitchell's or will die with Bi-rite in hand.  But, I rep Humphry's and I stand by my statement that this is the best ice cream in SF. 

They have a couple of flavors that you can rely on being there like "Secret Breakfast" (bourbon + cornflakes), "Harvey Milk and Honey Graham", or the "POG" (passion, orange, guava) sorbet... 

Which are all great, but you can always expect some crazy flavor that somehow works like the "After School special" (vanilla, caramel, choco-covered potato chips), "Eton Mess" (strawberry, marshmallow fluff), or some beer flavored ice cream.  

Sometimes they'll try to keep it classy and sassy like "Olive Oil" or "Here's your damn strawberry". 

In the end, there's no "wrong" flavor.  Everything somehow works... and deliciously.
author: Candace C.

description:
Love, love, love this place. This place is all about homemade ice cream with twist. Walked here after lunch at American Grilled Cheese and were happily welcomed by a pair of employees at the counter. They insisted we try as many samples as we'd like to decided. They have an interesting assortment of odd flavors but I quickly found my favorite. 

Their signature ice cream is Secret Breakfast which a bourbon and corn flakes ice cream that is to die for. It almost feels like you're drinking a glass of bourbon, so beware. Then there was the Oolong ice cream which made me so unbelievably happy as a lover of tea. It was so delicious. I couldn't decide between the two so I got both. Heaven in a cup. Secret breakfast can get a little intense after awhile, it's really strong, but I could eat my weight in Oolong ice cream. 

This place was amazing and any lover of ice cream must make a stop here. I'll definitely be back!
author: Stephanie P.

description: ok, I found what I ordered to be a bit too much in the sweet territory. Bi-Rite is better IMO.
author: H K.

description:
I really wish I could give 3.5 stars because 3 does not do it justice. The Secret Breakfast makes this very close to a 4 star for me, but the ice cream didn't agree well with my system (although this could just be me being too sensitive).

We tried several flavors and ended up with the Secret Breakfast and Black Sesame. The Secret Breakfast lives up to the hype and I think Humphry Slocombe could survive just fine selling only this flavor. I personally couldn't handle more than a few bites of it, but this was a general issue I found I had with ALL of their flavors--they all made me thirsty!!! Weird, right? This thirsty feeling came to me after every sample I tried, but was most particularly pronounced in the ice creams (as opposed to the sorbets). I also found every thing I tried to be way too sweet. So my guess is that there is a ton of sugar and salt in their recipes. I'm usually down with lots of sugar, but for some reason, it was a bit much, even for me. I much prefer the Black Sesame at Tara's in Berkeley, but I also think if you come here, you should just get the Secret Breakfast.

As expected, the more scoops you get, the better the price is per scoop. I recommend getting 3 for $7.50, if you can handle the sugar/salt overload!
author: Tiffany H.

description:
Great quality ice cream, wonderful favors. 

Humphry Slocombe delivers high quality frozen treats. There are a small selection of favors but they cover a wide variety of tastes.  This week, Humphry offered a selection of beer flavored ice cream. I sampled the Amber Flying Cloud Stout. It had a rich beery flavor with a hint of salt, creating a complex creamy flavor.

So if you need something cold to eat and up for some unique favors, then try Humphry Slocombe.
author: Nadav P.

description:
Blue bottle vietnamese coffee. The best coffee ice cream! So smooth and so creamy. yumm

I came here on a Saturday evening a few weeks ago. There was no line and the people working there were really nice and let me and my friend try almost every flavor :X 
There were pretty exotic flavors from candied ginger, to bourban infused ice cream. We personally didn't like those ones so much, but I can see people that like ginger and bourbon enjoying those ones.
author: Christie L.

description:
Yummers! This place is great! HS also has a new location inside the Ferry Building. HS doesn't serve as many flavors as Bi-Rite but their flavors are spot on. They're most famous for their "Secret Breakfast" flavor which is a bourbon and cornflake ice cream. It's good but not my cup of tea. If you like bourbon, you should definitely try the bourbon and coke float! I got a scoop of the blue bottle vietnamese coffee and the cinnamon flavor and I was one happy camper! 

$4 for a scoop and unfortunately they do not let you split the scoop for 2 flavors.
author: Denise H.

description:
You must try the Secret Breakfast (bourbon ice cream with corn flakes)!!!

It blew my taste buds away. The bourbon ice cream had a great mix of salty + sweet, which I absolutely love. The corn flakes were an amazing crunch for added texture. 

My single scoop cost $4. It's a little pricier than some places, but it was definitely worth it!
author: Lincy H.

description: Best offbeat ice cream in San Francisco! Secret Breakfast is no secret anymore, but it's danged addictive.
author: Barry H.

description:
I may have tried the wrong flavors, but nothing seemed especially special about the ice cream here (may also just be "disappointment caused by overhype" issue). I had the coffee flavor and lavender flavor. Definitely good ice cream and the line wasn't long either (grants this place 4 stars), but I didn't find anything special about this ice cream place. 

Would go back if I was in the neighborhood, but probably wouldn't make a trip out just for this place.
author: Rafat N.

description:
I don't know how I feel about a scoop of ice cream costing more than a full-fledged super taco in the same neighborhood.... $4 is steep, but my ice cream addiction runs deep :v

I've tried Humphry at Ferry Building before and I feel like the scoops are larger there: they pile on disorderly heaping mounds of ice cream, while the Mission location neatly rounds off their scoops. Maybe the server here got mad that I sampled 3 flavors. But if I'm paying ~$3-4/scoop, I reserve my right to sample :v

Prices don't include tax so my double scoop ended up being $6.53 The pricing justifies having ice cream for lunch :v

(+++) Oolong tea: I'm one of those Asian girl milk tea fanatics... you can thus imagine my excitement over ice creamy tea bursting with the aromatic scents of oolong. I think it's safe to conclude that Humphry's oolong tea ice cream has stronger tea flavors than Quickly's.
(++) Toast and jam: I imagined either a bread pudding variation or nasty bread mushed into ice cream, but Humphry somehow concocts a magical ice cream reminiscent of toast and jam without any of the grossness that you expect for bread ice cream. 
(+) Nectarine plum yogurt: I liked the nectarine and plum, but I don't know whether it's the yogurt that throws off the texture. I found it way too icy and much more like sorbet.
(+/-) Miso peach: Interesting concept, but to me the savory miso taste didn't go too well with peach in ice cream. Miso braised peach would be better off as a warm plate at an izakaya.
(+/-) Anchor Steam: I've had amazing Guinness ice cream before at Carmela's in Socal, but I'm not sure Anchor Steam is the best in ice cream. I'd stick to the PG-21 flavors here.
(?) Secret breakfast: I've actually not tried this yet! It always seems to be available so I'm drawn to trying the other flavors. Too many delicious ice cream flavors to choose from....best first world problem ever.
author: Edna C.

description:
