Am surprised I don't have a review for this place. This is one of my go-to ice cream shops in SF.

FLAVORS:
This place like a lot of the others gets creative w their menu naming.  Ice cream here is on the thick and creamy side with bold flavors, while sorbet here is also uniquely flavored and texture is melty and not super icy/chunky, which I like.  

My go to flavors:
-Vietnamese Coffee (so good!!)
-Secret Breakfast (beware this one has alcohol but it's mighty tasty all those times I snuck some ;)
-Balsamic Caramel
-Olive Oil
-Harvey Milk and Honey

CLEAN:
Yes the shop is clean but the seating is limited so eating and walking is a good idea--so much to see in the Mission after all.

PARK:
Go after 6pm for free street parking or be prepared to walk a few blocks to avoid the steep meter costs.

NOTES:
I like that they take Square and sell by the pint.  Check out their Ferry Building location as well if you need a post-work pick me up!
author: Jennifer Y.

description:
Hands down the best ice cream in SF. I'm so happy that the Ferry Building location isn't the only one. Don't want to wade through a sea of tourists to get my ice cream!

They let you sample the wonderfully artisanal ice cream flavors, and my two favorites are the secret breakfast and brown butter. The secret breakfast is Bourbon and corn flakes -- admit it, you've thought about having that for breakfast. The brown butter is just a fantastic butterscotch-y mix of goodness. No words can describe.
author: Nikhil S.

description:
Creamy ice cream with a side of quirk. Rotating flavors, but all strong and memorable. My favorite is always the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee. A must. Recent loves include boysenberry crisp and bourbon.

This location is better than the one at the Ferry Building because there's free street parking, and the line is much shorter on the weekends! The last couple visits, barely a 5-10 minute wait for deliciousness!

Triple scoop it every time. Trust.
author: Yvette T.

description: YUM! YUM! and some more YUM!! The ice cream is creamy with rich flavor. My favorite is Blue Bottle Vietnamese. It is simply the BEST! :)
author: Pamela S.

description:
I'm not the biggest fan of ice cream but Humphry Slocombe is the type of spot you can't miss when you're in the area. A group of friends and I split three scoops ($8): Secret Breakfast, Blue Bottle, and Peanut Butter Ripple. The bourbon flavor of the Secret Breakfast was really strong. I  initially enjoyed the novelty of the flavor but it left a bitter aftertaste. The Peanut Butter Ripple had a strong, sharp taste as well that I enjoyed; the blend of peanut butter and chocolate was very authentic and worked well together. My favorite was definitely the Blue Bottle. Its tampered sweetness really allowed the distinct coffee flavor to shine through and had a much more subtle taste compared to the other two. 

Overall, the creaminess and quality of Humphry Slocombe makes it well deserving of its hype.
author: Tony P.

description:
Very interesting flavors.

I got the Blue Bottle Viet Coffee and the Secret Breakfast.  The Secret Breakfast is the best.  The Viet Coffee was pretty good but there was just something off about it.  I can't tell if they mixed the coffee flavor with something that didn't quite work or if there was just some kind of after taste I didn't love.

I also tried the Banana Chai since I love bananas and I love chai.  It was way too chai for me.

Service is pretty good here.  Cute clean little store.
author: Phillip N.

description: My most favorite ice cream parlor is none other than Humphrey Slocombe.  I've chosen this place well, since there's great variety of random flavors.  One of the flavors I like is the Candy Cap, a mushroom flavor as sweet as a maple syrup.  I like to go there sometimes to see Today's flavors.  Few years ago (I don't actually know what year), I tried the fois gras ice cream sandwich for $5 at the Farmer's market outside the Ferry Building.  I tried it once and it taste good, but will never try again.  I like locally grown fruit and vegetable flavors made by scratch, and no artificial flavors, colors, sweeteners, and preservatives.  If you like great variety, Humphrey Slocombe is a perfect place!
author: Jimmy C.

description:
The Blue Bottle Vietnamese coffee ice cream is so good, definitely the flavor to get here for coffee lovers! I just wish they had some chocolate chips inside the ice cream or an option to have it as a topping. I tried the secret breakfast as well and liked the texture the crunchy corn flakes added to the ice cream, but it was just too sweet for my taste. My boyfriend got the chocolate smoked sea salt, which was pretty good and not overly sweet. He also got the red hot banana, but I wasn't a fan because I don't like red cinnamon.

Overall, Humphry Slocombe is a great ice cream shop with a variety of unique flavors, but I can't say it's my favorite, as some other spot has already got me Smitten. ;)
author: Celia K.

description: The ice cream was good, but it was a tad pricey. The assortment of flavors was diverse.
author: Mike F.

description: def one of the better ice creams in SF. They have unique flavors and much like a lot of the SF ice creameries, they make it fresh. I'm still partial to Garden Creamery though
author: Tao Tao W.

description:
Delicious creamy freshly made ice creams daily. 
Blue bottle Vietnamese coffee is my absolute favorite, $4 a scoop brings me so much happiness!! You gotta try!!
author: Iris H.

description: I tried their Secret Breakfast ice cream and immediately fell in love! It's a delicious creamy bourbon concoction with cornflake cookie clusters sprinkled inside. It doesn't sound like an appetizing combo, but they actually paired well together when fused into ice cream. The conflakes were a perfect mix of soggy and crunchy and you could taste the bourbon in the ice cream. Will be back to try other flavors.
author: Helen C.

description: The most intriguing flavors! Definitely worth the wait if there is a line. It might seem slightly steep for ice cream but it's super unique AND they'll let you try before having to decide.
author: Sarah G.

description:
From ham to soap, the ferry building's halls are populated with store fronts that boast everything "artisanal." Despite using the word ironically to describe arbitrary liquids put in mason jars, I didn't actually know the definition of "artisanal" until a couple minutes ago when I looked it up on Dictionary.com - "pertaining to or noting a high-quality or distinctive product." 

Humphry Slocombe is no exception. 

Upon entering the line, the menu board hit me with a lineup of flavors that all sounded so enticing, you could've called me a tree... I was stumped. haha. We were helped by a swell, beanie-wearing fellow, A+ customer service. After some intense indecision, I went with the "Double Happiness" ice cream sandwich which is made with Oolong Tea Ice Cream + Ginger cookies. The cookies were soft and the ice cream was very tasty. Oolong is my favorite tea and this is the first time I've been able to enjoy it in ice cream form!! I would've included a picture but 1) I was too focused on eating the food and 2) my phone was on important Pokemon catching duty. 

I'll definitely be back at the pier to nab the 300+ Magikarp candies I need in order to evolve mine into a Gyarados, so I can't wait to try the rest of the flavors when I do :~)
author: Annie W.

description:
You know when you have a perfect day and then something happens to make it even more perfect.. and you just feel like you can burst from happiness? Well I had the most perfect day with my gfs in Sausalito then came back on the ferry and decided to get a cone of goodness at Humphrys. 

This wasn't my first time having it but this time really stood out! Of course the Secret Bfast is great but you must try the brown sugar, I haven't seen this flavor often but it was amazing! 
I typically get tired of eating icecream after a few bites but not this time! I was smiling from ear to ear after. 

Like most places that are amazing, expect long lines; its worth it! The staff gets through the lines pretty fast. Humphrys does a stellar job at coming up with creative and exciting flavors with QUALITY ingredients.
author: Hetal P.

description: Man!!! I've died and gone to heaven!!! If you are ever in the Mission and are in dire need of some smakin ass Ice cream, look no further.
author: Chantel S.

description:
I was really excited to try this place after seeing everyone rave about all their unique flavors. 

I came here thirty minutes before they closed on a Friday and got Vietnamese coffee (MmMmMmm) and dulce de leche (so-so) on a cone. I also sampled peanut butter curry but I thought it was kinda too weird for my liking. Overall, cool place to hit up if your sweet tooth is feeling adventurous. I'm definitely coming back to try other flavors. 

Some things to keep in mind:
1. Don't come so late or else they might run out of flavors - Secret Breakfast on my mind but didn't get to try it (._.)
2. Line moves kinda slow if people in front of you sample everything. 

HUGE PROPS for their bangin' throwback playlist that reminded me of high-school dances. I really enjoyed eating my ice cream to Ms. New Booty.
author: Laverne N.

description:
A little on the pricey side, but this is SF after all. 
Abundant flavor and not too heavy. The  chocolate chip is recommended.
author: Charlie G.

description:
Amazing ice cream!!! 

The flavors here are very unique. You can't order these flavors anywhere else!

Loved the Harvey milk with graham crackers & secret breakfast bourbon cornflakes. 

Who else would think of these flavors?!
author: scott t.

description:
Food stand at outsidelands. My review for the storefront itself is under the ferry building location. 

Jalapeño cornbread ice cream - 5/5 - One of the best ice creams I've ever had. The jalapeño is not noticeable but the ice cream tastes so much like cornbread and there are so many crumbs of cornbread in there that it is amazing. I hope they keep this flavor.

Overall, cornbread ice cream is unique and "as good as it gets."
author: Mark O.

description: Terrific doesn't even describe the feeling I got after enjoying my artisan ice cream on the streets of SF's Mission District. Browned butter all the way, baby!!! I loved that I was allowed to taste the flavors before selecting, essential for enjoyment if I do say so myself. I can see why this local chain has become so big throughout SF. Don't question it, just eat it!
author: Carlie D.

description: Creative but only one standout flavor when we visited(secret breakfast-rum ice cream with crunchy cornflake cookie chunks).  The other flavors were ok.  We had malted chocolate and sampled almost all of the case.  Maybe it is because of Jenis and Graeters where we live,  but I found this place overrated.  Not bad, just not worth their prices.
author: Jeff S.

description:
MY OH MY. 

This ice cream place is definitely original. I mean, who else would think of putting bourbon and cornflakes together? 

This ice cream place is located on Harrison St. Just keep driving down Harrison St. and look for a navy blue awning. Parking is all on the streets and they're metered unless you try to look for parking in the residential zones. 

Inside the ice cream shop is a small sized building that only has one door way. There's about 6 seats for people to sit down and there is a unisex bathroom located inside as well. They offer water near the entrance if you need it. 

Prices are a bit pricey with one scoop costing $4. But the ice cream is amazing so I wouldn't mind splurging once in a while. 

They have a couple flavors a day. I heard they change some flavors from time to time so definitely should go back from time to time to see what they have to offer. Some of their flavors include their popular breakfast special, oolong tea, blue bottle Vietnamese coffee, Olive oil, Tahitian vanilla, chocolate sea salt, and pog sorbet. 

Overall, would come back again. Pretty easy to get to off the freeway, just need to spend some time finding parking. Some of tier flavors are definitely unique and man oh man, I can go for more. :)
author: Venus L.

description:
There's a two headed cow head in here. Also weird art in the front. Okay, okay. I dig.

I was already walking around this area (coming from Taqueria Vallarta) and saw this place right around the corner. Having remembered that I had bookmarked this place and read through the weird ingredients and flavors sometime in the past, I instantly ducked in the doorway.

Space:
It's kind of small, but that's to be expected. There's a bar for a couple people to sit and and people watch out the window, but otherwise expect to just head in and out, and not spend too much time in the store itself. The decorations are great: there's a painting with a wrestler on it that caught my eye, and of course the cow head is also intriguing.

Service:
Very friendly workers! They definitely could tell I had never been here before, and were willing to put up with my countless samples and questions.

Food:
Aaaand here's the best part. The flavors are so weird. I'm a little sad that I was a bit sick while eating this, so some flavors I couldn't really distinguish (for example, I couldn't really tell what was in Secret Breakfast.) However, I got the Thai Lime Chili Sorbet and my life was changed. It's the equivalent of a papaya salad you'd order at a Thai restaurant (wow, who would've guessed...), but frozen. And magical. It kind of reminded me of nuoc mam, a Vietnamese chili fish sauce dressing, which I love. And if that puts you off, then ignore that description and try it out for yourself, because I promise it is one amazing experience.

Some other flavors I would have liked to get? The Vietnamese coffee and strawberry flavors, or maybe if I'm lucky, bacon or something.


I'll come back for weirder flavors in the future, since this is quite an affordable treat! And another chance to look at that weird cow head.
author: Kat P.

description: I love ice cream even if I'm lactose intolerant but this place is a MUST. Parking is somewhat difficult to find tho since it's in a neighborhood with barely any parking unless you park couple blocks away. They got all types of crazy flavors which makes it unique. The other day I tried the secret breakfast flavor which had cereal in it! Your mouth is just going crazy thinking am I eating a bowl of cereal or an ice cream?! Hmm....anyways they had Vietnamese coffee which I had a sample but it was bit too bitter for me. There was other cool flavors but definitely satisfied my mouth in these hot weird weather we're having in SF! I'll be back!! (Terminator voice)
author: Monica W.

description:
I just love Humphrey Slocombe!

Like any ice cream place you're free to sample the flavors before buying. I agree with all the other Yelpers recommending the Secret Breakfast, since it's one of their most unique flavors! The ice cream is an interesting combination of bourbon + cornflakes. Sounds kinda funny but it's delicious, and I'm normally the type to order the standard cookies and cream at an ice cream joint.
author: Connie Q.

description:
I'm absolutely sure we would have learned about this place via Yelp but it was an episode of Andrew Zimmern's Bizarre Foods that pointed us to this destination.

Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee became an instant favorite for me... the best coffee flavored ice cream by a mile!!!  Our older daughter loves the Secret Breakfast while the younger one goes for the fruity flavors like the Orange Clove.

Flavors are unique and excellent - guaranteed to work wonders even on a cold day in the city...
author: John L.

description:
At first, I had negative thoughts about the ice cream flavors offered at Humphry Slocombe. I mean, peanut butter curry, balsamic caramel, and mango carrot? Who came up with these absurd flavors?!

Well, that person is a genius. I'm surprised that some of these flavor combinations actually work.

The ever so popular two-flavor combination, Secret Breakfast and Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee, make a wonderful duo. Secret Breakfast is very milky and the sweet cornflakes add a nice crunch, but the Bourbon is hardly noticeable. Vietnamese Coffee is rich and creamy, and is definitely one of my favorites!

The Carrot Mango Sorbet is a strange, yet interesting combination. The carrot flavor is much more prominent than the mango flavor. The overall texture is smooth, not icy, that I could've mistaken myself for eating healthy a vegetable-fruit puree rather than a dessert.

The Jesus Juice is a wonderful pairing of wine and cola in sorbet-form. Who'd knew these two would pair so nicely, yet taste the two flavors individually.

Service is very friendly and quick. They're very generous with giving out samples. The shop is small and cramped with only six stools inside and a few tables and chairs outside. It's very simplistic-looking from the outside, so this shop could be easily missed. If you're looking for non-traditional flavors, try Humphry Slocombe. But don't go too crazy by pairing an ice cream with a sorbet. Now that's just weird.
author: Priscilla W.

description:
When it comes to ice cream, this is the place to be. You guys know how I like my hole in the wall places. This Place is a nice hole in the wall. It has outside seating , maybe two tables outside , so first come first serve. They have inside seating, again like two chairs, first come first serve again. 

Now to pros: ice cream is not regular ice cream, if you want plain go to the nearest grocery store. If you want out of the ordinary stay here! They have different flavors every few weeks EXCEPT for the best ice cream called SERECT BREAKFAST! I swear by this ice cream, try  it and it will change your life. I also like the  Harvey milk and honey ice cream. (Please try both.) Whoevers working is always willing to let you sample all the different combinations! You could be there for a while #30mins or so. 

If you are in a hurry don't come on nice sunny San Francisco days the line will be out the door and around the corner. But if you can stand the stand then your feet and body will be glad with the decisions you have made. Always fresh and creamy. Never had a day where I came and said I don't like this. 

A plus: they actually have a bathroom and wheelchairs can fit as well! Yess everybody is welcomed in there.

Con: it is small and the wait time is long(on some days). They don't always have the same ice cream, some days the Harvey milk and honey is gone .
author: Monee C.

description:
I scream for ICE CREAM!!! :D

I've tried Humphry Slocombe's Ice Cream at BitterSweet in Cupertino a year ago and fell instantly in love with the Secret Breakfast & Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee. Soo heavenly good!

Finally, this past weekend I got to try the ice cream at their actual store, and yes, it was still freakin amazingly yummy! Friendly service, adorable little place with the cute spinny chairs, and a few outdoor seating as well. 

Perfect little ice cream parlor fo shizzle! :)
author: Amy C.

description: I'm used to going to the Salt n straw in LA more times than I can count and this does not measure up in any way. SnS beats them in portion size, taste, decor, creativity, number of flavors; but not waiting time, so that's one for them I guess. The Vietnamese coffee was ok but the famous secret breakfast was a total turn off. The huge pieces of cereal were hard and leathery and broke the experience. You want the almond brittle flavor from SnS instead.
author: JD W.

description: Humphry slocombe oh how much I love you and your delicious, creamy ice cream. The flavors are to die for. I love the selection, the many many samples I get every time I go, the friendliest employees, and everyone just has a good vibe every humphry slocombe I go to. I mean why wouldn't   you have good vibes when you're about to get the best ice cream. I love everything about this place and also how they sell pints of it to take home. This location and the ferry building location is just awesome. Beats Bi-rite in my opinion. Keep up the good work/business. Always satisfying my love for ice cream!
author: Anne F.

description:
- Unique flavors
- Creamy and milky
- Delicious
- Line moves quickly
- Outstrips Buy-rite and Mitchell's

Cons:
- In a part of the Mission that has me looking over my shoulders
author: Lovina H.

description:
You know something is a little different about this place when you spy the two headed calf taxidermy on the wall. 

Don't expect boring icecream flavours here, but rather wacky combinations that will really get your tastebuds and brain excited. I love that they let you sample as many as you like before deciding on your fix. Ultimately I couldn't go past the "secret breakfast" - a mix of cornflakes and bourbon. I don't know who actually would eat this combination for breakfast, but whoever they are I think they and I should be friends.
author: Tresna L.

description:
Super cool selection of flavors! If you are more of the indulgent type, seeking rich and creamy ice cream flavors, Humphry is your go to!

They seem to be rotating flavors on a regular basis, so if you find one that is around for a limited time, TRY IT! I had the Secret Breakfast, which was infused with Bourbon. I won't hesitate in stating that you literally get a sip of Bourbon with each spoonful! The toast and jam was quite delicious as well!! One scoop on a cone can set you back for about $4. 

Enjoy~~!
author: Sarin P.

description:
The reason that this part of the Mission is growing on me may have something to do with Humphry Slocombe. Not only do the employees move you along the line with minimal fuss and maximum efficiency, they get down to the ghetto tones of our youth. The vibe is the complete opposite of Ici in Berkeley - and I dig. 

It seems like many great ice cream shops these days have a few things in common (with the exception of Smitten):
- The Flavor Wall - a rotating selection of unique signatures (Prosciutto?) and classics (complete list found at http://www.humphryslocombe.com/www.humphryslocombe.com/Flavor_List.html)
- Samplings - you can't know before you know, ya know? Just make sure your spoon makes it into the "Dirty Spoons" can. 
- Paraphernalia - in this case, mugs with the twin calf-heads. And soon, the official Humphry Slocombe book!
- Nibbles - sweet little munchies you can eat by themselves from the package or on top of your ice cream.
- A Line - self explanatory. But actually, not bad, and by the time we were done eating there was none. 
- $$ - unfortunately, this is no $1 soft serve joint (ILY McDonald's). 

I only sampled the Secret Breakfast (bourbon and corn flakes, yes!) and Golden Beet Saffron (meh) flavors, but my ice cream senses were telling me to get the Szechuan Strawberry (yes!) and Jasmine Lychee (YASS). Good thing I brought a friend. In order of my preference:
Jasmine Lychee -- Secret Breakfast -- Szechuan Strawberry -- Blue Bottle Vietnamese Iced Coffee -- ... -- Golden Beet Saffron
The flavors are surprisingly true to their names, so if you LOVE Blue Bottle coffee,  or jasmine tea / lychee fruit, I will guarantee you will love that ice cream. Szechuan Strawberry earned an eyebrow raise from my friend, but it's like Strawberry sorbet BUT 10X BETTER. Pretty sure there's crack in here. It's gives you a delicious kick at the end of each bite and does NOT taste like mala sauce. Secret Breakfast is a little too sweet to keep eating for long, but will keep the liquor lovers coming back. 

Come for the ice cream, stay for the chill vibe, return for seconds in ten minutes.
author: Helen S.

description:
Four words: secret breakfast & butter beer. 

This is the only place recommended to me not through yelp so i trust the locals when they say to come here! 

That's all I want to say, but it you're lucky you can enjoy spoonfuls or licks of flavorful ice cream at the window and talk about how amazingly good it is, or say nothing at all. For me and my amigos we watched YouTube videos of our fave dim sum spot that closed down and mr. Trololololol 

I would bring a bag of cornflakes to top off the Secret Breakfast & maybe drizzle bourbon caramel sauce....
author: Julie S.

description:
What you've heard is true, SPECIAL BREAKFAST = NOOOMS!

Special breakfast consists of bourbon and corn flakes and my friend bought me here for my first time and i was blown away. Their vietnamese coffee is strong but if you like that, I do recommend it. I also found out a produce store near my work sold special breakfast, i got it for my coworkers and they fell in love with it too!
author: Eva O.

description:
I hate to be "that person" but I was really not impressed with this place and disappointed, especially because of the popularity and great reviews; I've been to Bi-Rite plenty of times and loved all my flavors, so thought we could try something new. I came here with four other friends, and none of us liked the flavors that much; both couples got two scoops to share and ended up throwing away half of it. 

I tried 7 flavors total from sampling there and from trying my friends' flavors. The flavors were very interesting, but a little too interesting for me..
Here's what I thought about them:
- Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee: I liked this one the most! It has a nice coffee flavor and isn't too sweet.
- Secret Breakfast: it was quite interesting, but not for me. There are pieces of something in it as well.
- Strawberry Crumble: good, but a little too sweet for my taste.
- Red Hot Banana: interesting.. not sure how I feel about it..
- White Miso Peach: I like miso and I love peach, but just not together.. still not a fan of having salty ice cream (unless it's salted caramel!)
- Nectarine Plum Yogurt: very tart, and tastes like the sour / dried plums that Chinese people have... but it was too much.
- Fudge Sorbet: really rich and really sweet.

At $6 for two scoops it was a little pricey, but I tipped the waitress (+1 to her!) for being so nice and patient with me while I looked for a flavor I liked.
author: Tiffany J.

description:
When you walk into an ice cream shop and are greeted with a "Hello! Would you like to try any flavors?" you know you're going to have a good time. The server here was friendly and didn't mind handing out sample after sample to eager customers. Picking which ice cream flavors I want is the most important decision I make each week; thanks for helping to make it easier! I ended up going with:

1. Secret Breakfast (Bourbon and Corn Flakes) - The Bourbon is strong with this one. Also, because of alcohol's melting point, this flavor was pleasantly softer than the other flavors. At times, the taste was so strong I felt like I was eating solid Bourbon. My last bite also had one of those large fused chunks of Corn Flakes -- WINNING!

2. Pumpkin 5 Spice - A pleasant blend of savory and sweet flavors of my favorite fruit.

3. Harvey Milk and Honey Graham - This was my favorite flavor of the three. It tasted like a cup of milk with crushed graham crackers in it -- absolutely awesome. It took me back to my graham-cracker-crushing childhood days.

Thank you, Humphry Slocombe. To say you are one of the greatest things to happen to happen to my taste buds may not quite cover how I feel about you.
author: Mark C.

description:
My second favorite ice cream shop in SF. While this location isn't close to anything else, there's always parking available. I love their flavor options and how their menu changes each time I go. I always have to get their secret breakfast and blue bottle Vietnamese coffee. While I tend to stick to my favorites it's always fun to try their other flavors!

-----------

Update: I still love this place but just say that my birthday ice cream cake was disappointing. The 1" thick cake on the bottom was so dry and hard, not to mention flavorless, that no one ate it at my party. Ice cream part was still stellar. I had a bi-rite ice cream cake last year and it was delicious! I would definitely say that after having this cake this year I will not be recommending this ice cream cake to anyone.
author: Tiffany L.

description:
Call me a fatty but I've been in a slump since I've tasted the Brown Butter.  I don't think I can get out of this slump until I taste it again. 

Really, it's that good.
author: David C.

description:
"That's something I noticed about San Franciscans. No matter how cold,
there will still be ice cream." - NW

Because ice cream on a cold day is the perfect antidote for the soul. Duh, NW.

I've been on an ice cream frenzy lately and Humphry's was my most recent pitstop. Even though it was almost closing, the workers were more than happy to serve me and my friend. I had the Matcha Doodle (matcha and snickerdoodle) on a cone. It was so good! I'm craving it as I type up this review...

Shoutout to the worker who let me taste as many flavors as I wanted, laughed at all my stupid jokes, and wiped my wallet for me when ice cream dripped onto it.
author: Judith L.

description: Texture is flawless, ice cream for ice cream definitely one of the best I've had. Their flavors were not as unique as I'd like considering I'm a local salt and straw guy. However, they did have some sundae and topping blends that made up for this. Overall great experience and will be back!
author: Joel G.

description:
Humphry Slocombe is a chic and lovely little ice-cream joint which serves downright sinful ice-cream flavors. Generally with artisan ice-cream, I try a few flavors and can quickly decide what I want, but at Humphry Slocombe EVERY. SINGLE. FLAVOR. WAS. AMAZING. This is not an exaggeration, like seriously, I can't tell you which flavor I liked better. They were all  SO GOOD. Plus what I love about this place is that you can look at their recipes, and all of them contain really simple ingredients, so you know you're getting the freshest, creamiest ice-cream with no preservatives or crazy chemicals.

1. Secret Breakfast - Bourbon icecream with cornflakes. I really loved the texture of the cornflakes, it tasted like a crunchy graham crackers. The bourbon flavor of the ice-cream was a little overwhelmed by the salt for me but it's definitely an interesting and yummy flavor.

2. McEvoy Olive Oil Ice-Cream : This was delicious which surprised me because I'm not a fan of olive oil! But the ice creamwas really light and citrusy. I could eat this all day

3. Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee - SO GOOD. Just downright addictive and delicious. It was basically coffee in a creamy dream. Our friend bought a pint of it the second he tasted it.

4. Strawberry Szechuan - It tasted like very good strawberry sorbet which was a little disappointing as I was hoping for some heat.

Overall Humphry Slocombe is a real gem! I love all their inventive flavors and their super delicious execution :) Definitely my favorite artisan ice cream place in the city.
author: Sarah T.

description: So blessed to have this spot near my house, its my go to whenever I craved ice cream. I always come and get the pint now since I am a ice cream fanatic. If its your first time get Blue Bottle Vietnamese coffee you can't go wrong with this, its sweet but you can still taste the coffee.
author: Luna C.

description: Secret Breakfast, which is Bourbon with cornflakes, was so good!  Loved the Blue Bottle Vietnamese iced coffee too.  There was a short line but it moves fast.  Ice cream scoop is a little small for $4 a scoop though.
author: Kim T.

description:
Came here after dinner upon hearing from two people that this ice-cream was some of the best in the area and I'm so glad I did!

I sampled a few flavors and eventually decided on the jasmine lychee and the here's your damn strawberry scoops. I'm obsessed with the jasmine lychee. It's a very elegant flavor, not too sweet yet very flavorful. Definitely going to be daydreaming about the jasmine lychee icecream when I head back to NYC.
author: Claudia C.

description:
I am so glad I went here for the first time today! I got the Secret Breakfast in a cup. The crunchy bits of corn flakes is so unique and delicious. Bourbon is the best match with those crunch bits. I am so pleased to have ordered it. I wish there was a storefront near where I live. 
Til next time!
author: Ava S.

description: Consistent Secret Breakfast and Vietnamese Coffee.
author: Christina S.

description: Kind of pricey for ice cream but the specialty flavors are probably why it's a little expensive for a scoop of ice cream~~ I tried a lot of flavors but settled for the "Secret Breakfast" which is made with Bourbon and Cornflakes... IT TASTES SO GOOD. Kind of tastes like bananas and oatmeal before you find out that there's Bourbon in the ingredients.
author: Juliana P.

description:
Sister and I walked by after brunch at Precita Park Cafe and couldn't resist. Ice cream is, after all, our favorite food. 

The young guy behind the counter was so sweet! He joked around with us and gave us big tastes of many of the flavors. He made both of us giggle and really put the cherry on top of our ice cream experience. 

I've been to the shop in the ferry building and knew that Humphry Slocombe ice cream is so creamy and filling that you really only need the small size (yes this is coming from someone for whom a single serving of ice cream is typically a pint).

I chose horchata rose (OMG) and my sister chose the Tahitian vanilla bean. Wow. I'd previously had the malted milk ball flavor and the Harvey Milk graham flavor but these two really shined with how simple and elegant they were. 

I'd highly recommend getting a pint of the Tahitian vanilla bean for like, anything - pumpkin pie, late night snack, dinner party. It's fruity and fragrant, really quite exotic for how simple it sounds. 5/5!
author: Ainslee S.

description:
Ice-cream is my favorite food. So obviously, I had to try Humphry Slocombe on my trip to San Francisco.
The two of us shared 3 scoops ($7.50). All the flavors here are so interesting, it was hard to choose. I think we literally sampled everything, which I'm sure the employees are used to. We finally decided on the secret breakfast (bourbon with cereal pieces), the POG (pineapple, orange, guava??), and the banana chai.
I'm glad we got such a diverse mix of flavors. The secret breakfast was really creamy and delicious. I love the little cereal pieces and although the bourbon taste is subtle, it's definitely there.
The banana chai was also extremely creamy. I LOVE banana flavors so this was a huge win for me.
The POG was a bit slushier, which I was thankful for because it off-set all the creaminess of the other two flavors. The flavor is really light and fruity and won't ever overwhelm your palate.
author: Jordyn Yian C.

description:
Really enjoyed my breakfast flavored ice cream when I went! My mom ordered the vanilla and they were both very satisfying. Their ice cream melts really fast though, so might be nice to ask for a bowl if you get a cone or make sure you get enough napkins. 

Would def go again!
author: Sheila W.

description:
* wierd but awesome selection of ice cream
* great texture on my Toast & Jam Ice cream 
* love my husband's Jalapeño Cornbread ice cream 
* clean bathroom 
* friendly & helpful staff
* get to sample before you have to pick
author: Jennifer F.

description: The first time I tried this place, I chose the Secret Breakfast flavor just because all the Yelp reviews recommended it and i was hooked! Ever since, I only come for that flavor. It's so unique and yummy! And it's located on 24th St which in general has a cool vibe. I just do wish the ice cream scoops were cheaper
author: Yanel S.

description: Love the unique flavours and creamy texture of the ice cream! I was worried that the alcohol taste in Secret Breakfast would be too much, but you can barely taste it. Super yummy!
author: Michelle C.

description:
I'll be honest. I'm a sucker for a big scoop of Secret Breakfast. It's sublime. But tonight I showed up at HS on Harrison and they were out of 1/3 of their flavors including Secret Breakfast. WTF? How can you possibly be out of your signature ice cream? Does Thomas Keller run out of salmon tartare? Does Momofuku run out of pork buns? Does In-n-Out run out of "animal style"?

So is that worth a one star review? Heavens no. But given that the one guy behind the counter was not only wildly surly, but was clearly sick complete with giant sniffles while his head was inside the ice cream case and half-covered sneezes everywhere else, I'm afraid the single dinger is well earned. I'm far from squeamish and will eat substances that others consider horrifying but this wasn't just a little cold. It was a get-into-bed-and-heat-up-some-chicken-soup sick. 

Seriously, that is not only gross but it is going to get people sick. Get your act together, Humphrey Slocombe. It's going to be hard to dissociate your ice cream from that mental image for a very long time.
author: Rob H.

description:
SO GOOD!!

They've got a very, VERY large selection of flavors that they occasionally switch in and out, maybe it's seasonal? Maybe it's "special edition"? Anyway, at any one time, they'll have approximately 10-20 flavors out for you to select from.

You've got classics like Tahitian vanilla and strawberry crumble (MY FAVEEEE, OHMYGLAWBS), and more notably unique flavors like anchor steam (there are different variations, but basically beer), jalapeno corn bread, their signature secret  breakfast (bourbon and corn flakes), blue bottle Vietnamese coffee..and many many more! A lot of them are adult oriented, but still great for kids and families.

If you want more artisan flavors that stray from the norm but still taste delicious, this is the place to go. HIGHLY recommend.
author: Katherine L.

description: Incredible flavors that change every few weeks. They'll always have standbys like secret breakfast though. Pints are about $9, a scoop about half that.
author: Libby C.

description: The ice cream is good but they need to change all the staff. They're the most grumpy bunch of ppl I've ever met.
author: Christian H.

description:
Here was amongst a list of ice cream places I want to try!

Saw that they had interesting flavors and many yelpers reviewed about the Secret Breakfast and the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee (what I got). 

The gps said we arrived but no sign of the store name to be found, just a brightly lit shop with a line out the door. We figured we had arrived. We lined up behind them, peeked and tried to make out the horrible penmanship written on a chalkboard hung on the wall. Listed were the ice cream flavors they had for the day. Some were crossed out meaning it was sold out. Thankfully the two I desperately wanted to try was still available. I decided to get a two scoop on a cone of the aforementioned favors $4.25 (doesn't charge extra for the cone!)

We did try the different favors because we were really curious how Hot Banana, Jesus Juice sorbet [wine+coke!! Definitely was able to smell and taste the hint of wine, interesting, but wouldn't get it as my scoop], Chocolate smoked sea salt [I knew I wasn't going to get it, but I wanted to try it. Didn't really like it because I don't like chocolate ice cream and it was too salty] tasted like.

Secret Breakfast [corn flakes+bourbon]: It was yummy! A little too sweet for me (that's odd!). I really enjoyed the crunchy texture of the corn flakes and the hint of bourbon in the ice cream.

Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee: I really enjoyed this one!! It's more of a rich and dark flavor opposed to the previous one.

Bourbon float $5 [Secret Breakfast+bourbon+coke]: what a deal! They provide you with the bottle of coke that they used for the float. Someone from my party got this and said it was good! I didn't think they would add more bourbon liquor, but apparently they did. Regardless, it sounds really goooood.

They have a few (two sets of three to be exact) of counter dining chairs. One unisex restroom. One deli fridge with pints of ice cream flavors you can purchase.

Plenty of street parking too! Maybe it's because it's at night and meters are free.
author: Winnie T.

description: Great ice cream spot with specialty flavors. Would definitely go again if I'm in the area. My two daughters loved the malt chocolate flavor (they split a scoop out of a cup) and I had the Peanut Butter Fudge Ripple (out of a waffle cone). Can't go wrong with either selection. A bit on the pricier side especially for being in the Mission district. $9 for the two scoops.
author: Richard A.

description:
I had read reviews about this place before I even got to SF and knew I had to try it before I left. Man, was I glad I dragged my friends on a hunt for this place. The secret breakfast ice cream is unreal. The bourbon ice cream base is delicious (you can actually taste the flavor of the bourbon, unlike so many dishes that boast alc flavors, yet you taste none or are overly powerful) but the cornflake clusters are the star of this ice cream. Somehow they stay crispy and are spread very generously through the ice cream. 

Highly recommend making a trip here!
author: Kirti N.

description:
The secret breakfast flavor is one of the best ice cream flavors you will ever have.
One of the few places that live up to the yelp hype.

I discovered this place via a friends review and finally had the chance to try it.
I had a double scoop. 1 scoop of the secret breakfast and 1 of the vietnamese coffee.

In short this place changed my life and taught me what ice cream is really supposed to be like.

I prefer this place over Bi-rite btw. 

Still haven't figured out a way to bring a pint back with me to LA. I've even considered  getting a cooler and filling it with dry ice just so that I can bring this goodness home with me.
author: Aerin A.

description:
Ice cream, ice cream!  We all scream for ice cream!

They have unique flavors with interesting ingredients meshed up with each other that is thought outside the box!

I heard from another active yelper that you get bacon ice cream here, but I guess they change up their selections often because it wasn't there when I went.  Otherwise, I would have definitely tried it!

I got their Peanut Brittle scoop that has this light crunch and top it off with their infamous Secret Breakfast scoop that has frosted flakes mixed into it!  

Picture of my double scoops on a cone - http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/humphry-slocombe-ice-cream-san-francisco?userid=I-FmdvI28N7OIIt4JZOgIg#5dRV8dsWs-xhWnMjjq8Obw

The combination of both, put a smile on my face! = )
author: Tiffany D.

description: As always it's fun to try their creative flavors. Tonite I got two scoops chocolate chip cheesecake and pumpkin nut. The babies liked it.
author: M C.

description: They're known for their "breakfast" ice cream.  Not a fan of it due to the alcohol taste.  Came here with some friends and we basically all enjoyed the black sesame and blue bottle coffee.  Creamy, cold, and GREAT service.  I think my friends and I tried SO many flavors!  They smiled the whole time and never looked annoyed.
author: Ivy T.

description:
Best ice cream in SF! Despite that, the wait at 24th can be unacceptable. Wait times need to be improved. Often 10-15 minutes. Doesn't stop me
from being a regular, but often frustrating.
author: Kyle W.

description:
This is what I would call 'fancy froufrou ice cream'.  

They offer a variety creative and interesting flavors that change regularly.  They do have some staples that are always available.  One of my favorites was Secret Breakfast.  The Vietnamese Coffee isn't bad either.  Their rotating flavors I've found are often hit or miss.  I always make sure to ask for a sample before committing to a full scoop or more.  I've tried a few flavors that sit just didn't sit well with my palatal preferences.  This isn't a bad thing necessarily but it really goes to show how adventurous they are with their flavors.  

In the past I would come here with some regularity and get at least 2 pints of Secret Breakfast and maybe another flavor.  Problem is, I recently went there and the quality seems to have gone down.  Either it was a terrible batch or they are really starting to cut corners.  

While I enjoy coming in now and then to see what new offerings they have.  I'm finding myself less and less inclined to return and more and more inclined to go to Mr & Mrs Miscellaneous instead which in my opinion is equally interesting and much more consistently delicious.
author: Erica Y.

description:
It was good. Is it a place to go out of your way for? Not really. It's one of those places you bookmark and have to try if you're in the area. Living in the East Bay, you can find multiple places that have signature flavors like Humphry. I'm not going to lie though, their Secret Breakfast is pretty good. I'll certainly keep it bookmarked though.

We came at night so the line wasn't as bad. Nothing but street parking so good luck finding parking. The establishment is small so there will usually be a line out the door. So be prepared to wait a little. Staff is friendly and enjoy helping you make your decision. Overall, a pretty good artisan ice cream spot.
author: Kyle B.

description: decided to find a new ice cream one night driving around .  They don't have too much selections in  ice creams, but all the ice creams are specific flavors.  My husband got the Vietnamese coffee flavors which I didn't really taste the coffee and I got the one with rum in it. i tasted more run than it was ice cream but I wasnt a big fan. I  would recommend people to try it once to their liking, but i was not so amazed by teh flavors of the ice cream.
author: Tiffany K.

description:
Came here awhile back with my friend Christine on our ice cream adventure. This was our first stop as she bought me the recipe book by them. I came here with very high expectations and with high hopes of trying the Jesus Juice. I mean, it's Jesus Juice, and Jesus was a cool guy, so it has to be good. Sadly, they didn't have the day I went.

I ended up trying the Thai Chili Sorbet which was very interesting. Never had spicy sorbet before, or even spicy ice cream. I really enjoyed the Thai Chili sorbet. It was refreshing in its own way, and it was spicy but wasn't (The only way I know how to explain it). But with that in mind, I couldn't eat a whole scoop of it. I opted for a scoop of the Vietnamese Blue Bottle Ice Cream, which I really enjoyed. The coffee flavor was extremely strong.

All in all, I enjoyed my experience here. Definitely not my favorite ice cream store, but still really good!
author: Kevin Q.

description: Interesting ice cream flavors in a local ice cream place.  Pricey though and I didn't quite get into the exotic flavors.  Everything looked like it was made on the premise.  Service was good as well.  Limited seating so take it to go.
author: Ronny T.

description:
Located in a semi-sketchy looking bootleg version of Haight, Humphry's ice cream is...

-/+ Average. When I go to artisan ice cream places, I expect the highest quality ice cream. The consistency of the ice cream was airy, when I wanted creamy and rich. 
+ There are 3 seats out looking the streets, cute view 
+ Unique flavors:
  + Viet coffee was good
  - Jasmine was okay, could've had a stronger tea flavor
  - I'm personally not a fan of the Secret Breakfast flavor
author: Marjo M.

description:
Amazing ice cream, with (as I'm sure you're aware by now), ridiculously creative flavors. Price is decent, and pretty much every flavor they have is something you won't be able to try anywhere else.

Me and the girlfriend are avid lovers of "Bizarre Foods with Andrew Zimmern", and were excited when there was an episode featuring a city within a few hours of us. This was one of the spots they visited, because their flavors are unique to the umpth degree (a recurring theme, you see). We had to go.

Parking was horrible, but then again, it is San Francisco. Walked in there at night with no line, and the dude was a nice fella. We got to try about all the flavors, and each one was as good as the next. 

Their flavors are INTENSE. Secret Breakfast was great. Tahitian Vanilla was pretty standard. We both love salt and pepper, and their flavor of it was really intense. She ended up getting Black Sesame (ridiculously good) and mine had something to do with Honey Comb (Harvey Milk Honeycomb she says), but I was too involved with devouring it to jot it down.

You've got to try it. Follow them on twitter or facebook for updated flavors each day.
author: Jonathan H.

description:
Holy smokes!!! This so far is my favorite ice cream place (and I've been to both Bi-rite and Mitchell's). Bi-rite didn't impress me and all and did not feel it's worth the wait and Mitchell's is good if you want some good ole traditional ice cream.

The thing  I liked about Humphry is that they only have a few flavors (i think 8-10) but at least half of them are unique. For example, the Secret Breakfast was my favorite which I believe is vanilla mixed with cornflakes and bourbon. The vietnamese coffee flavor was excellent too but Secret Breakfast was my favorite.

You gotta go and try it for yourself!
author: Kristina L.

description:
The flavor in this ice cream is just thaaaaat much ahead of everywhere else! Totally pops out at you, and very unique combinations.  SO. Good.  

Oh, and best vanilla. Seriously.
author: Teenie K.

description: I just came here today because my friend took me out here and I had dulce de leche ice cream and it's soooooo good, I highly recommend this place if you're in the neighborhood, lines can be a little long but move fast.
author: Fabricio V.

description:
I've only had their ice cream once about a year ago which I recall was delicious but this review is for the secret breakfast cake that I ordered (online on their website) for my birthday - and it is heavenly.. 

I found out about the cake on their Instagram and instantly knew that it was what I wanted, the cake has three layers, secret breakfast on top, vietnamese  coffee in the middle and the cake layer on the bottom. The cake was a little pricey $45 but for the size and the quality of the ice cream, it was worth every cent!! and it might even be a better deal than getting ice cream from their store. I'd say the cake would serve 12 people with cake to spare! I think I found my go to ice cream cake.
author: Vonny C.

description:
I sometimes would drive half an hour across town just to get their savory ice cream. My favorite is the white chocolate lavender, it's sweet, it's salty, it's fragrant. They serve about a dozen of unique flavors everyday and the flavors rotate. 

There's a small seating area but most people just stand on the street to enjoy the ice cream. 

On a day that I crave for something lighter, I go for the Fog- non dairy, tamarind, sweet and sour.
author: Pauline H.

description: A little pricey for ice cream, but they're pretty good! I like their variety of flavors. Got the pumpkin and hazelnut ice cream. It was excellent! Very pumpkin-y and the chunks of nut added texture.
author: Jen A.

description: This is my favorite San Francisco gourmet ice cream eatery. So many unique flavor. The service is always friendly and fast. A must for anyone enjoying San Francisco's diverse food selections.
author: Start V.

description:
The only flavors I like are the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee and Peanut Butter Ripple.

Service is really good though. The workers are super friendly and greet you with a smile.

Only 4 stars cause all other flavors aren't that great. Not really a fan of their Secret Breakfast...
author: Derek T.

description:
i liked it but i didnt love.

i had the blue bottle and strawberry. both tasted awesome. you can taste both the creamy dairy and its intended flavors. both were balanced and did not overwhelm the other.  i wish i could give it 5 stars but the ice cream was just too frozen to lick off easily. i felt i had to bite at it.  i guess this works better in a cup than cone. so this is not your licking kinda of ice cream.
author: Jason C.

description:
I ordered three pints for delivery on Caviar. Humphry Slocumbe got the order wrong. The items were listed correctly on the bag, but a pint of Tahitian Vanilla was put in the bag instead of Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee. Left feedback with Caviar to bring me a replacement pint, but it's a day later now, and someone has screwed up because I've still got no Coffee Ice Cream.

Also, the Malted Milk Chocolate mouth feel was too buttery and left a slimy coating on the back of the spoon as if it had been over-churned. At these prices, I expected better.
author: Richard L M.

description:
I love San Francisco's ice cream scene, and my list of favorites USED to include Humphry Slocombe.  That said, I had an absolutely terrible experience a week or so ago on a Sunday night that makes me question ever going back.  I walked in around 9:30 pm after dinner, and the shop was nearly empty.  Yet, the blond girl and Asian girl working acted as if they were doing us a favor even talking to us.

I ordered a one of my favorites: the bourbon coke float with secret breakfast.  Off the bat, they no longer use Mexican Coke and give you the extra mini-bottle.  Pouring lukewarm, half-flat Coke instead?  Huge downgrade.

The board says quite clearly "two scoops," and I found only one small scoop in mine.  The bourbon ice cream mixed with the Coke leaving me with a few bites of ice cream and a creamy, disappointing mess.

I mentioned it to the employees who told me that "two scoops doesn't actually mean two scoops, because it throws off the ratio of ice cream to Coke."  So, I just bought another scoop to add to my float.

I directly contacted the office, and I never even received a reply.  One in a while, I can deal with bad service or a bad product.  But as it stands, with so many better options in SF, why even bother?

I'd suggest instead soft-serve over warm pie at Bi-Rite or a chocolate sorbet on a free homemade waffle cone at San Francisco Hometown Creamery.
author: Patrick M.

description:
For my 75th review, I thought I'd finally scrutinize and find a place really worth rating 5-stars (LOL). But don't get it twisted, I will still keep it honest and real as I am know for :) I shouldn't even be giving them 5 stars honestly because I applied to work here, had a great interview and the stupid SOB's never hired me. They better be lucky I like the ice cream.

Someone else on here said it's hard to rate ice cream, and I have to whole-heartedly agree. I've been to quite a few more local places that were supposed to be so "good" and turned out to be overrated--Loard's ice cream being the most overrated of them. But Humphry Slocombe actually gets ice cream right, and even gets it right better than Coldstone. Coldstone used to be somewhat of a favorite, but their ice cream became generic in a sense, and didn't store well after the mix-ins. Plus it tasted weird just after like a day being in the freezer. Humphrey's actually can be somewhat compared to your favorite store-bought ice cream as far as quality. What I mean by that is you can REGULARLY go for Humphry's as you would like Dreyer's. If it were sold in stores I probably would always get it. 

1a) That name Humphry Slocombe is just not cutting it. I read the history of the name, but still, it has to go. Too awkward to read and say, and doesn't make much sense. it sounds like a Tax Preparer Service place, or a tailoring service. Actually, it really sounds like a place to do stock trading lmao. I will be the first one to vote if they ever changed the name.

1b) But once you get over the name, you can focus on the ice cream better. The texture and the flavors of the ice just mesh all too well. Other ice cream parlors of course are a hit and miss when it comes to finding the right blend of texture and flavor, but Humphry hits the nail right. My favorite so far is the Harvey Milk, and also the Chocolate Malt one. Their vanilla for the Harvey Milk is one of the creamiest vanilla's I've had yet; and is almost better than Haagan Daaz or Ben & Jerry's vanilla (and that's saying a lot). The graham pieces don't get overly soggy when the ice cream melts as other brands of ice cream may do, it stays edible and very delicious. The Secret Breakfast is somewhat reminiscent of Frosted Flakes and the flakes also don't get too soggy. 

2) Usually I NEVER buy the expensive pre-packed pints from these types of places, however Humphry's is the ONLY place I buy the pre-packed pints, and I highly recommend you do as well. I do it to skip the line, and because the quality of ice cream in the pints are really the same great quality in the regular big freezer for the scoops. And at $9/pint it better be worth it. The 3-scoop would average out to almost the same price and volume as the pint anyway in my opinion, if they were packed tight. 

3)They need to open more locations. Very annoying all a sudden "everyone and they mama" (that's slang, look it up) comes out of nowhere at the SAME TIME to cram the small shop, and block the doorway. The patrons usually are pretty snobby and rude so if you're going just to get the pints, don't be scared to bumrush past them after saying excuse me twice when they aren't listening to you because they are too busy engaging in stupid-topic convos thinking they are the only people in line getting ice cream, as they block the doorway. Shouldn't it be a fire hazard to block the door anyway? Humprhy should really get on that and enforce doorway space there. 

Congrats Humphry Slocombe for probably being the only business to get 5-stars outta me.
author: Marquis A.

description: I was really happy that I got to try their secret breakfast flavor ice cream and it was really good. We went during the weekday so there was plenty of parking spaces on the streets and no lines. Definitely coming back to try other flavors!
author: Victoria T.

description: pretty good place during ahot summer and they have a ton of flavours!
author: Eric M.

description: Yummy!!! The Vietnamese coffee is so good my favorite so far. The secret breakfast is good too! Definitely worth eating. $4.50 per scoop. $6.95 for a double.
author: Amber T.

description:
Being a big fan of Bi-Rite and Mitchell's, I haven't had a reason to try out any other ice cream places in the City.  Then, I was brought here and thought, why not - good ice cream is good ice cream, right?

My favorite thing about Humphry Slocombe is its creative flavors, such as Secret Breakfast (bourbon ice cream with corn flakes), Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee (tastes like you're actually having an iced cafe sua da), etc.  The server was pretty awesome and we bonded when he put on 'Superman' by Goldfinger from Tony Hawk's Pro Skater, but kinda got into a heated debate when I said that Salt & Straw (Portland) was waaaay better than his old employer, Molly Moon's (Seattle).  +1 star for him..+2 when he realizes the truth.

Anyways, check this place out if you haven't been.  The HS original flavors are definitely worth trying at least once and who knows, maybe this will be your new favorite ice creamery in SF.
author: Jacky L.

description:
I'm in love.

Humphry's is my absolute favorite for ice cream! Its hard to please me when it comes to ice cream since I have tried so many (almost all!) ice cream shops in the Bay Area. 

The workers are friendly, attentive, and informative, I was pretty curious about the flavors with the unique names (like After School Special, Secret Breakfast, and Jesus Juice). But I went for the other flavors.

 Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee. I dont even like coffee, but I enjoyed this flavor so much. With coffee ice cream, the coffee taste can be overwhelming, but this one is the perfect balance between bitter and sweet. It is subtle, but flavorful. It would be awesome if they added swirls of condensed milk, haha.

Harvey Milk and Honey. It was sweet, and I really enjoyed the bits of ?. Not really sure what it was. Its very light, which can be dangerous. I tend to down light ice creams by the pint full. 

Peanut Butter Chip. Addicting. I love peanut butter. The ice cream has peanut butter chips/ shavings throughout. I usually get sick of peanut butter ice cream pretty quick, but this one is light, I couldnt shove it in my mouth fast enough.

Tahitian V*nill@. Plain ol vanirra, but Humphry's does it right. 

Overall, all the flavors I have tried are light, and flavorful. I like the texture, not icy at all. Creamy and smooth, with just the right amount of extras. I like to walk around the neighborhood towards this small market down the street, and I find street parking quickly. I always enjoy my visits here, and I'll be back soon (:
author: Lindy P.

description:
Saturday, 8:30 PM.

Quickie:
+ Dessert quality
+ Hygiene
+ Customer service
+ Turnaround
+ Menu variety

And then...?
Humphry's is in the top tier of ice cream vendors. 

**********
Stuffed my face in:

1. Super secret: corn meal and Bourbon
     + Unconventional, bold, but somehow this combination pulls it off. 
2. Pistachio brittle
     + Takes pistachio, adds a salty spin and elevates this duo. 
3. Blue Bottle Vietnamese coffee
     + Strong roast and not too sweet. 
4. Balsamic
     + Did not think this could be an enticing ice cream flavor. 

Constructive comments:
*Source ingredients
author: Chuck N.

description:
Ice cream with unique flavors. They offer 10 to 12 flavors a day and rotate often. Sadly, the flavor I most wanted to try (green tea-black sesame) was not offered the day I went.

My friend got the roasted white chocolate rose water and peanut butter curry. I got the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee, which isn't really unique, but I really enjoyed the coffee flavor.

[As Seen On The Best Thing I Ever Ate and Unique Eats]
author: Helen H.

description:
4.5 stars

It's so hard not to end a night in SF without getting ice cream after dinner. There's so many good places!

This stop was obviously at Humphry Slocombe and I was pleasantly surprised to 1. find a parking 2. the line wasn't insanely long at 9pm (still had about a 20 min wait though).

It's a really small shop, but they do have a few chairs for you to enjoy your ice cream. I've read about yelpers raving about the secret breakfast and knew that I wanted to get that one. Spoiler alert: the secret: bourbon/ the breakfast:cornflakes - it combines 2 of my favorite things: breakfast and alcohol infused food. The flavor of the ice cream tasted like sweet bourbon with a crispy cornflakes texture. It was really good though I felt that it was a tinge on the sweet side. The texture of the ice cream was creamy, but (I hate to bring this up) not as amazing as Bi-Rite's. Still really good though!

Overall, at $4 a scoop, I would come back for a once in a while treat.
author: Sophia Y.

description:
The ice cream was pretty good don't get me wrong. I got the secret breakfast and it totally was delicious!--get it

To honest though, I think there's too much hype about this place and the guy who was serving us was clearly grumpy. Come on!? You're serving ice cream!! With awesome and unique flavors! Ice cream always means smiles.
author: Tiffanie T.

description:
Humphry Slocombe has some interesting flavors.  On the day I visited they had, among other things, Carrot Mango Sorbet, Guinness Gingerbread, and Hibiscus Beet Sorbet.  

After sampling the Secret Breakfast and the Pepper + Mint Chip, I settled on a scoop of the Secret Breakfast, which was bourbon ice cream with cornflakes.  The cornflakes were kinda soggy, but the taste was great and I liked how the ice cream wasn't overly heavy.

Prices are on the high end for ice cream, but the cool flavor options, good ice cream and friendly service make Humphry Slocombe worth trying.
author: Bryce A.

description:
I like Humphry Slocombe, I truly do. I find the flavors to be fun and unique. I actually get the same thing every time which is surprising because I usually like to mix things up. I order the black sesame and strawberry ice cream (two scoops $6.50). It's such a good combination of sweet and savory. I think the atmosphere is nice, has a old fashion ice cream parlor vibe but feels modern.

The reasoning for the four stars is I'm a strong believer in the two flavors one scoop policy. Please change this policy, and I'll be happy to give you the five stars you deserve.
author: Laurence G.

description: A hip little San Francisco treat with kinda overpriced ice cream and merchandise ($2.50 for a tiny tin of salt from somewhere I hadn't heard of). But, on a positive note, a great variety of unique flavors and twists on more original flavors (a Vietnamese cold brew coffee flavor when we went!). Still, it's not a cheap ice cream outing if you want more than one tiny scoop!
author: Liz H.
Pauline P.

description: Fantastic ice cream, probably because secret breakfast has just a hint of bourbon.  I love the texture on the cornflakes. Plus, the matcha doodle is tasty too. I think that for the uniqueness of the flavors, this ice cream is worth the price. You probably won't find most of these flavors anywhere else.
author: Ruobin W.

description:
I went here on a Friday afternoon, just right when they open because I've read that the line can be crazy long.  There was no line at all!  

The guy that works there was very nice and friendly.  He made us sample almost every flavor they have that day (they change their ice cream flavors everyday)

After sampling almost everything, I fell in love with their Secret Breakfast Ice Cream!! It has bourbon & crunchy bits of cornflakes! Ooohhhhmy it was delicious! I had one scoop of Blue Bottle Vietnamese coffee also! It's prolly one of the best coffee ice cream I had.

I can't wait to go back when I get a chance to try peanut butter and curry and their black sesame ice cream!!!!!
author: Junaline G.

description:
Original Original Original! There's no other ice cream place like Slocombe's that serves these insanely unique and delicious flavors! Whenever bf and I want ice cream (which is almost always), we head to Slocombe. We used to go to Bi-Rite, but now we're all about the double headed cow! 

A few weeks ago, I had a scoop of the pumpkin five spice. I love anything pumpkiny, esp around this time of year...Mmmmm... Bf had 2 scoops of the secret bfast. Although it's ice cream, that'll warm you up bc the bourbon is strong! I'm not too crazy about the jesus juice only bc I don't like coke much, but I'm all good with the red wine in it. My other favorites so far have been the viet coffee, beets (weird but I love beets), carrot mango, chocolate smoked sea salt, corn and honey thyme. 

Expect the unexpected! Expect to try ice creams like no other!
author: Liv A.

description:
I've just been going to places with cool names recently, and here's another one. 

Nothing beats ice cream for dessert or any meal during the day actually. I don't make it a habit to have ice cream for a meal but sometimes it's too good not too. This place is known for many things but their Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee ice cream is absolutely superb. I looooooooooove coffee and when you put that in my favorite dairy product, you've got a winning recipe into my stomach ^_^
Their coffee ice cream is smooth, velvety, rich, and intense. I sampled some of their other ice cream flavors and they were enjoyable but didn't stand out to me as much. 

It's a cute shop, very simple. You can get their ice cream and eat it there ( they have both indoor and outdoor seating ) or you can take a pint home for later :)
author: Jennifer H.

description:
The secret breakfast was just alright. 

Yes, I freaking said it. It was overly sweet and/or boozy at certain bites. But glad I got to try it. I was expecting similar to Momofuku's corn flake icecream for some reason.

However, I am a huge fan of the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Ice Coffee. Tastes just like the New Orleans ice coffee. Overall, texture and consistency is creamy and rich, yet not overbearing. Humphry's is one of my top fav ice cream spots in SF. The employees are great, esp. in remaining patient, even in my indecisiveness to find the perfect flavor. Thanks much!
author: Suji C.

description:
I died and went to creamery heaven! 

This place was delicious. Tried the peanut butter curry and the blood orange sorbet (I double fisted). Both flavors were delicious. I definitely recommend this place if you are feeling adventurous and want to do something different than regular ol' vanilla.
author: Griselda G.

description:
My friend Emily told me about Humphry's and that we should check them out during our SF trip. I actually like the consistency of their ice cream! I know most people like their ice cream really rich & creamy, but my palette taps out midway. 

I tried the infamous Secret Breakfast and it wasn't for me-- the bourbon flavor is very strong and you're unable to taste the base cereal-milk flavor. I sampled the Harvey Milk and it was good but a bit too sweet for me. I also really liked the Jesus Juice and was surprised at how the wine & coke flavors went so well together. My favorite by-far (and what I ended up ordering) was the Olive Oil! It was light and had a slight zesty brightness that was refreshing and clean. I would come back just for the Olive Oil!

Humphry Slocombe definitely has more adventurous flavor combinations than other ice cream places so props to the flavor creators! Personally, of the 6-7 flavors I tried, there were only a couple I'd probably want to order but it's a great place for those wanting to try fun, non-traditional flavors! Definitely a 3.5!
author: Angie D.

description:
This is a San Francisco novelty that you MUST try, whether you are a local or tourist. Once you try an "interesting" flavor like Jesus Juice, you can never really forget about this place. 

My favorite, of course, is Secret Breakfast. I tried this without even know how popular it was. It's cereal pieces in bourbon flavored ice cream. Not too sweet but not too sour either. LOVE IT. Definitely a crowd pleaser. 

My other favorite thing to get is the coke and bourbon float. (Maybe I just like bourbon if you are catching onto my theme.) It's very refreshing.

You can expect to wait in line when coming here, but it's totally worth it. Good luck, and definitely take a risk and dive into an unknown ice cream flavor!
author: Stefanie C.

description:
I went here for the first time a few years ago and re-visited it for the first time since then this month, it was just as I remembered which was nice and nostalgic.

I got the Secret Breakfast + Harvey Milk. They were a good combination since they were similar enough but distinct from each other so you don't get confused about which you're eating a spoonful of. 

The Harvey Milk was a little sweet for my taste, probably because it's honey-infused but the fact that it's sweetened w/ honey makes it better than just sugar. I still enjoyed it, especially with the small graham cracker bits (I love graham crackers).
The Secret Breakfast tasted just like I remembered...some bites had a strong flavor of bourbon but most of them were subtle. I love this flavor cause it isn't too sweet, and of course because it's unique and AMAZING! 

I will keep coming back to this place if I'm in the area because they have a ton of unique flavors that you can't get anywhere else. It's great that they have standard flavors done their way as well as adventurous flavors.
author: Hana S.

description:
While visiting San Francisco we stumbled upon the Ferry Building location of HS. The unique flavor selections reminded me of a very quirky ice creamery we have in Ferndale, MI called Treat Dreams, so naturally we had to stop and try some flavors. I personally tested Brown Butter, Butterscotch Root Beer, & Peanut Butter Fudge Ripple. All 3 were delicious, but I think Brown Butter was one of the Top 5 ice cream flavors I have ever had. SO smooth and rich, with a unique flavor that it's hard to describe everything that sticks out about it. 

The shop also had Blue Bottle coffee flavor combinations, and specialty #SFBeerWeek concoctions. They seem to be very creative and offer flavors you would not find anywhere else. 

Whether you stop by the physical location, or the stand in the Ferry Building, this place is delicious and deserves any ice cream lover's attention.
author: Katelyn A.

description: No line, no wait, and a double-scoop with my favorite Harvey's Milk and tried After School Special? 5 Stars! Never been to this location since the one in the Ferry Building is closest to my work. Parking wasn't too bad but it was a weekday in the afternoon. Will definitely be back :)
author: Amanda C.

description:
I think this might be the best ice cream in San Francisco (and San Francisco has some of the best ice cream in the world, so by chain rule, that might just make this the best ice cream in the world!).

I did only try a couple flavors and only stopped in at each place once, but after trying Bi-Rite, Mitchell's and Mr. & Mrs. Miscellaneous, I might have to go with Humphry.

I will say that this ice cream is not for everyone. Even for me, some of the flavors were actually pretty gross and a little off putting (Thai Chili Lime- spicy ice cream is just weird, Salt & Peppa - very strange). But the flavors that are good are REALLY good.

The consistency of pretty much all of the flavors is the best and what really makes this place awesome. It is so perfectly smooth and creamy.

Now on to specifics, and the flavors I tried:
- Secret Breakfast (Bourbon & Corn Flakes):
At first it is weird, but I told myself I should try more than just a sample and get a full scoop, and I did not regret it. You can definitely taste the alcohol in it, which actually works, and every now and then you get a nice crunch from some of the corn flakes.

- Harvey Milk & Honey Graham:
This is great too and is a little more of a normal flavor that can appeal to more people (like my wife, who I sampled it from).

- Malted Milk Chocolate:
This is also a very plain flavor, but was some of the best chocolate ice cream I've ever had.

- Vietnamese Blue Bottle Coffee:
The best coffee ice cream I've ever had. As I said before, the ice cream here is so smooth and goes down so easily you don't realize you just ate a couple ounces of pure cream and fat.

- Thai Chili Limi:
Pass...the idea of spiciness and a hot sensation in your mouth when eating ice cream on a hot day just does not appeal to me.

- Tahitian Vanilla:
Another very vanilla flavor, but again, one of the best renditions of the flavor that I have ever tried.

As for the shop itself, I was lucky enough to not have to wait in too long a line so I only had to endure listening to some hipsters discussing food snobbery for a few minutes. It was definitely well worth it. Another great thing about this place is the huge number of flavors they offer. Though they only offer 8-10 at a time, it makes me want to keep coming back to try all of the other flavors they offer.
author: Mike C.

description: Quiet and excellent ice cream shop. Yummy and kooky. Nice flavor selection, and not crazy busy like Mitchell's.
author: Jacob H.

description:
This place is really close to my apartment, and I'm sooo thankful that it is! 
They have a lot of interesting flavours - my personal favourite is Tahitian vanilla - and they regularly introduce new flavours. The service has also been very good each time I've gone and I've never had to wait longer than like 2 minutes, unlike at some of the other really good ice cream places, where you have to wait almost 20 minutes to place your order. The only thing is that it's a bit pricey, so I don't end up going as often as I actually want to.
author: Sahil S.

description:
Line was effing long on a Saturday afternoon, but that's expected right? For once we didn't mind "waiting" in a line cuz our foodie booties needed to digest all the goodness that we consumed at all the earlier stops on our SF Food Crawl.

Finally go to take our orders after waiting in line for about 30 minutes or so. I'm not sure why the line moves so slow to be honest, but hey at least we got to experience Humphry Slocombe!

I asked for a sample of their Vietnamese Coffee (even though I'm not a coffee drinker, coffee ice cream has always been a good flavor to me). I thought it tasted exactly like Viet coffee. Has that strong kick to it and slightly bitter.

I ended up going for a single scoop of their Fluffernutter which is basically just heavenly peanut butter mixed in with heavenly marshmallow. I thought the price was kinda steep for a single scoop but hey, I'm having one of the best ice creams in the city, I could care less what I'm paying since I wanted the full foodie experience.

Would I come back here? Eh, if there wasn't such a long line. I still have Bi-Rite Creamery, Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous and Mitchell's to hit up! :D
author: Michelle V.

description: Best ice cream in sf!! Forget Mitchell's and Bi-rite. Olive oil and browned butter, baby!
author: Disco B.

description:
Ice cream is one of my greatest weaknesses... it's so hard for me to say no to a scoop of the yumminess, especially if the flavors are really unique! I have a huge list of ice cream places bookmarked and Humphrey has been on it for awhile. I finally got to try some at the Off the Grid @ The Presidio and oh man, the ice cream was even better than I expected! *__* 

The flavors available that day were Basil Lime Sorbet, Smoked Chocolate w/ Sea Salt, Secret Breakfast, and Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee. I wasn't really in a sorbet mood so I only wanted one of the other three.. but it was so hard to choose one since they all sounded so good! My bf being the crazy dessert guy he is, bought a scoop of each flavor @.@ They were split amongst me, my bf, and my sis. 

My favorite was the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee. It definitely had a strong coffee taste but it was also sweet at the same time and it was just soo flavorful. This was also my sister's favorite and we both ate this one the most. Definitely get this if you're a coffee lover!

The Secret Breakfast was also deliciousss! It was a flavor unlike any I've ever had.. bourbon, corn flakes, and vanilla? It was the perfect amount of crunchiness, sweetness, and yumminessss. Highly recommended!

My least favorite was the Smoked Chocolate w/ Sea Salt. Although it did taste good and very unique, the salt was a little overpowering for me. Me and my sis let my bf finish most of this one :D 

Humphrey Slocombe is definitely deserving of all of the praise it's gotten. Next time I want to check out the actual ice cream shop and try some other crazy flavors!
author: Sandra N.

description: Absolutely delicious! I love their blue bottle vietnamese coffee, it tastes true to coffee and never fails.  I combine that with the refreshing but not so overly strong flavor of oolong tea and I'm in heaven! I get their pint size for $9 bc I cant get enough of it and it's so worth it!
author: Stephanie C.

description:
SO DELICIOUS, SECRET BREAKFAST, YOU ARE MY FAVORITE GUILTY PLEASURE. And Vietnamese Coffee, you're not too bad yourself.

The staff here is friendly, helpful, patient, and GORGEOUS LOOKING PEOPLE. If you don't come here for the ice cream at least come for some eye candy yayuh. 

Seating is limited, but they do have outdoor tables (: Also equipped with a restroom and water jugs, in case you want to rinse the sweetness from your mouth, BUT WHO WOULD WANT TO DO THAT!?

Also, good luck finding street parking!
author: Natalie Y.

description: Despite having the World's Creepiest Branding, this place totally made our first trip to SF.
