The Secret Breakfast (and anything with brown butter) is ridiculous, and one taste of Humphrey's cray-cray flavors explained to us why there'd been a half-block lineup every time we walked past there (three times over the course of the day, and right up into a pretty chilly night at 9:58 PM.) If I could have bought shares in their ferry building location, man, I'd be a princess o' plenty now.
author: Be F.

description:
Why haven't I written a review on Harry, err Humphry Slocombe yet?!?! :-)

This is my most favorite ice cream place PERIOD! 
Interesting and unique flavors, from regular ice creams to sorbets and sherbets. 

What can I say that hasn't already been said? Yes, parking can be somewhat problematic in the neighborhood, but you just have to deal with it and practice patience! Yes, the line can be long, but the ice cream is worth it. Just keep calm and practice even more patience. Maybe you could start yapping up with your line neighbors if they are friendly enough to make the time go by faster. 

I must say that the staffers are friendly, hard working, and try their best to be as efficient as possible, even with the samples upon request (with some folks wanting to try may flavors, which of course requires more wait time. I try to limit my flavor samplings to two). 

My favs in no particular order:
Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee
Secret Breakfast
Butter Beer
Malted Dulce De Leche
Limoncello Italian Ice

This unseasonably warm Spring weather is making me want my Humphry Slocombe now! Who wants to join me?????

Cheers and keep calm and ice cream on, my dears!
author: Gill C.

description:
My favorite ice cream in SF! It was a close tie between here, Bi-Rite, and Mitchell's. But I love how Humphry's has so many UNIQUE flavors! 

I can't get over how good their Secret Breakfast flavor is. Definitely one of my favorite ice cream flavors of all time. I had been wanting to try it for the past 4 years after seeing it featured on Food Network. Finally, the day came during a recent trip to SF and I was lucky enough to get the last scoop of it left for the day! Score!! Secret Breakfast = bourbon + cornflakes. It sounds like a weird mix but when you taste it, it's phenomenal. The bourbon flavor is there without tasting like alcohol. Instead, it has an addicting subtle sweetness. Trust me and give it a try! 

I also tried the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee flavor which was also really yummy. If you're a fan of coffee ice cream, you will love this!
author: Diana I.

description:
Where have you been all my life? I feel guilty for being a loyal Bi-Rite-ion, and never wandering to this less-popular neighborhood to try the amazingness that is Humphry Slocombe.

CROWDS.
On 2 pm on a Saturday, we walked in without a line. Later on, we saw a steady stream of groups coming by, but the wait time is never too bad.

PARKING.
Kind of a B to find, but the surrounding neighborhood is huge, you'll find something before too long!

FLAVORS.
Some of the most awesome flavors out there, making it hard to compare to any other ice cream joint in SF. I only tried a few, but my favorites were the Secret Breakfast, McEvoyRanch Olive Oil ice cream, and Elvis: the Phat years. We even picked up a pink of Secret Breafkast to bring home, it was that amazing.


100% coming back!
author: Claire S.

description:
Ice cream like this has got to be a joke. So ridiculously creamy, with an underlying saltiness prevalent in all its fun flavors that keeps you lapping for more.

I've sampled two combos so far:
1) Salted chocolate with bourbon caramel - The saltiness of the chocolate is intensely addictive, but beware, the flavors are strong (in the best possible way - but only if you're mentally prepared)
2) Secret breakfast (aka bourbon + corn flakes) with bourbon caramel - This is perfect for those who are afraid of aggressively sweet desserts! And the texture of the corn flakes is GENIUS

I've yet to go for their most famous flavor of all, the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee, but that's obvi next on my list.

In San Fran, we're spoilt for options when it comes to ice cream, but Humphrey Slocombe will always be an old favorite.
author: Tiffany W.

description:
This is the most delicious ice cream you will ever eat in your entire life. Hands. Down. No. Lies.

Oolong was amazing. So was the Harvey Milk Honey. And the Secret Breakfast. And the Malt Milk Chocolate. And the Tahitian Vanilla. And the Vietnamese Coffee. Everything is delicious. 

The girl at the counter is also very sweet. She let me try all the flavors and I ended up buying a pint :D
author: Akshaya V.

description:
So during my little foodie adventure we went to all of the ice cream spots!  All of the popular ones that we could think of.  Humphry's has been on my list forever.  We also went to bi-rite and mitchells. 

In my opinion, I would rate the 3 ice cream spots
1.  Humphry
2. Bi-Rite
3. Mitchells

I ordered the Kurios.  It's a coffee toffee caramel ice cream.  I loved the toffee in the ice cream.  The little bit of a crunch was so good.  

I love ice cream.  I had ice cream 4 times within my 48 hour trip.  Best idea ever!
author: Chrissie O.

description:
Months after visiting SF, I am still dreaming of Secret Breakfast. The flavor, texture, and ...spunk of this ice cream is unlike any other I've tried. Amazing.

Beats Bi-Rite HANDS DOWN, I personally thought Bi-Rite was "meh," as the texture was unimpressive and though interesting-sounding, their flavors were bland. 

The only other serious contender for best SF ice cream is Smitten, and that's only really a competitor in texture (which is heavenly, by the way...), but in terms of complete ice cream perfection, Humphry Slocombe wins by far.
author: Orr R.

description: 5 stars for any place that gives me bourbon-flavored ice cream. Ain't nobody judging me for eating ice cream before noon, I just don't tell them it's bourbon and that it's mostly cornflakes.. Actually, some people still judge. But the ice cream is so good I don't mind.
author: Monte H.

description:
What sets apart Humphry Slocombe from other ice cream places are two things: 1. how intense the flavors are and 2. the sheer ingenuity of the flavors. I tried a few things: the milk and honey, chocolate malt, etc. and the flavors were *intense*. There's no stinging on the flavors namesake ingredients. Secret Breakfast is also a must-try - it's cereal chunks in a bourbon flavored ice cream.

I wished they'd give smaller scoops for cheaper because I don't necessarily want to eat a 3/4 cup of just one flavor, but well, just come hungry!
author: Jin C.

description:
Humphry Slocombe Ice Cream is a place where you can be a kid again but also an adult as well with their exotic flavors.  We ordered:

1) Jesus Juice = wine + coca cola 
2) Miso Pear= good miso flavor
3) Cucumber Ice Milk = refreshing taste
4) Apple Wood = adding bacon to anything is good! 
5) Balsamic Caramel = unique flavor with the caramel
6) Secret Breakfast = deliciously tasty and creamy

I love this place for their unique flavors of ice cream, friendly staff and open until 10pm. I would love to come back for more ice cream!
author: Owie N.

description: Came here last minute on our way to the airport. I really liked their flavor list. The ones that stood out the most for me was the secret breakfast, oolong tea and the red hot banana. My favorite out of the three was the oolong tea.. It was just right! Not overpowering but still had the warm flavor of oolong tea. I liked the red hot banana but I wish it was just plain banana haha. The secret breakfast was just average.. Overall, clean and cute ice cream spot! I also sampled the POG flavor and it was pretty good too! I have never seen that flavor before! Kudos.
author: Jessica K.

description:
After a hard fought battle with the Torta Cubana at That's It Market, we figured that the bit of stomach space we had left would be for some dessert (there's always room for dessert, right?) and hurried down to Humpry Slocombe Ice Cream before they shut it down for the evening.

The ladies behind the counter were so awesome and answered any questions we had, and you could sample any or all the flavors available if you wanted to! I just love the "outside of the box" flavor combinations they have. Very unique, and can't be found anywhere else.

After sampling a few of their flavors, wifey got a scoop of the Harvey Milf and Honey Graham, and as always, I can't decide when it comes to ice cream, so I had to get the Secret Breakfast, Vietnamese Blue Bottle Coffee, and McEvoy Ranch Olive Oil complete with a sugar cone which were all great, and wow!, you could really taste the bourbon in the secret breakfast so much, I thought it was the alcohol that was making me see the Siamese Cow Head on the wall!

Such a cool place to stop by any time of day, and we'll definitely return any time we are back in the Bay Area....ALOHA!!!

YELP 365 CHALLENGE-(242/365) " Better Than Baskin Robbins"
author: Nelson Q.

description:
Secret breakfastdelicious
Tried the secret breakfast cake which was also delicious but i thought the cake part could have been a bit more moist.
author: Schelly Y.

description:
Purely for the Secret Breakfast.  It's THAT good.  Anything infused with liquor count me in.  And some fab candied corn flakes which remain crunchy?  Amazing.  

Great smooth velvety texture and doesn't melt too fast.  LOVE.

Lines look long, but actually moves quickly enough, about 15 to 20 minutes.  

3 generous scoops for $5.50.  I would skip the Olive Oil, WAY too lemony and the Vietnamese Coffee is good the first few bites and after a while, just one note, or plain dull.
author: Cynthia C.

description:
As I walked in the locker room.  I heard the guys debating about what was better.  Some said they prefer all natural women, or should I say normal.  Then there were the others saying they prefer enhanced women, or should I say those enhanced with boob jobs.  But as I overheard the ridiculous conversation, I chimed in a said "It's all personal preference"...

It's very similar to my feelings when it comes to ice cream.  Some like traditional (normal) flavors such as Chocolate, Vanilla, Strawberry.  They prefer to have a good milkshake or regular scoop in a cup.

Than there are some who like new (enhanced) flavors with clever names like the ones given to race horses.  Like Brown Butta or Cinnamon Brittle.

If you are into normal flavors like myself.  An ice cream traditionalist like me who believes the ice cream I ate when I was a kid was perfect just the way it was. Like when Baskin Robbins had just 31 flavors.  

Well Humphry, I know your heart is in the right place, but replacing traditional flavors with Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee, Brown Butta, Tahitian Vanilla, Boccalone Prosciutto ice cream is too radical for me.  Plus no milkshakes.  No Milkshakes!!!  As Denzel said to Petey in Remember the Titans:  "Ya killing me Petey, Ya killing me!!!!"

Can a brother just get a scoop of normal chocolate ice cream anymore?  Or a regular thick strawberry milkshake?

But no matter what your opinion is when it comes to ice cream or boobs for that matter.  There's no right or wrong.  It's all just personal preference..
author: Michael L.

description: The Strawberry Crumble flavor may just be one of the best strawberry flavored ice creams I've had. They didn't have my favorite Harvey Milk and Honey Graham so my second flavor I went with was Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee. I didn't like this flavor as much and was wishing I had another scoop of Strawberry Crumble instead. I sampled some of the other flavors too and they were just okay.
author: Amy X.

description: I was craving ice cream and looked on my book mark on Yelp and voila I came straight here! LoL. Over all very great service, very welcoming and let's you try everything lol. I would definitely come back again... How could I have missed this place, always came around the neighborhood and didn't even realize how close it was to home. It's my new found cravings.
author: Mona Lisa L.

description:
I came here with real high expectations due to yelp and one of my friends said it was on 7X7's list of places too.

I got the secret breakfast cause everyone talked about it. Man were we ALL disappointed. The bourbon flavor was very overpowering. But the cornflakes add a good texture to it (best part of it). The ice cream was very creamy making it pretty 
heavy. 

I will give them credit though, their flavors are very unique and creative.

The workers were friendly and nice.

There's always a line and the ice cream shop is small and doesn't hold much people.

I love ice cream and I might come back to try their other flavors, but there's definitely many other good ice cream places in SF to go to.
author: Stephanie L.

description:
I won't lie - I came here thinking this place would be overhyped, with limited flavors riddled with semi-random names that only hipsters would appreciate. I was a frozen-yogurt convert for the past few years, and gelato or coconut milk ice cream when I felt like splurging (diet-wise).

I settled on one generous scoop of the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee flavor, served in a waffle cone. The texture was very dense, yet perfectly creamy. My god, I could probably have eaten this forever if I didn't need to save room for dinner... The epitome of Vietnamese coffee, bold and strong, just how I like it... Amongst other things. I wasn't a fan of the Secret Breakfast flavor since I don't like Bourbon, but it's popular amongst the crowd (oh you alcoholics, you...)

Great service and the staff will give you generous samples. This is the first time that I came across metal tasting spoons, which is nice since it minimizes waste. Some flavors did sell out by the late afternoon, so get here early if you'd like to try them all. FYI the line moves fast, but feels like a Disneyland line only because it zig zags, reminiscent of Lombard Street (hairpin turns whattttt?).
author: Christina T.

description:
Arrived around 8pm on Sunday night and there was no line. I tried:
Secret Breakfast: It has bourbon in it...very sweet.
Viet coffee: super strong coffee taste, not as sweet at the real thing.
Harvey Milk and Honey Graham Cracker: this was ok, got tired of it real quick.
Sorry but Bi-Rite is way better even if I have to wait in a long ass line for ice cream.
author: Kim l.

description:
I love this place!  Best ice cream in the city.   I used to be kind of an ice cream purist, chocolate or Ben and Jerry's creations only, but after several visits here I fell in love. 

The Blue Bottle flavor is always a winner in my book, but I also love pumpkin curry. It sounds weird to have such a savory combination, but it is wonderful.  Yum!
author: Nicole P.

description:
The popularity of Secret Breakfast, a bourbon-flavoured ice-cream chunked with cornflake clusters, is another testament to SF as a "Disneyland for young adults".

Moreso than Bi-Rite, Humphry Slocombe's flavours are truly gourmet and interesting, though there are a few more misses than hits.  Secret Breakfast is a crowd favourite.  Harvey Milk is exquisite milk and honey-infused ice-cream textured with chewable graham crumble. They've done an artisanal take on Strawberry. Some of the flavours, like Salt and Pepper, are questionable.  Cinnamon Brittle tastes like Cinnamon Toast Crunch breakfast cereal but with more of a Red-Hots kick to it but my partner loves it and it tastes amazing mixed with SB or HMilk. I'd love to come back and try more flavours though!

Pro Tip:  Do NOT go to their little spin-off corner in Falletti's in the Haight, you will be disappointed because either they didn't transport it well or that freezer is either not cold enough, because the Secret Breakfast and Harvey Milk there were clearly slushy and refroze and tastes like ice crystals.
author: Letitia L.

description:
I couldn't stay away! My first time trying this place out was yesterday. I had the Tahitian Vanilla and it was AMAZING! Simple yet full of flavor. 

Today, I decided to go yet again! This time I tried the Jasmine Lychee flavor. UGH! TO DIE FOR!! You can definitely taste both flavors at the same time. Your taste buds don't even know what's going on at that point! 

I can't wait to try the rest of the flavors.
author: Betsy G.

description: Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee. You have my attention. Before I go on, I love my coffee. It has a special place in my heart :') but more importantly I love good strong Vietnamese coffee. They do Vietnamese Coffee ice cream pretty well here. A good balance of the coffee flavor and the sweetness from condensed milk. I expected it to be fairly creamy and not being able to capture the coffee flavor that well but they proved me wrong. I personally would've liked the ice cream to be a little less sweet. Came on a winter day so seating inside was easy. Highly recommend trying their Vietnamese coffee.
author: Tiffany Y.

description:
To me Humphry Slocombe offers exotic flavors of ice cream, since when I was a kid I only  
in general tried chocolate, or vanilla, or strawberry, and maybe coffee.  I like the variety of flavors here. Secret Breakfast perks me right up. My wife absolutely loves the black sesame ice cream but to her dismay Slocombe did not have it, so she ordered the secret breakfast and some coffee ice cream.   I think we will be back again soon since it is summer and my wife is on her summer break from teaching. My problem with ice cream is I tend to eat it too quickly but then otherwise it melts on those warm summer days, could have worse problems!
author: Michael S.

description: To. Die. For! I tried about 4 different flavors before settling on the decision of the Tahitian Vanilla. As an avid vanilla fan, this was truly an amazing experience. Think Madagascar vanilla, but much much better. My husband settled on the Harvey Milk & Cookies, I believe it was called, which he loved! They offer the option of serving a one scoop cone in a cup, which provides a larger portion! I would highly recommend this cute place to anyone looking for a late night sweet snack, and anyone looking to avoid long wait lines!
author: Alexis B.

description:
This absolutely is "as good as it gets." I still dream of how delicious the flavors are and weep that I will have wait until I get back to San Francisco to have it again. Sure my boyfriend has their recipe book, but it is not quite the same as getting it made by them. 

It's busy here. Very busy, and rightly so in a touristy area and the best ice cream you could ask for with gourmet flavors to boot. If you're willing to wait, it is well worth your time.
author: Erica T.

description:
Not yo mamas ice cream shop.

HS is one of my favorite spots in the glorious city of San Francisco. Sure, BiRite Creamery gets lots of love, but I find myself Desperately Seeking Slocombe every time I'm in SF. 

These funky, kooky, weird ass flavors somehow work, and gleefully seize my tastebuds every time I'm here. Jesus Juice? Oh, it's just a wine and coca cola sorbet. 
Secret Breakfast? Bourbon & cornflake ice cream. The fine folks who work here let you try any and every flavor you desire, and believe me, I've tried my share. Their flavors rotate periodically, so you never know what to expect on the daily flavor board!

Some of my favorites include: beet hibiscus sorbet, Vietnamese Blue Bottle coffee ice cream, Thai chili lime sorbet, pear lambic sorbet, brown butter ice cream (holy heart attack) and strawberry candied jalapeno ice cream. Those place is a force to be reckoned with. Oh and the bourbon coke float? Creamy, boozy delight.

I've been to San Francisco for work and play three times within the past year- and every time, no matter what else is going on, I make sure to stop into Humphry Slocombe. Sure, it's a bit off the beaten path, but well worth it. 

Pick up some bacon peanut brittle at the counter while you're at it!
author: Emily C.

description:
Finally had the chance to come here yesterday, and by golly it most certainly did not disappoint! I has a scoop of the Secret Breakfast and also one of the Vietnamese Blue Bottle Coffee, both were amazing!! The Secret Breakfast was a sweet, but slightly salty finish, and the Blue Bottle had a rich coffee flavor to it. 
My only negative comment would be that the Secret Breakfast was a bit ice-y and chunky, rather than rich and creamy. It also melted pretty quickly, so it was a race to finish it before it melted into a puddle!
author: Bonnie S.

description:
Stop #2 of 3 on our SF ice cream crawl.

The people working here were super nice and encouraged us to sample everything (it helped that the place was absolutely deserted on the 4th of July).  I tried the Vietnamese coffee, XXX (chocolate ice cream with chocolate wafers and fudge ripple), summer sweet corn and brown butter.  I was disappointed in the flavor of most of the ice creams.  I couldn't taste corn at all in the corn ice cream, the brown butter mostly tasted like sugar, and I really wished the XXX had a stronger chocolate flavor.  I went with the coffee, mostly because that was the one that tasted the most like what it was advertised.  It was ok, decent flavor but the ice cream had a lot of large icy chunks which I don't like

$4 for a single scoop was the priciest we encountered, but their scoops were also the most generous.
author: A M.

description: An amazing place with flavors like never before. Secret breakfast is my favorite! Ice cream lovers, this place is a highly recommended!
author: Soukya L.

description: Funny names for the flavors! The service is good, there was this guy who is so patient regardless the line that is always going around the corner.
author: Florence D.

description:
No wait around 8pm on a Thursday!

The place itself is a bit small, with about 7 chairs in all, but what do you expect from an ice cream parlor? Heh.

I had the SALTED CARAMEL WITH CACAO NIBS. Umm, yass. Please take me back to that first bite! It was smooth and well-churned. The flavor itself was exciting. The cacao nibs kept the salted caramel from being overpoweringly sweet.

IT'S PRICEY. I think it was $7 total with a cone? But, the price must be paid if you want happiness. Whoever said money can't buy happiness is an idiot. They obviously have never had unlimited ice cream.

I definitely want to give the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee a try next time! Maybe for breakfast because I'm a daredevil like that.
author: Vee B.

description:
I tried the Secret Breakfast and wanted to write about how it's overrated, but it's not! If I weren't so morbidly obese, i would probably eat it for breakfast, lunch, and dinner - and dessert after all those meals - on a regular basis. I secretly like it a bit more than Bi-Rite. Oh, well now that I've posted it on this Yelp review - I publicly like it a bit more! 

I also had the Black Sesame and Basil Lime. I'm a fangirl of all the three flavors I consumed. My new pseudo-goal in life is to try all their flavors and update this post after every lick. Will keep you posted.

+new flavor review: Vietnamese coffee. SO GOOD. Sweet but not disgustingly sweet and the amount coffee flavor is perfect for a true coffee lover.
author: Juliana P.

description:
Secret Breakfast
Blue Mountain Vietnamese Coffee
White Chocolate Rose

All delicious and good service!!
author: Hey Y.

description:
The Ferry Building Humphry Slocombe left us wanting more. The line for Bi-Rite Creamery was wrapping around the corner by the time we finished lunch at Bi-Rite Market. The flavors at the time weren't very interesting at all either, so we decided to hop in the car and drive to the back of the Mission for Humphry.

It was a lot easier to find parking by Humphry than Bi-Rite. There weren't crowds from Delores Park, either. The shop is small, with a small counter to sit inside, and a couple of tables outside. There were some different flavors compared to the Ferry Building locale. We opted for the Olive Oil and the Peanut Butter Curry. They were both super interesting and awesome, until about the last 15%. It got too sickeningly rich for us and couldn't finish. The Peanut Butter Curry was really different. It had a light curry after taste and some peanut butter cookie bits. I felt that the Olive Oil clung to my tongue funny, but it had a cool citrus zest note to it.

Overall, a great spot for unique ice cream flavors without the crowds during the day.
author: Vivian L.

description:
It helps to have good flavors and an angle for Premium Ice cream. However, they are always out of top flavors and the quality issues are glaring.
  Ice crystals in product, a sign of poor storage and handling. More often than not the ice cream here is semi soft at best , an indicator of bad things that are allowed  happen to their products.
 One evening I strolled in and the place had been bombed. Asking what was left the gal just said "this" and attempted to give me a mushy haggard looking scoop that was already dribbling. Not a good thing. I politetly declined
 Premium prices, Premium attitude but a product that lacks the finesse and consistency that they promote but most often don't achieve.
 Anybody but Humphrey Slocombe has it right in the MIssion
author: Craig S.

description:
i came back here again, and this time i finally had their foie gras Ice Cream!!! It was driving insane of when they were going to make this ice cream again. My friend kept on checking their facebook page to see when they will have it.   So when it was announced that they had it last week, we jumped on it! The Foie gras ice cream was sandwich between two gingersnap cookies, similar to those at Miette's.   I felt that the cookie was a bit overpowering.  The foie gras ice cream itself was rich!  You can surely taste the foie gras, but foie gras lover in me wished there was more foie gras flavor to it.Overall, i loved it.  They melt fast so you have to it there.  We were trying to bring it to our friend before it melted. but luckily we got it to him in time. 

We also had the Harvey Milk ice cream. Which was milk and graham crackers. It tasted like cereal, and it wasn't too sweet. The oolong ice cream was good too, we got that in the pint and went back home to down it.  I think after this visit i like Humphry more then Bi-Rite.  I'm very sorry Bi-Rite, sometimes feelings change.  Some place else has won my heart!
author: Belinda C.

description: Loveeeeeeeeeee their secret breakfast ice cream & their vietnamese blue bottle coffee ice cream. Although the line is never as long as bi-rite or mitchell's... Its still good. It sucks this place closes soo early. Came here on a tuesday at 930 only to find out it closes at 9. Pretty lame. Workers here also count down the minutes to closing and if you're buds or flirty with the workers... You get extra scoops. Unfair right?? Hence why the rate is low for this place. Love the ice cream but expect high school level students serving you. Not buds with the workers? Too bad for you not getting an extra scoop free. I guess thats what happens when you hire kids who look older lol
author: Linda L.

description:
They have a different selection of ice cream that can be fun and kinda crazy.  The Thai food ice cream really tasted like I was having some Thai food. Not sure how they did that but it was weird and yummy all in one.  Test some of the flavors out before the final decision is made.

Parking is a pita but worth it.
author: Asa R.

description: I live two blocks from here which is great for my sweet tooth and bad for my waistline. All of their flavors are unique, delicious, and super creamy. I've noticed their ice cream melts very fast though, so you better eat your dessert at lightening speed!
author: Tiffany C.

description:
So Happy to finally try this place!

The line was long but with great company wasn't bad at all!

Here's what I got:

JESUS JUICE - cote du rhone red wine and coke classic
I didn't care what was in it I just HAD to get a scoop of this because of the name haha!  It had more of a sorbet texture and it tasted refreshing.  It was so good!

SECRET BREAKFAST - bourbon and corn flakes
Of course I had to this infamous flavor and I can see why it is so!  I loved that sticky corn flakes that's in it! YUM!

So after I was done my tummy started to feel a bit weird and I had a slight headache.  Could it be from me mixing!?! (wine and bourbon) Hahah! :P

I cant wait to go back  to try their flavors :D
author: Tu-Anh N.

description:
I'm an ice cream fiend...doesn't matter how cold it is, I can never say no to a good scoop of ice cream!

After venturing from south bay, north bay, east bay, peninsula and throughout SF, Humphry's still prevails over all other shops! Not to say there aren't some other fine creamery's in the bay area BUT humphry's is definitely the creamiest while also delivering on flavor that I've come across. Even though a lot of their flavors can be pretty ruthless and a little out there they still generally have something for everyone to enjoy(if you're picky check out their flavor board for the day before making the commute!)... especially with Secret Breakfast (bourbon and cornflakes) and Vietnamese Blue Bottle Coffee being everyday flavors I know I'll never walk out disappointed *_*

Their brown butter (this is pretty rich/sweet mind you) and Harvey Milk, Honey Graham Cracker and white miso apple are also some of my favorites. I actually haven't had their hot fudge but their caramel and marshmallow fluff are really good if you're looking for something extra to put on top of your ice cream.

I made it my goal this year to get one of those duck fat pecan pies before I move and I'm SO GLAD that I did! It was one of the best pecan pies that I've ever put into my mouth..so soft, moist, gooey and flavorful...it actually reminded more of a really really moist cake than it did a pie, which was completely fine by me. I was honestly tempted to buy the last three pies they had so I could take them home for further indulgence :3 Also, instead of the vanilla they offered with it I requested to have the secret breakfast instead and thought the bourbon went nicely with the pie... my boyfriend said he'd prefer it with their vanilla but it's all in preference!

The bourbon and coke float is also a winner as well, has a pretty strong bourbon flavor...with it being in both the ice cream and caramel. Not so strong as to where you feel like you're drinking straight up liquor but a desert version of a bourbon and coke cocktail! 

But anyways! If you're an ice cream connoisseur such as myself you NEED to come here! I honestly don't know how people can go to medicore spots like bi rite when there is humphry slocombe just "around the corner". Follow them on twitter/instagram for updates on their 'flavors of the day' and special sundaes and you'll be salivating daily
author: Melissa C.

description:
I sampled the blue bottle vietnamese coffee, secret breakfast, and coconut sorbet. The blue bottle vietnamese coffee is really delicious, but pretty strong flavoured so I'm not sure I would be able to eat an entire scoop of it. The secret breakfast is also in the same boat...it's good but since the bourbon flavour is really strong I think I would be overwhelmed by an entire scoop. The coconut sorbet tasted pretty standard.

This review is ONLY for the mango sorbet. I sampled it, and I liked the way it tasted so I decided to get one scoop. I shared the scoop with a friend and we couldn't finish it. The more we ate, the more we felt this salty after-taste which overpowered the sweetness of the mango.

I didn't like the mango sorbet but I'm sure the they have other flavours that I would like a lot more. Humphry Slocombe seems to have a lot of unconventional flavours so I'm excited to come back and try something new.
author: Theresa L.

description: Fun place with constant new mix of flavors. The secret breakfast was great and the vanilla was pretty good too. Chocolate passion fruit was interesting, the kids liked it.
author: Philip L.

description: Service was slowww, but my God was it worth the wait. I tried the Harvey Milk & Honey Graham, easily one of the best if not the best scoops of ice cream I have ever had (and I am a bit of an enthusiast). So rich, creamy, and balanced. Still in awe 24 hours later, I commend Humphrey on a job well done.
author: Jesse A.

description:
Wow! The flavors here are totally off the wall and delicious. Forget about chocolate, vanilla, strawberry. How about Secret Breakfast, Tahitian vanilla or peanut butter curry? 

I didn't try them all but I loved Secret Breakfast (bourbon and cornflakes) and the Blue Bottle Vietnamese coffee. So much flavor and "healthy" for you. Well, healthy by way of being organic in their dairy and other ingredients.

They have a bunch of flavors but it varies day to day. They'll have about 10 flavors available on any given day. Check out their website for a list of all the flavors. 

http://www.humphryslocombe.com/%7C_Flavors_%7C.html

Don't let the names throw you off. Everything is worth trying once and you can sample anything in the store. If you love ice cream, you absolutely cannot pass up Humphry Slocombe.

My recommendation? The Secret Breakfast is a sure thing.
author: Lloyd B.

description:
Reasons why you should go to Humphry Slocombe:
- It's hot out
- You bit into a jalapeno while annihilating a burrito
- You have a date :)
- Because you don't have a date :(
- A desire to live dangerously

and the list goes on...
author: Vivek N.

description:
Hands down, this is my all time favorite ice cream shop! With it's location being small and no fuss-like, the actual product shows just how big a deal Humphrey Slocombe really is. The lines snake out the door and all for a good reason. 

Personally, my favorite flavors have been the Secret Breakfast, made with cornflakes and flavored with bourbon, and also Vietnamese Coffee ice cream made with the famed Blue Bottle coffee. I've also tried the poppy flavor and Jesus juice sorbet and have been equally pleased. There's truly no hit and miss when enjoying a frozen treat here at Humphry's Slocombe.

Located in a quiet Mission neighborhood, the surroundings are perfect for a laid back vibe when enjoying your sweet treat amongst the outdoor seating. 

I tend to be a little monotonous in my flavor profile and enjoy having the same things over and over, but after venturing out a bit and trying out the new ice cream flavorings here, I'm convinced that there's absolutely no wrong choice!

Always friendly and quick service!
author: Ann S.

description:
The 5th stop on the Mission Sweet food tour.   Mike and I ordered 2 frozen treats to share with everyone. I choose the POG sorbet and Mike, the vanilla ice cream.  

The POG sorbet was just that. POG in a frozen consistency.  After asking the workers about it, he verified it.   The vanilla ice cream excellent. Full of vanilla beans, it was a simple taste that was perfected.  

When mixing the POG sorbet and vanilla ice cream, we all agreed that it tasted like a Dole Whip. A dole whip is a soft served frozen pineapple flavored dessert. Just with POG.  So delicious. We suggested to the workers that they should mix the flavors and try it too. 

With our pallets cleansed, we headed off to the last stop of the Mission Sweet food tour.
author: Marck N.

description:
Better than Bi-Rite. 
If you are craving ice cream in the Mission District of San Francisco, do yourself a favor - skip the line and the hype of Bi-Rite and come to Humphry Slocombe between 23rd and 24th street...you will not regret it!

I have never had a bad experience with Humphry Slocombe. All of their flavors are creative, unique, and delicious. The staff here are super patient and helpful (and don't skimp on the samples!). The menu is constantly rotating, but they have some constants like Secret Breakfast (cornflakes and bourbon) and Jesus Juice (red wine and coke). Truly, all the flavors here are delectable, but my personal favorite will always and forever be Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee.

You can also get pints and even a cake (!!!) to go. Seating is limited (bar-style inside and some chairs/tables outside)...but it has never been crowded when I went. 

Humphry Slocombe, you are the real homie.
author: Olivia C.

description:
I was playing tourist for the day and of course had to make a stop for ice cream.  My friend said this place is known for their secret breakfast, but of course I went against his wishes and tried other flavors as well.  

The vietnamese coffee didn't really taste like vietnamese coffee, it just tasted like any other coffee ice cream.
I was tempted to try the beets flavored but then thought against it... who am I trying to kid.. beat flavored ice cream?
My friend got a scoop of the cinnamon brittle, he loved it but it was a bit on the sweet side for me.

Alas, I gave in and got a scoop of the secret breakfast.  I usually don't like alcohol flavored ice cream because it's too strong of a taste and if I was going to eat/drink something with an alcohol taste... I would just drink straight up alcohol, but although the bourbon flavor was strong at first it complemented well with the corn flakes and ice cream flavor.  I'm not going to lie... the more I ate the more this flavor grew on me.

Who knows.. maybe next time I'll be brave enough to try the hibiscus beet sorbet.
author: Belinda T.

description:
I had 3 flavors:
1. Blue coffee viet ice cream:  very very good. Mmmm.  Delicious.
2. Tahitian vanilla:  very rich.  It was so creamy and delicious. 
3. Secret breakfast: I'm not a fan of tasting alcohol in my desserts but I liked it in this. I definitely will go back for this one.  I didnt enjoy it as much as the other two tho.

I did get to taste:
- honey graham cracker: delicious. The honey flavor is strong. Very sweet.

I don't like there sundae option.  It's basically: the 3 scoop option plus topping which r a dollar each.  


Overall, I loved certain flavors like I love certain flavors at bi-rite.  I wouldn't really compare the two since they have different flavors I like.  But both are so much better than smitten.  Smitten just isn't worth it.
author: Jon P.

description:
The Secret Breakfast is a flavor worth taking extra Lactaid for.

You dream about it and think about it and plan a trip to San Francisco just so you can possibly swing by and brave the long line to have a scoop.  

Best flavor ever.
author: Madelynn K.

description:
Location: On the corner and street parking seemed to not be a problem!


Customer Service: The guy that helped us seemed pretty non enthusiastic but the ice cream makes up for it lol


Decor: Very small but cute! Little seating areas and they remind me of old school ice cream shops because they are the stools that you sit in and you face the outside of the street with the counter top for you to enjoy your ice cream!


Presentation of Food: Cup or in a cone!


How did the food taste?: Ice cream was YUMS!!! I tried the Vietnamese coffee which was amazing and mosdef tastes like the real thing, the breakfast cereal which was good also, but I ultimately ended up picking the Jesus juice which tasted sooooo good it's red wine + coca cola! Who would have new these two combined would equal perfection! That's probably why it's called Jesus juice though right?! 



Overall Experience: It was great I wish they just had more locations like in the east bay!


Would I Come Back?: YES!!!
author: Rosh E.

description: I saw an article that listed the best ice cream places I believe in the states. Humphry Slocombe was on it so naturally, we had to try it. We got the secret breakfast. Vanilla with bourbon and caramelized corn flakes. The flavor was very unique but great! Because the corn flakes are part of the ice cream and not a topping, it was soggy so there was no crunch. Overall, the ice cream isn't as creamy as we would have liked and a bit melted right when we got it. We prefer bi-rite creamery over this place. This place has good ice cream, just not the best.
author: Kristine T.

description: I went to celebrate Humphry's 8th birthday. They were doing a fundraiser with a free scoop for everyone. The line was kind of long, but when I got to counter the wait was worth it. Everyone working there was super friendly and patient, they encouraged me to try more flavors to make sure I picked the right one. I got their coconut sorbet and a friend got their gingerbread guinness. The coconut was good but the gingerbread was amazing!!!!
author: Bobby C.

description:
Fave: Secret Breakfast and Honey Milk 

Top 3 sellers:
Secret breakfast 
Blue bottle Vietnamese coffee
Malted milk chocolate 

They have the top 3 sellers in Pint size containers to take home
author: Scroniee V.

description:
I really wanted to give Humphrey Slocombe another chance since I thought my first visit (a couple of years ago) was pretty underwhelming, so I decided to take my sister to Humphrey's for something other than Mitchell's and BiRite. We sampled a couple of flavors: Secret Breakfast, Jesus Juice, POG sorbet, Harvey Milk with Graham crackers, Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee etc and thought the flavors were very strong and pretty good! My sister and I ended up getting 2 scoops of Secret Breakfast, Harvey Milk, and Tahitian Vanilla with the total being $12 for both.

First off, the texture of the ice cream was SOFT and melted even before my sister and I sat down. I let it go, however as my sister was eating her ice cream she found a fruit fly (see photo for reference.) The employees were very apologetic, however I just couldn't stomach my ice cream knowing a fly was in the batch of Secret Breakfast. Take a trip over to the other side of SF and visit my favorite ice cream place, Mr. & Mrs. Miscellaneous instead!
author: Joyce E.

description: Oh.  My.  God.  I love this ice cream!  Been to both the Harrison Street and Ferry Building locations -- Harrison Street far less crowded and not usually a problem to park within a block.  God this stuff is great -- personal faves:  Peanut Butter Curry, McEvoy Olive Oil, Harvey Milk & Honey, Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee, and (of course) Secret Breakfast!  It's just bliss in a cone -- for real!
author: Lisa W.

description:
We loved loved loved it! 
Amazing flavors like the "secret breakfast" which is with cornflakes and you get to try , and they have great taste too!
6$ for 2 scoops with froasted almonds sooooo goood
We warmly recommend you to stop by... We will ;)
author: Dominique L.

description: I hate to say it, but I didn't really enjoy the ice cream here. The service was spectacular and I was able to try a majority of the flavors. I eventually picked the Secret Breakfast because it had the crunchy corn flake element. Unfortunately I wasn't able to finish my dessert because it was too damn sweet; straight up overkill. I like ice cream and I'm a firm believer that there could be too much sugar. I was literally chugging down water after a few licks of ice cream. They have an awesome concept and interesting flavors, but damn. I'm sorry.
author: Kenitha Y.

description: I really liked my $4 scoop of blue bottle, but I guess I was a little let down because of my own expectations. I read somewhere that HS has the best icecream in the world..! I mean that is a HUUUGE deal. The ice cream here is great, I wouldn't go so far to say that it is the best.
author: Divya S.

description:
I am the most demanding person on earth when it comes to ice cream. However, Humphry is definitely one of the best ice cream places in SF to go to! Even the vanilla is a revelation!

I went a couple of days ago for the first time and I found a very helpful server who helped me get samples of various ice cream I wanted to try. Their service is just phenomenal. Usually places limit it to about 3-4 samples but I'm a creature of variety and I like trying all the flavors that sound appealing to me (which essentially is 3/4 of the menu) and the guy serving us was super willing to let me try everything!

I ended up trying the Thai Chili Sorbet which was very interesting. Never had spicy sorbet before, or even spicy ice cream. I really enjoyed the Thai Chili sorbet. It was refreshing in its own way. 

Whether you stop by the physical location, or the stand in the Ferry Building, this place is delicious and deserves any ice cream lover's attention!
author: Pablo R.

description:
I LOVED their black sesame ice cream! It was so distinct compared to other black sesame ice creams I've had. If I just didn't come from Bi-Rite with a group of Yelpers, I would have finished my whole cup. Other flavors I've tried ranged from very good (Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee, Tahitian Vanilla, Secret Breakfast) to very strange (Jesus Juice - red wine and coke sorbet). I liked the consistency of the ice cream better at Bi-Rite but both have different flavors. Humphry's line was a little shorter but seemed like we waited in line longer.

My rating of SF ice cream shops:
1. Bi-Rite
2. Mitchell's
3. Humphry's

*Cash Only

As seen on TV: Outrageous Foods - Food Network
author: Lei S.

description:
So yes, I came here a day after going to Lottie's in Walnut Creek. I'm in norcal, I have to load up on my ice cream!!!

I first heard about this place because my friend was like "THERE'S A PLACE THAT HAS SALT & PEPPER ICE CREAM!"

No, I didn't try the salt and pepper ice cream...  Instead I ordered the cinnamon brittle and Harvey milk & honey. I did like the Vietnamese coffee, but as a non-coffee drinker, it was a bit too much for me. I didn't care for the secret breakfast flavor. I loved the spice that the cinnamon brittle complemented with the creamy flavor of ice cream. And the crunch from the cinnamon brittle was just what I loved. And the Harvey milk & honey was so simple and I loved it. One of my favorite Three Twins flavors is their milk and honey. It's so simple and so underrated.

I have yet to try Bi-Rite (lines are too long), but the ice cream here is not bad at all!
author: Patricia L.

description: There was a long line when I spotted this store; however, the line did move pretty quickly. Phew. I read that many people recommended the special breakfast and oh my... They were right. The bourbon was just right and with the crispness of the cornflakes. De-li-cious!!! I also got the cinnamon brittle and Vietnamese coffee. 6 dollars for two scoops seemed kind of pricey, but their scoops are huge!!!!! I can't wait to return and get the secret breakfast again! That is how much I enjoyed the secret breakfast! I'd probably just stick with one scoop because their scoops are huge!
author: Kosmo Z.

description:
On a "Mission" to try out Slocombe, Birite and Mitchell's. On this day I was only able to try the sundae and I was rather un adventurous as I picked Vanilla as a flavor. The service was great and everyone in our group seemed to enjoy their selections.

Who doesn't love Chocolate and Ice Cream? (If you're raising your hand you can stop here ) 
I like making lists what can I say. I have lists for Ramen, Steakhouse/Brazilian , Milk Tea, Egg Tarts, Chicken & Waffles (super random list right). Give my profile a follow if you like them. 

Ranking explained:  #1 (listed at the top)  is my favorite/ #?  (listed at the bottom) is my least favorite. Check out my latest reviews for my latest up to date Rankings. 

Rod's San Francisco Chocolate and Ice Cream shop Rankings: 
1 Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous
2 Marco Polo Gelato
3 Dandelion Chocolate
4 Chocolate Covered
5 Smitten Ice Cream
6 Teuscher Chocolate 
7 The Ice Cream Bar
8 Coletta Gelato
9 Cako Creamery
10 Humphry Slocombe Ice Cream
11 Bi-Rite Creamery
12 Miyako Old Fashioned Ice Cream
13 Mitchells Ice cream
14 St. Francis Fountain
15 Christopher Elbow Artisanal Chocolate
16 The Baked Bear- Custom Ice Cream Sandwiches
17 Recchiuti Confections 
18 Poco Dolce Chocolates
author: Rod M.

description:
Secret Breakfast? YES PLEASE!!! 

This is such a cute little ice cream parlor. A friend had recommended this place and it did not disappoint at all. They have all sorts of the most RANDOM yet very tasty flavors! Salted watermelon was pretty good, Jesus Juice was surprisingly good, and the Secret Breakfast was my favorite... Corn flakes and bourbon! Be open minded, and you'll be surprised how many scoops of what you'll want! Can't wait to go back!!!
author: Chi P.

description:
No, not Bi-Rite. I know that we all just love standing in line for over an hour at Bi-Rite Creamery on a Sunday afternoon. Yeah, so there's been a few Mark Zuckerberg sightings in that line. Big deal. OK, I'll admit that I squealed like a little pig when I spotted him walking down Dolores Street for the first time. 

Anyhow, I know the routine. I'm not denying the fact that sitting in Dolores Park with scoops of salted caramel, honey lavender, and balsamic strawberry ice cream from Bi-Rite just puts a cherry on top of your pretty little weekend, but you really need to get your butt over to Humphry Slocombe and try their Secret Breakfast (one scoop for $3.50 and two scoops for $4.25, or if you're extra greedy 3 scoops for $5). It's only the most addictive ice cream flavor in the world!  Bourbon and corn flakes are the two ingredients that go into this delicious blend. 

"But it's so farrrrrr awayyyyy!" you cry.  Do I need to call the wah-bulance? Use your legs! Walk! Get on that pastel yellow cruiser you bought at Public Bikes that you named Holly and pedal your tush over there! Muni! Or god-forbid, drive and practice your parallel parking skills in the Mission! Enjoy the balmy 80 degree weather while it lasts because I'll give the weather gods another 2 weeks before they start telling the fog to roll into SF again. It's that good and totally worth the trek! OK, promise I'm done yelling.
author: Catherine C.

description:
Really buttery and creamy tasting, and super interesting flavors. 

We got the following flavors, which tasted great together: 
Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee (5/5) - I loved the strong coffee flavor in this. 
Peanut butter chocolate chip (5/5) - really rich and peanut buttery tasting.

Ultimately, I love the consistency and quality of this ice cream, but there just aren't very many flavors I'd actually want to eat an entire serving of. We tried Salt and Pepper, Jesus Juice, Secret Breakfast, Cayenne Cantaloupe, and Harvey Milk, and I think the Harvey Milk (aside from the ones we got) would be the only flavor we would have gotten. Still, gotta give them props for coming up with such imaginative flavors. It felt like Bertie Bott's Every Flavor Beans for ice cream!
author: Rachel L.

description: I really thought after trying bi rite there would be nothing that compares! Boy was I wrong. I tried Humphrys with my brother and friend and I have to say their ice cream is soooooo good. My favorite is the blue bottle Vietnamese coffee!! It has a great coffee flavor without being too bitter and it isn't too sweet. My brother got the secret breakfast which was also pretty good. I personally don't like the flavor of alcohol which is the only reason why I didn't order it. I also got to sample the Oolng which taste like milk tea! Other flavors I sampled where Malted Milk Chocolate (very strong chocolate flavor and not too sweet) and I believe it the other flavor was titled something about being fat... LOL it had peanut butter banana and something else but it was actually pretty good. The peanut butter wasn't too intense and I normally don't like peanut butter. Definitely check this place out!! The flavors are sooo good and the staff is super nice! They let me try as many flavors as I liked without pressuring me to hurry up and pick a flavor. Lauren is awesome!!!!
author: Kelly S.

description:
Rating is ice cream is a really difficult thing to do. Like cupcakes, it's hard to say why anything so sweet and delicious could be bad, ever. My bias is out there: I have no way of determining what makes good ice cream. All I can say is that I now understand why so many people have recommended Humphry Slocombe to me.

I had the graham cracker one (I think it was Harvey Milk and Graham?) and it was amazing. I want more graham cracker ice creams. I also sampled the black sesame, and they get points just for having that. Additionally, I was able to eat this ice cream without getting sick, so my guess is that it was actually okay for me to eat despite my allergies. Even. Better.

I would definitely go back, but I'm not in for the adventurous flavors. If they can do flavors that I like and turn them into ice creams I love, that's where it matters.
author: Robbin A.

description:
What more can I say about this place? It's really good ice cream and worth the trek to find in the City. Creamy, smooth and super flavorful. I'm a fan.

Faves:
- Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee - strong coffee flavor, perked me up, gotta love it
- Secret Breakfast - corn flakes and bourbon, a must-try, very unique

Parking was tough to find in the area, so we parked a few blocks away and walked back to the ice cream shop. Be prepared to wait in line, although it was not as long as Bi-Rite.
author: Cynthia L.

description:
This ice cream is not the one you enjoyed as a kid nor will be a place you bring kids too either. You see this ice cream is on a whole new level. It's innovative, edgy in a playful way and complex. Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee. Harvey Milk. Secret Breakfast.

Imagine bourbon and vanilla ice cream with caramelized corn flakes, covered in bourbon caramel and floating classic coca cola. It's a bourbon coke float. Part of you is taken back to your inner child while the other part of you is chilling in an ultra lounge surrounded by beautiful people and the sounds of deep house music. It's nostalgic and super cool at the same time.

The flavors change constantly so I have to figure out how I'm going to try the other 5 flavors I didn't by choosing the ice cream cocktail above. Destination worthy indeed. It should rank #1 on your dessert list if you're in the bay area.
author: Patrick Gabriel L.

description:
Jesus Juice. 

I would go out of my way, far FAR out of my way to get some of this wine and cola deliciousness. I have always been a strictly ice cream over sorbet kinda lady except when it comes to the JJ. try it.

extra points- the staff is always super friendly, knowledgable, and passionate about their product. 

and... worth the line! 
tho personally I've never had to wait more than 10 min. :)
author: Callie K.

description: We came in here at the recommendation of my brother in-law who lives locally.  I thought I would peruse the selection but I had my heart set on another ice cream shop.  Well we tried a bunch of flavors and chatted with the girl working, she was very knowledgable about ice cream.  We we ended up getting ice cream here, it was more cost-effective for my husband and I to share a pint then to each get two scoops.  We got the coffee one and some chocolate flavor.  It was delicious!
author: Rachel R.

description:
Dear Secret Breakfast,

You are that secret 'cereal chucked on ice cream' treat sneakily savored  at 7 AM.

Together with Oolong Tea, you melt my taste buds away. 

My mother will never know. ;)
author: Hyun S.

description:
Ive heard so many amazing things about HS and have been wanting to visit for ages. Well I got my chance and have to say Im a little disappointed. 

We came in around 9:15p and the guys working the counter seemed less than enthused to have any customers there. They were over it. I get it, they're busy all day and probably cant wait to close and go home. However a little tiny smile would go a long distance in showing that you even care there are loyal and new customers in your shop. Scowling sucks.

The store itself is quite filthy from the dust and cobwebs on the chain lights to the dirty run down walls. This is a concern of mine as it makes me question the cleanliness of the kitchen. I'm not trying to be a hard ass here. I mean HS has a reputation for being some of the best ice cream in American. So my advice, always put your best foot forward and clean the front of the house. 

Ice cream..

Secret Breakfast - I think the concept is better than the actual taste of this ice cream. Think frosted corn flakes that have become soggy in a bourbon flavored ice cream . I liked the bourbon flavor quite a bit, nice and punchy. 

Brown Buda' - For me the little clumps of frozen butter melted in my mouth leaving a coating on my tongue and palate. So after a few bites I couldn't pick out the brown butter flavor anymore. The first couple of bites were awesome. 

Elvis: The Fat Years - This was my favorite. Banana, peanut butter with bacon brittle. Rich, fatty and texturally delightful I'd order this one every time. 

Next time we visit I think we will shoot for an earlier time so hopefully everyone will be in a better mood.
author: Alexander C.

description:
Second favorite ice cream place in San Francisco, and once you factor in the line at Bi Rite, it's pretty much neck and neck.

A lot of interesting flavors. Secret breakfast is pretty great. After school special has a certain saltiness that can only come from putting ruffles chips in delicious ice cream. Blue bottle coffee, if that's your thing. Anything with the word bourbon in the description....

You really can't go wrong here, and as I said, the line is much shorter than Bi-Rite...
author: Brent W.

description: We were in the area and couldn't resist getting some ice cream!  We got there at a good time as the line started to build and wind out the door as we reached the counter.  We got the famed secret breakfast and brown sugar fennel - mmm!  Love this combo!
author: Maile N.

description:
The gf and I came here a little before closing time.  First off, parking is tough in this neighborhood.  It sort of veers into two very distinct parts of town.  You have a nice residential area with absolutely no parking available.  Then, you have a row of closed shops with a bunch of metered parking.  The street is full of wanderers and homeless people.  

We came right before a horde of people came in and bombarded this small ice cream place.  We got two scoops of ice cream in a cup- one Tahitan vanilla, and the other the Secret breakfast.  I felt the Secret Breakfast tried to be too unique. The bourbon flavor overpowered all.  I am a simple kind of guy.  Vanilla did the trick of pleasing my taste buds just right.  

I would come back to this place again.  It is way better than Bi-Rite, and less crowded for sure.  Waiting in line (at Bi-Rite) to get ice cream is just ridiculous.  Bi-Rite either needs a bigger store, faster staff, or more cash registers open.  After all, it is just ice cream.  They should be conducting a transaction every 30 seconds or less.
author: Victor L.

description: Oh yum. Secret breakfast for the win and I have malted milk chocolate in the freezer as I type. Good ice cream. I still say Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous beats the pants off any ice cream I've had in SF so far, but I'd never say no to a scoop of this tasty stuff!
author: Archana P.

description:
So glad i finally had the chance to try out Humphry's.   Came by on a Tuesday afternoon, and the line was WAAAAAAYYY out the door.  After a 45 minute wait, we were greeted with a cordial staff and knowing there was a long line behind me, felt I should rush to taste and decide on my flavors.  But the staff didn't seem to rush me at all and I tired a few before deciding.  The samples were very generous, btw.  

Secret Breakfast tasted like cornflakes and some captain crunch cereal, the Earl Grey Plumb was a beautiful verdant plum and  delicious sorbet.  The Dulce de Leche was good, but too sweet for me.  I ended up with the Vietnamese Coffee and Salted Chocolate.  I thought they were good, however 1 - the Vietnamese Coffee was nowhere close to being a Vietnamese coffee, which as we know, is very strong and borderline bitter.  It was just not strong or bitter enough.  2 - the Salty Chocolate was too sweet and maybe just a tad too salty.  I am one who does happen to like the sweet/salty combo (people either like it or they don't), but I didn't think the flavors on this could have been better balanced.

I love that they use organic Strauss Dairy for their products, however, Bi-Rite still tops my ice cream list.  I find Bi-Rite to be creamier and has a cleaner finish.  The staff is great, and portions are decent.  Pricing is competitive with other artisan crafted ice creams.  The most painful thing about Humphry's??  The LOOOONG wait!  Other than that you can't go too wrong!  Unique and thoughtful flavors, which combined, bring a little genius to your tongue... until it melts of course!
author: Angela A M.

description: Humphry Slocombe Ice Cream is to San Franciscans what Gelato Messina has grown to be to a sub-set of Australians. Or at least that's the impression I got on my last visit to the city when I finally got to chow down on some of this renowned gelato. With my work crew in tow, we opted for a gelato night cap and trundled into the Harrison St gelateria all wide-eyed at the flavours combos abound. I ended up with a classic Blue Bottle ice-coffee flavour in a cone but could have easily been swayed towards the Matilda (cake, biscuits and chocolate) or the secret breakfast mix of cornflakes and bourbon. Suffice to say decisions must be made but thankfully they let you sample a few to make sure you're committing to the best for you at that time.
author: Lani P.

description:
Oooh ooh ooh. Was up in the Bay Area for a family trip but was able to see San Francisco for half a day. My friend recommended this place but man, it was a journey getting here. 

Coming from Ike's in Danville, we wanted to get an ice cream fix so we took in the sights on the way to the Mission District. I dig the area but unfortunately for my parking efforts, Carnaval was happening so parking became an issue. We eventually found a spot further away but hey, we got to take in the Mission and the festival so it was a win-win. 

After a couple blocks' trek, we found ourselves outside Humphrey Slocombe's open doors and took great care in deciding what we wanted knowing that it would be a while before we could return. I settled on the Blue Bottle Vietnamese coffee and the secret breakfast. 

Man oh man. The Vietnamese coffee tasted like Vietnamese coffee but it was the perfect mix of the strength of Vietnamese coffee and sweetness of ice cream that just made it mmmmazing. The secret breakfast was on point too! The same balance between the bourbon (oops, not so secret anymore) and the sweetness made it unique and flavorful.

Not so delicious was the price. Five dollar scoops, but due to the uniqueness of the flavors, ehh I'm okay with that.
author: Paul B.

description:
They've got some real unique flavors here so definitely take some sample bites before you commit to any one flavor. I ordered the oolong ice cream based on a friends recommendation but not before doing my own research. I sampled the secret breakfast and jesus juice flavors as well. Both were good (and somewhat alcoholic) but I decided to stick with the oolong. 

Like any ice cream shop, Humphry's rotates flavors in and out depending on season and what's available. The weekend I went was Pride Weekend and they had run out of the Harvey Milk flavor due to pure demand. It looked like they had 16 out at any given point and I'm willing to bet there's about 8-10 that are hiding in the back. Definitely coming back here to try them all.
author: Philip W.

description:
On Sunday, 8/31/14, my girlfriend and I decided to try Humphry Slocombe Ice Cream as our last stop before we headed home. We've wanted to try the ice cream at Humphry Slocombe for years now. I'm glad we finally went here.  

Atmosphere/Decor:

The place is pretty small but then again it's an ice cream place. When you walk in you'll see the menu posted on the wall with the ice cream flavors listed. There's a few seats available inside. Directly in front of Humphry Slocombe and down the street are cement structures. My girlfriend and I sat down on the cement structures and ate our ice cream. I saw a lot of people do the same thing.   

Food:

I ordered a scoop of the Secret Breakfast and Harvey Milk & Honey Graham. Both of the ice creams taste similar but you can distinguish them from one another. The Secret Breakfast tasted really good. It kind of tasted like cereal mixed with a decadent waffle or pancakes with syrup but way better. It had a great flavor. I really liked the Harvey Milk & Honey Graham. It was my favorite. The Honey Graham makes the ice cream taste really good and sweet. It had the perfect balance of sweetness. The texture for both ice creams were very smooth and creamy. 

My girlfriend ordered a scoop of the Fluffnutter and Elvis: Fat Years. She really liked both of the ice creams. She said the Fluffnutter tastes like peanut butter and marshmallow cream and the Elvis: Fat Years tastes like bananas and bacon. I tried a bite of both of them and I really liked the flavors. 

Service:

The guy that took our order was very nice. Before I decided what ice cream I wanted he asked me if I wanted to try a sample of a particular ice cream. I thought that was pretty cool (try before you buy).

Overall: 

Humphry Slocombe Ice Cream has delicious ice cream and very unique flavors. It's definitely not your typical Ice Cream parlor. It's one of the best ice cream places in my opinion. If you want some good tasty delicious ice cream then Humphry Slocombe is the place for you!
author: David R.

description:
Good, but I'm not going to go out of my way to get to this ice cream shop, but I'm willing to give it another try.

The Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee was delicious and I did take a pint home, but the other flavors were a bit lacking.  While I'm not a huge ginger fan, the Ginger ice cream didn't have any ginger flavor and was practically vanilla.  I also tried the Black Sesame, which I was really excited about, but Maeda-en has a much better Black Sesame.  (You'll only be able to find Maeda-en Black Sesame at a restaurant or if you purchase it directly from a food distributor).
author: Audrey C.

description:
First I'd like to shoutout the guy who served my ice cream for being so patient because I really did ask to sample all the flavors. I know he was a little irritated, but he complied and didn't show it off too bad hahahaha! 

Anyways, after my sample fest, I decided to order the secret breakfast & cinnamon brittle. Humphry's ice cream is definitely creamy and yummy, and I hate to be one to compare in a review, but Bi-Rite still trumps for me Humphry's obviously would beat out store bought ice cream, but honestly, I didn't find the flavors as prominent as you would in Bi-Rites. It's the same problem I had with Mr. And Mrs. Miscellaneous (except m&mms was worse). Without the comparison to BiRites though, it was still good ice cream. It satisfied the palette. Both flavors were yummy, but I definitely wouldn't get the two TOGETHER because they both had cinnamon in them. It took me sooOOO long to figure out what the secret breakfast was and when I did realize it, it was so obvious! The secret breakfast also had a kick of rum in it, which wasn't evenly dispersed so some bites had WAAAY more rum flavor. Not complaining necessarily, but just saying hahaha. I also definitely liked the CRUNCH factor in both of them The ice cream also may be considered sweet, but who cares, it's ice cream ffs. 

Honestly, I don't understand how Humphry's has like 300k followers on Twitter, but it deserves recognition. Still biased to Bi-Rites, but hey if you're in the area or wanna try it, don't steer away!
author: Holly P.

description:
Foie Gras Ice Cream Sandwich!  Get it before July 1, 2012 because of that silly Calif. foie gras ban.  It's a tiny sandwich about 2"x2" about 5 bites & it's $5 limit 2 per person!

Also for PRIDE weekend there's Unicorn Sundae - strawberry ice cream, corn ice cream, rainbow sprinkles, cone on top.

Harvey Milk & Honey Graham Cracker Ice Cream - I only got a taste, should have gotten a scoop.

Now you can Charge it!  Text or Email your receipt!
author: Ann L.

description: We just love this place! The most unique and dating flavors but they totally work! This is a must visit whenever we are in San Francisco. Not your plain ole vanilla place!
author: Cass B.

description: Can't miss this! It's one of my favorite happy places in the city. Sample if you can. I have loved almost all of what I've tried.
author: Lauren D.

description: YUM!!!!!!!!! I wish Humphry had a location in Dallas! Their flavored are so unique and scrumptious!! It's a must eat!
author: Molly M.

description:
This place has some crazy flavors. I've only been once, and I tried:

FlufferNutter: Combo of peanut butter and marshmallows, but pretty much tastes like peanut butter straight out of the jar. Way tastier than any peanut butter flavored ice cream I've tried anywhere else.
Secret breakfast: Heavy on the bourbon, but definitely worth a try!

The texture is denser than most of the other ice cream places I've tried in the area (bi-rite, smitten), but no complaints from me. One scoop is probably enough

My favorite part about this place is that they really don't pull any punches when it comes to flavor. Most of them hit you fast and hit you hard, and I'm definitely coming back for Round 2
author: Madhur B.

description: The Honey Graham & Blue Bottle Vietnamese ice cream are now my favorite things in the world. I ordered these late night via Caviar and couldn't be happier! Delish & worth every penny!
author: Charlotte J.

description:
Some friends and I were walking around and Humphry's happened to be on the way so I insisted on a visit. 

There wasn't much of a line when we got there but the place does fill up fast. 

I ordered a small size (which is actually pretty big, I thought it would be a large) of salted chocolate and speakeasy prohibition ale. Speakeasy flavor has that beer taste but not as bitter. Pretty smooth. I paired it with chocolate because I thought it would go well together and it did. The chocolate is a little saltier than I anticipated, but still good. Not sure if other people would agree with me.

A friend ordered Secret Breakfast upon recommendation, I believe. She seemed to enjoy it.

I was tempted to buy a pint of ice cream for myself since they added a freezer full of different flavors in their store. Next time, I will.

Forever in love with Humphry's.
author: Sofia R.

description:
I made it my mission to grab some ice cream while on my third visit to SF.

Humphry Slocombe, your crunchy-liquored "Secret Breakfast", creamy caffeinated jolts of "Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee", herbaciously refreshing "Basil Lime"-- my tastebuds were definitely on a trip of its own.

I blame my own midwestern sensibilities. 
Try as I might, nothing quite compares to a scoop of Jeni's Ice Cream. 
BUT... when in SF, slip your tastebuds into something eccentric!
author: Jenny H.

description:
Overall, 3.5 stars. The ice cream was fine, but nothing mind-blowing. I was here on Friday evening and it wasn't crowded, but the staff didn't seem too happy to be there. 

Secret Breakfast - alright, but the bourbon was too overpowering for my taste
Salted Caramel - too salty and sweet
Fat Elvis - the banana made it taste good
Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee - favorite! Try it!!
author: Josh L.

description: They have their menu on card stock, so I took some time to figure out which two I was going to pick. I tasted the beet- and the description was quite accurate! I picked the Vietnamese Coffee and Secret Breakfast which were a fantastic match. I can't wait to go back and try more flavors!
author: S K.

description:
I thought a wrote a review of this place, hmmph let me break it down and tell you all that I have sampled

on a cold, hot, rainy night, day whenever!!!  this place usually has a line, not as long as it use to be when it first opened, but because of there flavors I am a regular, when I run out of that pint of secret breakfast!!! I make sure I come back and pick up another. I have also tried there vietnamese vanilla, their blue bottle coffee flavor, also a number of their sundaes got to say every flavor tried I like, but I stay true to the secret breakfast.

I bring the lil one and the wifey here when we need the fix, on a whole wait usually 5-10 min wait, they are kid friendly and you can sample everything they have in stock. the staff are friendly and insightful, the place is clean, their daily special is listed on the chalkboard in the front when you walk in; and on the wall to the left a list of all the flavors they have currently

recently sampled the hot toddy sundae = 2 scoops of jameson flavored ice cream, honey clove caramel & candied lemon zest, I can do without the lemon zest but all of it was still amazing.

definitely will be back for another fix of secret breakfast

if you have sampled there secret breakfast you will see why I mention it only like 12 times hahha, taste like grown up cereal, or in some kids cases spiked cereal hahah

ice cream ***** secret breakfast
price $$
service ***** always smiling
ambiance **** small shop few seats outside and bar seating inside take it to go it not eat it standing up
author: Clarence A.

description: Wow! Is all I can say. I wasn't expecting anything spectacular, but that's exactly what I got. I got to taste everything, and they have an extensive selection! From their brown butter ice cream to their POG sorbet... It was all delicious. I settled on their Secret Breakfast flavor. Bourbon and cereal wrapped up in creamy goodness! OMG! Heaven on a cone. Something reminiscent of run raisin but without those pesky raisins and a bit superior.
author: Tania S.

description:
LOVE the Secret Breakfast ice cream! It has bourbon and bits of cornflakes in it which add a nice crunch! The bourbon isn't strong at all which I was worried about. Alcohol in my ice cream??? Yah, but I'm so glad I tried it. I got a second scoop, too because I couldn't get enough of the first scoop. The sweetness was perfect because it wasn't too sweet.

My boyfriend tried the Vietnamese flavored coffee ice cream, which wasn't bad. It tasted like strong Vietnamese coffee, so I was okay about it. I am not a fan of coffee, so I personally would never order that myself.

Can't wait to try the peanut butter curry ice cream next time! It wasn't available when we went.

The shop is located in an okay neighborhood. Also, parking sucks because well, it's San Francisco parking. Squeeze in where you can, and bring coins for the meter.
author: Lin S.

description: The best ice cream I've ever had, period. The flavors offered are not at all your regular everyday options. We are a family of 4 and we all tried a different flavor. I had the chocolate Cabernet. EXCELLENT. My husband had the breakfast blend, one child tried Tahitian vanilla and the other malted dulce de leche. Every single flavor was delicious. $4 for a cone which contained two scoops. The day before I had gone to Ben and Jerry's where I paid $5 for ONE tiny scoop in a cup. This place blows away any other ice cream shop. A Must try! :)
author: Alicia S.

description:
Another typical small, hard to miss place in San Francisco.
The logo is apparently a two headed calf?
There's one (or should I say two), hanging from one of the walls. 
The ice cream, interesting names like Jesus Juice, which I didn't get to try, but contained wine
Secret Breakfast - frozen whiskey, my whiskey loving friend loved it. I'm not a fan of whiskey, so not my thing.
Oolong tea - tasted like oolong tea....
Blue Bottle Vietnamese coffee - tasted like really good coffee.
Basil lime sorbet - tasted like basil and lime.
Starting to get the point?
Note: I LOVED ALL OF THEM.
I almost dropped a scoop off my cone, I felt like I was dropping a child.
author: Trang B.

description: I like this place better than Bi-rite. They have a variety of flavors. I really like their oolong tea and earl grey lychee flavors because it's not too creamy. I do not suggest getting the POG sorbet. It was way too sweet. I've also had their Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee flavor and their morning breakfast, which are both good.
author: Shu T.

description:
I really do not get why Bi-Rite Creamery is considered SF's top ice cream spot when the city has a place like this. 

The Fluffernutter ice cream and Caramel Cocoa Nib ice creams were some of the best I have ever had. Even the Slocombe they dish out at the popular restaurant Frances is absolutely insane. Unlike Bi-Rite the fudge sauce here retains a silky smooth consistency without ever seizing up even when applied to the cold ice cream. Also the frosted peanuts they offer are the perfect complement to any sundae, cup, or cone. 

I tried the Secret Breakfast and Vietnamese Coffee ice creams as well and neither compared to the fluffernutter, caramel, or Tahitian Vanilla flavors. I get that the Secret Breakfast is super trendy but if you have only had that flavor and think Slocombe is only like 4 stars I would suggest you try a few others. 

In short, I am blown away by this place. Perfect, perfect, perfect ice cream and, in my opinion, the best in San Francisco BY FAR.
author: Paul A.

description: Go to spot for us: when we need to perk ourselves up or top off a great date. Never as crowded as Bi-Rite, yet better ice cream, in my humble opinion. Will continue to come here with my fiancé for years to come.
author: Ed O.

description:
Came here on a recommendation by a friend. Took us a while to find this place but it was worth it. The place is small and there's no huge sign out from saying Humphrey slocombe. Just a little window sticker on the window. 

While we were seeking out this place a guy recommended the secret breakfast and while I tried the Vietnamese blue coffee flavor and it was on par I decided to split the secret breakfast coke float with bourbon caramel with my boyfriend. They give you the whole coke bottle which was really cool and top on the caramel. The caramel was good. Super boozy which I liked and the crunch from the cornflakes in the ice cream gave texture. All in all a good choice. I loved it. Unique flavors in a hole in the wall place. Give this place a visit if you're in the mission district
author: Sam L.

description: I like what they're doing here.  Funky flavors that somehow work.  Better than most ice cream places, right up there with Bi-Rite, above B&J's
author: Charles C.

description:
Sunny day in the Mission and I notice NO LINE at Humphry Slocombe. What the fudge?! Let me check it out. Turns out they were not open yet, but too late - I was already craving some. Ten Minutes to Ice Cream.... 

As we are waiting, my mom tells me that I'm probably going to be the type to let my kids have ice cream for breakfast. It's true, I'd probably be okay with that and why not? Pancakes are basically cake drenched in syrup for breakfast. 

I laugh as I'm reading off the names to my mom, she knows I'm into restaurants and trying different things... but I love her reaction to things like: Secret Breakfast (Bourbon & Cornflakes), Jesus Juice (Red Wine & Coke), Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee, Black Sesame, Eton Mass (Strawberries & Cream). 

We both order two scoops and sit in the sun, without words. It's super creamy and I wish I had a cup of coffee to float a scoop of Secret Breakfast in. Next time... 

I can't wait to try the new flavors, seems that they switch them up often. For $3.75 each, it's pretty much a simply SF luxury to have such great ice cream.
author: Rebekah T.

description: This place has many good flavor ice cream. The best of which I tried so far is the Blackberry one. It is really good.
