As I walk in and im welcome by a wonderful employee who is happy to take the time to give me samples and educate me on the different flavors I will be back from time to time this is by far the best ice cream I've ever had everyone should come out and taste Humphry Slocombe ice cream .
author: Zack T.

description:
My friend wanted to try this place for the longest time and since we were in the area, we decided to take the plunge on this unusually warm day up in SF.

Three scoops for $5. Not a bad price for flavors that you'll probably won't find in your standard Safeway freezer. Some of the flavors that day was Vietnamese Iced Coffee and Brown Sugar Funnel Seed. However, me with my strong desire of Asian flavors, I had to get the oolong tea, black sesame and basil lime sorbet.

- Oolong tea. The flavor was SO milky, like if the maker took a oolong milk tea, made it SUPER creamy AND made it into ice cream form.
- Black sesame. Now this beats out ALL the black sesame ice creams and frozen yogurts I EVER had. A strong sesame flavor pierced through the ice cream, which was PRETTY amazing.
- Basil lime. For some reason, having a small taste of this reminds me of someone giving me a bowl of pho and the side toppings to put into my bowl. Just without the bean sprouts and hoisin sauce. A really refreshing flavor that cleanse the palette.

Hands down, this place changed my sweet cravings from just eating baked goods and drinking sweet tea, by adding trying out-of-this-world ice cream flavors.

Don't have cash? The place utilizes the Sqaure app.

Good news, there's a branch out on the pier where all the little shops are. So much closer to the ocean, which means closer to me.
author: Tom T.

description: Maybe I picked the wrong flavor, but I had such trouble choosing something not too weird. I got a scoop of dulce de leche and it was way too sweet. When I sampled it, it was good. It just became too overwelming when I had a lot of it. My friend was smart and stuck to vanilla, but I didn't want to come for some artisan ice cream shop for something so basic. We also tried the foie gras ice cream sandwich. I didn't know how to describe but it wasn't bad. If you're all for unique flavors, this place is good. Although I enjoy unique flavors, the ones they had just did not appeal to me when I went.
author: Cindy Z.

description: I stumbled upon this place when I was walking to Dynamo to grab some donuts and they only had two crappy flavors left. Hence, I needed to find a replacement to fulfill my sugar-longing because I was not about to have walked a million miles to leave empty handed. ANYWHOOO, three blocks down and VOILA! THIS PLACE IS AMAZING! I've only tried the white chocolate lavendar and the Snickerdoodley flavor and it is so perfect. I wish the girls in front of me weren't trying every flavor on the darn list, so I could've tried more than two. Ooh but sort of a sketch area in the Mission.
author: Tania S.

description: Decent ice cream with unique flavors  honestly I wish there was more of a selection & why is your name not on the outside of your establishment?1?!?
author: Ashley G.

description:
I was excited to try their ice cream after having Bi-Rite's to compare.  Humphry's definitely has a more creative menu, but I have to say that I did not care for a few of the flavors.  I got the three-scoop bowl for $5 (the scoops here seemed bigger than at Bi-Rite):

-Blue Bottle Coffee - You can even see the flecks of ground coffee!  My favorite out of the four, but I couldn't tell it was Blue Bottle.  I love coffee ice cream in general.  
-Brown Butah - OMG - do not get this unless you literally like eating a stick of butter.  I liked the flavor as a sample, but after I got the scoop and had a few bites, I noticed a weird oily film on my teeth.  UGH - it was butter!!!  Then I noticed tiny little balls in the ice cream - they were butter balls!  I seriously felt like I needed to scrape my teeth clean afterwards.  I just read a review by someone who pretty much said the same thing - wish I had read it before going to Humphry's!
-Secret Breakfast - People weren't kidding when they said this tasted like alcohol.  I didn't particularly like this one.  However, I did like the bits of corn flakes in it.

Bi-Rite wins this round!
author: Caroline K.

description:
Had my first tastes of HS ice cream at BITE Silicon Valley in Santa Clara. The HS folks were friendly and helpful. And the ice cream...well, now I'm ruined for all others. 

The Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee and the Milk Chocolate Malt flavors are the most intense, creamy, deep without being too sweet, full-bodied-almost-to-chewiness scoops I've ever enjoyed.

I haven't visited their retail locations, but next time I'm in the City I'm making time to visit either their Harrison St. or Ferry Building location. After all the gross foods your taste buds put up with in the course of a day or a week, they deserve this ice cream. Sorry, Ben...too bad, Jerry...regrets to all the rest. The new #1 is here.
author: Jean B.

description:
LOVE this place so much! Its hard to have a favorite flavor because their flavors change very often which is a good thing, but you definitely won't get bored/sick of a flavor here.

The chocolate ice cream with ancho chilly, if you ever see it again, try it!
author: Emily R.

description:
I'm a fan because of the unique flavors that they offer here at Humphry Slocombe but to me everything that they served was a little too sweet and that says a lot especially since I LOVE sweet desserts.  

I ended up getting the Roasted White Chocolate Lavender out of all the flavors that I had sampled that day (Vietnamese Coffee, Secret Breakfast, Chocolate with Smoked Seat Salt, and etc..)  After a few bites into my white chocolate lavender, I couldn't really finish it because it was just too sweet.  Too much of a waste to me especially if you are paying I think $5 for a scoop?  Yeah.  Love the unique aspect of this ice cream parlor but it was just too creamy and sweet.  

Definitely go if you are interested in trying new and interesting flavors!

Lina Chen
author: Lina C.

description: Just the best ice cream in town and the usual line at the entrance proves it. My favourite flavors are Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee and Secret Breakfast but they all are actually good.
author: Vlada C.

description:
Just get the damn secret breakfast. It is great!

They have some really really amazing flavors which will surely get some attention. But again, secret breakfast is the best. Once your palate has tasted its awesomeness there is no going back!
author: Milana R.

description:
About two months ago in the middle of the night my good Yelp friend Lydia L messaged me about seeing Humphry Slocombe on the Food Network. Her message reminded me to make a special trip to the Mission District, and I was glad to meet with fellow Yelper David N for a midday visit. Contrary to my previous experience, the venue was well lit and they finally carry their two signature flavors: Secret Breakfast and Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee. Before going head first into these popular flavors, I first sampled Blanche's Cherry Cheesecake and thought the flavor was weighted towards the cheesecake with elements of cherry fading into the background. 

Without wanting to deliberate any further, my double scoops of Secret Breakfast and Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee ($3.75) were as good as advertised. Both scoops were not creamy like the ones at Mitchells or Bi-Rite, but instead were super thick with an greasy texture in every spoon. The Secret Breakfast carried a sweetened bourbon flavor embedded with plenty of frozen sugary corn flakes to taste like bits of crispy caramel brittle. The Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee was steeped in gourmet espresso flavor with a twist of Werther's Original for a full aromatic finish. Each flavor was vibrantly sweet with definitive depth and intensity to render major wow factor with every spoon. It was a sensational one-two sugary punch that knocked my sweet tooth silly by the time it was said and done.

Without all the kids and teenagers in the store, the atmosphere was much more calm and relaxed. Service was patient and down to earth friendly as we sat next to the window and enjoyed an uninterrupted session of heavenly treats. The culmination of service and two really fantastic flavors were factors that led to their new rating. With this visit, they have really bridged the gaps in the hierarchy of ice creams in the order of Mitchells, Bi-Rite, Humphry Slocombe, Saffron and Rose, Fosselman's, Bombay and Ici. I would love to return at any given time of the year. Yum!
author: Daniel L.

description:
I did try that bourboned breakfast cereal taste-bud confusing flavor... why am I not feelin' it? 

Another hot day, another cry for artisan ice cream... 

Blue Bottle Vietnamese coffee... a delicious smooth tasty wonder. Great stuff...will come back to get fat off this stuff again, but Mitchell's and mr/ms misc. keep eluding me. No photo because they were having freezer issues with the hot day, and my treat had started melting before I even stepped out the door!
author: Jana C.

description:
Best ice cream in the city if you ask me. 

Unique flavor combos always delight and surprise.
author: Zac O.

description:
So many unique flavors to choose from!  How does one decide on what to get?  Luckily the guy working the counter was super patient on the millions of sample that my friend I were having before we finally settled on a flavor(s) that we wanted.  

I got the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee, and Chocolate Lavender.  My friend got the Bourbon, and Chocolate Lavender.  We concluded  that Chocolate Lavender was the definite winner.  It was subtle and delicious!
author: Linda T.

description:
5-stars for amazing flavors and for the family friendly price. 3 big scoops for less than $6.

My favorite ice-cream place in SF is the Ice-cream Bar in Cole Valley. The texture of Humphry's not as creamy but the flavors are better.

Tried their signature Secret Breakfast and Oolong Tea and Vietnamese Coffee. All were excellent.

I would recommend taking your friends here when they visit :)
author: Cheung L.

description:
Drive all the way across town to get a fix! 

Had a 2-scoop cup: Brown Butter (best) and Malted Milk Chocolate. 

Also sampled the Blue Bottle Coffee flavor--excellent!
author: Dan C.

description:
Humphry's has yet to disappoint.

I always make it a point to stop by whenever I'm in the area or when my dad (a big fan of Secret Breakfast) wants some. I've only had a few flavors, but the ones that've stood out to me most were Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee, Carrot Mango, and JESUS JUICE. 

Ok pause, let's talk about that Jesus Juice. I would go on Muni for as long as it takes (because parking is horrid) to get be some o' dat Jesus Juice again. I swear when I tried it, my eyes went O_O and I thought I died and saw Jesus himself. My friends didn't seem to like it as much, but I love me some red wine, so that plus the Coca Cola after-taste blew my mind a little.

All in all, Humphry's unique flavors and cute set up definitely make it a must-have when I'm in the area. I really want to go back and try more new flavors!!
author: Alyssa T.

description: Well, well, well. More ice cream in the Mission. This place has a catchy name. It's kind of far away from main strips at 24th and Harrison. I asked for a sample and the lady behind the counter I was trying to talk to asked me if I was in line in a snappy way. I did get the sample of Thai lime. I did end up getting a cone with Thai lime and liked it. The ice cream shop legends of Mitchell's and Bi-Rite have a competitor, but I wouldn't worry too much about it.
author: Denise C.

description:
Sometimes, a very bad day can be made good again with the application of a little ice cream.  The better the ice cream, the better the mood.  Humphry Slocombe is no exception; in fact, it might be the pinnacle example of this theory.

Unfortunately, I'm reading about all these flavors that are very seasonal, such as the prosciutto and salted caramel.  From what I heard there, though, there are only three they make all year round: coffee (Blue Bottle Vietnamese, I believe), Secret Breakfast, and... uh... sorry, I forgot the third.  But, it doesn't matter, because I'm going to tell you about Secret Breakfast anyway.  (And another one that is seasonal... so... sue me).

Okay, here's the scoop...  ha.  

Secret Breakfast is bourbon ice cream with corn flakes inside.  I want to say they were frosted flakes, or maybe bound with honey, as they were nicely sweet as well.  This... was... amazing.  This might be my new favorite flavor of all time ice cream.  This was very nicely balanced, not overly sweet, a slight hint of salt from the flakes, and a great mouthfeel and body throughout.  Totally going back and totally getting this again.

Despite my college days, I do not recall hearing of a concoction called Jesus Juice, which is apparently red wine and Coca-Cola (R).  You know what?  It makes a hell of a sorbet.  I would be hesitant to call this an ice cream given it's consistency and texture.  Maybe more of an Italian ice.  Whatever.  It was damn creative and damn tasty.  Not as astounding as Secret Breakfast maybe, but I'm a bourbon guy first, and a wine guy... fourth?

If you're in SF, go here.  Go.  Trust me.  Trust yourself.  Trust the scads of reviews on Yelp.  This is amazing stuff, and definitely worth the visit.  Look for (and try for free) several seasonal flavors, like Basil Lime, Here's Your Damn Strawberry, Hot Banana, and more.  Let those taste buds go avant garde and party!
author: Art T.

description: Superb heavy cream/very rich style ice cream...no confusing this with gelato.   Nice flavors and the Ferry Terminal building is easier than dealing with the lines at the other location.
author: Steinbeck H.

description:
My favorite place in the Bay hands down for ice cream. So unique, but done right, not in a gross/ weird way. 

My favorite is the Secret Breakfast, because it has bourbon. I'd like to branch out, try other flavors, but I probably won't. I did try the Negroni ice cream during Negroni week, and it was good because you can taste the alcohol. Did I mention I like that they infuse some of their stuff with alcohol, and that I love that?
author: Queen B.

description: Mm peanut butter fudge ripple was super good and creamy! They definitely have a funky variety of flavors but all of them are surprisingly tasty. Mitchell's ice cream still has my heart but this place is def a must try in the area!
author: Samantha S.

description:
Today I came in with my boyfriend craving the classic delicious creamy treat. 

I ordered the secret breakfast while he ordered the horchata, both absolutely amazing and bursting with flavor.

However, I had to take off a star for the poor service I received. 

The guy who took my order was not at all enthusiastic and looked as if he wanted nothing to do with ice cream.

He didn't offer me to get a cone which I later regretted for not asking myself and rolled his eyes as we came to a final decision of what size to get.

This is one of the best ice creams I've had in San Francisco, but bad service really puts a damper having a good time at an ice cream shop.
author: Melissa C.

description:
Straight forward ice cream and sorbets with some interesting flavors. What you see it pretty what you get in terms is flavor. 

Some of the favorites: 
1. Secret breakfast has bourbon (yum) 
2. Blue Bottle coffee (nice and strong) 
3. Basil lime (refreshing)
4. Pistachio brittle (need I say more?)

I can go on about the different flavors but they kinda rotate and you get to try them all if you want! 

Bottom line: Do it!
author: Meshell C.

description:
You see the line out the door? Yeah, that is Humphry's.

The first time I got to try Humphry's ice cream was from Bitter+Sweet in Cupertino. Somehow Bitter+Sweet manages to bring their most popular flavors (e.g. secret breakfast and butter beer) straight from the source in San Francisco all the way down to Cupertino without affecting the taste and quality. The first time was really a tease and I am glad I got to try it again.

Out of all the flavors that I've tried, my favorites are the secret breakfast, sweet summer corn, and butter beer. They have tons of flavors, but those are the most unique that I have enjoyed. The secret breakfast is a bourbon based ice cream with frosted flakes folded in. It may sound like a strange combination, but it's actually really good. The cereal adds a nice crunch to the creaminess of the ice cream. The bourbon flavor was a tad bit overwhelming in the last batch that I had, but it was still great. The sweet summer corn was exactly what it sounds like. It was nice and sweet and the corn flavor was apparent. What I found interesting though, was that the summer corn ice cream was very airy; unlike the other flavors.

The staff was very accommodating and samples were generous. I know some places get really annoyed when their customers ask for so many samples. I don't feel too bad asking for samples here though. This place is just that awesome! Summer is around the corner, so what are you waiting for?! Go check them out!
author: Lien T.

description: The ice cream was fair--we ordered Harvey Milk & Graham Cracker and Lychee Ice cream.  Meh.  I would not wait in a long line for this ice cream.
author: Miss L.

description:
Better than Bi-Rite or Smitten and it's best on a cold foggy San Francisco night! 

I love ice cream so I am always in search of the most unique flavors to try. Out of all the ice cream places that I have been to I find that this place is the best at finding ways to present greatly paired flavors. Some flavors they have had on their menu for years like the Vietnamese Coffee and English Breakfast but even after all this time those are still some of my favorite flavors. 

Today I had the Brown Sugar Fennel and it was delicious! I also absolutely loved their Grapefruit Tarragon Sorbet. I usually hate Sorbets because they are always so sweet! This sorbet on the other hand was so refreshing and light! I'm already planning on coming back one more time this week just so I can get it one more time before its gone! YUM!
author: Jacqueline C.

description: This ice cream place is worth your calories! I had the secret breakfast flavor of ice cream. It was so jam packed full of flavor! I highly recommend this place!
author: Jennifer H.

description: The Secret Breakfast and Honey Graham are my (and my toddlers) favorites, but their unusual flavors like cherimoya are usually good too! This is not the place for plain vanilla or chocolate, you made the trek might as well go for something you haven't tasted before. Parking sucks, but the ice cream is worth it! Oh, and thank you for finally selling them in Whole Foods!
author: Karla V.

description: Does Humphry Slocomb need 3001 reviews? I dunno but at least my SoCal friends will know about it and the fact that there are options other than Bi-rite in SF. Line was short on a hot Sunday evening in SF. There was only one person scooping and playing cashier and giving out samples and she was a queen at multi-tasking. I tried the fennel thing, that tasted like black licorice so not my thing. Also tried the peanut butter curry which tasted more like PB with just a very slight hint of curry. Really interesting. I got the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee which was delicious but I can't say it tasted specifically like Vietnamese coffee, as much as just strong coffee. A single scoop is $4, double is $6.50 and I think triple was $7.50 so if you're in a sharing mood, get double or triple scoops and save a couple of bucks. A couple of tables outside to enjoy your ice cream because it was like an oven inside the store probably due to the freezers for the ice cream. They also sell pints to go!
author: Ming-Jou C.

description:
People of the Bay Area:

I did not understand your complicated relationship with ice cream, your willingness to stand in line for hours in all kinds of weather for ice cream. 

Until now.

I had a couple of friends of mine from Austin, TX passing through on their way from Burning Man (cliche warning!) so I decided to surprise them with ice cream. I waited for approximately 30 minutes and was rewarded with an ice cream booty of Secret Breakfast (current favorite), Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee and Salted Chocolate. My friends ended up polishing off the quart of Secret Breakfast within a couple blocks of Humphrey Slocombe. 

I will definitely return to sample some more flavors soon, until then, San Francisco, just keep standing in that line. It's worth it.
author: Tara H.

description:
Bourbon and cornflakes should not be a secret. It is a lovely concoction of goodness that I want for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. I'm sure college students live off of this stuff, anyway! If you're still scared, just sample the secret breakfast, there's no harm in free samples!

Their blue bottle vietnamese coffee was a bit too sweet for me after the first couple tastes, but it was oh-so good. The flavor hits you right away, no lie.

Jesus Juice is okay...but not my favorite. Perhaps it tastes too normal for me to appreciate at Humphry Slocombe? The Elvis concoction I sampled, however, was more than interesting enough for me to make a face (not quite of disgust) - peanut butter, banana, and bacon. Or something along the PB+J line and bacon. 

Anyway. It's late, I'm tired, and I just wanted to Yelp. 
Try the Secret Breakfast, Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee, and sample a couple things for the heck of it.
author: Colleen M.

description:
Came here and seeing the long line there was, I expected some pretty good ice cream. I don't know if it's just me, but this place is a little overrated. We got the POG Sorbet, Secret Breakfast, and Jasmine Lychee. 

Jasmine was wayyyy too strong and overpowered the lychee. The POG was refreshing, but I may be biased since I love POG juice. Secret breakfast was basically just bourbon ice cream with globs of cereal which I regret tasting. Overall, I didn't find it that special.
author: Chacha T.

description:
Am I the only one who thinks that this ice cream is really overrated? In my opinion, after many attempts to like it, it's only appeal lies in the humorous novelty of the names of the flavors. The ice cream really completely lacks the smoothness you usually find in good Ice cream, and perhaps the worst thing about it is that it is so salty! No I'm not talking about the intentionally salty flavors like salted caramel or chocolate and smoked sea salt, I'm talking about strawberry and vanilla... It's all just so overrated. Even the whipped cream is overly whipped and has the cloying and unctuous consistency of almost-butter. 

Bottom line: total waste of calories.
author: Sam S.

description:
Dashing through the neighborhood on a deadline. Perhaps 7 spare minutes before the cab is going to show up. 

Three of us, armed with spoons, three scoops of gorgeous ice cream in a bowl. We can do it!

And so can you.
author: Lemonjelly L.

description:
Sadly, I live in So Cal, and only get to eat the delicousness that is SF cuisine when I visit my brother. This particular trip, was like going to foodie Nirvana. My brother asked me if I wanted some ice cream. Besides french fries, I think it could subsist soley on ice cream. So we go to Humphry Slocombe in the Mission. Blessed be the foodie gods because we actually find parking right across the street.

I'm told that I have to try the secret breakfast ice cream. Of course, I don't like being told what to do, so I try some root beer ice cream. Creamy deliciousness that tastes like a root beer float. But, giving into the peer pressure, I go for the one scoop of secret breakfast. 

HELLO FLAVORS! Is what my taste buds scream as I take my first spoonful of rich, creamy, succulent, mindblowingly good ice cream. I don't know who to thank for the explosion of flavor that just happened in my mouth. I have to sit down I'm so happy because I've achieved such a thrill from the flavor. I mean who would have thought that bourbon and corn flakes would be a match made in heaven but man oh man it is. I highly recommend it, but buyer beware, your taste buds will be crying for more so I highly suggest consuming only if you can make a regular habit of visiting this delightful little shop.
author: Shelley D.

description: It's good, but for some reason, it left me very thirsty. I ordered two scoops, don't be a fatty like me, just go with one. They give very big servings, and I finished half of each. I got the Viet Coffee and the Vanilla, though it made a very good combination, unless you're sharing, you probably won't finish it.
author: Stacy C.

description:
So I really thought they had Vietnamese coffee and a secret breakfast. No, these are ice cream flavors. I tried both and liked the secret breakfast. However, it was very soft and there weren't many cornflakes in it. The taste of bourbon definitely showed through though.

The store is on a corner without much of a sign so it's hard to miss. There are a few small dingy tables outside and they share the corner with a coffee shop.
author: Julie L.

description:
I didn't have time to meet up with my friend for lunch so instead we decided to grab some dessert at the famed Humphry Slocombe in the Mission.  Known for some of their really odd flavor combinations, this seemed like an excellent spot to grab some tasty treats.

We decided to share a two scoop sundae with secret breakfast and chocolate malt, topped with hot fudge and sweet salted peanuts.  Secret breakfast was the favorite flavor for me and had some pretty strong hints of bourbon throughout and just the right amount of corn flakes for crunch.  The key was the peanuts and they really made the sundae come together.

The service here is excellent and the entire place is dog friendly.  Not only do they have tables outside, but you can even bring them inside, as long as they're friendly.  Their desserts are really inexpensive for what you're getting and I can't wait to come back and try their famous brown butter.  I hear it's divine!

Food: 9/10

Service: 10/10

Price: $

Atmosphere: 9/10
author: Joe M.

description:
Why didn't I enjoy this as much as everyone else did?

I sampled almost all their flavors before telling myself that I have to just pick one.  Unfortunately, none of the flavors I sampled appealed to me, but I couldn't just walk out of there.  I ended up sticking to something safe - Tahitian Vanilla.  It tasted like white cake batter.  

On the other hand, the bf really enjoyed his Secret Breakfast and Vietnamese Blue Bottle Coffee.. and chocolate chip cookie.
author: Vivian H.

description: MY FAVORITE ICE CREAM SHOP IN SF!! unlike mr and mrs (makes me sick since I'm slightly lactose intolerant), birite (more normal flavors), and mitchells (I like halo halo but this place is a lot more creative). The secret breakfast is AMAZINGGG and I discovered it for the first time at the ferry building...once I went to the actual location on a cloudy day (there was stll a long line) they had blue bottle viet ice coffee ice cream...omg I went to heaven. They don't have that many flavors and they are on rotation (and ran out of secret breakfast to go in a pint) so I want to go back again!
author: Lily P.

description: The molted chocolate, Graham Milk and some kind of coconut sorbe were pretty tasty but we felt the price was a bit too high... No wonder this place is in a touristy spot, it's too expensive to be an everyday treat...
author: Anna K.

description:
FYI: CASH ONLY!

OH what a line, a line that does NOT move. It's filled with people like me that want to try the 8 flavors that are available at the time. 

I ended up trying...
- balsamic caramel: interesting taste, taste like sweet balsamic salad dressing, couldn't really taste the caramel
- sweet corn: it tasted like sweet corn, good
- peanut butter curry: I prefer this as a sauce and not as an ice cream flavor, I could taste both the peanut butter & curry
- Vietnamese coffee: tastes like regular coffee

Since I didn't want to hold up the line more than I already had with the flavors I tried, I quickly chose on a whim Brown Butter and Balsamic Caramel http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/47OC_X6KkiDDQ4jwoCUjFg?select=RGVZ12cmIvNgs9ZIS7HPOg. Oh the Balsamic Caramel flavor was not good after the third bite, it just tasted like sweet vinegar salad dressing. I wanted to try Brown Butter ice cream but didn't want to hold up the line so I got a scoop of this, it was the best decision. It was so good, taste like sweet brown sugar, even though brown sugar is already sweet. It was way better than the Balsamic Caramel. The only thing that sucked is the second I got my ice cream, it was already dripping everywhere.

4 friends got the EXACT SAME ITEM, Carrot Mango Sorbet & Vietnamese Coffee. Good choices, I probably should have got that too.

2 scoops aka medium for $3.75, not bad.

+Unique Flavors
+Free Tastes (no limit)
-Cash Only
-Long Lines
-Melting Ice Cream
author: Kylie L.

description:
Disclaimer: Not a huge ice cream fan (More of a froyo, tart-loving fan)

Generally I like high-quality, original ice cream. As Humphry is authentic and has a lot of original flavors, I think this was much too sweet for my liking.

My favorite here is the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Iced Coffee - like I said, it was just too sweet for me to finish one small cup myself. I was thirsting for water after a few bites, but I would not let my review deter those who are ice-cream-loving feigns!
author: Jamie Y.

description:
Very unique flavors! I absolutely loved the Harvey Milk with Honey Graham, the PB Curry was fun, but what I really want to try is the Bacon/PB/Banana flavor... 

What I didn't understand was why my boyfriend and I both ordered two scoops and I was given tiny golfball sized scoops in a small cup while he was given huge two huge scoops in a bowl and we were charged the same amount for both. SHADY! Girls LOVE ice cream MORE than boys... it's a historical fact!!! :(
author: Judy L.

description: Sure this is an ice cream joint and not a bar, but here beer and wine are transformed into a high calorie, fatty dessert. Take for instance their poplular "Secret Breakfast," where the only secret is, why hasn't anyone ever thought to mix bourbon and cornflakes with cream earlier? Or their seasonal beer menu ice cream which includes hints of honey and ale minus the suds and hangover. Of course they have your traditonal flavors such a chocolate, vanilla, and Blue Bottle coffee ice cream. For an extra charge you can get candied peanuts, a rich chocolate syrup, and whipped cream, and with flavors like these I say go for! Indulge.
author: Jack R.

description:
Still as good as it was that very first time. This place is a mandatory late lunch stop for me to indulge in the best ice cream around. Yea its smaller and more Mission-esque than that place that rhymes with alright but its way better for my taste. The flavors they create just seem to be alot brighter here than the rest.

So here are my favs in order of favorite:

Smoked Sea Salt Chocolate. Yep you're numero uno for me.
Ancho Chocolate y Vanilla Mix, oldie but goodie
Secret Breakfast, Southern Comfort if thats whats in there its dang good,
Flamin Rum Raisin, rum and raisins will always cheer you up,
Spotted D. its not what you're thinking dude
author: R J.

description:
I don't think I'll be able to say anything that hasn't already been said. I just wanted to add my rating of five stars to the collection.

Eat their ice cream. That's all.
author: Nicole C.

description:
This was my final stop on my "Great Mission Ice Cream Tour," where I stopped at every ice cream joint in the Mission I could, and though I was excited from all the hype I had heard about Humphrey's and the ice cream was great, it felt rushed and not super inviting. 

The ice cream flavors are super unique (a maple-tasting ice cream made from a mushroom WHAT?!?!) and all tasted great. I tried about 3, and though some were a little more interesting than others, they were all good if you're open to adventure. 

The service seemed a little rushed, which is understandable given how busy the place always is,  I just didn't feel that valued as a customer. I'd still probably go back though!
author: Marilyn M.

description:
Humphry Slocombe isn't very noticeable from the streets. just happened to pass by here after memorizing the address. very clean and about a dozen seats inside.

about a dozen flavors available. sampled 3
-blue bottle vietnamese coffee: just ok
-black sesame :dynamic taste
-lime basil sorbet : very rich, flavorful

2 scoops (4.25)
-richly, delicately flavored
-not a lot of cream nor fillers
-didn't fill full afterwards.
-finger licking good (if it melts onto your fingers)

ice cream drips:
-no lines on weekdays
-samples freely dispersed
-very good service (didn't see tip jar even)
-guessing flavors change often
-metered parking available
author: Victor G.

description: I know humphry scolombee is most famous for its secret breakfast & blue bottle Vietnamese coffee ice creams, but my favorite flavors are the malted dulce de leche & POG sorbet. The secret breakfast tastes like old cereal milk, which I guess a lot of people like for some reason.
author: Cici A.

description: They have some delicious unique flavors, I loved them all! They let me sample a bunch and take credit cards. It was hard to choose just one!
author: Lemon C.

description:
Dare I say that I like this place better than Bi-Rite?!?! I dare. And I do!

They're known for all the weirdly delicious flavors like butter beer, secret breakfast, chocolate and smoked sea salt; and sundaes named, "Hot Mess." What's not to like. lol

Friends got the cinnamon brittle, secret breakfast, and I got a "bourbon and coke float.."
As much as I love cinnamon, I LOVED the secret breakfast! That ice cream had frosted flakes in them! 
And that secret bfast ice cream was sooooo YUM with coke and bourbon caramel. I definately think it's different from what I normally get.

I need to come back soon to try more flavors!
author: Laurie V.

description: I read the reviews for a long time and kept meaning to stop by in this area and I finally did on a Sunday Afternoon in early December. There was no line, just a couple of people eating their ice cream. I told the guy at the counter it was my first time here and he asked if I would like to sample some of the flavors since I had hard time deciding. This tiny ice cream shop does live up to its name and has some unusual flavors that rotate, but the staple is the Secret Breakfast which is vanilla ice cream mixed with bourbon and cornflake cookies. I was excited to see a pumpkin flavor ice cream, so I had that as well. All I can say is, "Wow!" The flavors do stand out. I can really taste the strong flavors and spices of the pumpkin. I tried other pumpkin flavors at other ice cream shops, but this one wins the battle of great flavor where I felt I was eating a real pumpkin. The Secret Breakfast was pretty flavorful. I never had bourbon before and was afraid I will get drunk, since I drove here. Yup, there's alcohol in here and my tummy felt nice and warm! Very tasteful and I enjoyed the texture. Good balancing act with all the flavors! I am looking forward to go back again to try more flavors! In case you were wondering, I did drive back home safely. :-)
author: Priscilla L.

description:
Expect: the line

Expect: the friendly staff

Expect: the unexpected flavors

I give them 4 stars just for being creative. I saw flavors there I have never seen elsewhere. It's not surprising that they made it onto the SF Top 10 Unusual Ice Cream on Scout Mob's list. Not that I managed to find one flavor I'd like enough to go back specifically for. I think it's still a fun place to try. Sadly, they banned foie gras in Cali a mere week before I could try their foie gras ice cream! That might have been the highlight of my day. Haha
author: Yad L.

description: Uuuuuuuhhhhg. Thought it was overhyped but I was (urgh!) absolutely wrong. Delicious everything. Yes yes yes. Secret Breakfast and Harvey Milk. YES. Do it!
author: Nile A.

description:
This is my absolute favorite ice cream place in the world!! Not even kidding - I'm guilty of having Humphrey's almost every weekend.

Sometimes the wait can be long but it's definitely worth it once you have that cone in your hand. Like mostly every Humphrey's patron, my go-to is either Secret Breakfast or Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee... sometimes even both scoops at once. :)

I love everything about this ice creamery, from the crazy banana and taco man wall art, the double headed cow, to the funky names and flavors for their ice cream.
author: Sabrina P.

description:
Seriously? 2741, now 2742 reviews? What else do we need to know?

Ok, I will chime in. 

Fun flavors. Not into the Secret Breakfast (hello? who soaks their cornflakes in Bourbon for breakfast? Ahh, maybe Humphry). But I liked the Black Sesame and Malted Milk Chocolate quite a bit. 

Portions are generous, and prices are fair. The sundaes especially are the deal: one could feed 6, we decided. Or 8 not-so-hungry people. Or 10 really-just-want-to-taste-it kind of people.

Two of us got sundaes and the underlying brownie in one was hard as a clump of dirt slowly forming into a rock. Much tastier than that, but a huge disappointment in an otherwise mighty fine sundae.

The best thing about this place is the name. Really. That has probably been said before, but I don't know, because I don't have time to read 2000 reviews. Do you?
author: Ms. H.

description:
I live few blocks from this corner ice cream shop. Although i like the taste of the ice cream staff that works in this place does not carry good attitude toward customers. Few minutes ago I got a pint size ice cream. The guy who was helping me was not really helping. I first posed the question about the size of the servicing I wanted to have. He seem to be just not happy with the request and kept giving me stares. And this is not first time I am experiencing bad customer service at this place. 

you will just need to learn how to put smiles on your faces
author: Alper B.

description:
The. best. strawberry. ice. cream. ever.

Creative, if not at times head scratching, yet delicious flavors. Beautiful texture. Satisfying in a way only ice cream can be (you know what I'm talking about; if not, you need to eat more ice cream).
author: Jess C.

description:
OK, OK.. I don't tend to speak SUPER favorably about this place. Is it good? Yes. Is it as good as everyone says it is? No. Should there be a 30 minute wait any time its about 68F in SF? No. 

So maybe it was the nice weather today, maybe it was the rockstar parking (even though I had to pay on a sunday : ( ) or maybe it was that there were 4 people in line ahead of us today. But I'll give it up for HS, and give them 4 stars.

Went past Mitchell's today (upper 60s out) and there must've been 25+ people in line. So to HS I go. To my amazement, the line was tiny. How was there a line that long at Mitchell's, and not at HS? That baffles me. I've had Secret Breakfast before, but I like to try out new flavors. They had Harvey Milk and Honey Graham Cracker , which I had not see before. I sampled that, and it was good enough to get that. I paired the Harvey w/ Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee. After finishing, I must say, the Harvey just might be my new flavor of the month. : ) 

~ I would have given then 5 stars, but the coffee ice cream just wasn't quite right. The strength of the coffee, I thought was right on, even though my friend thought it was a little weak. And this might sound weird, but I thought it was a bit TOO creamy.
author: Benny N.

description:
- Locale Destination -
It's on Harrison St and 24 St in San Francisco. Mission.

It might be hard to park. It's very close to "Bi-Rite" but less line. The shop is very tiny. They got a seating inside and outside. Decor is pretty simple in white and sophisticated - very "San Francisco". Quick service. 

It's cool that they got funky flavors. But I think they should put the ingredients somewhere so that people can see them since it's hard to imagine the ingredients of "The Secret Breakfast"... It would help for the customers to decide the final choice. I might have missed out the good flavors just because of the too funky names... 


- Gluttony Expedition -
Vietnamese coffee: Great. Not too strong but really good coffee flavor. 
Old thunder pussy:  I don't remember the taste ;( I'm sure it wasn't so memorable.. 
Golden beet saffron: Light yet good saffron flavor. It was more like a sorbet.
Harvey milk& honey graham: My favorite. You see "honey" flavors quite sometimes but most of the time are not so good. This was very sophisticated one. 


- Conqueror's Deduction - 
This was similar to "Bi-Rite" - in terms of quality. They were very sophisticated gourmet ice cream with full of the ingredients' flavors like "Bi-Rite". But the texture was a bit lighter and less creamier than "Bi-Rite". Very "FINE" quality. 

But the flavors are much more adventurous and peculiar like the Secret Breakfast than anyone else. I think it's great that they are very unique and bold to go something weird or/and wild - out of the box. It's a very "San Francisco" to me - to be very unique and different from others. LA and OC got a less tendency for the spirit - they seem to be like everyone else - lacked in the originality. It shouldn't be like everyone else - especially ice cream competitions in SF seem fierce. Obviously they stand out from the crowds. This place requires you to be a little more adventurous than usual. I think all the tastes were alright. They were tasty but lacked in punch unlike "Bi-Rite". "Bi-Rite" is much less bolder flavor choices but got more WOW factors in flavors.  

They got less varieties than others. They claim they have like 10 to 12 varieties daily and rotate the flavors often. I have no problem with lesser options - I can avoid tasting so many and wondering my final decision. It requires you to come back for the different flavors. 

It's nice that they got a less line than "Bi-Rite" but similar quality ice cream to "Bi-Rite". I still prefer "Bi-Rite" to "Humphrey", but I'll come here over "Bi-Rite" for adventurous flavors and less line. 


"Humphrey" and "Bi-Rite" are more gourmet ice than "Mitchell's".
Here's the summary:

- "Humphrey":  bold and adventurous flavor choices, less varieties than others, light yet fine taste and texture, less line than "Bi-Rite"

- "Bi-Rite":  unique yet great flavors, lots of varieties, great texture, gourmet ice cream, ridiculous line for the hot days

- "Mitchell's": richer and creamier than others, wide and unique flavor varieties (Asian, Mexican, American - all over), pop&mom ice cream with bold flavors, long line

I still prefer "Bi-Rite" overall, but they are all different creatures....
It's hard for me to say which one is the number one. I would go back for the each place for the particular flavors that stand out.
author: Akiko I.

description:
Came on a whim with Stephanie L. since I was craving for some ice cream. I have seen reviews of this place and she has had a taste of it before but has never been to the actual store, we decided to come! Located so discreetly near the corner of the street, it was easy to find with our phones but if I didn't have my phone, I would have been a bit lost. It was nice walking into the warm store. The store is clean on the inside and not overly cluttered.

I had a sample of the Secret Breakfast with bourbon and I am not sure why this flavor is all the craze. The bourbon flavor is just too much for me.
Vietnamese coffee - This flavor was pretty good, not too bitter.
Tahitian vanilla - Like this flavor the most because of the vanilla beans and vanilla flavor was good.

Overall I think their flavors are very strong, almost overpowering. I can't have too many bites of the ice cream. It was a good thing I had a scoop of the coffee and another scoop of the vanilla to balance the flavors out. I could even still taste the vanilla after I ate a lot of the coffee, which usually doesn't happen... meaning that the vanilla is strong! Their variety of flavors and unique selection is cool. When I went, they had some beer flavors. Although, I didn't really like the texture of their ice creams. I felt like the ice creams were not very creamy. My coffee flavored ice cream was actually a bit icy.
author: Katherine L.

description: Great place to bring someone to a date. This ice cream shop is a genuine San Francisco experience. The staff is super friendly and the space inside is very unique.
author: Vladimir M.

description: Finally made a trip here.  Had high expectations after hearing about it from others, but it was just okay for me.  I sampled the Chocolate Smoked Sea Salt, but it was too salty.  Instead, I had the famous Secret Breakfast (Bourbon with corn flakes) and Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee.  In the first few bites, I really tasted the bourbon, but when I started eating the coffee one, it was hard to taste it as the coffee overpowered the bourbon.  Overall, I enjoyed the coffee flavor more than the Secret Breakfast.  I didn't get what the big deal is about the Secret Breakfast.  In terms of the texture, their ice cream was too ice-y for me, not creamy enough so I wasn't too excited by it.  Also, the two headed cow on the wall kinda freaked me out.  Can't compare to my favorite ice cream place in SF!
author: Erica S.

description:
The flavors at Humphry Slocombe are for those with an extreme sweet tooth and a love for trying unique flavors. Came here with Humphry Slocombe experts, Jess H. and Alex P., who were ready to give recommendations. With their opinions steering my decision, I got a scoop of Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee and another scoop of Secret Breakfast. 

While in line, I also tried a spoon of Jesus Juice (red wine and cocacola), Sesame, and Harvey Milk & Honey. I enjoyed all of the samples as well as my two scoops. The first taste of the coffee and bourbon awakened my taste buds. Very nicely defined flavors but towards the end both were insanely sweet. Luckily Alex P. got an ice cream float, which came with its own small bottle of coke; I needed it to dull down the alcoholic taste of Secret Breakfast.

My first Humphry Slocombe experience was great -- ice cream was excellent, parking was a breeze,the staff were friendly and patient, and the line moved very quickly. Next time I am in the area, I will revisit. 

What I recommend:
-- try as many flavors as you can because they are all unique and delicious
-- Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee
author: Andrew W.

description: Went back here 5 years later (and paid for it myself this time). It's still good. But holy crap, it must be made from fresh-squeezed organic gluten-free virgin non-gmo pasture raised vegan breast milk for it to cost $4.75 for a tiny scoop. Wow.
author: Ben G.

description:
Blue bottle vietnamese coffee and secret breakfast will change your life. I'm craving Humphry's ice cream right now as I write this review. Their ice cream is amazingly creamy and smooth, and their staff is really friendly.

We got lucky with parking right across the street around 4pm, but we still had to pay the meter. It was definitely worth it as I crossed the street with excitement knowing I was about to eat some delicious owce cream!
author: Alyssa F.

description:
I tried pretty much every flavor before picking the honey lavender, i think? I can't even remember and it wasn't that long ago. 
I'll stick to my bi-rite. Even though i get less for more money, I think it's still worth it.
author: Susie P.

description:
I love ice cream y'all. My friends think I have problems.

ANYWAY, Humphry Slocombe. It's been on my radar for MONTHS. I finally made it into the city to try it out. It's a small little shop in the Mission district; not a lot of seating inside but they do have some small tables outside. 

I believe their ice cream flavors are always in rotation, but Secret Breakfast is a constant. Obviously, I had to try a scoop of that. I also tried their Oolong Tea. Both definitely hit the spot, but Secret Breakfast is the one I can't stop thinking about! Oolong Tea tastes just like milk tea (and if you know me, you know I'm also a huge boba fan). Secret Breakfast was a perfect combination of creaminess and bourbon and crunchy corn flakes. It's seriously a must try! I'm already thinking about the next time I can go back...

Please do yourself a favor and check this place out. And try the Secret Breakfast.
author: Carole Y.

description:
Been here twice, my favorite ice cream being the "Secret Breakfast" which is a concoction of corn flakes and BOURBON combined! Yes Bourbon!!!! In ice cream!!!! You can definitely taste the liquor from the bourbon, and I felt I could get pretty buzzed off that order had I got more scoops!   I'm surprised they didn't card me!

If you're looking for the foie gras ice cream, try to go early. I came here yesterday evening though, and was lucky to get some foie gras ice cream - but they only come in the form of sandwiches so FYI.

Don't get strawberry.....I totally regret getting it. I liked the sample, but honestly the whole scoop didn't have much cream in it. Weird texture to taste, and it's funny to say that it tasted pretty dry.

Hours are kinda weird, but don't worry about the cash situation because they accept credit cards! Woot!
author: Jocelyn L.

description: Unique flavors at a very reasonable price.  Their sundaes are only $6.50 and include 3 scoops of ice cream with a variety of toppings.  We got a tin roof sundae & substitute  the vanilla for  scoop of  Vietnamese coffee, candied ginger, & malted dulce de leche. YUMMMMMMMMM. If you are not a fan of sugar do not even attempt this because it is super sweet. If you love sweets then you will feel right at home.  The guy doling out the creamy goodness was really nice and let us sample almost every flavor before deciding.
author: Deborah B.

description:
One of random and last minutes ice cream place that one of my brother and i went decided to go to couple years ago before dropping off my brother to his work place in Chinatown since it was a hot day. Plus it was close enough to our house. 

 When we finally came to the place, i thought it was cool seeing classic cars parking outside this ice cream place. Then once you go inside, it looks like an ice cream parlor from the 70s with the red mini high chairs and i think there was a jukebox too.

 Of course there was a long line since it was a hot but it gave my brother and i a chance to see what flavors we want to get. If you go to their website, they have over 20 flavors of ice cream but only have about 10 flavors at the store.

It has a unique names for all of the flavors they offer. 

My brother had two scoops with the flavor choice of Vietnamese coffee flavor peanut butter curry. He thought Vietnamese coffee was good and it does actually the flavor does somewhat taste like Vietnamese coffee. He didn't like the peanut butter curry since it has a weird taste to it. I had Strawberry szucuan sorbet. It was creamy, soft, and right among of sweetness but it doesn't have the strawberry flavor.

Another good thing is its cheap and reasonable price for many scoops of ice cream you want. Would definitely come here again

This ice cream place was even shown in the SF episode of Bizarre Food.
author: Julie N.

description:
Wow... I never thought I would see the day that I give an ice cream establishment only two stars. 

I love ice cream. I've never thought of myself as an ice cream connoisseur, but I suddenly got very picky while eating this Vietnamese Coffee flavored ice cream. My boyfriend chose the Cinnamon Brittle - based on several taste-tests - the Secret Breakfast was a close second.
The flavors were very rich and very strong, so you can't fault them for that. What was strange was the consistency. I feel like they were trying to make very creamy ice cream - but with butter. The "butter" however, pills up and leaves you with a grainy consistency that takes awhile to melt. 
The result is a thick layer of cream that you have to scrape off of the roof of your mouth, and a heaviness that I don't necessarily associate with ice cream. It made me bloated and full and gave my boyfriend a tummy-ache. (We only had one scoop each.)

On the plus side you can leave your chapstick at home, because all that creaminess amounts to very soft lips.

Regardless of that one fantastic upside, I don't think we'll be back.
author: Candice T.

description:
There's nothing better than ending a 2000+ calorie dinner of garlic bread laden with churned butter and roasted garlic gloves, spicy tender chicken wings lathered with blue cheese dressing, and a buttery crusted deep dish pizza stuffed with gooey cheese then with....ICE CREAM; there's ALWAYS room for ice cream!!!

I've been dying to try Humphry Slocombe since when they first opened last year. After paying a visit to LSP, my friends and I needed a sweet ending to our overindulgence and since HS is nearby, it was a perfect opportunity to give it a shot.

*Secret Breakfast: If you're a brown drinker, SB is right up your alley. It has a distinct bourbon flavor which slightly lingers in your mouth. It's creamy, smooth, and not too sweet. The cornflakes add a nice crunch. I'm a clear type of gal, so I didn't care much for the SB.

*Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee: DELIOUSNESS! I'm not much of a coffee drinker, but when I do have it, I enjoy having Viet Coffee from the local hole-in-the-wall pho place. If you like Viet coffee, you will love the BBVC. The BBVC was creamy, sweet, and a tad bit tart from the coffee grinds. You can really taste the kick from the coffee, especially when you get a piece of the coffee grinds, but the condensed milk flavor balances it our perfectly. It's sweet w/o being overly sweet.

*Pink Apple: At first, the description of apples and cranberry didn't seem appealing at all. But, having a bit of my friend's, I felt like kicking myself for not sampling the PA beforehand. It has a very clean and crisp apple flavor and tasted like you were eating a creamy frozen apple. I didn't really taste the cranberries, and I think it gave the sorbet the red color more than anything. If you're looking for a refreshing treat, go for the PA!

*Tahitian Vanilla: Mmmmm...although I was expecting more of a vanilla flavor too it, I wasn't disappointed. The TV tasted something between a frozen cream fraiche (slightly sour) and a marshmallow. It was much creamier than the other flavors and had a very clean aftertaste. 

They do NOT skimp on the portions. I got the single and the ice cream overflowing out the cup was a understatement. 

Prices:
*Kids (single scoop -1 flavor): $2.25
*Single (1-2 flavors): $3.25
*double (2-3 flavors): $4.50

HS also sells goodies like frosted peanuts, bacon peanut brittle, and duck fat pecan pie. I'm all about flavor and texture combinations, so I can wait to come back and try these. 

With about 60 different ice cream flavors and 20 different sorbet flavors, it looks like I'll be having more 2000+ caloric dinners in The Mission....b/c what's another 300-400 calories right?!?!?
author: Cherylynn N.

description:
The flavors here are very unique. The server is super nice. He encouraged us to try as much flavor as we wanted.

Ice cream is a little icy rather than creamy. There was a bit too much salt in the ice cream. Sweet food should have a little bit of salt to enhance the flavor but there was just a little too much in the ice cream. But at least it wasn't too sweet like how a lot of ice creams can be. 

I like the Jesus juice, maple walnut, Vietnamese coffee.
author: Bobby C.

description: Friend told us we had to try the secret breakfast ice cream.  It was fantastic!!  Bourbon ice cream with corn flakes yum!
author: Denise T.

description:
This was the last spot my parents and I hit on my way home from San Francisco.  It was on the way south so why not? 

PARKING:
Ummm, so we didn't even park. My dad dropped off my mom and I and we rushed in to buy some ice cream.  But I'm sure as you know or heard, SF parking is quite difficult...

AMBIANCE:
It's pretty much next to a neighborhood, away from the hustle and bustle.  I don't know my SF geography but we weren't even sure if we were in the right place 'cause it was all houses and apartments.  It's a very tiny shop.  Very cute and looks like it has maybe 10 seats in it?

SERVICE:
They let you try their flavors.  The girl behind the ice cream counter was very nice and patient with us.  The flavors sounded intriguing so I sampled as many as I possibly could before deciding and she happily let me try as many as I wanted.

FOOD [or rather ICE CREAM]:
I ended up going with Oolong Tea as well as a scoop of Brown Butter.  The flavors were nice.  I love browned butter.  When  you melt butter and just let it cook until the water evaporates and the fats start caramelizing it smells very nutty and sweet.  Almost like butterscotch which is exactly what this ice cream tasted like.  Noms.  I also love tea flavored ice cream so oolong tea was right up my alley.

UNFORTUNATELY, the texture of the ice cream is what I didn't like so much.  It was icy.  I prefer my ice cream really creamy so wasn't a big fan of that.  But the flavors are interesting.  But there are just too many ice cream spots in SF, I definitely got to try them all!
author: Christopher C.

description: Didn't think it was anything special. It's on the icier side. Had the Vietnamese ice coffee one. Good but nothing amazing. Didn't think it really tasted like what it was supposed to be either. Just like coffee flavor with a fancier name.
author: Heejin L.

description:
Everyone is like this place is the shit. 

I'm really ok with my tub of Breyer's and Netflix but whatever.

First comment, this place REEKS. It smells so bad I had to have my brother order for me. No, I'm not pregnant. They should consider making waffles IN HOUSE to mask the odor of their ice cream.

I had the Second Breakfast. As I took a bite, I literally felt the cream glide on my tongue. My mouth had this residual stickiness which was really disconcerting but this sure as hell is no fat free ice cream.

It was ok. I literally couldn't jump on the OHMYGODMORE bandwagon because something was off. I'll give it another chance but still, not insanely delicious, not really my cup of ice cream and Bi-Rite is really close by people.
author: Radhika P.

description: Amazingly delicious!!!! My group had the chocolate sea salt, Harvey milk and graham, and the secret breakfast. They were all so tasty and unique. They are happy to give you samples until you find what you like :) Give it a try!
author: Kristi H.

description:
When even the 12 year old says the ice cream is too sweet, it is too sweet.

This is an interesting ice cream shop.  I love the unique flavors.  And I have an oddly mixed feeling towards the ambiance set up with odd, and slightly seedy decor (such as the rusted condom dispenser, sitting on the floor of the bathroom).


The line was humongous.  There was a lady who ordered $70 worth of ice cream and goodies in pints, but despite only have a few staff members, they kept the line moving.  They also let you sample as many as you want, since the flavors are unique, to say the least.

I got the Vietnamese coffee, which does taste like viet coffee with a lot of condensed milk.  It was over $3 for one scoop, which isn't cheap.  I liked the first few spoonfuls, but it got too sweet, after a while.  There is a self-serve water dispenser, but I didn't know if I trusted the cups.  

It is strange, because it definitely tailors to teens and young adults if you look at decor and choices in flavors (like Secret Breakfast, which tastes like bourbon and cornflakes), but the ice cream is sooo sweet, like it was intended for children.  

Overall, it was an experience worth having, but I don't think I would feel the desire to go again.
author: Karen K.

description:
Wow this little place has a lot of reviews.
Pretty limited selection of flavors the day we were there.  They are generous with samples - the salt and pepper was like nothing I've ever had before.
I settled on the black sesame for something different - it was good.
Liked the chocolate malt better.
Some of their other flavors listed on these reviews sound amazing to try but weren't there that day. 
For some interesting flavors and good quality, it's definitely worth a stop if in the area.
author: Alexandra C.

description: Fantastic ice cream! The texture and quality cannot be better. I had the milk and honey graham and the strawberries with marshmallow (that wasn't the actual name). This is my second favorite ice cream shop in the country behind Salt and Straw in Portland, OR
author: Andre L.

description: Had the  jalapeño cornbread and miso white peach which was both amazing but wish it was more spicy - new flavors are posted on twitter
author: Marie r.

description:
Great little ice cream joint!

My wife and I went there twice on our long weekend in San Fran. I wish this place was closer to home as it is some of the best ice cream we have both had. I want to take a ride here if your in San Fran, trust me!
author: Nick C.

description:
Some of the best you'll ever try. Hands down. 

This is my second trip up here. I forgot what I grabbed the first time and it was a long time ago so no recollection there. I knew this time I'd remember the goods. 

*_Lineup_*

+ Brown sugar fennel: at first that fennel drop kicks you in the nose. It's strong and it is making sure you notice it, but in a good way. After a while all I tasted was delicious brown sugar. My peeps said it was strong for them every time they tasted it, but it goes away after a while. Personally I want that potency 

+ Vietnamese coffee: need a boost? Get it in scoop form. It was like every bite was freshly brewed coffee. Strong dominant taste you will not forget. Really good.

+ Black sesame: not my personal favorite, but everyone else liked it. Texturally not my diggs. 

+Cinnamon: tastes like you bit into a big red. Well not that drastic, but you will feel that hint posted up on your uvula.
author: Imran H.

description:
No matter what the weather is like out, Humphry's is a must-have every time I'm visiting SF. I can always count on their friendly and helpful staff and yummy variety of flavors.  The Secret Breakfast is simply amazing!  I can't get enough of it.  What's better than bourbon infused vanilla bean ice cream mixed with bits of delicious caramelized cornflake cookies.  

I was just there this past weekend and  aside from a bowl of the Secret Breakfast, I had a scoop of their Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee and a scoop of the Salted Caramel with nibs.  Definitely satisfied my sweet tooth craving.

Can't wait to go back for another fix!!!  Humphry Slocombe never dissapoints!
author: Gina S.

description:
I LOVE LOVE LOVE this place. 

It's not remotely close to where I live, and if I have time and want ice cream, this is where I'm going.

The first time I went, I shared a scoop of the proscuitto...and I still talk about it three months later. It. blew. my. mind. My best friend and sister were equally blown away. It makes me sad this ice cream is on rotation and not there full-time...

The second time I went we ordered their famous, always on tap Secret Breakfast and the Black Sesame. Both, I thought, were delicious. 

Hands down, this is my favorite place for ice cream in SF...though I've only had bi-rite once...regardless, this place is a MUST!
author: Chloé M.

description: Excellent even in cold weather. Love the blue bottle coffee and pepper & mint chip flavor. Rich and smooth.
author: Rebecca C.

description:
Ice cream flavors= interesting. I love the dulce de leche and the vietnamese coffee flavors. I tried the balsalmic vinegar as well but it was a bit too tangy, and I had a hankering for olive oil and foccacio thereafter. lol  

Portions = generous, for a small single of two flavors...for $3.25, kewl!

Service = okay.  They could be a bit more friendly, but I'll just be happy that they did not spit in my ice cream.  

Cash only joint, so don't try anything stupid.
author: Fannie S.

description: Love the secret breakfast (whiskey and cornflakes) with bananas on top! Too bad the cashier looked liked someone just shot his puppy. He gave me a disdainful look when I asked what POG stood for (Passionfruit-Orange-Guava sorbet...save yourself some grief), and an even more unsavory glare when I asked for toppings. The other guy provided better service and seemed a little more pleasant to deal with. But alas, I'm not here for chit chat. We're here for the cream! And it is rich and delicious. If you love their ice cream, they sell pre-packed pints but it's pricey at $9.50 each. I always like to try a new flavor when I come in but the secret breakfast always wins out.
author: Aleyna S.

description:
There is a certain evil that lurks here.

In the heart, soul, and vibes that is such at Humphry Slocombe, and I invite the possession with open arms.  Secret Breakfast, I command you.

My fave combination as of late has been the Secret Breakfast and the Pink Apple Sorbet.  I've adopted this combination when I was in Nihon and while on the ferry, purchased a common summer dessert.  A cup of cherry flavored shaved ice, surrounding a scoop of vanilla ice cream.  Mixing something creamy with a scoop of sorbet has become somewhat of a habit for me.  Secret Breakfast is a lovely sweet scoop of Bourbon tinged cream, bursting with crunchy clusters of cornflakes.  Although I am quite the wimp when it comes to alcohol, there is something wicked about feeling slightly flushed after my usual scoop.  The Pink Apple has a mild sweet appley taste, but not too overly strong.  If anything, it provides cushion from my first taste of the Bourbon hitting home.

The mixtures create an interesting menu, such as the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee, Candied Ginger, Ancho Chocolate, and Pumpkin Five Spice.  In addition to the variety, I am very much into the modern take on 50's diner style.  The counter faces the windows and local passerby as one can swivel on the bright red diner stools.  Patient and helpful staff here as one continues with free samples and decisions to be made.

A local dessert stop, especially after consuming my spicy burrito from El Farolito just a few short blocks ahead.
author: Miika M.

description: How about a frozen stick of butter that completely coats your mouth with fat?! Not sure why this place has so many good reviews!
author: Linda M.

description:
wow

delicious

good ice cream

these are words that describe humphry slocombe

secret breakfast so good

order secret breakfast
author: Tristan A.

description:
Come on man, $4 for a sad little scoop of ice cream! I haven't been to Humphry's in a while and was disappointed to see the prices raised now to as much as a gallon of gas. 

But no lie, the ice-cream here is amazing. I recommend the Secret Breakfast, Harvey's Milk, Tahitian Vanilla, and Vietnamese coffee for those that like their desserts extra sweet and creamy. I usually get a double scoop in a cup and a cone on top for $6 and just split it with a friend. The staff are always friendly and patient. Definitely one of my favorite ice-cream spots.
author: Michael L.

description: The service here is really great and the guy who helped me was very kind. I dropped my ice cream on the floor by accident and he gave me a new one. I loved their jasmine lychee ice cream, it's light and very flavorful! Although some of their painting and hangings on the wall kind of creeped me out. It kind of reminded me of AHS.
author: JJ R.

description:
I have had their ice cream before but never at the actual place.  

it was good, I had the fluffernutter ice cream and it was tasty. I feel like i had a second flavor too, but perhaps i didn't because I can't for the life of me remember it.  Maybe balsamic caramel? However the most delicious thing was the cone.  It was just the right amount of sweet and crunchy.

I have to say, I am still partial to Bi-Rite, but that doesn't mean that I wouldn't return here if given the opportunity.
author: Lu E.

description: Everyone talks about the secret breakfast flavor so I tried a sample. I thought it was good, but too much bourbon flavor. I wouldn't want a whole cup or cone full of it. My favorite so far is the Toast & Jam, omg so good. It reminded of strawberry cheesecake ice cream and Momofuku cereal & milk ice cream combined. I just learned it was brown butter ice cream and anything with brown butter is heavenly. It's so weird that they don't have a sign in front of their store (or did I miss it?), but their ice cream is definitely one of the best in the city. I hope they have peanut butter curry next time- I really wanted to try it!
author: Stephanie G.

description:
My Answer- Secret Breakfast 
The Question- What is your all time favorite ice cream flavor? 

WOW. HOLY MOLY. AMAZEBALLS. EPIC. PHENOMENAL 

I'm not kidding you, as I took my first lick of Humphry Slocombe's Secret Breakfast ice cream all these words popped into my head. It blew me away. 
To be honest, Humphry Slocombe is not my overall favorite ice cream shop in the Bay area but as long as they offer their Secret Breakfast I will continue visiting them over and over again.  

Located in the Mission, Humphry Slocombe is a small, extremely popular ice cream parlor. What makes HS stand out is their creativity. Their creative flavors are bold and intense. You won't find normal vanilla, chocolate or strawberry here. On my most recent visit to SF I went to HS three times. I tried many of their flavors, all of which were really good. I think their ice creams are a bit denser than most I have tried but they're still pretty creamy. These are all the flavors I tried in my three visits;

Secret Breakfast- Bourbon & Cornflakes 
Peanut Butter Curry
5 Spice Pumpkin
Fluffernutter- PB & Marshmallow 
Cinnamon Brittle
Black Sesame
Jesus Juice- Red wind & Cola
Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee 
Coconut Ice Milk
Tahitian Vanilla
Brown Sugar Fennel 

Again, the Secret Breakfast was fantastic. You could taste the bourbon so much that I swore I was going to be drunk by the time I was finished with my scoop. It also had a somewhat caramel taste. I also loved the crispy corn flakes inside this ice cream too. My other favorites were the black sesame, PB curry and Jesus Juice, which also had a strong alcohol taste. HS also has some excellent toppings, like homemade mallow fluff, frosted peanuts, alcohol infused cherries, homemade butterscotch, etc. 

The three times I visited the lines were actually really short, which was surprising. The prices here are slightly high but the quality and intense flavors of their ice cream make up for the prices. The staff here are all super friendly and willing to let you try as many free samples as you'd like. Oh, and they now accept credit cards as a form of payment.  

If you haven't already been to Humphry Slocombe you need to, especially if you're an ice cream freak like me
author: Craig R.

description:
Humphrey's style is impetuous,
the parking is impregnable,
and service here atrocious.
I want your heart!
I want to eat your ice cream!
Praise be to Jesus Juice.

Apologies to Mike Tyson.
author: .Alan Y.

description:
I've been waiting for a long time to try this place and I finally had the chance to on Sunday night.  I got there a little before 9PM and the line had already formed out of the store.  I was amazed at the flavors available.  My intention was to try the Vietnamese coffee and secret breakfast, but when I read the menu, they had black sesame.   I had a sample of that and the brown butter.  Both were absolutely delicious!

I ended up getting a 2 scoop sundae with the Vietnamese coffee and black sesame with hot fudge, almond crunch and whipped cream.  The only complaint I had was that there was way too much whipped cream.  My sundae ended up being around $10.  I can't stress enough on how shady ice cream scoops are at these fancy ice creameries.  

Overall, the flavors are so delicious and worth the drive out from Concord, but I just wished the scoops were more generous given that I paid $10 for a 2 scoop sundae with 3 toppings.
author: Rachel L.

description: bomb dot com! this isn't your baskin robbins factory ice cream!
author: Mariangeles C.

description:
VIBE: Casual... long lines
WHY: Amazing flavors!

It is dangerous living by this delicious place.

Whenever I have guests in town, this place is a MUST! My personal favorite is the Vietnamese coffee, but the Secret Breakfast is also really good. These creams are RICH, so 1-scoop is normally enough for me. The Jesus Juice (wine) sorbet & butter beer (made with STOUT) are also popular with my friends...

Never been here? You're doing something wrong. They let you taste anything you want. Check it out!
author: Eve D.

description:
There's always a line out the door here, even when we visited in February, albeit on an unseasonably warm day. We were lucky to get seats at the counter.

We considered the Vietnamese coffee, which tasted like, well... coffee. Instead we opted for a few unusual flavors (which is basically the whole menu at Humphrey Slocombe): the famous Secret Breakfast (bourbon and cornflakes) and the Chocolate Smoked Sea Salt. The Secret Breakfast was very good, though my sample mostly consisted of a giant cornflake, and since we were sharing samples it was impossible to share. I know, #firstworldproblems. The Chocolate Smoked Sea Salt might have been better with less salt. It had really good chocolate flavor. My husband wished they'd just made chocolate and called it a day.

We weren't blown away but it was good.
author: Kathleen M.

description: What do you do to the Secret Breakfast!?!?!  This has been my favorite for years upon years. The corn flakes were all stuck together and eating them was like eating my way out of a cardboard box. The bourbon flavor was waaaay off and even tasted maple syrupy. I've had Secret Breakfast at least 50 times over the years. But something is off. Need some QA/QC.
author: brian p.

description:
There was a gelato shop in Reno that closed down after being open for only 4-5 months. It was disappointing because they were amazing, and they'd allow you to try as many as you'd like because the flavors were so crazy. 

The San Francisco version of this is two things: Bi-Rite Creamery and Humphrey Slocombe. Until last night I had only visited the former; my excursion in search of amazing coffee (Philz, duh), found me seeing HS on my map about a block away. Having always wanted to try it, I walked absentmindedly over to the shop and checked it out.

Chocolate with Smoked Sea Salt? Brown Sugar and Fennel? Peanut Butter Curry!? Color me crazy and call me Sally, this is fantastic! And they even have balsamic to top it off (which is amazing and everyone should try it sometime). I've tried their Secret Breakfast at Little Star months ago, and while impressed felt the need to broaden my ice cream horizons. 

My favorite is the Chocolate with Smoked Sea Salt - I bought a whole pint. I'm lactose intolerant, what the fuck am I doing?!

5 stars for nostalgia of the little gelato shop that couldn't.
author: Jaime L.

description: You absolutely can't go wrong with getting "secret breakfast" w/ their "bourbon caramel" sauce on top! Almost every visit to SF requires me to visit this place for my sweet tooth craving! I've even purchased a pint to take home with me to SJ! Good news: it didn't melt on the car ride home. Bad news: I ate it in 1 sitting the following day! Haha!
author: Kim C.

description: Loved the coffee flavor and the creamy/ milky texture! Good sized scoop for $4!
author: Shradha A.

description:
Rachael Ray would be so proud.   WHY?  They have OLIVE OIL ice cream.  

As a fan of E-V-O-O and my home girl, Rachael, Humphry Slocombe definitely made the Olive Oil ice cream YUM-O!  At first when you take a bite of the ice cream, you only taste the creamy base, but as you swallow it, the olive oil taste starts to emerge and leaves a nice aftertaste. 

Since a "single" can come with two flavors, my other flavor I chose was their signature Secret Breakfast: bourbon and corn flakes, which was absolutely lots of fun.  Strong bourbon flavor with crunchy clumps of breakfast-y goodness. 

The ice cream flavors that Humphry Slocombe present are so innovative, especially the Secret Breakfast -- it's definitely the ice cream of champions.
author: Calvin Y.

description:
Humphry Slocombe is at the [Saturday] Ferry Building Farmer's Market! I was so excited to see them as I was walking through the tents on tents of vendors. They we're only carrying 3 flavors for the day(http://www.yelp.com/us...); their famous Secret Breakfast, Chocolate with Smoked Salt, and a special... Butterbeer! Yes, Harry Potter inspired. My boyfriend and I sampled their oh-so-famous Secret Breakfast, and we were not fans... a concoction of bourbon and corn flakes, it was unique, but bourbon+ice cream... we'll pass. So we opted for the Butterbeer. They weren't doing any scoops, so we settled for their 1/2 pints - $5.

The Butterbeer was good, but nothing mind blowing. The texture though was what was really not to my liking... it was very chunky and inconsistent, kinda icy. I prefer my ice cream smooth and creamy, like Bi-Rite and Ici. Maybe if I happen to pass-by their brick&mortar location, I'll give them another try... but so far, I'm not impressed... Hate me as you will. x=
author: Lana N.

description: Great ice cream if you can get past the bitchy workers. While the ice cream was fantastic, the taste was spoiled by how rude the employees are. They seemed pissed off that I wanted to get an ice cream cone 15 minutes prior to closing, and would not let me sample any of the flavors because of the inconvenience I was causing them. It was enough to make me angry, and I don't know if I plan on going back let alone bring my friends and family there on a good night. Advice I would give Humphry Slocombe's store is add a secret ingredient to your work ethic; kindness.
author: Lisa K.

description:
I had high hope/expectation for this place. but it's just an Okay.

the salty chocolate was WAAYYYY TOOO salty. 
the blue bottle coffee and vanilla was pretty good. 

It's hard to find parking around that area.. and too out the way from city center. Don't think I will go back just for the blue bottle coffee.
author: Zee Z.

description: This is probably one of my favorite creamery in San Francisco! I love their Jasmine Lychee ice cream, it's so creamy and well balanced on the sweetness level. They fall on the pricier level, but it's worth it every once in a while :)
author: Mandy Z.

description: People have been raving to me about their ice cream and I finally got to try it. However, I was a little disappointed. I sampled secret breakfast, passion fruit milk chocolate and the blue bottle Vietnamese coffee flavors. The passion fruit milk chocolate was a little weird; both flavors were distinct but they didn't really complement each other. They seemed like two separate entities that I just happened to eat at the same time. I liked the blue bottle Vietnamese coffee flavor in that the coffee flavor doesn't taste artificial like some other brands but I wouldn't go there just to get this flavor.
