I was choosing between this and secrete breakfast and I ended up choosing secret breakfast and I don't know if that was the best choice. When I first tasted secret breakfast I liked it in that it was milky and the corn flakes contrasted the softness of the ice cream really well. A spoonful was good but a whole scoop of it was a bit much. The bourbon was a nice touch and gave the ice cream a unique flavor. I also didn't like how soft ice cream was. The softness made it almost as soft as soft serve which I'm not that big of a fan of. It melted really quickly and got pretty heavy towards the end.
author: Sharon C.

description: Wow. I want to go back!!! Jesus Juice Sorbet and Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee!!!!This is a small ice cream shop with friendly staff. They offer samples. Selections are limited but all are so delish. The Continental Hotel serves the Roasted Chocolate Sea Salt!
author: Lorene P.

description:
All I have to say is BLUE BOTTLE VIETNAMESE COFFEE. I will guarantee that you will be satisfy with that flavor if you just can't simply choose one. It's so good that I really have no words to describe it. Just get it. Please get it. Yeah, really. Do it. 

Customer service was really good. The line moved along really fast. My friend dropped her cone and the server was nice enough to give her another ice cream cone (with a cup just in case she dropped it again)  !  The portion size is also perfect because I was perfectly full. The only thing that made me sad was when I finished my cup of ice cream.......
author: Tram N.

description:
I sampled the vietnamese coffee, secret breakfast, and the harvey milk one. Idk why I went with the secret breakfast one (it was bourbon with corn flakes?) kinda weird but it was tasty! Something different but if I come here again, I'm getting the vietnamese coffee one. Also, people were unfriendly like would it hurt to smile you work at an ice cream shop!!! Which pretty much means you have to be happy at all times bc you have the access of ice cream.
In all honesty, next time I'm craving ice cream, I'm gonna go to smitten or bi-rite.
author: Erika P.

description: One of my favorite ice cream places in the city! Secret Breakfast and Vietnamese Coffee are amazing. Brown butter is also good. I don't like the more adventurous flavors (black sesame?!?! Fennel?!?! No thanks!). Service is always kind and patient since I try the new flavors but always order the same thing :)
author: Semuteh F.

description: I think the ice cream here is overrated. Doesn't compare to bi-rite creamery which is so much better. I ordered the vanilla ice cream here. It's too sweet for my looking and is not very smooth. Tried other flavours and felt they were too sweet and didn't have a unique flavor to it. Wouldn't come here again.
author: Qianqi L.

description: I had two scoops of the secret breakfast and blood orange. I was not surprised. It was boring, Nothing really special about the ice cream. Bi rite is the best!
author: Iris C.

description:
Was looking forward to this place because of the great reviews and everything and from arriving here the line was long. We seem to beat the rush every time and anywhere we go which is a good thing. Had to wait outside the place for no longer than 5 mins. They are nice and patient with you if you're a first timer and let you sample as much as you want. From the decor inside this place the thing that caught my eye was the 2 headed cow. Not sure if they use the dairy from 2 headed cows to give that extra flavoring a single headed cow can't give. Who knows. 

They did have some interesting flavors as well as names for them. The one name that got us rolling was the Jesus Juice. Not sure how to make out of that. I sampled the Bourbon which pretty much tasted like Bourbon! It wasn't that bad it was just a little too strong for me at the time. Ended up getting the Malted Milk Chocolate. It was pretty good. I need to try the other flavors to give it a better rating tho. Other than that I'm pretty sure alot of other people will tell me wrong and say this is the best place. I beg to differ.
author: Aryan O.

description: every morning,  these guys take at least 20min spraying down the side of the building and the sidewalk.  I wonder how much water they are wasting? the manager doesn't know about the drought in California?  they should be fined.  oh yeah.....and their icecream is over priced, over hyped... and is terrible.
author: justin h.

description:
"Where'd you eat today?"
"This ice cream place called Humphry Slo . . ugh . . Slauc . Slawcumbe?"

Try as I might, I could never remember how to pronounce that last name . . so I successfully looked an idiot to everyone of my friends I had the fortune of talking with that day. But after deciphering my words, most of my SF friends would grin, nod, and say "Niiiiice". It's actually a little disturbing the consistency of that particular response but I guess it goes to show the popularity of this place.

When all was tried and tasted, I felt like I was in limbo. It wasn't as much that the ice cream was really really good but more that there was just nothing really wrong with it. I tried the following three flavors:

1) Tahitian Vanilla: Always gotta try the vanilla and it was decent. The texture was very smooth and creamy but there were some ice crystals. The flavor was pretty good but for some reason, it tasted a little more like cereal milk, kind of like the kind they serve at Momofuku Milk but it was a little more subtle. Thought that was a little weird but again, the ice cream was pretty solid.

2) Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee: I gotta say I wasn't really a fan of the taste. The texture of this one was the best of the three I had but I guess I'm more of a classic coffee ice cream kind of guy. This tasted a little more exotic and the scent/taste held a little more in my nose than I wanted. 

3) Secret Breakfast: This was the one that my friend had recommended I try and you know what, I'm a fan. It took me probably until the last few bites but I was eventually turned. Again, the textures were pretty smooth and the bourbon plus the corn flakes is a very unique combo that surprisingly works. If you're gonna get one scoop, this one is probably the one to go with. Although, I guess if you're just visiting and eating this only once (like I was), spending the better part of your ice cream experience wondering whether you like or hate it is probably not time well spent...

Overall, it's definitely a place to visit. It's very unassuming with a little seating area. The people who work there were very friendly and allowed us to try whatever we liked. Like other reviews have stated, they do serve ice cream more on the innovative side so don't expect to order your classic cookies n' cream; you'll have no such luck at humphry slacostabich.
author: Alex S.

description:
I almost felt I didn't have to review this place but just came from a social gathering where two things struck me as wrong.

First, no one else in the group had ever heard of Humphry Slocombe (blasphemy!).

Second, everyone gasped when I recommended Secret Breakfast.

So just to heap more praise on this place. Yes it is the best. Their flavors range from the bizarre "who'd have thunk?" variety such as Cayenne Cantaloupe to the "Why isn't anyone else doing this?" like Fluffernutter. And of course, there's the delicious and ever faithful Bourbon and Corn Flakes Secret Breakfast. 

My only complaint is I often find myself craving it after it's already closed. So make sure to head over in time or just stock a pint in your freezer.
author: Stephen S.

description:
Just really not worth the wait.

Maybe I've been spoiled by living within walking distance from two of the best ice-cream places in Portland (Salt n Straw, Ruby Jewel), but I didn't think the variety or creativity of the flavors available put this establishment in the "must taste" category.  The line was exceptionally long, and the ice-cream was good but not amazing. 

I think Humphry's does itself a great deal of self-aggrandizement by calling their ice-cream combinations creative names, but ultimately even their most interesting flavors tasted kind of bland when I sampled them.

In the end, it was very hip, very happening, and the servers were beyond friendly, but the ice cream just didn't cut it.
author: Olivia O.

description: Interesting flavors like anchor steam cream and blue bottle coffee. Loved the coffee one with hot fudge. The service is great besides the "im bored and annoyed" look the workers kinda give off when you ask to taste a flavor. They don't have a really wide selection just about 8 or 10 flavors and no interesting toppings. I would prefer smitten ice cream over this place.
author: Esther S.

description:
We came here one warm Saturday afternoon for some yummy ice cream. I tried one that's vanilla-blueberryish, but ended up just getting a scoop of the Tahitian Vanilla. The ice cream was pretty good and more on the milky side (which I'm not a huge fan of). It was a bit expensive, but that's expected in SF :)

Would I come back? Maybe to try something new and different.
author: Shrina S.

description: Carla and I both indulged in the secret breakfast coke float. It was very tasty. I tried the Vietnamese coffee (can't remember the exact name) and that was great too. I will return soon to sample all of their flavors( I'm curious to taste the salt & pepper & government cheese flavors).
author: Court S.

description: So first of all of the only reason why we stopped here was because Mitchells ice cream line was super long and then we decided to go to Bite Rite creamery and it was also a long wait. The choice menu here is very limited, its way super expensive ($4.95 per scoop), it's salty, and boring. There's nothing interesting about this ice cream other than wondering why it has a 4 star*. I honestly would not recommend it to anyone that I know.
author: elia g.

description: Yummy ice cream to be sure, with whimsical toppings and sauces. I prefer bi rite but my husband swears this is the best ice cream place in town.
author: Dani T.

description: I'm not really an ice cream person, but I loved the ice cream here. friendly service, didn't rush me even though there is a line in back of me. once you get up to the counter, that's your time. they always ask if you want to sample the flavors. I would say 90% people does the sampling. I said nope and just got the blue bottle coffee and earl grey tea. great combo! flavors can sellout but can always buy the carton ones. their cone was crunchy good too.
author: Jules L.

description:
This place tries to do flavors that are off the beaten path, sometimes it works but most of the time the ice cream comes out mediocre. The Blue Bottle coffee is a little too strong for my taste, the "jesus juice" concoction doesn't remind me of ice cream at all and their Tahitian vanilla is pretty bland and unmemorable.

There are a lot of other ice cream places in the city that I would recommend, but you probably have already heard of them: Bi-rite, Mitchell's, Smitten, Mr & Mrs Misc. 

If you haven't tried this place, by all means go for it, you might like the unique flavors. I've came here three times now and each time I've walked away disappointed.
author: Kevin C.

description:
Yum, I'm a new fan of Humphry Slocombe Ice Cream.  They do not have any basic flavors but they think outside the box and create unique flavors.  This place reminds me of Ici in Berkeley, small shop with unique flavors.

I sampled the secret breakfast, blue bottle coffee, Harvey Milk and creamsicle.  In the secret breakfast you can really taste the bourbon in the ice cream and gives it a great taste.  The blue bottle coffee tastes delicious and has a great coffee taste without being too overpowering.  My girlfriend and I wasn't feeling either of those at the moment and ended up getting Harvey Milk and Creamsicle.  The Creamsicle tastes exactly like the ice cream bars and it brought me back to my childhood memories.  The Harveys Milk was my favorite out of the four that I sampled.  It was a honey ice cream with honey graham cracker.  It was a mild ice cream flavor and the honey graham cracker topped it off.

I believe this place is better than bi-rite and would recommend the Harveys Milk.
author: Steven L.

description:
Harvey's honey and milk graham cracker ice cream is crack! It's unbelievable! It tastes like honey ice cream with chunks of graham crackers throughout. Top it with almond crunch and you have heaven in a bowl!

I'm a little sad that it's not one of their regular flavors. BRING IT BACK, PLEASE? I'll buy a gallon if you do!

Humphry's is now my favorite ice cream place of the bay!
author: Jeanette Y.

description:
Folks, I was a non-believer, and I was wrong. 

I'd heard of the infamous "secret breakfast" (bourbon ice cream with cornflakes) and I was pretty uninterested. Though I have a deep abiding love for my clear hard alcohols -- gin, vodka, rum -- the darker stuff just never appealed. If I don't want it on the rocks, why would I want it in my ice cream? I was convinced people raved about it for their hipster cred and not because it actually tastes good. 

So I carefully, thoughtfully, and annoyingly sampled over half their flavors. And I can very certainly say that this is the best flavor humphry slocombe has to offer, and may be the best the rest of the world has too. It's so good, I drool as I type this. It's so good, I felt compelled to type out a full review on my PHONE. 

Go in. Try it. I cannot describe how good you will find it.
author: Claire G.

description:
Oh, allow me to expound on the goodness that is Secret Breakfast.  No, wait a minute, everyone else already has.  It's the bee's knees, folks.  Give it a whirl.

The only things preventing me from awarding a prestigious five-star rating are the cramped quarters and the speed of the line.
author: Erin V.

description: Holy crap on a cracker, this is so good! Tried Salt & Pepper at staff's suggestion, and ultimately decided on having more. Jesus Juice (red wine and cola), Secret Breakfast (corn flakes in Bourbon ice cream) and Brown Sugar & Fennel were also delicious. Great service, too!
author: Bonny A.

description: Holy crap - Elvis the Fat Years (banana bacon peanut brittle) and Secret Breakfast (bourbon milk and corn flakes). So happy this place is only blocks from my place!
author: Rachael S.

description:
yum! got a breakfast in two scoops :) secret breakfast + vietnamese coffee! The line took a while and the scoops were pretty pricey (I think 3.50 for a single and 4.25 or something for two scoops). 

The workers were nice and let me try almost all the flavors. The flavors are unique and tasty! I wish Jesus juice was there and some of their other flavors.
author: Avita S.

description:
I was really disappointed. The ice cream is too soft and icy. I tried the secret breakfast, harvey milk, and ordered the passionfruit sorbet, which was way too sweet. It's expensive and doesn't even taste great. 

I would pick Thrifty ice cream (Rite-Aid) and Bi-Rite over this any day. 

On the plus side, you get to sample a lot, and they have unique flavors. Unfortunately, it just doesn't taste good.
author: Maleenee B.

description: This place is one of my favorites in SF. I'm a huge ice cream fanatic and have high standards for good ice cream. Luckily, Humphry Slocombe meets that standard. With the variety of flavors and overall good taste, I am never disappointed coming here.
author: Lillian C.

description:
Some super duper weird flavors, its pretty much a hit or miss. But thank god they will let you try everything which will be a blessing and a curse.

Recommend: Secret Breakfast and Black Sesame seed

too weird for my own good: Salt and Pepper and Basil Lime

I think if you get a pint or some large quantity to-go they hook it up with free ice cream cones. That is surely awful nice of ya, ma'am! Thank ya!

ALWAYS A LINE. ALWAYS. EXPECT TO WAIT MINIMUM 45 MINUTES
author: Hazel K.

description:
Had the honey graham and fluffynutter, it hit the spot again.

Next, bourbon and sweet corn. Corn was eehhh but the bourbon, clearly my favorite. Had a taste of the prosciutto and not good.
author: Minh H.

description:
I'm still thinking about this place and it's been over a week. Good thing for my waist line you are all the way in SF.  I had the Secret Breakfast and the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee. 

I'm in love with the Secret Breakfast flavor ... bourbon and cornflakes.... i'm drooling thinking about it! I don't even remember the coffee what's it's name one. I wish I had got a double of the Secret Breakfast.  I got a sample of SB and at first taste the bourbon hits you in the face and I thought eww gross not getting that but then you get the cornflakes and somehow angels are singing and it somehow works and you forgot she slapped you in the face to begin with. I never thought I would like an alcohol based ice cream but this is good stuff! Ask for a sample, might not be for everyone... and if you don't like it we can't be friends on yelp cuz your taste buds are messed up ;) 

And they could use better cones... they are not sweet and/or buttery.
author: Lindsay C.

description:
I finally got to try Humphry Slocombe after a year of it being on my  bookmarks!

TLDR; The ice cream is delicious and the flavors are unique, but...I still slightly prefer Bi-Rite. 

I tried the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Iced Coffee, which was awesome. I love coffee ice creams and this specific flavor had been on my list. However, I think the scoops are pretty pricey and we were not allowed to split scoops! This made sampling more flavors hard - each scoop is a generous size, despite the hefty price tag, but I would've liked to be able to have two different flavors for that size (which some other parlors support, or else I wouldn't have been spoiled by this idea/feature!)
author: Jenny M.

description:
So my original opinion was that I wasn't a fan of their ice cream. The flavors were just too strong for me. That's my personal opinion. But I did give it another shot, and if I mix the secret breakfast with a scoop of their vanilla...It's not half bad!

Still it doesn't make the cut for my favorite ice cream spots, but if you like it then you like it. If not, no worries.
author: Kristen C.

description:
After our bacon maple debacle from Dynamo, we three set sail west in search of a secret breakfast. The line was lengthy, it was Saturday, and it was roasting...give me some damn ice cream! 

We approached the cobalt blue awning of Humphry Slocombe and cringed at the thought of standing in a line for an hour, but the line moved relatively quickly. It took almost no time to get near the door, so we could attempt to sneak a peak at the list of flavors on the chalkboard, although I already knew what I wanted.

Secret Breakfast.

That creamy, rich, intense Bourbon flavored mouthfeel, good balance of saltiness and those cornflakes that retain their crunch and makes your senses build sandcastles in a textural playground. It's almost like gelato, but, not. This was definitely an immediate mood improver for us three cranky broads, no one was speaking, but our bodies were doing little dances and laughter shortly ensued.

After comments about the Salt and Pepper tasting like a bag of Sea Salt and Pepper Kettle chips and the Balsamic Caramel tasting too vinegary, one of us three had the Tahitian Vanilla. It looked almost beige with tiny specks of vanilla bean running a'muck throughout, it had great flavor. It wasn't too sweet. The sugar cone was fantastic and never got soggy, I wonder if they make their own cones. And at under $3 per one kid's scoop, we came out about even with Dynamo, except this proved to have bestowed more merriment.
author: Illyanna M.

description: I can't even describe how good this place is. I've also been to Bi-Rite which is another high quality ice cream place. Like Bi-Rite, this place makes their own ice cream. To compare them though would be like comparing apples and oranges. I got the "Secret Breakfast" flavor which consists of vanilla ice cream infused with rum or  bourbon (I do not know my alcohol types). It is also mixed with corn flakes. I can't even describe how good it is. It is definitely something to experience. They also had some other good flavors too like the Vietnamese coffee. I will definitely come back!
author: Jonathan E.

description:
I was excited to try Humphrys since my friend mentioned that they have unique ice cream flavors. Since I'm allergic to dairy, I was hoping this meant unique sorbet flavor also. 

Unfortunate its not the case. The sorbets they offered were blood orange and coconut. Pretty standard sorbets. I tried both and they were excellent. But I was hoping for something more out of the ordinary. 

If your looking for sorbet go elsewhere
author: Mike K.

description:
Finally writing an a review after countless visits. Tonight we tried the Tahitian Vanilla - tastes good but since I bake with Tahitian vanilla I wasn't a fan. We decided to go with something different. 

The Salted Carmel w/ Cocoa nibs. If you like the combo of salty sweet and creamy this is the flavor for you. The cocoa nibs add a nice texture to the ice cream. If you let the ice cream melt I your mouth first and then eat the nib second. You can enjoy the natural cocoa taste - LOVE IT! 

During other visits we've had:

- Blue bottle Vietnamese  Coffee
- Secret Breakfast
- Butter Beer
- blood Orange Sorbet
author: Kristina S.

description:
I wanted to try something different from Bi-Rite so I came here. Peppercorns, potato chips and prosciutto? These are the flavors they serve here, so I was intrigued.

Flavors:
+ Cinnamon Brittle- SO SPICY! it was painful to finish my scoop of this by the end of it and I was forcing myself to enjoy it (should not happen with ice cream)
+ Secret Breakfast- too alcoholic tasting and not in a good way
+ Cucumber - should not be an ice cream flavor; it was horrible. it tasted like frozen cucumber water.
+ Sugar Fennel- one of the better ones I tried.

Service:
The guy behind the counter was very sweet and let us try as many flavors as we wanted. Can't complain about him.

Ambience:
Ok, so this place is tucked away in the mission with no big sign or anything. You just have to look up the address. They have a few stools inside and a little bench outside but not much seating. 

-Hungry Hungry Pongy
author: Sangita A.

description:
What everyone else said: Secret Breakfast.

Bourbon + cornflakes. Disgusting, right? Try it and you'll be a convert.

I also sampled the peanut butter + curry, which was tasty. However, I didn't see myself eating a whole scoop of ice cream with a dominating curry vibe to it.

The flavors are great, but I do have to say that the ice cream is VERY buttery, because it leaves an unpleasant residual substance coating the interior of your mouth when you're through devouring your scoop. Didn't enjoy that aftertaste very much.

P.S. The line seems daunting, but it moves quickly. We got in within 35 mins or so on a warm weekend afternoon, which wasn't too terrible.
author: Mansi A.

description: One of the best ice cream shop in the city!  They had special flavored ice creams.  I got to sample many of the flavors and I like Vietnamese coffee and the oolong tea flavor the best.  The line goes by fast so don't get intimidated by it.  Parking wasn't bad either on the weekend.
author: Len L.

description: Just had a nephew fly in for a few days from back East, and his girlfriend from Paris.  Although cold, I sent them to here to have some of the unusual flavors - and they loved it!  Thanks for helping to make their experience here so great - keep up the great flavors!
author: Matilda R.

description: Delicious! Super cute place with a wide variety of cool flavors. There's not much seating inside but we enjoyed our ice cream outside and it was perfect. Would definitely recommend a stop after dinner one night!
author: Kathleen G.

description:
Contrary to what I pictured, this famed ice creamery is nameless on the outside... marked only by the long line that flows out onto the street. Brave the line, and a trophy mounted two-headed calf will watch over you as you taste samples and painstakingly pine over which flavors you should choose.

And you shall decide wisely, because their flavors are wildly imaginative and rotate on a near daily basis! We went with their 2 staples-- the Secret Breakfast made with bourbon & corn flakes is legendary, and the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee is out of control. 

You don't come to Humphry Slocombe for any ordinary ice cream... nope, according to their twitter, you come to Humphry Slocombe for ice cream with ATTITUDE! so LICK THAT!
author: Nicole C.

description:
Flavors rotate regularly here. Peanut Brittle ultra sweet, but so damn good. Hot Banana is the funky one... the banana is so strong and seems artificial (staff please confirm) and it's also made with Atomic Fireballs (assumingly). Remember those?? My favorite is the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee. If you know me and my reviews on gourmet ice cream shops, then you know I'm a coffee ice cream snob. I love this one. And the specs of coffee tops it off.

It's a small quaint spot. The line is typically out the door, but don't let that deter you. The shop only fits 5 people or so and the line moves quickly. The staff has always been really nice and patient when trying each of their very unique, mouthwatering flavors. YUM!
author: Camille R.

description: We made it here about 15 mins before they closed and we didnt wait in line at all. I had their ice cream already during my trip in the Ferry Building so I knew what I was getting into! It is a expensive for ice cream but it is really good and is definitely better then the famous Bi-Rite Creamery. I own their book and all of the ice is in there - including the Secret Breakfast!
author: Vanessa M.

description:
When it comes to "gourmet, designer" Ice Cream shops in San Francisco, there are two that stand out. You may think they are similar, but they are completely different.  

First there is Bi-Rite. It is like the city slicker of the two, with it's ever changing, dynamic flavors, diverse ingredients like the demographics of New York City, near the large city park and public transit station, with it's androgenous sounding name. It is crowded with 4,000 yelp reviews.

Then there is the country bumpkin, Humphrey Slocombe. The name sounds a bit hick, hayseed like, or like he is wearing a straw hat, sear-sucker suit, suspenders and a bow tie. 

The flavors are less changing, with some that are always on the menu, like Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee and Secret Breakfast. Nothing like sweet cornflakes and a shot of Bourbon(Secret Breakfast), always available like a mix of fresh corn squeezin's from the backyard still. 

Humphrey is sweet, like a syrupy southern drawl that charms and compliments you with its thick sugary accent. Less people down here in the country part of the Mission, but there are stools inside to sit on, just like at the old local barber shop. Less city crowds down here, with less than 1,800 reviews on Yelp. A little more rural, but still good. 

Don't underestimate Humphrey Slocombe just because it has a name like
Humphrey Slocombe.
author: Wanugee N.

description: This is some of the best ice cream I have ever tasted. Even the vanilla is a revelation. Definitely recommend the bourbon caramel sauce on everything. Best sorbet I have ever had. Incredible.
author: Jyoti G.

description: This place is an absolute must when I go to San Francisco! The Secret Breakfast is the best.
author: Romey F.

description:
Besides the fact that I was pooped on by a bird here AND a creepy old Russian man hit on me here... I have nothing but the best to say about Humphrey Slocombe!!

I had the black sesame (kind of boring of me) and my friend had the secret breakfast. I really enjoyed my black sesame. I thought it was really tasty and the flavors were really apparent. The secret breakfast was VERY bourbon-ey, which wasn't really my cup of my tea by friend seemed to like it!

I want to try more of their flavors! I'll have to come back soon. Next time let's hope I'm not sh*t on and hit on.
author: Jade R.

description: This place is amazing! I LOVE all their unique ice cream flavors. My favorite is their Secret Breakfast (bourbon + cornflakes) ice cream. Great texture and flavor!
author: Annie L.

description:
Humphry Slocombe is my absolute favourite Bay Area ice cream shop!! (And for reference-sake, I've tried Mr & Mrs Misc., Tara's, Ici, & Mitchell's to name a few)

The flavours here are quite unique, come in generous portions, and just downright delicious! I do admit, it took a couple visits to make a believer out of me, but I cannot stop raving about their ice cream! The texture is creamy without being overly soft. So perfect!

My favourite flavours:
****Secret Breakfast: Bourbon & cornflakes! This is one of my favourite ice cream flavours now! However, it was a little much when I first tried it (that bourbon, woooh). The cornflakes are also the perfect crunchy texture! 

****Harvey Milk: Honey & cinnamon: two of my favourite things. This flavour is a really delicious one for those who don't want to venture too far off the conventional path. 

****Toast&Jam: A new flavour as an homage to their original famous breakfast ice cream! Brown butter ice cream with jam. Surprisingly tasty! 

****Vietnamese Coffee: Classic!

Definitely sample a few flavours before you decide. I was super excited to try their Jesus Juice (bambus, mmmmm), but I found it to be oddly sweet and syrupy tasting. With an ever-changing menu, you're bound to find something you like!
author: Stephanie W.

description: Best ice cream in the city and shortest line! Secret breakfast (Bourbon and cereal flakes) and toast & jam are my current favorites but it's ice cream so you obviously can't go wrong :-) oh and you can sample before you buy. What's not to love?
author: Andrew S.

description:
When you spot the magical two headed cow, you'll know you're at the right place.

Go straight for the Secret Breakfast; whoever decided that corn flakes and bourbon need to go together is a genius. If you like crunchy things in your ice cream, you can also try the Harvey Milk & Honey (ha ha), which has bits of GRAHAM CRACKERS! Yum!

I'm not going to say that Humphry Slocombe is better or worse than Bi-Rite; I think that both of their approaches to ice cream making are fundamentally different. Both of them are delicious, albeit in different ways, so do yourself a favor and try both!

They use Square card readers to take both credit and debit. You may have to wander around a bit to find street parking. If venturing out late in the night, hit up the Mexican joints in the area for some taco action!!
author: Hanui C.

description:
Yes, it's true. It lives up to the hype.

I haven't had a single scoop of bad ice cream here. It's also super reasonable. $5 for 3 scoops. We are talking about fresh made from scratch ice cream. 

My faves: secret breakfast and peanut butter curry.

Parking can be a b-word but be persistent and go during odd hours to avoid the lines.

Super awesome. Super good. GO!
author: Andy W.

description:
Unique flavors that are made in house and changes regularly? yum!
Their Secret Breakfast tops my list so far as my favorite in their wide array of flavors.

+ unique flavors
+changes in menu
+opens late
-The place is tiny though, but they do have tables outside
author: Bobby L.

description:
I went here with my brother had a double scoop but thought it too sweet. Most of the flavors on the board were not there when we were at the store. The location we went to was in the Mission.

The place: not very big, had some seats along the windows

Flavors tried:
Harvey Milk 
Blue bottle Coffee
author: Irene L.

description:
One of my favorite ice cream places because of the awesome flavors. They definitely have some misses - such as the Thai Chili Lime, which tastes like Body Odor. But that's part of the creative fun, just like Bertie Bott's Every Flavor Jelly Beans!  They have Butter Beer ice cream, by the way, which is divine, along with Secret Breakfast. Originally, I was not a sorbet fan, but the intriguing flavors actually made me spend money on SORBET. Fancy that! My favorite was Peach Sake, although Jesus Juice (red wine + coke) was interesting as well. Their stout and ale ice creams are also worth a try. 

I realize that every flavor I spoke favorably of involved alcohol of some sort, but that does not make me a raging alcoholic. Nope. 

Prices are reasonable - $3.75 for two scoops! considering lots of novelty ice cream places charge $3.25 and upwards for one tiny scoop, they definitely give you a substantial amount. You will feel full since the ice cream is so rich, and this is coming from a girl who routinely eats half a gallon of ice cream in one sitting.
author: Alice L.

description: Picked up a pint of Secret Breakfast from here, and it was icy with soggy cornflakes. Wrote to HS and never heard back.
author: Tim C.

description:
I heard that this place was supposedly better than Bi-Rite so my friends and I wanted to give it a try.

We came here and I got a scoop of the Secret breakfast and the Blue bottle Vietnamese coffee. The secret breakfast was a bit to strong for me, but I liked the coffee flavor. Overall, all my friends agreed that Bi-Rite is better and creamier

I do like that they have different and unique flavors here. Its something different...
author: Phuong K.

description:
***Humphry Slocombe features very unique ice cream flavors; while I couldn't find a flavor I loved in the few samples I tried, there might be some good options here; that being said, I prefer Bi-Rite's ice cream (especially when it comes to texture)***

Humphry Slocombe is not that close to Bi-Rite Creamery and I found that out after walking from Bi-Rite Creamery to Humphry Slocombe.  While they are not next to each other, these two ice cream parlors are similar in how they showcase gourmet ice creams.  Humphry Slocombe though features more unique flavors.

I tried a few flavors, but I wasn't a big fan of really any of them.  The Secret Breakfast (at least my sample) seemed to be all Corn Flakes though it did make Corn Flakes taste surprisingly sweet.  The Tahitian Vanilla was just okay.

I finally opted for the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee.  I've only had Vietnamese coffee once, but the flavor here tasted just like it.  The coffee flavor was quite strong, but after my first spoonful, the flavor got less intense.  I liked the coffee flavor, but I wasn't the biggest fan of the texture.  The texture was quite bumpy and not that smooth.  Also, it was icier than I was expecting.

Service was just okay.  Prices seemed decent.  While the scoop was small, I felt the prices here were cheaper than many of Los Angeles' gourmet ice cream parlors.

I would give Humphry Slocombe another shot (especially since so many of their other flavors, if available, might be more to my liking).  Still, based on this one experience, I would definitely opt for Bi-Rite Creamery over Humphry Slocombe if I could only pick one.

Street parking is available and I do not think it as difficult to find street parking around Humphry Slocombe as it is around Bi-Rite Creamery.
author: Anthony N.

description:
Humphry Slocombe has some really interesting flavors-probably the most interesting I've seen so far! When I first tried it on a cold day (er, a normal day in SF), there was no one else in the store, so I took the liberty of sampling nearly everything on offer that day. The guy behind the counter let me indulge and didn't seem annoyed at all (always a good thing).

The secret breakfast was interesting, vietnamese coffee was good, and I eventually settled on the pink apple ice since I already had ice cream from 2 places earlier in the day (hey, don't judge me!). The pink apple actually tasted better to me when I'd only had a sample... the more I ate the more I thought it was just okay. It may have been ice cream fatigue--highly doubtful, because I can never have too much ice cream--but I think I was more impressed by the variety and unique flavors than I was with how everything actually tasted. 

I think it's worth a try though... you might find that hidden gem of an ice cream in here, and there's something for [almost] everyone!
author: Lily C.

description:
After several trips to Bi-Rite, finally made my first trip to Humphry Slocumbe to sample their Willy Wonka-like ice cream concoctions.  Whereas Bi-Rite takes the familiar and elevates it to new heights (salted caramel, balsamic strawberry), Humphrey Slocombe turns flavor combinations on its head with a unique base flavor (cantaloupe) with the occasional secondary twist  (cayenne pepper).  Based on their website, they seem to rotate their long list of flavors fairly regularly while retaining a few of their staples.  No first visit would be acceptable without getting their trademark Secret Breakfast.  

Taking my first bite, the bourbon flavor immediately cuts through the cold sweet vanilla cream and the crunch from the cornflake nuggets along with additional notes of sweetness took me back towards my childhood self eating a bowl of frosted flakes as well as transforming me towards future gray-haired self sipping Jim Beam on the rocks on a leather chair.  How often can food be simultaneously nostalgic and anticipatory (is there an antonym for nostalgic?).   

Random sidenote:  As I was outside allowing Secret Breakfast to bend my own personal time-space continuum, I watched a cute little girl with her dad come out of the shop and her scoop fell out of the cone and onto the sidewalk.  We all stared at that lonely scoop melting away on the sidewalk and I think tears were welling up in her eyes .  I would have had to deduct a minimum of two stars had they been heartless not to give a complementary scoop but they not only did so, they also allowed her to keep her original cone so she had her ice cream along with two sugary cones!
author: Christopher S.

description:
I had their "Secret Breakfast." Initially, I asked for a sample of it and THAT was killer. So killer, that I ended up getting a scoop of it. I'm not weak when it comes to alcohol by any means, but for some reason, each spoonful I had of this flavor left me increasingly unsatisfied. The taste of alcohol was strong, so if you're into that, by all means this is a winner. The cereal is a good complement to the strong bourbon taste,  but just a personal opinion that it was a little too much on the overwhelming side for me.

Oh yeah, for some strange reason, my tongue went numb for about 30 minutes post-ice cream. I thought that was strange.

I tried some of the other flavors, none of which I cared for.
author: Zo T.

description:
2 sentence review: H.S.I.C you did not disappoint! Try their flagship secret breakfast and yelp your opinion.

Extended Review:

Recently, I've decided to go on this crazy ice cream adventure to try each place in SF worth trying. So, I gathered up some cousins and took a trip to Humphy Slocombe. I'm always scared to try a place which such good reviews. It's one thing to stumble across a place and think nothing of it versus making a trip solely for the ice cream and being disappointed. Please don't disappoint me!

First sign of good things: I found parking across the street right away. The area has more places to try than parking spots available. The fact that it was not even an issue on this trip was awesome. 

Second sign: Short line, started inside the building right by the ice creams. Later on other people were not so lucky.

Third sign: 2 VERY HELPFUL Humphry Slocombologists behind the counter. I've read some reviews that said they were welcomed by unfriendly staff, but this was not the case!

Enough with the signs! Talk about the secret breakfast and anything else you got. 

Although I've heard about the Secret Breakfast, I didn't know what goes into it. I was surprised by the bourbon, didn't see that coming!  didn't mind it at all. It tasted like breakfast from the corn flakes and then the bourbon hits right after. It gave the ice cream character and made it more than just a sweet flavor. Everyone will have their own opinion but thumbs up from this guy!

They find fun little names for their flavors. It gives the ice cream some pizazz to match the creativity and ingredients that goes into creating it.

Other flavors: The salted dulche de leche was good, near the end it tasted a bit too sweet, but it was good. I had a bite of some Jesus Juice and Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee and they both tasted great as well. Someone else in our group also got the apple coded bacon and liked it. I wish I could give my opnion but it was finished so fast I didn't get a chance to ask for a bite! I guess thats telling enough?

Size: like most ice cream places don't expect a buffet line/costco scoop. That being said I found myself more than satisfied with two scoops.

There are a few seats inside and out. My abacus app wasn't working but it looked like 10-15, something around there. 

It is somewhat easy to get lost. It's right on the corner but there is no sign on the window or wall. There is a VERY SMALL fold up sign that they put on the corner. It's probably 2 feet tall and only seen by pedestrians. If you are driving you just need to know 24th and Harrison. It will be right there on the corner.

Next time I will go A) out of my way to get some, B) only when I'm already in the area, C) never Ill go somewhere else? ANSWER: Definitely would go out of my way to make a trip to come here.  Thank you for not disappointing!
author: Glenn M.

description: An ice cream shop with unique flavors, count me in. Truly my favorite ice cream shop in the city and no one else can compare. My favorite flavor and probably the most popular; the secret breakfast, a perfect blend of bourbon and corn flakes to give it that crunch that I love. Another favorite of mine is; jesus juice, a blend of red wine and coke. The ice cream flavors here are always changing so its always a thrill to make a trip and find another new flavor that I'll really like. Sure Humphrey's might have a bit of line, but it's no surprise given that they have plenty of outrageous flavors that generate a lot of curiosities. Still its worth the wait.
author: Limuel G.

description:
How have I NOT reviewed Humphry Slocombe Ice Cream yet???

This place is a gold mine for eclectic flavor combinations and tasty ice cream! As ice creameries go, Humphry Slocombe has extremely dense flavors, not skimping on any ingredients, and not going all dainty and delicate like many "fine ice creameries." If you're expecting it to taste like red wine, you got it. Vietnamese coffee? Oh yes!

My go-to flavors are the Secret Breakfast and the Jesus Juice. Pretty much two of their post popular flavors, and for good reason! Numerous others are really tasty, with too many to name!

Another memorable order was their St. Patrick's Day themed sunday! A scoop of Guinness ice cream, a scoop of Harp Lager ice cream, topped with Bailey's Irish Cream cream and Lucky Charms cereal! So tasty, and you can definitely taste the beers and liquor!

I'm a fan! Definitely not too far from the BART station, so if you ever find yourself in the Mission, stop by for some ice cream! :P
author: Kevin J.

description:
Four solid stars because I'm sort of a sucker for:

1. Adorable business names (what's a humphry slocombe anyways?).
2. Friendly staff that let me sample flavors to my sweet tooth's content.
3. Flavors that support local businesses-- a flavor based off Blue Bottle coffee! Ok, I'm a sucker for coffee flavors in general-- especially bay area brands:)
4. Ice cream parlors that make their own ice cream.
5. NO CREDIT CARD MINIMUM!! WHAT UP. :]
author: Sharon J.

description: The ice cream is overly sweet that it's overkill. The ice cream is good when you take the first few bites, but before I was even half done, it was hard for me to keep going. The sugar lingers and builds up in your mouth that you need to wash it own with water before you take another lick or else it'll be overpowering. The flavors are unique, but if I can't finish one scoop of an ice cream, I can't deem this ice cream to be good.
author: Jennifer H.

description:
Humpty dumpty, humpty dumpty, 
waiting in line like an ADHD crack baby singin' toons,  
this that ice cream that will make you scream, 
this that ice cream that will make your girl's panties cream, 
want plain vanilla, head back out the mission, pun intended, 
this that malted vanilla, sugar love flow,  
this that tahitian vanilla, freaky deaky lovin', 
scandalous, this that bb vietnamese coffee,
this is the party, saturday night fever, Jesus juice, 
and the morning after, secret breakfast, 
flavors astronomical, names très original, 
half-amazing, half-phenomenal, two headed mascot, 
bring home the party, 1/2 pint hopscotch
author: Roy C.

description:
This is my #2 spot for Ice Cream in SF.

I love harvey milk and graham.  Please have it everyday!

I usually do not get toppings but I love the frosted almonds... ADD TO EVERYTHING!!!
author: Anne-Mary P.

description: Best ice cream shop I've ever been to. I try to go whenever I visit. I liked it so much I bought their cookbook and have tried several recipes. My favorite is the blue bottle, secret breakfast, and now the orange dreamcicle (I forget the name). Just go there, now!
author: Stephanie C.

description:
Nighttime visits to the ice cream shop are always fun. A line up out the door, a good sign of good ice cream. 

Upon entering, the menu of flavours is up on the wall. Carrot mango sorbet, brown sugar fennel, Harvey milk & honey....so many flavours, what to choose?

Upon sampling different ones, my final decision was the Oolong tea and Blue Bottle Vietnamese coffee. Oh yes, coffee and tea, in purest ice cream form. The Oolong tea was amazing, smooth, fragrant tea and just the right amount of sweetness. Of course, the Blue Bottle coffee one was also just as good, with a hint of bitterness, this complemented the tea just right. 

Seriously loving ice cream places with unique flavours!!
author: Vincci L.

description:
My go-to spot in the entire Bay Area for unique, tasty ice cream, and probably the only frozen dessert shop I can claim to visit with any sort of frequency. And while I can't claim to have met any witches here like I have at Mitchell's, I HAVE run into several CEOs for local startups here before!

Carrying about 12-16 flavors at any one time, they rotate through a much larger list, though some flavors stay on between rotations. One of these permanent flavors, and my personal favorite, is their secret breakfast: bourbon and cornflakes. Sounds weird? Yeah, it did to me too, but it's full of awesome. If you don't mind the (light) flavor of bourbon, give it a try. Really. Your taste buds will thank you. 

Another equally amazing, but less seen flavor, is their milk and graham crackers - try it if they have it. Of course, with all their experimental flavors, there are definitely some misses (or just flavors for very specific palates), like salt and pepper. That's just weird, yo (but yes, I still tried it, because it was so weird - it tastes exactly like you'd imagine).

Texture differs a bit between flavors, depending on the makeup of the ice cream, but, for the most part, their ice cream falls a bit more on the creamy and slightly airy side. This is the only thing that prevents them from being a full five stars for me, as I prefer mine a bit denser than what I can find here. 

If you don't mind sharing with your friends, I recommend getting something with more scoops to share - definitely a lot more cost effective ($5 for three scoops versus $2.75 for one)! These guys also use Square, so credit cards are a-okay (for those who aren't familiar with the product, it basically makes credit card processing much more affordable for small mom and pop type shops like these guys). For those with a preference for more traditional flavors of the rich and dense variety, you may be better served at Bi-rite: just as tasty, but I find myself here more often simply for their intriguing flavor varieties.
author: Johnny W.

description:
Dear Matthew,
When I walked into Solcombe tonight, I thought I was just getting ice cream. Instead, you made my taste buds sing. When I asked to try Brown Buttah, you asked if I wanted my mind blown. I'm so glad I said yes. 

An ice cream tasting like never before ensued. There was laughing, tasting, great conversation, and I definitely made a love connection with every flavor you had me try. 

Every fiber of my ice cream-loving being wishes that I lived in San Francisco. Matthew, I will be back for another tasting soon. 

Until we meet again...
author: Ashley M.

description:
Ive been a fan since the beginning of this place, but tonight the taste I left with was far from sweet. 

I have worked in the customer service industry for long enough to know the customer isn't always right , they can be some what indecisive and perhaps even a little picky, especially when it comes to choosing the right ice cream flavor in such an artisanal shop. 

But to have some one rude, condescending and robotic working behind the counter is just plan wrong for such an amazing place. Come on now Brendan, your job is to helpful,  perhaps be nice and even like what you are doing.  I mean you chose this job in the first place.

I choose to my local ice cream shop to have something fun interesting and to support the little guy. Not to  have eyes rolled at me or to be told no to my simple requests.
author: Vannessa G.

description:
Accessibility (Parking / Wait Time)

0/1 Star: Parking is very hard to find and there is normally a line out the door.
_____

Service (Waiter / Cleanness / Ambiance)

1/1 Star: They are really nice and let you try as many of their unique flavors as you dare to taste.
_____

Taste (0=Not Edible / 1=Edible / 2=Good (average) / 3=Must Try!)

3/3 Stars: The flavors are a hit or miss.  If it's a hit it's a MUST TRY! I love the Harvey Milk & Honey Gram flavor, but it's not very often that they have it.  If it's a miss your going to wish you never tried it or even spit it out.
_____


Overall Experience
4/5 Stars 

_____

Pictures


_____

Last Words

If your hesitant about trying a weird flavor that you don't think your going to like, DON'T TRY IT! It will probably end up becoming a bad experience.
author: Elliott N.

description:
Our friends introduced us to this place when we first moved to the bay! Quirky, creative, and damn tasty! Love it. Now whenever someone new comes to visit the bay we always take them here.

Recommendations: Jesus Juice and an old time favorite secret breakfast, maybe not together but okay if you like that combo.
author: Michelle C.

description:
Did someone say bourbon for breakfast? Say no more. The ice cream is deliciously flavored with crunch corn flake chocolate nuggets. (Although it is kid-friendly, since there is no alcohol in the ice cream.) Had to try the secret breakfast float, two scoops of bourbon cream with coke and caramel sauce- they give you straws but really you need a spoon to get the syrupy thickness out of the glass. Dodge the long lines by going on a off beat time and get a satisfying scoop.
They're still a small operation with the ipad credit card swipe (which means no printed receipt). Hopefully you biked there, cause parking in the mission takes talent.
author: Naomi K.

description: Very Good Ice Cream.  Right up there with Salt and Straw in Portland.  Saw their "cart" at the Ferry Terminal, spoke with the gals there and got a good vibe from them.  I went to their store to try their "Secret Breakfest" flavor after our dinner at Martain Yang's M.Y.China.  Love the funky neighborhood and the decor.  Did not realize their logo is a two headed cow until I saw the logo mounted on the wall in their shop...so funny.  I wish their soon to be open shop at the Ferry Building be just as successful.
author: Bob H.

description: Another great ice cream place! I got the black sesame, jesus juice (coke and wine flavor) and secret breakfast (bourbon and cornflakes). Creamy ice cream and it was so good, especially the secret breakfast! I am so glad they are opening a new store in the Ferry Building that's close to me!
author: Kristy K.

description: Joy of joys! "Fancy" ice cream is one of my hedonistic vices, and Humphry Slocombe really perpetuates these desires for food pleasure. Every time I go, I am blown away by the flavors. There's usually a line, but it moves pretty fast  -- especially on weekdays. I am a big fan of their Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee and Secret Breakfast ice creams. Rich, creamy, slightly sweet, and in the case of the Secret Breakfast ice cream, a texture paradise! Those corn flakes and bourbon flavors -- ooof! Their Maple Pecan and Brown Butter flavors are also on point. Aside from the ice cream, I really love that the store is named after one of my favorite "Britcoms" -- "Are You Being Served?" When I first saw the name, I thought, "Noooo... Is this like that show?" I met one of the founders recently in the shop and had to get this confirmed. He said it was indeed paying homage to Mrs. Slocombe and Mr. Humphries. Hearing that made me love this place more. (If you haven't seen an episode. You must. It's tawdry, "lowbrow" 1970s British humor. A cult classic!) Anyway, back to their product, it's tasty and a delight for an afternoon snack or dessert. Check it out!
author: James Z.

description:
Dropping in with a friend, I ended up getting a cup of the bourbon ice cream and man, was I not disappointed.

The service was quick and patient (just what you need in an ice cream eatery) and I wanted to go back for a second cup.

Yum
author: Meg T.

description:
Absolutely delicious! If I remember correctly, it's about 4 sorbet & 8 ice cream flavors. I tried the Blue Bottle Viennese Coffee and Cinnamon Brittle ice cream. Very creamy and the flavors and sweetness level are just on point. 

Notable: Jesus Juice (red wine & coca-cola) sorbet- sounds intriguing :)
author: Joanna H.

description:
Hands down one of best ice cream I've ever tried. Since the flavors change so often, it takes a definite victory of the notorious Bi-Rite. 

Came here on a full stomach and still managed to swallow down two scoops of ice cream because that's just how good it was. We sampled a few flavors but ended up getting the infamous Secret Breakfast and my favorite, the Black Sesame. I've actually been searching for a good black sesame ice cream other than the Japanese grocery market brand, and this here is no joke. SO GOOD. It's not too strong on the sesame flavor but just enough. But personally since I LOVE the sesame flavor in all food, I would have wished for more but it does the job. On the other hand, the Secret Breakfast was amazing as well. With hints of bourbon and cereal flakes, it almost taste like the cereal ice cream from momofuku but with a mean twist. 

The staffs were great and they take card with no minimum! Definitely will be coming back here in the near future. Thank you for making jaw-dropping ice cream Humphrey Slocombe!
author: Luby H.

description:
Humphry's just didn't stand out to me. I told myself to get excited, but flavor concoctions ended up sounding better than they tasted. Blue Bottle Viet Coffee was on point with its intentions, but at the end of the day coffee ice cream is still just coffee ice cream. Texture and consistency was also rather icier than I prefer. 

Plus I couldn't hang with the taxidermy two headed cow. Hey, I tried.
author: Julia C.

description: This place drew us in because of the interesting flavors: Salt & Pepper, Black Sesame, Cinnamon Brittle and Secret Breakfast.  S&P would be a pretty good mix with CB which was a touch sweet.  If you like bourbon, you'll love SB and the same for BS.  Overall we really liked this place. The only drawback is the massive lines.
author: Allen C.

description: I'm an average animal in that I prefer a simple ice cream flavor such as vanilla and Humphry Slocombe's Vanilla ice cream is phuqin amazing!
author: Jan P.

description:
I'm a hypocrite. I'm the one who whines incessantly when the skinny white girl in front of me at Bi-Rite Creamery dares to have samplings of six flavors of ice cream much to the consternation of those waiting behind her. I'm the one who murmurs "anorexic bitch" while she licks her little spoonettes and drops them one by one in the "dirty" tin. I'm the one who hands her a medic alert bracelet so she can let others know that she has a problem. 

That problem would be self-absorption bordering on psychotic hubris. Yet, here I am at Humphry Slocombe on what I assume to be an atypically slow evening, and instead of asking about the state of their quaint business or the genesis of their obscure name, I keep asking for one sample after another of their strangely alluring flavors - salted licorice, McEvoy olive oil, balsamic caramel, Valrhona fudgsicle, secret breakfast. My God, I am a skinny white bitch. Someone stop me. Jamie W. had to have me sedated by pointing to the $6 bag of bacon peanut brittle....yes, bacon peanut brittle (see my photo). You know what happened next. 

I couldn't taste the bacon. I think I saw the bits in there, but the peanuts and molasses are too overpowering for a little pork fat to get through it all. But I still ate the whole bag. Oh yes. I don't let porcine-related disappointments stop me from ruining my teeth. But you know I also had to try the ice cream being the creamery connoisseur that I am. I went for a single cup - a scoop of strawberry candied jalapeno and a scoop of Blue Bottle Vietnamese coffee (see my photo). Although audacious, the jalapeno kick did nothing to enhance the strawberry, but the Blue Bottle was everything I wanted it to be and more. 

The moral of this story is to go with your gut and go risk-averse on the flavors. The quality of the ice cream is really high and not overly creamy - more Breyer's than Haagen-Dazs if you're thinking in Safeway terms. But the flavor clashing is hit-and-miss on my palate. The other lesson I learned is not to judge skinny white girls too harshly. Oh who am I kidding? Make your effin' order and move on, honey.

ICE CREAM - 4 stars...top-notch quality and even if the flavor combos don't always work, they're worth trying 
AMBIANCE - 4 stars...cute shop that melts in the background of the lively Mission...get it, melt...LOL 
SERVICE - 4.5 stars...hands out those samples like there's no tomorrow...patience thy name is Humphry 
TOTAL - 4 stars...a solid four-star taste sensation and in the case of Blue Bottle Vietnamese coffee, even more
author: Ed U.

description:
Pros:  delicious
          Unique flavors
           Friendly service
        
Cons: street parking 
           Hard to find parking at times
author: Bayarea K.

description:
The first time I tried it here was maybe in 2008? 

I love their concept of eclectic/sweet/savory flavors. I haven't been in a while, but I do want to hit up their Ferry Building location soon.
author: Liza Faye T.

description:
Dear Tooth Fairy,

I rarely have a sweet tooth craving.  But since tasting Secret Breakfast, I feel like it's really worth it to have cavities.

WHAT!!!

What do you mean you won't leave me a quarter under my pillow?!  I left you my GODDAMN TOOTH!!!

Oh. 

Okay.

I'll settle for a pint of Secret Breakfast ice cream. 

Sweetly Yours,
Janice C. 


P.S.
*^#!@%  ice cream better be there when I wake up!!!
author: Janice C.

description:
An outrageous claim was made by a fellow yelper *ahem* that Humphry is better than Bi-Rite! Oh, the nerve. But of course, I couldn't argue since I've never had Humphry's. 

I knew going in that Secret Breakfast and Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee are the popular choices. And that's why I didn't get those flavors. Because Marti L does not conform. She's no blind mice, and will not get on no wagon just because everyone's on it.

Instead I got a sample and a kids scoop of Salt and Pepper. It was tantalizing to my tastebuds. Bursts of sea saltiness followed by morsels of black pepper. I was hooked. It wasn't ice cream good. But I couldn't stop...until halfway through when my brain, stomach and tongue finally got together and decided maybe it wasn't a good idea.

My preference: still Bi-Rite. But Humphry Slocombe still deserves 5 stars for its creativity and its desire to challenge tastebuds. Just a bit too innovative for this girl. I've also sampled the Balsamic Caramel and McEvoy Olive Oil. And I must say, they've managed to make them palate-acceptable. Just takes time and in small doses.

Btw, totally kidding about the whole conformity thing. I knew my friends would probably end up with Secret Breakfast and Blue Bottle. So I just easily mooched off them. Suckers! =P
author: Marti L.

description:
One of SF's staples for specialty ice cream.  If you are somewhat adventurous, come here.  They have flavors such as Thai Iced Coffee Ice Cream. Salted Watermelon. Peanut Butter & Curry.

Yum! Yum! Yum!

Shorter lines than bi-rite, but less options too.
author: Roxane W.

description:
Pretty good ice cream but it's a little dirty inside and the people working there seemed anxious to get out.  Maybe I shouldn't have come in so late, but they were still open for another half hour so I don't feel they needed to be quite so rude.

Elvis the Fat Years is pretty good.
author: Mara S.

description:
I had the Secret Breakfast..

It was OKAY. 

Maybe i was not into the whiskey alcohol taste...BUT the after taste was good.

Hmm, maybe i should have tried the other flavors?

I'll give it another try..

although, the service was fast. There was a long line but i didn't wait long. parking can be tough...we talked to a filipino resident who was hanging out in his garage into letting us park on his drive way lol

Anyways, I thought it was pretty cool how they can text you your reciept..talk about go green!
author: Sarah F.

description: Amazing ice cream! The Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee flavor was crazy good. I wish I had tried every flavor!
author: Kim K.

description: Blue bottle Vietnamese coffee ice cream FTW.  Secret breakfast was a close second.
author: Chris L.

description:
Have been wanting to come here ever since Anthony Bourdain featured it on his SF episode, and even more after seeing it on Unique Eats.

Wish they had the prosciutto and foie gras flavors to try, but had a chance to try some of their staples:  Secret Breakfast (the best - inventive combo of bourbon and cornflakes), Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee (rich and robust), Fudge Sorbet, Fluffernutter (fresh ground peanut butter and homemade marshmallow fluff from Project Open Hand), and Tahitian Vanilla...

I had a small taste of their Jesus Juice (red wine and coke), may go for a scoop of that next time around. 

The service was extremely friendly and patient (despite the lines).  They are definitely a very green conscious business utilizing washable taster spoons, and recyclable cups and spoons.

Loved the experience, and will be back.
author: Lawrence L.

description: Meh, nothing special about this place. The fennel ice cream left an irritating itchy feeling in the back of my throat. Heard other saying the same as I was eating mine. Too bad, I was looking forward to having another ice cream place like Bi-rite. The only reason im even giving them 3 stars is the fact they think out of the box with their flavors.
author: AJ T.

description: One of the many small treasures in the Mission. Although it's small and a bit expensive, it's worth it. When I first came here I tried the Special Breakfast and it is always my go to flavor! I always come here when I'm in the Mission.
author: Diana C.

description:
Lines out the door. They indicate a place has got it going on, they create excitement, they often can't be helped. 

But in Humphry Slocombe's case, they so easily could be helped that I suspect part of the staff's job is to preserve the line at any cost. 

The other day, after finally getting inside and up to the ice cream case, one server was chatting with a pair of ladies, insisting they try *every* flavor, while the other just stood there, arms by his sides, with a catatonic stare. Eventually nudged into service by a managerial figure, he started scooping uninterestedly and monosylabically. Nonsyllabically, really. OK, bro, maybe you're in shock, you've looked out the window just in time to see your partner engage in amorous relations with a border collie. It happens. But the overall no-bueno-ness of servicio may have lessened my enjoyment of their Blue Bottle Vietnamese coffee ice cream: I found it grainy and watery, with a flavor that was distinctly average. And average on the Baskin-Robbins scale, not the Bi-Rite scale.

While we're on the subject--the flavor choices? I know it's the Mission, pushing the envelope is what we do, but beer ice cream? Basil? Salt and pepper? Je sais que ce n'est que mon avis, mais c'est ce que nous appelons en anglais "twee."
author: Douglas G.

description:
I usually don't like to give out 5 stars to just ice cream places as most of them are generic as it gets:
-Vanilla
-Boring
-Boring
-Boring
-Chocolate
-Boring
-Rocky Road
-Whatever
-Yeah mmhmm
-Some random flavor you haven't seen since you were 5

HOWEVER this place is definitely worth the long wait. Secret Breakfast is one of those ice creams that have texture- something that I definitely appreciate! Not to mention- their ice creams aren't insanely sweet and leave you screaming for milk and/or water. I do agree that it's a bit dirty inside but honestly- what can you do when you have hundreds of people coming into your doors and all your staff is dedicated with making the line move as fast as you can?

This unique place is definitely going to be on my list of places to bring out-of-towners!
author: Elizabeth S.

description:
Yaay for Jesus Juice, Secret Breakfast & Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee. Flavors are fresh and delightful. You can really taste the ingredients. The staff is great too, especially since it was my first time and i was asking for samples of everything. The BB Vietnamese was my fave one following by Jesus Juice then Secret Breakfast. 

I'm glad I came by this spot. If you're an ice cream lover, go give it a shot (not that it really needs any more reviews or reasons to convinve you to go)

=)
author: Sarina I.

description:
Well, excuuuse me.

There's a real-life best-in-show in the Inner Mission, and it's neither the sketchiest Farolito outpost on the earth nor the heap of used childrens shoes in front of it. It's HS, a beacon of country civility and cleanliness in the grimy 24th Street lineup. This is the institution that made me both a Weird Ice Cream Flavor convert AND a Boring Ice Cream Flavor convert! Bourbon-swirled and cereal-flecked Secret Breakfast was a genuine delight, and the Salted Chocolate is perfection.

I'm admittedly not crazy about all of it, but noobs should stick to a fluffed scoop of the very basic or the very unusual. If that's not your cuppa, they're so patient and generous with samples, that you'll be able to make an informed $3 decision.
author: Liz C.

description: I'm officially upgrading my Humphry Slocombe review to 5 stars. Can't get enough of their Secret Breakfast in a waffle cone!!
author: Vivian H.

description:
Quickie:
+ Packs so much deliciousness
+ Such interesting flavors 

---

Flavors that were yum city:
- Harvey Milk & Honey
- Secret Breakfast

Venue:
Seating is limited (line of seats facing the window) and there is a planter box you can plop down on outside along with a few chairs.

Verdict:
If you like ice cream, don't miss out on this cacophony of strange-but-perfect ingredient combos. It's like multiple parties in your mouth.
author: Amy H.

description: Their Secret Breakast ice cream is probably the best thing I've ever put in my mouth-- it's cornflakes and bourbon heaven. I've tried tons of other flavors which were amazing as well, but this is the one I always go back to.
author: Kim V.

description: Secret Breakfast is a dream come true...cereal with icecream...what more could you ask for!
author: Parita P.

description:
This ice cream place didn't fail me!!! Saw them on Zagat's list of 10 best ice cream place in San Francisco. When I was finally in the area, I didn't think twice of visiting! 

The staff were super attentive to us! Once we walked in, he immediately offered us a sample of his fave flavor w/o even us saying anything!! The samples kept on going and even gave us samples of toppings! The staff who helped us was amazing! I wish I got his name. 

Their ice cream is super! I got some kind of coffee ice cream (sorry forgot the name) and the staff suggested i should add bourbon glaze on it oh boy it was amazing!!! It's probably one of the best ice cream I've had and trust me, I'm an ice cream connoseuir so I know what I'm talking about. 

All in all, amazing ice cream, friendly and knowledgeable staff, awesome experience! I will def come back!!!
author: Cathy B.

description: I was in a rush, so I kind of did a blind order - Secret Breakfast and After School Special. I'm not sure which one it was, but they were both awesome, one more than the other (the one without pecans). I also tasted the Limoncello, which was more of a sorbet than ice cream. Overall, definitely coming back to try more flavors.
author: Jonathan B.

description: Had the secret breakfast - it was interesting and creamy. I don't know that I thought it was the best thing in the world and necessitates a second trip.
author: Madhuri K.

description: The line at Humphry Slocombe Ice Cream wasn't long and it moved rather quickly. My daughter had a scoop of the malted milk chocolate while I had half and half of black sesame and Vietnamese coffee - YuMmm. I loved both flavors equally.  My daughter sampled mine, and she preferred the Vietnamese coffee flavor over the malted milk chocolate.
author: Racquel E.

description: I'm normally not a fan of cereal flavored ice cream because they tend to be really sweet, but the Secret Breakfast knocked my socks off. Not too sweet, nice kick of bourbon, and full of crunchy cereal :). That, with a scoop of Salted Caramel w/ Cocoa Nibs, was my lunch on Saturday. No ragrets.
author: Lauretta L.

description: I dream of humphry slocombe ice cream. Every visit at both of their locations is always pleasant. The mission location is slightly sketchy & a bit of a walk from Bart but the people who work there are extraordinarily friendly. Even on busy days they make small talk & never rush you when you wanna sample new flavors. Whenever I get the chance I always grab a cone & two pints to-go. One, secret breakfast, two, usually vietnamese coffee. There's enough reviews + praise for their secret breakfast flavor but there's a reason people rave about it. It's freaking delicious. A little bit bourbon, a little bit cornflakes make this boozy, creamy ice cream with fun tasty texture. My current ice cream obsession is their black sesame flavor. Toasty, nutty, rich creaminess. If you've ever tried those Asian black sesame soy milk drinks it tastes just like that but better. There's not a whole lot of seating but it's the mission, immerse yourself. Maybe take a walk & take in the murals on balmy alley.
author: Kero S.

description:
Not as great as I thought it'd be. The flavor names sound awesome, but when you taste it, disappointment occurs. 

I got the Tahitian Vanilla (taste like Vanilla Bean from Starbucks) and Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee. (taste like any other coffee flavor). One of my friends got that Chocolate Sea Salt, which tasted mostly like melted Sea Salt! Lol.

If you like alcoholic flavors, go for the JESUS JUICE!!!

I hear they have better flavors during different seasons, like one with "Graham CRACKERS! They probaly have the "bad/unimpressive" flavors during the winter time, because HELLO?!, ICE CREAM in the COLLD?!
author: Jacob A.

description:
After watching Andrew Zimmern we ended up going to Humphry Slocombe to give it a try.

Call me lame but I really did not enjoy the secret breakfast- sorry! The bourbon was way too strong and overpowering. I tried a bunch of different flavors they had and ended up with the blue bottle coffee, which was probably the most "normal" tasting of them all.
author: M W.

description:
Loved the flavors here! And the customer service is on point too. The staff made recommendations and let us try many flavors. A couple of my friends tried the Jesus Juice (one of the signature flavors here), and really liked it! Wasn't really my cup of tea though. 

Out of all the ice cream I tried on the day I visited here, I think I was the biggest fan of Humphry Slocombe (for flavors). The day I came here, I tried Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee and Oolong tea. I ended up going with the coffee flavor, as I LOVE vietnamese coffee. The ice cream really captured the strength and subtle sweetness of vietnamese coffee. It did end up overpowering me in the end because it is such a strong flavor.

One thing I did notice here though: there's a pretty high fat content in this ice cream. There were a few chunks of milk-fat here and there, and by the end of the cup, all our mouths were coated in that fatty, slippery feeling. We just drank some water after our ice cream and all was good.

On a busier day, expect not to find seating nearby. There were a few small tables inside, and two tables outside. Parking was fairly reasonable.
author: Denise C.

description:
Every time I come here, I swear I like it a little bit less. I'd put it at 3.5 stars even though I really liked the flavors I had last time I came (Butter beer, which is guiness and butter, and Tahitian Vanilla). The flavors are quite hit or miss and most are VERY in-your-face. If you like strong flavors, I suspect you'll like this place a lot. I prefer a bit more subtlety and it doesn't quite work for me, although I like the secret breakfast (corn flakes and bourbon), strong as it is.

Texture is quite nice, a nice balance between substantive and airy. Just the right amount of creaminess for me.
author: David C.

description: Finally made it here after being on my bookmarks for 2 years. Sampled 5 flavors -- blue bottle Vietnamese coffee, secret breakfast, fluffernutter, chocolate & sea salt, and lime basil -- before going with a scoop each of secret breakfast and chocolate & sea salt to share with the boyfriend. We both agreed the secret breakfast was phenomenal (we also had fun imagining how they came up with the flavor -- drunken night of bourbon with morning-after meal of milk and cereal?). I liked the choc & sea salt, but it's more of a flavor you savor a few bites of rather than an entire scoop because it's super rich. I think I like the salted caramel from Bi-Rite better, but if I had to choose one over the other, I'd go with the secret breakfast from here.
author: Kathy L.

description:
I'm not going to engage in some self-pandering and list off all of the flavors of ice cream I tried. 

Seriously, they offer free samples of anything they have available. Try a sorbet that's a mix of red wine and Coca-Cola (Jesus Juice) or creamy goose liver if you feel adventurous. 

Having returned on several separate trips, be it when there was a line or we were the only people (Yeah, secret's out apparently. I still find it amusing having to stand in line with people who declare things like, "I knew about that WAAAAAAY before EVERYONE else did, because I work for Apple." True story), I maintain that HS is worth waiting for and whatever flavor you get will be unique.

I mostly returned to update my review for two reasons. 

Firstly, it seems they've raised their prices. It used to be that 2 scoops cost the same as a single, but now it's another dollar up ($3.75). 

And secondly, I don't feel there's enough coverage of their newer beverage, the Bourbon and Coke ($5), which features two scoops of Secret Breakfast with their own homemade bourbon caramel drowned in Coca-Cola. 

Most of the reviews, though few they are, remark on this magical elixir have been rather negative. I, however, found it delightful. For me, usually, Coke and ice cream never mix. Eating ANYTHING sweet and then drinking Coke usually creates this flavor that can only be described as "Bleh!" But, the Bourbon and Coke float pulls it off. I don't know why, but each flavor works in harmony with the other to create this refreshing treat, and I recommend it. They give you the rest in a miniature, glass bottle.
author: Christine A.

description: Wondering what cereal and bourbon taste together? No? Good. You're probably not drunk. If however you want to take a walk on the wild side, check this place out. Unique doesn't cut it.
author: Carolina V.

description:
I once went on a date with a guy named Humphrey and then laughed my ass off when they yelled his name over the loudspeaker at Fuddruckers. Little did I know, a few years later my favorite ice cream place would have the same name.  

I've never been a fan of all those ice cream places with the cult followings (bi-rite, mitchells, etc) but I love this place! My friends and I had time to kill before celebrating my birthday so my best friend recommended this place. We found parking right across the street (birthday luck!) and then we waited in line for a good 45 minutes but it was worth it! 

I got the Olive Oil and English Breakfast Tea. The small is 3.25 but it was WAY too much ice cream! I couldn't even finish all the English Breakfast Tea =( I was so excited to see it but it didn't have a strong enough tea flavor for me. My friend told me the olive oil one was amazing and I sampled it thinking it would be disgusting but it is by far one of the best ice creams I've ever tasted! I got it in a cone and then got a cup for safety since it was already falling off. 

While the place is small, there is eating inside and out but you might have to wait a while to grab a table. I sat down as soon as I saw an opening and my friends and I traded places standing in line.
author: Tiffany V.

description: Another ice cream  spot in SF which competes with some of the best.  The unique flavors and tasty toppings make Humphrey Slocombe stand out.  Although not a lot of seating and parking is hit or miss,  this place is usually crammed with people.  A popular stop after a dinner in the Mission.
author: Erika A.

description:
I'm a bit torn on how to rate this place. On one hand, the flavors were quite unique and perhaps even borderline artistic. On the other hand, half of their ice cream flavors simply tasted disgusting (which might actually be a compliment). It was as if they were blended by a preschooler in a sandbox making mud pie at the peak of his creativity.

However, the bottom line is that it was impossible for me to enjoy most of the flavors. If you are the type that likes the flavor of buttered popcorn and black liquorice jelly beans, then this is the place for you. Otherwise, move along.
author: Nathan Y.

description:
With apologies to the two-headed cow staring dolefully down at patrons, its miraculous oddness taks second place to the unique flavors of ice cream Humphry Slocombe's slings, which no matter how creative the combinations, taste exactly as advertised. 

Going for the Secret Breakfast?
