The rough taste of Evan Williams Bourbon melding with cream and cornflakes will give you a combination of flavors that would be an alcoholic's dream, the crunch of cornflakes adding a nice contrast to Slocombe's perfectly rich ice cream. Adding a scoop of the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee while smoking a cigarette replicates the flavor of every Saturday morning I've experienced since I moved out of my parent's house.

Ordering the Honey Thyme? Expect it to taste like local rose-flavored honey, the slightest bit of thyme providing an exceptional balance to a flavor profile that could be cloyingly sweet in the wrong hands.

If you're a punk rocker from the days of yore, go for the Jesus Juice, a marriage of red wine and coke. Despite the Urban Dictionary's definition, this sorbet isn't just for thirteen year olds, but rather tastes like an adult version of the ubiquitous grape slushy found in every childhood.

If you go at the right time (i.e. not after lunch or dinner), the lines are manageable, although at peak times waiting 15 minutes in a crush of Mission Hipsters is not uncommon.
author: Casey U.

description: I love their Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee. Had this on a Saturday night as a little treat to myself. Always delicious! And ooh, make sure you try their Secret Breakfast at least once. That bourbon tho... ;)
author: Pauline D.

description:
Two reviews in one.

Last weekend at the Ferry Building I got the " chocolate with the smoked sea salt" from their ice cream cart.  Sweet and salty at the same time. A nice round single scoop in a cup. 

Last night we drove over to the shop after dinner. Got a single scoop of the "secret breakfast" in a cup. Somewhat skimpy scoop and not cold enough. The peak of my ice cream didn't even peek out from the cup.  That's skimpy. The ice cream was half way melted down.  

For $3.25 a scoop, it wasn't worth my gas and time.
author: Shirley N.

description: Delicious! I'd say Humphrey's ice cream is more creamy than most. I love their secret breakfast flavor, as everyone else mentioned, but I think my favorite is their horchata. Blue bottle Vietnamese coffee is also good, and they are always coming up with interesting flavors. A cute little shop perfect for an after dinner treat!
author: Michelle K.

description:
I can't tell you how much I love this Ice Cream shop.  Let me count the ways...

1. Exciting, always changing and rotating flavors.
2. TOPPINGS - TOPPINGS - MAGICAL TOPPINGS.
3. Straus 
4. Organic products

i try and stick to my guns about my favorite flavors but having tasted almost all of them my favorite has to be a combination sundae of my creation.  Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee with Secret Breakfast topped with Marsh Mellow Fluff (Yeah, you heard me), Bourbon infused Caramel Sauce, and toasted nuts.  DONE!

AND now they accept credit cards.  What's NOT to love???
author: Kevin J.

description:
Only going to review what I bought, not the samples. 

Hibiscus beet sorbet: if you love the earthiness of beets with the mellow flower scent of hibiscus, then get a scoop.
White chocolate lavender: BAM! I love flowers in sweets. Very heavy and creamy though.
Wife ate chocolate smoked salt. Pretty damn tasty, but on par with all other chocolate and salt combos.
Will be back during our week long trip.
author: Garth And Saray P.

description:
Having been to Humphry Slocombe twice now, I am now ready to write a review. To start off, the shop is fairly small with about 6 seats inside and a couple tables outside. They serve about a dozen icecreams each day and each one is very unique.  I have had great experiences both times that I've been here because the staff is really nice and they let you sample any flavor you want to try.   

This last visit, I had:
-Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee: This has to be one of the best coffee ice creams I have tasted.  Very smooth and very rich, it's the perfect ice cream.  
-Balsamic Caramel: This is definitely a change from your normal ice cream, but strangely, it was really delicious.  A bit salty, a bit sweet.  This is one that I'd recommend you sample before ordering.  I liked it a lot, but my mom tried it and thought it was just okay.

The previous visit, I had the Secret Breakfast (bourbon flavored ice cream with Corn Flake crisps).  I would recommend sampling this flavor before ordering it.  I really enjoyed it, but some other people in my group did not really care for it.

Pricing:
1 scoop  ($2.75)
2 scoops ($3.75)
3 scoops ($5.00)

Overall, very tasty ice cream and fair prices.  I will be back soon.

Notes:
-Don't be shy about asking for samples!  Both times that I have gone, they have been really friendly and they don't make you feel bad for asking for samples, like other places I have been to.
-Street parking is manageable.
-Secret Breakfast is on the 7x7 Big Eat.
-Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee is on the 7x7 Big Sweet.
author: Samantha L.

description:
Yum! The ice cream taste comes back to me as I write this review. I ordered the Elvis. Nothing healthy about it but incredible taste. 

This place is great for trying new flavors of ice cream that you never thought before. Definitely a must try.
author: Chelsey O.

description:
So delicious and nutritious! 

O.k maybe the second part is false but on a hot day in SF (you know those 10 days of the year) what better way to celebrate than to have some delicious ice cream.

The line was pretty long and moved at a snail's pace but it was such a pleasant "summer day" in October that we did not mind.

The gals at the counter are very generous with their samples so we each tried a couple before going with the Blue Bottle Coffee and the Chocolate Sea Salt.  Both flavors were great and great together!

Yum! Yum!
author: Betty C.

description:
For quality of ice cream, Bi-Rite kicks Humphry's weirdo ass, but the exciting part of Humphry is the flavors. You always want to sample everything and the great thing is that the ice cream peeps are always happy to let you blow seven metal spoons on taste testing. 

Big fan of Secret Breakfast with its chunks of cereal in a bourbon ice cream. The peach sorbet was also really refreshing. Blue bottle coffee was tasty, but not very interesting.
author: Kevin L.

description:
Rich and decadent ice cream that is offered in interesting flavors. Service was friendly and efficient. What more could you ask for from an ice cream place?

I sampled the secret breakfast flavor. While it was good, I'm not sure I could have eaten an entire scoop of it. I opted for the Blue Bottle Vietnamese coffee instead. Yum.
author: Amanda L.

description:
This was almost a 3 star review because of the ATTITUDE behind the counter from the Surly goats.  SMILE bitches ICE CREAM is supposed to be happy food!

The secret breakfast, blah blah blah.  Let's move on now people...anything new?

Chocolate and Guiness was good and my friend wanted to get the bourbon float with the chocolate Guiness instead but she wouldn't let him...WTF?  Its the same thing I don't understand the problem hoe...It's not like she had to move her fat Tellitubby body anymore than if she had with the secret breakfast, and we are the only ones in line so it's not like she's busy.

I was seriously annoyed by the blaise look on the workers faces, no acknowledgment, no smile, no questions if I wanted to sample anything.  They just stood there and stared at us like a deer before you ram the shit out of it with your car. ( Sorry PETA i'm not pledging today.)  

I was excited for my 3rd visit to Humphrey's, but after this experience from the workers I probably won't bring people back here.  There are too many other ice cream places in SF where I can actually get better service without the bad attitudes.

Tara's or Ici up in Berkley is my new obsession...I'm over you..
author: Anthony N.

description:
LOVED the brown sugar/butter with blueberries - sweet and savory, and nothing like what I have tasted before (and as an SF resident, we definitely have our variety).

Vietnamese coffee ice cream was underwhelming in comparison, but still alright.  

Nice walk for dessert after dinner on Valencia or Mission.
author: Amy G.

description: I'm not the biggest fan of cream of ice, but this place is sew fecking kewl. The flavors are tasty and out of the ordinary, but the real pube in the soup is that they play gangster rap inside. The whole concept is just bigger than me. I was getting real weird and introspective listening to Eazy-E while eating secret breakfast (try this flavor)...but I actually prefer the Vietnamese Blue Bottle coffee or the aged pickled mung bean with organic gluten (one of these isn't a flavor).
author: Michael K.

description:
Humphry Slocombe Ice Cream I heart you! 

Been here a few times with friends to try out the recent flavors.  They keep ranting and raving about Butterbeer (a tribute to Harry Potter) but it seems like everyone ate it all!!! GRRR!!!!  But out of the list of things I've tried, here's a lil tid bit:

Tahitian Vanilla - Simple and not to vanilly, I'd recommend this if you're not in the mood to go crazy on something unheard of

Secret Breakfast - YUMMM!  crunchy and bourbon sweet, minus the alcohol.

Blue Bottle Viet Coffee - Me likey!!! It reminds me of when I was a kid and used to dump hella sugar in my coffee. LOL

Black Sesame - Eat in moderation.  The first bite was good, then after that, the sesame was super over powering, definitely a trained taste.  Just not the one for me.

All in all, a really cute shop with a twist of excitement.
author: Edrian D.

description:
I've tried lots of different flavors here...if I tallied up the good and the no-so-good, I actually might just end up with equal amounts of both.  So in theory, I guess that makes Humphry's an overall 3.5 stars.  But, I do go out of my way to get the flavors I love here, so I'm giving Humphry's 5 stars.

They sample freely without dirty looks or grunts, so if it's your first time, sample a few before making a decision.  Otherwise, there is only a 33.3% chance of getting something SUPER and up to 33.3% of getting something NASTY!

Here is a mostly complete list of flavors I've tried over my many visits:

The good:
Vietnamese Coffee/Blue Bottle--coffee ice cream like you've never had it. My # 1
Cinnamon Brittle-love this!  delicious little brittle pieces. My #2
Sweet Summer Corn--weird in a good way, surprisingly yummy! 
Oolong Tea--mild tea flavor and so yums. My # 3.
Black Sesame--nutty, semi-sweet and tastes asian. Love it. (almost made my top 3)

Everything else:
Salt & Pepper--It wasn't bad....it was F-ing disgusting.  First you think you taste vanilla, but then it gets really salty and just as you confirm the salt, you get a pepper rush up your nose.  No thank you.   

Secret Breakfast--I love the cornflake bits, but the whiskey infusion is overpowering

Chocolate Smoked Sea Salt--unpleasant., left a salty coat on my tongue

Elvis the Fat Years (Banana, Bacon, Peanut Brittle)--I love bananas and I love bacon, but not together!!

Honey Thyme--too mild of a flavor/calorie waster.

McEvoy Olive Oil--not a fan, this one also coats the tongue in what feels like a layer of lipid.  

Chili Lime Sorbet--Tart and Spicy. Meh.

After School Special (Chocolate-covered Ridge potato chips swirled with caramel in Tahitian Vanilla)--Interesting! It was ok, but not sure If I would have it again. 

Malted Milk Chocolate--didn't taste any more special than regular ol' chocolate icecream to me
author: Susan L.

description:
Innovative flavors and cute diner feel.

There isn't much sitting space, but who cares.  The ice cream is delicious.  Perfect textures and an array of flavors to choose from, it's hands down my favorite ice cream.

You must, you must, you must try the secret breakfast ice cream.  Cornflakes and bourbon? Who would have thought of putting those two together?  Doesn't matter, it's magical.

White chocolate lavender.  I know that floral tastes are somewhat acquired and might not fit everyone's palette, so I'll let you be the judge.  However, I found it to be a perfect balance of flavors.

McEvoy Olive Oil.  Savory and salty with hints of olive oil.  That first taste is a little funky, but you just want to keep eating. Very delicious.

There's always a dilemma of whether I should go to Bi-Rite or H&S, but I always find myself craving the secret breakfast and wander my way over to get a triple scoop here.
author: Miyeon L.

description:
I love ice cream.  When it's good when does it not deserve five stars?

Two flavors I really like from here: secret breakfast (big surprise) and Blue Bottle Vietnamese coffee.  Secret breakfast really does taste like bourbon.  It's not a very strong bourbon flavor, it's subtle, but noticeable.  The cornflake bits mixed within are crunchy, sweet and compliment the flavor of the ice cream well.  I actually wish more cornflake bits were mixed in.  The Blue Bottle Vietnamese coffee is a very good coffee flavored ice cream.  I'm not a coffee drinker but have always enjoyed coffee flavored ice cream and this one's a winner.  Also have sampled the Jesus Juice (red wine and coca cola) which has very noticeable wine flavoring and tasted pretty good, as well as the peanut butter curry flavored ice cream which wasn't too bad surprisingly.
author: Erich D.

description:
Here's a tip Humphry Slocombe - having cool sounding flavors isn't enough. They actually have to taste good. 

I love ice cream, like really love ice cream, like more than is healthy for an adult. And when I say I love ice cream, I love all kinds of ice cream - from McDonald's McFlurries to Treatbot and Smitten. I love vanilla. I love olive oil. I love ube. I like "normal" flavors and I like unique flavors. Here's what I do not love - Humphry Slocombe. 

After hearing all about Humphry Slocombe and the unique flavors, I was so excited to try it. On the day I visited, I was bummed to see that none of the flavors that sounded interesting to me were on the menu, but I figured there had to be something I'd like. I sampled the Salted Watermelon and the Prosciutto. Salted Watermelon was tolerable, but Prosciutto was absolutely gross. I ended up going with Secret Breakfast and Cinnamon Brittle since I'd read they are popular, but after eating about half, I did something unthinkable - I threw my ice cream away. Both flavors were a little too strong and the texture wasn't all that creamy. To top it off, the ice cream left a weird filmy feeling in my mouth. Not worth the calories...
author: Nicole L.

description:
Worth the wait and the fact they were sold out of 4 different flavors. 
WOW.
author: Nick R.

description:
3.5 stars

Waaah...I had such high hopes for Humphry Slocombe! It was the last of the famed Bay Area ice cream shops left for me to taste. In comparison to Mitchell's, Bi-Rite and Mr. & Mrs. Miscellaneous, Humphry's fell a bit short.

I will give them credit for friendly service and luckily, having no line on our Sunday afternoon visit. Unfortunately, when I asked for a scoop of Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee ice cream on a cone, the lady behind the counter replied, "Well, it's kind of crumbly today so I can't form it onto the cone. Would it be okay if I scoop it into a bowl and add the cone on top?" I figured she was being apologetic and I didn't want to budge flavors (I've ONLY had a teensy obsession with Vietnamese Coffee recently) so I said it was fine.

She wasn't kidding when she said the ice cream was CRUMBLY! It had this grainy texture that I totally wasn't digging. It was such a shame considering the flavor was great and the consistency of both my boyfriend's Fluffernutter and sample of Secret Breakfast were fine. In fact, both flavors were damn good.

I'm sure Humphry's had an off day, and the sweet worker even warned me when scooping my ice cream. However, if you KNOW that you're serving ice cream that isn't up to par, please don't serve it at all! It's a rip-off to customers that are expecting the best! I will make a return visit in hopes of a better experience. Til' next time Humphry's...
author: Faye G.

description: Wow. The Secret Breakfast did not disappoint. I was surprised by how much I loved the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee as I'm not a coffee person.
author: Marco M.

description:
Came here last saturday with some friends. The line was literally out the door,I felt like i was waiting for a ride at disneyland lol.... When we finally arrived inside i was getting anxious as my friend was raving about this place.

I ordered a single scoop on a cone of the malt chocolate.
I thought it was good but not amazing! I did think it was a little on the sweet side but nothing I couldn't handle. As we walked back to my friends pad my two friends gobbled their scoops while i still enjoyed mine.

Check 'em out!

They take card which they swipe on their iPad pretty nifty!
author: Evangelina B.

description: We really enjoyed the ice cream here.  Great plain vanilla bean ice cream - one of the best I've tasted.  The coffee flavor was also incredibly smooth.  Topped it all off with whipped cream and their caramel bourbon sauce, and it made for an awesome after-dinner snack.  Definitely worth a try.  This and Shakedown in the Tenderloin are two of my favorite ice cream spots in the entire city.
author: Zach S.

description:
Prosciutto ice cream sounds like all kinds of wrong.  But it's awesome and oh so right.  Word on the street is they procure said prosciutto from Boccalone which is just shy of ultimate porky greatness, only because they don't serve lechon.  Heyyyyyy, that's an idea for you Chris Cosentino!  

Anywhoo, the Jesus Juice is sinfully delish.  Who knew red wine and coke went so well together?  The Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee, Secret Breakfast and Fluffer Nutter were equally good.  Plus, I just love saying Fluffer Nutter anyway.  Fluffer Nutter.  Fluffer Nutter.  Fluffer Nutter.  

Thank you Humphrey Slocombe for adding to the weight of my already considerable arse.
author: Joc V.

description:
Why is it that the places with the most interesting names have the best things? 

Anyways, I finally got to try Humphry Slocombe's innovative flavors. The line on a Saturday was surprisingly. I got to try Jesus Juice (cold red wine - interesting but not my cup of tea), Wexler's root beer (tasted like cinnamon), and Red Hot Banana (tasted like spicy cinnamon). We decided on the 3 scoop with Secret Breakfast, Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee, and Nutterfluffer. The Secret Breakfast had a creamy, clean flavor to it and you could taste the bourbon here and there. I was disappointed that there wasn't a lot of corn flakes in it though. The Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee flavor definitely tasted like Vietnamese coffee. A must for coffee lovers. This flavor, along with the Nutterfluffer, tied for my favorite. The Nutterfluffer tasted like Nutter Butters, but sweet and fluffy in an ice cream! Both were so good I bought a pint of each!

The scoops are reasonably priced for the interesting and high quality type of ice-cream. I also like how they accept credit cards with their nifty iPad and electronic device. You can have your receipt emailed to you but I trust them. The people working there are also very friendly and even offered to keep my pints in the fridge while I enjoyed my delectables in the store!
author: Stephanie L.

description:
Delicious ice cream!  Not a bad price, in my opinion, for such awesome flavors.  Secret Breakfast is my favorite.  I also love salted caramel and the Vietnamese Blue Bottle Coffee.  Red Hot Banana is a treat.  The servers have always been really nice, and generous and patient with tasting flavors even if there's a line.  (There is frequently a line on hot summer nights.)

I live really close to this place, have been there a ton of times, and have never been disappointed.  Yum!
author: Carolyn N.

description:
I stopped in at here after a Giants game last weekend with some friends. I ordered two scoops, one of the the balsamic caramel and one of the peanut butter curry.

The balsamic caramel was good, but it's hard to describe the flavor. It tasted more like balsamic than caramel, but it didn't have the bitter taste of vinegar it was sweet.

The peanut butter curry was my favorite of the two. When you first take a bit it tasted exactly like peanut butter and had almost the same consistency. It wasn't until after the ice cream was out of my mouth that I tasted the subtle curry flavor. Delicious.

I also had a small bite of my friends "Special Breakfast" it was good, but the peanut butter curry was still my favorite.

I'm looking forward to coming back here to experience more of their unique ice cream flavors.
author: Stephanie T.

description:
I previously mentioned in my Bi-Rite review that I like classic flavors (vanilla, chocolate, etc.), so I went to Humphry Slocombe knowing it wouldn't be the best thing I've ever had.  But it was still something the wife and I wanted to try, so we went on down, like good little sheeple.

We knew we had to try the Secret Breakfast, because that's what every single review raved about.  But we found out it contains alcohol in it, so we had to pass.  That left us trying to figure out what to get, which was actually a really hard decision.  Not because everything looked awesome, but because all of the flavors just seemed way too out there. Like way far out there, man.

So we ended up getting as close to traditional flavors as we could.  The strawberry ice cream was really good, especially with the strawberry chunks.  And the vanilla was decent as well, with a really good vanilla bean flavor.

But overall, the experience was just okay, not awesome.  I'm just not a crazy ice cream flavor kinda guy, and now I know I shouldn't waste my calories on something I'm just not going to enjoy.  So from now on, if I'm back in SF and craving ice cream, it will always be Mitchell's!
author: Nadeem A.

description:
Ok, Secret Breakfast. I cannot keep it a secret anymore. After hearing so much about you and enduring a long line to get in, the first bite left me contemplating how I could have existed this long before trying this little piece of heaven. It's definitely a heart attack I'd gladly risk, to eat you on a more frequent basis. I have this overwhelming urge to tell everybody and their moms about how amazing Secret Breakfast is, it will take every last fiber in my body to stay quiet about it and keep it a secret. Everyone should try this at least once in their lives, go! now! if you want to fully live!! :D 

all the other flavors are also very robust and well done.
I especially like coffee and pumpkin 5 spice, but above all, Secret Breakfast. maybe the secret is how they keep the cornflakes from going soggy!! perfect texture!!
author: Tuwie N.

description:
We decided to come to Humphry Slocombe since my friends raved about their exotic ice cream flavors that range from Tahitian vanilla, Vietnamese coffee, to olive oil, salt and pepper, to beet sorbet, and even prosciutto. Yep. There is a definitely a whole world beyond the pedestrian chocolate, vanilla, or strawberry ice cream. I think it is bold, yet somehow thoughtful that Humphry Slocombe incorporates savory ingredients into their ice cream which can only be found at high-end restaurants and introduces it to mass population. 

The shop is located at the corner in somewhat less crowded side of the vibrant and cultural Mission District. Therefore, parking is not a hassle. It was not crowded when we arrived. Customer service was friendly and informative. The young chap behind the counter was willing to give us any flavors to sample. My friends yearned to come here for olive oil and oolong tea ice cream. Unfortunately, both flavors were not available on the day of our visit. The staff told us that not all flavors were made every day, so if you plan to come here, call ahead and ask them for the daily flavors.

We got to sample a few wacky flavors like beet sorbet, salt and pepper, and prosciutto. I have to admit that these aren't for the timid. My friends ended up not buying what they came for, but I bought a scoop of butter beer ice cream and it was delicious.

Cash Only
author: Chau V.

description:
A nice ice cream place in the city! I loved the unique flavors. I got one scoop of Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee as well as a scoop of Butterbeer. Both flavors were delicious! The ice cream had a smooth texture and was the right amount of creaminess.

I like that we are able to taste test the flavors since there are some strange combinations which you might not be willing to commit to without trying it out first. I also love that you can buy the ice cream in pints if you want to.

The only bad thing was that there were not enough tables/chairs to seat me and the other three I was with.
author: Selina L.

description:
The flavors are out there.... way out there. Humphry Slocombe is like BiRite with about half the flavors but you can tell with what they have, they've really specialized in it and serve it with pride.

Vietnamese Blue Bottle Coffee + McEvoy Olive Oil = creamy bliss is a cup, with a biodegradable spoon.

After reading reviews here it seems like there's a toss up on what's the best flavor. I'm coming back for the Secret Breakfast. Stay tuned.
author: Chelsea P.

description:
I'm the type of person that is down for ice cream no matter what the weather is like.
Humphry Slocombe on a rainy day? I'm game.

My all-time faves are the Secret Breakfast and Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee.

The Oolong tea they have is very good too!
author: Stephanie W.

description:
It's my 300th review and I saved it for a special place! 

I cant say much else that's not already been stated in 1675 other reviews, but here's my two cents:

- The line looks daunting but moves and is definitely worth it!
- Their staff is patient and will let you try the flavors you want.
- They sell gift certificates in $5 increments. (It's a cute little Humphrey Slocombe blue postcard simply stamped $5).
- My two favorite flavors thus far:  Malted Milk Choc & Blue Bottle! I loved them so much I wanted to go back the very next day to have more!

They definitely rival all the other amazing ice cream joints the City and the Bay have to offer. But I have my favorites at each one which makes me a fortunate girl!
author: Anna R.

description: Had the totally on point Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee ice cream, but the main reason I won't be running back is that none of the other flavors I tried worked for me. Usually at the best ice cream shops, I'm struggling to narrow down all the choices, whereas here there was really no other choice. A friend zeroed in on the fact that many flavors are overly salty and I would have to agree. And if anyone thinks I'm just another Bi-Rite fiend, while I do like them more, I continue to hail Scoops in LA as the creme de la ice creme.
author: John M.

description:
I have been dying to check this place out because it is named after 2 of my favorite characters from "Are You Being Served?"

The Secret breakfast - which I had @ the Ferry Building Farmers' Market - was fantastic!  There was just the perfect amount of bourbon & the cornflakes gave jut the right touch of sweetness & crispiness.  When I visited the actual shop, I got the Chocolate smoked sea salt which was way too salty & way too rich.

Even though the flavors I tried were a hit & a miss, I will definitely try this place again because the texture of the ice cream was excellent.  And I heard the Vietnamese coffee is quite tasty.
author: Karen S.

description:
Secret breakfast, sea salt caramel, and blue bottle Vietnamese coffee MMMMM

Kind of expensive to pay $4 per scoop of ice cream but it really is delicious. Is it worth it to make a trip here just for it? Not really because there's a lot of other delicious options in SF. 

Aside, I'm very happy to say that I enjoyed this insulin-chasing ice cream especially on the cone.
author: Jolene L.

description: This small place is a good comfy spot to grab some abnormal good ice cream flavors. They have a small variety but seem to have different selections every so often.
author: Anthony S.

description: The secret breakfast was freaking amazing! I can't wait to try the foie gras Ice Cream Sandwich
author: Solomon S.

description:
It's Easter and I have an incredible meal planned. It's supposed to finish with Humphry's  ice cream. I'm hoping for Meyer Lemon gelato and or Strawberry Black Olive ice cream. I call....long message, but no answer. Check Facebook where you are supposed to be able to see the day's flavors. Nope, not updated since Friday. Bummer. Gonna have to gamble....

Grrr, parking nightmare, but I prevail. Spot secured. I go get in line. There is no way you can get anywhere near the case to see what kind of flavors there are-you have to be far enough toward the front of the line to be able to look I think. There is ONE dude working. He is.......slooooooooooow. Customers are also sloooooooow. They have not made up their minds at all. Really? You had a loooong time while you were waiting in line to consider. But no, you are going to sample every single flavor. I think that must be part of the whole 'experience.' You waited in line forever, so now you are going to take forever too. Payback. I kind of get that, but I'm still irritated because I am not there for the 'experience.' I just want some damn fine ice cream to take home.

 Customer in front of me mentions that there is a freezer case now with pre-packed pints. Cool, I say, maybe they have what I want already. I go look. Freezer empty except for one lonely pint of peanut butter something. Sigh.

Go to get back in line. There are now like eight more people in line. I try to take my old place....but no, hipsters are not down with this. Wow....I took maybe 5 steps to the case, looked for about...maybe 4 seconds as there was only one thing to see, and then 5 steps back. Yet, they tell me I've lost my place?  I am frankly not capable of entering into a discussion with these d-bags without morphing into the insano screamy lady.  So I leave.

College girl SO disappointed when I get home. She says if we go back, she can deal. She has no problem pushing around hipsters, or dealing with slow ice cream boy. She tells me she has honed her 'deal with d-bag skills' at the ucla campus bookstores. She is clearly a dedicated foodie, and willing to put the knowledge she has acquired at college to use for the greater good ( namely our dessert plans.  See? Hasn't even graduated yet, and already she's giving back to society. I'm so proud)

I say ok....We go back. I wait in car. 5 minutes later she is back. 

Her:  'Wow, that ice cream dude was stoned outta his mind.'
Me:  ' Oh, I guess I missed that. I thought he was just slow.'
Her: ' Yeah, you're outta touch....and I thought you were a child of the 60s'
Me ( changing the subject):   'Uhm, where's the goods?'
Her: ' Oh, I pushed everyone out of the way, looked in the case, and didn't see any of the flavors you wanted. I asked stoned boy and he said no, they don't have those favors today'

So we went to bi-rite grocery, and bought the creamery's pre-packed orange cardamom and the salted caramel. Yum and NO LINE. 

Yes, Humphry's your ice cream is 5 star good. But your counter help, lack of flavor updates, and customers ( which I know you can't help, but still detracts big time)....not so good.  3 stars over all because of the not so goods.

Next time I'll go to DeLessio's and buy Humphry's ice cream there.  Which, of course, I shoulda figured out earlier. Moral of the story- unless you're a hipster looking for the 'experience' go to DeLessio's if you want to save time/stress.
author: El B.

description: If there is two flavors I recommend it would be Secret breakfast (duh) and schezuan strawberry, if they've got it. Very beautifully combined choices of flavors. The place was clean, semi-old looking with its cute red bar stools and simple decor but it felt uplifting. Great place, great service. The help was very knowledgable. Thanks for a great first experience there.
author: Elizabeth M.

description:
I had two scoops - one each of the much talked about "secret breakfast" and "rum and raisins".
They were both good and I think I sorta prefer the "rum and raisins" more than the "secret breakfast"
I prefer Bi-rite and Ici, but it's still a pretty good specialty ice-cream shoppe and I will come back and try the other flavours.
author: Umesh T.

description:
3 1/2 stars - hit or miss depending on flavor, but to me more interesting  than Bi-rite.  

We had about 5 between us -

Olive Oil
Basil sorbet
Chocolate
Secret Breakfast - what they're best known for
Vanilla

The Basil was very good, you could absolutely taste the herb, and it was texture-wise far smoother and creamier than regular sorbet tastes.  However, the Secret Breakfast was a bit overwhelming in its bourbon/sweetness, though definitely interesting.  and the vanilla was pretty ordinary.  

What was more irksome is the highly variable portion size--there were 4 of us, and while we each got two scoops, you'd have guessed we got a single, double, and triple among us.  Seemingly at random.  For an expensive ice cream shop, one would wish for more consistency.
author: Jay C.

description:
The sun was out, so it's an excuse to get ice cream! Sampled the Secret Breakfast, and it was good, but the bourbon flavor was too strong for me to finish one whole scoop. Got the Harvey Milk Honey Graham with the cone instead. It was good, but halfway, it became a tad too sweet. But really good flavor, and the graham tasted house made. 

I'll still definitely come back for the other flavors.
author: Rae C.

description:
SECRET BREAKFAST. Bourbon and cornflakes in ice cream form is pretty much a dream come true.

Also, Vietnamese coffee was pretty excellent.
author: Dan K.

description: Finally tried this! I got the sundae with caramel and whipped marshmallows and it was really sweet, but what was I expecting. Want to go back to try more flavors. Not cheap but high quality.
author: Turi F.

description: Always a nice surprise variety! Enjoying the Afterschool Special & Brown Sugar Fennel
author: Arlene D.

description:
Mmm, one of my favorite places to get ice cream in SF. 

I can't really add to what everyone else has said. I've never gone when there was a huge line, so that's a plus. Try the blue bottle vietnamese coffee and secret breakfast, if you're a first timer!
author: Judy B.

description:
4stars, the server was a bit sloppy with the scoops.

The sea salt smoked chocolate was too salty, but the Harvey Milk, Tahitian Vanilla, and the strawberry jalapeno flavors are really good.
author: Joy A.

description: Secret breakfast. The best flavor here! Vanilla ice cream with bourbon and cereal. They have other interesting flavors as well such as Jesus Juice, Blue bottle Vietnamese coffee or Harvey's Milk. I wasn't a fan of Jesus Juice which consist of coke and wine, but Harvey's Milk is your next best bet. It's a vanilla base with honey and graham crackers. Amazing! The Blue bottle is really good too if you love coffee. The only down side is they don't have very many cone options. Only sugar cones here. It would be nice if they had cake or waffle cones since the Secret Breakfast is on the softer side, it melts faster than other flavors.
author: Laura T.

description:
I'm always so zoned out when I'm walking that I would have never known that the place with the bright blue awning is a new hotspot for ice cream.  Thank you to Lolia S. (yes, the fro-yo girl does ice cream too!) for bringing this shop to my attention.

The place isn't very busy yet.  There was a nice steady flow of customers as I sat on one of the comfortable stools enjoying my ice cream and cookie on a lazy Friday afternoon.  With the exception of what I ordered I only tried the Thai Chile Lime Sorbet which had a nice flare of heat rise up through my nostrils.  It was very good, but I'm not a big fan of coconut infused anything.

My small cup consisted of the Vietnamese Blue Bottle Coffee on the bottom and the Secret Breakfast on top (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/47OC_X6KkiDDQ4jwoCUjFg?select=I4Y8LZRCN9B0gCQFPYYdCQ).  I enjoyed both with a homemade chocolate chip cookie.  The Vietnamese Coffee has a very subtle coffee flavor which I love.  Since this was the flavor on the bottom and I was eating pretty slowly, by the time I got to it it had softened into a very smooth, creamy ice cream.  The Secret Breakfast is great.  I love how the saltiness of the corn flakes, the bitterness of the bourbon and the sweet cream interact.  This was kind of firm when it was first scooped up so I just let it sit awhile for it to soften before I enjoyed it.

The homemade chocolate chip cookie was good.  It was nice and crispy on the outside and chewy in the middle with bits of chocolate chips and good dark brown sugar taste.  If they can keep the lines fairly short I will definitely return to try more offerings.
author: Wilhelm Y.

description:
Oh Oh Oh!  Strolled in here late one Sunday night for an after marathon treat.  I had the Jesus juice and something else that was totally awesome.  Oh this is sooo good!  Super cute location, ice cream was great staff was cool.  About an hour before they were scheduled to closed this place was full.  

Located in the mission area you must go by and grab some.  

Cheers
author: Robert A.

description: Yasssssss. A thousand times yasssss to this place! The flavors here are so unique and I love it! Ice cream places like this give me life. I love finding unique flavors and Humphry's has it ten fold! I came in on a Friday afternoon and it wasn't too packed. When you walk in, there is a chalkboard with all the available flavors on it. I tasted a few: Tahitian Vanilla, Secret Breakfast, White Miso Peach, and Toast and Jam... Needless to say that toast and jam flavor was the winner! It tasted like my childhood breakfasts and exactly like grape jelly which got the little girl inside of me so freakin' excited. I took a scoop of that on a cone and was on my way. I was insanely excited to try my Uncle's ice cream as well and he got the blue bottle vietnamese coffee flavor. That was so good too! I'll definitely be back to Humphry's as soon as I'm back in the city. I really enjoyed this place and I recommend it if you're into unique and exotic ice cream flavors!
author: Taylor H.

description:
(4thUpdate)... AND WE SCORE!!!

Really? Am i that lonely in this city to have my monthly date with Humphry Slocombe....

we had a little bit of foreplay with
- McEvoy Olive Oil Ice Cream
- Hibiscus Beet Sorbet
- Mulled Wine Sorbet

BUT... we hit a homerun with the BUTTER BEER ICE CREAM tonight ;)

my kinda spot
author: Jane A.

description:
Look here now. I know you are tired of hearing about little boutique cafes or pizza places with artisanal pepperoni, but brace yourself because I have one more painfully hip place that you need to know about. 

Humphry Slocombe is a weird ice cream place. Weird because of the art. Weird because of the mutant trophy on the wall. Weird because of the fancy ass flavors. 

If you don't mind the alcohol, you need to try some secret breakfast. I know it sounds bad, but just stick with it. Oh but make sure to grab samples of...everything. With flavors like Jesus juice and olive oil how could you resist?

Fair warning, on the wrong day the line is out the door and down the sidewalk. Luckily  it moves quickly, so don't let it scare you away from the most perfectly SF ice cream.
author: Scott T.

description:
Came here and shared 3 scoops of icecream in a bowl with my boyfriend, because it's simply cheaper to have it together vs. couples who get their own.

We got their popular Secret Breakfast, Tahitian Vanilla and a 3rd flavor which I don't remember....but it was the least of my favorite. 

All the flavors were okay, but they weren't something that would make me come dashing for it. 
Secret Breakfast - good
Tahitian Vanilla - the best vanilla ice cream you'll ever have.

Overall not a bad experience, but I'm not an icecream person so I won't be coming here tooo much.
author: Harriet W.

description:
OMG - Nutter Fluffer is where it's AT! 

Peanut Butter ground by Project Open Hand - a SF nonprofit that serves the disadvantaged in our community with homemade meals & delivery - mixed with marshmellow to create one of the best flavors, textures, overall ice-cream-gasm you'll ever have! It was like eating the creamiest, light & a bit fluffy peanut butter ever. 

No, it's not one of their crazy inventions and it won't make the "EAT List" by the Chronicle (although it should, especially since proceeds go back to Project Open Hand) but it's one of the purest peanut butter ice creams I've had...and peanut butter is one of my fave flavors so I eat a lot of it! I think the only addition I would like is to somehow add in some chocolate (or banana!) but that's also just because I love that ingredient in ice cream, too. 

$2.75 for a single scoop in a cup. Totally worth it. I'll eat that flavor any day. YUM.
author: Marissa H.

description: After seeing this spot featured on the Food Network, I was finally able to try it out. I sampled the Secret Breakfast, which had a strong bourbon flavor that was reminding me of the wild night before, I got the Vietnamese coffee and the Tahitian vanilla. In my opinion, a specialty ice cream shop has to have a good solid vanilla. This place did not disappoint and it's probably the best vanilla ice cream I've ever had! I love me a good coffee ice cream and this one was tasty. I saw an olive oil flavored ice cream and a mushroom one that looked interesting. I'll have to be a little bit more adventurous the next time i come back!
author: Mymy N.

description: I heard about this place on the food channel so I thought I'd check it out. I came here on a hot Saturday night and there was a bit of a line but it didn't take long. Thankfully they let you sample the flavors which were delicious. I'm not a huge ice cream eater but I ended up getting two scoops. I got the secret breakfast and Tahitian Vanilla which I scarfed down. They were both amazingly flavored and delicious. If you like ice cream you should definitely stop by and try this place out. It will not disappoint. Parking is a little tricky to find around here but the taste of the ice cream will be worth it.
author: Jency D.

description:
Yeah so the ice cream is amazing. The only one I personally really liked was the Blue Bottle Coffee. 

The staff definitely has a Mission-vibe about them, really chill which I love. I just hate that I feel a little unsafe in the middle of the afternoon walking through the ghetto to get me some fabulous ice cream.

Don't forget to try their homemade cookies!
author: Jess C.

description: Back today and my tastes have changed since my original review. The ice cream here is too sweet to my current palate. However, it's still high quality and their flavors are quite unique so I can't t really sing them (had the cornbread jalapeño which was creamy goodness but became cloying and there definitely wasn't a chili kick). The service was better than average too.
author: Sandy G.

description:
Came there on a Sunday around 3:30pm and the line was long.....but it moved pretty fast thou.  

The staff was very friendly and welcome even they were so busy.  They were pretty generous about sampling.  

My friend and I shared a large (three  scopes $5.50) with Secret Breakfast, Vietnamese Coffee and Coconut Sherbet. All three flavors were good.  All ice-cream were light but very creamy and rich in the flavors.  Perfect sweetness too.

Among the three flavors, I like the Vietnamese Coffee the most.  It tasted actually like coffee..a strong one.  

It is good that this place is not closed to my home or work, otherwise it will ruin my diet plan!
author: Liza T.

description:
The flavors here are awesome! They offer different flavors every day so check in through facebook or maybe by calling them up to see what's being offered. 
Their signature flavor, Secret Breakfast (bourbon and cornflakes) is offered everyday. The strength of the rum can vary from batch to batch, but the frosted flakes even out the taste.
Flavors I've tried are: balsamic caramel, blue bottle Vietnamese coffee, fluffer nutter, malted dulce de leche, peanut butter curry (one of my favorites), red hot banana, and of course secret breakfast (all pints). Yeah. I've been here a bunch of times. I don't even live in SF... It's sort of addicting.

Oh yeah, parking is a bit hard to come by (SF you know) and there are less than 10 stools inside to sit on. Outside they have two tables for three people each maybe. Prices are a bit high at $7.50/pint but this isn't like picking up a pint at the grocery store.
author: Jose U.

description:
This is definitely a different type of ice cream shop and not like the 31 flavors or TCBY Treats of your youth.

You almost miss this place on Harrison because as Mari C. states, the sign just says "ice cream." 

Walk in, avoid the hideous painting on the wall to the right and say hello to Ms. Hipster listening to the indie rock of the 90's in the background.

*Prepare yourself for trendy existentialism talk.*

Vietnamese Blue Bottle Coffee=Intense coffee flavor and sweet cream 

Secret Breakfast=The secret is the bourbon and corn flakes

Kumquat Poppy Seed=Delightfully mouthy and zesty indeed

White Miso Pear=Subtle Soft Flavor and a finish similar to caramel but not quite...

Blood Orange Sorbet=Not quite as zesty as the Kumquat Poppy Seed but a great compliment.

The staff seems to be getting over their honeymoon period of "can I have a sample of this? and this? and this?"

Otherwise, a wonderful occasional treat.
author: Jessica K.

description:
4-stars for the entire experience.

This place isn't as busy as Bi-Rite Creamery, but they do have a line - that goes by pretty quick. 

They have more of the crazy flavors for those who enjoy trying new and "unique" flavors.

I had the Secret Breakfast, Tahitian Vanilla & the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee. My brother had the Dr Pepper.

Secret breakfast: Good bourbon flavored ice cream, but would be *better* if they added more of the cornflakes for an even texture throughout the ice cream.

Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee: Tastes like black coffee with light cream. If they were trying to achieve the milk version, having condensed milk swirled in would be probably be delicious.

Tahitian Vanilla: was pretty Damn good, especially together with the Vietnamese coffee. I have no complaints or suggestions about it. But, I don't know what's Tahitian about it.

(something) Dr Pepper: I'm not a fan of this, but for all you red bean lovers, this is for you. There's nothing Dr Pepper Soda Pop about it.
author: J T.

description:
I was excited to finally make a visit.  We were driving home and it was nice since it was right off the freeway.  We were lucky there was a short line - about 10 mins.  They had good flavors, some classics and I sampled the salt & pepper - very interesting.  And the root beer tasted exactly how you'd think.  

We tried the Toasted Almond - so good!  The almonds are crystalized.  Also the blue bottle vietnamese coffee - also good.  I also tried a bite of the Cinnamon Brittle - tasty good!  

I've tried a scoop of their secret breakfast at the ferry building when they had a stall there and that was quite something.  Definitely worth trying once.
author: Meredith K.

description: Not my favorite place for ice cream in the city, but it's decent. The flavors are fun and unique, and the sorbets are particularly good. I found the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee to be just okay, and I wasn't a fan of the very mild Black Sesame. Olive Oil and Secret Breakfast were better flavors. The ice cream is very rich, and I didn't come close to finishing my second scoop. It's kind of fatty and coats your tongue.
author: Katie B.

description:
Oh San Francisco. Only you would have corn-flavored ice cream. 

But really. Corn.

I wasn't as brave as my friends to try the odder flavors, I did rather enjoy the fluffer nutter. I would drive to Humphry from San Diego simply to eat it again.

And Secret Breakfast is...the domb diggity. Who know bourbon and corn flakes tasted so sweet?
author: Sarah G.

description: Secret Breakfast ice cream. It's corn flakes and bourbon. This is how I prefer alcohol forever. In ice cream. Thank you.
author: Jane F.

description: Blah blah etc etc. Yes everything is true about this place. God actually makes this deliciousness right here. So many good flavors and a few bad ones cant share what they are hint one is curry ughf...have funnand enjoy
author: EL D.

description:
Yes yes yes yes yes yes. My boyfriend keeps telling people "they just open up the pantry and make ice cream out of whatever they have". Our friend's took us here three weeks ago and it's all I can think about! I had the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee with hot fudge and it was every coffee-ice-cream lover's dream. I almost ordered they Caramel Whiskey Coke Float, but decided (and then later, undecided) that the caramel whiskey would have been too much for me, but it was soooo good!

A few years prior, I had my first taste of Humphry Slocombe by way of the salted chocolate ice cream at Public House and it was delicious. Try all the weirdness you can!!!
author: Erica S.

description: One of my favorite places in san francisco! Decadent and real! Real ingredients make a huge difference! Chunks of butter that sound like they dont belong in ice cream but tastes...AMAZING!
author: Deborah N.

description: Made it in as the last customer at 9:58pm and luckily they let us come in! I've bought pints and taken them home before but never bought a scoop here. The secret breakfast is my favorite that I've tried here, but be warned it does have quite a boozy taste! I found that the scoop I got was a lot softer aka not as frozen as I would've liked it, but I'm not sure if it was just this batch or if that's generally how this flavor works. I love the flavor, just like my ice cream more frozen than half melted. May just stick to the pre-packed pints!
author: Stephanie K.

description:
I was going to save my 100th review for my favorite restaurant in Boston, but I keep putting it off, so screw it. Here goes.

I love creativity in food, seeing ingredient combinations that you wouldn't expect together. If you're looking for that, in your ice cream, go here now!

Before deciding what flavor to get, I tried the McEvoy Olive Oil flavor - subtle, couldn't really taste the olive oil, but nice if you don't like KAPOW! in your ice cream. Then I tried the Chocolate Smoked Sea Salt, which was delicious - very bold chocolate flavor, and surprisingly salty for ice cream (as in, more than I expected).

But the one that won the spoon challenge was the Secret Breakfast. Omg, ice cream-gasm. You start out with a very creamy, not too sweet vanilla base. Then, as it goes down your throat, you get a kick from the bourbon. Also comes with corn flakes mixed in, which add nice crunchy bits to the experience.

I saw some other flavors in their to-go fridge that I would've loved to try, like Peanut Butter Curry and Creme Fraiche. Maybe next time they'll have those by the scoop.

I might get hate mail for this, but this place beats Bi-Rite. There, I said it. No death threats because I'll have to call the Yelp police.
author: Angel C.

description: This place was hyped up to me and it lived up to the hype! super cute, awesome staff who let us try every flavour, compostable cups and tasty ice cream. i even bought a mug with their two headed calf mascot on it. A must-visit!
author: Amanda F.

description:
I cannot believe this place only has 4 stars when Bi-Rite has 4.5.
Don't get me wrong bi-rite is solid, good quality, BORING ice cream, but Humphry Slocombe is out of this world good. I'd say that the actual quality of the ice cream is comparable, both have great mouth feel and unbelievable creaminess but what Humphry Slocombe has is a passion and creativity that you can taste in their ice cream.

Sometimes the flavors they put forth are a little odd but no matter what they always have 2 to 4 "normal" flavors like tahitian vanilla, blue bottle coffee, and smoked salt chocolate, but my personal all time favorite has to be the classic Secret Breakfast (bourbon and cornflake cookie). What really makes a scoop of Secret Breakfast one of the best things i have ever had in my life, is having it drowned in their DIVINE chocolate sauce.

I could write a whole nother paragraph on this chocolate sauce but i'll spare you that and just say GET IT.
author: Sara G.

description: Hands down the Best vanilla ice cream I have ever tasted !!! Tahitian vanilla is what it's called I believe. I rarely eat vanilla ice cream but something about this one as I was starring through the glass deciding what flavor to choose this one just spoke to. "Try me ! Try Me !" And so I did.  I get this flavor with something new Every time I come here now. The coffee flavor is also good. Can be abit strong but with vanilla it is the perfect combo !!!
author: Stephanie L.

description:
Since my first review of Humphry Slocombe, I've been to other ice cream stores for a fair comparison like Fenton's, Old San Francisco Creamery, Bi-Rite, Mitchell's, La Copa Loca, and Mr & Mrs Miscellaneous.  

And the result is... my heart, mind, and body still crave for Humphry. 

Humphry Slocombe Vietnamese Blue Bottle coffee ice cream still reigns as the best coffee ice cream I have ever tasted, followed by Secret Breakfast. The Lambic sorbet is unlike other sorbet I've tried.  Less icy and more creamy like ice cream.  (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/47OC_X6KkiDDQ4jwoCUjFg?select=ejNm6TpppJESF0Obbg3APg)
author: Hannah C.

description:
Great service! They definitely hook you up with the sizes!! I tried the POD, blue bottle Vietnamese iced coffee, secret breakfast, Jesus juice, and vanilla.

I think my fav of those was the blue bottle Vietnamese iced coffee. Will be back!
author: Sophie C.

description: Every time I head to SF I have to make a visit here. Love the ice cream and all the unique flavors. Hate the neighborhood. Last two times I have been there I been treated to fist fights out in the street. Not HS's fault of course but takes away from an otherwise great business. Also the help some times seems a little...detached. The four stars are for great ice cream.
author: James R.

description: The ice cream here is rich and creamy. But it is soft and salty as well. Definitely had (or even made) better. Go get a pint of Hagen Daas and you'll be much happier.
author: Discretio ..

description:
Humphrey never disappoints and creates new flavors to tantalize your senses. For the sample tastings, please be courteous and remember that there are people waiting in line.

While I don't have a sweet tooth, I'm a fan of the Secret Breakfast. 

Humphrey also makes a  vegan candy capped popsicle which is sold only at Far West Fungi in the Ferry Building. Definitely try that as it is happiness melting in your mouth.

Cash only.
author: Sophie C.

description:
The best ice cream I've ever had. Pretty big words, for pretty spectacular ice cream!

+whimsical flavors that actually taste great.
+ real ice cream.... That's icey!!! Not whipped airy cream

- location is not my favorite

Try the black sesame! So good!
author: Ashlie R.

description:
How these people are selling alcohol in ice cream without any id check or any warning. My pregnant friend start eating the ice cream then she realize it has bourbon whiskey in it. When I asked where is the alcoholic content information, they said the name of the ice cream flavor is enough. 
How these idiots get license to run this business. I am going to call fda and enquire about it. Please you should also try to stop them selling alcoholic ice cream to pregnant woman.
author: Atul K.

description:
I enjoy how plain and simple this gourmet ice cream place is, yet so dressed up. There are a few sundae options and a handful of the standard offerings, but with a few improvements. Like the peanut brittle, it's BACON peanut brittle. Instead of fudge brownies, it's VALHRONA fudge brownie.

They've also got quite the list of flavors (http://www.humphryslocombe.com/%7C_Flavors_%7C.html). It's hard to pick out any that I wouldn't try. Rest assured that any day you visit, this place will have something you want. With flavors like jesus juice, which mostly tastes like red wine, even sorbets and sherbets sound enticing. However, do beware that although something may sound good and look good, it may not actually taste as so. That said, the oolong that I had was way too salty. It's such a shame, but I'll be back again and again. The secret breakfast is good too, but I can't really see the hype considering I'm not a huge fan of cornflakes.

As for seating, there are about 8 counter seats facing the high windows, about 3 tables that seat 2 people outside, a sittable planter box, a sprinkling of sittable bollards at the intersections, and plenty of curbspace + standing room. Other notable things include a cute water dispenser with an actual spout, restroom, and uses Square.
author: Jennifer W.

description: They had different flavors than I was used to, which made choosing difficult. Nonetheless the ice cream was delicious and I would definitely come back.
author: Celeste D.

description:
I came here because a coworker told me to try the Secret Breakfast ice cream. As soon as I walked in, the guy working here could tell that it was my first time there since I wasn't staring at the flavors in confusion since there wasn't anything conventional there.

After some sampling, I went with my coworker's recommendation of Secret Breakfast. A cone of it cost $3.25. It was really sweet with a small kick of bourbon. The amount of alcohol in it is not enough to do anything to you so if you're unsure of trying alcoholic ice cream, I wouldn't be worried about it; it's just for taste. The corn flakes are an interesting addition to the ice cream too because they add some crunch to it.

I'll definitely be coming here a few more times this summer just to try out some other flavors.
author: Allen C.

description:
I am simple Chocolate Chip cookie and Mint Chip Ice Cream man. I like simple deserts and simple ingredients. 

Then I found Humphry Solcombe Ice Cream. They've ruined me. I love the Burbon Cornflake Ice Cream so much, I have actually started to dislike Mint Chip. . . I know I know. . .

Don't think about it - just go. The weirder it sounds the better it is. I promise you will not be disapointed!

-A
author: Adrian E.

description:
Just... magnificent.

I've heard a lot about this place, but Bi-Rite had always captured my heart with its salted caramel and floral persuasions. My husband came here alone one time and had the foie gras ice cream (which, honestly, grossed me out), which he liked.

On Valentine's Day, Hubbs made early dinner reservations in the city so we decided to grab dessert before-hand. Why not pop my ice cream cherry by trying Humphry Slocombe for the first time?

If any of you were there during Valentine's Day week, you'll know that they had a triage of beer flavors, which I thought was gross, considering it was ice cream. After a few tastes (did not care for the too-salty chocolate), I went with the Secret Breakfast, a unique and genius mixture of bourbon and cornflakes. By the end of my cup, the bourbon flavor was overpowering, but was the perfect matching scoop for my husband's ice cream, the beer-flavored one with cocoa nibs. The sweetness from the Secret Breakfast blended well with the bitter cocoa nibs. If I only had one or the other, I think their flavors would've been too much.

I liked them so much I made my new profile picture of me double-fisting both ice creams. Boom.

I'd say, this place is the most inventive and exploring ice cream parlors I've ever been to. Even more bold than Bi-Rite. If you want your familiar flavors, of course, go to Bi-Rite. If you want to push the envelope just a little, this place is perfect for you.
author: Becky K.

description:
If you like mayan mochas from Pete's coffee, you have to try this. 

Vietnamese coffee and cinnamon brittle.
author: ray r.

description: Got their best seller - the Secret Breakfast, which is bourbon and corn flakes. I had two scoops of ice cream heaven. This is a nice little shop in the Mission with fun quirky flavors. Knocked off a star as finding parking was like trying to find the Holy Grail. Lesson learned. Take BART. Then burn those calories walking in Balmy Alley and enjoying the murals.
author: Reena C.

description:
I've had Humphry Slocombe on my list for ages and after finally making my way here, I can say without a doubt that they make some DAMN GOOD ice cream!  The guy behind the counter was awesome and encouraged me to try as many flavors as I liked...how could I not oblige? ;)  Over the next couple minutes, I savored sweet deliciousness in the form of Secret Breakfast, Chocolate Smoked Sea Salt, Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee, Pumpkin 5-spice, Fluffernutter, Brown Sugar Fennel, Tahitian Vanilla and Jesus Juice sorbet.

The secret breakfast more than lives up to to the rave reviews - I loved the firm bourbon flavor and added crisp from the cornflakes combined in a very well-balanced consistency that was neither excessively icy or creamy.  The chocolate smoked sea salt was also a huge winner as the sea salt added so much complexity to the chocolate.  Not surprisingly, I ordered a scoop of each and nommed in utter bliss =D  My friend's seasonal pumpkin 5-spice sundae was pretty ridiculous too with its marshmallow and crushed graham cracker.

It's interesting that a number of people say that the ice cream is too rich/creamy.  Perhaps they've never had Haagen-Dazs or Fenton's, but I would hardly describe this place's offerings as overly heavy...

Up there and, with certain flavors, exceeding Ici in execution and uniqueness.  Such win!
author: Eric F.

description: Blue bottle coffee & tahitian  vanilla are my favorite!  Love the reasonable prices & super friendly staff.
author: Kathie C.

description:
Yum.  As ice cream snobs who literally walked out of the Ice Cream Festival in SOMA without ordering a thing we came here and we're delighted. 
Everything we tried was delicious! We settled on vanilla with hot fudge, Matilda (super chocolate with chocolate cake, root beer-sassafras). 
We we got lucky with one of owners as our...sommelier. He was delightful. His passion and excitement took the already satisfying ice cream to the next level. 
The brown sugar ice cream cone was perfect- extra tasty without overwhelming the ice cream.
author: Andrew C.

description:
Unique flavors and the wait in line is not too bad (though I went on a cool spring evening, not a hot summer day....but let's be honest, SF doesn't really have too many of those). I sampled the Harvey Milk (honey and graham cracker) and the Candicapp which is apparently a naturally sweet wild mushroom (???), and ended up ordering a scoop of the Harvey Milk and a scoop of Blue Bottle Vietnamese coffee. Both were good, but I would definitely try other flavors before ordering those flavors again. Harvey Milk definitely had a lighter milk flavor and you could definitely taste the honey, but I wish it had larger bits of graham cracker in it  as opposed to what seemed like crumbs. The Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee was delicious, rich and smooth. I definitely tasted the Blue Bottle coffee and it had a condensed milk flavor to it, just like Vietnamese coffee.

All in all, it was a solid ice cream experience and I would definitely go back if I'm in the neighborhood.
author: Jacki S.

description: You won't find any regular ice cream flavors here! If you're looking to try something new, and don't mind standing in a long line, you should definitely check this place out. They were unable to take credit cards the night we were there, and it was a bear to find an ATM, so keep that in mind. Never hurts to carry a small amount of cash with you when you're wandering the city anyway. We tried the Special Breakfast, and while it wasn't our particular cup of tea, the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee was excellent. Will definitely stop in again when in the area.
author: Matt S.

description: Celiacs BEWARE, most of their ice cream contains GLUTEN, a totally unnecessary ingredient for suber fab ice cream!
author: Alison h.

description:
Yum!!!!! Who would have thought that this little place has some good ice cream? The server was really nice and let us try like every single flavor on the menu which was super nice! Don't be afraid to ask them to try anything that you want. 

I ended up getting the malted chocolate and it was so good! I mean it tasted like regular chocolate but something about it was a little different.

The secret breakfast flavor is apparently their best flavor but I didn't like it at all. It definitely was interesting though.

This place does give bi rite a run for it's money. It's also on the more expensive side because it came out to over $4 for one single scoop.
author: Stephanie W.

description:
Unique, no fuss ice cream shop with amazing, fresh flavors.  The flavors on the website aren't always available but according to other yelpers, myself included, sounds like they have a few favorite mainstays that their customers can't seem to get enough of.

I helped myself to a two-scooper -- Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee and Secret Breakfast (bourbon and cornflake).  The Secret Breakfast was love at first taste.  The bourbon flavor is strong but the flavor stops just shy of that all-too-familiar alcohol burn and shudder when a drink is just a little too strong, and the cornflakes provided great texture and cereal-milk creaminess.  The BB Vietnamese Coffee wasn't nearly as strong as a real Vietnamese coffee, but had a great flavor and rich color.

Came here on a Monday night around 9:30, so no lines for us.

Cereal and coffee? This could satisfy any adult's request of ice cream for breakfast (even the bourbon).
author: Monica H.

description:
What I ate: Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee ice cream with hot fudge
Visit date: October 13, 2011
First time? Yes.

I am hard to please with ice cream -- that's a fact. Humphry didn't impress me much. I tried the Azuki Bean & Dr. Pepper ice cream. I've never had an azuki bean before, but I've had Dr. Pepper and I didn't taste it in the ice cream. Not impressed. Then, I decided to stick to a flavor I knew -- coffee. It's my favorite ice cream flavor and am always up to try variations. The combo of 'coffee' and 'sugar' was off. It was super sweet. Again, not impressed, but it was hot outside and wanted to cool down from the within side. I wasn't up for trying any of their other flavors so I settled for coffee. If in the area, it's hot and I'm craving ice cream, I may or may not stop by again and try something new. It's not worth the trip to the Mission just for Humphry Slocombe.
author: Erin G.

description: Why haven't I come across this gem any sooner? Tried secret breakfast and it was delicious! The consistency of the ice cream was thick and creamy and the base was sooo flavorful with bits of waffles for a nice crunch. I could definitely taste the sweet bourbon and I don't even like bourbon! The shop is small with simple decor and few seating. What sucks is that when I crave for this I'll be having to drive 2 hours away! Can't wait to go back to try the other flavors!
author: Crystal C.

description:
Unique, Funny and Creamy!

Staff working here was eager to let me try all of the flavors, which was awesome because I wanted to! 

i have been searching for years for a vanilla that tastes like this! "Tahitian V@nil*a"  has that perfect home made taste that I have been missing since my childhood. Humphry Slocombe, thank you. Also, the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee and Secret Breakfast are stars of the show- duh!
author: Stephie M.

description:
Mmm ice cream.  It takes a bit of convincing to get me to go to ice cream on a mildly cold day.  Alcohol and ice cream?  COUNT ME IN (I said a bit of convincing).  I had the "secret breakfast" (corn flakes & bourbon) and it was great.  I'm pretty sure all ice cream is supposed to have some kind of alcohol in it.  Samples were available and I think you can try about three before the employees start to get a bit wary of you.  

I did ask for a cone for my single scoop and got it in a cup.  When I asked for a cone again, the employee looked at me and asked, "really?".  I nodded yes and she went to the back to get my cone, and started talking to her other coworker.  My bad for wanting a cone, my bad.

The ice cream was REALLY sweet, maybe too sweet for me.  The slight attitude regarding my cone was unwanted.  But love the alcohol.  Did not love the line that I had to wait in for all of the above (took about 20 minutes to get into the door to start sampling).
author: Lynn C.

description: The POG Sorbet was great but the Bananas of Babylon was just the best damn Ice Cream I have ever had bar none.Better than Fosselmans in Alhambra Ca. which had set the standard until now.
author: Andrew S.

description: Excellent customer service. I'd turn tricks for a slice of their pie or a secret breakfast affogato.
author: Melissa S.

description: Unusual and always unique, flavors of distinction, unparalleled by any (just wish there was more parking!)
author: Jarion M.

description:
The most unique ice cream flavors in SF.  Here's some more that I've tried:

[[ Brown Sugar Fennel ]] - too much fennel for me.
[[ Butterbeer ]] - Guinness and butter - but the butter taste overwhelmingly predominates in this ice cream
[[ Chocolate Smoked Seasalt ]] - yum!
[[ Guiness Gingerbread ]] - chunks of gingerbread in a smooth Guiness-base
[[ Oolong Tea ]] - I know I've never had this flavor of ice cream anywhere before, but it has such a familiarity to it, probably because it is so authentic in taste. But it's also lightly sweet.
[[ I Have A Dreamsicle ]] - very light/subtle in flavor. I think this was just in honor of the MLK holiday.
[[ Peanut Butter Curry ]] - too much peanut butter and too much curry for me.
[[ Thai Chili Lime ]] - tangy/spicy - a perfect mix of Thai flavors & the tartness of lime
author: Jeanne L.

description:
Humphrey Slocombe, whoever you are, your ice-cream namesake really disappointed me. This spot has been on my ice cream list for some time now, and I was eager to see how it stood up compared to the other city's best that I've tried (Bi-Rite, Mr and Mrs Miscellaneous). Well, turns out it doesn't stand up at all. Sort of fell over onto its face.

I had to wait in a decently long line.  It was a sunny Saturday afternoon, so that's fine and to be expected. What's not fine and to be expected are employees who want to rush you through that line (ok, I get that you can't stand there and sample every flavor, but with weirdly intriguing names like "secret breakfast" and "jesus juice," you kind of want to try before purchasing) and treat you like you're inconveniencing them by being there. 

Service is one thing, but taste/flavor/etc is another. If a meal or sweet is really great, it doesn't entirely bug me if the service sucked. I tried a few flavors and settled on secret breakfast, which is a blend of bourbon and corn flakes. It was pretty icy/thin; not creamy at all. And there were literally two pieces of corn flakes in the entire thing. Bourbon just started tasting like sweet vanilla after a few bites.

I realize after writing this that I sound pretty nitpicky and crazy. But I think if you're going to wait in line and shell out bucks for super gourmet/famously good ice cream, it should be super gourmet and famously good! Maybe Humphrey was having an off day. Maybe I was. But to be honest, I probably won't be going back.
author: Elena K.

description: Well now... I'm down with dishin attitude, but you better not be giving me attitude when I'm paying for ice cream. In San Francisco of all places. Harrison Street tonite, let's say 6ish. Cool dude, with big ears and a birthmark, giving me attitude. You ain't cool, you ain't cute, and you of all people should not be serving people anything for consumption. Oh, and next time you dis me, make sure mf-er there aren't any witnesses! Just some sound advice. And I'm not done yet.
author: Elizabeth Q.

description: My new favorite ice cream shop. The Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee and Secret Breakfast....that is all I have to say! Lol
author: Abegail D.

description: Considering this was my first time here, I think it was OK. I had tried this brand offered at a restaurant before (oolong tea and miso- which were quite interesting light flavors). I secretly wish I could try all the flavors before buying but of course the long lines would not have allowed me to do so! I went with the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee and a boysenberry one. Personally not a fan of the Secret Breakfast but can see why others would like it. I liked the coffee one! Kinda pricey $4 for a scoop which looked kind of small on the cone compared to the cup size; so go with a few additional scoops for a cheaper price.
author: Allyson L.

description:
We decided to walk over to the ice cream shop at 9PM on a Friday night.  While I expected a line down the block, I was pleasantly surprised that we were able to stand in the doorway.  The friendly staff efficiently worked their way through the line, even though they are willing to give you a spoon of anything to make your selections.

I ordered the small (a BARGAIN at $3.75), which was two scoops - one of brown sugar fennel ice cream and one of honey thyme ice cream.  This was a match made in heaven - a floral combination that was uber creamy and not overly sweet.  My sweetie had the VERY sweet combination of secret breakfast and vietnamese coffee, both of which were very creamy.  I was surprised that the cornflakes hold up in the secret breakfast, and the boubon is necessary to cut through the syrupy sweetness of this ice cream.  The vietnamese coffee is strong and is a contender in the coffee ice cream category.

Personally, I prefer my local Handel's or Bi-Rite in San Francisco, but I would not kick Humphry Slocombe off my cone.  :)
author: Stephanie B.

description:
Still my favorite ice cream store, and I love it more now that I get to make their yumminess at my own home with their ice cream book. Huge portions still and that secret breakfast was definitely strong on the bourbon...lush!

Note: they started adding sales tax to the cone cost so it's higher than before.
author: Pauline L.

description:
HOLY SMOKES! This place is amazing! My friend's sister lives in the bay area and she was telling us about this place that had ice cream with weird flavors like Olive Oil and Whisky w/ cornflakes and I was like.. hrmm that really doesn't sound too appealing, so she took us here so we could see for ourselves. I am now a believer.

I had a sample of the Mulled Wine Sorbet (sweet, yet refreshing), the Peanut Butter Curry (nutty with a kick!) and the Secret Breakfast - vanilla ice cream made with bourbon and cornflakes (omg!). I ended up getting a scoop of the Secret Breakfast, which is quite possibly the best ice cream I've ever had in my life. They also had a candy cap mushroom, which I didn't try, but my friend really loved it. 

If you're looking for something a bit different, try this place and sample everything. I can't wait to go back again.
author: Alyssa B.

description:
Super creative ice cream flavors, not particularly well-executed. Think: olive oil, curry, etc. Kinda nasty huh?

I ended up getting some of the more normal stuff, after sampling several flavors, I got Secret Breakfast (infused with alcohol and mixed with cereal) and some sort of Chocolate, which tasted like normal chocolate. The regular size (2 scoops) was actually quite huge. My ice cream ended up looking a bit unappetizing (http://media1.px.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/7HmQQjWrAIs8Cpm9JMDkMw/l) but it was pretty good.

Unfortunately, I couldn't finish the chocolate--it was just too rich and creamy for me to handle after a while. Secret Breakfast was pretty okay though. Overall, this is my least favorite of the gourmet ice cream places I have been to.
author: K W.

description:
After hearing about this place from my brother, I looked it up. I went with my friends and while we waited inline one of the workers came out and gave us all samples. Whenever I go they don't have the flavors I want to try such as the proscuitto or foie gras. Luckily, my favorite ice cream flavor is coffee and I loved there blue bottle vietnamese coffee ice cream even though I'm not a fan of vietnamese coffee. The only downside to this was the 45 minute wait, with a line that went down the street. 

They have pretty good service, except for the fact they didn't have enough water, and one customer decided to open the top of the water dispenser and scoop up water.....this was tragic because I was exceptionally thirsty after my fudgesicle ice cream. =[[

Overall I wouldn't mind waiting in line again not only cause of love ice cream, not only cause I love coffee ice cream, but cause I love there blue bottle vietnamese coffee ice cream.....and cause the drive out here is far so I might as well wait in line.
author: Sean W.

description:
If you see toast and jam on their flavor menu- just get it! I only wish they had it more often!

They have some unusual flavors here- jalapeno cornbread, miso peach, brown sugar fennel -which makes it a fun experience. 
Service is friendly and they let you taste before you commit!
author: Anj M.

description:
At first someone kept telling me to come here and I didn't want to make it a big deal. Unfortunately, it IS a BIG DEAL. Ice cream has never tasted so good. I LOVE Molly Moon's in Seattle, but flavor wise, this place has Molly Moon's beat! Sure there's no maple bacon ice cream or have the smooth creaminess (which I LOVE) that Molly Moon does, but the flavors here are unique and never get old. I have four flavors and THAT'S A LOT for me. 

Faves:

Salted watermelon (I would eat this many more times than I would salted caramel at MM's)

Secret breakfast (you can say you'll agree to put Bourbon in your frosted flakes cereal)

Blue Bottle Vietnamese coffee (you'll want a kick of this over the drink ANY DAY)

If you check out their full menu online, they're stacked with WILD flavors.
author: Lily L.

description:
I tried the infamous secret breakfast and I am definitely a fan! The prices are a more pricey than I'm used to but the ice cream here is really legit and unique! Personally, one scoop of secret breakfast was just right for me. It gets pretty sweet in my opinion but the more you eat it, the more of the flavors you'll taste. I definitely recommend it the first time around!

Can't wait to try the other flavors!
author: Joseph L.

description:
I heard about the foie gras and prosciutto ice cream here on food network and it's been sitting in my queue for a while. I tried a few flavors: secret breakfast, Vietnamese coffee and miso with peach. I got a scoop each of the latter two. Both were full flavored although the texture is a bit icy, not as creamy as some other gourmet ice cream places that I've tried. After a few licks, the strong favors became a bit overwhelming. I don't like overly sweet things so this place isn't quite my cup of tea, although I understand why some people swear by it.

On a positive note, the place is a lot cheaper than most other ice cream places though -- $3.75 for two scoops.
author: Alice W.

description:
my two all time favorite flavors there are:
secret breakfast
jesus juice

a SF treasure
author: A K.
