description:
Vietnamese coffee is all I ask for, and I'll be on my way. Limoncello Sorbet is great, too, as is Secret Breakfast.

Can be a bit crowded...
author: Garett T.

description:
YAYYYY I'm so glad I got to try Humphry Slocombe Ice Cream!!! YUMMMAZE! 

I tried the firey hot banana (tasted like a cinnamon ball candy), the secret breakfast.. LOL more like hangover Sunday w/ all its rum. The Jesus Juice did taste like the coca cola gummy. 

I ended up with the Vietnamese Coffee flavored one, was good, but not great. Maybe because I ate it on a cold day. What was fascinating, is that there were tons of people outside hanging out. I do love the atmosphere. I thought they had more flavors, but guess not.
author: Jenna L.

description:
Sister took me here after we wanted something sweet.  I've never had an array of such unique flavors from which to choose!  The guy behind the counter was super nice and (I'm guessing because there wasn't much of a line at the time) let us try a lot of flavors.  I am most impressed that they give out samples on actual little metal spoons!  It just adds a touch of quality to the overall experience.  

I ended up with the Brown Butter---who could resist!?  The ice cream is super smooth and creamy and doesn't leave a weird film in your mouth.  And the flavor is to die for---it tastes like it sounds but 10x better.

Lavender thyme and secret breakfast were also ordered during this visit and both did not disappoint.  I like the crunch of the corn flakes in the secret breakfast.

Need to go back!
author: Stephanie C.

description:
It feels kinda wrong NOT to like this place. That's why I whispered, "Bi-Rite is better" to my date when we went here. I went back again just to make sure; and yep, sure enough, Bi-Rite (and also Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous) is better.

Don't get me wrong, this isn't to say that the ice cream isn't good; because it is. It's just too weird for my palate. When I'm craving ice cream, I want something a bit sweet, something nostalgic yet unique; unless you grew up on Neverland Ranch, Jesus Juice sorbet (red wine + cola) isn't very reminiscent of my childhood.

Though I will say: the coconut sherbet was pretty darn tasty.
author: Adena B.

description:
There are so many UNIQUE flavors at this place, and I do not use the word unique lightly. There are so many interesting flavors you want to try but probably would not want a whole scoop of. 

The Jesus Juice flavor is not a bad choice to try (wine and coke). It is more of a sorbet than an ice cream but it is not a bad choice.

My favorite flavor here though was the blue bottle Vietnamese coffee. The ice cream had a nice coffee flavor to it but not too overpowering. If you do not what vietnamese coffee is, it is just coffee with condensed milk. It is by far my favorite flavor in this store
author: Spencer E.

description:
Always a sucker for yummy novelty/weird/unusual foods, I loved every minute of my time at Humphry Slocombe Ice Cream!

This isn't your run-of-the-mill ice cream flavors but they have a large selection of choices that rotate so you'll never quite know what's available. Just check out some of the weird choices: bacon, ancho chile, beets (gahh... I wonder if it has the same body fluid color changing properties as the original... ewww), Elvis the Fat Years (no idea...), foie (yeahhh...), jalapeno, Jesus Juice (ummm... yeah), olive oil, mushroom, pepper corn, potato chips, prosciutto, salt and pepper. Now they DO have the usual flavors (strawberry, chocolate, etc.) but I come here to taste the strange flavors. Those flavors taste EXACTLY like the real thing. WEIRDEST. ICE CREAM. EVER. But don't get me wrong: they're delicious too! 

I can just see myself coming over one day to create a crazy dish for my friends: bacon, jalapeno, prosciutto, mushroom, salt and pepper and slap that on a bun and tell them it's a hamburger. Bahahahhaha! Tempting...
author: Don D.

description:
Amazeballs!

While visiting SF, one of my local friends took me to this place and I couldn't have been more appreciative! I got the ice cream with stout in it expecting it to taste like beer, but instead it was sweet, smooth, delicious creaminess that made me feel like an adult since there was a hint of alcoholic flavor to it. 

Just like pretty much everyone else has said on their reviews, this is an epic ice cream shop and I'm really glad I got to try it in SF, but at the same time, it made me really sad that Houston doesn't have this level of awesome.
author: Andrew E.

description:
After hearing mixed reviews about the "secret breakfast" that everyone talks about, I wanted to try this place. Big ice cream lover over here!

Reviews on the 3 flavors I tried:
- blue bottle Vietnamese coffee --- YUM!  probably the best coffee ice cream I've ever had...
- secret breakfast - good, but not sure if i could handle an entire order
- pepper mint - meh, nothing too impressive. PASS!

One thing I REALLY liked was that they give samples on metal spoons vs. those standard plastic ones - very good and heightens the ice cream sampling experience.

CON - the guy helping us was a bit off, sort of rude about us trying flavors and impatient about us deciding when there wasn't ANYONE else in line and it's not like we took that long... I mean c'mon it was our first time there, geez.

$2.75 for a single scoop
author: Melody T.

description:
As a lactard, I tend to avoid places that specialize in cream - but I make a few exceptions. One of those is Humphry Slocombe. Whenever I need to kill and ice cream craving I make my way over. The lines are never crazy (unlike birite) and the counter service has always been exceptional. 

I love the texture, it isn't super creamy like processed ice-cream and it reminds me of the homemade style my grandmother used to serve. As for melt - I can't say, I have never had it in front of me long enough to see it melt :)

The flavors are great - I really like POG, Secret Breakfast and the vietnamese coffee.

gah, now that I have reviewed it I feel calling to stop by this weekend!
author: Joseph A.

description: I had Humphry Slocombe Ice Cream for the first time last night.  It was tasty and the location is cute.  I tried Secret Breakfast, Banana Chai and the Harvey Milk Honey Graham.  All were tasty, but a bit sweet for my palate.  (I still prefer Mitchell's or Bi-rite personally.)
author: Christy L.

description:
I really like this Ice Cream place. Compared to Ici in Berkeley, the flavors are richer and stronger. I had the Vietnamese coffee flavor, and just loved it. The ice cream captured the slightly-burnt taste that Vietnamese coffees usually have (and that I love). 

Also had the plain chocolate flavor - one of the flavors I use to 'judge' the taste of an ice cream. It was not overly buttery or sweet. In fact, it was quite similar to the chocolate flavor at Ici, but just a little stronger. As a choco-holic, loved it. 

Personally, I really liked the neighborhood, too. It felt very 'alive'. Planning on going back.
author: Soo Jung R.

description:
The name (hump-free-slow-cum) says it all!  


I mean, how does a person have a long lasting orgasm without humping around?  

Answer:  Have a Secret Breakfast with Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee! 

The Best!!!!
author: Bobby L.

description:
I like Humphry a little more than Bi-Rite because of the slight creamier texture of their ice cream.

The Balsamic Caramel may have to be an acquired taste for me. Well, I did see the note next to the sign... something like what do you expect? It's vinegar!

Anyways I did like how the balsamic neutralizes the caramel a bit. Bi-Rite's salted caramel gets too sweet after a while.

The White Chocolate Lavender was delicious. Creamy light white chocolate flavor with a distinct lavender breeze afterward.

Burp! lavender breeze...
author: Sam T.

description: Their website states "Ice Cream with Attitude"....and it sure is! Love them!! Pepper and Mint Chip, Pink Grapefruit Tarragon, Secret Breakfast and Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee are flavors to try. Can't wait to visit them again when I'm back in town!
author: Erica T.

description: Vanilla and chocolate are so...vanilla. This little gem supplies voracious foodies and flavor hunters with quite a treat. Although some flavors are absolutely dreadful, it makes tasting all the more fun. The basil lime sorbet was superb! Can't wait to come back for more.
author: Danielle O.

description:
One of the best ice cream joints I have ever tried. I'll be leaving San Francisco soon and I realized that ice cream is one of the only foods you cannot bring back with you... oh well.

Anyway, I tried their Secret Breakfast ice cream, which is a bourbon flavored ice cream with corn flakes mixed in. Doesn't sound appetizing, ty it! It's outstanding! Blue Bottle coffee even serves this flavor of their ice cream with a shot of expresso on top, it is a must try. I also tried their coffee ice cream, which is made with blue bottle coffee, their proscuitto (that's right) ice cream, peanut butter curry, and spicy chocolate (it's hot and cold at the same time).

The prices are very reasonable too, you can get a small for under $3, in this city that's a bargain.
author: Michael C.

description:
First sign that this place was good -- arrived at 4pm and the line was out the door and on its way towards blocking traffic on the street! 

My friends and I waited for about 20 minutes for some ice cream at Humphry's. The flavors this place offered were so unique, I really had no idea what I wanted! I ended up having a taste of the Jesus Juice, Secret Breakfast, and Earl Grey Plum Sorbet (sorry to hold up the line everybody!). All of which were great. I was feeling something subtle and light, so I decided to get the Earl Grey. 

The fact that I was blown away by the ice cream even on a full stomach (I was at sf street food fest all day) really tells me something.  I'll be back to try some of the other flavors.
author: Elaine N.

description:
Really? I don't know why everyone raves about this spot. 

I've been here twice. Waaaaay too sweet.  I had a weird taste in my mouth after eating their ice cream.  That weird feeling where you think you just had bad milk.  I've had their Breakfast Cereal, Rum Raisin. 

Not my cup of tea.
author: Nikki Z.

description:
Saw on top 5 restaurants, and while ice cream was pretty rich ... I wasn't impressed by the flavors (of which there aren't very many).  I kept sampling and couldn't really find one I liked.  
If Joe's Ice Cream was on Valencia instead of in the Richmond District - it would have 10000 yelp reviews.
author: A D.

description:
More like 3.5, so to be fair I rounded up. :)

Tried the Secret Breakfast and Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee flavors.  I really enjoyed the first few bites of the Secret Breakfast, but afterwards, all I could taste was the bourban. I guess it wasn't really for me, since I'm not much of an alcohol drinker (except for wine!)  I did enjoy the cornflakes though!  Wish there were more in it.  
The Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee was just a tad strong, but I did enjoy it.  

I would come back to try the other flavors.

Parking is pretty tough in the area....depending on the time and day you go.  We were lucky to get parking right across the street.
author: Sheila M.

description:
Mmmmm! That's all I have to say.

My friend YJ and I decided to get some tacos in Mission before catching the Giants game and playing some pool (totally her activities) ;P. It was her birthday the following day so I decided to follow her around in her territory to see what all of the locals did on a Friday night. ;) 

After delicious mexican food at Tacos Vallarta (http://www.yelp.com/biz/taqueria-vallarta-san-francisco), we walked over to Humphry Slocombe's Ice Cream because YJ swore up and down that they had the best ice cream. I had wanted to try Bi-Rite but heck, we were in the area so Humphry's it was!

There were so many flavors I wanted to try but I didn't want to bother the ladies working there with, "Can I try this? And that? Ooh and that, too. No nevermind that!" so I stuck with 2-3 tastings. I settled on ... ugh, I don't even remember anymore. I took a picture of it, though, so I hope someone can figure it out! I am really punching myself in the face for forgetting the name because it was heavenly! I can still feel the sweetness of it on my tongue...

The best part of my visit here is that when we got to the register, my girlfriend YJ was about to pay because she wanted to treat me for treating her to dinner (yeah, I don't get it either -- it was her birthday!), the cashier heard me mentioning her birthday and decided to just give the ice cream to us! (She got the cone, I got two scoops in a cup.) Yay, free ice cream!

Now I don't know if they always do this or if the cashier gal was in a friendly mood but don't go stampeding to Humphry's just because it's your birthday now. ;)

For a Friday night, it wasn't all too busy and I really enjoyed the flavors they have. I wish they'd open up a shoppe here in Los Angeles; I'd sacrifice gaining five pounds to have their ice cream everyday! ;D (Yeah, it's that good.)

(Love the weird decor, too. Hello, two-headed cow, sir!)
author: Stace K.

description:
"Wonka: Wait! Before we go on. I must show you this. Lickable wallpaper for nursery school walls. Go ahead, try it. The oranges taste like oranges, the raspberries taste like raspberries, the snausberries taste like snausberries. 
Violet: Snausberry, who ever heard of a snausberry?
Wonka: We are the music makers and we are the dreamers of a dream."

Wow Humphrey's...the snausberries DO taste like snausberries!

What am I talking about, you ask? Why, Humphrey's wacky yet delectable palette of experimental ice cream deliciousness, of course! (try saying that 5 times fast!) They taste like they sound, and in some weird, magical way, they totally work. I don't think I can ever go back to eating plain old Rocky Road ever again.

It was a cold Wednesday night and the line flowed out the door onto the sidewalk. I stood behind a girl in a corsetted Renaissance dress with underwire skirt, fishnet stockings, and pigtails.

As we approached the counter, we wished we could sample everything - salt and pepper, McElwoy Olive Oil, salted watermelon, ancho chocolate, Secret Breakfast, Blue Bottle coffee...it was hard to limit the sampling to just two or three (or four) without looking like what Ed U would call a skinny bitch.

As we sampled, my husband and I just kept looking at each other all wide-eyed and smiling in a "I can't believe this OLIVE OIL ice cream is actually good!" kind of way. 

The ancho chocolate reminded me of the chocolate mole my mom makes for tamales - the spicyness of the chile and sweet richness of the dark chocolate were magic! 
Olive oil tasted more like a light whipped-lemon flavor than olive oil. 
And salt and pepper tasted exactly like it sounds, but it was good! I can see you making a face right now...stop it.

I ended up going with the Blue Bottle Coffee and salted watermelon. The watermelon was crisp, refreshing though I couldn't taste the "salted" part. Blue Bottle Coffee was amazingly rich and creamy with tiny specks of coffee ground sprinkled throughout. 

My husband opted for Secret Breakfast. An old-timer who resembled Willie Nelson told us it's the only flavor he ever gets there, so my husband had to try it. It's now his new favorite. 

Considering that Humphrey's rotates their menu of 70+ flavors to feature only 10 flavors a day, it's a place you can't fully experience without a few repeat visits. I plan to make weekly thing of it. It's like cashing in my Wonka Golden Ticket any time I want.

"But, hurry please! We have so much time and so little to see. Wait a minute! Strike that. Reverse it."
author: Mariela D.

description: Heard good things about this place from my friend who is an ice cream connoisseur so I had high expectations. I tried a few flavors that were either good or okay but none that really stood out. But then I tried Secret Breakfast. Wow it's a great blend of bourbon ice cream and corn flakes and it's quite delectable. They had some other pretty cool unique flavors and the attendees were nice and very informative.
author: Ugo N.

description:
finally a place that lives up to the hype.  This place delivers where Bi-Rite falls far short.  Interesting flavors.  Really friendly service.  They will let you taste just about everything and the flavors are subtle but true to the natural flavor of the ingredients.  I did taste just about everything but ended up ordering the Elvis (banana, peanut brittle and bacon).  It tastes just about as good as it sounds.  Big chunks of peanut brittle, smooth banana flavor throughout and nice bacon surprise every now and again. 

Also had the olive oil.  It was rich and creamy going in with the olive oil flavor finish.  Very subtle and quite nice.  

So why not 5 stars.  The ice cream is quite sweet.  The first scoop is a 5 star experience.  The second scoop takes it down to 4.  It is just too much of a sugar assault on the palate.  Go with friends, order different scoops for each and try a bunch.  

Any way you cut it....so much better than Bi-Rite.
author: Scott C.

description:
Oh man I think I'm going to get murdered but....I was extremely disappointed by Humphry Slocombe ice cream. I tried both the Vietnamese Coffee and the Secret Breakfast. I couldn't finish either because they were too sweet and too strong for my taste. I got sick after a few bites of each.  

I really wish I could say I loved my ice cream...but I didn't. 

This is totally a personal taste thing as I have to give credit to the awesome creativity in coming up with flavors that seem to work. I think I'm just more of an Ici (Berkeley) ice cream person.
author: Jennie C.

description:
Just as everything is in Mission, quaint, one-of-a-kind, foodie hotspot. 

Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee: Strong as can be without being overly bitter or piercingly sweet. In other words, perfection.

Peanut Butter Curry: It's more sweet than savory and no, it is not spicy but it does have a hint of spice. This was my personal favorite. The peanut butter flavor is more prominent but the curry comes as a surprise after each bite. Delightful!

Chocolate Salted Caramel: It's too salty for ice cream. Enough said.

Dulce de Leche: Sweet but lacking flavor. It tasted like brown sugar to me.

Secret Breakfast: If you're a Bourbon lover, this flavor was created for you. Plus, it's their signature flavor so if you're looking for something unique, it's worth the try!

Staff was helpful and let us try as many samples as we desired despite the line forming behind us. Limited seating is available but come on, it's a lovely day, go out and burn the calories by walking WHILE eating your scoop or two.
author: Allison M.

description: Loved the bourbon and cornflakes! Great delicious flavor options (including sorbets). The staff were in a good mood given the hour and they kept things moving along - even with my 3 tastings.
author: Patrick C.

description:
Visited here for the first time with friends. What a great place. The staff are really friendly and are happy for you try the flavours before you buy. 

I went for the malted chocolate and it was delicious. The serving generous and the taste superb.

If you are in SF you should visit this place, excellent flavours and good pricing too.
author: Nathan D.

description:
I'm a fan of ice cream shops with unique flavors, but Humphrey Slocombe definitely tops them all. The character of the surrounding neighborhood and diverse mix of customers always adds to the experience during each of my visits. Humphrey Slocombe definitely has flavors for all ages. 

My favorite is the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee. Though this flavor is more on the safer side, it is simply delicious! We have also enjoyed Fluffernutter (peanut butter and marshmallows), Carrot Mango, and Nectarine Honey. 

Other flavors that I have seen include the famous Jesus Juice, Prosciutto, Honey Thyme, Secret Breakfast, Thai Chili Lime, and Balsamic Caramel.   I recently found out that they sometimes have Mint Chip and Foie Gras flavors too, which I will surely go back for to try out. Since they rotate their flavors, you never really know what they have until you get there. I travel over 300 miles to visit Humphrey Slocombe; otherwise, I'd be here all the time! 

Cool fact: When paying by credit card, they use an ipad to process your payment and can email or text your the receipt instead of using paper.
author: Michelle H.

description:
I've been coming here for years before I actually moved to SF and now that I'm here, it feels like the right time to review. 

This is my favorite ice cream spot in the city (I've yet to try Mr. & Mrs. M). The flavors are inspiring and there's never one element that's too overpowering. You just have to keep coming back to make sure you don't miss any of their crafty flavors. The ones that are constant (Secret Breakfast, Chili Lime sorbet) are never a let down.

My only gripe is that the employees consistently seem kind of dirty and despondent. I'm sure no one wants to be handing out silver spoons to people who need to sample everything (when I hear "sample abusers" I'm reminded of the Curb Your Enthusiasm where the woman tastes 8 different things and winds up getting Vanilla), but they work at what seems like a cool place with a great product and friendly customers. Why the long face?
author: Brandon K.

description:
Ever since Chris Consentino mentioned Humphy's  proscuitto ice cream in The Best Thing I Ever Ate, I've been dying to try this place. Unfortunately when I arrived, they said it was sold out  a few days ago and it takes a long time to make.

My back up plan was to try the Secret Breakfast (#46 on the 2011s top 100 things to try before you die). Imagine waking up from a night of drinking bourbon. The first thing you grab is a bowl of corn flakes to counter your hangover. Suddenly you burp and that's the Secret Breakfast.

I also sampled the chile lime sorbet. It tasted exactly like the flavor but it didn't make me a fan.

The wifey had the black sesame ice cream. This was like the black sesame paste I ate as a kid. Pretty darn delicious.

Overall, I like that they had unique flavors and I can't compare it to Bi-Rite.
author: Kien M.

description:
The ice cream gods were in our favor! We found a parking spot directly across the street(okay so the sign said no parking due to construction but there were two other cars in the two other spots.)  There was no line.  And I'm a fan of good customer service for kids.  The two employees were nice to my little one.  
She had a Tahitian Vanilla and did quite well eating that monstrous single scoop(yes I did have to finish it for her, poor me!)  I loved Salt and Peppa. 
Definitely worth many visits!
author: Julie C.

description: Pretty damn good. The chocolate was a little rich for such a hot day but the vanilla was perfect. As good as bi-rite but a dollar more expensive for a single scoop.
author: Logan T.

description:
YUMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMM!!! Humphrey Slocombe catered an ice cream social for a work meeting yesterday and it was delightful!

The flavors were shocking at first but fun to try and delicious on the pallet. I am a simple girl when it comes to my icecream so the Tahitian Vanilla with hot fudge was to die for.  I had two bowls of it and I wasn't even hungry, it just tasted so good!

I wish I had more time in the city to head over there for an ice cream excursion!
author: Colleen B.

description: Delicious, interesting ice cream flavors, with a texture that is definitely more icy than creamy. Friendly service, clean and cute ambiance. Secret Breakfast (cornflakes and bourbon) was incredibly tasty, XXX Chocolate was good (dense chocolate ice cream with chocolate wafers and fudge ripple), and Summer Sweet Corn had a little chili-kick. There was a line late at night but it moved quickly, so it's worth the wait.
author: C. D.

description:
BEST ICE CREAM I'VE EVER HAD.

Secret Breakfast. 10 out of 10
Blue Bottle Coffee. 9.0210 out of 10

kind of hard to find parking, but what else is new?

service was great. A+++++++++=
author: Niño M.

description:
CRAZY FLAVORS! 

if you are adventurous then this is one of the places you gotta check out in SF. The day I went, I was fortunate to try most of the flavors I was hoping for (their menu changes regularly) I even asked for the foie gras but they don't have it that day. 
I could understand why other people don't like this place that much cos really they have unusual flavors. No wonder Andrew Zimmern checked this place out...

I had NO problems with all the flavors so yeah... I'm a FAN!
author: Cryszilla G.

description:
3.5 stars in reality. 

This was good, but I think I was just expecting a little bit more.  I've had homemade ice cream from Handel's Ice Cream, which is my favorite ice cream shop ever. So that is my gold standard.

This place only has about 8ish selections of ice creams and a few sorbets.  I got the peanut butter/marshmellow ice cream, which was good, unique, and interesting.  It was $2.75 for one scoop.  I enjoyed myself.

This is in a nice location, close to a few other famous places, including Dynamo Donuts and El Farolito mexican food (popular on yelp...justifiably so).

Wasn't the best, "oh my god, best ice cream ever, i have to go back experience, but definitely good."

I would recommend BiRite over this, and if you ever find a Handel's Ice Cream close to you that will trump it all.
author: Rubin K.

description:
How do you make fully fatty and sugar loaded ice cream even better?

Make a browned butter flavored ice cream.

Nuff said.
author: Susan C.

description:
I came to Humphry Slocombe to check off Secret Breakfast from my 7x7 checklist. I had never been before, but I knew I was in for something good. 

I had Secret Breakfast and Fluffernutter and pretty much fluffernutter'd my panties. I can't describe the taste. I can just tell you to get your ass over there and try a few flavors. Bring an extra pair of panties so that you don't have to walk around all day in the ones you soil after tasting their ice cream.
author: Liz M.

description:
I've only come here once, and perhaps I should return to see if they just made a bad batch the day I came.

What's up with the waxy aftertaste/coating left in my mouth!?  My co-worker has experienced this too at Humphry Slocombe so mine was not an isolated incident.  I could not get the waxy residue out of my mouth for some time, very off-putting and doesn't allow you to enjoy the flavors.
author: Vicente G.

description: My husband and I tried the Vietnamese coffee - delish!!  The lime chili was a little too exotic for our taste.
author: Jill F.

description: Great ice creame!  Ancho Chocolate is nice spicy smooth chocolate flavor. Black sesame is a must if you are a chocolate fan.
author: Diane V.

description: My boyfriend and I have been searching for an olive oil ice cream since salt & straw in Portland, so we were excited to try Humphreys. We tried a variety of flavors(banana chai, jasmine lychee, cucumber milk, and olive oil) but we found them all very sweet. We settled on a scoop of olive oil each on a cone, but the ice cream was overwhelmingly citric and sweet, and the sugar tasted artificial. Also, the cone was way too sweet as well. We didn't finish them. Ici's in Berkeley is way better!
author: Kieu T.

description: Heard some buzz around this place so me and my co-worker decide to check it out after work. I was wary of some of the flavors but we picked out two winners from the bunch. The secret breakfast is great on this hot day because the bourbon has a very refreshing quality to it and when you hit a cornflake it brings a little treasured crunch to your ice cream. The blue bottle Vietnamese coffee ice cream held up to my standard since I love Vietnamese coffee! I like my coffee strong enough to jolt the dead and sweet enough to keep the coffee from biting me which is just what that scoop delivered. Thankfully they are far enough away from me that I won't become an addict so please don't open one up downtown I'd never be able to resist!
author: Norris T.

description:
I thought on a three day weekend with such wonderful weather that Humpry Slocombe's would be packed but it wasn't actually too bad.  This was my first time there and it was nice to take a few samples of what was available.  I ended up with a scoop of the secret breakfast and it was so good.  Who knew that bourbon and corn flakes could be so tasty.

It's definitely pricey here but for every once in a while I could see coming back for a different kind of scoop.
author: Blake B.

description:
Get the butter beer . . . yes like in Harry Pothead ... err Harry Pottery ... err Harry Potty . . . this is SF people hahaha! Anyways, when I write reviews about a restaurant, I like to compare it to a similar one.  So humphry slocombe's comparison is of course Bi-Rite.  Who wins?  Long story short . . . Bi-Rite.

Both are overly hyped places, both cater to the hipster crowd, both have unique off-the-wall servers.  So why does Bi-Rite win?

Taste.  Simple as that.  I've tried an assortment of all flavors from both spots and when in Bi-Rite, even the ones I don't like, I don't hate.... because of the great flavor it still tastes kinda good!  In Humphry's . . . the ones I don't like . .. after I taste it, I have to wash it down with a 6-pack of Fat Tire to forget about it!  It could just be my personal taste, but balsamic vinegar and candied ginger are a No No.  Taste like a frozen vomit... No, I don't know how frozen vomit tastes from experience, just use your imagination LOL!  I know it sounds harsh, but that's just what I feel.  The only redemptive thing about this spot for me?  Yes, you guessed it if you read my opening line . . . the butter beer!

Just a quick comment on service also . . . the people at Bi-Rite are always happy and cheerful and give you as many taste samples as you want. . . even if there is a horde of Dolores Park sun burned patrons outside on an Indian Summer day in SF.  In Slocombe's, there was no line, but the server with the handle bar moustache had this "I don't give a shit" look on his face . . . My friend was too scared to ask for a taste of the different ice creams so I asked for her and he just rolled his eyes . . . if it wasn't for the butter beer . . . *shakes fist*
author: Carlo S.

description:
Okay, I used to think that Bi-Rites Salted Caramel was the baddest (not bad meaning bad, but bad meaning GOOD), most awesomest ice cream out there.  Well, "Say Hello to the Bad Guy!"  Humphry Slocombe's Secret Breakfast just took over that title.  How can you go wrong with Bourbon and Corn Flakes???  The sweet taste of bourbon, the crunchy corn flakes, the velvet smooth ice cream...it taste so good once it hits the lips!  Amazing!

Throw in a scoop of the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee Ice Cream, and you got a match made in Heaven.  Haven't tried the other flavors yet, but if they are half as good as either of the two above, I will eat them all or die trying.
author: Veasna H.

description:
My world would fall apart with out you Humphry... Really it would!
Humphry is HOME! Mmmmm

Jesus Juice (Red Wine + Coke) - Genius!
author: M C.

description:
I really wanted to fall in love with this place given the immense positive feedback on Yelp. However, on two different occasions, I was left a bit less than impressed. 

Now don't get me wrong - Humphry Slocombe definitely has delicious ice cream flavors. However, restaurants, ice cream shops and almost anything nowadays must be reviewed on a relative basis. And in that realm, Humphry falls short with respect to its peers. 

The Secret Breakfast is great but it doesn't come close to the flavors at Bi-Rite or the texture at Smitten. In fact, I remember liking the less popular Brown Sugar flavor better than the infamous Secret Breakfast flavor. And the Vietnamese coffee flavor doesn't even garner an honorable mention.  

I recommend checking it out only after you've had the opportunity to frequent at other more popular ice cream shops in the city.
author: Priya S.

description:
This place is disgraceful!! The menu you see posted is nonexistent. They (according to them) only carry about 8 types of ice-cream. The listed ones are old and they no longer carry them! SURPRISE SURPRISE. The neighborhood is terrible...our car was broken into and we were there Sunday afternoon at about 5 o'clock .
BUYER  BEWARE
author: Penny P.

description:
One of my favorite ice cream places in the bay area! 
A much shorter line than Bi-Rite. The flavors don't change as much, but they have a stranger combination which is much more fun. 
Definitely a good place to go when the Bi-Rite line is too long. 
I always get the special breakfast and blue bottle vietnamese coffee.
author: Anthony Y.

description: The blue bottle Vietnamese coffee is legit!  Prob the best ice cream flavor there & all the names are pretty unique as the ingredients mixed in are what make this place different from other ice cream spots.  Kind of pricy, parking sucks but it's SF, a sorta out of the way place to get ice cream unless were craving it, so those are the only reason why it's not a 5.  Another recommendation would be the cinnamon crumble because it taste like cinnamon toast crunch cereal mixed with horchata!!
author: Oliver Q.

description:
no offense, the secret breakfast was terrible. blasphemy...yes i know. so kill me.

they didn't have the malted chocolate when i was standing in line, so i went for the malted dulce de leche. it was holy spirit awesomeness.

any place that serves "jesus juice" deserves a godly rating.
author: Charmaine L.

description:
Simply put, I LOVE Humphrey's and Slocombe!!!
Ever since I first discovered this hole in the wall ice cream shop, I've been coming back every time in the city. Full from dinner? There's always room for Humphrey's!!! Secret breakfast and Tahitian vanilla is my weak spot.
author: Danh N.

description: Eek. I'm preparing myself for the wrath of my less than glowing review. I'm a sucker for blue bottle, but honestly the blue bottle vietnamese coffee tasted like any other coffee ice cream. What's the point of splurging on blue bottle? Even worse, it felt super heavy on milk fat, left a weird fatty coating in my mouth, and was very icey, but also had terrible consistency and started to melt quickly. I'm a glutton for ice cream, but even a three for this may be generous. I ended up tossing out my cone. Hopefully I just caught a bad batch..
author: Ritu K.

description:
Sorry Chris Cosentino, I wasn't impressed.

Another popular ice cream joint with impossible to find parking spaces unless you walk there, take public transportation or ride a bike there.

Was really looking forward to grubbin their ice cream and the pork-flavored one. Unfortunately, they didn't have the pork but just about had everything else that shouldn't be mixed together.

They were just too sweet or too funky for my taste. Believe me, I eat the weird stuff and these were just too weird for my palate. I also had the Vietnamese Coffee-flavored ice cream and it didn't not taste close to the real thing.

I guess I'll just have to wait for the pork-flavored ice cream to change this Bull's mind.

What would Mr. T say? "Fool...you call this ice cream? I'd rather go to Mitchell's and Bi-Rite."
author: John G.

description:
The Ice Cream flavors are awesome. My favorite flavors are the Breakfast Cereal, Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee and the best Balsamic Caramel which makes me droll all the time even just thinking of it . nom, nom, nom... The texture though is not as smooth as other ice creams i have had. 
What I noticed are the folks who are helping their guests. Some are friendly and helpful, some, i think was just there to help the store have some sale or maybe had an unpleasant day. 
I am a fan of the ice cream yet not as always happy of the service.
author: Faye R.

description:
Came here on the right day at the right time. Found parking just a block away, but I can see how parking might be a problem for future visits. Barely a line when we got there, about 3 people ahead of us. But by the time we ordered, the line was out the door. 

The staff was very patient while we tried samples of different flavors. Decided on a scoop of Balsamic Caramel, Honey Thyme and Secret Breakfast. We all agreed the Balsamic wasn't for us, the taste is hard to describe, but the after taste was better. Honey Thyme was sweet and refreshing. The Secret Breakfast was really good- a nice, bourbon kinda good, I wish it had more corn flakes in it though. It's a good concept for good ice cream. Nice and creamy, freshly made. 

We were able to find seats inside. The seating area consists of about 8 bar stools and a counter in front of the window and a couple tables and chairs outside. 

A good place to visit when you're craving ice cream and want to try something different and creative. Be sure to sample before you buy, or you'll be left with a wasted scoop of Balsamic Caramel... I mean, a wasted scoop of ice cream.
author: S Y.

description: I think the secret about the secret breakfast is that the more of it you eat, the more delicious it tastes. There is something strangely addicting about it!
author: Sharon L.

description:
This classically styled ice cream parlor has a very attentive staff and a great assortment of fresh and very creamy flavors. We tried several flavors (with real metal spoons) until everyone settled on their perfect match: Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee; P.O.D., which tasted of a fruity sorbet; and root beer, which had a natural flavor more similar to ginger snaps than artificial root beer.

The two-headed, stuffed calf head that they have on the wall is a little unnerving, although it definitely adds character. Also, the secret breakfast flavor is very strong (take a taster before committing to this flavor). Overall, this was a great experience and we thoroughly enjoyed the fresh ice cream.
author: Paul C.

description:
Came here after hearing from Yelp!

The flavors here is something you have to try. Exotic flavors you will not find anywhere else! 

-Flutter Nutter (peanut butter): good blast of flavor but wayy to melty
-Secret Breakfast: good for tasting but wasn't a big fan
-Maple Walnut: Very good but after a while it gets tooo sweet
-Carrot Mango sherbet: good! very fruity and taste more like mango
-Cucumber Ice Milk sherbet: taste very like a cucumber... did not like the combination of milk and cucumber..

The scoop size is normal. A little on the smaller side but it's CHEAP here so i'm happy. :)
author: Sharon L.

description: The ultimate crazy flavor ice creamery in SF.   Best Vietnamese Coffee ice cream I have ever had.  The other flavors are pretty good, but this one takes the cake.   I wish their hours were a little later for the crowd that has a slightly later dinner.  So many times i just want a scoop of ice cream after dinner, but they're already closed.  booo.
author: Edgar C.

description:
Just wanted Yelpers to know that Secret Breakfast is the best ice cream I have ever eaten. It's BOURBON and CORN FLAKES. 

Also, there is always a line of people waiting so don't be that guy who needs to sample 7 flavors and make everyone wait. We all despise that guy.
author: DJ_Hippopotamus_Anonymous Z.

description:
Creative and well made quality ice cream. We had the blue bottle Vietnamese coffee +secret breakfast+Tahitian vanilla. Amazing individually, world-changing together. 

I cannot wait for the fairy building location to open(they said hopefully before Christmas on their Facebook page). 

I would gladly eat here everyday despite it being freezing in the city now.
author: Kerina J.

description:
I loved the simplicity of the interior at Humphry Slocombe and the stools that look out the window. 

I sampled the Secret Breakfast, and thought it was good so i got a scoop. The downside was that I wanted to split it with the Vietnamese Coffee but the guy said he couldn't do that(why do you not split scooooops, whyyyyyyyyy?). In the end Secret Breakfast turned out to be a bit much for a full scoop, but I think i'll be back sometime to try the vietnamese coffee!
author: Sarah S.

description:
What's that? Bourbon with my ice cream?? Sure, why not!!

Secret Breakfast is Bourbon with corn flakes. Go try it!

And if you like Vietnamese Coffee, make sure you try the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee.  

Not a fan on the Chocolate and Smoked salt ice cream. 

Def coming back! 

Street parking and Cash only!
author: Meems P.

description:
As much as I can see many other yelpers love this ice cream, I would say that it's definitely not worth the 1hr+ wait.  There are some interesting flavors, but I can't say it was a mind-blowing cup of ice cream.  

I was very happy that they had the option for sweet corn ice cream because I'm a huge fan of corn.  It was pretty good.
author: Jade L.

description: How is this place not 5 stars??? Their Secret Breakfast is one of the best ice cream flavors I've ever had (and I've had a lot of ice cream).  Sugary cornflakes with bourbon? It was a genius who came up with that one!  The other flavors are pretty good too, especially the Mexican Chocolate.  But really, you have to get the Secret Breakfast.
author: Sungeeta A.

description:
This ice cream is amaze. Balsamic Vinegarette was my favorite and then the Secret Breakfast follows...a flavor I only sampled. Where were corn flakes in ice cream my entire life? 

Just go. Try it. Keep an open mind. You won't regret it.
author: Stephanie M.

description: It was so hard to pick from the delicious flavors on display, and I tried a bunch. The peanut butter curry, secret breakfast and matchadoodle (green matcha ice cream with snickerdoodle cookie chunks) all were great. I ended up with matchadoodle and wasn't disappointed. I could easily go back for more - and could have had a second scoop today - but am excited to return and try more of their flavors.
author: David B.

description:
Meh.

I really wanted to like the ice cream here, but I just could not get excited. Interesting flavours, some of which are successful, some of which are just interesting. That I could forgive, but the texture? That was unforgivable. Grainy and too much over run to suit me. I like a dense creamy mouth feel. This was soft, grainy and untempered.

Another classic case of the Hipster's new clothes... This ice cream is walking around nekid. Put a shirt on it some one...
author: Sara D.

description:
One little lick and you can tell right away that they get their magic elixir from Straus Family Dairy. Seriously, outside of massaging their cows while they sleep or some type of alien abduction, Straus just does it better than everyone else. And HS has transformed this magic elixir into some of the tastiest, smoothest, flavorfulest, weirdest ice cream imaginable.

Yes, I managed to finally make it here. Oh my. The secret breakfast was good. Maybe too good. Made me giddy with delight. The Blue Bottle V-Coffee was true to the original and the strong flavor really stood out. I also tried my son's tahitian vanilla which was really good too.   

Service was friendly and fast. Server was kind and patient while my son sampled several items, which I appreciated. 

Overall I can say that Bi-rite still rates as my favorite, but it certainly nice to have an option in the same ballpark.
author: Dom L.

description:
If I can have breakfast for ice cream,  I would. Furthermore, I would go to Humphry Slocombe. In fact, I would order: secret breakfast and pair it with Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee. Secret breakfast includes bourbon and cornflakes, which really is all the essential breakfast items you need. Then, as a caffeine addict, the Vietnamese coffee will provide my caffeine intake for the day. 

That is all, my friend. If you want breakfast for ice cream, go to Humphry Slocombe... or actually, just go and have yourself some ice-cream, just because.
author: Cassy H.

description: i've always wanted to try HS but was always too busy.  Luckily, I saw that caviar delivered HS so I used their service.  I ordered Secret Breakfast and Malted Chocolate.  If you've never had bourbon or not used to liquor, I recommend putting away SB in the freezer until you're in the mood to be experimental.  I quickly ate the MC made of Guittard Chocolate and it was smooth and flavorful.  A couple of days later when I was in a quieter more thoughtful mood, I ate SB which was also very smooth but thinner as an ice cream with the sweet surprising bourbon inside with the corn flakes which gave texture.  I enjoyed SB and am can't wait 'til next time to try their Blue Bottle Vietnaese flavor ice cream.  Too bad they don't have more flavors on the caviar site. :-(
author: Frugal C.

description:
The place is located at a pretty nice and quiet neighborhood and it's just a few minutes walk from Bart!  The guys that work here are friendly and there are seats at the window where you can sit and eat your ice cream and watch what's going on outside.... which is probably not a lot but it's still a nice chill spot.

I had the "secret breakfast" and it was sooooo good! Best ice cream in the bay so far!  It's highly comparable to Ici in Berkeley!  I am definitely looking forward to enjoying other flavors in the very near future!!
author: Mercy D.

description:
The best thing about this shop is that it has so many interesting flavors that change often.  The workers were really nice and they didn't rush me when I was sampling their flavors and it was nice that not many people were in line behind me because I think they would have been irritated.  The interior is clean and the decorations are kinda neat, but terrifying at the same time.

The bad thing is that this place closes relatively early (9pm).  The location was a tad bit difficult to spot (at least for me).  The first time my friend and I tried to come here, we drove by it to find parking and we could see them putting up the chairs, so we sadly drove away.  The 2nd time we tried we went right before dinner just to make sure we made it before closing (that's right, dessert first, dinner second!).

When we got there, they did not have the procuitto one I was hoping to try, but they had Jesus Juice, which was like a red wine (good, but since I am not an avid wine drinker/taster, it was not my favorite).  I ended up getting a scoop of Magnolia Stout (creamy with a subtle stout taste) and my friend got Secret Breakfast (I am not sure what it was supposed to be but it was pretty delicious).  It was really good.  Idid  actually wish I had gotten a scoop of the secret breakfast half way through mine, but I think it was because things taste better when it is not yours.

When I am in the area again, I would like to sample some of the other many flavors that they have.
author: vanessa t.

description: Were out of a bunch of flavors when I tasted this brand... but, the flavor I got (maple walnut) was fantastic. The person I went with got vietnamese blue bottle coffee, which was also good. Good consistency, good creamy flavor. So much better than bi-rite or some of the other trendy ice cream shops.
author: Amy L.

description:
You scream! I scream! We all scream for Ice Cream!

Ok I'll stop with the cheesy lines now.  Came here cause I heard the ice cream here was to die for.  I have to say this is pretty freakin' good.  There is a bit of a line for this place.  A small little ice cream shop with very limited seating.  The got greedy and ordered two scoops (Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee and the Special Breakfast)  The special breakfast is a vanilla flavor ice cream with cornflakes and borbon.  I know it sounds funny but TRY IT!

Lets just say you can skip the Coffee ice cream and just get the tub of Special Breakfast.  OMG Love this flavor so much!  I will stand in line for this flavor any day.  HIghly recommended!
author: Ying F.

description: Upgraded to 4 stars after coming back and had the Vietnamese coffee and Secret breakfast ice cream. Must say these were better taste than previous visits.
author: T L.

description:
I love ice cream and I feel like there's a lot of pressure on me to like this place, but after repeated visits here over the past year, I think it's just okay.

I like the quirkiness and sense of humor present throughout the place and have always had great servers, but I think the ice cream itself is highly over-rated.  This is a classic case of people liking a place just because it's trendy and not because it's actually good.  I admire them for their bold and adventurous flavors (Boccalone Prosciutto, Salt and Pepper, Fume, etc.), but honestly, when I go out for ice cream, I want flavors that I will enjoy eating an entire giant scoop of.  If I'm going to get tired of or think it's gross after a few bites, then why would I pay money for that?

I've been here at least 5 times.  I've sampled a wide variety of their flavors and find that I always order their more traditional/less out there flavors, such as Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee, Tahitian Vanilla, and Coconut Sherbet.  

The first few bites are always heavenly - the ice cream is rich and smooth and the flavors divine.  And then you realize that the tiny little chunks of stuff you keep thinking are nuts are really tiny balls of butter and that the roof of your mouth and your spoon are coated with a greasy film.  

Since I'm an ice cream nerd, I tried to research what this could be and what I think is happening is that they are over-churning their ice cream and turning the butterfat content into actual butter.  

This doesn't happen with all of their flavors - just the richer ones - but still: yuck.  

When I'm in the Mission and I want ice cream, I go to Bi-Rite instead, and you should, too.
author: Pei K.

description: The help was unfriendly and seemed a little irritated to serve me. The portion was tiny and really expensive--$4.50 for a very small scoop. I do not recommend this place
author: alexandria s.

description: I tried the smoked chocolate with sea salt. Felt that it was over salted and couldn't finish it.  I should have read the reviews and got some of the other flavors but this won't be my first pick next time. I actually wanted Mitchell's but their line was too long.  I'll come back here and try the best secret next time.
author: JJ S.

description:
T.G.I.F.L...... Thank God I Found Lactaid

A cruel twist in life left me lactose intolerant and at the worst opportune time with the personal discovery of Humphrey Slocombe. Although I didn't try ALL their flavors, it's safe to say I'd love 'em ALL! 

Favorite: The Secret Breakfast..... with their homemade bourbon caramel! MMMMMMmmmmmm..... DROOL!
author: Stephen Y.

description:
After having heard so much about this place, I had to try it but I have to say it was a major disappointment.  The whole purpose of this place seems to be "look at how many unusual flavors of ice cream we can make" and not about "look at how well we can make ice cream".

My major complaint is about the texture of the ice cream itself.  It is a bit icy and chalky, contributing to a very unsatisfying mouth feel.  This is compounded by the compostable utensil given to you if you get a bowl as opposed to a cone; the spoon also has a grainy texture and something less than a neutral flavor.  Please, can the sanctimony and just give your customers a plastic spoon.

There are indeed a wide variety of flavors on hand and the three I've tried were OK but nothing special.  The chocolate with sea salt was a bit unbalanced to the point that the saltiness overtook rather than enhanced the flavor of the chocolate; the cinnamon brittle had all its flavor in the bits of brittle with the ice cream itself contributing next to nothing other than its icy texture; and the black sesame tasted like they poured bottle of toasted sesame oil into the ice cream base.

I can only imagine that this place is popular only because its clientele are unsophisticated ice cream eaters and are simply taken in by the novelty of things like olive oil and black sesame ice cream.   As a curiosity, it works, but as a serious culinary destination it is not noteworthy.  I would suggest the proprietors try to improve the basic texture of the ice cream and reassess the balance of flavors in some of their concoctions.
author: David O.

description:
ZOMG - best ice cream I have EVERRR had. I love the base ice cream here, it's a taddd salty. I normally can't stand the taste of melted ice cream, but honestly, for this ice cream - i lift the cup and try to drink every last melted dripping. No shame, no shame!  

I came here 3 times in one week bc I fell in love with this ice cream. My favorite flavors so far are the Secret Breakfast, After School Special, Olive Oil, and Sweet Corn. 

Man I can't wait to come home and eat more ice cream! 

FYI - Bitter + Sweet in Cupertino sells Humphry Slocombe so you don't have to travel all the way to SF if you're living in the South Bay. :)
author: Alisa C.

description: Oolong favor was so good! Matcha favor is amazing too!! Noms!!!! This is my second time eating the ice cream from here and its super delicious! And i even got to try the vietnamese coffee ice cream,  that was so delicious. But i ended up getting oolong ice cream. This place definitely gained is named for their yummy ice cream.  So if u havent tried it u def need to!
author: Joanne C.

description: Love this place, always a line unless you go in the middle of the afternoon. Great flavors and they're very helpful by allowing you to sample them all if you need. Just have patience and it will be worth your wait!
author: Jesse P.

description:
I finally tried the famous Humphry Slocombe ice cream joint after many attempts (they're strict about closing at 9PM! Boo...).

Went with the 3 Scoops and ordered the Secret Breakfast, Olive Oil, & Peanut Butter Curry flavors.

I actually thought that the Secret Breakfast had a significant amount of Bourbon in it ..a little too much for my liking. Peanut Butter curry sounds strange but it actually tasted yummy! Out of the three though, I liked olive oil the best. It's very light and refreshing.

Prices are right, people are friendly, lines are fast - what more can you ask =) ?


Prices are as follows:
1 Scoop: $2.75
2 Scoops: $3.75
3 Scoops: $5
author: Veronica S.

description:
Oh how I love fun ice cream flavors. Ever since I visited  Molly Moon's in Seattle, I've been hooked!

Best flavors of the day were the White Miso Peach and the Harvey Milk and Honey Grahams.  Love the names.  

Skip the Chocolate Passion Fruit -- it doesn't work.

My only wish is that they would be able to provide ALL of their fun ice cream flavors on the same day.  I know this is quite impossible what with the space and all, but a girl can dream.  I was really intrigued by their "foie gras" ice cream, but it wasn't offered the day I went.

The shop is tiny and the line was out the door when we went on a Sunday afternoon, as expected, but it moves fast so don't let that line deter you from going!

I hope these inventive ice cream shops aren't just a fad -- because I'm a fan!

Sidenote: there's a satirical website out there with the name Jasper Slobrushe and their ice cream flavors include "dog feces" and "swine flu".
author: Tiffany L.

description:
You came here for secret breakfast.

You said you wanted ice cream, but you all winked at each other, and you knew the only reason you're here is because they have ice cream that slightly implies it will get you drunk. Which is a shame, because it's all really good ice cream, even without the liquor, if you ever ordered the stuff without it. Which you haven't.

I introduced a good friend to Humphry Slocombe's just recently. She (of course) got the secret breakfast with bourbon and corn flakes, and she (of course) loved it. I tried out the szechwan (take THAT, spell-check) strawberry sorbet, which is super-flavorful. I'm not quite sure why they close at 9pm on weeknights, since the line was literally out the door at 8:40pm.

Sounds like the secret's out.
author: Kevin B.

description:
More unique flavors than Bi-rite, for sure. 

We had the black sesame and secret breakfast. I truly enjoyed the black sesame a lot. I love black sesame and this really did black sesame justice. The nuttiness of black sesame plus the creaminess of the ice cream made it one bomb flavor. It wasn't a subtle flavor of black sesame but the perfect amount of flavor. The secret breakfast, bourbon and cornflakes? That's why they call it a secret. You get a really strong flavor of the bourbon but yet it works really well with the ice cream and cornflakes. Of course the cornflakes are a bit soggy but its ice cream. I've never tried anything like this before. Maybe adding a little bourbon to cornflakes is the secret to enjoying it without making a face. The creative flavors are weird but strangely enjoyable. 

-Give it a try! 


p.s.: limited seating
author: Jocelyn V.

description: Eh... I don't really see what all the fuss is about. I tried the ancho chocolate and liked how rich it was, but I'm not a big chocolate ice cream fan, so I went with Secret Breakfast. Definitely boozy and while I appreciate that the corn flakes are still crunchy, the ice cream left a weird film in my mouth that was less than enjoyable. I ended up tossing half the cone. I'm guessing it's just that flavor, but everyone else seems to love it, so maybe I just got a bad batch?
author: Leah Y.

description:
My absolute favorite ice cream on the planet!

Favorite flavor? 
Two words BUTTER BEER!

Love the creamy consistency and the yummy frosted almonds as well!
author: Victoria S.

description:
Sure this place is great to take an out of towner ...freak them out with the double headed calf head hanging in the lobby, the bazillion exotic "only in San Francisco" foodie flavor palette, and just to have them wait pretentiously in the city for something that better live up to tastes of this nouveau riche San Francisco.
 
Yes, I have dropped in with friends and giggle-gaggled on flavors, taste testing things like Jesus juice and bacon laced ice cream, I had a friend  request I pick some of this ice-cream up for a small soiree I was having.   Well, thinking I could just stroll in and pick up a few half gallons... no.  Met with heavy sigh from the counter person she asked, "Did you place an order?" I said, "ummm I've been trying to call all weekend, but nobody seems to pick up a phone here, so HOW can I place that order, please don't say I had to go to a website?" **heavy stare and eye bat** Let me get my manager.  Manager comes out and asks how she can help, I ask "could I get a half gallon" ... "we don't do half gallons, gallon only and we need 72 hours advance notice". *staring at me like I was crazy to ask such a horrible jump through this hoop request. *  What the f*ck,  3 days to pack a gallon of ice cream.   That right there really made me question the nature of their business model.  Focus on selling scoops only...not bigger orders where more profit can be made, who's laughing here, yup that would be me.
 
Okay, really?  No sorry, no apologies... let me get out of the way here holding up your line.  I felt like a pseudo-weirdo San Franfreak in bunny ears drawing all the unwanted attention I could get.   No, pre packed flavors here, gallons, pints or whatever they will only do here...none?  I took my imaginary two scoops of attitude and heavy eye rolls to go... away.  Times like these I wish we had more no frills places like a Thrifty Ice Cream back in the day, or Mitchell's their competitor, which is where I ended up taking my business, (maybe they can learn something  from this business model).
 
Oh well, I tried and glad to say I'm over it, trying to support and adding to the success of these small business can be too much of a pain, I've diagnosed this place as wacktose intolerance.  

One less line to wait in San Francisco for me.
author: B H.

description: Came here for my birthday and loved it! I chose the Secret Breakfast and Harvey Milk and Honey Graham. Secret breakfast was pretty good but in my opinion, the Harvey Milk was the best out of the two. Definitely give it a try, it's worth it! Pretty unique flavors!
author: Lina M.

description:
My 4.5 star rating is based on the flavors I tried and ordered, missing half a star because they don't always have my faves. 

I have been here several times in the past month and found the Harvey Milk & Honey ( I think that is what it is called honey based ice cream with graham crackers in it. It is the most amazing honey based ice cream I have ever had. I also had the honey thyme. The mulled wine is to die for. 

The only downfall is that if you love a certain flavor, there is no guarantee it will be there when you go back. their menu changes every day. That is a good thing for some, and for someone like me, that is not so great, because I like to stick to the same flavors. 

The staff is super nice. Andrew helped us one time and insisted we try as many flavors as possible. He even helped me decide what flavor to put as my first scoop and second. I think their ice cream is better consistency than Mitchell's or Bi Rite. Check them out!
author: Keri V.

description: Favorite among 3 peoples cones was hands down the black sesame. For the sorbet the P.POG sorbet. Very affordable and not too sweet. Perfect for ice cream lovers. a big fan
author: Mazal S.

description:
My boyfriend saw Andrew Zimmern or Anthony Bourdain go to this place and he was so excited when we happened upon it. Even lined up for 15 minutes. I got the CHOCOLATE with SEA SALT & he had the BREAKFAST something...

Let me summarize the flavors in 2 words - QUE HORROR!!!! 

What in God's good graces was that?!? I tried very very hard to eat my ice cream until my throat started closing up and I could feel my body GETTING DEHYDRATED by ALL THAT SALT!!! I had to throw away ice cream for the first time in my life! 

I tried my bf's ice cream and let me put it this way... Someone doing AA should never come near this ice cream. If I want 10 shots of Bourbon, I will go to a bar, ok? Geez!!! This is what we get when hipsters attempt to make anything edible. 

STAY AWAY FROM HIPSTER ICE CREAM. BELCH!!!
author: Cholita L.

description:
Over rated and over priced. Maybe it's because I can't eat dairy that I hold such a grudge. Seriously though, the jesus juice? It's disgusting. 

At least the hipsters love it though.
author: Priscilla M.

description: Very unique but tasty delightful flavors. The names aren't self intuitive and some interesting combos. The good side is that as usual, you can sample (recommended)
author: C C.

description: Talk about funky flavors.. just a note that not all flavors are available all the time. Today I tried olive oil, basil and lime & harvey milk. Harvey milk was way too sweet for me. Olive oil was very buttery. I really like the basil and lime sorbet. Reminded me of a virgin cocktail but at $4 for a single tiny scoop , i opted for a $9 pint of blue bottle vietnamese coffee instead..
author: Att A.

description: One of my favorite ice cream places in the city! Creative flavors and all made in house.
author: Dimple B.

description:
Secret Breakfast. It must be made for those who are tolerant to alcohol, or at the taste of alcohol. The bourbon was SO overwhelming, I had a hard time downing the ice cream. I searched for those rare pieces of corn flakes to balance out the flavor. How do you guys do it?

The Blue Bottle Vietnamese coffee and the Chocolate Sea Salt, on the other hand, were really good. Apparently, I'm not made for all-out crazy ice cream flavors. Basic flavors with a pinch of crazy, please.

I had a taste of the Curry Peanut Butter. At first taste, the peanut butter took over my palate. After a few seconds, the curry was evident. Interesting, but I wouldn't get a whole scoop of it.

Do I dare come back to try foie gras?
author: Tina T.

description:
I was initially attracted to this place for the odd, but interesting ice cream flavors.  

I tried the Secret Breakfast, because bourbon and corn flakes early in the afternoon always sounds good.  The Vietnamese Coffee and the Balsamic Caramel were good, but not together.  I think I should of just got one scoop at most, but of course I had to get a three scoop bowl to myself because that is how I roll.  After eating all the prominent flavors in addition to the coldness of the ice cream, it made my taste buds go numb and it just started to taste weird.  But my first dig into it, I was pleasantly surprised and ended up finishing the entire bowl!

Very creamy and innovative ice cream.  However, my tip is to eat just one scoop per visit to really enjoy the unique flavors that they offer.
author: Sarah L.

description:
Spontaneously decided to check this place out after dinner this past saturday. i had heard of humphry's quite a bit from my foodie friends, but never sought it out. but when we walked by, we saw that there was almost no line (i think a bunch of people were out of town for labor day weekend), and decided to take advantage. 

I looked at the menu board to try and find a flavor tht appealed to me, and nothing really jumped out at except secret breakfast. i sampled it, and even though it was a little too sweet, i decided to get a one scoop cup. the other flavors were kind of strange, and this was the only thing that seemed quasi familiar -- it kind of tasted like cinnamon toast crunch in ice cream form. 

the ice cream was okay, nothing too special. i think i still like bi-rite more. would i be back? yes, but only on another off day where the line is short. i don't think i'd be down to wait longer than 10 minutes. If I return, i'd probably try the blue bottle coffee flavor.
author: Jennifer O.

description: My go-to for my ice cream needs. jasmine lychee is genius. I still need to try their foie gras gingers so ice cream sandwiches!
author: Vince S.

description: Came here with my girlfriend a few weeks back. We took the Bart from Embarcadero street in San Francisco, and traveled to the mission district in search of this hidden gem. It was a hike to get there, but I must say, it was totally worth it. The outside reminded me of a dive kind of feel. But inside, we were greeted by a nice man who let us try a variety of flavors, which were all so good. I would recommend getting an ice cream here any day. However, me and my girlfriend decided to get the bourbon caramel coke float and share it together. It was DELICIOUS. You could taste the bourbon, and the coke topped off their delicious ice cream float and made it nothing short of amazing. If you're in the area, or even have to travel a ways to get here, I would highly recommend it.
author: Mike B.

description:
It was very hot today up in SF and oh hey there is a two headed cow on a plaque in the store and I had no idea there was an ice cream shop there. Oh hey. 

Tried secret breakfast. It is savory. Loved the butter beer and the Blue Bottle Vietnamese coffee. 

The ice cream is rich, sweet, creamy, and so soft! I am so fascinated by the texture. However, my boyfriend said that this ice cream was the first one to ever fall off his cone. I'm not sure if it's just bad luck or the texture, but that sucks. At the same time, it seems hilarious. Five second rule... Although I accidentally dropped my taster spoonful of butter beer ice cream. I was too embarrassed to look at the person's face when I got my second taster... I guess I was on the same track as my boyfriend. Maybe if I got it on the cone too, I also would've had it fall off the cone as well.
author: Hayne P.

description:
The 4 stars is really just for the secret breakfast, the other flavors were too in your face. Maybe it's just me, but I couldn't keep eating my kiddie sized scoop of olive oil ice cream because the lemon in it just gave me a head ache. I love ice cream and have been wanting to try this place forever, so it was disappointing, to say the least, when I had this and the sugar dosage just felt cavity inducing. 

That being said, the secret breakfast is great, easily 4.5 stars. Warning, this isn't some mild bourbon mixed in, it's nice and boozy. The corn flakes in it balance it really well.

On hot days be prepared to wait 30+ minutes, the line out front moves at a snails pace.
author: Jackie D.

description: Great selection of ice creams! I went with Thai Tea and Coconut. Def all try again :)
author: Lina R.

description:
I think i tried almost every flavor (non-chocolate)! O_O haha

- secret breakfast (very bourbon-y)
- balsamic caramel (way too balsamic =\)
- honey thyme (mmmm this was super honey! loved!)
- dulce de leches (ohh i was tempted to order this. it was delish!)
- olive oil (i dunno about frozen oil =\)

Honey Thyme! yum! One scoop for $2.25!

LOVED:
- mmmm sampling :)
- the nice and CLEAN store
- along the wall there's seating!!!
- thirsty? water container to quench your thirst!
- FREE humphry slocombe postcards! :) i LOVE postcards! (i took a stack!) haha :P
- they sell interesting items such as duck fat pecan pie for $5

Everyone knows how much I LOVE ice cream!!! I will hug it! I will eat it! I will even take a picture with it! :D

I've been wanting to come here FOREVER!!! Everyone in SF has told me great things about this place!! Ice Cream Girl's verdict: it 's ALMOST as good as Bi-Rite. They have a lot of unique flavors, but it was hard to find a "WOW" flavor. Maybe I need to go there again and try more flavors. The ice cream texture isn't quite the same as Bi-Rite's. But I still LOVE Humphry's, I just LOVE Bi-Rite a little bit more (mm.. honey lavender). So I'd have to say Bi-Rite still wins my heart. And you know they say... to a woman's heart is through her stomach! :D haha
author: CeCe C.

description:
Omg secret breakfast ftw! Malted dulce de leche ftw too! Try them in a waffle cone! Balsamic vinegar not so much...

My crazy initial quick tip reaction aside, I had been hankering for a fix of Humphry Slocombe ice cream like Jesse James hankers for some tattoed nasty girls. 

It totally doesn't help that I follow Humphry on Twitter but live 500 miles away. However, on a recent trip back to SF and also the F-Mont (Fremont for the not-so-hip) I made a bee-line to my favorite ice cream shop. There was no line at around 1pm at first but then I turned around after trying like 50 samples and it was out the door packed. 

Again, I went with Secret Breakfast but then scooped a Malted Dulce de Leche on top of that on a waffle cone and then took a bite and was like this: http://twitpic.com/1djqbq 
Which coincidentally is the picture that Humphry tweeted about now we all know what this ice cream can do to a person. How is it two scoops are $3.25? Too sweet.  

Maybe it's a good thing I live 500 miles away otherwise it'd look like this: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/47OC_X6KkiDDQ4jwoCUjFg?select=Hp8W_fNRejgDCGt11OtRKA
author: Matthew T.

description: Walked two miles from the Castro to eat this ice cream.  And walked past Bi-rite which is another to-die-for ice cream shop.  The "harvey milk and honey" was my favorite, along with the "oolong tea" flavor.  The combo was really nice.  They let me try all the flavors I wanted.  Some were off the mark to me, but the good ones tasted EXCELLENT!  Definitely worth a trip and to check out the interesting local shops nearby as you enjoy your treat.
author: Kristin B.

description:
My first time trying their ice cream was at their booth that was at the ferry plaza farmer's market earlier this year. It was brown butter and it was super delicious! Finally we made it out to their actual location to try all their offerings.

B R I E F  S U M M A R Y
-- Parking sucks
-- There's usually a line but it moves decently (trend with most SF ice cream places)
-- Unique flavors
-- Friendly & awesome staff
-- They let you try whatever you want
-- Secret breakfast was very burboun-y (alcoholic)
-- Eton's mess was like fluffy strawberry ice cream 
-- Butter Beer was buttery and light

My GF and her Mom both got malt chocolate, which I tasted but I wasn't in a chocolate mood. I ended up getting 3 scoops; 1 of secret breakfast, eton's mess and butter beer. 

Secret Breakfast is their most popular flavor and I believe they always have it. It's bourbon and cornflake ice cream. If you don't like bourbon or alchol, I wouldn't get this. It has a pretty strong alcoholic flavor. 

Eton's Mess is strawberry ice cream with mashmellow fluff. It was pretty sweet and had a little bit different texture than regular ice cream. 

Since I had brown butter, I wanted to try the butter beer. You wouldn't think butter ice cream is good but it's subtle and sweet. It was very good. 

There's nothing like ice cream during the summer, so I'll be back soon to try some of their other unique flavors!
author: Daniel D.

description:
Summary: THE OOLONG ICE CREAM IS THE BEST!

In a sea of unique (but funky tasting) flavors last Thursday, was the unassuming humble Oolong. It went overlooked by husband amidst the miso peach, jalapeno balsamic strawberry, lavender thyme and the usual suspects (blue bottle vietnamese coffee and secret breakfast). But when we decided to get 1 of our 3 scoops of Tin Roof sundae as Oolong and the other 2 as vanilla, husband's attitude toward HS was forever changed. HE ATE ALL OF MY OOLONG!

I was seriously impressed with the Vanilla... it is truly one of the best I've had. BUT THAT OOLONG. The sweetness was subtle, the creamy texture and flavor were stars, but the oolong... the tea flavor really sang at the latter half of the taste profile. Major major winner of the day.

And next time... we will ask for NO salt on our Tin Roof sundae. The candied peanuts and rich decadent fudge were really marred by the excessive salt sprinkling. Blech. I scraped off as much as I could after my first bite, and then the sundae was much tastier for us. Salt on ice cream is just not my thing, I guess. Also... the Tin Roof is 3 large scoops of ice cream. Brace yourself.
author: Hannah C.

description:
I did not know ice cream can taste like that. I love the Secret Breakfast, but I also find myself very addicted to the Vietnamese Coffee. Other flavors I've tried:

- Jesus Juice - like Coke, there's red wine in there somewhere.
- Harvey Milk - Hunny in my tummy.

I'll be sure to try other flavors, if I resist the urge to order my usuals.
author: LM M.

description:
We found this place a little interesting. I had their secret breakfast. Corn flakes and bourbon, hahaha - got me thinking that i was gonna get bourbon wasted. The ice cream's texture was different than what i'm usually accustomed to. This place really got me confused.

Their flavors seemed exotic, but yes - could give this place another try. 

One word to sum it all up - INTERESTING.

THEN AGAIN PARKING CAN SUCK!!
author: Ferricci R.

description:
So I finally got to try Humphry Slocombe on the first official day of summer! :) I've heard/read about this place, but never made it out there until now. 

I was nervous that it'd be super busy, but to my surprise, there wasn't a huge line! :)  The worker was very nice to my sister-in-law & me. He didn't rush us & let us try whatever flavors we wanted. 

After reading a bajillion reviews, I HAD to get the Secret Breakfast. That was REALLLY GOOD! :) It's a must to get it. & I also got Strawberry Margarita Sorbet, which was YUMMY too! 

My sister-in-law got the Secret Breakfast & Brown Butter w/ Hot Fudge Sauce. The Hot Fudge Sauce made the combo even better :)

I enjoyed my ice cream very much & appreciated the uniqueness of all the flavors, but I thought that the place as a whole was okay. I think I had high expectations for this place (& I probably shouldn't have done that but I did). It's not that I was disappointed because I did like my ice cream. It just wouldn't be my go-to ice cream spot in the city. I'd prefer Mitchell's or Bi-Rite. 

Street parking. I think that we were lucky to find parking right away.
author: Jessica A.

description: Alcohol in ice cream? You can't go wrong with those two combos.  Their best flavor is secret breakfast (bourbon and cornflakes.  THeir second best flavor is Jesus Juice (red wine and coke)
author: Danny N.

description: So great...Secret Breakfast, obviously. But taste the other favors, too. Maybe you'll find one you like better. But I doubt it.
author: Lisa L.

description:
I LOVED their secret breakfast, as everyone says.  

I tried many others and although many sound intriguing, it's only fun to sample and not fun to get.

Even though their secret breakfast is one of my all time favorite icecream, I wish it could have a slightly harder texture (it's a little on the soft side from the liquor).  boo. 

3 stars because it's in a crappy area of the mission, there's only a few seats inside, their flavors don't excite the palate as much as the mind.

I'd take bi-rite over humphries 6/7 days of the week
author: Hannah W.

description:
After enjoying good tacos from tTaco Vallarta, we decided to have some dessert.  It was a lonng line but quick.

blue bottle was good
crackle was good too.
but compared to Bi-rite, i felt it was more buttery.  I couldn't finish it coz of the buttery feeling I got.
author: Claire J.

description:
This place is extremely unique. Push yourself to sample some of the more "crazier" flavors!

Here are yesterday's flavors that I can remember and my opinion if I tried it:

McEvoy olive oil = yummy

Strawberry with candied jalapeno = different, not as crazy as it sounds. the sample was good but I'm not sure that I could've eaten a whole scoop
 
Secret Breakfast (bourbon+cornflakes) = pretty good

Tahitian Vanilla

Fluffernutter

Peanut Butter Curry

Jesus Juice (red wine+coke) 

In the end my friend and I shared a scoop of Vietnamese Blue Bottle Coffee and Butterbeer. We really liked the ice cream and they were totally chill and kept suggesting us to try more samples. Plenty of metered parking around and outside seating.
author: Dahlia S.

description: Can't recall the last time I had a scoop of ice cream on a sugar cone and just strolled down the street licking it up! I am not into all the crafty flavors so kept it real with the pb fudge ripple. Wouldn't go out of my way but nice little treat when you're in the 'hood.
author: e w.

description: Very inventive ice cream flavors that are a great treat. I love in DC but m in sf a couple of times a year and stop by to try the new flavors along with a scoop of Secret Breakfast. My only qualm is the not-friendly nor even attempting to be civil staff. I've noticed the vibe the last couple of visits, eye rolling hipsters who sigh with every breath. Luckily the Secret Breakfast is worth it.
author: Tasey V.

description:
Pros: Bourbon & corn flakes=ice cream flavor
Pros: They will let me try EVERY flavor without so much as a double glance.
Pros: Olive oil is no longer just an ingredient in pasta, it's now an ice cream flavor!!!

Cons: I don't live @ 2790 Harrison St
author: amara k.

description:
I walked over here after work to check it out since I had seen it on the 7x7 Big Eat SF list. Good thing I got here a little before 5pm because the line got long after I got my ice cream!

Price: Decent $3.75 for two scoops
Service: The guy who served us let us try a bunch of different flavors to sample, super nice, not in a hurry to serve the long line. Awesome.
Decor: Pretty cute, very fitting for the Mission. I like that they have a row of seats by the window and a couple tables outside for you to sit.

Now for the ICE CREAM.
