As I was eating the ice cream, it was like someone slipped a little whiskey into my milk and cheerios and then whipped it into a delicious ice cream!  Loved it! But I'm also a really big whiskey fan. I also got the Huckleberry Creme which tasted like a delicious blueberry cheesecake made into ice cream.

I have to say though, I am not a fan of some of the more "odd" flavors. I know it's there for wow-sies but I tried the thai chili lime and it was just... weird.
author: Gloria C.

description:
#45 on the Big Eat SF List: Secret Breakfast from Humphry Slocombe

It was such a nice day in San Francisco and I wanted some ice cream, so my friend and I headed to Humphry to try the Secret Breakfast. I waited about 20 minutes and saw the Secret Breakfast, which is bourbon ice cream with cornflakes. Weird combo and I'm not the biggest bourbon fan but it's surprisingly good. Also I tried the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee and the Tahitian Vanilla. A couple of flavors that I caught my eye was Jesus Juice and Olive Oil. Next time I will try those.

I decided to get two scoops of the Secret Breakfast and Blue Bottle and enjoyed my ice cream outside at some nearby benches. This place has definitely weirder flavors than Bi-rite Creamery. If you want to be adventurous, go here!
author: Rhoda G.

description:
SRSLY you guys?

1 star for the unique flavors.
1 star for the texture (it's not sticky like Mitchell's).
1 star for not melting too quickly.

0 stars for the pretty foul scoop of Secret Breakfast.  I loved the concept of corn flakes in the ice cream, but the bourbon ice cream is just nasty.  It was the first time I had to suffer through the entire scoop, and that upsets me deeply.  The worst part is that with each lick, the flavor progressively worsened.

0 stars for the chocolate and sea salt.  Did someone just dump five pounds of salt into a quart of delicious chocolate ice cream?  Because that's exactly what it tasted like.

I am totally not a fan.  Normally I don't really discriminate between ice creams (heck, I'll eat mint chocolate chip from Baskin Robbins), but this is not a place that I would willingly step into again unless there was zero line and I had all the time in the world to sample each of the flavors to find a better option.
author: Tori S.

description:
I love Humphry Slocombe. Every time I walk through the Mission, no matter what the time or temperature, my eyes wander to Humphry Slocombe. The Secret Breakfast is my favourite because it's weird, but not that weird. The best is when you get the Secret Breakfast at a coffee shop (like Blue Bottle) and order the ultimate breakfast, which is secret breakfast with espresso. 

I love the flavours here. They sound horrible, like Curry and Peanut Butter, but then you ask for a taste and it's actually pretty good. The most normal flavour is the Vietnamese Coffee, which, although normal, is very good. 

And for SF Beer Week, they had beer flavoured ice cream. 

I love the inventiveness of the ice cream. And the best part is that they actually pull it off.
author: Mariko F.

description: Very good ice cream.   We tried 6 flavors and although they were all good some of the flavors did not stand out against the others and it was hard to keep track of what we were sampling.   Lots of liquor folks, which makes the ice cream a bit soft for my taste.   Alcohol changes the freezing point.  The storefront is very out of the way and we had to walk through an angry anti-eviction rally to get to the shop.   It was a bit contentious with all the yelling and drum pounding.    Not necessarily the place to sit and relax with your ice cream cone.   Maybe that is why the ice cream has so much alcohol in it.  To try to numb the pain of the location.   Overall kudos to them ,,,they must be masters of subtle advertising because there was not even a sign on the front of the shop and yet a line out the door.  Cheers to their success.
author: E. F.

description: Came here last night and I just thought it was ok.  Maybe I had high expectations.  I tried a few flavors (basil lime sorbet, olive oil) and they were okay but I went with the blue bottle Vietnamese coffee which was smooth and good.  Nothing that I would jump in the air for.  I prefer Tara in the east bay.
author: James L.

description:
I really want to give this place 5 stars, because I love it, however, there is so much amazing, and sometimes better, ice cream in SF that I just can't, especially since they have a number of flavors that just are not exceptional. That's not to say that they aren't amazing, and I still come frequently!

Their most famous flavors are justifiably popular; Jesus Juice and Secret Breakfast are delicious, with Jesus Juice being one of my all time favorites. Though their flavors rotate daily, they always have a supply of Balsamic Caramel in the back for their special sundaes; you can get a scoop of it if you ask, which you should, it's great! 

The best flavor, however, is one I sadly, rarely see. Candy Cap Mushroom is heavenly; it's a naturally sweet mushroom that tastes of a slightly earthy maple syrup. This is simply one of the best ice creams I've had, anywhere. If you see it, you have to try it.

I recommend caution with their other flavors though, always try a sample first. I usually find most of the lesser known flavors here are mediocre and occasionally downright bad. I still love them for their classics, and their Candy Caps, but because of this I have to give them 4 stars...
author: Joshua B.

description:
Finally had an opportunity to check out the fabled Humphrey Slocombe over the weekend, and I'm stoked to say that I wasn't in the least bit disappointed. It's a pretty tall order to compete with the juggernaut that is Bi-Rite, but they do a pretty admirable job trying. 

I went on the first day of SF Beer Week, so I was able to indulge in the $4.50 ice cream flight featuring 4 different breweries from San Francisco. The only one I can remember was Magnolia Brewery, but that doesn't mean they weren't all tasty. The special runs until the 14th, so if you want some cheap, boozy ice cream, there's no better time than now!

Speaking of boozy congealed cream, they have a creation called the Secret Breakfast. While I've seen some mixed reviews of that particular item here in the yelposphere, I thought it was amazing. It consists of Corn Flakes and bourbon. Need I say more? I overheard one of the cream slingers speaking with a patron a few paces in front of me, and apparently, they put at least 2 bottles of bourbon into each barrel. Good times, huh? Might want to make sure if you're going over 2 or 3 scoops, you avoid getting behind the wheel, though.

Didn't have a chance to try too many other flavors, but it was good enough to keep me coming back for more!
author: Ruggy J.

description:
I FINALLY got to try Humphry Slocombe's Ice Cream.  I had this place bookmarked for awhile now.  

My cousins, from sac, were in town over the weekend and they were planning to visit Humphry Slocombe - I found that to be a great opportunity for the boyfriend, kids, and I to tag along :) 

They have a very unique flavor list. You really gotta step outta the box for this one and be a little more adventurous.  Me, on this visit...not so adventurous!  
I just stuck to the "Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee" flavor, which I am now crazy over!  It's just that good. I also tried a little bit of my boyfriends "Secret Breakfast", which has Bourbon and Cornflakes - pretty strong I must say; it's like a rum raisin flavor but with way more power; if you like alcohol, then this flavor is your "must have"; if you eat enough of it, you'd probably get tipsaay lol. 

I believe their flavors change every so often. I will definitely come back (soon I hope) and try to be more adventurous.  
  
FYI: They are a great twitter follow!
author: jesiree b.

description:
Store decor was cute. That deer with two heads was kinda funky i liked it. 

I ordered the blue bottle vietnamese coffee one. SOOOO GOOODDD. there was no line, the guy was so nice about me wanting to try every flavor. 

Jesus juice is also really good. i will be getting that next time :)
author: Angela C.

description:
So I came here for the first time last week, and my visit was amazing to say the least. I had heard about this place by one of my managers, who talks about it ALL THE TIME, so I figured I should venture out to SF to give this a try. 

As for outside the building, It's at a convenient corner on Harrison, not very hard to pass. However I didn't see  there name on a sign, I just looked in their giant windows and saw an ice cream bar. Parking was easy and we got a spot right in front, but we also went at 8 at night so I can imagine it being tough during the day. 

Once I got inside, I looked around. Place seemed a bit small, but I figured it was more of a "to go" place. There were wall decorations and mugs for sale which was cool. Then, I made over to the ice cream bar....

The flavors I tried were:
Chocolate lavender: which was sweet and very rich in lavender, especially the aftertaste. 

Jesus Juice: which was crazy because it was bursting with flavor. Definitely could taste red wine in it, even in the aftertaste. 

5 Pumpkin Spice: which was amazing and spicy, but almost a little too spicy. 

and finally, The Malted Milk Chocolate: this was once of the creamiest ice creams I have ever tasted. It was smooth and melted on my tongue. This was the flavor we chose to take home with us! 

I'm definitely going to make my way here another day when they have some new flavors ready for my taste buds!
author: Jeanine M.

description: Secret breakfast and brown butter...man, I am addicted!! A small, easy-to-miss ice cream spot that always has great flavors. Have been to both Bi-rite and Mitchell's many times as well, but this is the place I take my out of town friends to. Definitely unique flavors: peanut butter curry, jasmine lychee, and I think it was called jesus juice? They were all great, and can't wait to try other flavors.
author: Justin S.

description: This is for the malted milk chocolate, which is arguably one of the better scoops of ice cream I've had. The other flavors.. yeah.. as others have said: it's either or thing or not.
author: Mel G.

description: Soft and fluffy.. kind of like heaven. All you need to know is, Secret Breakfast!
author: Heather O.

description:
Secret Breakfast- you're not fair! You're too delicious and too accessible- My tastebuds are dying to be with you again! My waistline is screaming to stay away! You're so cruel, but I must have you! 

A lot can be said about Humphry Slocombe- From the employees to the Ice Cream itself, this place is filled with characters. I follow Humphry Slocombe on Twitter and get to read first hand the kind of antics this place gets into. The workers are wild bunch, and they truly love their jobs- and their Ice Cream! The business associates themselves with alot of other great SF businesses including Blue Bottle Coffee Co. and Boccalone- very cool. 

The Ice Cream itself is heaven sent- seriously. I hate to bring them up in this review(since this is a Humphry review), but I thought I had the best 5 Star Ice Cream flavors ever when I tried Bi-Rite just a few blocks away. I promise you my fellow Yelpers, Humphry Slocombe is just as good- if not better! I really can't even compare them- Humphry S stands alone, needing other ice cream joints compared to IT!

Like previously mentioned, the Secret Breakfast flavor is my favorite. A mix of RUM and CORN FLAKES- lol! Absolutely awesome! Another favorite is the Vietnamese Coffee- I'm telling you this flavor is amazing!  If you haven't tried Humphry yet then you must give it a shot...

Humphry offers about 10-12 flavors a day and accepts cash only. If you go, you should also try their cookies- They're freshly baked, super soft, and very yummy! My mouth is watering just thinking about this place again- I may have to make a drive over to SF tonight for this lol. Humprhry Slocombe Ice Cream in San Francisco- 5 Stars Baby ;)
author: Greg G.

description:
Except for that time when they had to close because some coward of an idiot stole their iPad, I don't think I've ever had a bad experience at Humphry Slocombe. Named for Mr. Humphries and Mrs. Slocombe on my favorite British TV show "Are You Being Served?", the shop is anything but mainstream. From their jarred bourbon caramel syrups to their quirky mixtures of ice creams and sorbets, it's a pleasant feast on the senses.

I'm not about to erupt into a list of flavors I've tried because I could care less. That's right, I don't give a damn about the flavors I've had. Anyway, I really only have one BIG favorite that I must have each time: Secret Breakfast. I have been known to rent a Zip Car, zip on down from the SoMa area (when I worked in SF), pick up a pint and eat the whole thing on my own at work. Which actually achieved an elegant buzz that got me through the rest of the day. I still have yet to actually try corn flakes with bourbon...I doubt it would be nearly as good and creamy.

Do stop in and have a treat. I did do a t-shirt trade off with one of the owners once. I think they were a fan of my Twitter or my webcomic or something. I can't remember anymore. But I wear that t-shirt with pride. And they're a short walking distance through the Mission from 24th Street BART.
author: Lee A.

description:
I can't believe I'm writing this but....Humphry Slocombe is better than BiRite. Eek! Up until I tried Humphry Slocombe, BiRite was my favorite creamery on both coasts. But now Humphry Slocombe trumps all. 

I love their creative flavors and smooth creamy textures. Try their secret breakfast. If you don't like the taste of alcohol, try their Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee. I wish I lived nearby. I will definitely be back to try more flavors!
author: Lucy W.

description:
Like everyone has said the best one really is secret breakfast. I know bourbon in ice cream screams alcoholism, but it is pretty freaking delicious. I also tried the oh hell yes and it tastes just like blueberry cheesecake!!! Yumm!

A few things to pay attention to...
- line is almost always out the door just because it's as big as a shoebox
- if you're not from the city you may think you might get shanked around the corner
- parking is a beast!

Totally worth a try!
author: Tanya S.

description: They got some unique flavors like Jesus Juice, Ancho Chocolate, Secret Breakfast, etc. It's good. It's just not for everyone. Sometimes you just want the plain ol' Vanilla. It's not like they don't have the normal stuff, but if you're gonna go there for ice cream then you're better off not getting something so....normal. Right? The few times I walked in there, there were barely anyone lining up for it. Maybe because of parking? Eh, maybe if I am in the neighborhood then I will visit it again. The Secret Breakfast, I don't know what's in it, but definitely not eggs and bacon flavored.
author: Julie V.

description:
This was the second course in my breakfast a few weeks ago, preceded by a mass of bacon chocolate awesome from Dynamo. 

Let me rephrase that. Got a donut from Dynamo, walked over to Humphry at 11, and the three of us sat there for an hour until they opened. An hour. Five minutes until opening, I see a massive walking tour round the corner, as I hear the peppy guide announce their next stop. "OH HELL NO," I screamed, as I jumped in front of the door, not to have my sugar fix hindered by a pack of bumbling Hawaiian-shirt derps from a fly over state line up ahead of us after an hour of torturous longing at the ice cream case inside. 

The dudes behind the counter acknowledged our finely tuned patience and let us try, like, everything. And you know what? There was nothing in that case of lesser quality than WHATTHEHELLTHATISSOGOOD. And now I wish they shipped across the country.
author: Jacqueline M.

description:
I was finally able to try the Foie Gras Ice Cream Sandwich and the Boccalone Prosciutto Ice Cream!

The Boccalone Prosciutto was definitely all the porky, hammy flavor I thought it would be.

Now for the main event - Foie Gras Ice Cream Sandwich. In my hand was about a 2 inch puck of foie ice cream between 2 cinnamon sugar cookies. The richness of the ice cream plays well with the crunchy cookie. 


Nothing wrong with meat flavored ice cream.
author: Phi N.

description: Delicious!  I love craft ice cream.  I would love it if they offered a flight, but completely understand.  They are more than happy to let you try as many flavors as you like.  The Secret Breakfast was fantastic.
author: Frank G.

description:
Whenever I eat ice cream at a shop, I always pick mint chip and nothing else.  My reasoning is, since it's so good, stick with it.  I mean, what if you pick something horrible.  
Humphry changes their flavors all the time and when I came there was no mint chip.  So I got Blue bottle Vietnamese Coffee and Tahitian Vanilla.  I am so glad I got two flavors, otherwise I would have been reiterating to my friend on why I should have stuck to my regular mint chip.  The coffee was so good, so flavorful.  However, the vanilla was not good.  There was a certain taste that lingered that I just didn't enjoy.  I tried a bit of my friend's Secret Breakfast, it had a nice hint of alcohol and corn flakes, nice.
I'm not sure if I want to come back, we'll have to see.
author: Karen L.

description:
This place has a few great qualities:
1) excellent location in heart of mission
2) reasonable prices given SF ice cream prices
3) very nice staff who let your try many flavors before choosing if you ask

In terms of ice cream quality solid but Nothing mind blowing. I liked POG- passion Prague guava sorbet flavor but not fantastic. Other samples were nice but not amazing

Worth a visit and repeat visits to try more flavors
author: Charles S.

description:
Secret Breakfast (Bourbon and Corn Flakes) and Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee. Both hella good.

Other triptastic flavors like Salt n Pepa, Jesus Juice, Olive Oil, or Proscuitto. 

Yum.

Read some of the other reviews of Humphry Slocombe for longer stories...
author: Ed C.

description: We bought seven flavors to do a blind taste-off between this and MItchell's ice Cream. Sorry guys, our friends voted the Mitchell's flavors better. But we applaud the fact that you celebrate new flavors and aren't afraid to let creativity speak louder than the density of your ice cream. Keep churning it out, competition is healthy!
author: Kerensa H.

description:
Good location, nice decor, friendly people.  But the ice cream?  

Well, it's only okay.  Mainly, my complaint is that certain ingredients overpower rather than compliment the others.  The "secret breakfast" has too much alcohol and the balsamic caramel has too much vinegar.  I'm an adventurous ice cream eater, so it wasn't that the unusual flavors "scared" me.  But, just like with any other food, there has to be some balance so you can enjoy all the flavors together.  Otherwise, why bother adding all the ingredients?  After several unsatisfying taste-tests, I decided on the chocolate.  It was just fine, but not unbelievable.  

For a more flavorful and balanced but still adventurous ice cream experience, head over to Bi-Rite Creamery.
author: Cassidy P.

description:
I love their Secret Breakfast and the Blue Bottle Coffee. I like all things coffee flavored, but I'm not a huge fan of coffee. I know, odd.

The service here is great. The employees are friendly and helpful, and they let you try as many flavors as you want before you make your decision!
author: Jennifer H.

description:
Some of their flavors are seriously awful.  Not just in a "meh, this isn't my cup of tea" kind of way, but a "this is effing disgusting, why the f*** are they even attempting to sell this to people??" kind of way that makes you want to throw up a bit in your mouth and then punch someone in anger.  It reminds me of those Harry Potter jelly beans with snot or barf flavors, which are supposed to be a gag, except in ice cream form with pretentious names that sound like they take themselves a bit too seriously.

Still, Humphry Slocombe's got some flavors that are truly, truly golden:

* Secret Breakfast -- Bourbon in my ice cream?  Heck yea!

* Harvey Milk & Honey -- I make out with this flavor.

* Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee -- I never knew coffee-flavored ice cream could make me feel so smug.
author: Alice C.

description:
Made it 30 minutes before closing, so a couple of friends and I got lucky enough to cop some ice cream. I found it difficult to spot the place, even though the surrounding neighborhood was a bit dead.. I guess I'm just REALLY blind, or everyone was blending into the environment.. ):

It's a really small place, and there was even a line near closing so you need to find a good time to come by. We had to wait a good 10-15 minutes since there was only one person serving orders and another at the register.

I thought their names were pretty funny, and I couldn't decide what I really wanted even though I came here to try the Secret Breakfast. Now, I think it's an acquired taste for the Bourbon because some people like it and some don't. I really enjoyed the taste, and the Corn Flakes was a nice touch. Two scoops should satisfy your Secret Breakfast fix, any more and I think it might be overkill for your taste buds.

The next time I drop by here, I really want to try the Blue Bottle Viet Coffee since my friends say that was pretty good.
author: Richard C.

description: Tasty but not my favorite place to spend my calories for the day. I tried a bunch of their flavors and most of them were interesting but too sweet for me. I liked the black sesame, secret breakfast and malted chocolate the best but they weren't the most memorable things I have had for dessert.
author: Kim Le P.

description:
Got a call from a friend last minute and said, ice cream?  I'm in SSF so hearing that the location was in the city almost put me off... 

It was easy to get to and parking wasn't challenging at all.  Maybe because it's Friday at 1pm but oh well.

Walked in and was pleasantly greeted.  Not a huge place.  Simple and to the point.  

Ice cream selections on the other hand were UNIQUE!  I sampled the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee, Black Seasame and Secret Breakfast while my friend sampled the Strawberry Margarita Sorbet... I personally fell in love with teh B/B Viet Coffee and he selected his usual Secret Breakfast.  Note: All the selections I sampled were awesome!  BUT I couldn't just leave!  The Secret Breakfast was pretty darn good that a pint found it's way into my arms!  Cannot wait to go home and indulge this weekend.  I wonder if it'll last all weekend rather... 

Anticipating my next visit to try more ice cream!
author: Patricia G.

description:
After stuff my face at Hard Knox Cafe in Outer Richmond, ice cream sounded like a great idea so I mapped my way to Humphry Slocombe on my phone started my journey. Less than a 10 mile drive in San Jose means cruise for 15min and arrive. But in SF that means speed through a bunch of yellow lights, have some close encounters with buses, dodge potholes and look like a drunk idiot, and when you FINALLY get to your destination then you have to drive around and look for parking UGHHHHHH

Anyways, I had a scoop of secret breakfast and a scoop of cinnamon brittle. Secret breakfast was really yummy BUT the bourbon taste got a little gross to me halfway through my scoop(yes I'm a bitch, get over it). The corn flakes/frosted flakes were a nice touch to the flavor of the ice cream and changed up the texture every few bites. The cinnamon brittle had great cinnamon flavor and when you get to the brittle parts, mmmmmmhmmm so sweet and crunchy.

DELICIOUS CREAMY HOMEMADE ICE CREAM WITH UNIQUE FLAVORS YUMMMMMMMMMMMMM

***THEY TAKE CARD NOW***
author: Harry T.

description:
I read about this place before I came to San Francisco and I was attracted to their unique flavours such as Vietnamese Coffee. But the winner is definitely The Secret Breakfast! What's in it you ask? Well, if you have to ask, it's BOURBON & CORNFLAKES. I mean, why don't people make 'breakfast' like this anymore? =) I love the strong taste of bourbon and the crunch of the flakes. I came all the way from Fisherman's Wharf and it was worth it. Their storefront was not fancy by any means but it's the flavours, man!

And from what I read on Yelp, they have Jesus Juice (wine + coke) and cucumber ice milk? Looks like Papa needs to get more ice cream when I'm back for vacation.
author: Kwoky L.

description:
Yum!  A terrific cremery for ice cream.

They use excellent ingredients, and some very clever flavor combinations.  Love some of the names as well: "Jesus Juice" (wine and cola) - HA!

My favorites here are the coffee and "secret" breakfast flavors.  The coffee is deep and clean, with only the slightest bitterness.  And the secret breakfast with the bourbon and cornflakes is just awesome - still slightly crunch on the cornflakes.  YUM!
author: Mark M.

description: Found this delicious ice cream place from a self-guided walking tour online.  It was the perfect treat after walking around SF.  We opted for the peanut butter curry flavor and it was exceptional!  Both elements worked well together and I was able to taste peanut butter and curry with each bite.  Highly recommend stopping in for locals and tourists alike!
author: Tracy L.

description:
My first visit was a hitter, but the second not so much. 

My boss treated the whole group to ice-cream two weeks ago, so I was dying to go back for that bourbon-corn flake treat right. I  waited two weeks, so that I could build enough anticipation to savor that deliciousness yet again. I was so so DISAPPOINTED!

My $3.25 scoop of ice-cream was a HOT-MESS! I mean this literally, the ice-cream must have melted, because instead of ice-cream goodness in my cone, it was a weird slushiness of soggy cornflakes. NASTY!

I was like -the heck is this? Make up your mind, are you ice-cream or are you a milkshake? Unfortunately, I had stepped out of the store into the street on my way home, very sad and dejected that this frozen treat was a bust! I took comfort in practicing my Spanish by reading window signs- like I said, a sad evening indeed!
author: Bee O.

description:
Oh, Humphry.  What can I say that hasn't been said before?

I really can't think of a better day than one that involves a tamale (or two) from nearby La Palma, then a scoop of Secret Breakfast for dessert.  With quite a few sample spoonfuls in between!
author: Joanne G.

description:
When I eat a black sesame ice cream that isn't Humphry Slocombe black sesame ice cream, I am FURIOUS. Same goes for coffee ice cream (here it's Blue Bottle Vietnamese coffee), ice cream with flavored with booze (that's the Secret Breakfast, duhhhh), and ice cream that tastes like pralines (which they call candy caps, which are actually mushrooms, sucka!!!).

I swear, living in SF has made me a judgy fucking bitch when it comes to boutique ice cream.
author: Rebecca P.

description:
It was time to make a visit after my son couldn't stop raving about the HS Pluot Cardomon popsicle he had at the Ferry Bldg FM by way of 4505 Meats.  We decided to visit, along with a bazillion other people, on a hot day.  Yes, the line whipped around the corner and easily intimidated would-be ice-creamers but not me, my trusty mini-me and lactose-intolerant masochist.  Surprisingly enough, the line moved right along and allowed enough time to peruse Yelp reviews on our phones for recommended flavors; Secret Breakfast, Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee to name a few.

The folks at HS were patient and helpful considering the droves of samplers coming in and out of the shop.  After several tastings, my 8-yr old decided on Fluffernutter and Fudgsicle sorbet,  the BF opted for Secret Breakfast, Dulce De Leche Malt and Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee while I screamed for Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee and Lemon Buttermilk Sorbet.  WINNER, WINNER, CHICKEN DINNER!

2 scoops, and big ones at that (that's what she said) in a cup, a mere $3.75.  

Bring coin for metered parking.  Be prepared to be creeped out by the two-headed stuffed calf head gracing their walls.
author: Elaine L.

description:
Honestly, i'm not a big fan of this place. The secret breakfast left a nasty taste in my mouth... like I ate a cone full of plastic. 

I did however sample the Vietnamese Coffee and the Malted Dulce De Leche. Those flavors are really good!

If I ever go back here I am definitely passing on the Secret Breakfast...
author: Andre B.

description:
Secret Breakfast... a possible hangover cure with a side of cornflakes?

I'm not one for breakfast food to begin with but the flavor was amazing! One sample taste and I made up my decision for the night. Even my liver agreed to the bourbon, which, in case you were wondering, isn't strong enough to induce drunkeness. The ice cream did leave a smoky aftertaste that burned the back of my palate though (similar to a caramel aftertaste). Sweetness wise, it was something I could tolerate in one scoop and no more than that.

Jesus Juice was meh - nothing fancy, mostly coke flavored with a tinge of wine. You can probably reproduce something similar in taste at home.

Honey Thyme was awful, like eating a mouthful of thyme itself. I think this was concocted to rival Bi-Rite's Honey Lavender (or vice versa) but it doesn't work at all.

Hot Mess... was just that. One. Hot. Sweet. Mess. 

Short line is a plus. I would come back for a pint of Secret Breakfast.
author: Liana L.

description:
As the saying goes, "you have to kiss a lot of frogs before you find a prince".... The same can be said about the quest to find the ultimate ice cream flavor at Humphrey Slocombe.

With its unusual ice cream flavors, changing menu, hole-in-the-wall interior, and long lines, Humphrey Slocombe reminded me of my favorite ice cream place in LA (Scoops). However, although I'm all for trying new, unique flavors, there were some definite hits and some definite misses.

LIKES:
-Olive Oil (Who would've thought olive oil would taste good as ice cream? Sounds gross, but it works!)
-Candied Ginger
-White Chocolate Lavender
-Lychee (can't ever go wrong with lychee)

DISLIKES:
-Thai Chili Lime (I'm not sure if spicy and ice cream really go together....I thought this one definitely had a kick, and not the good kind)
-Secret Breakfast (I know this is the flavor the place is known for, but I wasn't really digging the bourbon-y, alcoholic aftertaste.)
-Salt and Pepper (Yuck...I felt sick after this one. Bad idea!)

They didn't have foie gras ice cream the day I was there due to the changing menu, but I'd go back just to experience the sheer novelty of it.

Overall, big props for creativity. Every adventurous foodie should come here at least once, since you can't find a lot of these flavors anywhere else...but be prepared for lots of surprises (both good and bad)!
author: Sarah T.

description:
It's all about the Vietnamese Coffee and the Secret Breakfast.  You must pair them up in order to take advantage of the Complete Breakfast.  The cashier was super nice and was very patient as my GF and I sampled every flavor.  He made lots of suggestions and was very helpful in describing what went into every flavor.

Originally, we had come by for Beer Week.  Humphry's was promoting 4 beer-infused ice creams as part of the promotion.  The "beer flight" bowl was a value at $5.  But that's a serious amount of ice cream.  And 4 scoops of ice cream in a single sitting is teetering on the ridiculous in my opinion.

Of all the beer ice creams, Old thunder pussy was my favorite.  It could definitely stand out as an everyday offering.  But after sampling all their offerings, my mind could only focus on the Complete Breakfast.  

My GF and I decided to share.  Well, we had to share because we just finished up at Dynamo.  And before Dynamo, we had sandwiches at the Ferry Bldg.  Yes, that's a lot of food in the morning.

When in San Francisco...
author: Nino R.

description:
Same price as Birite ($3.25 for a single scoop, which is actually 2 scoops), and it's good ice cream, but the flavors are more fru-fru and, in my opinion, less appealing.

By Humphry's own admission, balsamic caramel is the famous "why does this taste like vinegar" flavor. Seriously it tasted like caramel ice cream with balsamic vinegar...yuck. On the other hand, if you want to taste vinegar in your ice cream, then you would probably like it. 

What I did have -- Vietnamese coffee -- was very good, but there weren't any other compelling flavors.

I also tried the following:

- Tahitian vanilla (creamy, but kind of plain)
- Pink grapefruit (sorbet that doesn't really go with the other flavors)
- Secret breakfast (bourbon and corn flakes -- I'm not a huge fan of alcohol) 

I was afraid to try the peanut butter and curry flavor after balsamic caramel, but I'll have to taste it for next time. 

I would come back here to have the Vietnamese coffee. And as another reviewer mentioned, the portion size is slightly larger than Birite. I still prefer Birite though.
author: Ted W.

description:
It's appropriate that this ice cream parlor lists its daily flavors on Warhol-esque cans. If San Francisco is a world-class gallery, showcasing all the ways in which food can be presented as art, Humphry Slocombe Ice Cream has earned its extra-special status. It's the Big Name Piece everyone's willing to seek out on the second floor of the museum, and as playful and beloved as Andy's iconic works. 

I'll admit that a colleague and I were recently THOSE girls: we paid for a cab expressly to get to and from Humphry Slocombe, and took our time sampling every exotic flavor, from Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee to hibiscus-beet sorbet. Luckily, we came early so there was no line! (Eventually, I settled on a bourbon float based on Secret Breakfast: for those who don't know, this means cornflake-and-bourbon ice cream. Hey, it was almost five o'clock!)

As food's a disposable art, I also appreciate that HS keeps it green, with re-usable metal spoons instead of throwaways, and compostable everything else. 

And, of course, I appreciate the one actual piece of art, if you can call it that, adorning the wall: HS's trademark two-headed cow. 

All in all, a worthwhile aesthetic experience (which, like every other kind of art form, is only enhanced by the addition of bourbon).
author: Ryan W.

description:
Wow alcohol in the ice cream?!?!  Incredible.  

Im at a loss of words.  Not much you can say about good ice cream other than NOMNOMNOM.  Very creamy and the right balance of flavors.  Some of the other flavors can get quite weird, such as basil.  But if you choose the right flavors, then you will not be disappointed.
author: Timothy D.

description: Secret breakfast- bourbon and corn flakes. Delicious but I need to work on my alcohol tolerance. My friend wanted the prosciutto ice cream but they didn't have anymore. =[ The ice cream sure melts super fast so eat once you get it in our hands!
author: Sarah C.

description:
I've had this place bookmarked for so long! I'm glad I finally got here. Today was my day off but was called into work for an emergency. Since it was so close to my work, I decided to have the bF take me here. He was just going to stay in the car but we found parking a few steps away from the store. 

I tried the peanut butter curry and instantly knew I wanted it. I ordered the peanut butter curry along with the secret breakfast that everyone's been raving about. I didn't even try it. I took a small scoop of it and I was in heaven. It was so good. I'm not a drinker but man, it was good! I liked it so much that I even bought 2 pints...1 peanut butter curry because I wanted my mom to try it and 1 secret breakfast because I think my dad would like it. 

On yelp, it says this place doesn't accept credit cards but they do! They use the app and reader squareup :)
author: Serena F.

description:
Huge fan of ice cream and I was so excited to try out Humphy Slocombe this past weekend! Even though it's January, I wasn't surprised that we'd have to wait in a long line to get ice cream.  When we finally got into the place, I was pretty surprised to see the most unique flavor combinations I've ever seen - Salt and Pepper Ice Cream and a Sorbet called Jesus Juice (Red Wine and Coca-Cola).  

I sampled the Vietnamese Coffee and the Chocolate Sea Salt.  I thought the Chocolate Sea Salt was a bit on the saltier side but the Vietnamese Coffee was pretty spot on and amazing.  I got a scoop of that as well as a scoop of the Secret Breakfast.  It turned out to be a pretty good combination.  

Extra tip - the Frosted Almonds taste exactly like Frosted Flakes...get it on your ice cream with of course Marshmallow Fluff!  Mmmmmm....
author: Joel C.

description:
Let's just put it all out on the table. Can you really go wrong with a quirky little ice cream joint in the Mission? Two things that I love about Humphry Slocombe: one, it's close to work and two, it's devilishly delicious. 
There is something about the Jesus Juice that scared me but also tempted me to compromise my way out of my normal food segregation laws. I also super loved the bacon brittle that we bought at the counter. I love coming here with coworkers to celebrate... well any old thing! Three scoops of Humphry Slocombe just isn't enough. Because it's that good, that's why.
author: Kelly B.

description:
One of my fave ice cream shops in San Francisco!

I'm used to having rotating ice cream flavors (I'm looking at you, Ici in Berkeley!) so after many trips to Humphry Slocombe I was rather surprised to see that the menu had some constants! Generally, you'll find fan favorites like Jesus Juice or Secret Breakfast. In many of my other trips here, I've generally found the likes of Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee, Sesame, and/or Tahitian Vanilla at the store.

Though there is a varying offering of ice creams, none really compare to the tastes of the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee! As a (blue bottle) coffee lover and an ice cream lover, it's hard to come by an ice cream that really does justice to both, and I believe that this shop has hit the jackpot with the perfect blend of creaminess and coffee flavor!
author: Mary C.

description: Ok, so far, this place is def. my new favorite Ice Cream place, simply because of the flavors. Mitchel's will always have my heart for quality/texture (they make the BEST sorbets!) but the Summer Sweet Corn, Harvey Milk and Honey Graham, Secret Breakfast, and the root beer have all been bangin good!
author: Larry B.

description:
Too bad it's yet another trendy food joint for hipsters! (victim of its own location in the ultra gentrified douchey mission district).

The ice cream here is pretty good and if you're into quirky food joints then this Humphry Slocombe's should definitely be on your list of places to try.

Unique freakoid flavors and moderate lines (trust me...unless you're a regular and know every flavor then you'll appreciate the line so you can leisurely decide on what flavors to get...unless you enjoy a "Soup Nazi"-esque environment)
author: Richard C.

description: The oolong tea tastes kind of like milk tea, and the vietnamese coffee flavor was really good too! I want to try the secret breakfast next!
author: Victoria L.

description: Shwing! Black Sesame ice cream and Vietnamese Coffee ice cream were hitters for me! Wish I tried the chocolate, but it was all gone by the time I got there.
author: Tricia A.

description:
I've been hearing about this place since before I moved here. I finally went. LET ME TELL YOU EVERYTHING.

I got there at 21:00 but it turns out they changed their hours so they close at 22:00. Wicked! The line was short. Is that because it was cold? I don't freaking care. It's worth waiting 20 minutes for.

The first thing I saw was their shirt which has a siamese cow head on it. I thought, "oh that's cute." I look up above there and see a taxidermied siamese cow head. AWESOME. That's an epitome of a double scoop, right?

There are so many options. SO MANY. I thought I wanted Vietnamese blue bottle coffee flavor. I was wrong. I wanted Jesus Juice. Jesus Juice is where it's at! That + POG ice cream = mouthgasms. But wait - there are more flavors! Prosciutto, cheese, beet, other dinner flavors...  Thank you for pleasuring me Humphry Slocombe. I will try your other flavors another day.
author: Sterling D.

description:
Just a tad bit disappointed after reading all the hype for this place.  Wouldn't go back when there are so many other options, unless I had a craving for rum raisin or secret breakfast.

Good:
Secret breakfast
Rum Raisin
Vanilla

Not so good:
texture of ice cream was crumbly and melted very quickly
miscellaneous chunks of stuff in the vanilla, needs to be strained better.  

Staff was a bit rude.
author: Xela C.

description:
After coming here 3 times, I can say that I will not be coming back. On hot days, their place gets pretty packed and the wait is pretty long. Service is not too friendly (they should definitely NOT be working at an ice cream joint if they can't even put on a smile.. totally kills my ice-cream mood).

Flavors:
Vanilla: GOOD, never lets me down
Vietnamese coffee: OK. kind of strangely "salty & sour"
Cantaloup sorbet: NOT ok. decent at first, but then gets extremely SPICY
Sesame: Pass. strangely "salty"

Overall:
I don't like how they never really change up their flavors and how their workers are not friendly at all. When people crave for ice cream, they are either in a good mood or in a sad mood and hoping to eat some ice cream to BE in a good mood. They always frown when I ask to sample flavors. What? Do you think I'm just going to try ALL the flavors and then jet? JEEZ. I never leave this place with a happy feeling. And why are your flavors all SALTY?? I understand you're going for the "unique" flavor.. but really? Salty and spicy??

Eh. I rather make a further trip to Three Twins Ice Cream or Marco Polo.
author: Annie T.

description: I was introduced to this wonderful little ice-cream factory by friends after an amazing dinner. This is real life Willie Wonka stuff, but not in a gimmicky way, this place is the real deal! The "Secret Breakfast" flavor is inspired (and has become a staple SF classic.) Vanilla ice-cream flavored with bourbon and cornflakes. They are open late so forget dessert wherever you happen to be and make the pilgrimage, you won't regret it.
author: Charlotte R.

description:
My Ratings:
Quantity: 4 - Good
Quality: 5 - Very tasty!
Price: 4 - Good
Location: 3 - Small
Parking: 3 - Street parking
Service: 3 - Good
Speed: 4 - Good

Overall: Unforgettable Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee Ice-Cream!

My Opinion/Story:
I was curious how their Vietnamese Coffee would taste so I ventured out to find out.  I was not disappointed!  It was the best coffee flavored ice-cream I've ever had and I can't even compare it to any other.  Like what I said, it's Unforgettable.  I still plan to come up here to try other flavors but once I've found my favorite, it's hard to try others.
author: Cherryl D.

description:
I LOVE ICE CREAM. Like seriously, allll ice cream...I don't believe in discriminating! But I must say, Humphrey Slocombe is superior to the other ice cream brands (maybe not Bi-rite, it's a close one).

My favorite here was the Oolong Tea and the Jesus Juice (red wine + coke). Not a huge fan of the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee though, just because I don't enjoy  bitter, grainy pieces of coffee in my ice cream. I like my ice cream smooth and creamy ;) Bf loved it though, so maybe it's just me. Brown butter is also pretty good.

Bf always raves about the time he had the Prosciutto flavor here, but hasn't seen it since. Apparently, it's a pretty rare flavor and they only offer it 1-2 times per year, so if you happen to see it on your lucky day, try it!!

Also, not sure if it depends on the time of day you come here, but so far I've never had to wait more than 2 minutes for my ice cream. I'm always here on a Saturday afternoon. At Bi-rite, which I usually go to on Friday or Saturday nights, the lines always wrap around the corner!
author: Kate Y.

description: I know people really like this place, but I really don't. The ice cream leaves a weird greasy film in your mouth that you can literally scrape off in between bites. It looked a little like lard or Crisco or something. I don't like to scrape my mouth out while eating ice cream. The flavors are all very trendy and trying a bit too hard for me. I didn't mind the coffee ice cream flavor, but I cannot get past the awful insoluble grease that I had to scrape out. Also, the prices are a bit high for my taste. I won't be going back here. Just go to St. Francis down the street for delicious ice cream.
author: Jody S.

description:
Finally got to try what everyone was talking about - last night when it was about 48 degrees!!

Still I was super impressed with Humphry Slocombe!!  The ice cream flavors are unique and one of a kind.  I finally settled on a scoop of Secret Breakfast (LOVED it) and After School Snack - so good!

I am a bit of an ice cream gal and I have to tell you this place is up there with my other SF favorite Bi-Rite!  I will for sure be back again and most likely when the weather is cold because the wait wasn't too long and we could actually sit inside and enjoy our dessert.  I have a feeling that if it was a hot summer night I wouldn't have been so lucky!!

See ya soon HS!!!
author: Heidi S.

description: What can I say, this is the best ice cream parlor in the Bay Area asides from Bi-Rite and Smitten, the flavor is outrageous yet delicious, this is the original place, a little small yet you can see the ice cream making through the window and they still hang the double cow head logo (totally cool concept for bold!)
author: Bryan T.

description:
I had a spoonful of the thai chile lime and was pleasantly surprised by the lovely mixture of spices and lime! I love that they're so adventurous with their flavors.
My friend and I ended up with a scoop of balsamic caramel and secret breakfast (corn flakes and bourbon). It was a cup full of sophisticated, creamy goodness that I will definitely be going back for.
author: Carolyn K.

description:
They definitely have unique flavors but when we went it was during the Beer Festival in SF so all of their flavors were mixed with some sort of beer.  Mixing beer and ice cream for me is just not right.  I like to keep them very separate and away from each other.  It almost ruined drinking beer for me to have it in ice cream form. 

I tried a taste of their Secret Breakfast, Blue Bottle Coffee and Tahitian Vanilla and they were okay.  Maybe I had too high expectations for this place.  And maybe I went when they had limited flavors as to what I would prefer.  

I would definitely have to go back to try it again because I'd never seen flavors like theirs and I'm sure I will find one that will stand out to me eventually.
author: Stephanie H.

description:
Humphry Highlights:

*novelty flavors & novelty menu items
*manageable line you won't feel ridiculous waiting in
*try all the flavors you want
*single is $4, double is $6
*they accept credit cards

I was wandering around the Mission this sunny Sunday afternoon and Yelp'd ice cream options nearby, which originally brought me to Mitchell's in Bernal Heights. There were tonsss of people outside, so I walked up to someone and asked if they were the end of the line. They scoffed at me and told me you needed to take a number and then wait outside like everyone else. Um, no. Plan B: Humphry's Slocombe. It did not disappoint.

The secret breakfast (frosted flake ice cream!) and blue bottle vietnamese coffee were both wonderful.

You're a true gentleman, Humphry.

Just like Nicolas Cage.
author: K M.

description:
San Francisco & the Bay Area in general are no strangers to great ice-cream, there are many places to get your taste on. What sets places like this apart is the creative &  unique flavors.

I ordered the Secret breakfast and it didn't disappoint. It would be awesome if they had some bacon in it however since it is a "breakfast" flavor. The ice-cream was good, creamy, and not too expensive. I also tried the salted watermelon, which was surprisingly tasty. Take advantage of your free taste tests!
author: Justin R.

description:
We drove a long way out of our way to try this place. Very small and from what I saw a very unhappy staff. When we arrived all three of us needed to use the restroom. We found a sign that said out of order. I wonder what the staff does all day. Well I don't care if I drove for an hour, if a food business does not think a working restroom is important enough to repair I will not eat there. We left.
Watch out Humphry Slocombe the reruns of best thing I ever ate will run out and so will the lines.
author: Mike P.

description: Fancy ice cream with very unique flavors. I had the "sweet breakfast", which is bourbon rolled with corn flakes. It has that unique flavor that is strongly bourbon, but not overpowering. The corn flakes add to the sweetness and texture. This place is pretty good, but just not my preference. It's too wild for me. I'm more of an conventional guy preferring Bi-rite.
author: Arnold W.

description:
We stopped by for a visit recently.

Pros:  Very unique flavor possibilities..

Cons:  The flavor you want is probably not going to be available on the day you show up.

We were in town (and we hail from Milwaukee, WI - so it's quite a journey) and I have been dying to try the prosciutto ice cream for the last two years.  No dice.  

Here is my really sad face and crying, tear filled eyes because it wasn't available.  :-(  ::::

Ok, now that that's over with...
We did try several other flavors.
Most notable were the smoked chocolate sea salt - holy smoke Batman! It's not for the faint of heart.  But it is excellent - and worth a try.  And our other favorite was one that you'll see in a lot of reviews - the Secret Breakfast.  The combination of bourbon and corn flakes was spectacularly rich - I highly recommend, especially when paired with the smoked chocolate sea salt.

We also tried Guinness Gingerbread.  While it was good, it didn't knock my socks off after the second spoonful, and I wish I had gotten something else.

I really wanted to get a t-shirt (it's an addiction I have - which I have to be careful of, because you can really look like a cult weirdo if you happen to walk into a restaurant because of a craving while wearing their swag...the other side to it is you might be mistaken for waitstaff..) and they literally had none in stock besides the mannequin.  However, I was directed towards the website to complete that purchase.

One more note:  I hail from Milwaukee WI.  This is the land of frozen custard.  Which I have been told by a friend from LA is tantamount to eating frozen butter.  (I want you to know that he thought that was amazing, and not gross).  What they have here at Humphry Slocombe is ICE CREAM.  It is NOT frozen custard.  It will not be as rich as custard.
(Just a little warning for you - in case you are like me, and all ice cream tastes a little "thin").  This isn't the fault of the maker...it's just because it's not frozen custard.

One last tip:  Follow them on Twitter.  You can see the flavor board and salivate over the delectable flavors...and decide if you need to drop in.
author: Maggi K.

description:
I'm giving this establishment 5 stars due to taste and originality. My friend read a foodie article that mentioned this ice cream joint. So, we were really excited to try their Foie Gras and Prosciutto ice cream! 

We were bummed when the guy told us that they haven't made those flavors in a while. We sampled 4 flavors before making up our mind. Our final flavors were Secret Breakfast (bourbon & cornflakes), Balsamic Caramel, Thai Chili Sorbet, & McEvoy Olive Oil ice cream. 

I have to say the Secret Breakfast (oooooooooo weeeeeee you can definitely taste the Bourbon in this one...should have ordered 2 more scoops) and the McEvvoy Olive Oil were my favorites. It was so creamy and rich in flavor. Also, the Balsamic Caramel really had a kick to it. I think it might even pair well with a salad. My friend really liked the Thai Chili Sorbet. It's not hot but you can definitely taste a hint of the Thai chili pepper.

There are about 8 flavors there...some sweet and savory. The workers there are friendly. Even though, we took a while to pick our flavors he was always patient with us. There is limited seating here, so it's best if one person sits down while the other person orders. I asked the workers if they can recommend a cool place to grab drinks. They even went on their work iPad to search for an address for us. 

I love it here and my next ice cream pit stop has to be Bi-Rite Creamery in the Mission!!!
author: Melanie B.

description:
Ice cream is my all time fave, so I'm ALWAYS down. I kept debating whether or not I should get 3 scoops... Anyways, my friend and I beat the crowd, so we sampled way more than we should have :) It's not my fault they have all these crazy flavors!

FlufferNutter is peanut butter + marshmallow blended together... very smooth & creamy - fluffy & nutty, I must say ;)
Harvey Milk & Honey is very light with chunks of graham crackers mixed in.

2 scoops on a cone = $4.25 (FlufferNutter // Harvey Milk & Honey)

They are going all high-tech on us with their iPads, asking if we wanted our receipt through text or email! (In the email: If you download the Pay with Square app, you get $10 off your next purchase) --- You know I'm all over that!
author: Janet S.

description:
1 star for good service - They are very patient as customers try out the different flavors
1 star for creative flavors - Truly unique. From secret breakfast that has bourbon and corn flakes to jesus juice which is wine flavored to Irish Ale. You are a long way off from Cold Stone or Baskin Robbins
2 stars for the ice cream itself - Had to get more for the house on the way out
1 star for being a small biz - They make the ice cream in the back of the store.
author: Sunil R.

description: I love their ice cream and their flavors. If I am in the area I am always up for some Secret Breakfast Ice Cream, my favorite flavor!
author: Natalie R.

description:
I must warn you, this is a bias review as I cannot say no to ice cream, any day, any where, any time... :D

@Humphry's, I rotate between the secret breakfast and the earl gray flavors... the secret breakfast though is by far, the best flavor in my opinion (definitely not for the faint-hearted ice cream eaters), be careful on what you order!
author: Ming S.

description:
With the intent of getting all Suge Knight on yelp, I'm proclaiming that Humphrey is the best ice cream in Mission District ice cream war.

With all the singular flavors (secret breakfast, white pear miso), Humphrey's always comes up with his own work, never one to plagiarize. 

No Vanilla Ice here!
author: Joanna M.

description:
Came here twice in 3 days because I didn't realize this place was on the 7x7 list. They have some very interesting flavors here and I made sure to get their secret breakfast which is bourbon and corn flakes. At first lick, the bourbon was pretty strong but after a while you no longer notice it. It is very tasty.

FYI, whenever they have the spotted dick, don't be shy to say it because the girl will make you say it louder if you don't lol. A pretty funny prank to those a little bit weird about it. This place is awesome. Come here if you can.
author: edward k.

description:
OMG the ice cream is delicious here. There's a line going out the door and just when it looks like it's half its size, a new group arrives to form a longer line. I can't make up my mind which flavor is my favorite. It's a toss up between Secret Breakfast and Butter Beer. Both are excellent flavors. Actually, I also liked Vietnamese coffee. I'm going back soon because the time I went there before last was a year ago. You can never have too much ice cream when it tastes this good. :) 

Looks like I'll be running four times a week instead of three...
author: Clare H.

description:
Street parking (circled a few times before we could find a spot)

I tasted: Cornflake and bourbon (Secret Breakfast), Vietnamese Coffee, and Tahiti Vanilla (a tad too sweet). 

Small cup is $3.25.  

I'm glad I finally got a taste of this place and I'm not sure what the hype is about.  It's too:

*too sweet for me
* oily. It left a film of oily fat on my lips
*Very creamy and I like it to be more firm

I just need regular flavors and they serve too many funky flavors.
author: Jboogie L.

description:
I looooove the ice cream at Humphry Slocombe! I think the ice cream is really delicious - super smooth, rich and creamy. They also have an interesting variety of unique flavors that you'd be hard-pressed to find elsewhere. 

Some of the flavors they have can be hit or miss but when they hit it, they hit it reeeeeeal good. Even when it is a miss, I appreciate the interesting spins they try to do on ordinary flavors. And after all, that's why you have the option to try flavors before you buy them -  to see if you'd like it or not. 

My favorites are Secret Breakfast and the Vietnamese Blue Bottle Coffee flavors! They're stables there, which is awesome for me, because I always always get at least one of the flavors when I visit. The last new flavor I tried was oolong tea - that  one was also delicious! I think it was more lightly flavored than the other ice creams here, but still good!

Parking is the usual - with street parking, it's a bit of a crapshoot. Some days you're lucky, some days you're not so much. Parking doesn't tend to be terrible though. 

There can be lines here, but they usually move along at a decent pace (unlike Smitten....). They do have a counter you can sit at by the window (yay, people watching!) and a few chairs and tables outside.

Overall, one of my favorite places for ice cream in the city! I just wish it was a bit more centrally located - and by centrally located, I mean, located closer to me!

Protip, Secret Breakfast is on one of the 7x7 big eats list! Well deserved too!
author: Lena Y.

description:
After getting brunch at Mercury Lounge, the bf wanted something sweet and thought it'd be a fantastic idea to walk all the way to Humphry Slocombe's for some ice cream. I'd heard about this cafe sua da flavor, or Vietnamese Iced Coffee, so I was down for the cause. We get to the front and see a line of about 10 people ahead of us. Don't worry, it moves fast - the employees know what they're doing. We get to the front and try a couple of flavors - Jesus Juice, something else I can't remember - then decide on Secret Breakfast, Boccalone (prosciutto), and Vietnamese Coffee.

Ho boy. Loved the Vietnamese Coffee and Secret Breakfast (although the bourbony flavor was overwhelming after awhile), not so big a fan of the Boccalone. It just tasted like prosciutto. I realized I prefer prosciutto in it's natural meat form, that's all. The workers were awesome too and since it was such a nice day, we sat out front to people watch before moving along.
author: Johanna L.

description:
Friend 1: "You can really taste the bourbon"
Friend 2: "The bourbon really hits you"
Friend 3: "Yeah that bourbon flavor was too strong for me"
Me: "....I can barely taste the bourbon".

I guess this means that I'm an alcoholic. I could only taste a "hint" of bourbon in my scoop of Secret Breakfast. It definitely seemed to be overhyped.

I also had the vinegary caramel and the tahitian vanilla. Although the ice cream itself was very creamy, I'm not sure if I was sold. The tahitian vanilla was no better than regular vanilla ice cream from the grocery store's freezer aisle. The vinegary caramel, though tasty at first, ended up being way too salty in the end. I think I prefer bi-rite's salted caramel, more.
author: Kazu O.

description: This place is good. Hands down, one of the best artisinal ice cream spots that I've ever had. Whenever I go there really isn't that much of a line. This is something that I love. I usually get my tried and true favorite there, Secret Breakfast. You cannot go wrong with that. I've also had the Thai Tea and the Olive Oil ice creams. I need to start trying the other flavors though. I bet they're all good.
author: John W.

description:
I've heard really great things about this place, but as with every bizarre-flavored ice cream place, the flavors taste like their titles. If you're into salt & pepper ice cream, this is the place for you. I, on the other hand, don't care for those exotic flavors. It's a cool place to experience, but I am more than happy with grocery store ice cream.

$3.25 for a scoop and only street parking.
author: Melissa G.

description:
We sorta came here by mistake. We'd intended on going to Bi-Rite but my sister somehow entered the wrong place on the maps app. It must have been a serendipitous mistake.

Our party of 4 stood shivering outside in line (yes, any reputable ice cream spot will have a line. Even on a cold day.) I started canvassing and asking what people were getting as they came out (shameless, I know). 

Read on yelp that the Secret Breakfast was highlighted in 1192 reviews. (Bourbon and cornflakes?!?! blech I thought.) Finally it was our turn (not bad really, just 10 minutes) and I read through the menu....about 10 flavors ranging from Candied Ginger to Salt and Pepper. 

I decided on a few to try.... Vietnamese Blue Bottle Coffee...very nice. Chocolate and Smoked Sea Salt... oooh.  Oh what the heck, Secret Breakfast. OMG. I was sold. The crunchy corn flakes in the sweet bourbon ice cream. Yessss. This hit my happy spot.
author: Nicha K.

description: This place had a long line, but it moved quickly.  The employees were nice about letting me try a flavor or two since it was my first visit.  Initially I was weirded out by the idea of having cornflakes in my ice cream, but I was pleasantly surprised at how much I liked the Secret Breakfast flavor.  I guess the bourbon in it didn't hurt either :)
author: Pam S.

description:
I love this place! I go here rain or shine, and hot or cold. It's just good. They have bunch of unique flavors and they have seasonal flavors also. My all time favorite is definitely the secret breakfast. If you have low tolerance on alcohol, have secret breakfast and beer flavor, it could get you buzzed, since my friend got buzzed. 
If you want cakes you'll have to order it in advanced, for about I believe 3-4 days, since they don't have anything pre-made like bi-rite. Humphry and bi-rite is my go to ice cream places, you have to try this place.
author: Toni Rose M.

description: I rarely eat ice cream because not a huge fan. Came here at night and the line was out the door which was a good sign. The line moved pretty fast so it wasn't too bad. The first thing that caught my eye was the unique names. Immediately the Jesus Juice made me start guessing the flavor but I was completely off lol. I sampled the Jesus Juice which was red wine mixed with some sorbet which was pretty good. The secret breakfast was a perfect combination of bourbon and cornflakes, two very odd combinations that worked well for this ice cream. Lastly, the blue bottle Vietnamese coffee ice cream. It was a good balance between sweetness and coffee. Price wise, its average for your craft ice cream palors at $4 a scoop, but worth it to get the double scoop for $6. All in all definitely a place I will revisit to try all the new flavors!
author: Ricky C.

description:
I stumbled upon this trendy ice cream shop by accident on a rainy day in the Mission. I was excited as I had heard so much about it and there was no line.  The girl behind the counter was very patient as she described flavors with names like Jesus Juice and let me sample almost all of them.  

Humphrey Slocombe definitely serves an eclectic array of ice cream flavors.   I tried one called Special Breakfast that mixed corn flakes and bourbon and another that combined peanut butter and curry.  These two were a little too wild for me so I settled on the McEvoy Olive Oil flavor.  The ice cream is incredibly dense and creamy, just the way I like it.  And they don't charge an arm and a leg like some boutique ice cream shops.
author: Jeannette W.

description:
This place is amazing. The flavors are fantastic. Today I had pluot cardamom sorbet and pistachio brittle ice cream, each of which were totally amazing. 

I like this place better than Bi-Rite. Bi-Rite is whipped so light it feels as though it disappears instantly. Slocombe is denser and richer and it takes forever to lick my way through a scoop.
author: Jen W.

description:
We got there at 8:58PM and they wouldn't let us in.

Someone in line had to buy for us.

vanilla was really good.
olive oil was not that good (gjelina in LA has a really good one)
secret breakfast (was pretty tasty)

even though i gave it 3 stars...its worth taking the trip to go because it is something different.
author: Addison P.

description:
I like their sense of humor. 

I came in on a holiday one time and they said they were closing early for "sexual harassment awareness training". I promptly asked for a secret breakfast, and for them to keep their eyes off my chest. 

Bourbon and cornflakes. Bourbon. Bourbon. Bourbon. The whiskey drinker in me cries in excitement.
author: Ben T.

description:
A unique ice cream place, yes, but a bit too unusual for my taste buds.  Wanted to really buy an ice cream, but just could not get myself to like any flavors!  Tried like five different samples, and by then I just had to give up and kindly walk away.  But props to them for letting me sample so many- and to not buy anything!

Secret Breakfast - a little too much alcohol tasting, would have been good with less
Cayenne Cantaloupe- too much cayenne, wanted more sweet, melon taste
tried 2 strawberry flavors, but forgot the names- too much of that odd flavor and not enough plain, simple strawberry flavor

May come back to try other flavors, hopefully I'll find a favorable one!  But I do like the idea of these unusual flavors!
author: Jennifer L.

description:
They have something for everyone here:

Potter fans:  Butter Beer
Alcoholics and Cereal lovers: Secret Breakfast
Chocolate lovers: Malted Milk Chocolate
Religious folk: Jesus Juice
Democrats: Barak-y-Road
late 80s/early 90s hip hop fans: Salt and Pepper

I fall somewhere between 1 and 2.....more leaning towards......
author: Sanket K.

description:
I had a taste of secret breakfast, a scoop of pistachio ice cream and a pint of black sesame ice cream at Humphry Slocombe at the Ferry Building stand a year ago. As I recalled, they were delicious! A year later, I came to the actual store and got a taste of the cinnamon brittle and the Thai Lime Chili Sorbet. I ended up choosing the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee ice cream. The coffee flavor wasn't as strong as expected, and it didn't really have that distinct Vietnamese coffee or condensed milk taste--it just tasted like coffee; but the texture was amazing--very smooth and creamy. 

The unique flavor choices and texture of the ice cream definitely won me over. The price is pretty decent of gourmet ice cream. Thumbs up for being eco-friendly.
author: Mandy C.

description:
Seriously out of place: walked by it and around it quite a few times before we got that "DUHHH" feeling when we finally walked in. It's off a side street in the mission district so maybe it's because I was distracted by all the delicious smelling Mexican food. Yeah, that's probably it. 

I don't know if I should break this down flavor by flavor or what, but basically I'll say if you come when there's not much of a line (which there was NONE when I went) try to sample as much as you can and then choose from there. 

My favorite is the brown buttahh (butter.. someone misspelled it.. I like it better that way) because I have quite a sweet tooth. Honest to god, Paula Deen would have died and gone to heaven. It was such a rich, buttery flavor but not dense enough to feel like you just ate a bar of butter. 

The grapefruit sorbet was completesy opposite of the brown butter, but still fantastic. Light, airy and just enough grapefruity goodness to make your mouth sigh with happiness. 

If you're in the area you should definitely swing by, but if this is your only destination on a long trip I would advise having something to nom on first. 

Oh, one sadface moment is when I was going to use their bathroom and I opened the door and a tornado of flies attacked me. EW.
author: Kelly E.

description: I sampled two flavors and neither were very good.  I really do not understand the hype.
author: mi m.

description: Love the Blue Bottle & Harvey Milk and Honey Graham Cracker flavours!
author: Esther P.

description:
Came to this place late one Sunday night after dinner down the street.... 
The 2 employees working this past Sunday were amazing! They let you try all the flavors you could want to try, and don't get all judgey. 

Our group probably spent about 30 minutes here. 

the Secret breakfast is amazing! My fave! 
Oolong tea was good (Reminiscent of the Earl Grey tea, but less bold -in a good way, than Bi-Rite) 
Chocolate and sea salt - was super salty
There was fat elvis, that was good, interesting. 
my 2nd fave is the vietnamese blue bottle coffee! 

I wanted to buy a pint to bring home to the bf, but I had CE and it would have melted in my car the next day before i got a chance to put it in the freezer. Boo! Next time though! :)
author: Judy N.

description:
Unfortunately,  my growing inability to digest dairy has forced me to cut back on a lot of tasty foods.  Ice cream has been the most tragic of losses.  So when I do decide to dangerously flirt with my lactose intolerance, I need to know that it is going to be worth the risk.  Thankfully,  Humphry Slocombe has never disappointed.  

The staff is always friendly and willing to let you be the pesky customer who tries every single flavor before deciding.  A few core flavors remain the same but for the most part you can expect new and exciting combinations everyday.   Secret Breakfast marries chunks of corn flakes cereal with bourbon flavored ice cream.  Fluffernutter combines marshmallow fluff with tasty peanut butter.  I am so grateful when they offer their Fudge Sorbet because I can get my "ice cream" fix without the dairy.  The first time my friend and I tried the Fudge Sorbet, we had to return to the counter to buy pints to take home.  When I saw her the next day, we both confessed to eating some for breakfast.  Yes, it is THAT good.   

One day I will be more kind to my body and avoid dairy altogether.  But until that day comes, Humphry Slocombe, I am happy to call you my guilty pleasure.
author: Renee M.

description:
+:  Great flavor.
-:  Way too much rich cream or milk or something, left a weird flavor in my mouth afterwards.
!:  We did an ice cream challenge during our visit and this was unfortunately third place.
?:  No questions.
author: H O.

description:
Their flavors are interesting but not really my style. I'm all for interesting combinations but this were...interesting. I might come back and try other flavors but I'm not going to make my way out to the Mission, especially since I don't live near there.

The guy working there was very patient with me and my friend since we did tasting spoons on like 3 other flavors before finally deciding on a flavor. I got the Tahitian Vanilla that just tasted like a sweeter version of vanilla. *shrug*
author: Jean T.

description:
The epitome of great ice cream.  Creamy and delicious with unique flavors and excellent customer service.  And what?  No ridiculous line of lemmings!

My partner in crime and I went on a crawl of the Mission/Noe Valley creameries one day: Humphry Slocombe, Xanath, Bombay, Bi-Rite, and Mitchell's.  Bombay and Mitchell's stand apart because of their unique flavors like rose, various teas, and ube, but we tip our hats to Humphry in particular.
author: Jenn C.

description: One of the best ice scream spots in SF. Amazing and interesting flavors they offer. One of the best flavors I recommend is the secret breakfast. Vanilla ice cream infused with bourbon and caramelized frosted flakes. Delish!!!!! And they have other great flavors to offer, such as the blue bottle coffee. One of my faves, especially if you're an avid coffee drinker/lover. If you're around or near the neighborhood, you must stop herd and sample their ice creams. You will not be disappointed.
author: rae m.

description:
No, no and more no. 

Seriously, half of the flavors made me puke in my mouth just by thinking about them. 

Salt & Pepper:
Anchovie Chili Chocolate
Jesus Juice
Secret Breakfast
Balsamic Caramel
Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee
Peanut butter & curry

To be fair, my friends and the 600+ reviews on yelp love this place. I really don't get it. 

Sorry guys, maybe I like normal flavors. Maybe I'm boring. I feel like I'm the PC of the ice cream world and you're the Mac. 

Whatever it is - you're not doing it for me.

It's not you, it's me. We're going to have to to part ways. 

Ok, thanks, bye.
author: Carlos A.

description: SOOOOOO GOOD that I have 8 pints of Humphry Slocombe ice cream in fridge !!!
author: Linda L.

description:
I'm giving it a three stars because I had Lemon Sorbet something and it was not anything I would want to eat again nor could I finish a few scoops. It tasted like I was eating the lemon peel. When you first put it in your mouth, it was almost delightful, but the aftertaste was not good. They shouldn't even sell this.

Lady friend tried the Vietnamese coffee one and really liked it.
author: Vanguard T.

description:
What to do on Happy Hump Day?? Git, git, git it on with Humphry of course!!

Boccalone proscuitto ice cream was odd. Weird. Confusing. I don't know what it tasted like but not like proscuitto.

Want some Jesus Juice with that? Red wine and diet coke sorbet-ish. Very strong red wine flavor and smell.

Pumpkin 5 spice was.. spicy.

Obviously, Malted vanilla & Blue Bottle Vietnamese coffee were safe.. you can't go wrong!! =)

On top of a crunchy brown sugar cone. You have to get the cone.. they're sooo good!!

Secret breakfast was strong. I could feel that bourbon hit me going down... Ahhh smooth.

Come here for if you're feeling blah and need some Secret Breakfast  or Jesus Juice to brighten your spirits..
Please don't come here if you're vanilla.
author: Angela W.

description:
After all the hype, I was fairly disappointed with this place.  


There are a handful of places out there that make "unique" ice cream combination flavors - Peanut Butter Curry, Crème Fraiche, Honey Thyme, etc.  Even though these flavor combinations can be odd, they should still be appetizing, and most of the flavors I saw when I arrived were not appetizing.  I tried three flavors: Balsamic Caramel, Autumn Harvest Corn, Tahitian Vanilla...they were okay.  The Balsamic Caramel was actually pretty bad - it was very sour and tasted like vinegar ice cream....not good at all.  Autumn Harvest was pretty good - a sweet corn ice cream that had a refreshing taste to it, my problem with it was that there wasn't more "corn" flavor...it seemed a bit faint.  The Tahitian Vanilla was okay too - the texture was decent, but it wasn't as creamy as I like my ice cream to be...also, again, the flavor was pretty faint and not really sweet enough.  

With organic ice cream, I feel the flavors should really come through since unneeded chemicals are not being added...at this spot the flavors were barely there.  Also, the execution of the final flavor seemed to not be very good - if caramel mixed with anything tastes like vinegar, that's not a good thing.  Also, when I usually go for ice cream at least a handful of flavors should immediately pop at me so that I can't decide what to get...when I was there, I felt like I couldn't decide because nothing really sounded very good.

I think I'll be sticking with Bi-Rite...
author: Ken G.

description:
Secret Breakfast = Cornflakes + Bourbon
Elvis in his Fat Years = Peanut Butter + Banana + Bacon

Humphry Slocombe FTW!!!

I definitely need to try the rest of the flavors here.
author: Dipesh G.

description: Must try b4 u die!  Secret Breakfast & Jesus Juice!  The Peanut Butter Curry was intriguing!
author: Aureliano C.

description:
Sometimes I have the tendency to psych myself out and question my obsessions. For ex) for Humphry I've wondered... is it REALLY that good or have I just hit these guys up on a good day? Did they manage to sprinkle crack into my scoop of ice cream on my last visit, or am I just being paranoid?

I had Humphry's last week and am scolding myself at ever doubting my head-over-heels feelings for all my obsessions (happened once w/ Ragazza and I should have learned my lesson). Humphry's Secret Breakfast really IS the sh*t. No questions about it. It is unique, savory and sweet, w/ such a beautiful combination of bourbon & cereal, that I could eat a vat of this. I paired my Secret Breakfast w/ a scoop of their Candied Ginger and loved it. I also had a taste of Humphry's  Vietnamese Coffee and.. still loved it! But, I'm not gonna lie... Secret Breakfast is the creme de la creme and ain't got nothin' on my paranoia!
author: Tiffany M.

description: Tasty, but the flavours are a little too out there for me.  Most were good, but I'm not a huge fan of "artisan" ice cream.  Recommended, though, if you're looking to try something new.  Note, though: they only have a few flavour choices.
author: Brian B.

description:
My friend and I were on our way to Bi-Rite when we happened to pass by this place.  "There's Humphrey Slocombe!" I shouted, excited that I would get to cross it off my bookmark list.  We immediately made a change in plan and turned back around.  Parking was fairly easy on the weekday night we went shortly before closing, there was no line, and we got a table for two outside.  Score!  I like my food nice and simple so I sampled their Tahitian Vanilla (too plain) and Brown Butter - ding ding ding!  Found a winner with that one!  If you like Ricanelas at Bi-Rite then you will love Humphrey Slocombe's Brown Butter.  Delicious!  

I went again with someone else who had never been and wanted to try it out.  This time we went on a weekend night before closing.  Parking was difficult.  We had to circle around a few times and ended up parking on another block.  The line was also out the door this time.  There were no seats either so we had to stand and eat our ice cream.  To my disappointment there was no Brown Butter.  Still wanting to stay on the simple side I went with their Tahitian Vanilla and Malted Dulce de Leche.  My order of preference: Brown Butter (sooooo good!), Malted Dulce de Leche, and Tahitian Vanilla.  I had a taste of my friend's Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee the first time I went and while not a coffee drinker I still was able to appreciate and enjoy its taste.  Each of the flavors really packs a punch in there!

One gripe: the worker who stood at the back of the line at closing time was smoking right in front of people eating their ice cream.  Was that really necessary?  Hard to enjoy your ice cream when you've got cigarette smoke wafting in your direction.  Minor complaint though, and I would definitely come back, hopefully on a night when Brown Butter is being served!
author: Carnita M.

description:
Ding! Ding! Ding!
