Hands down the best, THE. BEST., "pepper + mint chocolate chip" ice cream EVER. (Not sure if that's what they called it, but it was spelled like that on the glass (also a President Day's special))

I'm a hardcore fan of mint chocolate chip/cookie ice cream, but I'm not a fan of big chocolate chip chunks in ice cream to the point where it's gross to chew them because they're so hard from being frozen, thus ruining the ice cream. This mint ice cream is made with REAL mint (not the toothpaste-y kind which makes many people shy away) and it's nice and subtle. There's a lot of chocolately goodness as well. There's chocolate in every spoonful and the chunks are small enough to melt in your mouth once the ice cream is gone. I love it. If they had any pints left, I would've picked up some.

I also had the balsamic caramel which has really strong flavor. It's overwhelming, but still good. My BF couldn't even finish his scoop!

We came into this place around 7 and a lot of the ice cream flavors were already gone. Some lady also wanted a pint, but they said they don't pack anymore for the day. It was quite empty in comparison to Bi-Rite, but maybe it wasn't ice cream time in the city....

With that being said, I'd come back for the peppermint chocolate chip any day :)

CASH ONLY!
author: Clarisse C.

description:
The unique ice creams are amazing!

Perfect place to go after you get some Mexican food in the area. 

Breakfast Special with corn flakes and rum? SO GOOD. LOVE IT. 

This place is so SF.
author: Anya R.

description:
Wow. I cant believe there is an ice cream shop that is daring enough to mix flavors together (that dont usually belong together) and create it into an ice cream! We went last night and they had crazy stuff like peanut butter curry, or basalmic ice cream. I had the oolong black sesame ice cream and the cinnamon caramel brittle.  Both tasted great!! My friend had the Vietnamese coffee and it was sooooo good. Although it was pretty strong so I'm not quite sure I could have handled a full scoop. 

Prices here are definitely affordable. You can get two scoops for $3. The best part is that this place is very GREEN. They have recyclable cups AND spoons! And their tasting spoons are silverware spoons so they can reuse them over and over again! I am a huge supporter of this!!!
author: Janet E.

description:
I wasn't a big fan of the flavors they had the night I went.  I really wanted to try the Thai Chili Lime but it wasn't available that night so I settled for Salted Watermelon and Red Hot Banana.  The Salted Watermelon tasted exactly like I remembered how watermelon with salt tasted as a kid.  Just like with the actual fruit, it was a great combo between sweet and salty.  The Red Hot Banana was less exciting though it had great banana flavor with bits of red hot candy.  I also had a sample of the Vietnamese Coffee and just like the real thing, it was strong.  Perhaps next time I'll take that.  With the Thai Chili Lime.

Though I commend their creatively combined unique flavors, I can't give them more than 3.5 stars knowing there is better ice cream waiting for me at Bi-Rite and Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous.
author: Linh V.

description:
My love for Humphry will surpass my love for my future offspring, partner, friend, family member - you name it. My love for Humphry will bring about world peace. Yelpers, my love for Humphry is beyond your wildest imaginations. This is the kind of ice cream you share on any kind of day, the kind of ice cream that hints at the possibility of a higher being, the kind of ice cream that is made of pure joy. 

Before you continue reading I'd like you to stop comparing it to BiRite. STOP. I MEAN IT! BiRite is its own creature with a refined and original pallet. Humphry is the underdog of ice cream, the renegade, the prodigy of creamed delights. Furthermore, she is the everyday companion. On my sad days I indulge in the "Shhh...secret breakfast". Happier days look towards the Magnolia Ale. When I'm feeling classy and fanciful I go for the exceptional olive oil. This place has a creative treat for any mood and occasion. 

Sometimes Humphry will toss you a curveball. Jesus juice sorbet made of red wine and cola? Salt and pepper flavoured ice cream? The list goes on (and changes daily). The most impressive thing about H.S. is their use of Twitter - I am a follower and it is their updates that feed my addiction. I strongly advise you to follow it as well. Any person who cries "nay" to Humphry Slocombes should be harangued by a mob of hipsters.
author: Emily T.

description:
Cold day. Random time mid-afternoon. Just after a huge rain storm. Once you finally find this place, THEN find your fortuitous parking spot, AND you miss the notorious crowds, you will stumble upon heaven's own ice cream parlor.

Bi-Rite, Ici, Molly Moon's, I LOVE YOU ALL very very much. Although HS's unique product is not as rich, creamy, or generally decadent as the others, the awesomeness of the flavors more than makes up the difference.

The much-hyped Secret Breakfast flavor? On the medium high side, very medium. I mean it's still crazy outstanding to taste bourbon on your palate and texturized by the subtle presence of corn flakes -- don't get me wrong. It's a wonderful taste sensation. But it's not as mindblowing as I likely imagined, so there's just the tiiiiiiny tiniest bit of 'awww' involved. But still good!

The real showstopper, walk-off home run in HS's arsenal? Guinness Gingerbread. O.M.G. Soooooo flipping tasty -- there is something in their special brand of gingerbread that spectacularly complements the slight flavors of what many probably assume to be bland Guinness stout. But it really isn't!

There's a small daily rotation of flavors (like 8-10; don't expect the massive cases like the other places feature) and they definitely have Affogato! Next time, HS... next time indeed!
author: Monica D.

description:
Creative ice cream parlor in the Mission district. There are several unusual flavors that I would never think of making into a dessert but somehow, Humphry Slocombe makes it work. Of course, I had many sample tastings:

1. Secret Breakfast - The most popular item. Perfect amount of alcohol and goes well with the cereal bits. I can see why it's the staple for this place.

2. McEvoy Olive Oil - I wasn't sure what to make of this flavor. It didn't taste disgusting but I was not impressed either.

3. Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee - Delicious! I love blue bottle so putting it in ice cream is a winner.

4. Tahi Chili Lime Sorbet - This is the most interesting flavor that they offered that day. It reminded me of Southeast Asian cuisine and it had a spicy kick to it, too. I enjoyed it but my friends didn't. Definitely a personal preference. 

Fantastic shop. People are cool and let you try everything. I'll be back to try their latest creations.  

4 stars.
author: Jonathan L.

description:
Hrrmmmmm....

This is a tough one. I do want to like this place a lot more. BUT their ice cream are all too heavy for my taste! Nice flavors, but man, they are so heavy that they almost taste like frozen butter cream? I don't normally leave a drop of ice cream behind, but I could not finish the Blue Bottle Coffee and the Chocolate Sea Salt. They have defeated me...but not in a good way.

If you like super sweet and heavy, this one might be perfect for you.
author: Aya C.

description:
This is the best ice cream I've ever had. It's intensely flavored, rich and delicious. Go and greet the tiny hipsters behind the counter, try a few flavors, and devour your final choice at the sit down counter. You can also sit outside at their tiny tables on the 6 days a year when you want to do that in SF.

I have tried every flavor they have, I think... My favorites are the balsamic caramel and Secret Breakfast. Or banana with red hots. They always have at least one or two dairy-free options for the adults in the crowd. Also, they have a stuffed bust of conjoined cow twins on the wall, ok? Go and get some ice cream already.
author: Betty G.

description:
i REALLY wanted to try the boccalone prosciutto and foie gras ice cream tonight...but unfortunately it wasn't on their flavor list!  after seeing chris cosentino on the food network talk about the prosciutto one on "the best thing i ever ate"...i was going insane for a taste!  but we had to go with what they had...between mom, wifey, and i...we got to try a handful of really awesome and unique flavors:

1. tahitian vanilla - plain and simple...but freakin good!

2. candy cap - so i asked the guy behind the counter..."what candy is in this ice cream?"  and the guy says that it isn't candy...the ice cream is flavored with MUSHROOMS!!!  what???  i had to try this...considering that i just put a spoonful of mushroom ice cream in my mouth, i have to say that it was pretty tasty and brilliant.  weird...but not bad at all.

3. secret breakfast - if you like bourbon...this is definitely the flavor for you.  there was an explosion of boubon with a hint of corn flakes once in awhile...craziness!

4. blue bottle vietnamese coffee - wifey said it was ok...but both mom and wifey said it was a little too sweet?  can't tell ya...i didn't try this one.  

5.  brown butter - i can't always trust mom's taste...but she spit this one out.  but i saw a bunch of people ordering it after us.  i personally love brown butter especially in my pasta.  next time, i'll definitely have to ask for a taste.

6.  rosemary's baby - rosemary and pine nuts...sounds great...this was my mom's choice...and it disappeared!

overall, i think the idea of the flavors was better than anything else here...i thought the ice cream was a little on the mushy side and was difficult to eat without it falling all over the place.  i'd come back just to try everything exotic cause well, you can't really find this anywhere else!  the closest place i could compare humphry slocombe to is bi-rite..but a little more extraordinary.  if you're feeling adventurous, then this is the place to go!
author: Jen W.

description:
Hands down the BEST ice cream I have ever had!  In fact I want to go back to San Fran just to get more.  I had the balsamic and Vietnamese coffee.  Wow.  The flavor punch is the first thing I noticed then the creamy mouth feel.  

Great job HS.  This is artisan ice cream at its finest!
author: Laura C.

description:
Headed back in this past Friday night. Line was out the door per usual. Myself and 2 companions entered the line @ 8:45PM. We were a little worried since it was close to closing but the line moved fast and they actually went outside and cut the line off. I appreciated that.

We had Vietnamese Coffee, Rootbeer, Peanut Butter Curry and Jesus Juice. They had a few i'd tried before like Secret Breakfast and they had an awesome Bourbon and Coke float special. PB Curry had way too much curry and not enough PB for me. Jesus Juice - always awesome. Rootbeer - tasted like an old school rootbeer barrel candy - straight up awesome. Vietnamese Coffee - as good as before.

Just as awesome as ever... can't wait to head back!
author: Sabrina B.

description:
I was here a few days ago on my birthday and definitely liked the product.  I'm personally not a super big fan of ice cream -- I'd rather sit with my red wine and have a cheese course -- but I realized that I had to file a review as soon as http://www.nytimes.com/2010/07/04/magazine/04icecream-t.html came on line.  This article is a long profile of H.S. founder Jake Godby, and it doesn't shy away from talking about the ice cream either.

I first had Humphry Slocombe ice cream a fairly long time ago at Spork and definitely wanted to come over to check out the source, but it wasn't until earlier this week that opportunity knocked.  We were lucky in that the place wasn't crowded when we first arrived; we got to taste a bunch before placing our orders.  If you're into ice cream, Humphry's is not to be missed.
author: Kenneth R.

description:
The fact that they were able to make ice taste EXACTLY like Vietnamese ca phe sua da is a beautiful and tasty miracle. I would complain about how far I have to drive to get here and acquire such goodness except that I recently discovered they installed a little creamery in the Falletti's/Delessio Market just a few blocks away! I may never leave my neighborhood again...for ice cream.

Try the Olive Oil and Cinnamon Brittle.
author: Jasmyn M.

description:
It's like Paxton's Gate meets Miette Confiserie...

Quirky place designed to look like an old school ice cream parlor complete with cushy diner stools (watch out for that little ledge as you're hopping on), a two headed calf mounted on the wall, and a golden Maneki Neko (or "beckoning cat") that perpetually waves.

Their flavors are wonderfully whimsical and the staff is happy to let you taste all you want... although I didn't push my luck :). They use tiny metal spoons instead of disposables, a nod to the eco-friendlies.

I settled on their prosciutto ice cream and while I was saddened there was no bacon option, the delicate intermingling of fine swine with creamy sweetness scratched an itch I hadn't realized was there.
author: Jeremy S.

description: Secret Breakfast~ Bourbon and Cereal~ Must try
author: Melanie T.

description: Waltzed in here with a friend after seeing it ranked among GQ's top 10 ice cream shops. I have to say, I was pleasantly surprised despite the mediocre interior. EVERYTHING was delish! I ended up getting a cup of "Secret Breakfast," I could still taste the bourbon :) The blue bottle vietnamese coffee was good, but then again so was everything else. Highly recommended yelpers!
author: Emily T.

description: Today it seriously smelled like shit in there. I come here once in a while and always end up getting the Jesus juice (wine and coke sorbet) and the secret breakfast (bourbon and cornflakes) but DAMN. I could not sit in there and enjoy my ice cream because of the raunchy ass smell!!!!!
author: Alex R.

description: The Ancho Chocolate is amazing! They great concoctions. However the prickly pear coconut sorbet taste like fish. No one that I served it to liked it. Hopefully they can improve the recipe as it's hard to imagine anyone ruining ice cream with coconut.
author: Reasonably H.

description:
I feel like every time I come up to SF I need to stop by this place.  Every flavor I've tried so far has been pretty tasty.  The secret breakfast and blue bottle vietnamese coffee are one of the best ones.  But the cinnamon brittle.. oh.my.god.  Seriously the best ice cream I have had in my life.  They also let you sample as many flavors as you want which is pretty cool since they have a lot of interesting ones.
Four stars because it's cash only and also because they only have the cinnamon brittle on certain days and I never seem to be there when they do.
author: Cecille B.

description:
**The Flavors**
The first time I came here, I had the Olive Oil icecream, I strangely enjoyed it a lot. It definitely tasted like olive oil, but I can't quite figure out how they managed to pull it off, because it just sounds so weird! Moral of the story: try the strangest flavor they offer that day, and you might just be pleasantly surprised.

The other weird flavor that they had that day was ricotta. They pulled that off well also- sweet cheese is a good idea? who knew?!

I tried the Secret Breakfast, but I liked it a lot better (and ordered it) the second time I went. The rum.... the rum... MAN!

**The Texture**
reminds of Häagan-Dazs. Dense and silky. Just the way I like my ice cream.

**Service**
Unfortunately, their service varies. The first time I went, service was great. For the second time I went, however, I was slightly sad that my scoop of ice-cream was about 3/5 the size as that of my friends.Thereafter, the cashier gave me the look as I was paying. Maybe because I tried just as many flavors of ice-cream as everyone else? Not sure.
author: Noel C.

description: Must try the secret breakfast flavor ice cream if you are in the SF area.  it's amazing! The staff was super friendly and very generous with offering samples :] Unlike other ice shops this place offers quite a few unique flavors that will only make you smile :D
author: Mike T.

description:
Everyone just wants a taste of that butter. And seeing as there is always a line wrapping around the block, it's no secret that this place has it.  
But luckily, it moves at a decent pace.

Out of the handful of times I've stopped by, I've taken a special liking to having 2 scoops of any of the following combinations:

-The Peanut Butter
-Bourbon & Cornflakes
-Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee

Served in a cup, and always with a sugar cone on top. 
Always.

I would even go so far as to say that these flavors are pint-worthy.  But I guess in saying that, I would also have to admit that I've actually succumbed to suckling on these Slocombe pints before.  Which, I have!  

Even if you don't eat anything else for the week, it will be worth it.
author: Ty T.

description:
Always something interesting, always more palatable options. 

Salted Licorice, peanut curry. Both good. 

Harvey Milk and Honey Graham: amazing texture, great flavor.

Secret Breakfast.


Always an adventure.
author: Ben M.

description:
I love it. It's simple. It's tasty. It's daring and different! 
The gal behind the counter was so sweet and let me sample everything! The flavors that stuck out in my mind:

Thai chili pepper- Yes, it is spicy! Not a fan of it. 
Peanut butter curry- Tasted like peanut hoisin sauce. Thumbs up. 
Corona Lime- Refreshing just like the beer itself. 
Secret Breakfast- Basically, bourbon ice cream with cornflake bits. 

In the end, I picked out the one flavor I didn't sample, because I had a feeling that it was the ONE. haha and it was. I had Guinness Gingerbread on a sugar cone. 

This place is just brilliant. Sweet and savory flavors that taste exactly like their names. No frills, no artificial colors or preservatives. You can definitely tell that it's home-made ice cream.
author: Lynn V.

description:
I guess my journey to find the world's best ice cream sometimes goes a little too far. Dragged an ice cream-loving friend here and we were disappointed.
Caramel+balsamic? Sounds good on paper but let's be frank, the two flavors together taste a little like vomit. I was eating the ice cream and thinking, how desperate am I for new experience? Am I that desperate?
Tried the olive oil ice cream and it was fine, but no comparison to Bi-Rite's olive oil sundae (which will be filed under my "last meal requests").
Tried a peanut curry ice cream too, but it just tasted like curry powder mixed in with regular ice cream (the counter girl clarified, though, that usually they use some sophisticated Indonesian lemongrass curry paste and they'd run out and substituted plain ol' curry powder).
author: Lisa T.

description: Best ice cream in the city!!! I had the coffee flavor and the Gabba Gabba Sundae. Great texture and flavoring. Staff was super friendly and helpful as well.
author: Michelle L.

description: If you go, you must try the secret breakfast, whiskey and cornflakes! It's my absolute favorite.
author: Elizabeth T.

description: My coworker brought this ice cream into the office and it was amazing!! The best I've ever had. Can't wait to try it again
author: Kem K.

description: This place was great!  Very small shop with old school diner chairs and a two-headed cow on the wall.  They have some really unique flavors that were pretty tasty.  We tried the Malted Dulce de Leche and would definitely recommend it!
author: Whit C.

description: Secret Breakfast is hands down the best ice cream I've ever had.
author: Alek M.

description:
Fascinating place!! My brother lives just down the street and took me here on my last night in SF.

As a huge dessert fan and a former waitress at Fentons Creamery (serves amazing homemade icecream), I am quite the ice cream lover & critic. Trying new ice cream places is super exciting for me!

The place was small with a line out the door. Really cool ambience with modern decor. The whole place screamed niche and specialty. Prices were reasonable.

The ice cream: wild flavors that I was not at all expecting! I had to try almost all of them...but the happy guy behind the counter didn't seem to mind. I appreciated that. 

"secret breakfast" was a mix of rum ice cream and crispy cornflakes. 

Candied ginger was super good. Tastes just like it sounds.

"Harvey milk and graham crackers" tasted like dipping sugary grahams into sweet milk. Yum,

The chocolate sea salt was a bit too salty for me.

My favorite: the vietnamese coffee. Super creamy and just strong enough.

My older brother got balsamic vinegar drizzled on his which was very interesting. Not your typical chocolate and vanilla place, but very delicious. I'd definitely go back for the coffee ice cream.
author: Sonia D.

description:
Humphry offer ice cream with flavors for those who want to venture out of their comfort zone, i.e. jesus juice, secret breakfast. Gave those lavors a taste but didn't like it so much to get a scoop but I did get a scoop of the peanut butter curry mmmmmm it was good with a hint of curry and I tasted some peanut butter cookie crumbs in there. The vietnamese blue bottle coffee flavor is a safe option but I did not like it at all. The coffee taste was flat and not creamy at all (taste like stale day old coffee with water.) 

They do offer a lot of flavors so I will be coming back to taste the others.
author: Donna C.

description:
blue bottle viet coffee in ice cream form?? waaaaat.
smooth and even consistency. not too sweet. perfect

orange clove. yum
closer to a sorbet, it was good but a bit icy.
if you dont like clove, choose something else bc the clove flavor is STRONG like it was from boston or something.

save some for me and dont buy out the place even though you will love it ;)
author: Brandon N.

description: The secret breakfast is what its all about. Lots of irregular flavors keep me coming back to this fantastic jewel. To bad they dont make salad icecream that i could eat guilt free, oh wait, thats disgusting.
author: Matt B.

description:
Finally... redemption to my day of horrible service (see reviews on Rosamunde Sausage Grill--Mission location and Pirate Cat Cafe and Studio).

Let's see.  I've had the Vietnamese Coffee flavor at Mission Street Food previously.  So after a quick glance at Yelp reviews, I wanted to try the Balsamic Caramel since someone in our group was getting the Secret Breakfast.  Oh boy should I have sampled it first.  It was so balsamic that I felt like I was eating a salad.  I couldn't eat more than two bites before apologizing and asking if I could have a different flavor.  And the girl behind the counter gave it to me!  I felt so bad but she was really nice.  Pluses for that.

I ended up getting what I know would be delicious -- the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee ice cream and it was just that.  But do listen to everyone else and try the Secret Breakfast -- bourbon and corn flakes.  The corn flakes provides really lovely texture to it.  I also tried the Red Hot Banana which is banana with crushed up Red Hot candies (the fiery heart shaped ones).  And I also had some Chocolate Sea Salt but it was quite salty.

There is some stool seating by the window and it stays pretty warm there so you can even have ice cream on a cold night.
author: Shannon L.

description:
My cousin brought me here because it's one of her favorite ice cream places in the city. Now I always stop by Humphry's when I'm in the Mission District.

I've had the Secret Breakfast, Honey Thyme, and Vietnamese Blue Bottle Coffee flavors. All of them are fantastic, I honestly can't choose a favorite because they were all delicious.

If we must compare, I'd say that my Bi-Rite is better but Humphry's is definitely a close second. Depends on the person! Bi-Rite usually has more flavor options. But if you're a gourmet ice cream person, this place should be on your list!
author: Alli Q.

description:
I'm not crazy about ice cream, but I did really enjoy the vietnemese coffee ice cream here.  I think I could've finished the ENTIRE scoop! 

Mike had the secret breakfast ... tasted A  LOT like bourbon and a little too strong for me.
author: Dina H.

description: I went here today and got a cone with 2 flavors, my favorite one was the malted milk chocolate although the other was nice too.  Nice/cool/pretty cashier with short hair n tats.  I like the 2-headed calf on the wall... pretty amazing ice cream spot, this is now one of my 3favs (others are mitchells and biritecreamery).
author: Cynthia B.

description:
In the mis of the mission... this is the joint!!!! u definitely have to drive or ride your fixie here.  Too far from the BART drop off point.  but dont let that deter u. 

End of the day its all about the Vietnamese Blue Bottle coffee...handsdown...bliss..done well and flavors are truly represented...

#2 is the cornflake and bourbon for those that want alcohol wit their cereal. Though it didnt work for me that particular day cause of the heavy scotch and whiskey the previous night...

It's a cute shop and nice to bring ur girl.. Downside, no waffle cones.. but flavors and nice service compensate.
author: David N.

description:
The cab driver thought I had the wrong address, because he picked me up from Union Square and this part of town is quite different, but then there it was -- the one SF shop I new I had to go to as soon as I got a chance.

I had planned a business meeting nearby at 11am and was able to get into the ice cream shop right as it opened (at the crack of noon), which meant that there was no line. 

Try the chocolate sea salt ice cream, or the basil lime sorbet if they have them when you go. Both are outstanding! Make you also at least taste the other flavors under the glass too.

I read a write up on these guys in the Times Magazine over a year ago, I have been thinking about the possibility of getting here for some time, and it was well worth the wait to taste it for myself. Sadly, on this day bacon ice cream was not on the menu, but I guess there's a reason to come back now!
author: Tracy N.

description:
3.5
tried so far- in order of pref
-harvey milk and graham: graham was best part

-cinnamon brittle: nice brittle bits

-salted caramel cocoa nib: liked this a lot.. but bi-rite is better

-butter beer: made w guiness when i had it

-secret breakfast (bourbon and corn flakes): stronger than expected

-horchata: yum

-POG: passionfruit, orange, guava.. tasted like those hawaiian sun drinks

-black sesame: good flavors but intense sesame 

-malted dulce de leche: by the end it was too sweet

-pumpkin 5 spice: good but after a while all i could taste was nutmeg

-brown sugar fennel: strong fennel taste.. good and unique but i wouldn't be able to handle a lot of it

-blue bottle vietnamese coffee: not a coffee person so it was eh

-ancho chocolate: couldn't taste the spice at all
author: Raquel T.

description:
Nowhere near as good at Bi-rite.

So expensive.  All the ice cream tastes like butter.  I never thought I'd be saying this but it's TOO rich.  The coffee ice cream didn't have that strong coffee flavor, just the cream flavor, again, like a scoop of butter.  Secret Breakfast and black sesame are novel but no one needs a whole scoop of them.

It's pretentious, no sign on the outside, you "just have to know".  Unfriendly servers who look pissed that you bothered to come in.  There's no where to sit.  Did I mention how expensive it is?
author: Meg M.

description:
My favorite ice cream place in the bay area. Better than Mitchell's, Bi-Rite and Icy. Everyone has already commented on the glory of their ice cream, so I'll keep this short. 

The Vietnamese Coffee legitimately tasted like the stuff my mom would make in the mornings. The Secret Breakfast was so confusingly good. The sweet undertones of bourbon without the whiskey burn. Add in the sweet, crunchy goodness of the cornflakes and you an unforgettable ice cream experience.

Definitely worth the trip.
author: Billy T.

description:
I saw Humphry's featured on the food network awhile back ago for their bacon flavor ice cream and was intrigued by their different daily specials!  I've been meaning to come check out this place for awhile and finally did today.  

While finding street parking was quite difficult, the wait was short.  Unfortunately, I didn't check the flavors before going and the bacon flavor was not in its rotation.  But, I learned that you can follow @humphryslocombe on Twitter for live flavor updates!

The Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee ice cream from Humphrey Slocombe Ice Cream is so amazingly awesome!  I'm a coffee fiend and the strength of the coffee flavor was perfect!  

There was a Special Breakfast flavor that incorporated cereal that sounds interesting... Can't wait to go back and try more flavors!
author: Steph F.

description: not much to say. their flavors speak for themselves. absolutely scrumptious ice cream. great combos. i had their honey thyme with secret breakfast with caramel bourbon drizzled on top. check it out for yourself!
author: Ryan B.

description:
How unique the flavors and ideas are gives it a plus. The employees were so jolly, i loved it! They were jammin' to the music in the background, having fun while working, totally awesome!

They didnt give dirty looks or roll their eyes or show impatience for my friends and I trying almost all the flavors and causing a line out the door.... Thank guys!

I went with the black seasame, but i loooooooooooooved the coffee icecream (but i wanted to sleep that night and it was already late at night.)

Using the name Jesus Juice for a flavor of bourbon and cocacola was a little disappointing in my opinion. Im not religious, but i would think that that may be disrespectful for those whom are? 

A bit pricey per scoop ($3.25?), but hey! QUALITY icecream over quantity. If i wanted ALOT of icecream, i should have went to a grocery store, right?
author: Jenny L.

description:
Little known fact about me: my favorite flavor of ice cream is coffee. Another little known fact about me: my second favorite flavor of ice cream is bourbon. Seriously, this is real life. I love bourbon ice cream. I have it as often as I can. And it seems weird but it's not too hard to find in this ice cream fanatic world.

So when I realized that the signature flavor at Humphry Slocombe was The Secret Breakfast (cornflakes and bourbon) I knew what I was getting and how!

I tried many of the flavors and I thought they were all sensational. Even the Jesus juice flavor (red wine and coke?) was pretty good. 

Secret Breakfast still made it into my cup. I loved every bite of bourbon, caramel, cornflake goodness. Next time. I'm coming with a group of 20 so we can just buy all the ice cream in the store. yum.
author: Tai F.

description:
This is a cool place to get some ice cream. It's small and there's not much seating, but you don't need to eat ice cream sitting down.

I like trying samples since all the flavors seem interesting. I had the Secret Breakfast and I liked it very much. I'd recommend this for sure. I also had a scoop of the Vanilla (forgot what kind of vanilla), but I didn't really like it. It tasted like wine.

The neighborhood is interesting/colorful. Parking might be hard to find. One thing I didn't like about the place is that the water tasted very much like San Francisco tap. It was not good.

I would say that this is one of the top 3 ice cream joints in SF (Mitchell's, Bi-Rite, & Humphry Slocombe).
author: Marlon T.

description:
If you're ready for some mixture of flavors, this place does it pretty well. Of course you've heard of the secret breakfast and jesus juice, and I would have to agree the secret breakfast is damn good. I've also had the blue bottle coffee and butterbeer. The coffee does have a strong coffee taste, but wasn't impressed with the butterbeer (guiness and ????).
Although they do a good job marrying flavors together, they can't seem to get the smooth texture down.
author: Stephanie Y.

description:
I was really excited to try this place because I saw this on the 7x7 and read about their interesting and innovative flavors. I came here with a few friends and most of us decided to get their 2 most popular flavors, the Secret Breakfast (corn flakes and bourbon) and Blue Bottle Viet Coffee. Both flavors were pretty heavy so all of us couldn't eat past a few spoons. 

The Secret Breakfast was okay, not great. The bourbon flavor was overpowering and not exactly in a good way. My friends and I all agreed that the corn flakes were the best part of that ice cream. One of my friends didn't even eat past 3 spoons before she decided she hated it. 

I think both ice creams were good to start with but in the end, it really was too strong (particularly the bourbon taste...) and VERY VERY creamy. I felt like I ate a full meal after just 1 scoop. Couldn't have been very good for you...

All in all, this place is overrated. I expected much better after all the hype and reviews. Bi-rite is definitely better in my opinion.
author: Venus L.

description: 2 scoops in a cup, Anchor Steam Stout and Corn Flakes and Bourbon (aka Secret Breakfast). Different and good.
author: Bill I.

description:
Sweet, rich, high quality ice cream.  Lots of unique flavors.  I tried the secret breakfast, which was good - however, the mix of alcohol and cereal after a long night out was probably not the best choice in flavoring.

Long lines, usually beacuse people try a bunch of different flavors before deciding.  Costs are standard for a high end ice cream shop.
author: Winston G.

description:
Only in San Francisco does eating Ice Cream on a windy, 65-degree day sound appealing as that's considered "warm".  Nonetheless, this is what my friends and I did on a recent trip to SF because #1 we were allured by the 2000+ reviews, #2 we all like ice creams #3 there's really not much else to do in SF but eat.  However, as a self-proclaimed ice cream blob of 20+ years ( really believe 5% of my weight is attributed to ice cream), I can assert that there's nothing special about Humphry's Slocombe Ice Cream except for the weird spelling of its name (where's the damn E in Humphrey??) and slightly interesting flavors that they offer.

Just like places in LA, there's always a lot of hype over these "designer" ice cream places that charge much more than necessary; in this case, Humphry's charges $3 for a scoop (ripoff) or for a better "deal" $5.50 for 3 scoops (which is what I shared because I rather get ripped off on 3 cheaper scoops than 1 really expensive scoop....it's a logic that is hard to follow, but it's kept this rating at 3 vs 2 stars lol).  At least they take credit cards...MUHAHA take 3% off your 3000% profit margin biatch!!! They even promote a Humphry book in their store which "reveals" the secret to rip-off ice cream recipes!! I'll bet even the book is just paper with ink all over its insides :P

So once again, my rudimentary ice cream palate was not impressed by this Slocombe ice cream business as it didn't tickle my taste buds nor arouse any inner desire to eat an entire tub (which would have cost like $200 probably). I even tried 3 different flavors in hopes of tripling the chance I would get "THE" flavor that I would rave about in my Yelp review.  The Vietnamese Coffee, Oolong Tea, and Special Breakfast flavors unfortunately were as-advertised: basic, cool-sounding, yet overpriced ice cream.

In fact, some of my Oolong tea has ice granules in several bites!! I did not pay for 99.8% ice cream and .2% ice crystals (which are indicative of either old or remelted ice cream). This alone should have eradicated any chance of a high review, but I guess since I finished my 3 scoops (with the help of a friend), it was edible.  I kinda hoped the Special Breakfast (which contained bourbon) would get me slightly intoxicated to the point where I would LOVE Humphry's.  Sadly, even an attempt at legal substance abuse failed.

Overall, I would deter someone from going to Humphry's unless you really really wanted to be a cool Norcal hipster eating over-priced ice cream in your skinny, tight-ass jeans. Other than these people (and really rich, non-value-seeking people), just drop by your local Rite Aid and get 2 tubs of Mint n Chip & Cookies n Cream (for the same price as 3 scoops) which will give you satisfaction for days/weeks/months to come!

Btw, like all SF places (Socal over Norcal!!), there's no parking and you have to pray you're not hiking 10 uphill-blocks to pay for this basic ice cream.

RITE AID ICE CREAM, FTW ALL DAY, EVERYDAY!!! :)
author: Rob C.

description:
What an absolutely amazing ice cream place! I love that they veer away from the conventional ice cream flavors and try something different. Trying different flavors while you're there becomes a fun game and the entire experience of being in an ice cream shop is elevated to another level with all these different tastings!

This place is known especially for it's secret breakfast flavor. Essentially it is bourbon with cornflakes...sounds weird, and in my humble opinion, it kind of was. So I steered away from it and went to the next intriguing sounding one - Thai Chilli Lime Sorbet. I'm a sucker for a spicy kick and this packs a punch! What a novel taste for ice cream! I combined it with the Pink Apple Sorbet and the taste created was absolutely phenomenal. There are so many other types of flavors that I want to try...and for less than $4 for two scoops (which is plenty) it is so very doable!

The staff is also great and very helpful. They are very environment friendly which I love - so when you try flavors, they give you steel spoons rather than plastic spoons. And let's face it, who doesn't love a place where the mascot is a two headed cow? This place is the shiz as far as ice cream places go. My favorite in SF so far as it has the perfect mix of ambiance, staff, and naturally, absolutely amazing interesting, ever-changing flavors!
author: Aditi R.

description:
The girl worker shut the door on us because we weren't walking fast enough towards the entrance, which I found amusing.  

Tried the banana pecan and peanut butter curry (which the girl worker said was her favorite combo).  These two flavors definitely complimented each other and if I lived in SF I'd probably be 10lbs heavier from indulging in their ice cream.

A very clean seating area in the inside with complimentary water you can pour yourself (which you will need after enjoying their rich ice cream)  My favorite thing about Humphry's has got to be the two headed cow that's on display inside :3
author: Agent X.

description:
Venturing on an ice cream tour, Humphry Slocombe was amongst the list of must hit destinations in SF.  It was a clear winner for me with the variety of unique flavors, in particular alcoholic creations.  

Highlights: The Secret Breakfast featured fun crunchy cornflakes with just the right amount of bourbon to add a kick.  The Beer Butter offered a nice caramel flavor, but was a tad sweet for my taste.  My favorite of the day would have to be the Magnolia Stout - creamy, delicious beer goodness.  

Though the location is small and quite busy, the line wasn't too long and moved by fairly quickly.  I am definitely interested in visiting again to try more flavors.
author: Angela Q.

description:
Humphry Slocombe rocks! Jake and Sean are the bee's knees.

If you're afraid of the Mission, there's a new store coming to the Ferry Building!
author: Mark P.

description:
I stopped by on my way home from work. The customer service was nice, the guy behind the counter even told me to stop by to sample more flavors when I had the time.  I tried a coffee flavored ice cream and it was good and creamy. The price was a little steep, one scoop costs 4.00 in a cup/cone/ or both. Also, the packaged ice cream is 9.00.

Ice cream is a rare treat for me, so if I am in the mood and in the area, I might give these guys another try and check out a new flavor.
author: Rose H.

description: This is an awesome place to come for ice cream flavors you won't find anywhere else. Their signature Secret Breakfast had too much alcohol taste for me, but I love their Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee and Malted Vanilla. Peanut Butter Curry was interesting, but the curry flavor eventually becomes too overwhelming if you get a full scoop. I'm sad I didn't have a chance to sample the Foie Gras Ice Cream Sandwich before the ban, but hope Humphry's decides to still sell the cookies and give us a scoop of the foie gras ice cream for free : ) Both the line and parking can be crazy here, but it's worth it for the yummy ice cream and being able to sample all the awesome flavors!
author: Amy D.

description: I just love the Secret Breakfast flavor.  They have lots of weird flavors, but they're all good.  I also like Smitten, but I think Humphrey's is better.  Parking is not impossible.
author: Ed D.

description: Tried the breakfast surprise flavor at their tent at OTG Picnic at Presidio. It was gross... tasted like watered down rum and... I just don't know how to describe it, but it was just nasty! Though the texture was very creamy. I would go back to the actual store and try their other flavors before committing to this 2 stars.
author: Michelle L.

description:
I've officially joined the group of super fans of this place.  After hearing about them and following on Twitter, I decided to head over on a hot SF Sunday a couple of weeks ago before going to Twang Sunday at Thee Parkside. 

There was a line, but the wait wasn't too bad considering the heat (maybe 10-15 minutes).  I liked that you could order a single (which I thought was pretty large for a single) and still try two flavors.  I had the Secret Breakfast (bourbon & cornflakes) and Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee.  They were a perfect combo and the ice cream itself was so luscious!  I'm definitely a Secret Breakfast fan now and would have to have that again, but try one of the other flavors (maybe if they had the Cream Cheese or Ancho Chocolate one).  Or I might just find two completely different flavors.  

It's a good thing I live on the other side of SF or I wouldn't be able to stay away!  I'm definitely going back.  The SF Street Food Festival is this weekend and Humphry is right around the corner....
author: Kimberly B.

description:
Mmm, two words: Secret Breakfast.

Or if you're into floats, you should try the Secret Breakfast Float.
author: Valerie N.

description:
Definitely the weirdest and most creative flavor selection out of all the ice cream places in the bay.  It's a shame that they often run out of their flavors by the end of the day... I came here after dinner one night, not particularly late - maybe 8pm - and they were already out of almost half of their flavors for the day.  And there was still a long line... couldn't they have made more ice cream for the customers who kept on coming?  They were open for at least another hour after that.  It just discourages me from coming back if I don't know if they'll even have a complete menu of flavors available.

They were out of Secret Breakfast so I didn't get to try it - I did try the Jesus Juice and that was... weird.  I give them props for being creative, but some of the flavor combinations just didn't do it for me.  I tried the Vietnamese coffee as well, but I didn't enjoy it (funny, because I do like Viet coffee... I just didn't think the ice cream did the real thing justice, as I had been expecting).  I ended up getting a scoop of the Tahitian vanilla and the black sesame, which I thought was a nice flavor combination.  The texture of the ice cream was fine, but not particularly outstanding.  I've had similar flavors at Ici before, but they were better than Humphry Slocombe's versions.

Overall, I'd come back if I were in the neighborhood or if I knew I'd be able to try the beer flavor (which I am still curious about).  However, I do think that there are better ice cream spots in the bay.
author: Amanda N.

description: I am probably spoiled by the ice cream in Italy and France. No doubt, the taste factor is 5 star. What I'm most disappointed with is the texture - it's not smooth and creamy as I envision. It's a little bit rough. I tried olive oil, secret bfast, blue bottle vietnamese coffee (strong and most real like coffee taste), etc. I ordered the secret bfast, the only flavor with alcohol, bourbon. It was great taste, but I just wished it's more smooth. I still prefer ICI or Birite. But even those, I'm still not satisfied yet...
author: Wendy T.

description:
I thought Secret Breakfast was different, but OK. But the Salted Chocolate was superb!

They also seem to keep their freezer at a higher temperature so the texture is more like Gelato :)  Yum! and very clever. 

Tip: Multiple scoops won't stack on a cone since it's so soft, but they'll be happy to put the ice cream in a cup and put the cone on top.
author: John H.

description: This place is one of my favorite ice cream shops,  even more so than bi-rite.  The signature flavor I'd recommend is bourbon and cornflakes.  Honestly I've never ordered another flavor but I've sampled many.  Don't ever get salted watermelon. ..you will be disappointed.
author: Dani H.

description:
Very inventive flavors, but that doesn't necessarily mean they all taste good. Well, I'll let you be the judge of that, but here's my two sense on the flavors . . . 

- Salt & Pepper: it was like licking frozen sea salt & pepper, too strong for me
- Ancho Chili Chocolate: sweet and the spiciness kicks in later
- Peanut Butter Curry: sweet & good even though the combo just sounds bad
- Jesus Juice: red wine & coke - no thanks, not for ice cream at least
- Secret Breakfast: yummy! how did they make bourbon & corn flakes taste so good together?
- Balsamic Caramel: strong balsamic flavor, couldn't taste much of the caramel
- Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee: taste just like a frozen viet coffee = yummy! 

Prices are very reasonably and they are very environmentally green. Oh yeah, the two headed cow is just trippy along with the clown painting by the door, but I really like the parlor swivel chair seating and the soup artwork. Looking forward to coming back and seeing what else they come up with.
author: Linda C.

description: How can I describe how much I love thee, secret breakfast ice cream? I don't know if I can.
author: Stephanie T.

description: umm... this place is AH-MAZING! They need to open in NYC so i can do my sinful dessert runs here. The secret breakfast (bourbon & cornflakes) and viet coffee was delicious. Its a crazy taste bud trip. The place is super clean and the guy behind the register ha dan awesome handlebar mustache and very friendly
author: Angela L.

description:
I love how fast the line moves! Every time I came here it was on sunny weekend days.  I never had to wait more than five min. to get my ice cream. I'm always a happy girl after coming here. (; 

Also, I've never had any problems finding parking. Parking nearby is metered tho, so be prepared to bring some change.  (25 cents gives you 8 minutes.)

This ice cream shop holds the craziest flavors I've ever seen. Jesus Juice (coke & orange juice? I think, don't remember.), Secret Breakfast (Bourbon & corn flakes), Oolong Tea, Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee, Buttered Brown Sugar, Tahitian Vanilla, Bacon Peanut Brittle, Milk Chocolate Malt, and some other good shits. :D The texture of the ice cream is soft. I like my ice cream a bit melted, easy to lick off and put in ma bellay! My favorite ice cream flavor is the Oolong tea. Tea lovaa, of course. :)

If you want something different come by and taste test everything! Haha jk. Don't be greedy :P
author: April D.

description: Oh man, the secret breakfast is like crack! If you order anything here, this is it!
author: Abby S.

description:
Humphrey Slocombe is for adults only but don't be surprised when your alter ego of a six year old comes out. No schizo moment...just "bitch pleasin'" Humphry Slocombe

So like the six year old brat...I had to have the 3 scoops as opposed to the two scoops that my friend suggested. He obliged and my greedy little eyes were pointed towards the 3 which I enjoyed very much:  Balsamic Caramel, Secret breakfast and Olive Oil. I hate secrets but....Good Lawd!!

 All 3 aren't exactly the match but surprisingly the whole bowl suited me just fine. Very rich...just like what gourmet ice cream should be. 

Salted Caramel is the winner. 

Be sure that each spoonful is individually savored like an experience...oh well, it's the yelper in me

Warning: If you're the old school chocolate, vanilla & strawberry type ...not the place to go to.
author: Charmian D.

description:
Oh, Humphry, you evil tempter, your tractor beam of deliciousness pulls me in from blocks and blocks away.  Even on a full stomach after a dinner in the Mission, someone just has to barely whisper the words "Secret Breakfast", and I am moving rapidly towards the corner of 24th and Harrison.  I've tried a few of their flavors but always come back to The Secret.  I don't know what mad ice cream genius came up with that one, but it is not to be missed.

There really aren't a ton of good dessert options in the area and I actually prefer Humphry Slocombe to Bi-Rite.  Antony's Cookies is great, but they close early.  Mission Pies is nice, but only if you're in a pie sort of mood.  For me, HS is my go-to place for a little Mission dessert action.
author: Eric S.

description:
Yep, I'm a fan (as are so many others!).  Their flavors are so unique, I love it.  My favorite is brown butter. The last time I was there, I had their sweet corn ice cream.  The idea of corn for dessert was a little odd, but it was tasty!  

There is always a long line at this place, just like at Bi-Rite. The staff is always super friendly and I think street parking here might be a tad easier than at Bi-Rite.
author: Mary D.

description:
+ Secret breakfast! Bourbon & coke float!
+ Straus Organic Dairy used here :D

I must be something close to a blissful alcoholic because I found the BOURBON & COKE FLOAT to totally float my boat. Bourbon tastes good to me. Cream does a body good. Creamy bourbon? Makes my heart sing. So if you're not into boozy creamy decadence... get outta here! But if you are? No joke, get your grubby hands on a bourbon & coke float. P.S. it's great for sharing. 

Not much hasn't already been said about the SECRET BREAKFAST. They've got to be doing something right, because they can make corn flakes sport some crunch and chewiness even after a churned marriage with ice cream. 

I sampled a handful of their other flavors and I conclude that unless you've got a fairly adventurous palate, you may do better elsewhere with relatively tamer flavors. Every flavor tastes like you just chomped an intensified chunk of whatever food it is based on.
author: Megan L.

description: Interesting flavors and super friendly guy who offered tastes of everything.  The Vietnamese coffee was good; sorbets were a bit sweet but still tasty.
author: mary l.

description:
I haven't actually been to the SF location, but they're selling certain flavors (in rotation) at Bitter+Sweet -- a super cute cafe in Cupertino.  But it's SOOOO good that I had to come write a review under the original business.  

So far, I've tried Secret Breakfast, Butter Beer, Harvey's Milk & Honey, and Vietnamese Coffee.  Each flavor is intensely unique, creative, extremely tasty, without being overly sweet or indulgent.  I have to say that I am much more impressed with Humphry Slocombe than Mitchells or Bi-Rite.  When the bf, who NEVER on his own craves anything sweet (especially not ice cream), suggests dinner at a certain location just so that he can get Humphry Slocombe ice cream next door afterwards . . . that's when I know there is something special about this ice cream!!  We both agree that all the flavors we've tried have been phenomenal.  Never going back to regular flavors ice cream!

I'm so glad they're randomly rotating the flavors being offered at Bitter+Sweet so that I don't have to travel far to try different flavors.  But I also can't wait to go to the original location in SF!!!
author: Tiff K.

description:
I was adamant that the BFF accompany me here today because:
1- i gave into the hype
2- their massive online list of never before heard of ice cream combinations piqued my interest
3- i was craving ice cream, but neither ben nor jerry could quell this strong craving today; i needed something different, something more & something NEW to my palate

Scary things:
- the double headed cow heads sticking out of the wall
- "fetal kitten soup?"
- the painting of the scary boogey man jumping out onto someone's windshield when you first walk in
- the neighborhood & hearing police sirens. My BFF was like, "this ice cream better be BOMB because I'm not risking my life for mediocre ice cream!" 

Not so Scary Things:
- blue bottle vietnamese coffee ice cream- super strong in flavor
- secret breakfast- i love the name & love the image of a boozy, but fabulous mother in a fur coat pouring burbon on top of her morning bowl of corn flakes in front of her children. The bourbon is really strong & good & the corn flakes give it great texture.
- trying a scoop of my BFF's rosemary's baby- fragrant, aromatic, yummy flavor
- dirt cheap price of $6.50 for four scoops between me & the BFF.
- the fact that I want to keep coming back until I've tried all the flavors that make my mouth water (i.e. white chocolate lavender, chevre strawberry jam, & salted licorice)
author: Fancypants X.

description:
This place was so disappointing. I braved a 45 minute Muni trip each way, solely for this ice cream, and it was an absolutely waste of time.

Here's the deal. The flavors are intriguing, and I expected that coming in. I also expected ice cream with creamy texture and good consistency -- unfortunately, that's where Humphry Socombe fell short. I tried a scoop of the Secret Breakfast and a scoop of the beer week special White Russian. Both suffered from poor consistency, meaning that the flavors weren't well mixed and therefore "pooled," so that you ended up with a mouthful of liquor at one point, and then a bunch of cornflakes in your next bite. Furthermore, the ice cream itself wasn't as smooth or rich as I've come to expect from SF's otherwise excellent ice cream scene. I just don't see how this compares to other gems around the city. Certainly does not live up to the hype.
author: Theresa P.

description:
My ex boyfriend (still a good friend!) shared an address with them when they opened. Yes, I watched them as they were just a distant vision of an ice cream store at 24th and Harrison. The roommates and I all pondered, "what could possibly be going in downstairs to cause such a commotion?" as we watched the 2008 elections and rooted for Obama. We were doing freelance marketing work at the time for fun on top of our day jobs, and we thought it would be cool to talk to them about their business.

Hello, 2011! 2 years later, and over a year and a half since S moved out, they have been JAMMING. I can't even imagine a normal night there WITH Humphrey Slocombe. I was at that apartment for almost a year before this place came to be, and if it had been, I would have been 30 pounds heavier.

They are wonderful. So we delivered them their mail, made small chat before they opened, and admired the red seats through the windows before the glassy doors opened. Wonderful, once more. They are not only friendly and upbeat, but they give you SAMPLES. Of EVERYTHING.

Yes. Samples of EVERYTHING!

I had a taste of "Secret Breakfast" and that crazy thai chili pepper (what one is that? It was so long ago), both amazing. I do quite prefer the Secret Breakfast, but will make a special trip back soon with friends to share the love.
author: Kristin F.

description:
OH MY GOD. Its like I died and went to humphrys. If you want Vanilla or chocolate, this is not the place to be. They are very adventurous wit their flavors. I highly recommend the peanut butter curry and secret breakfast. I wasnt too big of a fan of the olive oil and the thunder pussy. I can't get enough of this place. Its a nice little shop in an OK area. The lines can get kind of long but it is well worth the wait. The reason for these long lines is that everyone samples everything. 

Humphrys surpasses Bi rite and then laps them again and again and again
author: Andrew Y.

description:
Thanks again to our local friend in San Francisco, we stopped by Humphry Slocombe for some ice cream after a long day of walking around.  We stopped by on 6/15/12 and the place was a beehive of activity.  Too many inventive ice cream flavors to name here in this review, but I had a scoop of secret breakfast and malted dulce de leche.  The secret breakfast had corn flakes and bourbon in it, and it definitely has a noticeable taste of bourbon.  It may not be for everybody, but I am a firm believer that bourbon is quite possibly the liquid version of bacon when it comes to flavoring.  Everything is better with bacon or bourbon, or hell why not both!  The malted dulce de leche was good as well, but I would have been happier with two scoops of the secret breakfast.

The place is tiny and difficult to into and move around when it's packed, but it's worth the wait in line.  They do allow you to sample before making your choices, (at least they allowed us, as we were nice about it) so there are no excuses for not getting a flavor you like.

And for all the people that think they are messing with your ice cream, there are plenty of places in the world that serve chocolate and vanilla.  Why don't you frequent those places?
author: Andre B.

description:
Wow, did Yelp steer me wrong on this one.  After dinner I promised my wife and 3 kids ice cream at a cool new place all my coworkers had mentioned.

We decided to outpace Muni by walking (not hard, I know) all the way from 24th & Castro.  Was it worth it?  No.

This much is easy - Secret Breakfast is excellent.  I could see craving it.  Cream cheese was fair, and my 7 year old ate the weird peanut butter and curry though the rest of us thought it was nasty.  The other flavors were all interesting, in a one or two bite setting.  Put them in a whole cone, and ick.

If you're making the trek here with kids, save yourself the effort, and hit Bi-Rite or Mitchell's instead.  It's the first time I have ever seen my kids throw out uneaten ice cream.  I know, this makes it all the more popular for the rest of you.
author: dan s.

description:
Ice cream: 4 stars
Service: 1-2 stars

Unfortunately we waited in line a LONG time. They definitely don't move you through as quickly here as they do at BiRite. Additionally, the person behind the counter was a rude, snott, elitest hipster. I won't bore you with the details...just trust me, it was to the point of ridiculous

Fortunately once we got our ice cream, all was good again in the world. I split the the Gabba Gabba Hey with my husband (Balsamic caramel ice cream, brownie, Amarena cherries, whipped cream) and enjoyed every bite!
author: Sydney L.

description:
Unique flavor alert!! Somewhere between the Jesus Juice and the Secret Breakfast, the genius behind Humphrey Slocombe has some serious brain waves going into their ice cream. 

Went on a super busy day and waited like 50 minutes for my ice cream. No that is not a typo. But they were very kind to allow me to sample the coke-wine combo of Jesus Juice (which is probably why the line was so dang long in the first place)!!)
I ended up getting Blue Bottle Viet Coffee with Secret Breakfast on top. Their scoops are more than generous to the point where the bourbon-cornflake concoction was getting to be a bit too much. Really sweet after a while, even when I was sharing the cone!!

Minus a star on the line. Dummy me for going on the same day as the La Cocina Street Food Fest, but srsly? Almost an hour? That's a lot of time out of my life for ice cream.
author: Rayna L.

description:
We thought parking would be bad, but we found meter parking easily around the corner. Maybe we lucked out, but I was pleased. 

I tried the bourbon cornflake. It has great bourbon flavor without being overpowering. The ice cream was smooth and not too icy or rich.
author: Joy G.

description:
SECRET BREAKFAST. That's where the magic's at.

Cereal and bourbon, what a wonderful combination. The cereal is crisp and goes wonderfully with the bourbon flavored ice cream. It has a nice bourbon aftertaste. If you've never had it, you'd never know how good it is. If you've had it, you're probably nodding your head as you're reading this. Oh secret breakfast, I'm totally having you for breakfast on Sundays. 

My second favorite is their Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee. You know how some coffee ice cream doesn't have enough coffee flavor in it and it just tastes kinda like creamy coldness with a drop of crappy espresso with a bitter aftertaste? This is at the other end of what I just described. It's so coffee-y and it's not overpowering. It's not too sweet either, it's the perfect balance. 

Other flavors I've tried that was memorable:
Sweet summer corn - it straight up tastes like the sweet corn on a cob you can get from carnivals. Really buttery.
Limoncello - a nice, refreshing sorbet. Very lemony and I love the tanginess of it. If you like sour/sweet stuff, give it a try!
Jesus Juice - the name itself is interesting right? It's got red wine and something else in it I can't remember. It was.. interesting. 

I really want to try their Oolong flavor. Tea+ice cream has always been my favorite.
I've always gotten really big scoops from them; I can barely finish the whole thing with the cone if I got 2 scoops. 

If you're going on a Saturday -- We went on a Saturday evening at about 7:30, just about the right time to get in line, get a seat, and avoid the huge crowds of people coming for after dinner desert. When we left, the line reached the end of the block. 

The reason why the line is so long/moves slowly is because most people try a sample of every flavor they have. And they let you too. There's always two mugs full of spoons on top of their counter. Take advantage of their generosity and try everything (if you wish) before you decide on a flavor (or 2!) It's a smart business strategy for them and we benefit from it too ;)

If you're here, order the crazy flavors!! Don't let yourself leave this place with a boring flavor and later complain about how not exciting it was. Be adventurous!!! ;)
author: Erica L.

description: One of the few top awesome ice cream places in the city. They have very cool unique flavors and they all taste amazing. Definitely recommend and you'll keep going back.
author: Haleh H.

description:
Red hots + banana
Brown butter

Amazing! This place is pretty dangerous. I personally like BiRite more, but that's just individual taste. Both are great.

They have Square here.
author: Leigh D.

description:
Unique, scrumptious, mouthwatering, ice creamy goodness! 

My favs:

Secret Breakfast: If you were a rock star and poured Bourbon in your frosted flakes it would taste like this.

Black Sesame: Sweet, Buttery, and Nutty

Chocolate Smoked Sea Salt: Everything is better with salt, especially chocolate!

Brown Butter: Man, oh man, that is some good shiiieeet

Salt and Pepper: Intense, but wonderful in small doses

YUM!
author: Miss T.

description: So many interesting choices! Came while visiting on the recommendation of basically everyone we know in San Francisco. Turns out 'everyone' knew what they were talking about. The block is a little quiet in the evening, but well worth the visit.
author: Saskia S.

description: Lives up to expectation. Why should ice cream just be fruity? It's not. Olive oil was so smooth and creamy and paired with ancho chocolate, like slipping naked between silk sheets.
author: Courtney D.

description: I've changed my mind over the past few years about this place... It kills Bi Rite and that's that. The best and most interesting flavors I've ever encountered, ie: salt and pepper, candy cap (mushroom ice cream), brown buttter, beet sorbet, carrot mango sorbet, lemon buttermilk sherbert, salted watermelon sorbet, jesus juice (coke and red wine sorbet)...
author: Aniela G.

description: I tried the black sesame, special breakfast, and tahitian vanilla. Everything was way too sweet for me. Pretty intense. So I personally didn't like it very much but I know everyone else does so I'm also aware it's just me. I don't think I will be back unless I get one of their sorbets next time.
author: Jessie M.

description: Black sesame I love you. Came here on some fun little culinary tour and it happened to fall right on the Cesar Chavez Day festival so I got to eat ice cream on a 80 degree SF day while watching a bunch of awesome Mexican men in authentica outfits riding caballos! Sooooo cool and this experience was ten times better because of the magical black sesame flavour. F--- yeah!
author: Natasha P.

description:
Every time we make a trip to SF, we try and make a stop here on the way home. We are intrigued by unique and unusual flavors, and this place definitely has them! Here, we've tried flavors from peanut butter curry, salt & pepper, and carrot mango to secret breakfast (bourbon with cornflakes), jesus juice (red wine and coke), olive oil, and thai chili lime. And those are just naming a few of all their flavors. The crazy thing is, the ice cream really does taste like their names!

Many ice cream places have odd flavors, but they only have a tint of what their flavors should be. But this place has their flavors down to the spot. Will keep coming back to see what new flavors they have available to try!
author: Richie D. And Grace J.

description: I was a little bummed, thus the 4 stars instead of 5. The flavor of ice cream was awesome! I had the Futter Butter (Nutter Butter) and Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee. They were super yummy together! The reason for the 4 stars is if you look at the pictures people have posted on here, the ice cream scoop is just about the size of your fist. I got two scoops and both were about the size of my fist and they charged me $5.17!?!!! Really?!!! I didn't even order a cone! This place is better tasting than Creme, but I won't be rushing to come back. At least at Creme, you spend about the same AND get a freshly made cookie or brownie. HS is definitely more novelty than anything.
author: Sara H.

description:
I live in the neighborhood and used to frequent Humphry Slocombe pretty regularly. However, the past two times I've been the service has been f-ing horrible!

The 1st bad experience was ordering coffee ice cream with marshmallow topping. The ice cream is always good here and the portions just right, but this time was ONE bite of ice cream drowning in marshmallow, SO SAD. Had to throw it in the garbage.

And then today, young girl working behind the counter had a permanent stink face and didn't even ask my bf (who was waiting in line) if he wanted anything. Stink face ain't cute or friendly, girl!

Also, one scoop listed as $3.75, you get charged $4. Change the board!

Flavors are great, service is horrible.
author: chels h.

description:
Secret breakfast with Bourbon & Cereal Flakes...Honey Thyme...Cinnamon Brittle...Balsamic Caramel...Milk Chocolate Passionfruit...Boccalone Prosciutto...Salt-N-Peppa...sounds like stuff from a Willy Wonka factory gone bad.

But trust me...all the flavors I've tried from here work...boy do they work!

Here goes the blasphemy now...  I say to hell with it... this place blows away spots like Bi-Rite in my book.  There...I said it.  I'm done.
author: Justin L.

description: I have been on a mission to try all of the best ice creams in the Bay Area for the last year. After hearing so much about this place, I knew I had to give it a try. I enjoyed the unique selection of flavors and decided to have the secret breakfast (whiskey and cornflakes), Jesus Juice (coke and some type of red wine (I think it was port)), and Vietnamese Blue Bottle Coffee. I agree with every other reviewer in that secret breakfast is their best flavor. I don't normally like alcohol flavoring in food, but this was really well executed. You can taste the wine in Jesus Juice for the first few bites, but then it just becomes coke flavored (which I really have no issue with). The coffee flavor was true to its name and just tastes like coffee. I enjoy places with a unique selection of in store made flavors, and Humphry certainly offers that. The only thing I would have changed is that the ice cream here is a bit more icy than I prefer. I am the type of person who normally doesn't shortcut on sugar and fat when it comes to dessert, so I like rich creamy textured ice cream. Purely a personal preference. Maybe to some of you this is a pro rather than a con. Overall good ice cream, but I will probably still be getting my full fat ice cream fix at Bi-Rite.
author: Tiffany N.

description: My friends came in to visit from out of state and I had to take them to a gourmet ice cream place in the City.  We were in the Mission and this was the perfect stop.  I've been here before and have tried the Jesus Juice and a few other regular flavors.  This time I had the chocolate with sea-salt flavor.  Good stuff!  Even found a parking space close by which was wonderful!
author: Brent T.

description:
All of my yelp favorites, pretty much, have already reviewed this place, but I figured I'd throw another drop into the bucket.
THIS PLACE IS THE THE FUCKING BOMB.  Really interesting flavors, and finely crafted ice cream.  The texture is like that of gelato--so not quite as rich as bi-rite or Rick's in palo alto.  But still fresh cream, and they did not skimp on the ingredients.  
ice-cream review:
(Daddy's) Secret Breakfast was my favorite there.  You can taste the bourbon--possibly Bulleitt--even the alcohol in the ice cream. and the corn flakes add a great texture.  

Tahitian Vanilla was chock full of vanilla beans and again, that gelato-like texture.  Quite possibly the best vanilla I've had in SF.

Balsamic Caramel was very interesting.  Actually a little sour from the balsamic vinegar, making the flavor a little intense and sharp.  The caramel then rounded out the end of this flavor journey.  I didn't get a full scoop of this, cuz I wasn't in the mood for the sharp intensity.

Oolong tea.  The tea they chose was honestly not a very good oolong, but it was still clearly an oolong.  I wish they just went to Ten Ren and picked up some cheap oolong there, which would be leagues better than the stuff they used.  their oolong was a little smokey, bitter and not very well balanced.  But the flavor of the ice cream was still enough to make me get a scoop of it.  and it was especially good with the secret breakfast, mixed into it.  the nutty/grassy/smokiness of the oolong complemented the bourbon well.

Anyway, I now have a new go-to ice cream joint in SF.
author: Fong L.

description:
Humphrey Slocombe...not your traditional ice cream joint. It's a sweet spot for those who are spontaneous and are open to try some innovative flavored ice cream!

I had the following:
- vietnamese coffee (ON POINT! a must-try), 
- Secret Breakfast (YUMM!) 
-Salt n Pepper (kinda spicy and you taste the hint of salt...)
- Thai Chili Sorbet... This is an interesting one...its a refreshing sorbet, however, you can feel the heat gradually building up from the chilli after 4 spoon fulls.
author: Rebecca L.

description:
Nice experience, oddball flavors, good yes.

It didn't blow me away. I tasted the Secret Breakfast and the Peanut Butter Curry. Breakfast was good, I didn't like the Curry. 

I ordered the coffee and carrot sorbet, ok I like boring flavors. 

Street parking.
author: qirk z.

description:
Likes: Variety of unique flavors like red wine+ coca cola, peanut butter curry, chocolate sea salt, etc...  Oolong tea ice cream was light and delicious! Blue bottle Vietnamese coffee is popular and does taste like coffee.

Dislikes: Not sure I'm brave enough to try peanut butter curry ice cream but I like uniqueness
author: Karen M.

description: Great ice cream and nice scoops. Tried the Secret breakfast because it was on "the list" and the Chocolate Sea Salt. Both were really good. Secret breakfast was amazing (bourbon and cornflakes). Definitely recommend getting this flavor. The sea salt on the Chocolate sea salt was good because it balanced out the sweetness in the chocolate.
author: Liwei Y.

description:
This is a great place to go to get ice cream with exotic flavors.  Since the flavors are so exotic, there are some hits and misses.  

I really like the Secret Breakfast ice cream.  This is ice cream that contains corn flakes and has been infused with Bourbon.  It has an unique flavor.  I can definitely taste the Bourbon, 

The Vietnamese blue bottle coffee flavor is good.  I can definitely taste the coffee and the coffee beans that were used to make the ice cream flavor.  Moreover, I felt a caffeine jolt from eating the ice cream.. It is probably one of the best coffee ice cream I had.  It is not too sweet or creamy, 

I especially like the peanut butter curry.  The curry flavor complemented the peanut butter flavor very well,  It made the ice cream slightly spicy and creamy.  A nice unique ice cream flavor.  

The Olive oil ice cream flavor was interesting,  It is hard to describe. It was creamy and slightly sweet. It sort of tastes like creme fraiche, but less tangier.

The Balsamic Caramel was interesting.  It had a very strong flavor,  I could taste the vinegar in it.  However, eating caramel ice cream that had a strong vinegar flavor felt odd.

Also, the Boccalone Prosciutto was interesting.  I never had ice cream with pork in it.  I could definitely taste the smoked pork in it.  It was OK.

I am looking forward to coming back and trying out some more flavors.  They only serve about 12 flavors of ice cream and they rotate the other flavors every week. 

It is not a good as Bi-rite, but you cannot really compare them.  It is like comparing apples to oranges. However, Bi-rite has a more modern and expensive ice cream freezer unit.  It is frost free and prevents ice chips from getting into the ice cream.  Because, ice cream should be creamy and smooth, not crunchy like a 7-11 Slurrpee.
author: Hiroshi K.

description:
I'll preface this with... I'm lactose intolerant.  However, the ice cream was pretty good.

The ice cream... extremely creamy, some would go so far as to call it a bit buttery.  The stronger cream/buttery flavor will overpower some of the weaker flavors, so stick to something stronger like bourbon or one of the honey based flavors.

The venue... small and packed.  It's a popular ice cream joint, so expect a bit of a line and if you're late in getting there, some of the flavors may be out (happened to one of the guys in our group).

Overall... if you're a fan of thicker ice cream, this is your place.
author: Justin L.

description:
I heard through the grapevine that this spot had pretty darn good ice cream. It doesn't take much for me to try it, just say the word "ice cream" and I'll be there before you can roll your eyes at me, even on a blistering cold day.

I got here at the right time because as I was leaving, there was a line out the door filled with children and puppies.

So here's what I sampled:

-Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee - Tasted more mocha-ish than coffee and condensed milk. But savory and addictive like coffee is.

-Secret Breakfast - Corn flakes and bourbon. The bourbon aftertaste stuck out. I wasn't really feeling it though.

-Tahitian Vanilla - Tasted like plain vanilla to me. Not a bad thing though.

-Red Hot Banana - I don't like hot sauce mixed with bananas.

-Salt and Pepper - Tasted like creamy cold salt and pepper. Not too pleasing, missing some hard boiled eggs on the side or something. 

Shoop shoop ba-doop
Shoop ba-doop
Shoop ba-doop ba-doop ba-doop

K, lets move on.

I ended up with a kid size (one scoop) of the Blue Bottle. I enjoyed it. I can't complain about good ice cream. I like trying new and creative flavors and they deliver on that part. But some flavors just don't do it for me.
author: Minh D.

description:
SPIKED ICE CREAM. How can anyone go wrong with that?! This place is awesomely delicious and I was blown away by the creative and tasty flavors they have at this place! Located just off of 24th Street down by the Mission, this ice cream shop doesn't disappoint despite the walk from the 24th St. & Mission Bart station. The place is hipster-esque with its super chill staff and clean, white decorations. Just outside of the shop, there's bench seating in addition to the Balmy Street art murals, which I suggest checking out whilst eating your ice cream.

But for reals. The flavors. Honestly, I had no idea what to expect besides the fact that this place was supposed to be amazing, so when I saw (and tasted the flavors), I was definitely impressed. Basically all the flavors were delicious and the alcohol-infused flavors were refreshingly unique. A few that I was able to try when I went (and yes, all were fantastic): Butter Beer, Secret Breakfast, Rum Raisin, and the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee. So good.

The portions here are also pretty generous, which is always a plus. I'd say that I probably like this place more than I do Smitten and comparable in flavor and quality of ice cream to Bi-Rite. However, this place definitely wasn't as long of a wait as the usual hype at Bi-Rite. So all in all, I'll be back soon when I get the chance.
author: Cheston W.

description: Breakfast Special and Vietnamese coffee were the best combination for a 2 scooper. Staff was friendly and the line that was out the door for me moved pretty quickly. I'd come here over bi-rite, it's that good.
author: Laura C.

description:
The good....
1) Vietnamese iced coffee - one of my favorite drinks ever in ice cream form??! I'll take 3 scoops! This really captures the essence and all of the subtle flavor nuances of the drink but in a scoopable form
2) Chocolate with smoked sea salt - comes darn near close to topping Sam's Sundae at Bi-Rite. Just the perfect amount of salt to highlight and contrast the chocolate flavor...wow this was seriously good.
3) Secret breakfast - mmm all the bourbon flavor within the alcohol burn :)

The bad...
I just moved to less than a mile from here so ice cream trips might become a bit more frequent = bad for my already non-existent six pack.
author: David H.

description:
Gosh, still so good.

Secret Breakfast - Always a classic winner
Vietnamese Blue Bottle Coffee - Delicious if you're a big coffee fan
Lemon Buttermilk sherbert - Delicious, icy, light
Olive Oil - Interesting, creamy, okay
Taihaitan Lime Chili - Weird. Might as well try it but skip when it comes to ordering icecream
author: Diana Y.

description:
I'd been wanting to get here for a few years now. I wish I'd made more of an effort before. I love this ice cream. I had the chocolate with smokey sea salt. Wow. Easily one of the best flavors ever. 

Such a cute shop and they offer you a taste of whatever you want. I wish they had an ice cream shop like this in san diego. They really know their craft.
author: Doreen E.

description: The long line is worth the wait! Blue Bottle Vietnamese coffee and the black sesame were divine!! So flavorful!! No wonder Andrew Zimmer paid them a visit, many unique flavors to choose from. I will be back to try the Secret Breakfast.
author: May N.

description:
