description: omgheeee secret breakfast - try it! More sophisticated and tasty than anything you ate at 10am in college.
author: Alex W.

description:
Bless me, Father, for I have sinned.  I have never witnessed the edible power and saving glory of Humphry Slocombe's frozen treats until tonight.

I have seen this humble shop praised throughout the nations, as far as Travel Channel and in Yelp.  Lo, they said, you must visit this place and save yourself.  So with my boyfriend I made the pilgrimage.  The bright lights warmed our chilled bodies.  The perfect temperature to try what we found to be ice cream salvation.

The helpful shop keepers let us sample every flavor.  I tried the aptly named Jesus Juice sorbet.  Almost immediately I was taken to the days of my youth.  My first communion, having the blessed wine and wafer mingle on my young palette.  Just like that moment so long ago I was in awe.  I had to spread the good news.  I bought a pint to bring to my family in order to share the love of Humphry Slocombe Ice Cream.

[NOTE:  Menu changes daily, so you may not have Jesus Juice the day you stop by this store.  At the shop I ordered a scoop of Ancho Chocolate.  As a standard ice cream flavor it was delicious.  Not too heavy on the chocolate taste but just enough creaminess to make you dig for more.  Now to find more friends/reasons to go here.]
author: Christine L.

description:
Support local small businesses!

If you want BR or ColdStone, don't come here.  This is for people who appreciate little gems.  I mean even the name is fitting!

ANYTHING here is good, even if it sounds strange - which should be the motto.  Secret Breakfast is my favorite (bourbon and cornflakes).  Olive oil was good too, smooth and subtle.
author: Dylan T.

description:
I LOVE THIS PLACE AND THEIR ICE CREAM!!!!

My brother and I first came here because we saw it on the food channel and we wanted to try a bunch of places in the city. And Humphry Slocombe was definitely the best place we tried that day. :D

I love that they have a bunch of different flavors every time we come here. Their flavors are very unique and delicious. I love their Secret Breakfast, Eaton Mess, and Harvey milk and honey. 

It is definitely a place where you have to be adventurous and sample all the flavors because you never know what you're going to like. There are no simple or boring flavors here. I actually don't understand why people bring their kids here because there's no plain vanilla or chocolate. 

The workers are super friendly and don't mind that you sample a lot of flavors and they never seem stressed because there is a line of people out the door and someone is trying 5 different flavors.

Some may think that paying $3.25 for a scoop of ice cream is expensive and maybe a little absurd, but it's all worth it because their ice cream is amazing!!!

It's kind of a small place and it can get busy but it doesn't get overcrowded with people who like to loiter around.
author: Denice D.

description:
No need for a long review here.  Focus is the key.

1) Bacon Peanut Brittle
2) Gaba Gaba Hey
3) Burbon Coke Float
4) Jesus Juice= no bueno

That is all.
author: Sally T.

description:
I've finally tried all the top ice cream places in town and Humphry definitely stands out.

The flavors are generally bold and consistency is clean and creamy, not heavy (opposite of Mitchell's). They don't do generic flavors and I think it does great at that, it addresses an ice cream market unfilled here. The bourbon/cornflake "Secret Breakfast" is definitely something to try and I think the best marker of what Humphry's is, and you can either like it or not but I think everyone can appreciate what they're trying to do.

For my taste, I prefer Bi-Rite as the flavors were a little overpowering for me after a couple bites, but ice cream is fun and always interesting so if that's what you're looking for - it's here. Not your childhood ice cream, its definitely an adult version of it.
author: Sam H.

description:
OM NOMNOMNOMNOM
No words. 
No words.
Okay I'll try to find words.
Oh for the love of ice cream!! I was feeling the love. Big time feeling the love. 

Never before have I felt such a quintessential "kid in the candy store" moment than I did at Humphry Slocombe. Yes, the flavors are innovative, yes, the special breakfast is way better than bourbon in your morning cornflakes + a stick of butter sounds (...wait...delay...waitthat'sGENIUS), but even more than that, the EXPERIENCE is what sets Humphry Slocombe apart from the rest. 

At no other ice cream place will you find so much willingness to help you fall in love with their craft. Maybe I just got lucky and happened to have a run-in with the owner or something, but when I mentioned it was my first time and I might need to taste something before I decide, the lady was handing me spoonfuls of everything faster than I could even grab the spoons from her hands. 

Metal teaspoons, not plastic, and she's muttering "OH and you gotta taste the texture of the malted chocolate today" and "but you might like something more refreshing like the Jesus Juice," more to herself than to me but, regardless, this was a real life fairyland. The line was out the door at closing, and I still got that kind of attention.
author: Joanne S.

description:
Very clean look inside. +1

Tried the secret breakfast, but it had a bit too much bite for ice cream. I loved the Tahitian Vanilla and my friends liked their Vietnamese coffee. Mild flavors for the win!
author: Tiffany C.

description:
Is it worth waiting in line 30 minutes for ice cream?  If you have someone interesting to talk to and nothing better to do, sure.

The show dozens of flavors on their website but only seem to have six or eight in stock at a given time.

Loved what I got, two scoops: one scoope of something vanilla-esque with ground up redhots in it atop a scoop malted milk chocolate with cherries as a topping.  The cherries made it all come together.

I've definitely, definitely had better ice cream, but as ice cream goes, it's pretty darn good.
author: Brian J.

description:
Love this place too! I like their blue bottle Vietnamese coffee ice cream! I had their cantaloupe Cheyenne and salted watermelon, both so delicious for a warm summer night! So refreshing! 

Very friendly staff. Once my friend dropped her ice cream when trying to pay and u hear a collective awww from everyone in line. It was quite hilarious. They immediately offered her new one without hesitation and put it in a cup this one with a cone! Haha we kid to this day that She can't handle a cone lol. 

Def want to come back for their bourbon float and their prosciutto ice cream if it ever comes back! Lol
author: Angela C.

description:
I haven't been to the actual shop, but my cousin did bring home some "Jesus Juice" for me to try.

I must say, red wine and cola do make a delicious sorbet! I tried this on "Fat Tuesday" (the day before Palm Sunday). While I'm not an avid Church goer, eating it felt sinful in a weird (but delicious) way. I would've tried to eat the whole thing, but I didn't want to get hit by any lightning bolts that night. I'm not as good at dodging them as I used to be.

Trying the Jesus Juice only made me want to visit this place for myself. Give it a try! I'll probably see you there over the weekend!
author: Daniel M.

description:
I really really love their Vietnamese Blue Bottle Coffee ice cream. It has amazing rich flavor and accompanies most other flavors well.

I've been lucky enough to have tried many other flavors, but the coffee stands out the most. Their coconut sherbet is pretty good too.

I am always tempted to drop by whenever I'm in the area. Luckily I don't live in the Mission otherwise I'd probably drop by every day.
author: Stephanie K.

description: A lot of hype but didnt really deliver. The selection wasn't great that particular day and the flavors were just okay. Had the Blue bottle coffee and coconut sherbert. The coffee was waay too strong and I barely finished it. Coconut sherbert was a little watery.
author: Queena T.

description:
Following a late brunch at La Taqueria, I decided to follow-up with a dose of some Secret Breakfast. 

After a brief wait, and a small taste of Jesus Juice - which totally tastes like both wine and Coca-Cola!! - I asked the dude to pick my second flavor for me, which was Tahitian Vanilla. A very balanced combo, which had me pondering how I was going to finish consuming it all after a huge taco breakfast! 

My boyfriend grabbed some Salt n Pepper with Olive Oil. I felt like there was some chili powder infused in there, which didn't settle well with either of us, but the Olive Oil was tasty. If you're into having it. 

Fanatastic concept, and will have to come back from some Chocolate Stout floats later on when they come back again - we didn't see the notice that they were actually available that day, so I have something to go back for!
author: Alita M.

description:
In the almost 6 years that I've been up in the SF/Bay Area, it has always been about Bi-Rite. Any time anyone asks about ice cream, a scoop of Ricanellas ice cream from Bi-Rite immediately bursts into my imagination and life is good. Over the last couple of years, people have told me many times: "Have you ever tried Humphry Slocombe's? It's damn good too." I would sneer in disgust: "What? Humpty Snowcone? F that shit! Now wait with me in line for an hour in the freezing cold for Bi-Rite!"

And time passed. Dozens of scoops of Bi-Rite later, I finally decide to try it out. I mean, everything deserves a chance, right?

Jumpin' Ya-hoes-are-fat!! Is this what I've been missing out on all the years of my life? I can strongly state that Humphry Slocombe's is my new favorite ice cream. Better than Bi-Rite? Yeah it is. But of course, the thing with ice cream is that flavors are completely subjective and vary based on your tastebuds -- if you love the salted caramel from Bi-Rite, then I'm not sure if you'll find that at Humphry. Also, you might love some flavors and abhor others -- that's what tasting spoons are for.

For me, though, Humphry Slocombe's Secret Breakfast is phenomenal. It has a hint of bourbon with little pieces of "corn flakes" (but they really taste like sugary crack clusters). The Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee is also an awesome flavor if you love condensed milk. I mixed the two and the result was mind-blowing.

After trying this place, it's hard to understand why people wait so long for Bi-Rite. Unless, they are all skeptical like I was and have yet to try the awesomeness that is Humphry Slocombe. That isn't to say that I won't ever go back to Bi-Rite here and there -- I mean, a man's gotta have his Ricanellas once in a while.
author: Roy C.

description: First I went to the SF street food festival, then I cam here.  I did not think my stomach had room to spare, but once I had a bite of the "special breakfast" and black sesame, my stomach understood that it was going to have to deal.  I will definitely back, for more ice cream and to pick up some bacon brittle.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
Located near the 24th/Mission, Humphry Slocombe is small and cute neighborhood ice cream joint.  Unlike other ice cream eateries such as Bi-Rite, the two times I visited Humphry Slocombe I did not have to experience any long lines.

I had a scoop of the candied ginger in a cup.  The ice cream had a very creamy texture with just the right amount of ginger chunks.  I liked that the ice cream was not watery, so it barely melted.  

My friend tried the famous Secret Breakfast but was a tad bit disappointed in the minimal amount of corn flakes present in his scoop.  The whisky flavor was very strong and in some ways a bit too overpowering for my taste; however, don't let that deter you from trying it out since nobody else makes whisky flavored ice cream =P
author: Andrea W.

description:
Had a small cup (2 scoops) of Secret Breakfast & Blue Bottle Vietnamese coffee. The verdict? Secret Breakfast is like breakfast for grown-ups in ice cream form! The bourbon is a great flavor, and the bits & pieces of corn flakes are a nice touch. If you like rum raisin ice cream, then this will hit the spot. The coffee is reaaaally good - if you love Blue Bottle and if you love ice cream, then this flavor is for you. 

Also sampled the McEvoy Olive Oil, Balsamic Caramel, and some ale flavor that's not listed on their website. Olive oil had a nice floral flavor to it, caramel was ok... I like Bi-Rite's salted caramel better. The ale was surprisingly refreshing!

2 things to note:
-Humphry Slocombe is like the adult version of Bi-Rite: creative flavors for a grown-up palate.
-I don't think it's worth an extremely long wait unless it's freakin 70 degrees or something. We came here at a random time (6:30pm) and it wasn't busy at all.
author: Miss H.

description:
Two words: secret breakfast. 

I been coming here bi-weekly for the secret breakfast. Is my new favorite ice cream beside the gelato I had in italy. :)
author: Ramon S.

description: Great and uncommon variety of flavors...too bad it's so far from Oakland. No wait on a warm Sunday afternoon either. Lucky us. Service was super nice too.
author: Holla F.

description:
Their secret breakfast tastes exactly like the continental breakfast you get from Gary Danko, I shit you not.

If you yearn for an alternative to the common excruciatingly sweet,caramel & candy ice cream standard, this is the place to go. It's flavours are unheard of--I urge you to try: 

Salt & Pepper
Olive Oil
Peanut Butter Curry 
Secret Breakfast


The only nuisance is lack of parking and the flavors list being inconsistent.
author: Olivia Vanessa R.

description:
Humphry Slocombe is most certainly deserving of 5 stars, if not just for their name alone. Having grown up watching "Are You Being Served" I was thrilled to see this little shop named after my two favorite characters!

Adorable and non-pretentious ambiance. It was the perfect day for ice cream...a crazy random warm day after a rainy cold week! A short line and the very friendly servers allowed us to taste to our hearts content.

Next week, they should have the sundae fixings up and running, but they had a sign letting you know they are working in baby steps, so I'm fully willing to be patient. Especially when they are up front with their customers AND currently serving an awesome product.

AMAZING:
Secret Breakfast (shhh...cornflakes and burbon!!)
Guinness Gingerbread


Totally rad:
Cream Cheese and Chips
Red Hot Banana
Balsamic Caramel
Malted Dulce de leche


A single was enough for me (you get 2 scoops!) and I loved the recyclable cups and spoons.

Oh and homemade chocolate chip cookies...you have my heart.

On the way home we walked past the epic line and Bi-Rite creamery and smiled. I love Bi-Rite too, but this place definitely won me over on the charm factor.
author: Nikki M.

description: Interesting. Must try in San Francisco. The flavor is rich and overwhelming. The area is also in some sense weird.
author: Curly Junwu H.

description:
This ice cream shop specializes in wild, out there flavors. As far as flavor went, I couldn't taste much of a piggy note at all in the prosciutto ice cream, which I'm sure some would argue is a good thing. However, if I'm brave enough to order such a thing, I would at least like some hint of meat in my treat. Instead, it tasted a lot like bland ice cream base.

The Candy Cap in question is a mushroom. It adds a nutty quality to the dessert, and this was by far the best flavor of the three. Secret Breakfast, which I tried just a sample spoon of, is intended to be Irish Whiskey and corn flakes. I couldn't really taste any of the cereal, so basically it was a half-teaspoon of whiskey ice cream. That's not a bad thing, per se, but isn't exactly revolutionary.

My biggest problem with all three ice creams was the texture. Try this experiment: go buy yourself a good premium pint of B&J and leave it on your counter for an hour. Refreeze it, then taste the outer surface. Every one of the Humphry Slocombe ice creams that we ate had this same kind of grainy consistency. It's likely that the flavors that I wasn't getting were being washed away by the huge ice crystals ensconced in the ice cream. At any rate, it's not a pleasant texture for ice cream, and seems like the sort of thing that a pro can easily avoid. Looking at their flavor list, I think we kind of lost out on some of the potentially exciting ones. Unless of course, all those flavors end up just as bland as those we tried. Color me disappointed, overall.
author: Ryan C.

description: Great little shop with quirky flavors.  Really liked the After School Special, which was vanilla with caramel and chocolate covered Ruffle chips.  Very similar to Mr and Mrs Miscellaneous in concept. Would come back here again, and I don't even live close to SF.
author: Nolan K.

description:
2 things I love: 
-San Francisco 
-ice cream 

So my boyfriend and I came here after dinner on a Sunday night. We've heard so many awesome things about this place, we couldn't resist coming here. 

The ice cream flavors are super unique!! Vietnamese coffee.. Apple caramel.. Tahitian vanilla and of course... Secret breakfast! 
We both couldn't help but get a single scoop each of the secret breakfast.. After all, it's what they're known for right? 

SECRET BREAKFAST:
It's a very creamy.. Soft.. Perfectly sweetened ice cream with hints bourbon that were stronger than I thought.. Amazing. Also added are big chunks of corn flakes that give the perfect amount of crunch and sweet offset to the bourbon undertone that warmed our throat perfectly.

Overall, the ice cream was 10/10. 

I rated it 4 stars because the service wasn't too friendly. The lady was attentive for the most part.. Getting us sample spoons and what not, but was just kind of "whatev" about helping us. 

Other than that, it's an amazing place to try for the adventurous sweet tooths and ice cream-holics out there,  or for a quick ice cream run or date night. 

Card is accepted through SQUARE and parking is typical for the city.
author: Antoinette S.

description:
This is hands down the best ice cream that I have ever had.  The texture is dense and hard.  It softens in your mouth and not in your cone or spoon.  It is also not icy.  Rather it is creamy.  These are the hallmarks of great ice cream texture.

The flavors are all well thought out and they are perfectly balanced.  A great example is the Secret Breakfast.  The flavor of the corn flakes is enhanced by the corn whiskey.  The sweetness of the whiskey enhances the sweetness of the corn flakes and the starchiness of the corn flakes helps with the texture of the ice cream.  (Adding alcohol to the ice cream tends to make ice cream icy.  But, starch counteracts this effect)  Also, the starchy flavors cuts the fire of the alcohol.  Genius.

I have tried many flavors.  All of them are rich and buttery.  I love that it is not too sweet and that you can taste the milk fat in every flavor.  My favorites are the Secret Breakfast (Best Flavor Ever!), the Vietnamese Coffee and the Butter Beer.

Humphrey Slocombe, can I marry you?  Maybe after this prop 8 thing gets resolved, after all corporations are people.  With apologies to Colbert Super Pac.
author: Andrew W.

description:
I'm from Fairfield, California.  I currently live in Sacramento.  When I visit the Bay Area, I'm usually in San Mateo County and I'm unfamiliar with public transportation in SF.  

That being said, I took the BART, got off on 24th and walked a few blocks down to Humphry's.  Damn, what a walk. I'm a suburbanite; we gripe about walking. hahaha.

My friends and I walked in and I didn't know what exactly to expect, I was just glad there wasn't a line around the block.  I sampled a miso pear but decided to go with a Jesus sorbet? It was wine and cola flavored.  It was interesting.  Very interesting.  I liked the small cup it was served in; perfect portion and it wasn't styrafoam!

Staff was really friendly and genuine.  They didn't get annoyed when we wanted to try flavor after flavor.  Thumbs up!
author: Christine A.

description:
What's cooler than cool? ICE COLD ice cream from  Humphry Slocombe! 

This is what this is about: 

These guys are the real deal. Friendly, fabulous, creative with their ice cream flavors...and the ice cream, well, that speaks for itself. With a constantly changing array of flavors such as Vietnamese Blue Bottle coffee, Shhh!! Secret Breakfast (which is bourbon with bits of cornflakes and don't say I told you), Thai Lime Chili, and my personal favorites McEvoy Olive Oil and Balsamic Caramel it's hard to go wrong. The shop is adorable  with a long counter looking out onto Harrison Street with retro red swivel chairs and a black and white tiled floor. You can pretty much try every flavor before you pick your poison. 

Also, I'd just like to note, if it isn't obvious to you already, that the owner takes his ice cream very seriously. What leads me to believe this you ask? Well, the last time I was there, as he kindly explained many of the ice cream flavors to us, what inspired him to create certain flavors, where he purchased most of his ingredients, what he was brewing up in the back room (Barack-y-Road and I-Have-A-Dreamsicle for a party to be held at Charles Phan's new Heaven's Dog & Noodle if you must know) I noticed he had a band of ice cream scoops in sugar cones tattooed around his arm.   Now that's what I call loving your ice cream.
author: Dee I.

description: It was hard to choose between the flavours but I ended up with the Secret Breakfast. It's a must try!
author: Susan K.

description: On my quest to hit up some of the best rated ice cream shops in the city, I arrived here at Humphry's. I did not leave disappointed. The staff there were nice; they let me try 5 flavors before I settled on the chocolate goldrush and the secret breakfast. Both had filling inside and when eating mixed together, it was very nice blend. Of the two, I personally favored the secret breakfast more. With just right kick of bourbon, it was a very interesting and appealing flavor. I will definitely make my way back here to try full size scoops of other flavors.
author: Maurice C.

description:
You know this guy knows what he's doing when he has ice creams tattooed on his arm.
The ice cream I tried was the coconut ice milk, maple walnut, thai chile lime, blue bottle coffee, olive oil, pepper-mint.  Don't worry there was no one behind us. so i took advantage and  my sweet time sampling a ton of the flavors.  

WHOA! Secret breakfast was definitely not that secret, the ice cream that i had the bourbon was waaaaaay too over powering. I like me some alcohol but I think if i were to get that flavor I would need a "chaser" ice cream.
Blue Bottle ice cream- I could really taste the coffee, one of my favorite flavors
Coconut ice milk-  you know those street ice cream vendors that have those fruit ice cream bars...i would always get the coconut. The coconut sherbet was an elevated version of that. Extremely smooth and flavorful.
Maple walnut- It was kinda bland, nothing special. I wish i could taste the maple more but it lacked flavor.
Olive Oil-  was good kinda tasted lemony
Pepper-mint - interesting Idk if i liked it. I got a big pepper chunk in my mouth. no bueno.
Thai chile lime- I did not like this flavor at all. Tasted like chile, didn't think ice cream was the best match for it. 

Pretty interesting flavors. Some worked, some i really questioned what he had in mind. If i had to choose between bi-rite and humphry slocombe I would choose bi-rite.
author: Julie B.

description: Holy bomb diggity bomb ass ice cream! I don't think I can have ice cream anywhere else in SF without thinking longingly of what I COULD be having here instead! My daughter ate her first ENTIRE cup of ice cream here (up until then she only ate a couple of bites before giving up) and chortled happily the entire time. Nez and I went here with my daughter after a glorious dinner and it was amazing! We sat in companionable silence as we happily ate our ice cream, enjoying the sweet explosion of culinary flavor delights the mad Willy Wonka genius behind this operation concocted. He's nothing short of a visionary! I know good ice cream...Mitchell's, Bi-Rite, Bombay, Lourd's, Fenton's, Lappert's...the list goes on and on...this is...this is...ICE CREAM SEX!!!!
author: Jill D.

description:
Pros:
- super unique flavors! Secret Breakfast (corn flakes & bourbon), Pepper and Mint Chip, Cinnamon Brittle, Butterbeer
- great toppings like 30 year-old aged balsamic!
- cute little classic ice cream shop feel
- easy to get to via public transpo

Cons:
- one small counter of seating (maybe 10 seats total)

Overall: 
Definitely worth going out of your way for to try something new, unique and (sometimes inexplicably) delicious!
author: Tasha H.

description:
This place is good and you can tell because the line is always out the door. All the flavors here have weird names and it involves everyone trying at least 2-3 flavors so the line will take a long time.

I tried the Jesus Juice and Secret Breakfast, both alcoholic and interesting. I am not a big fan of the balsamic caramel and I would take the Bi-Rite salted caramel over this any day. I just feel that the balsamic caramel has too much balsamic giving it a weird taste.

My favorite; however, is the Harvey Milk and Graham Crackers. The ice cream taste exactly like delicious milk and it is because of this that I love this place. 

Overall, worth trying and probably my #3 favorite ice cream place thus far (#1 Marco Polo and #2 Bi-Rite)
author: Anthony N.

description:
I am an adventurous eater so why not go to a place that has unusual flavor combos!!!
I sampled the Miso Pear, Viet Coffee, Milk Chocolate Passion Fruit, Olive Oil, Peanut Butter Curry, and Secret Breakfast. I should of just sampled them all! 
I decided to go for the PB Curry and Viet Coffee. The Coffee ice cream was really delicious and had a good depth of coffee flavor. The PB Curry was delightfully and unexpectedly good. It was like eating PB sauce, like the one you dip your spring rolls into. I liked it but definitely not for everyone. And yes, I did get kind of sick of it after eating half the scoop of this flavor. 

Overall, I want to come back as they change and rotate their flavors!
author: Angela D.

description:
Any reviews would just be redundant at this point, with 2000+ reviews already, but what the heck, I'll add my two cents...

This place is pretty much a Mission institution, and is a mecca for new and innovative flavors (I believe I read something about bacon ice cream at some point).

Secret breakfast is the flagship flavor, and recommended for first timers.  Since I've been on a coke float kick, I got the Secret Breakfast coke float, and it was AMAZING.  The sample I had of the blue bottle coffee was heavenly, and blew all other coffee ice creams I've had out of the water.

Service was quick and friendly, as an ice cream shop should be. Will definitely be back to try everything else.  Dare I say it's better than Bi-Rite? Hard to say, since it's been awhile since I had Bi-Rite.  I think I'd have to do a side by side comparison to make a decision :)
author: Michael C.

description:
Yesterday, my friend and I had dinner and one of them brought a pint of Secret breakfast icecream from Humphry Slocombe. It was the perfect dessert for a delicious dinner. 

The icecream was really creamy and it has a very unique taste (burban). I can totally understand if you don't like it right away but it is definitely an acquired taste that you can eventually get use to =) 

it makes you wonder if it is alcoholic? haha
author: Pin X.

description:
This place doesn't have any of the conventional flavors you'd find at a "regular" ice cream shop, but hey, this is San Francisco...they definitely offer some interesting flavors. Went here on a really nice day, so the line was out the door. However, the line moved pretty fast, and once we got to the front, the people behind the counter were patient even as we asked to try multiple flavors before choosing what we wanted.

My favorite was secret breakfast (bourbon+corn flakes). I also ordered jesus juice (coke+red wine, if I remember correctly), but halfway through it started giving me a stomachache. My friend had peanut butter curry, and that was surprisingly good!
author: Elizabeth B.

description: Simply delicious. Thanks to Matthew for being patient while I tried all the flavors. Cinco de Mayo kids are the best kinda kids. See ya again soon!
author: Autumn B.

description:
I guess I just don't understand Mission yuppie/hipster tastes.  I went to 24th st with a friend for a donut, but the shop was closed.  We passed Humphry Slocombe and there was a line..  Something sweet, and a line, must be good, I thought...

The line moved as slow as molasses, and the ice cream was NOT worth the wait.  What's the deal here?  Is it because they have crazy flavors that this place is so popular?  Is this a symptom of today's disaffected youth?  

I guess I should have known when I saw the line of mostly white, mostly young hipsters that this would not be my taste.  I'm very sad that it seems one more piece of yipster gentrification seems to be enroaching on one of my favorite parts of what is left of the MIssion.

I had honey thyme and black sesame.  I ended up throwing most of it away.  My friend had chocolate sorbet, and only ate a few bites.  We won't be going back.
author: Nelson K.

description: Wonderfully creative!   I've always wanted to try the secret breakfast (bourbon + cornflakes) but was also slightly apprehensive since I'm not a huge fan of bourbon.  Everyone here is super nice and I was able to try all the wonderful flavors.  The secret breakfast was surprisingly good, but the flavor I really loved was harvey milk and honey graham.  The honey had a really strong flavor with pieces of graham cracker.  So good.  My bf got the blue bottle vietnamese coffee, which was also delicious!
author: Tiffany C.

description:
The equation is simple: The combination of two things I absolutely love: Blue Bottle + Vietnamese Coffee = a to die-for ice cream flavor!

I'm still dreaming about the creamy flavor ice cream. I don't think I've ever had ice cream where, with every bite, I kept repeating, 'this is sooo good!' It's some seriously strong stuff, so if you're sensitive to coffee, or not a fan, it might be a little over-bearing. But for me, I loved every bite of it! Now I wished I bought some to take home!

I also had tastings of the Secret Breakfast, Tahitian Vanilla, chocolate with sea salt.  Their website lists a bunch of enticing flavors that I'll be sure to come back to try.
author: Lisa C.

description:
Normally when things are hyped up and located in the Mission/hood, I will steer clear.  I'm not one for waiting in line for 30 minutes to get a sandwich or get excited about a place because it's in a hipster location.

But this place simply kicks ass. 

Get the Secret Breakfast flavor.  Trust me... don't ask questions, just do it.   Or don't... I want more to myself.
author: Serge S.

description:
Was a bit disappointed since everyone raves about this place. I don't know if its the batch of secret breakfast I had, but the bourbon taste was a bit overwhelming. There were times where I tasted something like breakfast, but the majority of the time, it was just bourbon. 

Totally didn't even see the Blue Bottle Vietnamese coffee flavor since I was *focused* on secret breakfast. Next time I come here, I will try another flavor.
author: Rosie W.

description:
After seeing this place on the Travel Channel I decided I had to go next time I was in town. When i arrived there were ten people in line. No big deal I thought as Bi-Rite routinely has much longer lines than that. It took at least thirty minutes before I got to the counter. Why the hell did it take so long do you ask? Because once you get to the front of the line they ask you what flavors you want to sample. This practice is ridiculous. If someone wants a sample they will ask for it. It should have taken no more than ten minutes. 

Now all this would be forgiven had the Ice Cream lived up to the hype. I would wait over an hour for Bi-Rite's Honey Lavender Ice Cream, but not the off the wall crap they serve here. Prosciutto Ice Cream, come on. Who wants to eat a whole scoop of that? 

I tried four flavors: Secret Breakfast, Fluffernutter, Malted Milk Chocolate, and Brown Butta. None were even of the quality of your local Baskin Robbins. Secret Breakfast was disgusting, tasting strongly of booze. Malted Milk Chocolate tasted like an old milkshake from McDonald's. Fluffernutter subtlety tasted like Nutterbutters. Brown Butta had an indistinguishable butter taste. Some of the other flavors I did not try were pretty disgusting sounding. There was Salt & Pepper, Jesus Juice (which was wine flavored), and Honey Thyme just to name a few. 

Humphry Slocombe needs to quit being so eccentric and focus on making more traditional Ice Cream more tasty. I'm not sold on the whole savory Ice Cream thing. It's not 200 years ago and I am certainly not Dolly Madison. 

So everyone in the Mission who doesn't know this already (both of you) bypass this joint altogether and hoof it up to 18th Street and go to Bi-Rite instead. You will be very glad you did.
author: Andy Z.

description:
After hearing so much about the Secret Breakfast ice cream, I finally stopped by last Sunday to try it out.   Got there around noon when they opened and sampled a few different flavors and ended up getting:

Secret Breakfast -  I tasted bourbon with a hint of cornflakes and the hubby tasted cornflakes/milk with a hint of bourbon.  If you're against the taste of alcohol, then this might not be your cup of tea.   It was rich and creamy...definitely our favorite!

Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee - If you are a coffee fan, you will love this.  Tastes like coffee straight from my French Press.  Mmmmm.....

Pepper and Mint Chip - This one was unique....nothing like your standard peppermint chip ice cream, which is why this place is so much fun.   If you're a fan of black pepper, you will love this.  Otherwise, you might find it a little strange.  

$5.50 for 3 generous scoops
Take credit cards
Friendly employees

Will definitely be back to try other interesting and unique flavors!
author: Ring K.

description:
It's all about the Secret Breakfast ice cream!!

Well, I've only tried that and the Salt and Pepper one...NOT a fan of the latter. It literally tasted like salt and pepper and isn't really my cup of tea. The guy who served me recommended it though so maybe it's popular with certain people. I also wanted to try tie Blue Bottle one but alas, they were out that day. =( The workers were super helpful though and were happy to let you try as many flavors as you wanted.

Now about Secret Breakfast...I've never had or even heard of bourbon-flavored ice cream before but it was delicious! It was super sweet, creamy, and didn't taste anything like alcohol. I'm really glad I got the kid's scoop though since it would have been a little TOO much if I ate anymore than that. The corn flakes added an interesting texture and really complimented it. I will be back to try the rest of the flavors...and I only live a few minutes away! Score!
author: Karen Y.

description:
I went to both Bi-Rite and Humphry Slobombe today (equal parts ashamed and proud of that), which makes for a nice time for comparison, I think. Overall, I think the flavors at Humphry Slocombe are better conceived and more interesting - the latter fact is probably obvious from the names of the flavors, but as far as I can tell, they are actually good ideas and not just unusual for the sake of being quirky. I didn't really think I'd like the Blue Bottle Vietnamese coffee (not a big fan of coffee flavored ice cream) or the Secret Breakfast (bourbon and ice cream doesn't appeal to me). But they were both great! The coffee is much more nuanced than any normal coffee ice cream I've had, and the bourbon flavor is complimentary and not overpowering (I knew I'd love the cereal in it!). Olive oil was good for a taste but not necessarily something I'd want a full scoop of. 

After sampling all these flavors (I would have killed us but the guy at the counter was wonderfully friendly), we settled on the chocolate sorbet (as one of two options (in addition to another sorbet) for non-lactose tolerants), which was pretty intensely chocolate-y to the point of almost being fudge-y. I liked it but would probably opt for ice cream for a non-shared scoop.

HIGHLIGHT: free samples of bacon peanut brittle! Amazing! Even if this already strikes you as a good idea, it's probably better than you would expect!!! (Baked goods at the counter looked delightful and will probably be sampled in later trips).
author: Lisa K.

description:
Went here for the first time this past June as part of my 25th birthday celebration...

My co-worker had been raving about how great this place was...so I decided to add it to my "itenerary."

My boyfriend and I went here on a Tuesday, in the late afternoon, and fortunately, there wasn't a huge line...

Customer service is great, they welcomed us and asked us if it was our first time visiting. The girl that helped us was so very kind...she took the time to tell us a little about each of the available flavors, and was very patient with us as we sampled a few of their unusual, but extraordinarily good flavors...

We tried:
-peanut butter curry...I've eaten weirder things, so the combination of these two flavors didn't phase me haha...goes well together...you taste the peanut butter and curry simultaneously, curry isn't too overpowering

-black sesame-good, but again...I've eaten weirder things, so this to me was just ordinary

-blue bottle vietnamese coffee-i'm not much of a coffee person, but i was willing to try a sample of this...alot of people like this flavor, but for me, it was just too strong, and i didn't like having that after taste in my mouth

-mcevoy olive oil-...and they say olive oil is good for you...which it is...so eat this if you want your nutritional intake haha...subtle flavor, not sure what exactly is also included in the ice cream...but it tastes like orange...whatever it is, it's good...

-secret breakfast-best tasting out of all that we tried...cornflakes and bourbon...mmm...you can never go with wrong with booze hehe...

-only downside was that my bf was hoping for ice cream with bacon in it...the girl said that they weren't making it for that day...poor bf...he's such a bacon lover...

-the girl suggested that we try the peanut brittle with bacon...didn't sound appealing to the bf so we didn't get it...my coworker did bring in one to work one day though, and i must say...it is pretty good...try it

-i'll come back here again if i'm ever in the area...but i know this place has got some serious competition out there...so before i decide to come back, i shall try mr. and mrs. miscellaneous, bi-rite, and whatever ice creameries are out there...
author: Zerrilyn P.

description:
Delicious. 

Some of the flavors might seem unappealing, but ask to try them before you just order the vanilla. You'll be surprised at how amazing some of the flavors can be when paired. The staff is always willing to let you sample as many flavors as you want before you order (especially if you're a first-timer or an out-of-towner) they want to be sure you are going to enjoy what you decide to order.

The vegan options are a delight as well: The Chocolate Sorbet is to die for if you are a chocolate lover.
author: Melissa O.

description:
4pm line out the door. 

Very clean. i had the chocolate maltd (something) the taste resembled rocky road.. it was ok... i think (sadly) i would have actually preferred a rocky road ice cream instead.. i didnt feel like anything else was really that great.. (n i sampled quite a few)


also, their selection was really limited. =(
author: Lisa N.

description:
I was super excited to finally have a chance to come here when it was opened. They close so early!

I tried the HIBISCUS BEET sorbet, it was disgusting to me even though I absolutely love beets. I'm not a fan of floral flavors in my ice cream.

I got two scoops of SECRET BREAKFAST and VIETNAMESE COFFEE. Both were really good the first few spoonfuls, then it left (especially the secret breakfast that they're known for) a layer of unwanted cream on the roof of my mouth. Just after about 3 spoons I can literally use the spoon to scrape off cream from the roof of my mouth. NASTY. I thought it was just the secret breakfast because that was on top and I couldn't get to the Vietnamese coffee till after but no, it continued to have that effect, just not as bad. 

I also tried my boyfriend's scoop of STRAWBERRY MARGARITA, first bite was good, but it was super sweet.

I don't see the hype about this creamery, I have attempted to come here about 3 times before I was successful and it's so hard to find. I don't even see Humphry till I walked in. 

It doesn't take much to satisfy my ice cream cravings, but this place really did not hit the spot. :( sorry.
author: Erica L.

description: Absolutely fabulous, no complaints here! You can taste as many flavors as you want and since our friends were late, they even let us taste twice since we had to go in line again! I got the the candied ginger and blue bottle vietnamese coffee as our flavors. Superb location, some decent amount of seating (the Sunday rush begins around 4PM) and great ice cream!
author: Shang S.

description:
The ice cream place with such weird, interesting, creative, and unusual names (and unique combination of flavors and ingredients) I think everyone should have a chance to taste. I mean, where can you find ice creams and sorbets with names such as Thai Lime Chili Sorbet, Secret Breakfast (with bourbon and cornflakes), Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee, and Jesus Juice (red wine and coca cola)? Located in the Mission district, I was not so surprised there are many good ice cream shops there due to awesome sunny weather and the lack of fog (unlike the Sunset district). This place was one of my "to-go" places for ice cream and honestly, I don't think ice creams and sorbets can be made terribly as long hearts and efforts were put into making unusual combination to make them stand out from all the other ice cream shops.

Enough rattling, I had the Jesus Juice sorbet. Thought that if I had some sorbet with this so-called religious figure's name attached to it, perhaps something might happen. And yes, something happened. I enjoyed it. The perfect blend of red wine and coca cola, I think I might just try that by combining the two drinks together minus the sorbet part.
author: Kim L.

description:
yummalicious!  

vietnamese coffee
brown butter
secret breakfast (bourbon and cornflake)
butter by moodlight (brown butter with a blueberry swirl)
harvey milk (milk and honey graham cracker)
author: she q.

description:
I love that they are ready with their little spoons to let you taste their creations.  Love the Secret Breakfast with Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee together.  How perfect is that?  

Gotta have the Double Chocolate Stout Ice Cream Beer Float!  

Is it safe to drive after having ice cream here?
author: Maria S.

description:
My favorite ice cream shop!

Every time i come to the city (which is not often), I have to come here! HAVE TO! I'm always trying to reach the bacon ice cream, and they never have it when i come! Although the Elvis is quite amazing. Banana ice cream with bacon and walnuts. YUM! My mouth is watering just typing all this.

I LOVE this place!
author: Angelica G.

description:
I sampled the pepper & mint flavor, it was savory and very pepper-y. I definitely couldn't eat a whole scoop of it. Also had:
Vietnamese Blue Bottle Coffee - LOVE. LOVE. LOVE.
Jesus Juice - meh. it was alright. interesting combo of cola and red wine. not sure i'd get it again. 
When we got there around 9 pm there was no line, after walking around for about 15 minutes the line was down the block. I might wait in line to sample the other crazy flavors they offer but if I can't eat a whole scoop, then what's the point? Better ice cream can be found elsewhere but if I'm feeling like something different, I'll come here.
author: Sara P.

description:
Bi-Rite has nothing on Humphry Slocombe.

The flavors are unique to Humphry Slocombe and are stunningly delicious. 

I got the Balsamic Caramel ice cream- that's right vinegar flavored! It was perhaps the most smooth, balanced ice cream I've ever had. Topped with a warm brownie and you've got heaven in a cup.
author: Russell S.

description: I adore this place! The flavors are amazing alone and even better when paired! However, re: customer service--- I came here with a friend who has a nut allergy. We asked if the ice cream was safe for her to eat and the smug server w the "wu-tang clan" shirt was Completely unaccommodating. I guess when your ice cream is this good, you can afford to have jerks like this on staff. I haven't had issues with other servers yet thus far.
author: Margot B.

description:
Icecream at its best (: Can't say that it's better than Ici's 'cause the texture is about the same, but the flavors are definetely more diverse, and creative. I heard that they rotate their flavors and add new ones more frequently too. 

A breakdown of the flavors that day: Jesus Juice is a combo of red wine and coke, the taste is so interesting and that alcoholic taste afterwards is like sweet alcohol straight out from a cooler. Peach Sake Sorbet on the other hand, it's a little weak in comparison, felt like the peach flavor overwhelmed. Secret Breakfast is good because of the flakes inside that adds texture, but people that don't have a sweet tooth might not like it. They have BUTTERBEER!! just like in Harry Potter! and it is exactly as JK Rowling described, "a less stickier version of butterscotch" and there's like no alcoholic taste, but it was so yummy!
author: Lizi F.

description:
Every visit to Humphry Slocombe is an adventure. You won't find such creative and out of this world flavor pairing in ice cream anywhere else! 

Kumquat + poppy seed?
Bourbon + cornflakes?!
Coke + red wine?!?!!/1

So. Freaking. Amazing.

What else to love? The line isn't as long as Bi-rite and I've often found seating inside and outside the couple of times I went.  The location is a little out of the way, hidden deep in the Mission, but you can easily plan a lunch around Humphry Slocombe with some great places just around the corner and end up here.

Try paying with a credit card too, because they keep it local and use Square's card reader on iPad, and you get to sign with your finger on the screen and your receipt sent to you via text or email. So cool!! 

There's not much more to say. Try this place out!! BEST ice cream in the city.
author: Ray W.

description: I do not eat ice cream in general but this one is exceptional. My favorite is Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee and I brought a pint of Green Tea Black Sesame home to my girlfriend and she actually complained to me that she couldn't stop eating it and finished the whole thing in one sitting.
author: Ilan J.

description:
Humphry Slocombe produces a solid scoop in the midst of San Francisco's surfeit of ice cream shops. 

I sampled several flavors the evening I went, but ended up choosing the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee. Yum. I was up till 4am because of the caffeine rush, but that kind of deliciousness is worth the price of sleep depreciation, right?
author: Kori M.

description:
Secret Breakfast is very good and unique flavor. Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee is a really good coffee ice cream but not quite that different than regular coffee ice cream.

None in our party like Salted Licorice.. It was not good on its own but if you mix it, it wasn't too bad (or was this just guilt from my picking it?). Tried it before ordering for sure.

Peanut butter curry is like it says, you can definitely taste the curry. Interesting but not something I'd get again.

Tried a couple of sorbets which both were good but I'm not big fan of sorbets in general.
author: Agustinus T.

description: I was visiting a friend in SF this past weekend and at around 9:55 on a Friday we decided to hit up Humphry Slocombe.  They were nice enough to stay open a little past close which was quite nice.  Plus, they let us sample all the favors!!  Props to them for that.  I ended up going with the Bourbon Cornflake and Tahitian Vanilla.  Both flavors were unique and super flavorful.  Next time I'm in SF (hopefully sooner rather than later) I will most certainly be making a stop here.
author: michael G.

description: Very unique flavors! I had the secret breakfast, because of all the reviews on here. It has bourbon in it. At first, I thought it was a bit bitter and kind of strong...but after a few more spoons...it was actually really creamy and yummy! I'm not sure if I would be back because there are many other ice cream places in the city.
author: Kathy N.

description: Secret Breakfast was unique and delicious, liked it so much, that I bought a pint for home. The Blue Bottle ice cream was also pretty good, but not too exciting. I will have to come back and try some more flavors.
author: Nikita K.

description:
Having indulged in Humphry Slocombe ice cream more than a dozen times I feel I am finally ready to give a rating.

If I were rating on the ice cream alone, Humphry Slocombe would get 5 stars hands down.  Most flavors are simply incredible!  Secret Breakfast - where have you been all of my life.  Malted dulce de leche - fantastic!  Even the Tahitian vanilla is truly something special.

As for ambiance, it is above average.  The store is somewhat small and is decorated well. The service is good and you are always offered tastes.  The biggest downside is that it can sometimes be exceedingly slow to move through the line.

So, while I cannot recommend the ice cream highly enough, the overall package falls just short of the "as good as it gets" 5th star.
author: Terry P.

description:
In a word...decadent. 

I went to the mission with friends for some amazing Mexican food and I thought the night couldn't possibly get more enjoyable than that. They suggested we take a walk down the street to get the best ice cream in the city and I took that as a personal challenge. I'll be the judge of that! 

I had a single scoop of the "Secret Breakfast" and I became a believer. Never in my wildest dreams did I imagine that bourbon and corn flakes could taste so good in a frozen treat. It was amazing! 

Being slightly nerdy, I was almost as excited about the iPad the cashier used to ring us up and send us our receipts via email. Seriously, how cool is that? I didn't stay very long or try any other flavors, but I thoroughly enjoyed my scoop. The place was clean and the servers were friendly and accommodating. 

The crowd really showed up after we got there and when we left, the line was around the building. Show up when people aren't usually thinking about ice cream and you'll be all set!
author: Stephanie K.

description:
Humphry Slocombe has interesting flavors.

I really wanted the Black Seasame and Blue bottle vietnamese coffee, but they were out of the black seasame when I got to the counter.

You can sample as many flavors as you like; of course I had to try the secret breakfast (bourbon & cornflakes) and the Jesus Juice (cola & red wine). Both were just alright. The bourbon was too strong for me in the secret breakfast and the jesus juice was definitely interesting - i think the cola taste overpowers the red wine. 

I got a scoop of the blue bottle and it was really good. The coffee taste was strong but not bitter.
author: Terry C.

description:
What people say about Humphry is true. Ice cream is basically as good as it gets there and the flavors are just unheard of. 

This place is very small and can get crowded quick. The ice cream servers are all friendly and serve with a smile. They make you feel like a kid again; handing you tiny samples of whatever you want behind their glass and ice containers. 

I was glad to see their sercret breakfast flavor was available that day. I tasted a small serving and maybe it's just me, but I feel like it's not as good as people say it is. I can really taste that bourbon. For me, it's a bit strong. Not one of my favorites. Another interesting flavor was their Guinness ice cream. There wasn't much Guinness in my opinion but it was interesting. My favorite so far is their Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee. Strong flavors of the famous BB coffee and that sweetness from the ice cream all mixed together is just amazing.  The ice cream seems more dense than Bi-Rite's however the prices are just a bit higher. 

Another thing that's cool about this place is that they do the credit card stuff with an iPad, adding a hipness to the joint. Coming back for sure for more of that coffee flavored heavenly concoction.
author: robin w.

description:
Although I was not a fan of the ice cream, they deserve 5 stars for sheer creativity.  

P.S. the only flavor I didn't try was the Tahitian Vanilla - vanilla is my favorite flavor - making this an unfair review of the actual ice cream tasting.  Don't worry - next time I'm in town I will give it another go.
author: Mandy H.

description:
Shiiii that secret breakfast is really strong. Stronger than I imagined. ALSO, frickin curry ice cream tastes like I'm eating indian food.

I'm not sure why I was so surprised by the amount of flavor Slocombe was able to produce from the ice creams. They sure as hell delivered when they said the ice cream was a curry flavor. I was not disappointed.

I also got to see Jake Godby, and I giggled like a little girl (or boy?) who had just seen Justin Bieber. That man has rad ice cream tattoos.

I'm only sad that Humphrey Slocombe is not closer to me, as Bi-Rite has stolen my heart for ice cream. And because I'm lazy and Bi-Rite is only 2 blocks away.
author: Charles L.

description:
Okay, so the line was bonkers, but I suppose that's half the charm. Hey management, you can do something about this! ... like have someone with a clipboard go down the line and take orders ahead of time ... so that we don't all have to face the bottleneck of waiting for everyone to taste 100 flavors, ponder the meaning of life, ask questions, and finally order. 

The legends are true, you definitely want to go for the "secret breakfast" flavor.

This place is certainly better than Bi-Rite.
author: Ian S.

description:
As a loyal Bi-Rite consumer, I wanted to try something a bit more adventurous...

Humphry Slocombe DEFINITELY has more adventurous flavors.  I LOVE the Thai Chili Lime Sorbet.  Seriously would be okay drowning myself in a barrel of this stuff.  

Im lactose intolerant so this place is good for a handful of sorbets/vegan treats.

I do appreciate the original flavs... dont give up on it if it doesnt have anything you LOVE the first time you go. If at first you dont succeed, eat and eat again!
author: kim f.

description: I have heard so much about this place that I couldn't wait to try it. The funny names and interesting flavors got my attention. I tried a scoop of Secret Breakfast, which tastes like bourbon and has crushed corn flakes in it. It was love at first taste. I can't wait to go back.
author: Cindy B.

description: Humphy Slocombe is as good as they say.  The flavors are very unusaul, but they are very good.  The line to get in was about 20 people deep and moved slowly because everyone gets to try the flavors before they buy them.  I got a prosciutto, Brown Butter, and a Black Sesame and it was great.  My wife got Secret Breakfast and Fluffernutter, both of which were good.  It was great to be able to enjoy the ice cream at one of the outside tables with our dog on a nice sunny day.  After seeing a story on how they make their ice cream and choose some of the flavors I find them even more interesting.  We'll go here with people from out of town and every once and a while with our dog.  Be ready for some long lines.  It's nice they have a few tables outside and take credit cards.
author: Scott L.

description:
There's nothing to complain about this place.
Endless samples.
Great service.
Magic that melts in my mouth.
Just had a mix of Black Sesame & Brown Butter.
One word:
Orgasmic.

Makes my Mondays feel like Fridays.

*GUSH*
author: Sara D.

description:
Recently seeking unconventional flavored ice cream, I was happy that my friend took me here during a visit in SF.  Even though it was very cold day, there was still a line outside the door when we got here, and mmm it was worth the wait!  

One of the flavors that I surprisingly liked a lot was their Secret Breakfast: bourbon and corn flakes in a sweet cream ice cream.  The bourbon flavor wasn't too strong and the corn flakes were not soggy at all, surprise, surprise!   I would pass on the Salt/Pepper flavored ice cream, true to it's name and it's exactly what you think it would taste haha.

Luckily the guy who was helping (hopefully!) wasn't getting irritated by the fact that I wanted to try all flavors.  I mean, you sort to have to, since they are such weird flavors!  I also liked the fact that the owner of the place was on site and real friendly with the customer.  I love lil mom and pops shops, especially ones that get a lof of love and yelp review!
author: Nicola V.

description:
$3.25 for two scoops. As everyone already mentioned, Vietnamese Blue Bottle Coffee + Secret Cereal makes a good combo. I also liked their ginger bread and their balsamic caramel and I could just go on forever.

JONASAPPROVED!
author: Jonas T.

description:
The Chocolate Smoked Salt ice cream was amazing, only bested by the Duck Fat Pecan Cake: delicious!
Glad I'm not from around here or I would weigh 300lbs.
author: dean d.

description:
Yummy, overpriced, and trendy ice cream with great service and creative flavors.

The Secret Breakfast is a fantastic way to mix bourbon with ice cream (on the top 100 eats list for SF) and Fluffernutter is darn good. 

A great stop after devouring a burrito at a local taqueria.
author: Chad S.

description:
Love this place and their crazy ice creams! I can't really describe all the flavours of ice cream they have because you have to try it to believe it!

Go and get yourself some crazy ice cream!
author: Vickie Z.

description:
So we arrived to a lucky found parking spot right in front of this joint. The line was already a good deal out the door, but thankfully was moving pretty fast. As for the location, parking can be pretty difficult to find. Also, there are waaayyyyy too many hipsters here for my taste. Definitely not my scene.

Now, for what you wanted to hear about... The ice cream. The ice cream is alright. They have a lot of interesting flavors which I think is better for tasting, not eating a lot of. It gets sickening pretty fast. I got two scoops of ice cream, and seriously ate less than half. For anyone who knows me, you know this is one of the signs of the apocalypse... The day I turn down dessert.

I tasted the fluffernutter. Way too much peanut in there. It tasted like eating frozen peanut butter, but if thats your thing, go for it.

I ended up getting a scoop of the olive oil and the secret breakfast which everyone on here has been raving about. You can tell they used a good quality olive oil since it has that fruity taste, but there was way too much orange zest. And I mean, the amount of orange zest definitely overpowered the flavor of the olive oil, which is kind of the point of this one.

The secret breakfast was good as promised by all you yelpers, but I wasn't wowed. I really liked the added texture from the cornflakes, but got sick of this before I was halfway through the scoop. Again, I think their ice cream is only good in small quantities.

Next time I want some ice cream, Ill stick to Holy Gelato. I prefer gelato anyways.
author: Alison A.

description:
Humphry Slocombe is famous for bizarre ice cream flavors.  They put flavors into their ice cream that you wouldn't normally associate with ice cream (salt & pepper, curry, beer).   It's definitely worth a try just for the novelty value and bragging rights to your friends.  It's also a weird experience, because you'll keep chewing on their ice cream for 10 minutes debating whether you like it or not. 

I tried their Peanut Butter Curry ice cream (I can't help it, I'm Indian, I automatically gravitate to anything called curry).  

I didn't end up getting a full bowl of it, all I can say is that it was interesting.  It is very odd to have curry and ice cream paired together, it's like a savory ice cream with a very strong nutty curry taste.  Like cold curry.  

I also tried their Chocolate Sea Salt.  The sea salt really intensifies the flavor of the dark chocolate, it was like eating a very cold 80+% cacao chocolate bar. 

Their Secret Breakfast flavor (bourbon and cornflakes) is a solid flavor, it's sweet and tastes like a very good regular ice cream.   

I ended up sharing their Beer Week special with a friend (it's gigantic, 4 different flavor scoops for $5, what a deal!).  One tastes like pale ale with a hint of coconut, one tastes like mocha (it's the cocoa stout I think), one tasted like regular beer, and my favorite tasted like buttered rum (you could really taste the butter).

It's in the middle of nowhere, and the parking is tough so it's better to just walk here.  There's also usually a line, so be prepared to wait.
author: Bee M.

description:
Interesting flavors. There's always a line so pick a flavor that'll make it worth it. 

Blue bottle vietnamese coffee is pretty good, but more icy than creamy. Foie Gras ice cream sandwich for $5 is very rich and you can really taste the foie gras, but the cookie overpowers the flavor (nix the cookie).

The orange clove sorbet was interesting but overpowering in the end. I tasted it and it seemed fine so I ordered a scoop.  A bit of orange, a bit of clove. Kind of like orange and cream. As I ate more and more, I realized the clove flavor might be a bit too much. For a good 15 min after I finished it, I felt like I was going to yak. 

CASH ONLY
author: Christina C.

description:
My favorite was one day when they had lanolin ice cream with a hay garnish. Magnifique!

Until I feel like gaining a bunch of hipster friends and treating them to ice cream, I'm just going to say: the emporer isn't wearing any clothes.
author: Wendy M.

description:
I had the Jesus Juice sorbet, made of red wine and cola.  It is sacrilicious.

Anything below a 5-star review for Humphry Slocombe is a sin.
author: Ren L.

description:
We came here yesterday.  Waited 45 minutes (with children) in FEBRUARY to get ice cream.

Had the balsamic carmel, secret breakfast, lemon ginger, blood orange sorbet, Speakeasy IPA, Chocolate Salted Carmel, and the Peanut Butter Curry  (yes.. really - all that)  

loved the ice creams, loved the creativeness.  There needs to be some way to stop people from sampling everything in the store before they pick their one scoop, because it was the customers that were holding everything up. 

I'll come back, although not in the dead of summer when I bet the line is out the door.  

one strange thing - the artwork in the place.  While I found it interesting, explaining to a 10 year old why the words 'fetal kitten' were on a soup can, is something I can do without.
author: Samanta V.

description:
yums!! I really like this place. The cute, nostalgic awning, to the double-headed cow decoration. Cutesy little ice cream shop with fun, funky flavors. 

I had the Secret Breakfast (Bourbon+cornflakes) and the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee. Delish. My gf had the peanut butter+curry and loved it. I thought it was interesting. Probably one of those hit-or-miss for most people. I definitely can't wait to go back and try more flavors!
author: Tammy S.

description: They let you sample! So many flavors to choose, some I wasn't too thrilled about. Salt N Pepper, was very strong. I end up choosing  the cinnamon brittle, which was good. Blue Bottled Vietnamese Coffee was great though, unfortunately it wasn't mine. But I will be getting that the next time I come back. All of the flavors have a great punch, so it's best to get two flavors.
author: Mandy D.

description:
As much as I wanted to love this place for its creativity, creamy texture, and quality ingredients, which earns the joint 2 stars, I threw away about 2.5 scoops of my 3 scoop cup.  Sad, indeed.  The ice cream here is salty--it must be the base they're using.  Had I ordered proscuitto or some other savory flavor, I'd expect that, but even the flavors I chose were not.  

My vietnamese coffee, salty, malted chocolate--salty, and even the tahitian vanilla was SALTY!  I get that salty sweet is trendy and I'll stick it out for the kettle corn, salted caramels, and candied bacon, but this was too much!  I walked away disappointed and dying of thirst.  I guess I will be avoiding a lot of ice cream at restaurants in this city.  Woe is me.
author: Candace C.

description:
I love the fact that I live in a neighborhood that when someone tells you a gourmet ice cream place featuring exotic, inventive flavors just opened, my first reaction is "Another one?"  That's right; watch out Bi-Rite Creamery, there's a new kid in town.  And his name is Humphry Slocombe. 

He'll match your Salted Caramel with his own Balsamic Caramel and then leave you speechless with Pistachio-Bacon.  Yeah, it's like that.  A few friends and I all took a Saturday stroll down to this retro-style joint at 24th & Harrison a week back.  It was the perfect (January) day to try some ice cream, temperature in the mid-60's.  I tried the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee (solid) and the Secret Breakfast, the secret being a devilish blend of bourbon ice cream and caramelized corn flakes.  They have a few dozen flavors listed on their web site and rotate about 10 at a time.  I am already looking forward to my next visit.  Highly recommended.
author: Saminda W.

description: There's never a shortage of unique flavors here.  Jesus Juice, Secret Breakfast, Fluffernutter, Fat Elvis...  one can only guess what is in these flavors if you don't actually stop in and try them for yourself.  And the folks who work behind the counter are quite friendly and will let you sample so that you don't have to guess how these unique flavors taste.  However, my favorite flavor here is probably the most plain vanilla one of them all...  quite literally.  The Tahitian Vanilla is sooo delicious!  Rich, bold flavor, good creamy and heavy ice cream texture.  A definite winner!
author: Jeff C.

description:
Humphry, why did you have to come into my life? You know I'm lactose intolerant AND I'm trying to look hot for the summer... But you keep teasing me with your secret breakfast and Vietnamese coffee ice cream. DAMN IT HUMPHRY, no means no! But... no really means... yes.

Thank god the Mission location is too far for my lazy, ice cream eating ass to travel to. Unfortunately Falettis in Lower Haight houses 8 of your flavors and I fall at my weak knees before you.

Inner fat girl secret: I've been known to eat only ice cream for dinner.
author: Michelle N.

description: Simply, the best ice cream in the city. They have so many great flavors. I'm really never disappointed trying new flavors, though my personal favorites are the peanut butter chocolate chip and the pepper and mint chip. Friendly people and actually reasonable prices for this quality in SF. Kind of one of the best things ever.
author: Eric G.

description:
Remember when you found out that the tooth fairy wasn't real, but you didn't say anything because you were happy to have a source of income at 8 years old?  Humphry Slocombe makes me feel like I have that same kind of secret - even if the long line of waiting people says otherwise.

Get excited, people!  It's ice cream for grownies!

And I know at least two of the food groups were well represented - bourbon and rum - so I can only imagine that this ice cream must be considered health food.  Delicious and nutritious!

+2 for secret breakfast and Vietnamese coffee ice cream
+1 for quick moving line
+1 for friendly staff
+1 for supporting local businesses

Unlike Ike's and other over-hyped eateries in this town, this is one you don't want to miss.
author: Patrick C.

description:
I'm sorry, humphrey.. you're second (but a close second). 

I prefer bi-rites flavors but your texture and creaminess reign supreme. You also have a lot of cute boys working at your shop. 

I've tried most of the flavors at this point... Secret breakfast is definitely memorable but I really like rosemary's baby, harvey milk w/ honey graham, and some of the other more subtle flavors. This is definitely the CREAMIEST and smoothest textured ice cream in the whole city, but it can be a bit on the rich and heavy side. 

A must try for adventurous palettes.
author: Sandy H.

description: Yum!! Had a single scoop cone of the Brown Butter ice cream and it was to die for. A little sweet and a little salty. The boyfriend had Secret Breakfast and that was great too. We will be back soon!
author: Lizzie C.

description:
After an unfortunate miss on Dynamo Donuts but a lucky find on La Panaderia I next made my way to Humphry Slocombe in the Mission - significantly praised by ChowHounds and Yelpers alike I felt it my duty to experience Slocombe and compare it to some of the offerings in Columbus Ohio, a place many call "the ice cream capital of the world." Walking up to the small shop there were notably three young ladies standing outside enjoying small cones - and a small dog enjoying one as well. I asked what the dog liked and the one girl said "the olive oil - its good for his coat." -- yes, she said that, I couldn't make something so insipid up.

Walking into the small shop I was struck by the relatively drab appearance - no flourishes, just a bar, a white board, and 12 types of ice cream - excellent. A smiling staff of two offered me a taste (on cool metal spoons no less) and I gladly endulged - first on Balsamic caramel (best. Ice cream. Ever.), then Blue Bottle Vietnamese coffee (not as good as Jeni's Black Coffee, but good) , then Andante chevre-strawberry jam (Good, but Jeni's fig and goat cheese is better,) and finally McEvoy olive oil (Better than Batali's - I could feel my coat getting stronger immediately.)

Having heard rumor of the Secret Breakfast from any number of sources I took a taste and immediately ordered a scoop in addition to a scoop of the balsamic caramel - no cone, just a cup - awesome. Sitting down at the long bar I dug in and slowly enjoyed the wonderful caramel peaks with the heavy nuance of a quality balsamic underneath. While Jeni's back home makes a superb Salty Caramel, this simply raises the bar a couple notches. In addition to the flavor, what struck me most was the incredible creaminess of the ice cream - almost a velvety texture on the tongue that didn't even seem 'cold' because it was so smooth. 

My second flavor, the Secret Breakfast, was not only cleverly named - but incredibly well flavored. Consisting of candied cornflakes with bourbon-flavored ice cream it reminded me of the standard "butter pecan" except without pecans and with a substantial "kick." While others have not mentioned it, I distinctly caught the flavor, texture, and appearance of raisin in the scoop which makes me wonder if this was indeed a candied raisin-bran as opposed to corn flakes. Once again, the ice cream was like velvet and absolutely superb.

While I wish some of the more exotic flavors (Foie Gras, Government Cheese, etc) had been available and that they'd taken Credit Cards (see, again, the retarded $fine$ for not having cash on the way to Napa) I must say what I tasted was excellent and in the realm of designer ice cream I'd rank them on-par or better than our famous Jeni's at home - I'd come back for Balsamic Caramel in a heartbeat and next time aim to get the Blue Bottle and mix it with Valrhona fudgesicle. Great service and good for your pets, too!
author: Michael U.

description:
You have to try their Secret Breakfast and their Malted Milk Chocolate. Hands down the best ice cream in the city. Well worth the long lines (often in the cold).
I like how they use Square/iPad for payments but that iPad screen is disgustingly dirty with all the finger signing going on - I wish they cleaned it more often or offered customers a digital pen or something?
author: Sunil K.

description:
Gotta love the innovative flavors and friendly staff.  The two they always have are Vietnamese coffee and Secret breakfast, which is bourbon and corn flakes in sweet cream ice cream.  The others are always changing and definitely unique.

I wonder how much alcoholic content is in the secret breakfast... if I have a huge scoop (and by scoop I mean the whole damn to-go pint) and I go out, might I be intoxicated?  Yeah imagine that- "Ummm no officer, I haven't been drinking, you see I just ate a ton of this ice cream....."
author: Maxine S.

description:
The ice cream was almost as impressive as the line.  It took at least 45 minutes to get served.  I never like to punish a place for being popular but the counter staff was a little disorganized and not helping the situation.  

The ice cream flavors are unusual and mostly very good.  I can understand now why everyone loves their secret breakfast.  The Thai Chili sorbet was also very good.  Just a enough heat so that you notice but not enough to overpower the sorbet.  Given how trendy this place is your would expect it to be more expensive but the prices are very fair.  Overall, a great place to get some good and different ice cream if you are willing to wait.
author: Brad L.

description:
I don't always eat ice cream, but when I do...

I've been to Humphry's three times now. On product alone, they are doing it right. Very smooth textured ice cream with bold flavor that is truly delicious. 

I personally admire the ambition of any recipe/flavor combo that marries unexpected ingredients. If the flavor joining succeeds, it makes the risk all that much more sweet. For me, this is encapsulated in Humphry's olive oil ice cream flavor. I don't know if I trust myself in saying this, but this flavor may be the best ice cream (based on personal taste preferences and flavor ambition) that I have ever tasted.

The Chocolate Goldrush flavor was also very very good. It's dark chocolate ice cream, may I add. The smooth texture was also there with surprising bits of crunchy waffle cone running through it here and there. 

If there is anything not perfect about Humphry's, it's not the ice cream, because it is damn near perfect - it's waiting in line for the ice cream, which has averaged about 15-20 minutes in my experience. However, you can't get too mad because those that are scooping behind the counter let customers try a couple flavors if they'd like, which is what makes the line move so slowly. If you want really delicious ice cream, Humphry's is worth the wait.
author: A. P.

description: The best thing here are the crazy concoctions they come up with.  It is so much fun trying new things and always being surprised how good they are when you skeptical at best.  A huge favorite of mine and my bf is the secret breakfast.  The bourbon makes it feel so naughty but taste so delicious.  I also enjoy the sorbets because they always taste exactly like their names.  Plus, you don't feel so guilty getting the kids in your life a scoop of beet-carrot sorbet.  It's a fun place to go to and try new things!
author: Jenn N.

description:
Quaint, nondescript ice cream parlor.  Very easy to miss (had to drive around the block).  Simple navy blue awning with the words "ice cream" in small, lower case font grace the lower left hand corner.  Looks like something that belongs on Union Street or in Noe Valley.

Tried the Special Breakfast which I liked but thought it wasn't classy to have alcohol before 5.  [lawl]

I ended up playing it safe with the Blue Bottom Vietnamese Coffee which was a creamy, rich treat.  A kid's size is $2.75, a little on the expensive side.

Pro tip:  they take credit cards with their nifty iPad.
author: Kimiko Q.

description:
I scream for ICE CREAM! 
You scream for ICE CREAM!
WE all scream for ICE CREAM!
AAAAHhhHH!

Cool, simple place located in the mission with just some wacky flavors that are sooo amazingly good. I love the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee ice cream and the cola sorbet. I tend to stick with the more simple flavors like tahitian vanilla or chocolate. Am tempted to try the foie gras and proscuitto one day when I am bold enough or hungry enough to have ice cream replace my meals. 

Packed like it's some crowded party on all the days we've been, we'd always have to weasel our way thru to get to the line and wait for at least 15 mins before getting our scoop of ice cream on a sugar cone.
author: Laurel P.

description:
I have no idea what I was thinking when I got a scoop of Chocolate Smoked Sea Salt without trying it first. It was straight up SALTY.  It tasted literally of of melty salt and chocolate. *shiver* Somehow I managed to finish the entire single cup, wincing here and there. No bueno!

I also bought a pint of brown butter back home to share with my boyfriend, but to my surprised, the browned butter did not taste the same as when I last had it. It was sour......? I didn't get a stomach ache so that's ok.

I tried my friend's Thai Chili Lime sorbet and think that is the most RANDOM flavor aside from Salt & Pepper. I was disgusted by the spicy after taste. Never again.
author: Rosanne L.

description:
This is by far my new favorite ice cream shop EVER.  The rave reviews on here are well deserved and the only problem with this place is that the flavors are so good I always end up eating way too much ice cream.
My first time I got the malted milk chocolate and it was simply the best chocolate ice cream I've had in my life.  I haven't tasted anything that even comes close.  
The next time it was the coffee (or I think some variation on coffee) that blew me away.  
I look forward to trying the really strange ones - I've had the secret breakfast (corn flakes and bourbon) flavor and although it is by far the most unique flavor I've tried, I can't say I actually liked it.  
I'll go again and again, I'm sure.  I've already been like 6 times since I discovered it roughly one month ago.
author: Theo T.

description: OMG. This place is the bomb. They are just a block from my house so I go there all the time. They have crazy innovative flavors. And they always have either hipster or ratchet music (you heard that right) playing all the time. One time dude was playing versace versace versace versace versace versace. Anyway, about the ice cream. Secret Breakfast is the shit. Many days, I bring home a pint and eat it for breakfast the next day. I don't feel bad about it all. If you want subtle and not too sugary, try Oolong Tea. It's perfect. If you want a really sugary high, get the Harvey Milk. WOW. Pretty much every flavor is the shit (other standouts: Malted Milk Chocolate, Horchata). By far, the best ice cream place I've ever visited in my life. One day, these guys will be known all around the world.
author: Abi R.

description:
I don't know what else I can say about this place. Flavors are all so unique, and taste so *surprisingly* yummy. I can't wait to one day try the foie gras.

I've had:
Browned butter (amaaaazing)
Secret Breakfast (bourbon + corn flakes) Delish - a FAVE
