Salt and pepper
Honey Thyme
Jesus juice
Tahitian Vanilla

And I can't complain about any of them.

They use Square on the iPad as their check-out device.
author: Uyen D.

description:
After reading review after review of how amazing this place is, I had to get my butt outta SJ and up to SF. And I am so glad I did!

This place is amazing .. really unique. I love the store front with huge windows to see in or out, the tables and chairs outside, and the photos of their products on the wall and artwork :)

I had the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee and Secret Breakfast.

BBVC was the tastiest coffee ice cream I've ever had. It tasted just like what I would get with my Pho. Bursting with coffee flavor in a rich and creamy consistency.. Super drool worthy and my MUST HAVE flavor when I come back.

When I read the ingredients of Secret Breakfast, I was a little worried. I've never been one for liquor flavored sweets. But when I taste tested this, I was sold and had to have a scoop of it. It had the flavor of the bourbon without being overpowering, just the sweet essence of it and  mixed with the slight crunch of cornflakes.. it  was the perfect marriage of flavor! 

Must try moar flavors!!!

My two cents: A MUST when visiting SF. Freakin' winnar!
author: Shauna Y.

description: mehhh... just alright. Really nothing spectacular. I think it has been so hyped up because they have crazy flavors, like Vietnamese coffee and Secret breakfast... which I tried, and the alcohol flavor was a little too strong for my liking. I don't get when people say this is the best ice cream in SF... come on people, compared to Mitchell's and Bi-Rite?!? Its kinda pricey too! I will give it one star for customer service. The guy that works there was really nice!
author: Jan C.

description: This place has great quality ice cream.  But, I'm convinced some of the more ridiculous flavors are made up just to create a buzz.  I mean seriously--is there anyone on earth that can eat an entire scoop of salt & pepper flavor ice cream?  I seriously doubt it.
author: Ralph B.

description:
Grumpy Slowpoke is what I call it. The line is LONG and SLOW and the hipster scoopers are GRUMPY. Therefore, I go on odd days and when it's cold out so I can avoid the downers and get what is probably the one ice cream flavor that comes closest to great sex--the smoked sea salt chocolate. Wow. My mouth is watering as I write this.
I wish they would have a "know what you want" /pre-packaged pints line, but whatever. I live nearby so I can just hop, skip on over there during the down times.
author: Uda W.

description:
Mmm... a scoop olive oil and a scoop of smoked sea salt and chocolate on a waffle cone pretty please! 

A damn fine treat after a day of frisbee golf with friends. I wish I lived closer to this place! 

The ice cream itself is creamy and rich, sweet, but not too sweet, and definitely unique in the flavor department.

Check this place out! And bring friends!
author: Leigh W.

description:
Is it the fact that this shop is in San Francisco that their service sucks, or is it just them? We were the only ones in the shop and our presence wasn't acknowledged until we finally gave our order. Then, coming back in to buy a mug for a coffee/ice cream lover, we were ignored for 5 minutes, and the guy even helped a lady who couldn't make up her mind about what she wanted before helping us, and we had exact change for the damn mug!

They had a Peach Habanero flavor when I went, so, as a Mexican, I was excited to try it. A wiener-looking white guy came in and asked the girl behind the counter if it was spicy. She replied "oh yeah, its got a nice heat." So he chickened out and got vanilla instead. Oh boy! I was getting ready to be wowed by a Peach Habanero ice cream described as having a nice heat. I took a spoonful and...it tasted like effin Lucas. The candy. The powdered stuff Mexican kids can eat pounds of without getting even a murmur of discomfort from their stomach. MASSIVE letdown.

The one somewhat positive thing I could find is that their Vietnamese coffee flavor was good. That bumped them up one star.

So glad that I live in LA, so close to my beloved Mother Moo Creamery.
author: Mark S.

description:
I can't help it...I bring the crowd wherever I go.

I came here with some friends last night, and there was only a couple in line before us doing some tasting. By the time we started to taste some flavors, a huge line of more than 15 people had already formed!

I tasted Jesus Juice, Salt&Pepper, Malted Chocolate, Tahitian Vanilla, and Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee flavors. However, I ordered the McEvoy Olive Oil flavored ice cream, a decision I never expected myself to make. I thought it would be heavy since its name indicates oil, but it had an appealing tanginess and a good balance of sweet and savory. I absolutely loved the consistency of the ice cream; it was firm but smooth. I didn't enjoy tasting the Salt&Pepper flavor since there was a terrible clash of the competing flavors, both of which were overpowering and not really meant for an ice cream flavor.

A must-try and a definite new favorite for their interesting flavors! I've got to try them all!
author: Bonita K.

description:
On an early Saturday afternoon, I opened the door to Humphrey Slocombe, noticed no one inside, looked outside the door...(yup....says "OPEN"....) and walked in.  3 workers stood with their backs towards me, talking amongst themselves.  One by one, I lugged each barrel of ice cream from their freezer display and rolled em out the store into my big white no windows van......

Ok ok ok I lied.  It was a Sunday afternoon. :P

I sampled:

Balsamic Caramel (tart and sweet)
Chocolate Smoked Sea Salt (deep, rich chocolate with hint of salty tang)
and Peanut Butter Curry (this one I ended up buying a scoop of)

I couldn't tell if the actual ice cream was peanut butter flavored or curry flavored, because most of the flavor came from the peanut butter and curry pieces I'd find in it, which for my tummy, sufficed.   

4 stars for their unconventional recipes, 2 stars for mindless employees. 5 stars for my van full of ice cream. Bwahaha.

There's no huge "HUMPHREY SLOCOMBE" sign outside, so if you're not careful, you might drive or walk straight past this place and not even know it.
author: Rho T.

description:
My friend heard about this place and we decided to check it out. I knew it was known for its crazy, unusual combinations but I was really excited after showing up and seeing them in person! 

1. Thai Curry and Peanut Butter- very strong flavors that sort of clashed and overwhelmed the other. I didn't particularly love it. My friend said my first reaction was "Woah," and it was-- and not necessarily in the best way.

2. Tahitian Vanilla- light and creamy, with a hint of a some kind of exotic spice.

3. McEvoy Olive Oil- I tried my friend's and this was my favorite. It was light, fruity, and creamy. This is a flavor I would come back for!

4. Secret Breakfast- I understand the hype but it didn't particularly appeal to me; seemed rather bland and boring.

The reason I give it only three stars is because while I appreciate its ingenuity and interesting combinations, I think there are better ways to combine unique flavors together. It just didn't have the creaminess and texture I love in my ice cream. 

By the time we got there (8:30 p.m.) the Vietnamese Coffee and some other flavors were already gone. My Viet friends were disappointed. Thus, I would recommend going early if you want to have all the selections. Also, having been to Ici and Bi-Rite, I would rate Bi-Rite first, Ici second, and this third.
author: Allison S.

description:
This ice cream makes me feel as if I have been living a very sheltered foodie existence, perhaps even a deprived existence, because I have never sampled such creamy dreaminess. Lucky me, we had a Humphry Slocombe ice cream social, and I was able to sample several of these wildly creative concoctions. True, perhaps some work better than others, but any joint that elevates ice cream to this level of inventiveness deserves recognition. Plus, not only do they provide you with cardamom pluot and secret breakfast ice creams (to name a few), they crate custom sauces for the flavors, such as a bourbon caramel sauce and a lavender scented drizzle. Baskin, you need to step it up!

I leave you with one simple question: How can you not give a place 5-stars that manages to combine ice cream and alcohol?
author: Misti Y.

description:
Amazingly creative flavors that constantly rotate.  Check out their website or follow them on Twitter to find out what they're serving and be sure to try their Secret Breakfast.  My advice: visit during the day.  Otherwise, don't forget to pack your bullet proof vest and shanking blade before you venture out into this part of the Mission!  

Seriously though, you can kill 2 birds with one stone by visiting Frances, Flour + Water, Hog & Rocks, or Maverick and have both a delicious meal AND try Humphry Slocombe ice cream.  

Personally, I'd rather grab a pint of salted caramel from Bi Rite and have a day in Dolores Park but take that for what it's worth...
author: Sean H.

description:
oh snap. SECRET BREAKFAST! i know the truth now ...

The only downside? NO PARKING at all! If only this spot had some kind of designated parking lot like Mitchells or some better parking spots, I'd be here more often. 

I wanted the blue bottle one but they were all out =/ Cant wait to be back!
author: Kenny L.

description: Awesome flavors, cool staff. A must try: secret breakfast! So good. The line to get in can be a bit ridiculous
author: Dave A.

description:
Humphry's has very adult falvored creamy ice cream! Made with quaility ingredients and taste creamy

Falvors that I've tried:
Special K - ehh not my, but some people love it!
Vietnamese coffee - yum
Rocky Road - yum yum

Check this place out!
author: Fried Rice B.

description: I absolutely LOVE LOVE LOVE this place. One of my previous Chef's good friend owns it. The flavors are out of this world yet so delicious! Makes culinary sense. It's defiantly worth my 30-45min commute. My mouth is watering(now drooling) just thinking about their peanutbutter curry flavor!
author: L V.

description: Came here for the first time last week w/ a couple friends and tried the Special Breakfast in a sugar cone! It was perfect!  Must try!
author: Camille Y.

description:
Another "First Review" feather in my cap. Can't believe nobody wrote this place up yet.

Anyway, I highly recommend adding the roasted peanuts and hot fudge to any order. The peanuts are insanely good.
author: George B.

description:
Mmmmm..as my taste buds were firing off their super sensors on my quick stop at this awesome ice creamery.

Just off 24th Street in the Mission at Harrison, a quaint small ice cream shop is serving up the good scoops of frozen cream delight. I didn't have time to try all the current flavors but on the menu that night was the Shhh!! 'Secret Breakfast', Coconut Sherbet, Balsamic Caramel, Vietnamese Blue Bottle Coffee, and a few others to boot.

After tasting the Secret Breakfast I see why the 'buzz' is swarming for this flavor. Excellent mix of 'secret' ingredients worth trying out. Crunchy, silky smooth flavor and sweet at the end.

I ended up having the Balsamic Caramel with a great chocolate chip cookie that was very satisfying. The flavor to me was very sharp at first but the caramel really brings it back around to smoothen and sweeten it out. As for the great crispy yet chewy cookie, I was done! All smiles for me!

I didn't get to meet the prodigy behind the sweet madness, but I definitely will be back for my occasional creamy indulgence.
author: Dave S.

description: Why do the employees seem like they are at a funeral? The ice cream is pretty on point though - $5 for a couple of scoops seemed a little steep.
author: Daniel F.

description: Came here on a Saturday afternoon. The place can be easily missed if you're just passing by the area as the storefront is only marked by an awning titled "ice cream." The cashiers here are very patient and provide incredible service you don't expect from an ice cream shop. We tried the the oolong tea ice cream and grapefruit tarragon sorbet. The oolong tea was great, not too sweet and the tea flavor definitely came through. The grapefruit tarragon was refreshing and had a prominent grapefruit flavor as well. I'm not the biggest fan of cream or sweets in general (yeah I know I'm weird) but I would not mind coming back here again. Definitely worth a try.
author: Kevin N.

description: Very good, fun artisanal ice cream. However, I personally think Bi-rite and Mitchell's are better. It's just a little too funky for my taste. However, hats off to HS for making stellar ice cream. I can easily see how others love this place.
author: Michael S.

description: It was good!  There was a line out the door which I always a good sign just make sure you're in no rush.  I tried every flavor and they were all good but I was looking for something a little more on the unusual side (more like Portlands Salt & Straw). Now that's not to say it wasn't good ice cream - just not the most unusual there is.  With that being said, the "surprise breakfast" was my favorite and the "Elvis-the fat days" was good too (it just needed more bacon!)
author: Samantha S.

description: So we went there, and had previously heard they have very eclectic flavors.  I had the Thai Chili Sorbet..  it was wonderful.   My kids had more traditional flavors- which were just okay.    If you go, try a flavor that you would never buy, you won't be disappointed.   If you have a Cookie Dough,  you will wonder what all the hype is about.   If you want Cookie Dough or basic flavors, Go to the East Bay and eat at Fentons (on Piedmont ave).
author: jennifer w.

description: The Secret Breakfast ice cream was amazing as part of a coke float, with caramel sauce. It was like the best bourbon and coke, with some strangely satisfying crunchy cornflakes and caramel. Just...wow! But there's only the compost bin available, so I had to hand my glass coke bottle back to the woman at the counter. Reminds me of Molly Moon's in Seattle. Great stuff.
author: Tracy M.

description:
Kudos for their inventive flavors!  On the day that I went, I tried Jesus Juice sorbet (Coke and red wine) and peach sake sorbet.  The JJ sorbet had a slight acidic Coke aftertaste which I didn't care too much for, so I got the peach sake.  It was nice and smooth, not icy as sorbets can sometimes be.  

Also, if you are able to get a stool inside, it's a great spot to do some people-watching.  

I'll be back to try more of their flavors.  =)
author: Kipy K.

description:
I think of Humphry Slocombe as the underdog when it comes to quirky ice cream flavors in the Mission. And I can't help but have a soft spot for the underdog. 

I think the draw of Humphry is 1) They actually have weird flavors. So, yeah, they might taste a little weird, but some people like that stuff and it serves a real niche. 2) Weird or not, everything is top-notch quality, so you know if they've got your favorite flavor that it's going to be amazeballs. I especially like the cinnamon brittle. 3) Underdog! This area of the Mission has way more of a mom-and-pop feel than the Dolores Park area, and I like that.
author: Richa A.

description: I wanted to try this place out since a friend of mine mentioned that it was showed on Food Network. As expected, the line was really long. We waited around 30 minutes. They do have very creative and original flavors though. I had the secret breakfast, the dulce de leche, and the vanilla. The vanilla was nothing special, tasted regular to me. The dulce de leche was really good though. The secret breakfast tasted surprisingly strong. After eating a lot of it I could really taste the bourbon in it. I almost got buzzed. However it was really good. I also tried the cayenne cantaloupe as a sample and it was really spicy! Overall, it is a good place to get some unusual ice cream flavors. The line will be long so be ready to wait.
author: Juan F.

description:
Hammer said it best.

"Go with the funk, it is said.
If you can't groove to this
Then you probably are dead."

Stop!  Honey Thyme!

I went in the middle of the day, in the middle of the week, and tasted at least five different flavors but finally decided on Honey Thyme.  Boy, am I glad I did!  It was the perfect afternoon indulgence and I can't wait to go back and taste some more.
author: Melissa M.

description:
Spot the Brit on the page, huh? You lucky San Franciscans, heck, you Americans even can afford to be picky and knock off a star here for small scoops, a star there for overly outlandish flavours. I live in Manchester, where the closest thing to interesting ice cream variation is the tiny little freezer at Thornton's with about five flavours. Apart from Moonlight (http://www.yelp.co.uk/biz/moonlight-manchester) which I've yet to try...

During my amazing week in San Francisco our lovely head honchos brought in vats of this delicious frozen loveliness to pep us up in the afternoon. Oh yes. Humphry Slocombe catered for us. Win!!! Welcome Limoncello Sorbet, Tahitian Vanilla, Eight Ball Stout, Secret Breakfast and others... it was an icy sensory overload. 

The condiments that came with them were all kinds of special. Chocolate fudge, marshmallow swirl, bourbon caramel (Britain, you've officially failed me. THIS is how it's done)... and that Secret Breakfast, well just call me a ditzy darling. I had no idea it even had alcohol in it, and there I was munching away. It doesn't taste nearly as intense and overpowering if you don't know about its booze content, just absolutely stunning.

Like Colleen B, I wasn't hungry either. I'd eaten a flatbread in its entirety for the first time in my life in addition to all the falafel it contained just hours earlier. The darn frozen stuff is THAT hard to resist. Between Thermidor and this place, I'd *walk* back to San Francisco if I could. Go on, treat yourself!
author: Emma Louise M.

description:
I've never been much of an ice cream fan, that is until approximately 7:45 pm tonight. My boyfriend and I just moved to the mission from Russian Hill. We've had fun exploring our new neighborhood spots. We decided to try Humphry Slocombe for dinner, it was just one of those nights.

I was a bit skeptical after some of the reviews but this place put all of my fears to rest. To start off, it is super adorable. The staff was very friendly and offered up samples without us even asking. My boyfriend is a vanilla guy, and after 27 years of vanilla ice cream expertise he announced that this Tahitian vanilla was one of the best he ever had. I'm more on the wild/random side so I went for the secret breakfast (bourbon&cornflakes) It was beyond delicious. Not too strong, not too sweet... just right! It turned me. I am and forever will be, an ice cream lover. Cant wait to try more flavors, a bourbon float(i swear I'm not an alcoholic) and the bacon peanut brittle...
author: Lacey M.

description:
H eap of Humphry Slocombe ice cream is a great SF treat
U nique flavors -- and there's a lot of them
M ight have a hundred, but they only offer about ten a day 
P lace gets a line but it moves pretty quickly
H ipsters run the counter -- they're somewhat friendly
R eally liked their snazzy iPad credit card machine
Y ou might want to grab seats outside on a sunny day

S o as for the ice cream, its consistency is thicker than Bi-Rite
L ittle bit icier texture than Mitchell's (still my favorite)
O f the ones I tried, my favorite is the McEvoy Olive Oil
C itrus tang really complements the nice subtle flavor
O ther favorite is Elvis: The Fat Years (peanut brittle, banana and bacon!)
M any raved about Secret Breakfast, but it didn't work for me
B lend of bourbon and corn flakes just had an unsettling flavor
E very flavor is an experience -- will be back to try more!
author: Anthony N.

description:
On my last day of my SF trip, I was already dying from too much fat, sugar and carbs.

Yet, I couldn't go back to L.A. without trying Humphrey Slocombe. After all, I needed to compare it to Bi-Rite.

Well, it's not really fair to compare the two. On one hand, they are both ice cream. On the other, their flavors are really not comparable. At HS, I had peanut butter curry, balsamic caramel and the Youngs Double Chocolate stout. The three ice creams were approximately the same color and pretty soon, you couldn't tell which was which unless you tasted. And of course we tasted. 

If I have to say the difference in the two ice creams were mainly HS was a bit creamier and melted faster.
author: Min T.

description:
Booze...in ice-cream...and in caramel?!?!  Do I really need to say more?!?!

Side Notes: Secret B is as boozy as they say.  Parentals, that means you may want to reconsider letting the kiddies partake in that flavor (can you say future AA's in the making).  Grown folk, I suggest the Bourbon & Coke float because booze infused into the ice-cream and the caramel is double the delight.  Oh, and it's not cash only.  You got to know that any spot that be coming up with these flavor banging concoctions are on top of their game.  Their spiffy IPAD will swipe your card and have you sign so grab a pint of secret b and a jar of their bourbon caramel (yes, they so bottled it) and have yourself a partay...Cheers!!!
author: Stephanie E.

description: Amazing. I absolutely love their unique flavors. Can we say Bourbon Cornflake? With flavors like Peanut Butter Curry and Foie Gras, this is a one-of-a-kind frozen goodness establishment you must try.
author: Tiffany L.

description:
I must be on a bad streak with these beloved bay area jewels.... Could it be my unlucky timing?  Humphry Slocombe Ice Cream was indeed delightful.... But not as impressive as I thought it would be.  Is this place over-hyped or did I just come at a bad time?

The Blue Bottle Vietnamese ice cream was rich and heavenly.  Maybe a little too sweet for my taste buds but still delightful.  The secret breakfast is shockingly good.  Yeah, who knew this crazy concoction would turn out so well?  The Jesus juice however was an absolute failure.  It was simply.... disgusting!

Since the flavors are seasonal, I would like to come back to try their other flavors.  I love how they use metal spoons for tasting so they can reduce, re-use, and recycle!
author: Danny L.

description:
A scoop of the Vietnamese coffee ice cream after what I thought was already a fully satisfying meal was blissful perfection. Kind of wish I had opted for two scoops, but I was belly busting full from dinner at this point. I had a spoonful of my friend's chocolate ice cream and it closely mimics a Fudgsicle. I'm sure this version would also be Bill Cosby approved. Even though he endorsed Pudding Pops. (Same difference.)

Very glad to know that the Vietnamese coffee is one of their staples from a usually rotating menu of limited ice cream flavors. I shall return and make sure to have enough room to eat an entire pint's worth of the stuff.
author: Karen T.

description:
Do I have to choose between Humphry Slocombe and Bi-Rite?  I think Bi-Rite is more reliable and may have a better base texture to its ice cream, but the mad scientist flavors at Humphry Slocombe kind of rocked my world.

The shop is cute and tiny, and rather hard to spot from more than a few yards away.  The interior is clean with all the flavors clearly on display.  When I went, there was a short line, for which I was thankful - it gave me some time to ponder my options.

Justin C. and I sampled a number of flavors and shared two cups with two flavors in each.  I'll dispense with the rejects first.  The samples are definitely necessary at this place - how else would I have tried the strange, savory Thai chili lime sorbet?  I couldn't eat more than a few bites of this flavor, but it was refreshing and certainly weird.  I also passed on the Jesus Juice, which was a vibrant combination of red wine and cola.  I liked the flavor but found the texture a bit too icy.  The last sample we didn't end up getting was McEvoy's olive oil.  We tried this after we ordered and had a moment of regret.  It tasted like high quality olive oil, light and fragrant with a taste that was almost flowery.  Next time.

We were more than happy with the flavors we ended up getting.  Never in my life have I had bourbon and cornflakes for breakfast, but maybe I should start.  The Secret Breakfast was one of the best scoops of ice cream I have ever had.  The ice cream really tasted like bourbon, but the strength of the alcohol was moderated by the sweetness of the cream and cornflakes.  The texture was lush and creamy - if I could take my alcohol in this form all the time, I would be a fat drunk.  Young's double chocolate stout was another great alcohol-based flavor.  It was heartier and a little sweeter, and the flavor really developed in my mouth.  Next to the Secret Breakfast, though, my favorite flavor was the brown butter.  This ice cream captured the nutty, savory sweetness you get from that aromatic smoky pan sauce.  Good grief is it good.  The only flavor of our four that I could't die for was the Vietnamese Blue Bottle coffee, which I expected to blow me away based on reviews.  Maybe we got a bad batch, because ours was a little icy.  I did like the taste, though, which was grittily coffee, with grounds and all.

The day after our visit to Humphry Slocombe, Justin and I found ourselves in Blue Bottle Coffee.  There, we could not resist an affogato made with Humphry Slocombe's Secret Breakfast.  I had that amazing ice cream two days in a row and have not licked it since.  If you see me replacing milk with bourbon for my cereal, you can try to intervene, but the only cure will be another trip north.
author: Steph C.

description: I have loved their flavors since they opened. I am more of a savory girl and adore anything they do with peanut butter (curry or Elvis) and the sorbets!!! They are amazing! It's like Willy Wonka- where every flavor is just so clear and straightforward. They did an incredible and easy kickstarter/ give us $100, and we will give you a $150 giftcard. Even better- it's on Passbook, so it's super easy to use!!! I have treated myself to loads of yummy pints and will definitely get another when this one is used up-- I only have 2 pint left!!!! Good luck at the Ferry Terminal!!! You are going to kill it!!!
author: Alisha A.

description:
Humphrey Slocombe is it. Instead of lengthy and unnecessary prose, I'm just going to list what flavors are ridiculously good.

-Secret Breakfast (Bourbon and cornflakes)
-Vietnamese coffee (and I usually don't like coffee ice cream)
-Tahitian Vanilla (best vanilla ice cream I've ever tasted)
-Coconut Sorbet
-Roasted White Chocolate Lavender
-Malted Milk Chocolate (incredible)
-Smoked chocolate sea salt (very rich, delicious)
-Jesus Juice (Wine & Coke)
-Balsamic Caramel (quite vinegary--not for the faint of heart)

The staff is friendly and willing to let you try more than a few flavors--which you will undoubtedly want to do.

Best part is, prices are not outrageous! Humphrey Slocombe, will you marry me??
author: Sara D.

description:
Went here a few weeks ago...

They have discovered that ice cream can be different, and its amazing. I had the potato chip and chocolate ice cream...soo good, sweet and salty.  My 4 year old son had the Ancho Chile Chocolate, he loved it...and my girl doesn't remember hers.

But it was all delicious.
author: Adam L.

description: Omg! Seriously so fresh tasting it was like the cow got milked that day to make the ice cream. Perfect texture. Cinnamon brittle, Fluffer Nutter peanut butter, root beer & special breakfast. Line wasn't that long. I adore this place. Cinnamon Brittle was my fav!
author: Jessabelle R.

description:
Hubert Humphrey's Ice Cream is an exercise in typical Bay Area sensibilities : the more strange , the better .

I was in Oakland recently scouting areas for the shooting of my next movie , " The King of El Rey " , when a homeless fellow told me about this ice cream shoppe in S.F. was serving beer-flavoured ice cream . Naturally , my almond-side got the best of me ; so , I caught the next B.A.R.T. train and headed to "The City Built on Rock and Roll" .

When my tongue spanked the beer-flavoured ice cream , I was instantly taken back to my days of Jacuzzi's and women of questionable integrity ; I was dismastered !

Of course , I couldn't help but think : ' I hope this isn't served to children , as this will cause them to search out beer and liquor when they're in their early teens ... '

As a cigarette smoker , and therefor an unwelcome demon in the Summer-of-Love City , I must admit that this readily-available beer ice cream is a bit frightful !

Never-the-less , Hoover Vacuum's Ice Cream Parlour is delightfully decadent .
Now , where can I get me a pack of unfiltred Kool cigs ?
author: Arthur F.

description:
After chauffeuring my brother around the city, he said he'd get me some ice cream. Lately I've been sad with the LACK of flavor in the ice cream at the spot that starts w a M, so b/c we're both yelpers and neither of us has been to Humphry Slocombe, we found ourselves here on a Wednesday afternoon.

NO LINE? WHAAAAAT?  There were people sitting outside enjoying their ice cream but apparently we came at a very good time. We sampled nearly everything before making our choices. He ended up with the Secret Breakfast. Good but too much bourbon flavor to me, it's good if you like that stuff, not really my thang. I did like the corn flakes though. I got the Blue Bottle, I already knew I was going to get that when he said to drive in the direction of Humphry Slocombe. It was good and I'm normally not one for coffee ice cream. The baby got the carrot mango sorbet, b/c really what would she have gotten? Everything else was a little too extreme for her simple palette. You could easily taste both the carrot and the mango. And my taste buds actually tasted the carrot first and finished with the mango, easily a good palette cleanser IMHO.

I can imagine super long lines and super waits on the weekends. I'll stick to midday jaunts during the week.
author: Dina V.

description: Humphry Sloccombe does have a lot of interesting, innovative, and unique flavors. My only gripe with them is that the texture of the ice cream is more icy than creamy.
author: Christina T.

description:
i know it's lame to go to humphry's and not try their amazingly bizarre flavors (though peanut butter curry was surprisingly good), but seriously, my favorite is their BLUE BOTTLE VIETNAMESE COFFEE. it's not super sweet and the texture of the ice cream is just phenomenal. i highly recommend it.

i cannot wait until they open up a place at the ferry building!
author: Julia H.

description:
So, I will give this place props for their creative ice cream and witty monikers -but that is IT. Maybe Humphry Slocombe is an acquired taste, but I compare it to those Harry Potter jelly beans that were popular way back when (flavors like ear wax, pepper, vomit, etc). It has a interesting gimmick, but boy does it taste like crap! 

Won't be back anytime soon. Not my cup of tea.
author: Victoria B.

description:
Exceptionally interesting flavors infused in their ice cream.  I've tried seven different scoops now and only Salt n Peppa wasn't delicious.  

The people behind the counter are surprisingly cheerful despite serving so *many* customers who don't know what they want.  Want a taste? No problem!  

I wish the folks waiting in line could give us folks in line a better idea of their options before getting to the counter.  And speaking of that, I wish people would respect the neighborhood and give a little room on the sidewalk.  Ok, the soapbox has been put away.
author: Mike H.

description:
Lovin these ice cream shops with the most random flavors!

Being in over 800 reviews out of Humphry Slocombe's 1500 or so reviews, I just had to try the Secret Breakfast. Liked it! Tasted like vanilla with rum and mixed in cornflakes, though I wish there were more cornflakes. $3.75 for two scoops, so my second choice was the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee flavor which tasted like, uh, Vietnamese Coffee. Nothing special, but still good b/c 1.) I love coffee and 2.) I'm Vietnamese.

My friends had Jasmine Tea and Milk & Honey. Jasmine Tea was OK and Milk & Honey tasted pretty plain, IMO comparable to Cold Stone's Sweet Cream, but a little less creamy?

I would come back to try the other flavors that sounded interesting to me, but I think overall Bi-Rite Creamery wins for their vast selection in the weird-flavors department.
author: Jacqueline V.

description:
This place definitely gives Bi-Rite a run for its money.  Their flavor combinations are wacky, interesting, good.  

White Miso Pear - My favorite!  Refreshing sweetness of pear with subtle hint of savory miso. 
Secret Breakfast - Tasty with a strong hint of bourbon with the crunch of cornflakes.  Great for alcoholics.
Vietnamese Blue Bottle Coffee - Must-try for coffee lovers. 
Tahitian Vanilla - Unlike any vanilla ice cream I've ever had...in a good way. 

So excited to try more flavors next time!  Maybe when its not freezing outside. ;)
author: Connie C.

description: Fabulous ice cream with very interesting flavors. Try secret breakfast: bourbon with corn flakes. The line out the door shouldn't deter you.
author: Peter S.

description: JESUS JUICE!! Enough said.
author: Vanessa K.

description:
I had the Gabba Gabba Hey sundae, which is balsamic caramel ice cream, cherries, and whipped cream on top of a brownie. I'm a big caramel fan, and the caramel+balsamic combo sounded interesting, which is why I went with it. And the sundae *was* interesting, so I'm glad I tried it. That said, it was a bit too rich for me, and I'd probably not have that specific item again.

Despite the mixed experience I had with that particular sundae, I could tell that it's really flavorful, well-textured ice cream, so I'm excited to come back here to try other things.
author: Greg P.

description:
I wish I lived closer, but then I would be fat

Secret breakfast of course blows minds with its unique and comforting burst of familar flavor.

and blue bottle vietamese coffee, was how coffee icecream should taste and all others cannot match... heaven for a coffee junkie like me.

Balsamic caramel, was not my favorite but worth the try.
tahitian vanilla, not your typical vanilla. super tasty 

next time I need to taste either the Foie gras or the hot toddy sundae, but most likely both if I can mmmmm :)
author: Breezy M.

description:
After listening to my supervisor school me in good SF eats, I knew I had to try Humphrey Slocombe. I'm more of a Mitchell's/Bi-Rite person now, so I thought I'd give HS a try and see how it sized up in comparison.

A big bonus is that they are generous with their portions. For about 3-something, you get two scoops of ice cream. As for the flavors...I think I still prefer going to Bi-Rite or even Ici in Berkeley. I'd definitely come back if I were ever in the neighborhood.
author: Patricia Q.

description:
I've decided that all these places with long lines set you up with unrealistic expectations.  Sad but true.  I've been wanting to try Humphry Slocombe for some time now after hearing many people rave about it.  Finally made it here on a warm and unexpected Saturday afternoon.

Sampled the Blue Bottle Vietnamese coffee and the black sesame ice creams and ultimately got a cone with the black sesame and a scoop of tahiti vanilla.  Nothing super special IMHO.  In fact a little too icy for my liking.  I'm a fan of smooth and creamy.

Also, I see that a friend of mine wrote a review for February--for a small place you would think they would rotate flavors more readily especially since they can make small batches...
author: Christopher W.

description:
So it's a rainy day in San Francisco but because we have some free time I decide to drag a few willing (and not so willing) medical students convincing them to take the shuttle from Parnassus to SFGH so we can walk to Humphry Slocombe because it's supposed to have amazing ice cream.  

The ice cream is good, but not worth the hype, not worth the shuttle trip, and not worth getting wet in the rain.  I would have been just as happy driving to Safeway or Target and grabbing a tub there.  

Secret Breakfast was nothing special in terms of flavor, I had something with marshmallows and peanut butter and didn't taste much marshmallows.  My friend described his ice cream as "normal" and the general consensus was "meh" and "why did you drag us here again?"

Bi-Rite is something I would actually line up for and go back for, even Polly Ann's ice cream is amazing (especially at Crepe Temptations when they put it on your crepes), but I doubt I'll be going back here unless I'm in the area and it's a ridiculously hot day in SF.
author: Erica G.

description: I am IN LOVE!!! Ice cream is excellent and the flavors are so unique! I got to visit when I was in town with my friend and I wish I could live next door so I could get endless scoops of this amazing dessert. You will forever be a part of my heart Humphry!
author: Adrienne C.

description:
Survey says.. THREE & A HALF STARS! 

Arrived here on a Saturday (foodie) afternoon, craving some ice cream on a gorgeous SF day.  Line wasn't too bad as we were only behind one person outside.  I'm a fan of the mini tasting spoons, and applaud them for trying to be as green as possible.  Flavors change regularly, so don't get too attached to just one. 

I sampled Jesus Juice sorbet [red wine and cola] - I mean, c'mon, with a name like that you just HAVE to try it.  It tasted exactly like a mixture of red wine and cola, like sin in frozen form.  It was good, but I don't know that I would've been able to handle a scoopful of it.  Hubby tried the Salt & Pepper, and not surprisingly, found it to bee too salty.  Ah well.  

Winning!  Rum raisin;  Blue Bottle Vietnamese coffee - words cannot describe.  So far the best coffee ice cream I've tasted to date. I could slurp it up in a heartbeat; and finally, the pièce de résistance: Secret Breakfast - bourbon and cornflakes.  Um, yeah.  It was crazy good.  And yes, you can definitely taste that bourbon.  Whoo! 

All in all, a yummy ol' time, and I look forward to trying their latest creations.
author: Shereen R.

description:
I really like all the ingenious flavors and the variety of decorations that frame the place.  

They had:
-Blueberry Nectarine Yogurt
-Thai Chili Lime
-Spicy Chocolate
-Jesus Juice
-Secret Breakfast
-Fudgsicle
-Cinnamon Brittle
-Balsamic Caramel
-Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee (ran out by the time i got there)

But I was a bit disappointed with the ice cream (maybe it was because of all the hype). The texture of ice cream quite good (smooth, melts in your mouth) but I had about 4 bites and dismissed the rest. The balsamic caramel was okay, but the cinnamon brittle, blueberry nectarine, and fudgsicle were overly sweet. 

In my opinion, bi-rite creamery is much better.
author: Caroline C.

description:
Oh devil's food cake - how do I love thee? Your luscious cream cheese base with bits of red velvet cake... I pine for you. 

I can come late on a weeknight since the line doesn't seem as long then. 

Until our next meeting, dear devil's food cake - please stay on humphry slocombe's repertoire.
author: Karen K.

description:
Came here after dinner to try the ice cream.  I've been to BiRite so I was curious what they offered here and how they compared.  I had the Peanut Butter Curry flavor and suffice to say...it was definitely different.  I wanted to try the Ancho Chocolate but since it was late in the night and near closing, it was out along with a few other flavors.  I didn't feel like getting the Jesus Juice(red wine and cola) or the Secret Breakfast. Only one bathroom for all the traffic that comes through?  Yikes...hopefully I won't need to go next time I drop by...

I'll gladly come to revisit though it'll be earlier in the day when they have their full inventory in stock...
author: Ben H L.

description: Yum! I got the secret breakfast (with bourbon flakes) and the strawberry margarita sorbet. Both were sooooo good! I want to try more flavors!
author: Sheeva G.

description:
After recently becoming a fan of Blue Bottle's coffee, I was surprised to hear there was an ice cream joint in town that used their coffee for their Blue Bottle Vietnamese ice cream. it's just like having the coffee only tastier and more refreshing. The hubby and I went to try it last month and BOY were we PLEASANTLY surprised! The coffee flavor in it is so rich and you can see the little specks of grounded coffee still in it. THIS is what real coffee ice cream should be about! The staff is nice and lets you take your time with sampling. Plus their organic so what's not to love?!

Note: You might want to come early as parking sucks in this area!
author: Petra S.

description: Our mission to discover the actual "secret" behind the Secret Breakfast ice cream was accomplished. A scoop of the bourbon and cornflake infused confection, combined with a scoop of Blue Bottle Vietnamese coffee made for the perfect "meal" in a cup or cone. They're not at all stingy with the amount of alkie in this ice cream. Another helping of it would have had me on a good buzz. Woo!!! This place by far has the most interesting flavor menu. It's a must that I stop by again and sample as many of them as I can, seeing that they rotate them often and feature between 10-20 flavors a day. Yowzah! Challenge accepted. Thank goodness I'm not lactose intolerant.
author: Rhia R.

description:
Frickin' ridiculous. Who puts that much granddaddy bourbon in some ice cream? That's insane - insanely delicious, that is. With corn flakes, that's a "Secret Breakfast"? Don't tell anybody, but WoW! Better than either any bourbon or ice cream I've ever tasted. Yum! Wonderful. Then I had the audacity of pairing that with Rum Raisin. How can creamy be so potent. 
Tasted Jesus Juice flavor. Not my fave but I liked trying it out. As a house music fan, I could appreciate the "Boom-chagga-boom-boom" soundtrack in the back though I prefer Mozart or some Anita Baker with my double scoops, but that's probably personal, huh? 
Next time I'm back I'm bringing an insulated bag to bring it back with me. Also I will not be denied the prosciutto ice cream experience I saw on Travel Channel. Jeepers, that looked mouth watering. This is in Top 5 of my Top Ten best ice cream experiences EVER. Yeah!
author: Michael W.

description: Yum! Banana with red hots and malted dolce de leche, olive oil surprisingly good... Lemon Ginger very  nice!  Great, interesting ice cream well worth the line!
author: Alana D.

description:
On a recent trip to SF, this was the one place I had to visit. The ice cream was everything I expected, my kids loved it too. 

The staff was very friendly and I appreciated the time they spent telling us about the ice cream.

Not to be missed
author: Jeff K.

description:
I'm not sure how much it is at other places but 3 scoops for $5 seems PHENOMENAL to me.  The girl helping us was so patient as we tried 98% of the flavors available.  

We ended up getting (1) black sesame (2) Oolong Tea (3) Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee.

First, the black sesame:  interesting. Very interesting.  We got it cause my friend liked it but it was straight up like eating sesame oil... in a creamy icy form.

Second, the Oolong was hands down the BEST.  So light, so fresh, so PERFECT.

Third, can never go wrong w/ coffee.  Never.  Except sometimes.  But mostly never.  

The consistency of the ice cream is SOOO good.  I honestly prefer fro-yo to ice cream but this place is so light, not icy & also not too creamy.  It's really just heavenly.
author: Christine B.

description: So I have been wanting to try this spot for a while now. This was last on my list of ice cream shops in the city. Bi-rite being my fav by far, this place had a lot to live up to, and cannot say that it did it for me. Although secret breakfast (bourbon and cornflakes) is interesting and the blue bottle coffee has a good taste to it I was left with a very weird taste in my mouth when I was done. It was buttery, creamy, but not very delightful. I felt like I needed to drink a gallon of water to dilute it. The ice cream is alright but a little rich for my taste, the line was redic, and I guess I will just have to stay with bi-rite!
author: Michelle I.

description: I have only one complaint about Humphrey Slocombe Ice Cream.  They don't make "Afternoon School Special" nearly enough.  It is unbelievably good.  My other favorites are Harvey Milk & Secret Breakfast and anything they make with blueberries and strawberries while they are in season.
author: Lisa M.

description:
Over. Rated.

Sorry, but I did try to love it - as a foodie, I wanted to appreciate Jake's unique flavors and flavor combos, but in the end.... I actually tossed several cups of ice cream simply because I found them to be inedible. Too much focus on using bizarre ingredients and not enough on creating a delicious ice cream. Recipes for their standard flavors change from one visit to the next  (take "Secret Breakfast" for example: one visit it was BOURBON, OMG SO MUCH BOURBON, I NEED A CHASER, the next it was more like "Secret Elmer's Glue"). Then there's the staff, so hip and cool because they work at HUMPHRY SLOCOMBE that they can take as long as they want before they wait on you, or randomly decide they will not sell you any pints because they're "running out of ice cream." (direct quote)  

if I'm going to wait on a long line for out of this world ice cream, it will always be Bi-Rite Creamery with their friendly, fast service and consistently delicious ice cream, none of which contain mushrooms, harissa or deli meats.
author: Ed K.

description: It's too expensive for small served ice cream and pog flavors don't mesh well while tasting bland. The flavors are limited and not that good.
author: M A.

description:
Love this place! I walked two miles to get here and it was worth every pain in my foot. 

I got the secret breakfast and one scoop is just enough. You don't want to overdue it, just be able to savor it and enjoy each bite/lick is what the flavor is for. 

I got there before the line started to grow out the door, too! It was around 2PM on a Sunday, so I'm sure any other time is crazy or even crazier. 

I saw the dude with the ice cream tattoos! Is that humphrey? Anyway, a picture with him and his arm would have been awesome!
author: renn a.

description:
INT. HUMPHREY SLOCOMBE - 12:01 P.M.

After tasting Secret Breakfast and Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee, Natasha S. decides she can check off Secret Breakfast from her 7x7 list and that Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee is too strong for her palate.  She then picks 2 heaping scoops of McEvoy Olive Oil and Caramel Balsamic.

                                          NATASHA S's BRAIN:

              Good grief.  These scoops are way too big to finish!    

Natasha S. delicately spoons the first petite bite into her welcoming maw.

                                          NATASHA S's MOUTH:

              Oh my!  Lemony olive oil and slightly sour balsamic, 
              so thick and creamy.   Just one more bite.... maybe one
              more.... OK, maybe a few more ....

INT. HUMPHREY SLOCOMBE - 12:03 P.M.

SPOON-OLIVE OIL- CARAMEL BALSAMIC-ICE CREAM-BLUR.

INT. HUMPHREY SLOCOMBE - 12:04 P.M.

Natasha S. scrapes the last of the  olive oil and caramel balsamic ice cream from the bottom of her cup.  SHE goes back for more.
author: Natasha S.

description:
Headed over here after just reviewing Dynamo Donuts + Coffee - ugh what am i DOING to myself.  The whole "i'm on vacation" thing is a bit overplayed, but whatever.

Seriously, this ice cream is fantastic.  The texture is amazing, it's reasonably priced, and the flavors are created and really delicious.  I tasted the butter beer and would have gotten it, had the secret breakfast not gotten rave reviews from a friend.  So I got the secret breakfast, and proceed to rave now myself.  OM NOM NOM NOM.

Go here.  Even if it's out of your way.  Make the effort, your taste buds will thank you.  Your hips may not but...whatever, call it a vacation.
author: Sarah C.

description: Smoked Salt Chocolate and Fluffernutter. The chocolate was complex, paired with the subtlety of the marshmallow peanut butter, It was phenomenal. The wait was long, but worth it. Don't be intimidated by the unique flavors, just accept it and give it a try, you will not be disappointed.
author: Shannon H.

description:
Pistachio Brittle - OMG!

I love the taste of the Special Breakfast too but the texture isn't very firm, I'm assuming from the alcohol content.  Personally, I like a firmer texture.
author: C S.

description: Best ice cream in San Francisco, most innovative flavors in north america.
author: Mike D.

description: Awesome! Try the Oolong and Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee favors.
author: JayJay L.

description:
I had the brown buttah and my main squeeze had the secret breakfast. They were both delicious. It was a hot day in the city and there was a line out the door but we didn't mind it just because we knew the juice was worth the squeeze. :D

Brown buttah is heavenly. Fluffy, creamy and just downright perfect.
Secret Breakfast is for those who love bourbon! WE loved it!! It tasted like we were taking shots of bourbon but not really, but really. Strange but you have to at least try it once. It's a unique experience.

If you are in the Mission District, you MUST make this a priority stop.
author: Nikki C.

description: This is one of the places when you leave, you can't wait to yelp it (sometimes that's a bad thing).  Humphry's in my opinion is better than Mitchell's and way better than Bi-Rite with the advantage of not having to wait in a humungous line.  You know how you want to sample different flavors at an ice cream shop and the worker gives you the stink eye when you keep sampling?  They don't do that here.  I asked for their most popular and he gladly gave me a sample of the Secret Breakfast and then gave me a sample of the Blue Bottle Viet Coffee without me asking.  Both were so FN' good.
author: Alex G.

description:
This place gets 5 stars for it's awesome flavors, great tasting ice cream, and friendly people.

Between my own order and my friend's orders, I was able to taste most of the flavors they were offering.  The "butterbeer" (Sierra Nevada stout with butter) was my favorite.  I haven't been been to Orlando to taste Harry Potter's butterbeer yet, but I imagine it tastes just like this.  It's like butterscotch candy meets ice cold beer.  You have to try it!  The second flavor I chose was "secret breakfast" (Bourbon and cornflakes) and it was also amazing!  Other flavors that day included malted milk chocolate, Guinness gingerbread, and balsamic caramel.  My friend got "Jesus Juice" which was red wine and soda.  It tasted like a frozen sangria!

They only offer a dozen or so flavors a day, and i can't wait to go back to see what else they have come up with.  And completely unrelated to ice cream, but equally cool, their register is an iPad that has a small credit card reader where you usually attach headphones.  I signed my bill with my finger right on the iPad.  A gadget freak like me was super amused and impressed by this!
author: Melisa C.

description:
Two words: secret breakfast.  (or four words for those needing a description: bourbon and corn flakes).  

They had friendly staff, adventurous flavors and were everything I hoped for since hearing about them on the Food Network.
author: Pavel L.

description: Secret breakfast and vietnamese coffee makes it so worth it to come here. I'm not a local and parking is not easy to find, but STILL GO!
author: Anthony V.

description:
I've been wanting to try this place for a couple of years and finally got down there last Saturday.  I must say that it was worth the wait! Scary neighborhood, though, so be careful!

Luckily we got there in between masses of crowds so the guy on the register was able to take a few minutes to let me taste items.  The fluffernutter was right up my alley, as were a few other flavors but it was the salted chocolate ice cream that did me in.   I'm hooked on salted chocolate anyhow but didn't realize anyone was making ice cream out of it.  Let me say WOW!  My husband ordered the coffee ice cream and we sort of mixed the two.  I don't even like coffee and it was good!  But my salted chocolate left me coated in happiness for a few hours afterward.  The lady in front of me brought a cooler filled with ice so she could bring home a bunch of pints.  I think she was pretty damn smart.  I wish I had done the same.
author: Marie N.

description:
That afternoon, after a nice long girly brunch at nearby Foreign Cinema I was feeling pretty adventurous and was looking forward to trying something else other than the default Secret Breakfast, Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee or Brown Butter at Humphry Slocombe.  

Their listing of flavors - http://www.humphryslocombe.com/%7C_Flavors_%7C.html - have certainly piqued my interest.  In particular, I was excited to try strawberry candied jalapeno, or McEvoy olive oil (no foie gras for me; the only dessert made of foie gras that I've ever had - one from Momofuku Ko - has set the bar way too high for any other foie gras-themed dessert to even come close).  

Sadly, neither flavors were available then.  

I was toying with the idea of trying the black sesame, but unfortunately it looked nothing like Passionflower's (http://www.passionflower.com.au)  black sesame ice-cream that I grew up on, and I have the biggest color prejudice when it comes to food and would not touch any food whose color is not agreeable (from my perspective).  

So I had to settle with the old favorite, Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee... with just the right amount of sweetness which doesn't overpower the coffee flavor, I'm starting to convince myself that I prefer this over everyone's favorite Secret Breakfast.  

But one thing that I just wanna put out there, WHY WOULD THEY HAVE A WALL ART FEATURING CAMPBELL'S "FETAL KITTEN" SOUP CAN? 

Discuss.
author: Ange L.

description:
I had the Brown Sugar & Fennel and can say that I thought it was very very good. Sweet with a slight herby flavor that made it very interesting and delicious. My sweetie's Cinnamon Brittle was not so much what we like in ice cream but I'm sure some people love it. I thought the other flavors sounded interesting though; Secret Breakfast, Thompson Grape Sorbet, and Tahitian Vanilla were possibilities. 

I had heard about this place for months, about the unusual flavors and the line out the door. Yesterday while waiting for my car to be detailed in the Mission and after a late breakfast, we found ourselves a couple blocks away and decided to wait in the relatively short line (thanks to a foggy overcast day) to see what all the fuss was about. 

I would go back if I was in the neighborhood again, but have Bi-Rite and Mitchell's and Blissful Bites on my list of ice cream places to try next.
author: Kira B.

description:
i cannot decide which i like better, humphry or bi rite

i had the secret breakfast and the marshmellow thingy, the fluffelnelor? i think thats how spell it

i would say, you cant go wrong with either bi rite or this place, its simply amazing! 

however, this place is better than bi rite in the fact that for the same price you get a bigger cup of ice cream..more bang for your buck, and your wait time
author: Long C.

description: I had a tasting of Secret Breakfast, loved the cornflakes, but the flavor was too strong for my liking. I also tasted the lavender thyme which for me didn't really work. I settled on Blue Bottle Vietnamese coffee and it was amazingly delicious. I love Vietnamese coffee, so this was perfect. It wasn't too strong at all, and this could easily knock out a coffee and ice cream craving with one ball.
author: Cindy T.

description:
Oh, I wish Humphry Slocombe would do mail order.  Even in America's Dairyland, I have yet to find anything like the Secret Breakfast!  The previous reviewer described it perfectly.......f'n awesome!  Aside from the Secret Breakfast, everything else I've tried has been excellent.  I never imagined that I'd enjoy salt and pepper ice cream as much as I did.  

Yes, I did have to wait at least 20 minutes for every visit I made, and I made many (had a 5-day streak going).  In my view, the $3.75 they charge for a "small" (actually two good sized scoops) is a bargain for the quality of the product.  Hell, I'd pay $20 for a small serving of the Secret Breakfast at this very moment.
author: Mark Y.

description:
I wanted to do something special for Calvin for his birthday that allowed him to celebrate with his coworkers and since i couldn't invite all 50-something people to dinner, I decided to throw him a ice cream party with ice cream from his favorite place, Humphry Slocombe. So I emailed HS and started working with Sean, who was AMAZING and helped me plan the perrrrrrrrfect party! He helped me pick the flavors and even teamed up with Jake to work out some toppings to go along with each flavor. 

I went with: 

~ Secret Breakfast with bourbon caramel sauce
~ Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee (Calvin's favorite) with frosted almonds and whipped cream
~ Fudgesicle with housemade fluff (marshmallow fluff!!!)

Each flavor and topping combo was a big hit!! I've never seen so many grown ass folks so excited over ice cream! Calvin was happy, as well as his coworkers. The ice cream went fast and it was great timing since that day was one of those super hot days in August. 

Oh and when I say I've never seen so many grown ass folks so excited over ice cream, I meant it... UNTIL.... we had a similar party for our CMs during CM week at HQ. We had even more flavors and even more toppings. Worked with Sean again and just like before, he was amazing. 

Thank you Sean and everyone at HS for helping me to make a memorable birthday party for my boyfriend and an awesome party for all of our hardworking CMs!!! 

If you are looking for a unique party idea, come to HS and get Sean to help you plan an awesome ice cream party that is sure to be a crowd pleaser!!
author: Jen D.

description: Great ice cream. I had the secret breakfast and wife had the blue bottle Vietnamese ice cream, both were excellent. Had to wait in line but it went fast and was worth it. Staff was friendly.
author: Brian J.

description:
I have yet to try the secret breakfast, but when I do I'll be sure to re-yelp.

I'm not too impressed with the flavors because everything I tried was out of my comfort zone so I ended up getting Malted Vanilla. I tried the Chili LIme and it felt like someone kicked me in the mouth. It seriously tasted like someone froze thai food, added some sugar and blended it together.  It was sour +spicy +sweet, too weird for me, but I do like how it's just walking distance from my house so I don't have to deal with parking. I still like Bi-Rite more, sorry!
author: Nancy Y.

description:
Well I read the nytimes article about a place that has prosciutto ice cream and I had to give it a try.

http://www.nytimes.com/2010/07/04/magazine/04icecream-t.html

Unfortunately no prosciutto when I was there, but I went for a double scoop cone with olive oil ice cream and secret breakfast (bourbon and cornflakes).  The secret breakfast was thoroughly enjoyable, but I didn't care for the olive oil as much.  But hell, I give em props for trying all this stuff, I'll be back.

What I didn't like is the goddamned tight jeans idiots in front of me sampling 9 god damn flavors before ordering.  I guess it's just the east coast in me, but I say "order your friggin $3 ice cream cone, and if you don't like it, too fucking bad".

But I guess the sampling is part of the allure.

And this is California after all.
author: Rocco B.

description:
There was a line out the door, but of course when it's my turn, I have to be 'that' guy and get a taste of three different things (they were all good).  Pumpkin curry= tasty -but ended up with Bourbon and cornflake ice cream topped with a scoop Red wine and Coke Classic!  Talk about mixing your alcohols.  Fantastic!    
The service was good and quick. 
They have nice out-door seating.  It's on a stretch of 24th that includes other goodies/shops and is lined with trees.

It's pretty much five stars.   But, the decor and space is really vanilla, ha!  They have great and interesting flavors, but not the biggest selection.  -And it has intense competition with Bi-rite and Mitchels, etc.

This place is a must for a treat.
author: Jake H.

description:
I finally made it to Humphry Slocombe and boy am I glad I did!

Ordered the Gabba Gabba Hey, but was told they were out of Balsamic Caramel.  Substituted the Wexler Root Beer, and watched as my sundae was prepared.  It looked like any ordinary sundae, but certainly did not taste ordinary.  The flavors of the sundae all came together perfectly, the root beer ice cream, the whip cream, the amarena cherries, the fudge brownie, the cherry sauce... yummy!

I sampled the 8 flavors of ice cream they had left (yes, I know, I don't need that much ice cream), and the secret breakfast and blue bottle vietnamesse coffee were both good.  Can't wait to return, even with the long lines.
author: David D.

description:
Yes, Secret Breakfast is good.

They have interesting flavors that you can't get anywhere else.

Novelty points 5 stars.

Some, like Salt & Pepper, are just plain awful.

So if it doesn't taste good, what's good about it?
author: Shiba I.

description:
Whoa, what?  Salt and pepper, peanut butter and curry, and beer are the flavors of the day?  And a LARGE is only $5 (sorry, I come from overpriced Boston).  Um, and then I learn that this place is super-famous and recommended by everyone from the Food Network to Lonely Planet?  And it's practically on my block?  

New. favorite.  ever.
author: Jillian Y.

description:
Came here after Giants Fan Fest this weekend to try out the beer ice creams for SF beer week.  When we got here the line was out the door but we waited under 10 minutes to get our ice cream.  Even with the crowd, the staff was very patient and willing to give us samples of whatever flavors we wanted to try before ordering.  We all got smalls so that we could try 2 flavors each.  We had:

Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee - probably the best flavor we tried.  Pretty strong coffee flavor.
Smoke Stack  - not a bad beer ice cream.  it was sweet and a little chocolaty. probably the best beer ice cream that we had.  
Blood Orange Sorbet - this wasn't bad but wasn't great.  wasn't too flavorful and was a little too icy for me.  
Secret Breakfast - this was pretty interesting, bourbon and corn flakes.  pretty sweet and you can definitely taste the bourbon. 
Pomegranate Ale - another beer ice cream that was less beery and had a slight tart/sweet taste of pomegranate
Winter Ale - this tasted a lot like winter, almost a pumpkin pie sort of flavor.  seemed like there was a lot of cinnamon or something in it.  

Overall, Humphry Slocombe Ice Cream was some good ice cream paired with good service.  The beer ice cream was really interesting to try but I'm not sure if I'd order them over a regular flavor, especially the Blue Bottle Vietnamese coffee.
author: steve w.

description:
Do you LOVE **DELICIOUS** ice cream? Does the sound of bourbon and cornflakes turn you on? What about Jesus Juice (Coke and Red Wine) a la Michael Jackson? If so, then head over to Humphry Slocombe. 

This place is good. REAL good. In the past month, I've been 4 times...and I definitely think the flavors are more colorful and interesting that Bi-Rite or Three Twins.

Secret Breakfast, Jesus Juice, and Vietnamese Coffee are alllllll awesome.

I've been lucky and have come at opportune times when the line has not been out the door and down the block. 

Love their iPad payment technique too!
author: Misha F.

description: Shh the secret in Secret Breakfast is that it's made out of cheap GMO non-organic cornflakes! I expect more from a $4 scoop of ice cream at the Ferry Building or in San Francisco in general!
author: Joy C.

description:
I was ready to hate this place! I'd heard of all the quirky flavors and had already decided that it wasn't for me. Flower flavored ice cream, cheese flavor, olive oil flavor; just who the hell does this Mr. Slocombe think he is?

I'm a Mitchell's man to the core but I figured it was time to see what all the fuss was about. I stood in line and waited while each person in the group in front of me tried every flavor before making a choice. One of them turned to the crowd of people waiting in line because of their lack of consideration and announced " everyone has to try the honey thyme". In my best Rain Man voice I said "honey's made from bee vomit". She looked at me for a second, then grabbed her ice cream and got the hell out of the way.

It was finally my turn so I tried the secret breakfast. It was good but not really what I'm looking for in an ice cream. I settleded on the caramel flavor, I think they call it Dulce De Leche, and Oh man was it amazing!

I haven't been back because it's summer and I usually crave ice cream on cold days but as soon as the temperature starts going down I'll be back in line bewildering over enthusiastic patrons.
author: Manny F.

description:
After a food filled weekend in San Francisco, my boyfriend and I decided to make one more stop before heading to the airport to catch our flight home.  Having passed Humphry Slocombe the day before, we decided to go back after some friends told us it was a huge mistake that we had passed the ice cream up the first time.

Known for their unusual flavors, Humphry Slocombe is definitely not for everyone, although the line outside might indicate otherwise.  After trying almost every flavor in the case, I decided on the Secret Breakfast (bourbon ice cream with cornflakes) and the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee ice cream.  Both were incredible, full of flavor and super creamy.  My boyfriend decided to try the Chocolate Smoked Sea Salt, which was amazing even though I thought it sounded odd.  

HS was definitely a perfect ending to an amazing weekend in the great city of SF.
author: Jen C.

description: Came here because I was in the neighbourhood I had heard about this place through the Food Network on "best thing i ever ate" I really wanted to get their prosciutto ice cream but they didn;t have it when I went but that had some very inventive and interesting sounding ice cream flavours. I got 2 scoops for 3.25. 1 scoop of Jesus Juice(soo good tasted like a sweet red wine) and Secret Breakfast (bourbon vanilla ice cream with flakes). I ended up sitting outside savouring my ice cream. I swear I'm in love with definately go back and bring my friends.
author: ariel d.

description: So eclectic and crazy fun flavors..had Ginger Lemon Grass which will transport you to Bali in your head and taste buds...Also the Salted Chocolate some thing something off the hook!!! If I did not live in Napa...I would be going to HS rehab...it is addictive. ..Jesus Juice superb. ..and the Breakfast one is delicious. .heck ..they are all so dang good!!!! And made fresh daily. Opened a new location Ferry Bldg. Yeah hoo hooo please DO NOT OPEN ONE IN NAPA... lol
author: Rhonda U.

description:
Their ice cream is...ok.  A little *too* inventive maybe?  I had the peanut butter curry, which was unusual, but it's not something I would ever have again.

Give me less crazy flavor pairings, and more solid ice cream fundamentals, like cream content vs sugar content.  Bi-rite still wins my vote.
author: Cat L.

description:
Well, I guess this was my weekend for trying the epic Ice Cream joints.  After just having had Scoops in LA, boom, I'm lucky to have had the opportunity to try Humphry Slocombe and Bi-Rite in SF.  Slocombe's innovation and quality of taste were simply awesome.  I loved this place.  Wait was insane, but it was made better with a great company of people.  Fun to people watch and pet everyone's dogs.    

Sampled Tahitian vanilla, Secret Breakfast (bourbon and cornflakes), Balsamic Caramel, Banana Pecan, and finally settled on Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee in a sugar cone.  Just how I loved Brown Bread the instant we met, I was infatuated with Blue Bottle from first bite.  Perhaps it was because it reminds me of where I live (close to Little Saigon), or perhaps it was because of the creamy texture and the sweet bite of coffee, but I really liked that flavor.  More or less the classic story of a hook-up, we met at a bar (ice cream bar here), and I wanted to take it home.  Great spot.
author: Kevin F.

description:
Being the glutton that I am, I ordered a large consisting of Thai chili lime sorbet, hibiscus beet sorbet, and Blue Bottle Vietnamese coffee ice cream. I requested a sugar cone but was denied... only because it was way too much ice cream to put on a cone. Instead the server put my ice cream in a bowl with the sugar cone on the side. I guess she didn't want me to drip ice cream all over my smart sweater vest.

My uncle, who was pretending not to be a glutton, only ordered two scoops in a cup... but it was not enough for him. He got back in line and ordered two more scoops on a cone. Next time, just order the large!

Sadly, the prosciutto ice cream was not offered that day.
author: Herman B.

description: Love love love their flavor choices. I also love that they didn't give me a funny face when i tried all of their flavors! I got secret breakfast of course, and my boyfriend had rhubarb. Both were superb! I wish I lived in the city so I could take a pint of their ice cream home!
author: Samantha D.

description:
I love their Secret Breakfast! 
Cornflakes and Bourbon was introduced to me by one have my favorite friends. My mom always dressed my ice cream up with cornflakes and nuts as a kid so I was loving their Secret Breakfast favor. 
They serve untraditional flavors of ice cream but I must say they each flavor was delish. 
I think I also tried something like balsamic vinegar and peper and it was more pleasant than it sounded. I only wish they were located closer to me neck of the woods.
author: Lynn T.

description:
Driving up to Humphry Slocombe and getting that first glimpse of its epic line was definitely a buzz kill. I immediately wanted to bail. My friends talked me out of it, though, and we schlepped over to the end of the line. 

It was a blessing that we stuck it out because if I had left I wouldn't have tasted the amazingness that is Secret Breakfast. I'm going to let you in on the secret...it's bourbon and corn flakes! I'd love to wake up every morning to that but unfortunately I'd have to wait in that line. 

Yes, there's a wait and yes they run out of flavors. My advice, get there early if you want the full selection and if you can't stand to wait in lines, bring some entertainment. It's worth the wait, I promise!
author: Julia N.

description:
I had an awful day, needed some ice cream desperately, and the mama-san told me we should try this place she saw in The New York Times.  What she didn't tell me (because she wasn't aware) was that this place has a line.  A big.  Long.  Line.

We waited for an hour, being goofy and watching as people drove by with that "NO FRICKIN WAY" looks on their faces as they saw the line getting longer and longer.  I tried out Vietnamese Coffee and Chocolate Smoked Salt, both of which I loved separately and loved even more mixed together.  The staff was friendly, and the guy helping me choose flavors was amazingly patient (I'm sure with a line like that, they are scooping and serving non-stop for a while).

Minus one star because, dear god, I can't stand the decoration they had (if you go, you'll understand what I mean, hint: it has four eyes).  It just creeped me out.  But I willing to get the heeby-jeebies again if I can try their Black Sesame-Green Tea flavor, because that sounds delicious!
author: Addi M.

description:
I've been dying to try this ice cream place after learning of all the creative, interesting flavors.  Finally did on a Tues night, parking was a breeze, there were stools to sit on, got to try ALL the 12 flavors of the day!! No one was behind us in line so why not?? 

The Secret Breakfast - Creamy, milky vanilla flavor with cornflakes and bourbon.  Yes, you can definitely taste the bourbon but it's not overpowering.  If you go here, this is the ONE flavor you will have to sample. Very Unique! 

The Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee was great!  Extreme coffee flavor.

Brown Butta -  YUM! Sounds weird but very addicting.  Can't quite explain the taste.  No, it doesn't feel like you're eating butter.

Limoncello Sorbet - Light, sweet and tart.  Great palette cleanser after a heavy dinner. 

Jesus Juice - Not so crazy about.  Red wine & coca cola.  Not so good a mix for me.

We'll definitely be back to try the rest of the gazillions of flavors..They only have 12 a day.  You can look on FB or Twitter to see which ones they have.  Kudos for being innovative and mixing very different ingredients to create AMAZING flavors.  Also love the flavor names, peaks my curious mind even more...
author: Danielle P.

description: If you want different, come here. They always have the interesting favors. Always very helpful and patient. Generous with samples. I've always come at the right time, no waiting. :) My favorite is the Harvey milk one, which is seasonal. I also like the secret breakfast as well as the sweet corn.
author: Glessie C.

description:
OK I live nearby, I am here more than I would like to admit. 

Open Hand FLUFFER NUTTER = amazing, a perfect creamy ice cream, peanut butter and marshmallow fluff. This flavor alone keeps me coming back here. Well, also the obvious other worthy flavor is Secret Breakfast but there are so many Secret Breakfast fans on yelp and all.

remember they are CASH ONLY. $4 a scoop or $7 a pint, you do the math.
author: Shannon Z.

description:
Forget Ben & Jerry ---Make room for Jake & Sean!!

Jake Godby, chef/owner and Sean Vahey, operations manager creates the "Greatest treats of all time"  --Nantucket by the way of the Misson --Unexpected find from a jaded New Yorker :-)

After our burrito adventure... we stumbled upon HS.
OOOH MY, obscure flavors but really worked in a brilliant way Excellent!

To name a few:
Jesus Juice -Kermit Lynch Cotes du Rhone and Classic Coke
Secret Breakfast -Bourbon & Corn Flakes 
Salt 'n Pepper
Ancho Chili

Loved:
Red spinning stools  
"Sweeties" behind the counter
12 samples or so
Real tasting spoons -sans plastic
Freshest cake cones
Under $4 for two scoops
Cafe tables

Line behind me formed fast but the cute brunette didn't mind... I finally made a decision: Fudgesicle + Olive Oil with hints of lemen peel.  Pure delight!!!  The ice cream was creamy, the right balance of individual notes.  I didn't mind that it started to melt right away because I enjoyed licking the goodness like a first timer... Feeling six years old was just right!
author: phong-lan h.

description: I actually heard about this place from Patrick Norton on a webcast called Tekzilla. I couldn't wait to try their unusual flavors and after reading the many Yelp reviews, I made a beeline to this place once I was in the area. I sampled the Jesus Juice and a few other flavors, finally deciding on a scoop of the Secret Breakfast (great) and the Fluffernutter (really great). The line is often long apparently, but places like this are worth the wait and the line moved fairly fast. I liked that they use an iPad and Square dongle for credit card purchases.
author: John B.

description:
While I can't say that this is the best ice cream place I've ever been to, I can say that it's so much better than some of the hyped up trendy ice cream places that have been popping up around the country.  Mitchells is still solid "old school" classic flavors, but for a place that does "unique" and "interesting" flavors, this is the best I've been to so far.

The boyfriend ordered vanilla (once again, he feels like if you can't do vanilla right, don't even bother) and pumpkin.  I ordered Secret Breakfast and Ancho Chocolate.   I really enjoyed the Secret Breakfast, bourbon flavor.  The boyfriend said it was good but he didn't care too much for the cornflakes.  I really liked the chocolate, although a little hint of cinnamon was missing for me...just a bit.  The vanilla was surprisingly good, very intense and rich flavors that made me appreciate it a lot.  The pumpkin was a little too much for me though, but then I'm not a huge pumpkin fan (I don't really care for pumpkin pie, so take what I say with a grain of salt.)

Overall, I was thoroughly surprised.  We've been disappointed by lots of "fancy" ice cream places in the past, so we didn't really walk in with high expectations.  It actually took some convincing to get us to come here, and I'm glad we checked it out.  I don't think I'd stand in line for it though, but it's definitely good.
author: Quynh-An P.

description: So I'll make this short. I'm not a picky eater but the flavors here were just too crazy for me. I didn't think the flavors were tasty at all. Props to Humphry's for their unique combinations, but just didn't work for me.
author: Christine N.

description:
I decided to swing by Humphry when I heard they had alcohol flavors. Bearing their line, I was surprised that half of their daily menu was alcohol related and felt at home during my first visit. 

Secret Breakfast is a hit with me but I know a few friends who don't like the flavor, so like most ice clean places, you should try before you commit. The flavor of bourbon is there and I could swear that I felt I had a buzz going on by the time I finished my scoop. 

Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee taste just as it suppose to. It is sweet, but I just feel like it should be part of my everyday breakfast to start the day.

Guinness Gingerbread - I like Guinness, so I guess I'm biased when I say I like the ice cream. 

Humphry has exotic flavors and good toppings that warrant everyone to at least try them out at least once. I would definitely recommend Humphry to others (especially those who drink). Beware parking can be difficult during nighttime.
author: Casey L.

description:
Ask for the low sodium salt & pepper ice cream or the Mrs. Dash alternative.  No, those don't exist but they might as well have.  Despite having absolutely great ice cream - including Special Breakfast and Malted Chocolate - H&S's outlandish hipsterism makes me feel a little uneasy.

The three best things about Humphrey Slocombe:
* The name.  It comes from "Are you being served?"
* The ICP themed painting on the side wall.
* The liquored up cherry topping.
author: Ivan L.

description:
Inventive flavors - not afraid to take risks. 

Overall cream consistency doesn't quite overtake Bi-Rite but among the best i've tasted overall. 

Near a number of really good Mission taquerias as well...
author: Tyler C.

description:
My new favorite place for ice cream.  I've made 2 visits in the last 4 days.

It's a great place for high quality, creative flavored ice cream.  Just don't go right after dinner on warm evenings unless you're willing to line up and wait for about a 20-30 mins.

I've had Tahitian Vanilla, Balsamic Caramel and Secret Breakfast.  They're all great.  I love vanilla and thought the Tahitian Vanilla was creamy and rich.
