Sorry Humphrey Slocombe...I wanted to like you but came away empty :-(
author: SFnativeGal ..

description:
4 stars for thinking outside of the box.

I enjoyed my honey thyme ice cream cone.
It was a nice mix of two opposing tastes.

I think you have to be an ice cream or dessert lover to want to try this place. My husband didn't think much of it because he really isn't an ice cream fanatic like I am.

There you have it.
author: Jo M.

description:
Lived up to the hype!

I would knock it a star for closing it's doors on my butt at 8:59pm, but I will forgive them because it is that good.  There's really nothing like it in terms of the creativity and willingness to experiment.  You may get something not so tasty in my book (beet or balsamic caramel), but you still want to try.

Serious hole in the wall with no seating and hard to park, but delicious none the less.

Truly the breakfast of champions:  Secret Breakfast (bourbon and cornflakes) and Blue Bottle Coffee
author: Christine K.

description: Icy strawberry, not very creamy. Pretentious portions. I'd rather have had a pint of store bought ice cream at a third the price.
author: Brian C.

description:
Got the secret breakfast and chocolate smoked sea salt flavors.  I like bourbon so the secret breakfast was good.  The chocolate was hands down the best ice cream I have ever had.   Both flavors the consistency, or mouth feel or whatever its called was really lush and dense.
The shop is real clean and well lit.  The people working were very nice and gave us samples of different flavors.  Service with a smile.
I will definitely come back here the next time I visit San Francisco.
author: Big S.

description:
I've been a deadbeat reviewer, but I'm trying to be better, so here I am reviewing ice cream. Perhaps I should be part of ice cream addicts anonymous. Sounds fun, no?

I came here 2 weeks ago...or so? I wasn't too impressed, but maybe it was because I was really full from lunch. My over zealous friend and I were trying to hit up Mitchell's after this too. 

I sampled the Secret Breakfast...oh man, the bourbon is VERY strong. If I had this for breakfast, it would be no secret as to what it was spiked with...that was not for me.

We shared a small - Blue Bottle Vietnamese coffee and on a whim the nectarine(?) sorbet, which we chose last minute because I can't read and didn't realize we get 2 scoops. I'm also senile, so I don't even remember the sorbet flavor I got, though I'm PRETTY sure it was nectarine. Anyway, the other flavors are intriguing, but I think some of the flavors are just too adventurous for me.

The people working there are extremely friendly and it is very pristine, almost heavenly inside. I really enjoyed the decor.

We didn't make it to Mitchell's. Too much ice cream, even for this addict.
author: Dolores L.

description:
Fluffernutter: YUM

Secret Breakfast: Not so yum for me, but YUM for those who love the taste of straight up bourbon

Vietnamese coffee: also YUM


Shop is minimal and clean in appearance (very lovely) and the employees are very nice and not annoying nor rude at all. Love the creative flavors; one of my favorite ice cream shops in SF.
author: Geraldine T.

description:
Foie Gras Ice Cream Sandwiches?  Really?

As much as I eat a lot of ice cream, this shop actually made me feel ultra-conservative with my choice of black sesame ice cream.  I am frankly speechless at the assortment of idealistic ice cream flavors.  The shop was intimate and inviting.

Come here if you want to blow your ice cream taste buds out of their minds...
author: Christia P.

description:
What the F?

service was awesome, $ rating is misleading, cuz 1 (small) scoop is $3.75.  Rite Aid Thrifty Ice Cream is $, this place, not so much.  But omg the flavors they come up with!  try them all, guilt free, because the staff doesn't mind giving samples, and they use metal tasting spoons to save the environment.

Definitely should try this place, if only for the shock value.  ice cream itself is heavenly, but can be overwhelmingly rich and sweet half a scoop in.  my mouth felt numb from the flavors. 

i had the Secret Breakfast (bourbon with real corn flake bits...like an old man spiking his coffee during breakfast), and the Cinnamon Brittle (with real brittle bits).  wanted to try the basil flavor, but they were out.  tried the vietnamese coffee flavor, which was spot on, but like vietnamese coffee, also very strong sweetness and flavor.  brown sugar flavor was TOO sweet.

most interesting and scariest flavor is called "Fetal Kitten".  didn't see any, but saw the name on the wall with other flavors.  i don't even know what to imagine that would taste like.
author: Trish G.

description:
I have yet to try Bi-Rite (I know, what's wrong with me!?), but they would have to have some ungodly ice cream to top Humphry Slocombe!

Of course, had to get the Secret Breakfast cuz everyone on here is talking about it.  I can definitely see why though.  It's definitely a secret, twisted sort of breakfast - cinnamon toast crunch and bourbon.  YUM.  Haha.  My favorites though were the Smoked Chocolate with Sea Salt (almost exactly like the the Pan Con Chocolat dessert at the now closed Laiola) and the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee (also tried the Jesus Juice, Pepper & Mint, and Olive Oil...can't remember the names of others).  Granted, the coffee ice cream isn't overly unique like some of the other ones (Peanut Butter and Curry comes to mind...tastes like the peanut satay dipping sauce you get at Thai restaurants), but it's well done - and so flavorful with the coffee!  In fact, all of the ice cream is well made...creamy, soft, and flavorful just as the name describes.  And did I mention that their scoops are ginormous?  No, okay, well...there you go.

Now, let me tell you now...you WILL have to wait in line (it's a given, so just accept it and line up to the right) but have no fear as it moves rather swiftly (about 15 minutes for us on a sunny Sat afternoon).  Also, don't get discouraged if you see the board with flavors crossed out.  They will pull those tubs and replace them with other flavors, so don't start to panic because it looks like they're out of the goods - they've got plenty more in the back.

Will DEFINITELY be back, and likely soon.  The flavors change often, and throughout the day since the crowd turns over their stock so fast, so any return trip is likely to be something new all over again.  Definitely ask for tastes of those that interest you though since they are rather unique combinations of flavors that may or may not sit well with you.
author: Mike L.

description:
This is such a fun ice cream place.  We were surprised that we liked so many of the flavors!  They offer many very unique and creative flavors that you would never think of, especially for ice cream!  For example, Salt & Pepper, Olive Oil, Jesus Juice (red wine and coke sorbet), Peanut Butter Curry, etc.  They also have some more familiar flavors like coffee and vanilla.  So far, our favorite is the Secret Breakfast, which is bourbon and cornflakes - it is unbelievably good.  The texture of the ice cream just melt in your mouth and even with tiny bites you get so much flavor.  It is very satisfying ice cream.

Very high quality, friendly service, fun flavors and experience.  Parking can be difficult in this area, lines are usually long but move fairly quick.
author: three's company M.

description:
I had the secret breakfast flavored ice cream in a cup. There was a long line, and I was expecting it to be amazing, as usual. I probably should have taste-tested it first. So the secret breakfast flavor is bourbon and toasted corn flakes. Eehhh, didn't really like the bourbon flavor part. Reminded me of when.... I HAD to take shots of whiskey. GROSS. It actually wasn't that bad. I guess then I'm biased. This is a biased review. 

The bourbon had a sweet flavor to it though. But... still... I have to compare it to Ici in Berkeley. Ici is just way better and you can taste how fresh the ice cream is at Ici.
author: Vera W.

description:
#1087

I have to put it in writing - I didn't like it. I tasted 4 different things and didn't order anything - I can't remember the last time that happened at an ice cream shop, even good ol Baskin Robbins.

I'm also going to go ahead and say I don't appreciate the owner's inflammatory quotes about vegetarians. I don't even care if he's a hard core carnivore (I'm from TX and have only been veg for 5 years), but saying things just to get a reaction is a just jackassery, especially for a small business owner.

You got your reaction. but not my money.
author: Shal J.

description:
"Death by Ice Cream"
 
That's what my tombstone will likely read.  I live across the street from this hell hole (and by hell hole i mean, amazing amazing amazing place).  If my windows are open, I can hear people happily licking their effing cones.  Ugh.  Torture.  It takes every ounce of will power not to go here everyday.  They change the menu so often that I have to literally think of my naked thighs in order to keep my toosh firmly on my couch and not at one of their stools.  

As someone who has had every flavor thrice (at least) my fave has to Brown Butter followed closely by Pepper & Mint Chip.  Obviously, if you're a first timer, try everything - then get 1 scoop of Secret Breakfast, and 1 scoop of something else.  Then there's Jesus Juice... and chocolate malt... and balsamic caramel... the toasted almonds... the hot fudge...CRAP.  THANK GOD I AM AT THE OFFICE INSTEAD OF IN MY APARTMENT RIGHT NOW.
author: Chris Q.

description:
Bookmarked for months, I knew I wanted to check out Humphry Slocombe, and glad I did on a warm Sunday afternoon in October. Not much of a wait, but I could see there potentially being a wait because you can sample all the flavors and still have a hard time deciding what to order. 

The staff is super fun and patient. Their suggestions and question answering were helpful in again, making the very hard decision between flavors. In the end I settled on McCoy's Olive Oil and Peanut Butter Curry--both savory as I was in a savory mood. The McCoy's Olive Oil had a hint of citrus, and was just the right amount of creaminess. I enjoyed every last bite. The peanut butter curry was equally part peanut butter and curry, and just the right amount of creaminess, as well. You get a sense that the ingredients they use are good quality. 

I tried the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee, and while it's a bold spot on flavor, I couldn't envision eating a whole scoop of it. The same can be said about the Secret Breakfast. Bourbon, cornflake chunks, and cream flavors were excellent, but maybe I was a bit too hungover to want to digest (pretty strong) bourbon flavor. 

Portions are very generous, and prices very reasonable. Bring cash though because they don't take plastic. I was more than satiated, but left wanting more...and I think that's a good thing. I'll be back, Humphry Slocombe!
author: Marie B.

description: The Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee is my favorite.  The portions are also very generous for the price. They are also very friendly here and patient when you want to try flavors.  The bacon brittle is also a must try, a little different but good for bacon lovers.
author: Gordon C.

description:
This review is LONG overdue and I only remembered to write it because I was craving it. HA....

This is my favorite ice cream joint and if it weren't for the travel time of 20 minutes from my house to get there, i'd be a fatty and eat dessert here at least 3 times a week! DARN YOU MISSION DISTRICT!

I've tried Secret Breakfast (hennessy and cornflakes), Jesus Juice (wine and coke i believe), Lemon Thyme, Blue Bottle Viet Coffee, Tahitian Vanilla and Balsamic Caramel so far... and I enjoyed every single flavor minus the balsamic caramel. I just couldn't have too much of it.

The prices are fair and the flavors are definitely unique. My favorite combo is a scoop of Secret Breakfast with a scoop of Jesus Juice. Those two go so well with each other! MMM! Delicious. Be careful though, because their flavors ARE very different and isn't for everyone. So just keep an open mind.
author: amelia g.

description:
I've been dying to come here for quite some time now, but get discouraged and annoyed everytime I drove by and saw the insanely long line......even in the freezing cold.

So what better day than today, a GORGEOUS sunday afternoon when SF is in the high 70s and with no urgent plans to attend to whatsover, to finally give it a shot?  

We parked right across the street!  Omg how lucky was that?  Then, only waited like 5-10 minutes total - sweet!  Definitely headed to a great start.

- Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee - looooooooove (my fave)
- Peanut Butter Curry - strong curry taste indeed (if you like curry), but a very interesting combo that's for sure.  I still can't wrap my brain around this one....
- Boccalone Prosciutto - porky for sure haha, but not bad whatsover
- Honey Thyme - pretty tasty and sweet

With such creative flavors like these, you really can't go wrong.  Overall verdict?

5 solid stars over and over again!!!
author: Carmen Y.

description:
The flavors here at Humphry are A-OK. There're definitely a little more indulgent than others. Elvis (The Fat Years) with banana ice cream and bacon peanut brittle anyone? 

Whatever you do, don't have the Thai Chili Lime. It burns.
author: Adrianna C.

description:
Great prices and awesome flavors! 
The Jesus Juice (coke and red wine) and Orange Clove Sorbets really hit the spot on a hot day after we had done a lot of walking. 

They also allow you to try the flavors ahead of time so you don't get stuck with something you don't even enjoy. Can't beat that kind of customer service!
author: Ash R.

description:
This is ice cream that will make your eyes scream once you see the flavors that are as bizarre as square watermelons! 

They had ten flavors, many of which were unavailable due to popularity, of great ingenuity and inventiveness, such as Peanut Butter Curry and Jesus Juice (Red wine and Coke).  We came to a consensus that we would try the Secret Breakfast, which fused the two constituents that form the ULTIMATE breakfast of champions: Corn Flakes and Bourbon. Yes, Whiskey!  The intensity of the two flavors really came through  in each bite, yet still managed to stay in harmony to provide a freakishly palatable, zesty experience! 

If you're a lover of the absurd, make this a must on your list of food adventures!
author: Kelly S.

description: Best place for Ice Cream, really unique flavor combinations. If you are not sure what flavor to get you can get ask for a sample. The staff was very friendly.
author: Belinda C.

description:
Came here after dinner with my bf...and was so satisfied after a not so satisfying dinner. We got three scoops to share and it was plenty. We got a scoop of Tehitian Vanilla, Blue bottle Vietnamese coffee (cause I love Vietnamese Coffee) and a scoop of Fudge Sorbet.

None of the flavors were dissappointing! I loved each and every one just as much. I was very surprised that the Fudge sorbet was so chocolately! And it didn't taste too creamy that I would feel bad eating it, but it was packed with chocolate flavor...and not too sweet! The Tehitian Vanilla was so vanilla-y, and the Vietnamese coffee tasted like Vietnamese coffee. 

The staff was very friendly, they were patient with patrons trying to taste every single flavor they had displayed. Line can get long, especially with everyone trying to taste everything. Busier during dessert hours. They have two small tables and seats outside for you to enjoy your treat on a nice clear night, or if its not so packed...some seats inside, but the place is tiny. Street parking, but lots of cool places to wonder around, especially Mexican food if you need dinner.
author: Amy L.

description: This is near one of my work offices, but yesterday was my first visit.  But it won't be my last!  I wanted to try the Boccolone Prosciutto ice cream, but the cashier said that they don't stock that flavor often :(  But, I did sample the Secret Breakfast flavor, which was very tasty.  But I decided on 2 scoops of Hibiscus Beet Sorbet on a sugar cone.  It was very sweet and delicious.  The 2 scoops did not last as I walked the 6 blocks back to my office.  This will be frequent stop in my future visits to the Mission.
author: Jeffrey S.

description:
Can I sample? Why of course you can...spoons waiting for you to sample all the flavors! 

I'm a traditionalist and settled for the Tahitian Vanilla and it was delicious. 

A friend went for the Secret Breakfast and Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee and he loved it!
author: ERICA G.

description:
I get the hype, they have a ton of interesting flavors. Where else can you find a foie gras ice cream? Sounds wrong, yet intereting.. BUT we went today and I was a bit disappointed. 

The service was great, the people that worked there are insanely friendly and attentive. I sampled the Ancho chocolate, secret breakfast (cornflakes and bourbon) and Brown Butter... I felt obligated to pick one.. BUT really I thought the Ancho chocolate was toooo sweet and didn't have enough kick to it, just tasted like super sweet sugary ice cream. The Brown Butter tasted like a stick of butter with a ton o'sugar and the Secret Breakfast, meh..

I'll continue to follow them on Twitter until I get them on a prosciutto or foie gras day .. Then will review again, so stay tuned...
author: Monica S.

description:
very interesting Doctor Jones...

why is this place so popular?  I think having such creative names such as "Secret Breakast," "Jesus Juice," or "Lemon Buttermilk" can create quite a stir when it comes to "what's hot."  

HS definitely lived up to its hype, they have excellent ice cream concoctions, you can definitely taste the blend of unique flavors and the quality of their ingredients.  If you don't mind bourbon, go for Secret Breakfast, which also has sugary cornflake clusters.  

But my favorites were the Lemon Buttermilk sorbet, Olive flavor and the Blue Bottle coffee.

The only issue with this place is that it gets busy and there isn't enough time to try all their flavors because it feels like you're being rushed while everyone is behind you waiting for their turn.
author: Kevin W.

description: Secret Breakfast might be the most delicious frozen treat I've ever put in my mouth. I wish they shipped because I would have buckets of the stuff shipped to Chicago for me! Also tried the Banana Chai which was also crazy delicious. I don't think there is one thing that would be bad here. Make sure you stop in, and even if there is a line, it's worth it!
author: Sydney J.

description:
Not sure what the hype is all about...Secret Breakfast really should be kept a secret so no one would have to endure it. I'd rather take a shot of a well drink...cheaper and taste the same as Secret Breakfast. 

Yuck! 

I'm sticking to Polly Ann's in the Sunset!
author: Allan M.

description:
I walk through the door, and like a magnet, the freezer displaying the array of ice cream calls my name.  My eyes are glued to the frozen delights, and with palms glued to the glass...it took every ounce of me to not ask for samples of every single flavor.  Of course I try the Secret Breakfast and the Cinnamon Brittle.  Secret Breakfast is a mixture of cornflakes and bourbon.  Oh my.  That was heavenly.  Cinnamon Brittle tasted like a snickerdoodle with a crunch.  Cinnamon Brittle won this battle...but I'll be back for my Secret Breakfast.

Creative, unique, and imaginative.  My first visit to HS Ice Cream certainly did not disappoint.  With flavors ranging from Cinnamon Brittle, Peanut Butter Curry, Sangria, Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee, and Secret Breakfast (just to name a few)...you just can't go wrong.  

In addition to the fabulous ice cream, they also sell sweets.  But just like the ice cream, they're treats are nowhere near ordinary.  We're talking peanut bacon brittle...lard taffy...you get the picture.

FYI: Cash only

I'll most definitely be back...
author: Maybelline C.

description:
We'd spent the day walking around 24th Street looking at all the fantastic murals and thought ice cream sounded good so I did a search on the GPS and found Humphry Slocombe. Strange name, especially in this neighborhood, but we were craving ice cream so we decided to give it a try.

They also had some strange sounding flavors and a few that we had to sample. I tried the Thai Chili Lime while my mother sampled the Olive Oil. I liked the fact that they didn't use the disposable plastic spoons for the samples.

They were surprisingly good although we settled on a Tahitian Vanilla cone and Blue Bottle Vietnamese Ice Coffee cone. My mother really liked the vanilla. I on the other hand loved the coffee ice cream! I can't stop thinking about it. Intense flavor with just the right amount of sweetness! I will be back, hopefully next time I'm in the city because there were a few more flavors I just have to try.
author: Debi T.

description: Humphrey Slocombe is pricier than many other ice cream places considering they give out the smallest scoops in the city and their ice cream just isn't as smooth and creamy as Bi-Rite or Mitchell's, so I'm not convinced incredibly unique flavors make up for these faults.
author: Beatrice W.

description:
Oh goodness.  Some friends had some Humphry Slocombe ice cream in their freezer a few weeks back.  I'd never heard of this place until they mentioned it.  The ice cream flavor?  Vietnamese Coffee.

Talk about a strange ice cream flavor!  Well, it was amazing.  Everything you liked about the Vietnamese Coffee came out in that ice cream.  It was rich and oh so flavorful.  Shit, at this point, I'd prefer this to the real thing.  

I'm definitely going to hit up Humphry's in the future to try a few other flavors... but just from this one flavor alone, I have a good feeling about this next visit!
author: Johnson N.

description:
Great. Now I've been somewhere that I am going to have to figure out a way to make a well-beaten path straightaways. 

The staff has been kind when I've asked to try everything, and seriously, I've had a go at each of the flavors whenever time permits. I would have slapped myself.

In short, Thai Chili Lime. Tom Kha ice cream, no lie. Complete with some HEAT. No lie. Harvey Milk ice cream? Damn. Proper. When we gonna go again?

Cash only, and my god, they could easily charge twice that, but they don't! You don't have to ball to enjoy a cup of Balsalmic Caramel!
author: Charlene L.

description:
If you're a food prude be afraid ... VERY AFRAID!  I was watching The Best Thing I Ever Ate of Food Network on Friday night and they mentioned this place and their prosciutto ice cream.. "Ewww! That sounds DISGUSTING! Let's go there tomorrow." Oh thank goodness I was in my hometown for a couple days to be able to experience this.  This place is cash only and sometimes the wait gets a little long because it's so hard for people to decide what strange flavor they want. They only make 12 flavors a day plus a special of the day which was Secret Breakfast (bourbon and cornflakes).

Vietnamese Coffee Ice Cream - I don't even like coffee ice cream. I think they're all disgusting but for some reason I was really drawn to this because the flavor was so strong. 

Thai Chili Lime - The first scoop was DISGUSTING but as long as I kept eating it without mixing it with the other flavors it tasted more like lime and ended up being my favorite. 

Ancho Chocolate - Don't knock it til you try it. I liked it.

Prosciutto Ice Cream - If you like bacon and you like vanilla ice cream ... well this is for you.
author: Antoinette O.

description:
I like a place that challenges my taste buds. I know what vanilla tastes like, give me something different! I want to try all the flavors that Humphry's has to offer. Jesus juice? Bring it. Secret Breakfast? Let's give it a shot. 

Minus one star for their Blue Bottle Vietnamese coffee flavor. There is a lingering aftertaste that is not quite right. Somehow the cream and rest of the ice cream separates at a different rate, and what's left at the end of the spoonful or lick is a layer of cream film. Ew. 

Maybe it was a bad batch? 

I'll keep coming back as long as there's a flavor I have not yet tried.
author: Ava C.

description:
Cool, inventive flavors. Definitely give it a shot, even if you're hesitant. I'm extremely picky and I was surprised how much I liked flavors like black poppy, secret breakfast, and olive oil. 

Make sure to check their FB or Twitter to see what their flavors of the day are, they rotate.
author: A H.

description:
Have you ever had ice cream that was just well made and perfectly indulgent, playing off the flavors and textures of its contents?  May I present Humphry Slocombe.

Secret Breakfast is surprisingly yummy for boozy cereal ice cream.  And Harvey Milk and Honey Graham Cracker is the best Honey flavored ice cream I have ever tasted.  

They let you try out whatever flavor you want and they have to go cups in case you drew the short straw and now have to go get everyone their ice cream fix.

Parking is at a premium so if you don't have to drive then don't.  When it's a slow day or near closing it's not so hard but any other time and you're screwed.

Lines can get long so if there's a flavor you can't live without then stock up on it so you can eat it while watching old episodes of Star Trek and secretly laughing at those suckers who didn't have your foresight.
author: Vicky C.

description:
I am a self-admitted ice cream fanatic. And if there's one thing I try to catch when out about town, on vacation or down the street - it's where to find high quality cream. I'm a regular at Marrianne's in Santa Cruz, some of the best, hands down, ice cream in the world, with hundreds of flavors, but we'll get to their review on their page. 

Humphry Slocombe is the closest thing I've had that rivals that type of quality. They offer a gorging of flavors in all manners of experimentation and imagination: Secret Breakfast (bourbon and corn flakes), Jesus Juice (wine sorbet), Tahitian Vanilla, Brown Butter, Pumpkin 5 Spice, Cinnamon Brittle, Collaborative Evil Ale, Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee, Blood Orange, Cayenne Cantaloupe, and my most beloved flavor the Balsamic Caramel (it sounds horrid, I know, but the experience is exquisite so difficult to describe.)

The rotate through the flavors, offering 12 a day, and a smattering of cleverly named sundaes. 

The price is as high as the quality of cream you're consuming, but considering a scoop from Ben & Jerry's costs $5 for the smallest size... This costs less, like a dollar less. 

Couple downfalls: 1 - the line, most always out the door and slow as that diet you plan on starting after "this last scoop." And offering 12 flavors seems too few to offer each day when people they've traveled a far distance to hit up this one location and are hunkering for that one they saw online. Oh yeah, it's also in one of the crimiest and grimiest parts of the Mission. Possibly a couple of shootings on those blocks in the last few months. Which is crazy cuz it's such a freaking cute spot. 

I'd say get choosy about who scoops for you though, as I've noticed extreme size differences for my scoop depending on who's serving.
author: Kelly S.

description:
5/5 stars on the Wing Scale... 

- Quality of product: 2.5 of 3 stars (rounded UP because of the great service + overall experience)
- Quality of service: 1 of 1 star
- General feelings of happiness: 1 of 1 star

I had the Framboise Beer sorbet at the server's suggestion; the raspberry flavor was refreshing. For my second scoop, I had the Magnolia Cypress Ale... it didn't taste like beer but did have a caramel-ish, coffee-like taste. Hubby J had the Secret Breakfast (bourbon and cornflakes) and the Harvey Milk (honey and graham crackers). I really liked the Harvey Milk for its subtle taste and slight crunch. 

Although I thought Humphry Slocombe's flavors were good, the Chinese grandma in me wanted to scream "Wah, it's too sweet!" when I sampled Yelpers' faves such as Vietnamese Coffee and Secret Breakfast. The runny consistency also turned me off a bit. Overall, it is good stuff for a decent price, $3.75 for the "small" cup (2 scoops!).

The service, I thought, was more than satisfactory. Our server put up with me trying all the flavors; I finally *did* just go with his two recommendations. We encountered no lines on a weeknight (around 8pm). Plus, a very pleasant surprise--Hubby J and I ran into a college classmate who I haven't seen in about 4 years! Thanks for the unexpected mini reunion, Humphry Slocombe!! :)
author: Wing Y.

description:
CrAaaAaaazZzy place! I heard about this place on Food Network's "Best I Ever Had" and since I'm from So.Cal, this was definitely a place to check out since I was in the city.

There was quite a line, but I wasn't going to give up trying out a place like this!  Hell nah.  The awesome thing about this place is that you could sample the different variety of flavors that they have to offer.  Variety, indeed.  Slocombe's got flavors that kids, potheads, and alcoholic adults could only dream of!  The real question is, "Does it taste good?"  YES, bitch!  Now get your own damn cone!

If you check out their website, they've got a giant list of different ice cream flavors.  My girlfriend really wanted to try their prosciutto ice cream (she LOVES prosciutto), but was sad to find that they didn't have it for the day.  I still have no clue how their rotation works, but whatever, you just know there's something good if there's a line out the door for ice cream.

Some of the flavors I tried were the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee, Candy Cap, Cinnamon Brittle & the Secret Breakfast.  The ice cream will blow you out of this world!  I ultimately ended up with a scoop of the Candy Cap (supposedly made with mushrooms? Couldn't find the taste of it) and ...I think the Secret Breakfast (Bourbon + Corn Flakes).

Bring cash, friends.  Your plastic means nothing here!
author: Patrick K.

description:
does this place need more reviews? yes, their ice cream is delicious. super creamy.. tastes exactly what the name of the flavor is that day. 

don't always have the same ones, so check their tweets but i find Secret Breakfast, Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee and Tahitian Vanilla to always somehow be there.

what are my favs besides those 3? balsamic caramel, sweet corn, brown butter, salt and pepper, but of course i haven't tried them all (has anyone?) 

so how about some tips?

if you go during peak times, expect to wait in line, in the San Franciscold. Yes, there will be locals in line, but now there are also lots of tourists (thank you, NYTimes). Why is the line so long if they only serve like 6 flavors, and 2 sorbets? because everyone basically tries all the flavors before choosing 2 or 3. 

is waiting in line for about 20 minutes worth it? yes.. we waited in line on a saturday night around 8 pm for about 25 minutes, and by the time we walked back to the car, it was already all gone ... and we parked the car across the street.. yes, that good.

cash only

the flavors are written on the wall, not just on the glass, so start thinking what you want to try.

compost the cup/bowls, spoons when you're done!
author: Lauren Y.

description:
Maybe I just don't get it...the ice cream was good, but not "oh my god I've died and gone to heaven" good. More like "interesting flavor but I'm not going out of my way to go here again" good. And it was kind of lukewarm, half melted already. I prefer my ice cream "ice" cold. 

Ordered two scoops - malted chocolate and sangria. Got two scoops - malted chocolate and honey thyme. Huh? 

Dear server, how do you get "honey thyme" from "sangria"? And you're unfriendly and obviously sick of giving people samples. Well, forgive me, ice cream serving lady, but I'm not going to order a peanut butter curry ice cream cone without trying it first.  Nobody forced you to come to work today.  Try to make the best of it please.

Plus, you don't take credit cards. And I don't carry cash. Bummer. 

Two stars for you...next time I'm going to try Mitchell's or Bi-Rite.
author: Michelle M.

description:
What everyone else said. And they don't charge you extra to put it on a cone.

Which is awesome because you don't want to have to walk up to the place, smelling cone for fifty feet, and then have to debate with your wallet as to whether or not its worth the extra 75 cents.
author: Sachi T.

description:
Disappointed. Bi-rite and Ici still have this place beat. Bi-rite's flavors are just good old traditional, and Ici's combinations of exotic flavors actually works.  I feel like this place could be a haven for folks who like weird things put in their ice-cream (black licorice? you bet!)

On the ups - friendly service with a smile, HUGE portions, no attitude if I want to taste the rainbow spectrum of flavors

Downers - I wish they had a broader selection of flavors, was kinda underwhelmed by the Secret Breakfast and Tahitian Vanilla (which were the flavors that I ended up with because they were the most "normal")

It was the saddest moment in my life when I couldn't bring myself to finish my ice-cream. But hey, if you're in the 'hood and craving some sweets, it'll do the trick.
author: T. B.

description:
This is a little out of the way, so unfortunately I didn't get to try more than a couple of flavors, but boy are they good!  The ice-cream itself is as expected, but the real draw is the crazy flavors.  Secret breakfast gets well-deserved kudos, and the balsamic caramel was a flavor I could see working into lots of desserts.

Looking forward to visit #2!
author: Foster K.

description:
I came here two weeks ago and I know I was late by like 15 minutes but the scooper was still scooping ice cream for other patrons who were still waiting to get their ice cream. I asked nicely if I could come in and get a scoop and he said well we're closed (as his arm is all up in the freezer scooping ice cream) So not nice!

Needless to say, my friend convinced me to come back here after dinner at Pizzeria Delfina (which was excellent, I think it was worth a wait of no more than one hour). I got the Secret Breakfast ice cream (Bourbon with cornflakes mixed in). The bourbon was so freaking strong, I thought I was gonna get drunk. I'm not lying but you could smell the fumes coming out and the cornflakes? Where? I got like these two tiny ass clusters I probably needed a magnifying glass to actually see it. 

My friend ordered the Tahitian Vanilla ice cream, that I liked very much. No complaints for that.
author: Linda X.

description:
We hit Humphry Slocumbe second in the Ice Cream Walk of the Damned.

Ice Cream Texture : 4/5.  Good texture but a bit overly sweet.
Flavor Variety : 4/5.  Many flavors, some of which are really fun to taste but I can't imagine eating a whole cone of them (peanut butter and curry).  The standbys like secret breakfast and Vietnamese coffee (with condensed milk flavor, yum) are delicious and novel.  The downside is a relatively high percentage of the ice creams are still in the experimental stage.
Customers : People too cool for Bi-Rite
Strengths :  Weird flavors, taxidermy
Cons: Weird flavors, taxidermy
author: Dave S.

description: Yes, this is one of my favorite places for ice cream.  I just rotate through all the flavors.
author: Byron L.

description:
We *just* discovered this little gem, thanks to a friend.

Since we are a bit bored with the long wait over at Mitchell's, we were up for a new ice cream adventure!

We drove out to the City with Humphry Slocombe on the brain.  We heard about the Jesus Juice and Secret Breakfast and said, "we gotta taste this for ourselves!"

I think they have something for everyone here.  It's refreshing to have a twist of flavors.  It is a little pricey, sure...but I'm sure it goes towards the Chef and the cost of making your own ice cream on site.

We actually got lucky with parking on the street, but just bring plenty of quarters since I think it was something like 8 minutes per quarter!
author: Dee M.

description:
Tahitian Vanilla = the best! 

Close runner-ups- Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee, Black Sesame, and any Malted flavor :)

Though the scoops are small, and a bit pricey (1 scoop = 2.75, 2 scoops = 3.75, 3 scoops = 5), it's well worth it!

Long lines during summer times and it gets a bit stuffy inside...but it's the ice cream that counts!
author: Agnes L.

description:
I hate having to give anything ice-cream related a mere 3 stars.

But I have to give Humphry Slocumbe a knock because for premium ice cream, I didn't think it was right to have flecks of ice throughout my Brown Butter ice cream.

Maybe I'll make the trek over again and give HS another try but until then, Bi-Rite Creamery still takes the cake!
author: Ellen B.

description: Ice cream isn't at the top of my list of favorite sweets - it's a mental list, but it exists - yet I found myself here two days in a row. Everything about this place is wonderful. They have an excellent selection of interesting flavors (e.g. Breakfast Surprise), super friendly service and seemingly unlimited samples (we tested this). Most importantly, the ice cream tastes amazing. It's been a day since my last visit, so I think I'm due for a sundae...
author: Brett B.

description:
I love me some unique ice cream.. Secret breakfast is my go to flavor when eating there but I will always grab two quarts of blue bottle Vietnamese coffee for home ( one for me and one for the bf =D) 

Yummmmmy
author: A. Z.

description:
Secret breakfast ice cream - cornflakes with rum....YES PLEASE!!!!

So happy to have walked the 10 blocks from the BART to get a cone!
author: Cecilia B.

description: Secret Breakfast - Yum. And Foie Gras ice cream sandwiches. I love this place. I'm glad it's over an hour away otherwise I'd be in every day and would become obese. Thank you for placing yourself a good distance away. What a treat for when I'm in the city. :)
author: J S.

description: Olive Oil and Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee, both were good but frankly I expected to be more wowed based on the reviews I read.  Service was 5 star.
author: M M.

description:
This is the little ice cream shop that everyone else wishes they were.  Experimental flavors that sing on the palette when you try them.  Coffee ice cream that is more intense coffee flavored than actual coffee.  Innovative and surprising tastes like peppermint that is pepper (think fresh-cracked black pepper) and mint.  I had a scrumptious beet flavored ice cream one time that was just sublime.

Cash only, but worth a trip to the ATM.
author: Gabriel S.

description: Very unusual ice cream flavor ingredient combinations that manage to be only the good kind of weird when you put it in your mouth.
author: K. C.

description:
Although I wish this place was open late, they close at 9 and at 10 on the weekends, I still give this place 5 stars for their delicious unique flavors. I love 'secret breakfast'. It is creamy and actually tastes like bourbon. Hubby liked the 'Jesus Juice'. Even though it sounded weird (it's red wine with coca cola) it was really yummy. It kinda tasted like a slushy. 

You can't find these flavors anywhere. They have a rotating menu though. If you follow them on twitter you can see the list for the day. 

We come here alot and there's always a line, which can move kinda slow because they let you sample everything if you want so some people take a while deciding what they want. But trust me, it is worth the wait.
author: Ireri L.

description:
I had been dying to go here for ages, but since it wasn't within my normal radius of travel I hadn't made it here until now. We were taking a nice leisurely Saturday stroll when I suddenly realized we were right next door to ice cream! (okay, I saw their sign and turned the corner). I was ecstatic, despite being stuffed full of tacos from La Taqueria. 

Now I'm not one who really loves ice cream and will sit around on the couch eating a pint of it every month. But I do really enjoy the occasional cone or banana split (so shoot me, I have no sweet tooth, just a chocolate addiction). So here we are in line, with me jumping up and down trying to crane my neck around to see what flavors are on deck all whilst trying to give off a cool and calm persona, nothing to look at here. 

We get to the counter and try about 6 flavors, all of which are tasty. I end up getting Ancho Chocolate and Jesus Juice (yay!), pay and wiggle my way out of the store. half a block later, and only a few bites into my ice cream I'm already trying to pawn in off while trying to hide my disappointment. how could something with so much hype leave such a bad taste in my mouth.

No doubt they have awesome flavors, but unfortunately none of them are good after a few bites. So I guess you'll find me in line at birite, waiting my turn to scarf down some roasted banana ice cream.
author: Allyson S.

description: I live less than a block away from this place, so I wish I could rave more whole-heartedly about this place.  They get an A+ for inventive flavors, but the ice-cream still tastes a little bit watery and the corn-flake or balsamic combos never leave me completely satisfied.  An interesting culinary experience - but perhaps the classic flavors are classic for a reason.
author: Ben T.

description: 5 Stars because I have such a sweet tooth for delicious exotic ice cream concoctions. Came here and tried  their blue bottle vietnamese coffee, tahitian vanilla, fluffernutter(marshmellow fluff and penut butter, and the oh so famous, Secret Breakfast( bourbon & cornflakes). The Fluffernutter was okay, however I am not much of a peanut butter fan. Maybe its not fair for me to judge that one. However, the Du Ma Coffee and Tahitian Vanilla were very interesting flavors and I would definitely order them again. Of course out of all these flavors, I have saved the best for last. Its hard to explain how the secret breakfast tasted like. Creamy sweet bourbon ice cream and cornflakes together in matrimony. Something about them two being together feels and tastes so right. They should definitely get married.
author: Richard R.

description:
perfect dessert after a bowl of ken ken ramen! 

candy cap (mushroom) - if u love mushroom, u'll love this flavor.... although i might have to say, the woodiness turns into a praline sweet after a while....

8 ball stout - weird, but good

tahitian vanilla - super duper good vanilla!!! 

TIP: if your sharing, the best value is to get the 3 scoops!
author: Kelly H.

description:
This is a long drive from where we live!

And well worth it. We were in the 'hood and in the mood for some ice cream. Humphry met our expectations and more. The long line outside was reminiscient of the lines outside Didi Resse's in West LA and an indication of some delicious recipe churned inside.

We tried 'The Secret Breakfast', 'Vietnamese Coffee'  and 'Peanut Butter Curry'. ... They are patient with 'newbies' like us, letting us sample and savor the new and different tastes for our traditional 'french vanilla'ish accustomed palettes. 

Surely a place to stop by again ..
author: Abe K.

description:
Two words:  Secret Breakfast. -Okay,  a few more words:   Balsamic Caramel, Blue Bottle Coffee,  Peanut Butter Puree.  Olive Oil!  Superb ice cream and servers who are unfailingly upbeat and johnny (or jilly, as the case may be)-on-the-spot.  Yes, it's worth the wait.  No, I haven't been courageous enough to try the Salt and Pepper.

Two scoops of this heavenly ice cream will set you back $3.75-a pittance for such oral indulgence.
author: Earline A.

description: I was really excited to finally come here with flavors still available...but it was just OK for me. Maybe I expected too much since Yelpers talked so highly about the place? Don't get me wrong...it was good, but I didn't crave it afterwards. I ordered the SECRET BREAKFAST and VIETNAMESE COFFEE. Secret breakfast was a bit sweet for me, but the Vietnamese coffee was good!
author: Cat K.

description:
The ice cream is rich in flavor!  No where else can you find flavors like these. Crazy flavors like "salt & pepper" and the best one "secret breakfast"! They also offers savory toppings like almond crunch and fluff! 

Great Ice Cream and all you need is one taste.
author: Lind G.

description:
My favorite thing about going here is that they dare to be different.  I had a scoop of salt & pepper ice cream here one time.  I took the taster, tried it, was sort of conflicted on the whole thing, but i figured I might as well snag a scoop to dwell on it.  It wasn't my favorite ice cream ever but I appreciated the sweet and savory together.  Secret Breakfast (bourbon and cornflakes flavored) on the other hand?  Yeah that's definitely one of my all-time favorite ice creams.

It's just a fun place to go.  Try some weird stuff, find one you like, and then eat it..
author: John S.

description:
I am in love with this ice cream spot. It has such unusual flavors that you have to try them all to find your fave. Most are good, but so far my favorite is Mint Chip & Pepper Ice Cream. Not too spicy, but just perfect! Yumm... Jesus Juice was also very yummy, but not my thing (Red wine and Coke).
Not for kids, but a great ice cream spot for adults!  :)
author: Lucia A.

description:
Ice cream lovers beware, Baskin Robbins this is not!

Phew, now that that's out of the way, let's talk about how awesome HS Ice Cream really is. I first heard of this joint from an article in the NYTimes (article here: http://nyti.ms/ayFZnU). Uh, if the NYTimes writes about an ice cream parlor on the other side of the country, it's gotta be good, right? With my curiosity piqued, I grabbed a bunch of friends and off we were to see what this place was all about.

I tried the special breakfast (corn flakes, bourbon) and the black sesame. The special breakfast was good (the corn flakes give a good contrast to the softness of the ice cream), but it wasn't my favorite. The black sesame, on the other hand, was rich, tasty, and had a sinfully creamy texture. I also tried my friends' flavors: olive oil (surprisingly light and lemony!), the blue bottle coffee (coffee aficionados, you will love this), et al. Flavors I hope to try in the future: foie gras, prosciutto, and guinness gingerbread! (whoas)

Cash only, but 2 generously sized scoops of ice cream came out to a little less than $4. I would recommend this place to everyone in a heartbeat; their creative flavors are definitely worth trying at least once!
author: Justin C.

description: Just one word! Wow! Ice cream is one thing, this stuff is something totally different. With flavors like brown butter, balsamic, and honey thyme they have entered an entirely new world of ice cream. Check it out before its all gone!
author: Ben C.

description:
Dear Mr. Slocombe,
Your Secret Breakfast ice cream changed my life.
Love,
Dama


Really. Secret Breakfast (Whiskey ice cream with cornflakes stirred in) is my favorite flavor here - too good for words. Loved the balsamic caramel, blue bottle coffee, salt and pepper, and Stout ice creams, too. Ive tried nearly all the flavors but these are hte ones that stand out. 

Who cares if its a 15-20 min wait? Take a friend and have fun mocking the Mission hipsters walking by. Let the anticipation of your impending wierdy ice cream cone wash over you. Wait for it....

And ponder this: DUCK FAT PECAN PIE
author: Dama J.

description: This place rocks my world! Brown butter ice cream is like a lady orgasming in my mouth! Will return again, and again and again and again.. I think im addicted.. Maybe i have a problem.. Do they have support groups for this kinda thing? I'm at the point where i might sell my left nut for a quadruple scoop of that brown butter goodness!
author: Tommy F.

description: Vietnamese blue bottle coffee on bottom with secret breakfast on top in a crispy, sweet sugar cone. My mouth waters just thinking about it. So good!
author: Cheryl C.

description:
Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee and Nuffer Fluffer (or something like that).  Gooooooooooooooooooooooood.

But, minus two stars because they ran out of malted milk chocolate and it reminded me of Starbucks whipped cream.
author: Marisa R.

description:
This place definitely gets high marks on the "interesting" scale!  However, if I were craving ice cream, this would not be a place I would turn to.  Plus the two-headed cow and the paintings on the wall kind of skeeved me out.  But maybe it's just not my style.  Overall, this place was a cool experience, and I'm glad I came!

I tried the Tahitian Vanilla, Cinnamon Brittle, Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee, and Olive Oil.  They were all delicious, and we decided on Tahitian Vanilla and Cinnamon Brittle on a sugar cone.  The texture and flavors were great, but it was a little sweet for my taste.  My boyfriend LOVED the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee, but since I'm not a huge fan of coffee, we ended up not getting it.  If you like coffee, though (and real coffee, not like...mocha almond fudge coffee stuff), then you'll love it.

My friends got the Chocolate Smoked Sea Salt and the Secret Breakfast, which they loved.  

I would definitely check this place out for the experience, and I would come by here again if I'm in the area.  However, I'm a sucker for the kiddish flavors (mint chocolate chip!) and wouldn't come here to satisfy a craving for ice cream.
author: Carrie C.

description:
So I ended up having a taste of everything... all were very interesting and all different in texture. 

I chose the roasted white chocolate with vanilla (something like that), oh so creamy and so good, really, it tasted just like Werther's Original hard candy! So if you liked that candy, this is the one to get!

Their cantaloupe cayenne tasted like cantaloupe and the after taste was all cayenne, that went nicely together, but wasn't creamy. 

Overall, they had a nice selection of different flavors, like the blue bottle Vietnamese coffee, i mean every flavor was right on and just in ice cream form. Cash only.
author: Annie D.

description: Was in the area and saw people with cups of ice cream walking around which reminded me to try them finally.  I saw Ancho Chocolate and immediately figured it was an anchovies / chocolate flavor, given the reputation for crazy combinations here.  Fortunately, the "acho" refered to acho peppers and it was perfect.  Not too overpowering of the pepper and the basic chocolate ice cream was outstanding.  Even though I was full from Mexican food, gobbled it up quickly.  Kids size is probably enough for most.  Don't let them shame you into getting a bigger size just because they label it for kids.  Price seemed ok for the high quality and freshness.  Don't know about the other flavors, but this one I would get any time it was offered.
author: Marc S.

description:
Best. Ice cream. Ever.
Rich, creamy and inventive flavors like foie gras. I had to get a double  scoop--pistachio brittle and balsamic...pure heaven! I am now seriously considering moving to the bay area.
author: Ava R.

description:
pics - http://www.yummycrave.com/2010/04/i-left-my-tummy-in-san-francisco.html

Before we hit the road for another 6 hours drive back to LA, we went for some desserts recommended by some locals. As if we still have some room in our tummy, for last one for the road sake, two scoops wouldn't hurt. We had the secret breakfast, rum and cereal, which has crunchiness and sweet never taste so good. Second scoop is blue bottle vietnamese coffee which I think the best coffee ice cream I've ever tasted, strong coffee flavors formed in creamy texture. Strange thing though, along enjoying these, my tongue went numb and it felt so weird...oh well maybe it was just me.
author: Monica W.

description:
Wow. How had I not heard about this place until last week? Big thanks to Frances for having Humphry Slocombe's olive oil ice cream on the menu (which was shockingly good), otherwise I'd still be in the dark. 

Hands down, best ice cream in the city. Well how about this - just as good as Bi-Rite with a bit more originality (and no, it's not a competition between the two, just using Bi-Rite as reference). Every flavor is just a perfect manifestation of what that flavor is supposed to be. I know that sounds funny, because of course if they say it tastes like vanilla, it should taste like vanilla, but the flavors of the off-the-beaten-path choices (the maple walnut, or the balsamic caramel, or the ancho chocolate, or almost everything for that matter) are so pure it's unbelievable. 

And, have you heard about the duck fat pecan pies? Because, they're kind of a big deal. Rich, chewy, without being way too sugary-sweet (no, I'm sorry but they aren't smothered in caramel) - they will, single-handedly, be the downfall of my New Years weight loss regime. And the reason my bank account dwindles to nothing, because those little suckers are expensive! $5 for about 4-5 small bites. *shaking fist in air* Damn you duck fat for being so delicious!

I've already gone out of my way, twice, in the rain, to stop by and get my unnecessary sugar fix. And, even the days that I didn't go, I called to find out the flavors. Pathetic, I know. But what can I say? I'm totally hooked.
author: Kelsey E.

description:
3 stars for ice cream, 4 for sorbet, and 5 for service.

First I'd like to say that their service was amazing, the cashier was very patient with our group and said we could try as many flavors as we'd like and explained what went into each ice cream. I must admit, though, the power of placebo really got me here... after tasting nearly all their flavors, I settled for a scoop of the Harvey Milk and honey graham ice cream, thinking Harvey Milk must be a special culturing process for milk that made the texture different (clearly I'm not a SF native or else I'd have know that Harvey Milk was the first openly gay man elected to public office in California). I thought this was the best tasting ice cream with a superbly creamy texture that was perfectly complemented by the bits of graham cracker... then I found out that Harvey Milk was a person and I realized how much I built up expectations and reception in my head and the true power of placebo. A note about their Secret Breakfast... I don't get the hype... couldn't taste the bourbon and the corn flakes were just weird because you can't expect them to retain their crunch. 

I must say, though, their sorbet is excellent if you are looking for something extremely flavorful. I was handed a taste of the thai chili lime (without knowing what it was) and the flavors (I really thought I just ate a biteful of Thai food) literally exploded in my mouth. The cashier ended up telling me that they use double the amount of fresh fruit or ingredient called for to make the flavor stronger, which I do indeed agree with. But, beware, because it can really be over the top.

All in all, I do like this place a lot better than Bi-Rite (I couldn't taste the unique flavors in the ice cream), and I truly appreciate the smorgasbord of eclectic flavors (no much unlike Ici Ice Cream over in Berkeley). However, my palate is not refined enough to really enjoy the subtleties in the ice cream (hence why I attribute my liking of this place to placebo), so my rankings would go like this:
1. Ici
2. Humphry Slocombe
3. Bi-Rite
author: Debbie L.

description:
Unique and fantastic place. I haven't attempted all of the flavors though. It's worth a look. 

The decor reminded me of the show "Happy Days"
author: Ronnel C.

description:
Humphry Slocombe isn't what its hyped up to be.  

Me, my aunt, and her bf went there around 5:30 and the line was out the door so we did expect a little wait, maybe 20 minutes worth.  We got our ice cream at 6:10. 40 minute wait. 

As for the flavors, they got brownie points for creativity, but there is such thing as TOO creative.  I got a small (2 flavors) of chocolate smoked salt and vietnamese coffee.  The Chocolate was really strong.  It was okay but it was just way too sweet, i was in bad need of water.  The vietnamese coffee, however, was better.  Tasted like coffee so no complaints there, but it did leave a weird creamy/slimy coating on my tongue.  My aunt seems to think the fat content is a bigger. yuck.

My aunt got a small also.  She got brown butter (butla) flavor and balsamic caramel.  The brown butter was actually good.  It wasn't too sweet but it was still different.  The balsamic caramel was nasty though.  I mean, try it first because it tastes exactly like balsamic vinegar. where's the caramel?  She threw that flavor away, lol. 

My Aunts Bf got a small of the vietnamese coffee and the secret breakfast (has alcohol).  He agreed with me on the vietnamese coffee but I did taste the secret breakfast and i think it contains whiskey, but to me, it straight up tastes like grey goose ice cream.  I didn't really like it.  

This place gets a 2 because of the long line and weird flavors.  
The only pluses for me was effort in creativity, nice workers, and the fact that it wasn't too expensive.

Even if there is a long line, try the flavors because honestly, its either a hit or miss. 

or go to this place, bi-rite creamery.  i rate it 10 stars.
author: aimee a.

description:
For years I've been a staunch advocate for Bi-Rite Ice Cream. I've wanted to branch out for some time, but I just couldn't turn my back on my salted caramel. Now that HS got a plug in Sunset Magazine and New York Times, not to mention the Food Network and Travel Channel mentions, I decided that I should try it before the masses tare it down. I'm so glad I did. It's nice to know that the massive line outside is well worth the wait. 

We went on a Friday night and, as expected, there was a mob outside. To our great surprise however the line moved rather quickly. We spent no more than ten minutes shuffling our way down the block. So fret not when you see the monstrous line. The fine folks with the scoops keep the people moving.

When we got inside most of the flavors were sold out, but it doesn't really matter because all the flavors are good. We tried black sesame, vegan chocolate and the infamous secret breakfast, which was by far the best. Before I die I want to take a bath in secret breakfast ice cream. 

There are so many flavors and combos and sundaes to try that I will be visiting many times over no matter how long the line. If you let a long line stop you, you're going to miss out on a lot because usually the line is long for a reason.
author: Spencer C.

description:
I'm beginning to love this place more and more.  I find that every time I go to SF I gotta at least check this place out if I have an Ice cream craving.  My favorite at this place by far is the Blue Bottle Vietnamese coffee ice cream with toasted almond crunch BUT just this past weekend I found a second favorite:  ButterBeer flavored ice cream.  Yes people it does taste like beer but sooooo good.  I also sampled the pumpkin see:  Good, Pumpkin 5 spice: Good, Cantaloupe Cayanne:  Good, Oolong Tea:  Good, Redrum:  Good and  Cucumber Ice Milk: Hella nasty.
So as much as I LOVE Mitchell's Ice cream.  I love HS for their unique and OFF THE WALL flavors.  LOVE IT!
author: Blue S.

description:
It was alright. We tasted every single flavor there and a lot of the flavors had the same kind of peppery/salty thing going on. 

Red Hot Banana -banana ice cream with red hot candies was my favorite. Secret breakfast -bourbon flavor was a bit much

I would say Mitchell's is a lot better. Sometimes weird flavors are novel, but that doesn't mean good.
author: M M.

description:
I would endure the long line, cold weather, and not so easy parking for this dairy madness.  It's good ice cream, but I don't quite have a favorite yet.  Like almost everyone else I do enjoy their Secret Breakfast (booze and cornflakes - what's not to love) and Miso Peach (subtle, but just enough sweet).  

Don't forget to bring your jacket.  Because, Baby, it's cold outside!
author: Heizel M.

description:
Ice cream is such a universal food - everyone eats it or has eaten it, countries have their own variation, it is eaten when you're sad/angry/happy/in celebration of, and it's the ultimate sweet treat.

I was craving ICE CREAM, and I've been to Bi-Rite on many occasions, but never to Humphry Slocombe. Luckily I was meeting my friend right after work in the same area, so why not?

The store itself isn't as polished as Bi-Rite is - my friend noticed that the chairs by the window were made for "extremely short children", there wasn't an extremely long line, service was so-so, and everyone that ordered ice cream couldn't help but take a picture of the window where we sat.  I see Humphry Slocombe as the Bi-Rite with experimented flavors like Black Pepper and Foi Gras.  I really wanted to try their Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee, but was disappointed that it wasn't available.  So while tasting the Harvey Milk Honey Lavender Graham (which was absolutely delicious), and while tasting the Cinnamon Brittle (which was really good as well), the service rep was tapping her foot signaling that either I'm taking too long (which I wasn't) or that I should make up my mind quickly, like excuse me, customers are entitled to decide, why give customers options if you are expected to decide in an instant? My friend also noticed that she was not wearing gloves and kept playing with her hair as she was scooping the ice cream (ummmm....ewww....). 

Anyways, I ordered those two flavors "in an instant" on a cone, and it was just so good! I wanted to take home a pint, but I was certain that it would not have made it home to my fridge. 

Was definitely disappointed about the service, not having the flavor that I initially came for, that cleanliness could be an issue (wear gloves for heaven sakes), and location-wise (not somewhere that I'd venture to often in comparison to Bi-Rite's Delores Park/Castro location where it's more hip).

On the plus side, flavors were interesting and good, and O-M-G - they take credit/debit card despite being advertised as "Does Not Accept Credit Cards" on YELP.

I scream for ICE CREAM!
author: Alex C.

description:
Creamy deliciousness!

I tried their secret breakfast (bourbon & corn flakes) which was very fun but not my 'thing', but went with Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee ice cream which was woooonderful.  Their sugar cone was delicious, too.

It was cheaper than I thought it would be (I think $2.75 for a single?), service was lukewarm and there weren't as many flavors to pick from as I'd hoped (maybe 10?).  I wouldn't mind seeing some topping options, a few more flavors and maybe a waffle bowl?  

There was a very short line at 9pm on a Friday night.
author: Stephanie W.

description:
A foodie friend took me for the first time last night and I was pretty impressed with the exotic flavor selections this little ice cream parlo had to offer.  I wanted to get a taste of ever single one!

I ordered a small cuz which allows for two scoops...one scoop of  the Secret Breakfast (sweetness of bourbon and crunchy cereal bits) and the other, Peanut Butter Curry (which includes house-made peanut butter and Vadouvan Golden Mix, a top-of-the-line blend of garlic, shallots, onions and spices).  At first I was a little hesitant to get the Peanut Butter Curry because I feared the curry may be overwhelming.  Much to my surprise, the curry flavor was so slight, it was the mere essence of the spice.  The spice combined with the creamy peanut butter flavor created a uniquely interesting and tasty combination.  

I got to taste my friend's Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee ice cream.  It was good, but it reminded me of Haagan Daz's coffee flavor ice cream.

I'd definitely be returning to try their other flavors, but the size small was a little much for me...it would have been idea if that size was share between two people.  

The ss
author: Michelle N.

description:
looks like ppl found my secret ice cream place!!! jk

everytime i come here, there's no line. why? it's because i come weekday business hours. yes, that means i skip out work to come get some ice cream =)

Humphry have very unique flavors... flavors that you don't even think of. my favorite is Hibiscus Beet Sorbet.  The Olive Oil is not bad either. The Secret Breakfast is good too! too many good flavors!!!  I've heard about the Foie Gras Ice Cream but haven't had the chance to get it yet. 

They also have very good peanut brittle... mmmmm... 

I can't wait to go back to try more new flavors!!!
author: Kapo T.

description: I left bits and pieces of my mind on the walls of Humphry Slocombes because the ice cream blew it so hard.
author: Kelsey G.

description:
Let me preface this by saying I do not eat Ice Cream anymore.
BUT WHEN I DID...
This is about the best Ice Cream gets.  I had the "special breakfast" flavor 
and was blown away.  Bourbon in ice cream with corn flakes...yup!
I have heard this place gets long lines, but the 2 times I have been there were just a handful of people in front of us.  I am really hoping that when I go back they have some non dairy options like coconut milk or a sorbet.
author: Jay D.

description: Olive oil ice cream, yes you read that right.  Seriously, it has little bursts of citrus.  Amazing!  Coffee is good, albeit predictable.  Truly artisan flavors.
author: Arlene C.

description: Awesome ice cream place with very unique flavors.  Had the bourbon and corn flakes and it was awesome.  They also let you taste their flavors with a real miniature spoon instead of a plastic one .  Small selection of flavors but good ones that you probably haven't seen anywhere else. Very nice.
author: Nick M.

description:
I have been wanting to try this place for a long time and finally got the chance last night after dinner nearby. We got there around 8:45pm which was luckily just in time because they close at 9pm.

I tried a spoonful of the Jesus Juice (red wine & coke). It sounds interesting but didn't taste as good as I thought it would. I got a scoop of the Secret Breakfast instead. So glad I did because the Secret Breakfast (Bourbon & Corn Flakes) was so good! The corn flakes absorbed the bourbon and it was crunchy but not too hard. My friends got the Blue Bottle Coffee (Vietnamese coffee) and Olive Oil. The Olive Oil was interesting, not bad actually. The Blue Bottle Coffee was good, I think I might have to get a scoop of that as well next time I come  here. Yum! Definitely a good way to end the night.
author: Tracy Y.

description:
Fans of the eclectic, weird combos that somehow end up tasting good (i.e. bacon and peanut butter...errr, in my case, fakin' bacon and peanut butter)... rejoice.  This has your strangest combinations wrapped up in a scoop of delicious, homemade ice cream.

FLAVORS: Gotta try the Secret Breakfast.  I'd tell you why, but then it wouldn't be a secret. =)  Just know that you'll like it, especially if you're a Guiness/brown beer fan.  Jesus Juice is great too, and no you don't have to be religious nor a Coke fan to enjoy it (I'm only sayin' because I was asked before).  The Chocolate Passionfruit is good if you like dark chocolate, which I'm actually not a huge fan of but I know my chocoholic girlfriends would LOVE.  My favorites are a toss up between the Olive Oil and Miso Pear flavor.  Both are so refreshing and light and... surprising.  I mean seriously, who would expect that the ingredients you'd normally find in a salad would taste good as ice cream?  The flavors change out... I'd say monthly, so you're likely to get a different assortment every time you go in.  Truly a unique tasting experience.  I'll be back to try more flavors.

AMBIENCE: Not much to say.  A damn cute and tiny hole-in-the-wall with a cute modern navy blue storefront.  There's very limited space to sit down in there so it's likely best to just grab your ice cream and walk around the esoteric Mission area... or if it's a nice day, enjoy your ice cream at Dolores Park.

PRICES: Ouch.  Ok, I had to take a star off for this one.  At nearly $4 for a small scoop, albeit a very good scoop, of ice cream, this place is probably best as an occasional treat.  Nonetheless, this is a novel post-dinner date idea for the man trying to impress his lady of how worldly he is.  Or, depending on the lady, might freak her out that you're the type who eats peanut brittle with bacon in it.  You make the call.

PARKING: Yeah... the Mission doesn't have a lot of that.  You could try the lot on 21st Street and Valencia and just walk the 8 blocks to get ice cream.  Or you could pray to the Parking God that a space on the street will open up for you. Or here's a novel idea - the place is about 8 blocks from the 24th and Mission BART station.  Probably the best option for getting yourself there.
author: Catherine C.

description:
Occasionally the hype is justified.   

I've only tried secret breakfast, malted milk chocolate, and the 10yr old scotch but they were all boner blastingly delicious.

That fuckin secret breakfast with it's crunchy little corn flake nuggets and buttery burboun taste.   
It's the best ice cream I've ever had.  

Ps. 
Talk about names that've gone by wayside in the 20th century.  HUMPHRY.    Maybe it's time for a comeback?  That whale is probably dead or lost in another easily escaped cove... we've gotta keep the name alive, Agnus.
author: Boiled H.

description:
Best Ice Cream!

Favorite flavors in order:

1) Black Sesame
2) maple Walnut
3) fudge sorbet
4) secret breakfast

Flavor I wish they had:
Poppy seed (I wish for so many ground poppy seeds that the ice cream is grey)

Flavors I don't care for:
Olive Oil
Malted Chocolate
author: Grilled O.

description:
I finally got a chance to come here right before they closed the door Friday night. My friends and I had an hour to kill while we waited to get seating at Burma SuperStar, so we decided to start off our night with some dessert.

Flavors sampled and/or purchased:
* blueberry peach sorbet
* white miso peach
* secret breakfast
* blue bottle vietnamese coffee

My favorite out of these were the white miso peach and blue bottle coffee. The secret breakfast was really good, but only for the first few bites. After a while, the bourbon flavor just never leaves your mouth which was really annoying. I used the blue bottle flavor to wash it out. 

Downside is that they don't open THAT late and parking is a hassle. I got lucky this time.
author: Julia K.

description: Incredible -- who doesn't like bourbon spiked ice cream?
author: Peter G.

description:
I watch Food Network a lot, and thanks to them for showcasing foods that are truly gastronomic.

Ice cream is Ice Cream. I already had my share of Hagen Dazs, Ben and Jerry, Coldstone, Baskin and Robins, Mitchell's Magnolia, Nestle, Selecta (yes the latter are Filipino brands) so Ice Creamery like Bombay really is a hit with me. (too bad Bombay closed) So after learning that there is this Ice Creamery that serves out of this world flavors I knew I got to try it and the best person to try it with is with my teddybear and his sweet tooth.

So when he casually invited me to get an ice cream only because the sun is out and warm, I suggested this place instead.

I orderd the Jesus Juice (Redwine and classic Coke) Sorbet and he ordered the Hot Toddy. Both flavors are great. 

We are definitely coming back to try out the other flavors.

Staff are casual yet very efficient.
author: Malou C.

description:
I was pretty impressed with the crazy flavors listed on their website, but sadly disappointed once I realized they never have all flavors available. Apparently I didn't scroll down far enough to read that they rotate 10-12 flavors daily! 

In any event, it was worth the drive just to give it a try! I shared the Secret Breakfast (bourbon and cornflake) which tasted like a semi-alcoholic butter pecan ice cream with surprising crunches. And Elvis something which included banana, bacon, and pb I believe. Secret Breakfast was my favorite out of the two. I def want to try some more of the flavors next time!

Beware: parking is a nightmare!
author: Angie Q.

description: i had the hibiscus beet sorbet and it was fantastically weird. beets for dessert?  yes please. perfectly not too sweet and great texture.
author: L S.

description:
Excellent ice-cream in an ever-changing variety of weird flavors. 

"Secret Breakfast" seems to be a popular item, but did you know there are a variety of unpublished flavors you can request?

Unpublished flavors:

Peppermint Vodka
Dasani Surprise
Cinnamon Toast Crunk
McRibbed for Pleasure
Sweet Clam
Pigmy Marmoset
Off the Deep End
Mystery Chunk
Flaming Lips
Alpha Omega Mocha
Oregon Trail
Inverted Vanilla
Mac & Cheese
Ophelia's Afterbirth
Red Bull
The Ice-cream of Sauron

The person at the counter will likely give you a skeptical look if you order any of the flavors above, but be persistant. They might claim that those flavors aren't real, that they don't exist.

But they do exist! The list above proves that they exist at the bare minimum in list form. 

Existential issues aside, these flavors are as real as dark matter, unicorns, and physics. Coincidentally, those are also delicious flavors at Humphry Slocombe.
author: Nik D.

description: I loved the breakfast mystery ice cream.  It was as good as I anticipated.  I also had a taste of the black pepper ice cream, which I thought was pretty good also.  I was a little bummed when we arrived, to find that they actually dont have every single flavor that they list on their menu.  It was a much smaller ice cream shop than i thought it would be.  But it was still really good, and Id go back next time I visit.
author: Kate M.

description:
I enjoyed the Jesus Juice and a Secret Breakfast.  Tried every single flavor!  the service behind the counter were friendly and nice.  I enjoyed the cleanliness and the spacious area of the place.  It didn't need that much seating because every one is in and out of the place any ways.  They knew exactly what they were doing when they designed the place.

Each flavor tastes exactly as it is described.  coffee tasted like coffee and the blueberry tasted like blueberries.  Another place you can get intensity of flavors is Smitten but I like the price and portions here better.  Parking was easy because we parked in front on a Sunday.  

I love, love, love this place.  If i can package them and open one right next to me i would =).
author: Daphne A.

description:
Wow. Loved the malted dulce de leche, black sesame (more salty than Bombay Ice Cream's, but wonderful), brown butter and peanut butter curry... I got the duck fat pecan pie to go. MUST get the recipe - best pecan pie that I have ever eaten and I'm from TEXAS.

Next time, I'm eating at El Delfin, the Mexican place around the corner on 24th, which has the excellent champurrado (hot chocolate), BEFORE I eat too much ice cream again.

I'm an ice-cream-a-holic and my tummy hurts.
author: Vena V.

description:
Oddly awesome!

Unique for its: decor (weird painting, the cow with two heads), name (it's hard for me to remember the name of this place :p), and obviously the ice cream flavors...

I tried peanut butter curry. It's really good and I can taste the curry too! It's not a strong curry flavor like you would imagine in a meal, it's just a hint of curry perfectly blended into peanut butter ice cream...

Must try!
author: Verena S.

description:
TIP TO OUT OF TOWNERS: if you do not have a car, this place is a BITCH to get to. We came from Fishermans wharf so it was quite a trek through the city. But we had to come and try this ice cream. 

So glad we did! The employees will happily let you try every single ice cream in the case. For us it was: peanut butter curry, balsamic caramel, prosciutto, salt-n-pepper, secret breakfast and a few more I have forgotten. 

We both got the brown butter which was creamy buttery heaven. 

This is definitely a unique purely San Fran type of place for foodies. A trek for sure, but well worth it!
author: Jessica M.

description:
Creative weirdness, I like! The flavors here are pretty odd, but very delicious. It's almost as if they decided to throw random stuff into ice cream and see if it would taste good. If you want to compare this to Bi-Rite, I would say the two are like siblings and this is the rebellious one (for I still love Bi-Rite). 

Shh... Secret Breakfast is one of the flavors they are known for, bourbon and corn flakes. The bourbon flavor is quite strong, but I don't even like to drink and I think secret breakfast was still great. The Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee was also very good. The coffee taste was strong, which I liked. Jesus Juice (red wine and coke) was also very interesting, I didn't taste the wine much, but the coke made it taste good. Peanut butter curry, another strange but good flavor.

They do rotate flavors so it'll be a surprise what you'll see too!
author: Angela T.

description: YUM!  YUM! YUM! Did I say YUM?  This place is great.  I try a new flavor every time I'm in SF, and I have yet to be disappointed. If you can't make it over to their location in the Mission, you can find limited selections of their ice cream at restaurants all around SF, just check the "peeps" section of their website.
author: Shawn H.

description:
Another trendy ice cream place with unique flavors. Good ice cream, good flavors. Whatever the flavor, it will be crisp, clean, and spot-on; not imitation flavoring.  I ordered the balsamic caramel and Vietnamese coffee. Wowsers, I found the balsamic a bit overwhelming, so only get that if you really like balsamic. My fault. I got to switch half with my sister's Dulce de leche: yummy, very sweet. I liked it contrasted against the coffee.  

Nit-picking: I thought the counter people were a bit dismissive. The group ahead of us were adding more cones, more cups to their order and the ice cream scoopers looked a bit exasperated. It seemed as though they would rather the people leave than order more ice cream. It's $3.25 for a "single" (2 flavors) scoop, so why the attitude? Maybe the group had tried all 12 flavors forever. And it was 30 minutes to closing time, so I kinda understand.

Cash only. Not on public transit.  Simple, clean decor.
author: Yan E.

description:
This is the 2nd time I'm writing a review for Humpry Slocombe. Technically, I was the FIRST TO REVIEW this place (just look at who uploaded the first two pictures) but the haters at Yelp decided to remove my review :P

I first dropped by this place about a week after they opened and I remember thinking it was alright, but not quite on the level of Bi-Rite. At least not YET.

Fast-forward to a beautiful Sunday afternoon in March. I found myself in the Mission with some time to kill so I dropped in for another try. My reaction in 1 word? Mmmm!!!! I can safely report that the ice cream has finally met the expectations and hype that preceded its opening back in December. I've had the Secret Breakfast before (the breakfast is cornflakes. the secret is bourbon ^^) and while I remember thinking it was alright at the time, it wasn't anywhere as good as it was today! Absolutely delicious! I also got some Kumquat Poppy Seed (I heart poppy seed muffins) and I was quite happy with it. I tried a sample of the Carrot Mango Sorbet. While it wasn't necessarily bad, let's just say it was more 'carrot' than 'mango.'
author: Cristofer P.

description:
I'm generally not a sorbet kinda person, but after trying the carrot-mango flavor, I was hooked. So refreshing and the flavor intensity was just right - mild, but still definitely carrot-y.
