The secret breakfast flavor doesn't do it for me though... wayyyy too intense, but then again that's probably why its so popular. My boyfriend got the blue bottle Vietnamese coffee flavor and it was wonderful as well. Line wasn't too long and nice outdoor benches for seating as well. Not too expensive (I now compare everything to how pricey Smitten is) and a good variety of off the wall flavors. They also played a lot of music I liked, but one employee gave me a pretty snotty response when I asked him what song was playing. Oh well, you can't have it all.
author: Janey L.

description:
Wow what an experience!  One of the best ice cream places in San Francisco.  I will fly back west just to have the creamy goodies they have. The experience was so good that I went two days in a row.  As someone I know would say, "It made me a fahtso!"

First day I had their Peanut Butter Curry which was absolutely amazing and my friend Crystal had their Miso Peach.

We both were blown away by the space and the amazing flavors.

Next day we went in the middle of the day which wasn't as busy, and the San Francisco weather cooperated. 

I had the Salt and Pepper and Secret Breakfast.  I can eat gallons of the Secret Breakfast every morning.  It would make my work day a lot more interesting!
author: Justin N.

description:
I have heard a lot of hype about this place for years and I decided to finally try it. It lived up to the hype. My favorite ice cream place is Bi-rite but this place is definitely right up there as one of the best. This place definitely has a lot of whacky flavors but there are amazing!   

Flavors:
Jesus Juice- Sounded kind of weird but Red Wine and Coke is a great mix
Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee- Amazing, and I dont drink coffee
Secret Breakfast- THE BOMB! Corn flakes and bourbon goes together like bread and butter. The flavor reminded me of the creme brulee in Gary Danko
author: Elliot T.

description:
I've wanted to come here for a while. Brought my parents here for an after dinner delight. We had Jesus juice and Magnolia stout. While the flavor is very unique, I found ice cream and sorbet a bit too sweet for my palate.

The place is small with some bar stools for customers. They have complimentary water for you as beverage if needed.
author: Eva Y.

description:
I can't say I love Humphreys because..

Yes flavors like Secret breakfast, peanut butter curry and boccalone prosciutto may interest you, the texture is a little off.  It's really strange because the after taste is oily.  I like thick milky ice cream, but no overdone with cream to the point its oily.  And being realistic, the "strange" flavors are great to try but not a whole scoop full.  However I do enjoy tahitian vanilla, blue bottle vietnamese coffee, and the thyme.  With that being said.. I still heart Bi-rite!
author: Joanne H.

description: Love this place. Don't think I've ever had a flavor here I haven't liked, but my favorite is the salted dark chocolate. While the decor totally creeps me out (creepy killer clown painting, anyone??) the ice cream totally makes up for it, and the staff is always laid back and super nice. I used to trek all the way down to Bi-Rite, but this place is closer to me and is, in my opinion, better.
author: Kathryn M.

description: Not the best, I have to say not even in my top 5 either. I LOVED BiRite, so I thought Humphry would be on par at least, but my Eaton Mess (strawberry meringue) was good in flavor but lacked in texture and consistency. I think they get a lot of hype for the weird random flavors, but that's not really my style. One thing that bothered me was that I could see they didn't keep their freezer where the ice cream is stored as a proper temperature. For mine, the guy had to literally scoop/push to the side the top layer or ice cream bc it was a melted mess (no pun intended with the name of the flavor). For a specialty ice cream place and at almost $4 a scoop, I expect them to maintain their fridge at a proper temperature. Half the point of making ice cream is having it set up correctly.
author: Diana Y.

description:
Humphrey Slocombe, you are the music maker and the dreamer of dreams. 

I finally got to try Humphrey Slocombe for the first time on Friday. and then again on Saturday...and Monday. By then I felt like such a fatty going so often I just bought pints to take home. People who know me will say yea...you would. 

They have some very unique flavors and the most amazing part for me is that they manage to capture the flavors so perfectly. Each flavor I tried was so deliciously on point. The strawberries taste like strawberries, the snozzberries taste like snozzberries. Who's ever heard of a snozzberry? I don't know, but I've never heard of peanut butter curry ice cream either. Take that Veruca Salt!
author: Katherine T.

description:
I can't believe I haven't reviewed this place yet.
Seriously the best ice cream in the world. yes pricey and extremely long line on the weekends but very much worth it. 

They have very interesting flavors so always make sure to sample.
But my favorite staples are Dark Chocolate Sea Salt, Secret Breakfast, Brown Butter. You cannot go wrong with those unless you are lactose intolerant.  But then so am I and I just load up on lactaid pills because this is a pleasure that cannot be denied me. I'm sorry sorbet is just not the same!!! Although try their sorbets too, Jesus Juice is quite good ;-D
author: becca w.

description:
Best Ice Cream in San Francisco. (I'm not mentioning any other names...)

The secret breakfast got better with every bite. The interesting but subtle bourbon flavor wasn't overwhelming and was complimented PERFECTLY by the flecks of corn flakes and caramel. You can make it a "meal" by adding a scoop of the Vietnamese coffee ice cream, which tastes like very strong, but very good, Vietnamese coffee. 

Another good combo is the brown butta, which is sinfully rich and creamy, and the caramel balsamic. (I can't believe I just said "sinfully." I sound like a commercial for some diet food they're trying to hype up so people buy it thinking it will taste halfway normal). 

When you're done with your ice-cream, your mouth will most likely be coated in a heavenly layer of leftover cream, which sounds gross, but is actually delightful and a testament to the quality of the ice cream.
author: Kristen B.

description:
I am not an ice cream lover by any means, but it's very hard for me to avoid this place!

Be prepared to wait, it's a small place and the lines are long, but it's worth it.  Secret Breakfast is probably one of their most popular flavors, a good one to try out on your 1st visit.
author: Aalok P.

description:
Very creamy and savory ice cream, similar to the likes of other popular creamery's in SF.  During SF beer week I was able to try some bourbon flavor, secret breakfast?  Also had a jack daniels flavor.  Both of them were interesting to say the least.  I had a small size, which was a good amount...any more would be a little too much.  I did enjoy the blue bottle vietnamese coffee.  

They were also very generous with sampling.  However, this place gets a ton of people so the lines are pretty long, so you have to move quick.
author: Justin L.

description:
Reminds me of Ici in Berkeley.
Flavors here unique - their blue bottle Viet coffee ice cream and oolong tea is realllly good. Sucks that it's so far!
author: Janice W.

description:
When you go to get ice cream, and all you can smell is bacon, you know you're in for some good stuff.  Suprisingly though, the Breakfast flavor - didn't have ice cream in it!  

I'm going to continue to talk about that Breakfast, because the first bite you'll say "interesting" then bite after bite, you won't be able to get enough!  

Like most things in SF, it gets crowded, expect a line if you don't get lucky.
author: daniel m.

description:
I'm a big fan of ice cream, and San Francisco is the place for good ice cream -- with Mitchell's, Bi-Rite, and Humphrey Slocombe all within a stone's throw of each other.  I'm a fan of all three of them, and which one I go to usually depends on the mood I'm in.  When I'm craving really interesting flavors, I go to Humphrey Slocombe.  When you first look at the list of flavors, you kinda think "WTF?" but just go with it... 

I first went in for the Secret Breakfast from the 7x7 list, which was described as "bourbon and corn flakes" ice cream.  But the ice cream was so much more than that.  The ice cream is super creamy and lightly sweet, and then the hints of bourbon come through -- strong enough to taste, but not strong enough to overtake the sweet cream taste.  Then you get a nice surprise, the corn flake, which is like a candied cookie bite.  It's like getting a nice crispy cereal piece in the middle of a sweet bowl of milk.  MMMM.... 

I'm also a big fan of the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Iced Coffee, which had a great condensed-milk sweetness to it.  I've also enjoyed the beer flavors they had for beer week, as well as the Tahitian Vanilla (which is really good, but perhaps just a notch down from the vanilla at Mitchell's) and a few other things I've sampled.  I'm looking forward to trying the Prosciutto ice cream -- they've never had it when I've been there -- as well as the Ancho Chocolate.  

They only lose a star because not all of the flavors have appealed to me -- orange clove sherbet was too clove-y, balsamic caramel was a bit too balsamic-y -- but I think the flavors are so diverse that everyone will find something they like there.  

Trust me, it's worth a try, and they'll let you sample flavors until you find the one that's right for you!
author: Pilan C.

description: People are friendly and their ice cream is to die for! Get the Vietnamese blue bottle coffee seriously one of the best coffee ice creams I've had. Worth the wait in line! Plus you can try all the samples you want the staff are usually super friendly
author: Jewlz L.

description:
Oh, man, was it hot today! Like 65 degrees I think, in SF degrees that's like (calculating...) 99 degrees!  I came home, put on a sundress, and anxiously awaited boyfriend coming home from work, because I knew today was my day to FINALLY go to Humphry Slocombe for ice cream.  

I've know about this place for a long time, and heard all the talk, the rumors and intrigue, so I went already knowing what I would get: the "Secret Breakfast", or Bourbon and cornflakes ice cream, of course!  When I got there though, I took my privilege of trying out the flavors and ended up walking out with the grapefruit sorbet.  So fresh, a perfect cusp of sweet teetering on tart.  The moral of the story being, Humphry Slocombe makes sorbet (the dieter's ice cream) so good that it can make you change your already set in stone mind from something as devilishly good as booze and cereal ice cream (I did sample and will get it next time).  This is a feat, and I suspect they're on to something.

P.S.  All this talk of which is better, H.S. or Bi-Rite is beside the point.  Who cares! We have two amazing ice cream purveyors in the same neighborhood.  Do we care which is better, puppies of kittens?  Of course not! (Kittens and puppies cuddling in a basket is best.)
P.P.S. I crunched some more numbers and 27% of their flavors are liquor based, this is true business savvy and should be taught in MBA programs.
author: Kathryn M.

description:
Secret Breakfast....  

That is all you need to know or care about when you go to Humphry Slocombe the first time.  I was skeptical when I heard about it.  Mix booze into ice cream, call it secret, and they will come is what I thought was happening here...but people, let me tell you, Secret Breakfast is the shiZZ with capital Z's.  The little flecks of corn flakes mixed with just a slight taste of bourbon without too much bite made Secret Breakfast one of the highlights of my trip to San Francisco and has me ready to ask our local ice creameries to make something similar.  I also had the Fluffernutter which was a great pairing with the Secret Breakfast.

The place isn't overpriced, the service was exceptionally good for being staffed by a hipster, and the locale itself was very nice.  Overall, I think Humphry Slocombe, slightly edges out Bi-Rite, but just barely.  Thanks Tess and David for recommending I check this place it, totally worth it.
author: Tony R.

description:
The selection is relatively small with only about a dozen flavors on a given day...but you'll still have a hard time deciding with all of the delicious flavors they offer.  

Tonight I tried the olive oil, jesus juice, breakfast and lemon ginger ice cream (and sorbets) and I enjoyed them all.  

The line was long, but out not out of control...even on the hottest day of the year (like today). 

The folks behind the counter...I think they're pretty cool.  

They have tables with candles inside and outside...an extra special touch.

If you're tired of the same old flavors and the long lines from that other yummy ice cream place on 18th St near the park...definitely make your way down to Humphry Slocombe.  You will not be disappointed.
author: Dudley F.

description: I'm a sucker for artisanal anything, let alone ice cream. I've tried the salted caramel and breakfast cereal option. Both were superb.  Located in an off the beaten path part of SF, but worth a visit even if you have to detour.
author: Kenneth E.

description:
Stupid Slocombe. Opening up after I leave. What kind of deal is that? That I have to come to 24th & Harrison every time I'm back in town to visit mi familia? I guess that will have to be.

What's strange is that almost NONE of my friends who still live in SF have ever been here. I chalk that up to sheer laziness, though. When they're walking distance to Bi-Rite, Mitchell's, Maggie Mudd's, Naia, wherever - why even bother?

Well, Humphry Slocombe is worth the bother, so I guess it's their loss, my gain.

DUDE, GET ON WITH IT ALREADY! HOW'S THE ICE CREAM?
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Great, for the most part. In the multiple times I've been here, I've had the chance to snarf down a diverse assortment of scoops, including:

* Salt & Pepper - Seriously, if someone extracted the essence from a salt & black pepper-flavored kettle chip and injected it into ice cream, this would be it. And for me, it worked. Perfect balance of creaminess, salt, pepper, and sweet. Big fan of this flavor, and the texture was just right. Sure, it's a "novelty" flavor but it's become a favorite of mine.

* Secret Breakfast - Bourbon & cornflakes. Yeah, I know. I see you going, "ewwww." Stop that grimace now and put a spoon of this in your mouth and shut up. You won't be sorry.

* Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee - Exactly what it says it is. Tastes as good as you'd think it would, too.

* Jesus Juice Sorbet - Coke Classic blended with red wine. Sounds like it would be one scoop-sized holy party foul in the mouth but it worked somehow. Like magic.

* Others I've had but am too lazy to expound on right now are McEvoy olive oil, peanut butter curry, hibiscus beet, thai chili lime, and balsamic caramel. I liked all these flavors (yep, even the hibiscus beet sorbet) except the balsamic caramel, which is one of their more popular flavors. Don't know if it was because didn't really challenge my taste buds or if the balsamic-caramel combo just didn't work for me. Oh well. One "eh" out of many surprisingly interesting and stellar flavors isn't too bad of track record.

ANYTHING ELSE VISITORS SHOULD KNOW?
---------------------------------------------------------------
Humphry Slocombe is not in a touristy part of town, unless you're doing that "murals of the Mission" walking tour dealio. The 24th & Mission BART station is about a 5-8 minute walk away, or usually you can easily find nearby daytime street parking, even on sunny, hot weekends (far cry from the situation near Bi-Rite).

I've never found the lines here more than a few people deep, which is pretty refreshing. There is some bar stool seating along the window inside and also a few small tables and chairs on the sidewalk, or you could sit on the tree planters. Or just wander around and take in the Mission. Unless you can't eat ice cream and walk at the same time. That may cause some issues.

IN THE END...
--------------------
I'd strongly recommend Humphry Slocombe for folks who are open to expanding their boundaries with ice cream flavors. Sure, there are plenty of gourmet creameries/gelaterias in the Bay these days, but these guys definitely come up with some of the more inventive combinations that I would never have thought of myself. They definitely take more risks, and while sometimes their flavors fall flat, for the most part those risks are well rewarded. And I like the texture and consistency of their ice cream - not too soft or overly creamy - and the ingredients for each flavor hold their own.

Am I bummed that I only get to eat here a few times a year? You bet. But then again, maybe that's a good thing. I can't buy bigger pant sizes every 3 months. I have a budget to keep and all that.

I'll refrain from awarding all 5 stars until I've tried about 10 more flavors, because I'm a glutton that way. Gives me motivation for those future trips...

4.4 stars for now.
author: Mr K.

description:
Finally got a chance to check out this place after hearing great things about it.

And.....what can I say about it...it's good!

Tried their vietnamese coffee flavored ice cream and it made me think of having a bowl of pho next to me.

hmmm.....love it.

Also had a taste of their Secret Breakfast and that is impressive as well.  I was kind of surprised at the variety of flavors where....simply...i have no idea what's in it.  And that's what makes me want to go back....and go down their list of flavors =)
author: Dave L.

description:
Wow - I totally discovered this little unknown ice creamery !!  The  best thing is that they have all these crazy, yet amazing flavors...  wait, what?..  there's already over 800 reviews of this place? - ok.

Just try as many flavors as you can - they are all good.  The Secret Breakfast was tasty, but slightly underwhelming...  I think the Chocolate Smoked Sea Salt was more intensely flavored, and the Buccolone Prociutto was amazing, and not really as "meaty" as you'd expect.  I really liked the Vietnamese Coffee, but most of my serving was eaten by someone else.  I also had a taste of the Peanut Curry (ok, but I couldn't quite pinpoint the aftertaste...  i guess it was curry!)...  The Jesus Juice (coke & red wine) was nicely refreshing - perfect for a hot day...  so, some other day, i guess.

I definitely need a place like HS in Hawaii...  f*ck a fro yo!
author: erik w.

description:
This review is biased because by the time we got there (9 PM on a Sat) they had run out of half the flavors I had wanted to try. We sampled several  of their "weird" flavors - and the ones here were in fact weird, but not much more than that - the balance of each of them was just a bit off and none of them actually hit he mark. We enjoyed the more pedestrian flavors like Blue Bottle Coffee and Malt Choco, but were not blown away by. We probably would have enjoyed them more if they had been willing to put them on cones instead of in a cup, but they wouldn't let us because by that point in the night, the ice cream was too runny! 

There was no place to sit, the trash was about to explode, and the two-headed deer mounted on the wall creeped me out. In fact the two-headed deer about summed up my experience here - I was intrigued, it seemed like they were trying too hard for novelty, it didn't work, and it made me want to leave.

***UPDATE***
Went to their stand at the Ferry Building on Saturday - Secret Breakfast is pretty legit - boozy and tasty. A novelty but not a staple.
author: Snuffles B.

description:
I love ice cream (all kinds!) and was very excited about visiting Humphry Slocombe, but i have to say i was disappointed!  There is alot of hype around this place from sunset magazine to food network, but it was super soft and melty!  

I tried the prosciutto and my boyfriend tried the special breakfast, but we both ended up getting the blue bottle coffee!  the prosciutto was interesting but i couldn't eat a whole scoop of it and my boyfriend just didn't like the special breakfast!  As far as the coffee ice cream was concerned it was alright, i've had better out of a carton of haagen dazs!  

Although the flavor and texture didn't do it for me it was the slimy film that was left on the roof of my mouth half way through eating it that completely turned me off to this place.  I literally had to scrap the filmy residue off my mouth with a napkin!  gross!!

don't waste your time on this place and just go to bi-rite!
author: Andrea G.

description: I made the journey out here and left indifferent. The flavor variety, although small, was too unique for my taste. What I did have, I enjoyed. This place is designed for the food adventurer. Its also designed for patient people as parking is a disaster here.
author: Eila S.

description:
2nd destination: Humphry!!! (See first destination: Bi-Rite)

Who would have known Bourbon and Cornflakes would mesh so well together! Sounds weird right? But Humphry boasts this ice cream, aka as the Secret Breakfast, with a drop dead amazing Bourbon flavor. I completely fell in love and I would literally have the Secret Breakfast everyday!

My friends and I also tried the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee, Fudge Sorbet, Carrot and Mango Sorbet, Olive Oil, Salt and Pepper. Being a chocoholic, the Fudge sorbet became my best friend and the Salt and pepper and Olive Oil ice cream were my least favorites, but definitely worth a try! Both Bi-Rite and Humphry have its unique flavors, but if I were to choose, I would go for Humphry!
author: Cindy C.

description:
I love the adventurous ice cream here. My favorite is the Secret Breakfast. 
It's great to try the different flavors by taste testing first. I brought someone here and she was too afraid to try something other than vietnamese coffee and another had Thai Vanilla. I tried Jesus Juice (wine and cola) salt and pepper, Thai Lime sherbet and they were all good. The salt and pepper needs an acquired taste. I heard about this place from the food network and wanted to try the prosciutto ice cream but it is never there when I go. 
Usually a long line on weekends. It's nice that I can pack three flavors in a pint to take home. Expensive.
author: IM P.

description: This place was pretty good and it's open late.  Only thing that I would warn others about is the long line.  Try going during slow hours to avoid the long line. Try their Secret Breakfast.  It is delicious.  Service is pretty decent.  I'd go back again.
author: Aban E.

description:
Day: Tuesday in April
Weather: Sunny and warm
Feeling: Pissy (why? I do not know. May have been set off by my disastrous lunch experience at Maharaja.)

So I thought a little ice cream would lighten my mood. 

Flavors: Secret Breakfast and Smoky Salted Chocolate (or something along those lines) Both winners! Creamy creamy frozen goodness in a cup.
Checkout: **Cash only**
Wallet: **Cash free**
Girl in line behind me: an ice cream ANGEL. Thank you for your generosity!
Karma: gotta pay it forward :)
author: Carnley P.

description: I'm a Secret Breakfast fan, but the Earl Grey tea ice cream was really nice.  Sweet cream lightly flavored with Earl Grey - yum.  There was a line and it moved slowly but it was an unusually warm Saturday night so it was o.k.
author: Kat M.

description:
Honestly one of the best ice creams I've ever had. Well worth the short wait (of 20 people out the door) on a Saturday afternoon

Secret breakfast - absolutely delicious
Cinnamon brittle - fantastic
Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee - definitely the best coffee ice cream I've ever had
author: Sam E.

description:
I'd never heard of this place until BF's brother rolled in from out of town and specifically requested that this be a stop on his 1-day SF food tour.  It was fairly empty when we arrived, so I was unaware of the extent of its popularity until we drove by a few hours later and noticed a massive line out the door.  But, despite its legion of fans, I wasn't crazy about this stuff.

It scores big on novelty with its eclectic assortment of unique flavors, but that doesn't mean it was all good.  We shared scoops of Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee, Cinnamon Brittle, FlufferNutter, Honey Thyme, Secret Breakfast, and Jesus Juice.  The most palatable was the Vietnamese coffee, which also happens to be a "normal" flavor that could be duplicated elsewhere.  The others were just okay, except for the God-awful, oxymoronic Jesus Juice that tastes like a bad marriage between wine and ice cream.

Perhaps the flavors were a little too unconventional for my taste, or maybe the unconventional flavors just weren't that great.  BF and his bro enjoyed it more than I did, so it's probably just a matter of personal taste.  Either way, it's a cool concept that's worth trying at least once.
author: Liz N.

description: I've tried Mitchells; I've tried Bi-Rite; Humphry Slocombe is my favorite-- the ice cream flavors are rich and strong and it stays sticky without melting too quickly.
author: Natalie W.

description:
Had the Secret Breakfast (bourbon ice cream with corn flakes), and Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee, on a cone.
There was science to this effort. Cone, then BBVC scoop, then Secret Breakfast on top. This whiskey lover thought the bourbon flavor was AMAZING, although I heard others whisper it was a little too strong. 
Enjoyed the added crunch texture with the corn flakes in the top scoop, then the bourbon mixed in and carried into the coffee of the bottom scoop, which was savored IMMENSELY with the fresh crunch of the sugar cone.
Quite possibly the best 10 minute ice-cream experience of my life!
author: Barry A.

description:
I don't want to say that their flavors here are hit or miss because i really really love it here, but some of their flavors are a little hit or miss. Thai peanut curry? The first lick was good, at least.

There are a few flavors here that make me believe in God. The first being Secret Breakfast: cornflakes and bourbon. Somehow, the cornflakes retain a nice crunch, kind of like those rice crispies in a Crunch bar. The second flavor is fumé, the smoked Earl Grey: i don't know if words can describe how good this is. And lastly, there's the olive oil flavor. I know it sounds weird, kind of like garlic ice cream, but it's so good. Light and refreshing, just give it a chance.

I've also had the chance to try some of their other confections thanks to a fantastic gift box i got for Xmas. Bacon peanut brittle is every bacon loving hipster's dream. The Tahitian vanilla marshmallows are like clouds of heaven. I'm still trying to figure out what i can do with all this bourbon caramel. Also, i'm still dying to get my hands on a duck fat pecan pie i've been hearing about.
author: Phuong M.

description:
Came to Humphry after eating some tacos at La Taqueria down the street. I have heard so much about the Secret Breakfast Ice Cream, I just knew I had to order it.

Prices are very reasonable and one scoop in a waffle cone is just the right amount. The secret breakfast tastes like a frozen shot of jim beam with cornflakes folded in to add that extra delicious crunch. It was super flavorful and really really good. I still need to come back and try some of the more unique flavors, especially foi gras and prosciutto!
author: Thomas D.

description:
O - M - G...YUUUUUMMMMMM.

Favorites were Secret Breakfast (umm...Bourbon ice cream? Hell yes!) and Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee.

Rosemary and Toasted Pine Nuts was interesting and well balanced, and the Ancho Chocolate was also really tasty, like Mexican hot chocolate.

Balsamic Caramel was a little too sweet for my taste, but I can see how others would like it a lot; it has a nice richness and bold flavors.

Also of note: 

The people who work behind the counter are very friendly and let you try anything you want.

They use metal spoons for tasting and 100% compostable spoons/cups for serving, so it's a super green establishment.

The inside of the place is cute and has quite a few seats - more than I would have expected for a place in that part of the Mission.


In conclusion:

It's a good thing I don't live anywhere near this place, because I'd turn into a total fat ass...although I will surely be back soon to see what new delights await me.  Maybe a kid size next time...
author: Sarah G.

description:
So yummy!! 
Lemon buttermilk was FANTASTIC
Azuki Dr. Pepper was yummy
Salt and Pepper was so good when I tasted it as a spoon sample, so I got it as a scoop...and it was yummy but waaay to salty when you have it in a larger portion. So beware...it will probably raise your blood pressure haha.
author: Gato P.

description:
Finally, after seven months of living on the Peninsula I made my way up to  SF to try some weird, bad-ass ice cream. The vibe of this place is really fresh - small but inviting store, really nice staff (the ice cream scooper guy even told us where the closest ATM was when my sister and I realized we had no cash between us), and of course the array of cool-sounding and generally cool-tasting flavors.

I tried the Thai Chili Lime, the Balsamic Caramel, and the Vietnamese coffee - the lime tasted amazingly like dessert-ed lime soup broth, so I got a single to explore it some more. Have to say, while I appreciated how inventive their flavors are, it was difficult to finish an entire small cup of something so assertive. Maybe I didn't try enough to find the flavor that was right for me, but it took the wind out of my sails somewhat that I wasn't satisfied from start to finish. I'd prefer to eat small portions of these as amuse-bouches; they're super cool, but I think some of their flavors push the envelope past enjoyment of a full cup or cone.

Despite this little hangup, I love what they're doing and will definitely be back to find "my flavor". I'd recommend this place to anyone for at least one visit!
author: Megan E.

description:
That Secret Breakfast is MY kind of breakfast.  So generous with the bourbon that i could taste it in every single bite?  Its like you just get me Humphry.  *makes heart with hands*  Its like no other ice cream you'll ever taste.  Go to Humphry, taste it, you'll LOVE it, guaranteed.

Second runners up:  Vietnamese Coffee and the Salted Caramel.....yumm!  Flavors change daily so you're always up for a surprise.  Im waiting for Hibiscus Beet to come back.  Also, they have bacon peanut butter brittle.  Who does that?  It was pretty damn tasty.
author: Juv C.

description:
Humphry Slocombe ice cream is cheeky and creative.  And creamy and delicious.  

The last time I was there, they were celebrating SF beer week and had FOUR beer-themed flavors.  Talk about dedication!  I like that they're not timid and really went for it, as they do with all of their flavors.
author: Lindsay L.

description:
One word: overrated

If you are reading this review and are on the way to the Mission for some ice cream, I strongly suggest you spare your taste buds and head towards Bi-Rite or Mitchell's. 

The variety...eh, it was lacking. The taste...could be better. The texture...could be creamier. I was probably better off going to a Lucky Supermarket and settling on...gasp...private label ice cream. And I bet they have more variety to choose from, too. 

I took a few bites of the McEnvoy Olive Oil and well, it kinda tasted like olive oil, but let's think about this, folks. On a normal day, I want olive oil-flavored ice cream as much as I want puke-flavored Jelly-Bellies. Then I had a sampling of the Secret Breakfast. Really? Bourbon and corn flakes? I guess that's an acquired tasted. I've always thought that that kid in the third grade who mixed ketchup in with rice and beans was a little weird, but hey, to each his own, right? I guess my palette just isn't as sophisticated as "Booger Billy." 

I finally settled on the Ancho Chocolate and the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee. After much reflection, I realized I could have had the same experience on a scoop each of Haagen Dazs' Chocolate and Coffee ice cream. Should have gone to Lucky's...at least I wouldn't have to suffer driving around the Mission looking for parking for sub-par ice cream.  Two stars for effort...
author: Blenda L.

description:
I died and went to ice cream heaven. This place IS ice cream heaven.

I don't think there are even words to describe how AMAZING this ice cream is. It's wrapping the ultimate gourmet desserts and flavors into a spectacular ice cream. The flavors are inventive - some downright whacky - and all very well executed. To die for good. 

I've had the balsamic caramel, secret breakfast (candied cereal in vanilla bourbon ice cream) and cinnamon brittle. Each one is spectacular. 

The service is a little snooty, prices are high, the parking is challenging and the place can be crowded, but it's absolutely worth it.
author: Angela C.

description:
SUPER TASTY. The ice cream here is a true delight to the palate. The odd flavors are fabulous, despite their weirdness. 

black sesame
secret breakfast (corn flakes & bourbon)
blue bottle vietnamese coffee
balsamic caramel
white peach miso
peanut butter curry
ancho chocolate

i tried all of the above flavors, and delighted in them all. actually, I went here 2 nights in a row. first night, I had the coffee with the breakfast. awesome pairing that was suggested to me by the staff as their favorite combo. the next night i had the chocolate with balsamic caramel. 

the balsamic was so strange, and yet good. and the chocolate offered a spicy relief from the shock my buds were going through from the balsamic. 

highly recommend this place, especially as they use metal sample spoons!!! love it. more ice cream places need to pick up that practice. the staff is really nice too.
author: Vanessa B.

description:
What can I say about Humphry Slocombe that hasn't already been said?  Obviously, it is delicious.  Obviously, it is unique.  Obviously, it is well-worth the wait in line.  Any place that serves Harry Potter inspired ice cream is pretty amazing in my book!

Also, try the brown butter.  To.  Die.  For.
author: Jessica H.

description:
Huge portions, tasty flavors. We came for the Beer Week special, and then we ended up getting two additional flavors (resulting in 6 scoops of ice cream). Beer ice cream was hit or miss, depending on the flavor. There was one flavor mixed with white chocolate that was excellent. There was a sour sorbet that was not appetizing at all. We also got their malted chocolate flavor and their Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee flavor. Those were excellent!

I would say overall that this is a solid ice cream place, but unfortunately, there are better places in the nearby area. Sorry, Humphry! You're just second best.
author: Wendy S.

description:
Rating  ::  2.5 stars

Passed by a couple of times and always wondered what they served with the crazy lines out the door and down the block.

Finally got around to try it out there on a Thursday afternoon. Parked right out front! sweet..

Pretty slow day. wasn't too hot and we got to looking at the menu. Samples were of abundance and tried the blue bottle vietnamese coffee, infamous secret breakfast (bacon w/ corn flakes), thai lime chili, and vanilla. I like how they use regular spoons so it's less waste.

We decided on the HOT MESS sundae - 3 scoops total (vanilla, coffee, SB) topped off with housemade marshmallow fluff, Butterscotch, and fresh bananas.  It truly lived up to its name. the guy had to wrap it up with paper towels and sop up the fluff spilling all over the sides before handing it over.

Service was kind of sloooooow. girl who rang us up just came back from her break and was a little....hmm..how should be say. rude. whatever.

Sat outside and dug in! First taste was DELISH!! then the second..and third...and then UGHhh.....thats enough. 

$6.50 for a sundae and we could barely finish it. Not to say it wasn't tasty, but it was way too sweet. Not to mention the ice cream was old. It was not smooth and it had tons of ice crystals in it. DEFINITE signs of NOT BEING FRESH. (Trust - i know my ice cream)

Plus for self service water to wash down the sweetness  =) 

Cash only folks
author: Tiffany T.

description: If you're looking for a place with unique ice cream flavor's come to this hidden gem! I've come here and have never been disappointed. The line can get long, but it's worth it. Also, they allow you to try all the flavors! I would recommend coming to this place on a sunny day in SF!
author: Kat P.

description: Black sesame ice cream - incredible!  Really refreshing on a hot summer day.
author: T T.

description:
Perhaps this has become a bit of an obsession...

We stopped here on the way to the airport. I had the "Secret Breakfast" which was bourbon flavored ice cream with corn flakes.

It was soooo good. You should go here.
author: chris c.

description:
This place is like a hidden gem. My friend dragged me out to grab a taste after reading the reviews on yelp.  The store is cute, you'll see four painting of the Campbell soups on the wall.  There are limited seating, probably 8 seats (the ones where you get to spin around) with a long counter facing the window so you can tempt people who walk by to come in for some ice cream. 

I tried olive oil, chocolate, and blue bottle Vietnamese coffee. I think i fell in love with olive oil. The coffee taste good too, but i still prefer sipping on coffee. So if you're feeling adventurous and want to try some interesting flavor, check out Humphry Slocombe.

Random fact: The person who makes ice cream in the back has tattoos of ice cream on the arms.
author: Christina W.

description:
Came here multiple times, each time forgetting what I had ordered the time before, and always ends up ordering "secret breakfast" because it sounded like "something I've never had before" when, in fact, I had the same exact order the last time.

I'd like to think that it's because it's so good that I forget to remember.  Or perhaps it's the bourbon.  I don't know I don't know.

P.S. Will review the other flavors when I get to them.  Meaning never.
author: jon y.

description: We went late on a Saturday night so basically all the flavors were out but there was still a line. We tried the secret breakfast and let me just say. If you ever had a bad experience with bourbon... don't ever get this flavor. My sister found the flavor to be icky since it really did taste like bourbon but I was eh about it. It didn't really wow me or disappoint me. I did enjoy the occasional corn flakes inside though...
author: Jessica K.

description:
First time at HSIC - we sampled the Cinnamon Brittle, Brown Butter, Wexler's Root Beer, and Boccalone Prosciutto, before I settled on the root beer and S.B. settled on the cinnamon (both on cone).

They are very generous and patient with the samples, and we didn't have to wait in line.  I really liked the root beer because it tasted like anise, the cone was really fresh and crunchy, but the ice cream was a little too sweet for my taste.  S.B. says Bi-Rite is better (I suspect because the flavors there are more conventional).

The only one I didn't like was the Prosciutto - too salty, and the aged flavor of the ham kinda messed up the ice cream.  I guess they are trying to be avant garde with this one.  For me, not so much...

Note: Cash only
author: Burrito M.

description:
After hearing all the hype, I decided to come and try it out. There happened to be a carnivale going on so getting there was a bit hectic. However, it was worth the hassle. The flavors were unique and did not disappoint.
I ended up getting Secret Breakfast (surprisingly AWESOME), Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee (strong flavor and simply super), and Jesus Juice (so/so in my opinion). I also tried the prosciutto, but I was not a fan of the taste. All in all, a great experience and I would definitely come back again to try out their other flavors.
author: C K.

description:
My Slocombe Experience:
1. This place has the best name ever! (+4 stars)
2. Plus seating and water (+1 star)
3. Pretentious flavors: salt and pepper, balsamic vinegar, secret breakfast (funny, but not good)... really? I tried them for the record. Maybe I just came on a bad day? What am I missing here?! Ice cream can be untasty?! I agree with other comments that say its a little too strong for an entire scoop. One taste is intriguing and then its over for me. (-3 stars)

I recommend walking over to Bi-Rite and getting flavors that actually know how to walk the line between innovative AND tasty. This place tries a little too hard and doesn't quite get there.
author: Merrill S.

description:
You know its a major disappointment when you have to throw away ice cream. Tried the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee, Secret Breakfast, FIve Spiced Pumpkin, Balsamic Caramel and finally decided on the Blue Bottle as being remotely decent. First thing I noticed was the texture. The ice cream tasted coarse and chalky without maintaining the smooth and creamy texture you'd expect out of ice cream. The taste was just off. The more I worked on my ice cream, I could not help but long for the Haagan Dazs coffee ice cream I left behind in my freezer. I love Blue Bottle and love Vietnamese Coffee, but they really messed up on this one. The sugar cone I ordered was also stale. 

If you are headed to the Mission for ice cream, head to Bi-Rite (much  better) and Mitchell's instead.  It's surprising that this place can get away  with mixing confounding and unappetizing flavors together in their ice cream and call themselves a business.
author: Annie Y.

description: Traveled to The Mission just to check this place out.  It's a tiny ice cream parlor with lots of different flavors.  I went for one scoop of the chocolate sea salt and one scoop of the peanut butter curry.  They were both amazing.  The ice cream was soft and delicious.  My favorite out of the two was the chocolate sea salt.  The PB curry was great, but the curry was a bit too strong.  The people working there were nice and had no problems letting me sample a few of the flavors before ordering.  There were also some customers ahead of me that requested pints of ice cream to be taken home.  Now that's how you know the ice cream is good quality - when a customer orders 5 pints to be taken home.  Summarize time: awesome ice cream, nice service.  Can't go wrong here.
author: Jesus J.

description: Delicious! I had Secret Breakfast and Vietnamese Coffee which were to die for! The quality and creativity was over the top amazing  :) I pushed my luck and got a scoop of cinnamon brittle, after getting a sample spoon, for walk back to our car , that one is not for me..... Be prepared for a TON of cinnamon ! For some reason the small sampler spoon was great but an actual scoop was too much for me.... but thats the wonderful thing about this place everything is so unique !
author: Courtney M.

description: VEEEEERY good ice cream, I tried it out during Beerfest, and they were featuring different alcohol based flavors. I got a beer infused flavor that was paired with some cherries. It was a wheaty-malt flavor that was surprisingly scrumptious! Definitely worth the wait, and is a spot to stop by when on 24th street.
author: Janelle D.

description:
There's something to be said, to what looks to be a hole in the wall ice cream parlor.  Frankly I'd say "Yum!"  =)

It doesn't have 31 flavors but it does have really good ones at a pretty rich flavor of well made ice creams for the right price.  If you want to have a cool scoop of ice cream in SF.  This is a good place to stop by.
author: California K.

description:
What?!?! This place only has 724 reviews? Well, I get to be number 725. What a surprise Humphry is! I never heard of this place until earlier today. A friend from out of town wanted to check this place out, so I got to tag along for the ride. Tonight's ice cream winner... Black Bottle Vietnamese Coffee. Just the name of the ice cream won me over. Now, I'm not easily impressed by fancy schmancy names like "Blue Bottle", but I do love coffee ice cream. The Vietnamese Coffee was definitely a hit. Love the fact that it was served in a compostable cup with a compostable spoon. Then again, what place in SF doesn't? 

My current favorite ice cream place is Three Twins and Humphry's definitely comes close if not equal. Yum... yay for places that make fatties like me happy.
author: Teresa Y.

description:
Oh the disappointment... 

Pumpkin 5-Spice: Shoulda just left it at pumpkin.
Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee: OK, but I'd actually prefer Haagen Daaz's version.
Caramel Balsamic: first taste is interesting, kinda good... anymore than that, and it tastes rancid. (Also, thanks for the rude "It's vinegar, stupid!" written beside the flavor, Slocomb.)
Secret Breakfast: I don't like bourbon in it's normal form, and I didn't like it in ice cream form either.

Cones: Stale. Tasted like it's been sitting out for months.
Service: rude. 

If you're in the Mission ...Bi-Rite is MUCH better!  (Hell, Dreyer's is better!)
author: Christine Y.

description:
#45 on 100 Things to Eat Before I Die in SF: Secret Breakfast

For those of you following my little quest to finish all 100 in 2010, it has to be said that: I'm limiting my sugar, refined flour, and all that crap.  So, the fact that we're doing this list means that in many instances, I will only allow myself a bite of the item on THE LIST.  This is actually okay.  Especially on a day like today where we knocked three items off, all of them fairly rich on the carb scale.  While my friends felt like they could eat no more, I was light on my toes, skipping along with little stomach angst.

We leave Miette with lovely ginger snaps in tow, and really choose Bi-Rite Creamery first, for #35's Salted Caramel Ice Cream.  But we arrive and they're closed.  Not that Slocombe is a slouch in bed - its reputation precedes it...however, Bi-Rite was closer.

On the way we think of the things that could possibly make up this "Secret Breakfast".  I vote for waffles and bacon.  Friend thinks its pancakes.  Other friend doesn't venture a guess, to leave the anticipation in the saliva forming.

We snag an easy parking space and head in.  Now, as I said earlier, I know going that I will ONLY have a little spoonful's worth of this "Secret Breakfast.".  Friends 1 and 2 order small cups each of it and we oblige to allow me to take a picture of our spoons getting ready to love it.

I take the spoon to my mouth...and....

It's pure heaven.  All I could do was keep saying, "That's pretty fucking good ice cream," while friends 1 and 2 continued to bask in their carb and sugar loving ability to down the rest of their respective cups.  Then friend 1 gets the idea to take it back to the car so that she can put the ice cream on the same spoonful as the cupcake that she got back at Miette.

She does.  She exclaims that there was sex on her spoon as the creaminess slid down her throat.

I mean, what else needs to be said?
author: Tamar D.

description:
The long queue and wait are worth it. 
At least it is for the bourbon float
author: Gonzalo M.

description:
YUUUUUUUMMMMMMMM! I can't say enough great things about this place. Easy to find. Parking was simple, up the side street. There was no line! The service was super friendly and they let you sample everything. On a real spoon! Not a mini-wanna be-spoon. 
  I'm not usually a fan of alcohol laced desserts but the secret breakfast was sooooooo good that I got a scoop, with the chocolate sea salt and they balanced each other perfectly.
author: Martha D.

description:
This is a place I always have to visit when I am in SF.  The Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee flavor is the best coffee ice cream I have ever had.  The secret breakfast is also really tasty.  Flavors are always changing.

They will be opening a new location at THE FERRY BUILDING in October!
author: Jimmy C.

description:
Been here on more than one occasion and leave happy every time. They have some random flavors like curry and peanut butter, salt and pepper, buttered popcorn, balsamic vinaigrette, guiness and gingerbread, bluebottle vietnamese coffee flavored ice cream but all of the flavors are extremely delicious as weird as it may sound.

The blue bottle coffee and their secret breakfast is by far the greatest ice cream ever invented, next to Bi-rite's salted caramel ice cream. When you come here, you HAVE TO GET secret breakfast. you won't regret it.
author: Jessica L.

description:
Okay. I reeeeeeally don't get the hype.

I guess the people who like Humphry Slocombe are those that like to drink for breakfast and like to mix really odd flavors into their ice cream.  Maybe I'm just not experimental enough (I never did try the beef ice cream at that little store in Taipei).

First of all, what happened to selection?  That is first and foremost one of the biggest factors of any ice cream parlor.  "31 flavors"... that's what made Baskin Robbins famous, isn't it?  What's up with this "we only serve 12 flavors a day" bull-crap?  Bi-Rite and Mitchell's both have a much better selection than this place.

I tried the Secret Breakfast.  One spoonful and I thought I felt like I should be drunk, except I wasn't.  All I tasted was bourbon - what happened to the corn flakes?  Don't get me wrong - I'm a big scotch fan, but I don't think it's something I want as ice cream.

The root beer tasted nothing like root beer (but pretty similar to bad root beer candy that I've had before).  The olive oil had a lemony flavor (but lacked olive oil flavor, oddly enough).  The Vietnamese coffee was the only flavor I tried that I remotely liked, so I got a single of that (I'm still kicking myself for not getting the kid's size).

After finishing all of my coffee ice cream, my tongue went numb.  And not in a good way.  Maybe my body is allergic to sub-par ice cream?  I'm not really allergic to much, so I didn't understand why my tongue felt so funny.  I went to Blue Bottle later and had their drip coffee and my tongue did not reject that, so it wasn't the coffee.

Maybe I should have gone for the vanilla.  However, another thing that I noticed was that the ice cream here had kind of an odd consistency.  You know how most ice cream is smooth and creamy?  This wasn't smooth at all.  Also, it was overly sweet - or at least the coffee one was.  As if adding more sugar makes up for the lack of flavor.

I guess it should have tipped us off when we came here at 2:30 on a Sunday afternoon and there wasn't a line that this place really isn't that great.

2 stars, because no one had food poisoning (but my weird allergic reaction is questionable).  Oh, and also for the teeny tiny dining hall water cups that they had - those were so cute!  Definitely the highlight of my visit here.
author: Annie G.

description:
I like sweet/salty and odd flavor combos, so I thought Humphry Slocombe would be right up my alley...but I found the ice cream to be in your face overpowering (i.e. fun for two bites, but not for an entire scoop).

I tried the 
Pink Apple: good for a couple of bites, but too sweet after a while

Secret Breakfast: taste strongly of bourbon...again nauseatingly strong after a couple spoonfuls...the cereal was soggy instead of cruncy as I had envisioned it.

Blue Bottle Vietamese Coffee: good, but I'm not a big fan of coffee flavored ice cream

Peanut Butter Curry: Probably my favorite, but maybe it's because I only had a couple of bites instead of a scoop...think subtle peanut butter flavor with curry after taste.

The ice cream wasn't very creamy and the flavors were too strong in my opinion, I left without finishing my order of secret breakfast/pink apple.
author: Cindy C.

description: Pretty tasty!! Four stars for Originality.  I mean, come on really! Why not w/ flavors such as Balsamic Caramel, Jesus Juice, and Secret Breakfast! Haha, I giggled after each bite because I never would have imagined these flavors be combined...EVER! For example, the Secret Breakfast had Bourbon, REAL BOURBON, mixed in with Corn Flakes. The flavors POW into ur taste buds and leave you scratching your head like really, did I just taste that? This a fun place to go to if you really want to leave your taste buds confused...all in all, tasty, creative and fun! :)
author: Joy A.

description:
I first read about Humphry Slocombe on Eater SF late last year and promptly became a fan on Facebook on the basis of their creativity . With flavors like Olive Oil and Boccalone Prosciutto, how could I resist?  This past weekend (with friends visiting from LA in tow) I finally decided to give this relative newcomer to the local ice cream community a try.

Sad to say, but after all the hype, it was a little disappointing.  We walked in around 2PM on Sunday afternoon and promptly noticed that there was no line (we'll chalk it up to the fact that they just opened an hour earlier and it was a little cold outside.)  

The Boccalone Prosciutto definitely tasted like prosciutto but wasn't really to my liking.  The Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee was too sweet for my taste, and the McEnvoy Olive Oil had a lemony sweetness that I did not really care for either.  I had to try the Secret Breakfast after all the reviews here, but found the bourbon to be overpowering and couldn't identify the corn flakes anywhere.  The Ancho Chocolate was my favorite out of the ones we tried.  The pepper was a nice complement to chocolate and provided for an intense flavor combination.

The texture was pretty gritty across the board, so it must be something in the base that they use.

Overall, the experience was pretty underwhelming.  Now I need to go and figure out how to remove myself from their Facebook fan page...
author: Allen L.

description:
I really do not get why people will line up for the weak flavors at HS.  The root beer, tastes NOTHING like root beer.  The tahitian vanilla...meh.  

The blue bottle coffee and secret breakfast are good, but there is no comparison to bi-rite.  My friend tried to explain that HS uses muted flavors so you can really taste the quality of the base cream that they use, but that is not why I eat ice cream.  I love the flavor intensity at Bi-Rite, and they use high quality creams and base ingredients, too.
author: Amy D.

description:
Came here for beer week. The ice cream was kick butt. The curry ice cream tasted just like curry. However, the hipster cashiers behind the counter were complete dbags. Look, I get it, its the Mission. But in a City full of local, soulful food, service still counts. 

Stick with Bi-Rite.
author: Rich B.

description:
Over-rated.

I mean, I don't get it.  Points for the creativity of the flavors, but the flavor base is overwhelmingly sweet.  Coupled with the dense and rich texture, its way too much.
author: Dave H.

description:
Taking the book of traditional ice cream flavors and literally throwing it out the window, Humphry Slocombe offers an eclectic assortment of inventive and unlikely ice cream flavors that will take you on an irreverent journey of discovery.

The "Secret Breakfast" ice cream, flavored with corn flakes and bourbon sounds a little suspect if you are not accustomed to spiking you morning cereal, but tastes fantastic and is one of their best flavors.  And for all you true alcoholics, they've taken what you are already doing and made it into an ice cream!!!! Hooray for You

Other flavors, such as the "Jesus Juice" sorbet, an obvious reference to Michael Jackson's second favorite cocktail of Coca-Cola and Wine, is surprisingly tasty and is more than just a novelty flavor.  His first favorite cocktail being Demerol and Morphine (Would not be surprised if this shows up on the Humphry Slocombe line-up of flavors next week.)  

I can also recommend the Thai Chile Lime Sorbet, the Balsamic Caramel, and the Vietnamese Coffee.  The flavor components are strong and each ingredient gets their chance to shine.  The bourbon flavor is a bit stronger than most ice cream with alcohol and the Thai Chile Lime Sorbet will get you good in the spice department. 

These flavors are all very tasty, but the only complaint is the lack of flavor rotation.  Other than that, this is perhaps one of the best ice cream spots in the BAY AREA.  
  
Highly Recommended
author: Raphael C.

description:
So I fancied myself an ice cream connoisseur, and thought that I had experienced pretty much everything that SF had to offer in that department. Bi-Rite, check, Swensens, check, that place in the Mission with Indian ice cream, check. But then my friends started talking about this mythical Humphry Slocombe. Supposedly, it was the best ice cream anywhere - the flavors were allegedly magical. "Try before you buy" was the only thing that they warned, because the flavors were, well, um, interesting.

I didn't think much of it until a sunny Saturday in March, when I was wandering around the mission with a friend. Out of the blue, he suggested that we try the mythical Humphry Slocombe. I assumed that it didn't really exist, kind of like the Sasquatch or the Loch Ness Monster, or more appropriately, the mythical pot of gold at the end of the rainbow.

But, sure enough, there it was, and there wasn't even a line. I tried a few flavors, they were interesting, and the nice people at the counter were happy to give me plenty of tastes. There was a coffee ice cream, which really tasted like coffee beans, and some others that I don't quite remember.

I finally settled for the peanut butter curry, which I could best liken to having sex with an indian elephant. First a taste of peanut, and then that curry hits you... whoah. Truly a memorable experience.

I had the kiddie cup, which was plenty. Not a lot of ice cream, but enough for one day. And there will be other days - I'm definitely coming back.

'Nuff said (for now) ...
author: Dana L.

description: I always pass by this ice cream joint and finally walked in after a a great dinner at San Jalisco restaurant.  I had the Secret Breakfast flavor. Bourbon and corn flakes mixed in. It's sooo delicious. You have to try it since its their most popular flavor.
author: Alex H.

description:
We live most our whole lives thinking rocky road or butter pecan pushes the extreme of what ice cream can offer.  Being an avid viewer of the Food Network, I have grown an appreciation for the oddities of the culinary world.  Humphrey Slocumbe is the answer to those of us looking to challenge our taste buds in the form of ice cream.  Whether its the Secret Breakfast (bourbon & cornflakes), Stout, or Miso Pear, you will leave "weirded out" and smiling at the same time.  

If available, give the Fois Gras Ice Cream Sandwich a try!
author: Jason A.

description:
Cloyingly sweet with an aftertaste.  The initial flavor is good, but the rest of the experience isnt.  Flavors range from safe to creative.

Staff is nice and friendly.  The lineup can be long, but they seem efficient.
author: H C.

description:
Mixed feelings on this place.  

Pro's:  Run by a queen.  Sundaes named things like "tin roof".  Pretty cool

Endlessly inventive flavors.

Cute people behind the counter

close to home

Cons:  ICE IN THE ICE CREAM!  WTF, work this out.  Maybe it's just the Vietnamese Coffee kind that gets it but really this should never happen at a high class joint like this.

Flavors get a little too freaky for me sometimes

Conclusion:  Definitely worth a try but I still think Bi-Rite is on top
author: Ryan M.

description: I ordered two different scoops, Vietnamese coffee and Harvey Milk & Honey Thyme in a cup. The board listed the price for a double (two scoops) as $4.25. When it was my turn to pay, they wanted $6.50 [(single scoop is $3.25) x 2]. I said that I ordered a double and then the cashier said that, yeah, they charge two scoops as two single scoops. Huh??? I should have just changed my order entirely but, well, my tummy was just too greedy. My fault. I let myself get suckered into it. Next time I will know better. I'll just skip this place entirely.  The ice cream was good, but I feel somewhat scammed enough to just avoid this place from now on. So many other yummy ice cream places to frequent...
author: Christine T.

description: Weird taste ice cream, there is always a line for the shop, but, highly recommanded, the wait is worth it.
author: Nicole L.

description: One of my favorite San Francisco originals! Best homemade creative flavors ever! I'm a big fan of their Hibiscus Beet Sorbet, Secret Breakfast (bourbon ice cream and corn flakes), Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee, and the all-time fave Jesus Juice (diet pepsi & red wine)!!! mmmmm good. Don't forget to sample!!
author: Nicole B.

description: Perfect dessert choice after a good meal! I had a sample of the much raved about Balsamic Caramel and Breakfast Special. The BC was different. While I commend the shop for introducing new & interesting flavors, it wasn't my cup of tea. I felt like the vinegar was far too overpowering. The BS was a little too sweet for my liking so I opted for the banana, peanut & bacon. Very good - similar to the roasted banana at Bi Rite. Can't wait to come back & try the Jesus Juice!
author: Cheryl P.

description:
BEST ICE CREAM EVER!

Their ice cream is rich, creamy, and every lick is like a little taste of heaven. So much flavor and many unique flavors to choose from.

You haven't tried vanilla until you've tried their Tahitian Vanilla. You haven't had chocolate until you've tried their chocolate malt or chili chocolate. You haven't tried coffee ice cream until you've tried their Vietnamese Blue Coffee.

Hell this is the only place you can try rum (?) flavored ice cream and corn flakes (Secret Breakfast). 

This place is so delicious we spend $5 for toll, $8 bucks for gas, and risk our lives to find parking JUST to spend $4 for two scoops of ice cream to satiate cravings. Yes, this ice cream is just that damn good.
author: Francis A.

description:
Wah!

I came here and was excited for the cool flavors but was disappointed by the selection. The place was located in a kind of weird area, but the particular corner it is on is clean and serene.

I was disappointed because of two elements of most of the flavors-alcohol and licorice. Many of the flavors contained alcohol and I don't drink. And two of the flavors contained a licorice flavor-licorice and fennel. That left me with only two options, one being vanilla-BORING. 

OH well, next time maybe it will be better. I'm still gonna try it again.
author: T W.

description:
So we were in the bay area this weekend for the Bay to Breakers.  On our first day getting into the city (Friday)  I had to do my, "got to do and got to try list".  Humphry Slocombe was one of those to do's.  

Looked up the address through GPS and it was in the not so "safe" looking areas of the city.  But that didn't stop me.  =)  So, found the place very easily and got a parking spot right in the front (which was a loading zone (BF was in the car waiting just in case the meter person was coming around)).  

The line was out the door, but not ridiculously long.  THANK GOODNESS!  So waited patiently and was trying to look at the chalk board of the selection of ice cream for the week.  They also write it directly on the glass of the freezer.  As I was waiting I referred to my good ole YELP mobile to see what people were recommending.  2 flavors were "Secret Breakfast" and the "Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee".  So, I got the BF the Secret Breakfast, because I read the reviews that it was made with alcohol.  I knew he would like that. ;)  I got the coffee.

So I asked for 2 scoops of the Secret Breakfast (pretty big scoops) in a sugar cone and 1 scoop of the coffee in a cup.  It cost a grand total $5.50.  I was like..."AWESOME"!  For the price its a "so coming back again" feeling.

As I handed the icecream to the BF he was like.."is there alcohol in this"  I laughed and said.."Yup".  He was in love!  

Mine was stronger than the usual coffee ice cream.  But still delish.  As I took the bite of ice cream off the spoon it tasted a little grainy.  After pulling the spoon out of my mouth,  surprise, surprise that the spoon was eco friendly and it also said  "bio-degradable" and so was the cup when I took a closer look at it.  There's always a different taste whenever its an eco friendly product.  That didn't diminish the taste at all.  As I kept eating my coffee ice cream, the roof of my mouth tasted/felt somewhat weird.  Weird meaning it felt a tad greasy after each bite.  I'm not sure what they put in the ice cream to make it feel that way, but I can only assume the cream from the coffee?  Will be coming back anyways to try out the other flavors.

The shop itself is small.  Looked like they also offered chocolate chip cookies too.  Clean, white and blue.  The seating was bar/counter style that faced the window.  They also had a small water dispenser in the corner of the shop.  I'd rather get my ice cream and go so that it wouldn't feel as crowded, especially if there was a line outside the door.  

They also do offer sundaes.  Might try one of those next time.  So, if you're in the area and craving an "alcoholic" flavored ice cream, you know where to go:  Humphry Slocombe! =D
author: Noemi M.

description: My friend took me here a couple years back and I still remember the Vietnamese coffee ice cream. It was that good!
author: Thu L.

description:
I love dessert. I also love breakfast. Unfortunately, I got there around 8pm and there was no secret breakfast flavor ice cream left. 

Despite this, my taste buds had an amazing time. I ordered two scoops:  Vietnamese coffee and Vanilla. These two flavors complemented each other well. If you tried Bi-Rite and were underwhelmed, go visit Humphry's! It's creamy, rich and delicious, but not overpowering.

They use Straus milk! Even with no Yelp reviews, I would have visited for some ice cream. If you haven't tried Straus milk, butter or yogurt, I highly recommend it. It's much better than Clover or other mass produced organic milk.
author: Lauren Lynn L.

description:
When I heard the name of this ice cream store, instantly, I thought Humphrey Bogart. Oh well... give it a try maybe it can beat my favorite ice cream store, Bi-Rite. The line was long and it was a chilly night at San Francisco again. After 30 mins I thought it's crazy... why should people wait in line for 30 mins just for an ice-cream and yet, I complained while refusing to forfeit my chance to taste the store than had 1,000+ reviews.

I was served with the ice-cream. Couldn't wait until I got my change back. Dipped my tongue on it. Oh wow..... nom-nom....... couldn't stop eating Secret Breakfast. And what's with this sudden craving now? Now, Humphry only reminds me of the liquorish Secret Breakfast... light, creamy.... *drool*
author: Cliff T.

description:
Out of the Big 3:
Mitchells , Bi Rite and Humphrey, 

My vote for best ice cream in SF is Humphrey. I don't understand why bi-rite is so highly rated. Mitchell's is really good, but you can go to the store and get a half gallon.

As far as most delicious AND ingenious flavors, Humphrey Slocombe takes the cake. They might not have as many toppings or cookies as its rivals, but believe me when I tell you, as far as pure ice cream goes, all HS flavours MUST be experienced. 

There's no point in listing the cool flavors out. Just know that Humphrey Slocombe is the best without all the bells and whistles.
author: Edwin L.

description: If Humphry Slocumbe were down the street from me, I'd have Secret Breakfast and Blue Bottle Coffee every morning to avoid the afternoon/evening lines.  Yes, ice cream for breakfast every day.  Don't judge me.
author: Kevin W.

description:
I come to this place every time I visit sf.  I am obsessed with the Secret Breakfast, which gets better and better every time I eat it.  The bourbon taste is sometimes strong on the first bite, but stick with it and you too will become enamored with the buttery, bourbony, and cornflake-crunch combination of flavors.

Not a huge fan of the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee (but was never a big coffee fan).  Balsamic caramel was pretty good, altho I thought balsamic strawberry combo at Bi-Rite was better if you are going with balsamic flavor.

The 5 stars are essentially for secret breakfast -- a must if you visit the store!

If you are listening Humphry Slocombe here's a suggestion for you -- put more cornflakes into Secret Breakfast.  next time I get it I am also going to make sure that I have some extra cornflakes to make sure that I get that crunch!
author: Ellen C.

description: This place is a little far from the city, and the neighborhood is a little dark at night. You will need to find parking on the street and walk there! We ordered three different flavor and the VIETNAMESE COFFEE is my favorite! It's strong with the coffee taste and sweet at the same time. The RED WINE WITH COKE is interesting -- but the taste of coke is stronger than the wine, and I wish the aroma of wine is stronger (but it's worth a try). The BLACK SESAME did not surprise me like the others, but you can tell they did not water down and you can still taste the pleasant scent of sesame. They offer samples, so my advice is to try all the favor before you order one! Overall, I like the place cause they have some really interesting favor and the price is about right!
author: Margaret C.

description:
Humphry Slocombe... interesting name for an ice cream joint. But I absolutely adore cute ice cream shops, even in freezing cold & rainy weather. A friend took me here when I was visiting SF for the weekend, and I loved everything about this place. Super cute decor..looks like it could just be another house in the neighborhood! 

The employees here were all very friendly, and did not hesitate to let me sample any flavor I so choose. I tried the olive oil and ended up ordering the Vietnamese Coffee flavor and LOVED IT! Authentic vietnamese coffee flavor in every bite... mmmm. I really could not get enough of it. I also had a bite of my friend's cucumber which was pretty interesting. 

I know it is partially due to San Francisco in general, but I loved how GREEN this place was - sample spoons are using metal utensils, and everything was biodegradable. 

I definitely recommend going for ice cream at Humphry Slocombe. Yummy! : )
author: Angela Y.

description:
I was hesitant to try the Secret Breakfast. David Chang's Milkbar in New York has a cereal milk flavor ice cream that gave me a sour face, like why is this good? Serious? 

Well what David didn't do was add BOURBON. Is it a secret that people add bourbon to their cornflakes? Alcoholics must have a GREAT breakfast because it tastes pretty damn good. 

This icecream alone will undo a bad day for anyone. The staff is also notably friendly. There is nothing worse than a mopey face hipster handing me icecream. Geezus you're serving ice cream not battery acid. *cough* cough* Birite!!!!

Challenge your ice cream pallete. I just hate that I can never remember the name of this place.
author: Christina Y.

description:
If you are looking for a place to enjoy some alcohol in a more socially acceptable setting, midday, no brown bags and in front of children, then Humphry Slocombe Ice Cream is your best bet. Dropped by this place yesterday afternoon, and their selection of flavors were unique and refreshing i.e. Candy Cap Mushroom, Banana, Peanut Butter, & Bacon, Jesus Juice (Wine & Coke). 

They rotate 10 flavors everyday and I was lucky to try two of their most popular flavors - Secret Breakfast (Bourbon & Cornflakes) and Blue Bottle Vietnamese Iced Coffee. Secret Breakfast is THE ice cream to try if you are craving that sweet and bitter taste of Bourbon in the afternoon. The "essence" of alcohol will definitely linger in your mouth if you eat enough of it. The Vietnamese Iced Coffee was just as tasty, leaving that strong aftertaste of espresso that  loyal coffee enthusiasts love.

If Humphrey had more flavors available, it may give Mitchell's a run for their money. Until Ube (Purple Yam) is on the menu, I don't think I can look Humphrey Slocombe in the face and say, "This is just as good as Mitchells."

4.5 stars for Food and Service.

Next time Humphry, next time.
author: Joann A.

description:
HOLY SECRET BREAKFAST, BATMAN!

I am not even a big Bourbon fan.  Or cornflakes.  But that flavor is out of this world!!!

I'll be back, you best believe.
author: Valerie W.

description:
Just hit this little ice cream spot up after our Pierna Enchilada torta lunch (7X7 list, duh)...

Had to try the Secret Breakfast ice cream and we were definitely not disappointed. Obviously different from your traditional ice cream flavors, but full of a unique bourbon flavor and a delicious corn flake crunch within the ice cream. I also tasted the honey thyme flavor and will definitely be back to try whatever else is being featured. Very rich and the small size suited me just fine. 

Gotta love days when it's 70+ degrees in San Fran and ice cream doesnt seem like a ludicrous idea.
author: Sarah A.

description:
Made a special trip here after dinner around 8pm and was frankly a bit scared. Other than the street where the line of people were waiting to order their crack, I mean ice cream, the neighborhood is a bit sketch. We decided to circle around once for parking, and if the parking gods didn't magically present an open space to us on a platter, well it simply was not meant to be. But the parking gods really wanted us to try this ice cream. 

We strolled quickly to get there, where just standing in line gave me a sense of safety (safety in numbers perhaps?). Most of the flavors were sold out, so there were only about 5 flavors available. I was a bit disappointed because it seemed as though I would have enjoyed some of the other flavors. Lesson learned - Get there earlier in the day. 

Nevertheless,  I tried the Coffee, Tahitian vanilla, Secret Breakfast, Maple Walnut and Proscuitto flavors. The Secret Breakfast was my favorite. Very creamy and unique. Definitely a must try if you make it out here. Nothing especially mindblowing about the other flavors, but again, this only pertains to the "end of the day" flavors.
author: tessie n.

description: Very foodie-centric. Savory ice cream!!  It's now my favorite ice cream store.
author: Chris S.

description:
interesting ice cream flavors...

great to try but couldn't handle a whole scoop of bourbon ice cream or olive oil or even basil ice cream.

guess i'm not hipster enough.
author: Elaine Y.

description:
Been coming religiously since July.

I love the inventive flavors and dream of Secret Breakfast.  Also find it neat that it's named after two characters (Mr. Humphries and Mrs. Slocombe) from an old British tv show I used to enjoy -- Are You Being Served?

Thank sweet baby Jesus I don't live in SF otherwise I'd gain so much weight because I'd eat Humphry Slocombe every other day.

Cash only!
author: Laura S.

description:
The Vietnamese Blue Bottle is really good.  Can't go wrong with that.  But the most intriguing flavor I sampled today was the Peanut Butter & Curry!  It was surprisingly good, but the kind of ice cream flavor that you can't eat too much of at once.

I did not try the Secret Cereal because I just totally forgot about it.... but next time!  This place has larger portions than Bi-Rite for around the same price.  However, I am still a Bi-Rite fan.  Maybe I will be swayed once I try the Secret Cereal one.....

Can they please also start taking credit card?  People don't carry cash anymore!
author: Anna T.

description:
I tried this place out bc it was on Food Network or Cooking Channel or something. I was told it is better than Bi-Rite Creamery and Mitchell's.
It was not. 
The flavors are very inventive and quite interesting. Too bad the girl behind the counter kept eating ice cream in between serving other people.
I would go back, hopefully before they run out of salted chocolate again.
author: Sammmy L.

description: Went on a Saturday night about half hour before closing and there was a line outside.  However, the line moved pretty quickly and also gave me a chance to decide on a flavor.  I sampled several flavors but went with peanut butter curry and the secret breakfast (real bourbon and corn flakes). Peanut butter curry took a while to get used to but was pretty good once I got used to it. Actually, many of their flavors are so exotic, it may take a while for some people to adjust. The Secret Breakfast was the winner.  It was very creamy but also had a nice crunch from the corn flakes.  It's truly unique and you can definitely taste the bourbon in it, although it's not enough to get you drunk or buzzed.  Only flavor I really couldn't get used to was their McEvoy Olive Oil.
author: Les S.

description:
Yummy!  I had vietnamese coffee + blood orange sorbet.

I still think smitten is better though.
author: T Y.

description: We went to H&S on a freezing saturday afternoon a few moons ago and I was taken aback at the mile long line sprawling outside the door. So we waited in wild  anticipation and finally got to the counter where we sampled a few ice creams and were impressed by everything we tried. We proceeded to order the secret breakfast, vietnamese blue bottle coffee and smoked chocolate with seasalt. Let me say they were all undeniably incredible. Deeeevine with a capital D. The secret breakfast was a bourbon ice cream which had a strong note of... Well whiskey! offset with crunchy n sweet cornflakes. The combination is perfect. The Vietnamese coffee was amazing as well and the smoked chocolate had a higher concentration of salt which kept it from being the plain ole chocolate. The ice cream was creamy as an any superior ice cream should be. As for the store it's tiny and has some interesting art adorning it. The place also smells of caramel. Note: cash only!!
author: Natasha I.

description:
I just might have wiped drool from the corner of my mouth.

Reading these reviews and thinking about my own review, yes it is tru, it was drool! Humphrey I think I am in love with you, but not nearly as much as my husband is,

We regularly venture out on a lunch date or a quick trip in sweats after dinner for PINTS!!! Thats right we get pints all the time. Always  hand packed. And everyone there is super friendly. My fave is Chcoclate Smoked Sea salt, second, Brown Butter, and ohhhhh the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee! 

I can't take it....I want them all. 

Thanks Humphrey, I trully am in L.O.V.E!
author: Cara G.

description: I am a big fan of the Humphry Ice Cream place that I had to update my review. Too many flavors to try so i have to go back again-darn!
author: Dianne P.

description: Some friends suggested we try this ice cream shop in the heart of the Mission.  I had the grapefruit sorbet on a sugar cone and it was very tasty.  Honestly when and if (and it's rare) I hit an ice cream shop I like a generous scoop of cream, I mean lay it on me.  SO I go three stars because I received a small scoop of sorbet like it's some artisan ice cream in Paris or something.  All good.
author: H H.

description:
I love sweets, and my usual spot for ice cream is Mitchell's, but my sweet tooth lured me in one night. The shop has some interesting flavors, but after a few tastes, Vietnamese coffee was the winning choice!

Staff is super friendly and ice cream is reasonably priced. Will definitely drop in again if I'm in the area.
author: crystal e.
