description: One of my friends from the hostel worked here for a bit and would bring me home pints of Harvey Milk. I love her, I love Ireland for bringing me Granie and I also love ice cream. Thank you HS!! Good job on hiring awesome kine.
author: Marina M.

description:
My friend and I made a point to go to Humphry Slocombe while visiting from Canada.
We walked all through the great Mission area, we had a great day and we wanted to finish it off with a great ice cream. How happy we were to finally get there to savour the reputable product. Well, first the flavour I wanted wasn't offered that day but the worse was the very unfriendly service we got from a miserable young man who seemed to really not want to be there! We tried the friendliness approach, but it didn't work! He wouldn't crack a smile if his life depended on it. We got a cold, stern and silent service. I was not impressed!  We still savoured our delicious ice cream but unfortunalely he put a damper on our perfect day.
Very disappointing! I will not recommand this place nor go back.
author: Sylvie C.

description:
I stumbled on this place accidently, and was sper excited to try the much talked about humphry slocombe's. I sampled a few options but ultimately decided on the drunken breakfast (with rum and cornflakes). overall, the experience was definitely meh. the first bite was great, but the it was diminishing returns thereafter, and i wasn't even able to finish the cone.

at the end of the day, there's no place that beats bi-rite!
author: Danielle J.

description: May be the best in the city. Which means NATION DUH. REally creative flavors
author: Heather P.

description: salty sweet and good to eat. It's really delicious. I happened to go at a good time so the line wasn't long. I'd go back next time I have an ice cream craving. Parking is impossible in that area, so take public transit if you can.
author: Shanee B.

description:
Secret Breakfast.

I am a convert.

I walked into HSIC and was almost immediately disappointed by the offering of flavors. What was this frou-frou white-tablecloth top-chef schlock? I searched the case looking for a familiar flavor.

Nothing.

So I started sampling. And sampling. And sampling. Some flavors were too sweet (Apple Cranberry and Chocolate sorbet, I'm looking at you). Some were a little too understated (McEvoy Olive Oil). 

But like Goldilocks, I eventually found something just right: Secret Breakfast. Bourbon and cornflakes? Sounded silly, but tasting was all I needed to set myself right.

The ice cream here is extremely well-made. There's not an ice crystal to get in the way of the silky-smooth, low-overrun ice creams here. The ingredients are top shelf.  The ice cream is served at the perfect temperature. Jake is a friendly, welcoming presence. And most of the time it isn't overwhelmingly busy.
author: Lindley E.

description:
I would love to start every morning with a scoop of Special Breakfast. Cornflakes and bourbon in iced cream form? I have died and gone to heaven.

The olive oil ice cream is divine....and I would come here for those flavors alone.

The drawbacks: the location...far from me and not available yet at my favorite bougie retailers in the bay area. 

Dear Humphrey- please reproduce your slocombe. Love, Mai-Ling.
author: Stella G.

description:
Was cravin some bi-rite but my bf mentioned one of his friends suggesting humphry bogart... I said "what?!" and we later found out my bf's friend actually said humphry slocombe!

Anyways, back to this review.  I love the unique flavors they have.  Harvey Milk ice cream = 5*! I could taste the honey and the lil graham cracker bits add a nice crunch! 

I also got Vietnamese Coffee = 5*! Nice bold coffee flavor!

Secret Breakfast is HELLLLLLA good! If you like bourbon and cornflakes, omg. this is the ice cream for you! just try it! it's worth a spoon full!

Texture and consistency of the ice cream = 4.5* mainly because I got a weird feeling in my mouth after eating a few bites... the feeling reminded me of when I would eat too much of the Starbucks whipped cream they put on the Frappuccino drinks... 

Price = fair for the product, especially a 2 scoop ($3.75 compared to 1 scoop for 2.75!)
Atmosphere = nice bench top with probably 6-7 stools to sit on while people watching
Line = Came here at 8:30 with a line of about 20 people. Got served at around 8:58, but the wait isn't so bad if you have a group of people!

*WARNING: Come earlier than I did because they ran out of some of their flavors!!!*

I'm definitely coming back!
author: Roxanne K.

description: great service, everyone is super friendly. nice small little ice cream shop with a few counter seats. interesting flavors like butter beer and breakfast with corn flakes. and they also make floats and small dishes. the blue bottle viet coffee is good and so is their oolong tea flavor. the ice cream is pretty good here, but I'm giving it an A-OK just because I've had some pretty darn good ice cream/sorbets in the east bay. but If I'm in the area again, I would def consider coming here again.
author: Serena L.

description: i'd say this place is a distant 2nd to Bi-Rite.  The Secret Breakfast was good the first couple of spoonfuls but I wasn't really feeling the whole bourbon/cornflake thing. The Sea Salt Chocolate was kinda blehhh.   But the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee was awesome.  Good to try but don't think I'll frequent too often as much as Bi-Rite.
author: Tony L.

description:
At first, I was honestly quite skeptical of this place because of all the hype surrounding it... and the fact that the approach of this place is a bit too much on the "we are from a culinary holy place, so you MUST like it" spectrum for me (much like their pal Chris Constentino, who I can only take in minor doses)... I personally always take the approach to both food and wine of "eat and drink what you f*cking like" and don't let anyone tell me whether I should or shouldn't go gah-gah over something... but I digress :)

It was really good!!!  Very different from Bi-Rite (stop comparing to Bi-Rite folks... their philosophy around flavors and approach here is just so different from Bi-Rite I think it's unfair to compare) - but very pleasing in its own right.  I agree with one poster that the Vietnamese Coffee ice cream was the "best coffee ice cream ever".  Yes, that WAS the bomb - and definitely the best I've ever had and I LOVE coffee ice cream.  The Cinnamon Brittle I had was also excellent and not too sweet - much more of the cinnamon and nutmeg flavors which had me very happy, although a bit more brittle "crunch" would have been good.  The "proscuitto" and "olive oil" flavors were a bit too overpowering for me... but again, back to personal taste :)

Admittedly, I find almost every flavor I have at Bi-Rite extremely appealing and tasty... not so here.  BUT, I get their schtick and what I did choose was extremely high quality and very, very pleasing.  And they are walking distance from my house and Bi-Rite is not... so they may win more patronage from me by default :)
author: Chris P.

description:
I admire those who experiment with their creative juices and freeze it into a delicious creamy thing called ice cream. 

Don't get me wrong, I love the basics like chocolate and vanilla. But, when you are looking for a tasty experience to take off in your mouth, definitely go to Humphry Slocombe. 

When I heard they took Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee and made it into an ice cream treat, I was there lickety split. Oh YUMMMMM...this coffee fanatic was not disappointed. More please.

My other favorite is Ancho Chocolate which has a little kick from Ancho Chiles. If you read my reviews, then you know I drool over spicy hot gourmet. Now, they just need to come up with a flavor that has Sriracha Sauce as an ingredient. I would be all over that like Sriracha on Pho. 

My co-worker is absolutely hooked on Secret Breakfast which is a mix of cornflakes and bourbon...imagine that? Yes, you mid-day office workers can get your alchy on before Happy Hour with a bourbon induced sugar buzz. 

Overall: In San Francisco, we are blessed with creamy treats from Mitchells and Bi-Rite, but don't overlook Humphry Slocombe. Experience their creative creamy indulgences. What other place serves up Foie Gras ice cream? Be bold, just lick it!
author: Liz K.

description:
Fun little ice cream parlor with unique flavors!  :)

There was a long line when I got there but when I got to the front to place my order, I understood why.  Not only is the ice cream good but when you get to the front, they ask if you want to sample any flavors.  So the line might move a little slower but well worth the wait.

I sampled the Jesus juice (not a fan) and two other flavors, decided to go with the Secret Breakfast which is made of bourbon flavored ice cream with cornflakes.  MmMmM!

Try and come at a reasonable time, some of the good flavors do sell out.
author: Jennifer N.

description: 12 flavors daily. I tried 6 of them and after careful evaluation I ended up getting a scoop of the Secret Breakfast (bourbon and cornflakes) and the Cinnamon Brittle. I  LOVE the cool innovative flavors like Salt 'n Pepper, Guiness Gingerbread, Peanut Butter Curry, and Blue Bottle Vientamese Coffee. How did I not know about this place sooner?! The quality of ice cream is comparable to Bi-Rite Creamery but the flavors are definitely more funky. I WILL BE BACK!
author: Debbie C.

description:
Lester and my 3 scoop bowl of ice cream ($5): 
-Boccalone prosciutto- i can taste the creamy meat fat more than the saltiness of the prosciutto. 
-Jesus juice- quite refreshing. 
-Secret breakfast- an alcoholic's delight =]

Mikey and Erica's bowl of goodness: 
-Szchuan strawberry- very fresh strawberry flavor. 
-Maple walnut- i was tasting everything so fast that i couldn't taste it too much. 
-Balsamic caramel- good balance of flavor.

Love people watching.
author: Connie M.

description: As a semi ice-cream expert, I'd like to say that my experience wasn't as amazing as I had hoped for. When I went the line was extremely long and the service was ultra slow! Speaking of the service, the workers there barely said a word to me and ignored me even! I had ordered the Secret Breakfast (which wasn't even that good) and the lady just said okay with no enthusiasm. Where as the people behind me who looked homeless got more attention! This place was just so disappointing. Plus the flavors were too funky for my taste. Definitely sticking to Bi-Rite or Mr and Mrs Misc!
author: Susie N.

description: If you're in the area, I highly recommend Humphry Slocombe.  They rotate through an interesting range of flavors.  My favorite is the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee which gets rave reviews from many others as well.  They also proudly serve a secret breakfast flavor made with cornflakes and bourbon. The texture of their ice creams are heavier than both Ici and Bi-Rite, but not as heavy as Mitchell's or Fentons.  Its an interesting combination of modern flavors with traditional texture.
author: David O.

description:
Tried this place at the suggestion of a coworker and, yes, it's good!  The Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee has a very rich coffee flavor, it's very strong.  The Secret Breakfast is better than you would expect from bourbon ice cream, but it was a little heavy and caramely for my tastes.  There was a hugely long line, but they seem to serve up your ice cream pretty quickly, and there's no doubt that the interior and exterior are very cute.  

I'd love to come back when they're serving Oolong tea ice cream.
author: Jessica N.

description:
FINALLY made it here yesterday. Ah- mazing. It was fun to try all the different, very unique flavors, before actually getting a couple scoops. 

Staff was friendly, encouraged us to try the crazy flavors. 

You gotta try it! Do it.. go while its hot.. i mean.. ya, right?!
author: Art A.

description:
Loved this and I don't even like ice cream!!

Much better than Bi-rite creamery. Their ice cream is light and not too sweet.  

Had the olive oil flavor which is really a weird, but yummy taste sensation!

Was back twice in a week!
author: Rossini P.

description:
I'm not a huge sweets person but Humphry's is pretty awesome. My roommate swears by this place so I had to try it. Secret Breakfast is my fav so far, and I also tried the sea salt chocolate??? flavor, which was also very good. If your in the mood for gourmet ice cream with a twist, this is the place to go. 

Also noted is the 2 headed calf head on the wall... very interesting.... 

Enjoy!
author: Byron C.

description:
Humphry Slocombe Ice Cream celebrated SF Beer week in a big way: Ice cream flavors based on beer!! Oh hell to the yes!!!

The several flavors I tried were impeccable. I don't even like beer, but these flavors got me. I tried to see if I could buy a pint of one of the specialty flavors, but unfortunately they were only selling by the scope. Thankfully their regular flavors are available for pint purchases so we picked those up, as well as the burboun caramel sauce, & frosted almonds to make sundays at home.

Last note, try the beacon peanut brittle. So good!
author: Michelle G.

description:
What better way to spend a warm sunny Sunday afternoon than with a boy and an ice cream cone...mmMmmm....

FYI: the single scoop comes with 2 (TWO) flavors...AND they let you sample...so i took full advantage and tasted the Jesus Juice (red wine & coca cola). Had there not been a line out the door, I would have stood there and tasted ALL the flavors...

For my 2 flavors, I ordered the secret breakfast (bourbon and cereal) and the coffee (blue bottle coffee)...Yowza! The boy ordered the coffee and caramel..however, his caramel was a tad too sweet...
author: Sue L.

description:
Cornflakes and bourbon is the way to go.  I'm not a huge ice cream person, well not a huge sweets person in general but this ice cream was awesome.  The flavor, the texture, the double headed taxidermy calf head openly displayed for customers, and the enthusiasm of my friends is what made the trip enjoyable.

You can walk out with one scoop for about $3.
author: Ashley I.

description:
Good stuff.  I love trying all of the (non-meaty) flavors and picking a favorite.  It's usually hit or miss, but love it when I hit upon an unexpected flavor that just tastes so right.

I'm a huge fan of their Secret Breakfast, beer ice creams, and rose petal creme fraiche (yum!).  Their honey thyme is also a favorite, and possibly a more normal variety.

Not my favorite ice cream in the city (3 twins I love you!), but it's delicious, and I'd definitely go more if it were closer.
author: Shila S.

description:
I read my sister's review and I had to give it a try.  And it was down the street from my other snack taste site.

I come here, I like the setting.  The guy that was up front was really friendly and since they had some flavors I have never tasted.. I asked for few samples..and he had no problem.

Place was clean!! and even the bathroom.. which is always a plus in my book.  

The price is decent.. but for what you get... excellence.  

I got the Jesus Juice (red wine + coke sorbert)... and My wifey got the Malted milk chocolate... Wow

Great ice cream and very unique in flavors.  

I will come back often.
author: Roger A.

description:
I've officially joined the fan club! 

There are so many ice cream places popping up and I'll admit I can't tell much of a difference between them. Mainly because they are all pretty good! I don't really have a loyalty to any specific ice creamery but Humphry Slocombe got me very excited with their exotic, unusual and delicious flavors. 

After dinner on 24th Street, I saw this blue little store and before even reading the store sign, I knew what it was. I've had H.S. bookmarked on my yelp since the first days it opened and here it was, right before my eyes! There was no way I could not go in. 

I sampled the Olive Oil, Secret Breakfast and Miso White Peach. I could have easily eaten full sized scoops of ALL of them but I opted for the Miso White Peach. I think we're all familiar with the savory Miso soup served at Japanese restaurants but the Miso used for sweet ice cream added a great texture and nutty flavor to the peach ice cream. It was surprising and wonderfully tasty! 

My theory is if they can make miso and olive oil taste great, of course the rest of their flavors will be delicious... if not better. No doubt, I will be back!

Sidenote: There's a two headed cow on their wall. so COOL!
author: Julia T.

description:
I love ice cream. I try to contain it, I rarely eat it. 

See, ice cream is the hulk inside of me. 

Really nice folks work here, high five for that. And frankly, Humphrey Slocombe has the best ice cream in sf. Secret Breakfast favor, BE MINE XOXO! This place will make you appreciate ice cream in a whole new way. The flavors are rich, innovative, and hot damn delicious! 

You and only you, HS: You have my inner hulk forever.
author: Liz F.

description:
Humphry Slocombe, even though you ran out and did not offer some of the flavors that I wanted to try, I'll give you the benefit of doubt. Let's just say that their unique flavors of ice cream may take a while to get used to. 

- Blueberry nectarine yogurt: It tasted a little salty at first, but I think it was the burst of flavors that screwed my taste buds up and after a while it was actually pretty good. 

- Blue bottle vietnamese coffee: Wowzers, this one is rich/creamy/strong and gives you that extra kick of caffeine high exactly like Vietnamese coffee. 

Parking was not too easy in this neighborhood, line was formed inside the shop, stuck behind a person that smelled like armpit the whole time in line, flavors crossed out on the chalkboard, no balsamic caramel that I came here to try (boo!), and lady in pink was out (So curious about this flavor!) = all worth it in the end. 

P.S. You can get up to two different flavors in a single scoop, up to three in a double scoop, etc. Oh yeah, CASH ONLY. Remember your skriLL!!!
author: Tracy T.

description:
Ice cream in SF is an embarrassment of riches as far as I'm concerned.  Where I live in North Bernal, I'm close to at least three wonderful and innovative places.  But when H.S. opened a few years ago, it was the closest of all and I was excited.  They have not disappointed.  I love that they take risks, and often succeed.  While Jesus Juice, coke and red wine, was *not* to my taste - it at least has a fun name, and I enjoyed a sample - just no more than that.  Other flavors, though, have knocked my socks off: Vietnamese Coffee, Salted Watermelon sorbet, Brown Butter, and even Candy Cap (mushroom) flavor I had tonight.  Tasted like maple, you'd *never* guess it was based on mushroom flavoring.

When I went in tonight, I was on a mission.  I'd had a particularly crummy day, and had even been reduced to tears.  To cheer myself up, I went for an ice cream sundae - for dinner.  I stopped by, and got the sundae with bananas, butterscotch and marshmallow topping - with vietnamese coffee and candy cap ice creams. The flavors combined were the bomb. Very sweet, yes - but just what the doctor ordered.  My husband got chocolate fudge sorbet.

On top of this, the staff gets extra thumbs up. Always nice, but they outdid themselves. I happened to mention my crappy day story, and the lovely woman ringing me up said that I deserved my sundae for free.  I was dumb-founded and, for once, speechless. I almost lost a few more tears, just for the simple kindness of it. I kicked in a few bucks for a tip, but I also promised myself to get this review done ASAP.  They deserve the 5 stars for sure.  What a wonderful place!
author: Fran C.

description:
I love the eccentric flavors. If you want to deviate from the conventional ice cream, then this is the perfect place. 
So far I have only tried a few flavors, but they were all very good. The Boccalone Prosciutto, Peanut Butter Curry, Tahitian vanilla and Vietnamese Coffee are all delicious. But I would have to say that my favorite was the Brown Butter .
author: Renee E.

description:
NOT impressed. I have been to many ice cream / frozen yogert places and this one was the worst by far. I tried several flavors and ended up picking Honey Thyme cause it was the only one that i could have even attempted to eat. I didn't even finish the small kids cone! 

I know that the odd ball flavors are their thing, but at least make them tasty. I will have to say that i would not return, unless forced by a gun. I am glad to have done something special in SF, but that is as far as i would take that!!
author: Heather P.

description:
Humphry's has the most interesting/unique ice cream flavors you've ever seen.  But sorry to say the tastes of these flavors is just ok, maybe missing a little something?  Secret breakfast with bourbon and there was another ice cream with stout in it, both good if u want your ice cream and alcohol fix at the same time.  Vietnamese coffee flavor, tastes like regular coffee. 

Ice cream isn't bad here.  Didn't really care for oily (fatty?) film you get at the roof of your mouth/tongue; weird.   
Do come here to check out the neat flavors though.
author: j h.

description:
This place is just okay... yes... just okay.

Tried several flavors: Olive Oil, Cucumber, Secret Breakfast & Blue Bottle Vietnamese coffee. Wasn't crazy about any of them but if I had to pick a favorite out of these, it would be the Coffee.

I'd much rather spend my money and indulge my taste buds at Bi-rite or Mr. & Mrs. Miscellaneous.
author: Goober S.

description:
Please note that the experience this yelper had was definitely x-rated and this is definitely ice cream for grownups. HS takes ice cream to the next level.

It is rare that I experience that that is known as a foodgasm... but I had multiple in succession here. After trying a few samples out, I settled on Secret Breakfast, with a contrasting sorbet of Limoncello.

The nice thing about HS is that the ice cream and the sorbet are both so creamy and smooth, they simply roll down your throat like they were always supposed to be there. The limoncello was peppered with chunks of lemon, and unlike other sorbets, the flavours were pretty muted. Normally, I like a lemon sorbet to pucker me up like no other, but I did dig this one. It was not to rock and roll levels, but it was definitely an understated treat. 

Now, on the other hand, the Secret Breakfast had me on my knees. The bourbon simply hums throughout the ice cream on a note that was just in tune with every taste fibre of my being. The occasional crunch from the cornflakes just simply pushed me over the edge into pure unbridled joy. If you haven't, you must. If you have, then you know what I mean.
author: Catriona C.

description: The secret breakfast flavor is made up of bourbon and cornflakes (breakfast of champions). You can definitely taste the bourbon and a hint of saltiness from the cornflakes. It is creamy  and the texture from the cornflakes and kick from the bourbon does add a nice surprise. Get it on the cone, the crunchiness only adds to the flavor of the ice cream.
author: Eve C.

description:
Is the ice cream ok? sometimes. Is it mind blowingly  good with flavours that always work together? HELL NO.

Is it the most pretentious ice cream place ever? There is a good chance the answer is HELL YES.

My spouse loves this place. She also loves twitter, thought rednecks didn't really exist in the USA and has weakness for hipster crap. So yes she find the taxidermied wall art cute rather than insulting and tacky like I being the kid of bambi killers and rednecks find it.

Now that we've dealt with the ugly hipster decor on to the important thing: the ice cream. It gets all my stars for trying new things and then it loses three for not delivering ice cream that tastes good.

Secret Breakfast? more like boring soggy breakfast, corn flakes are good because they are crunchy but not here and so what if it has alcohol in it. They may as well just make it with PBR since that's what the clueless hipsters consider decent alcohol. 

I've been here about a dozen time, ie where ever the spouse sees an interesting flavour posted to twitter and despite all the radical flavours they create, I can't remember one that made me want to go back.

Not to mention they have mexican chocolate ice cream but of course being hipsters they have to rename it.

place I would go to before this place: Bi-rite, Maggie Mudd's, the Indian place on Valencia, Naia in the Castro, the three or four good places on Geary and Ici in the East Bay.
author: DeathandFood H.

description: I had the breakfast icecream w/ vinegar-- amazing. The place is super cute too.
author: E B.

description:
I'm jumping on the strange-flavored ice cream bandwagon. 

Who knew an oatmeal stout beer would make for a wonderful, no, DELECTABLE, ice cream treat or that thai chili and lime would taste good frozen on a cone? I sampled quite a few of their flavors, but ended up with a scoop of their Salt n Peppa to enjoy with my friends.
author: May T.

description:
The most original and inventive ice cream flavors ever, seriously, period. They've concocted flavors I've never even imagined on ice cream like Balsamic Vinegar. I remember when I was wowed by the lychee, longan, and durian flavors available at the Chinatown Ice Cream factory in New York City, but this totally blows that out of the water (or should I say, ice?).

Every flavor is creative, but not all of them are very good. You'll definitely find something you like, but make sure you try a taste before you dive in. 

Lastly, this little shack is a little too famous for it's own good. You really know you've made it when you're a destination on a tourist scavenger hunt. There's almost always a line, but it moves fast so its rather unpredictable. Sometimes you could be only third in line, and other times you'll be out the door and snaked around the corner.
author: Tian X.

description: the quality and energy here is great, but i just can't get used to the savory ice cream flavors . occasionally , they'll have wonderful sweet flavors that are AMAZING (which i wish all their flavors were more like) . but i respect their creativity , innovation , and passion . best / favorite flavors i've had were the pistachio brittle and maple walnut , but they are seasonal / temporary.
author: Nancee C.

description: Wow! These flavors are Intense with a capital 'I'. I find that I never want more than a few bites but that I enjoy each and every creamy bite. You can't go wrong here if you're a huge fan of ice cream like my hubby, just be sure to taste before you choose as their flavors are pretty unique :)
author: Emily S.

description: Hipsters have good food.  Humphrey Slocombe has a macabre double headed calf thing as their mascot which is horrifying but they have tasty ice cream and excellent names (craigslist missed connection, hot mess sundae) so it's a winner in my book.
author: Poppy C.

description:
Jesus Juice.  I really didn't know how to respond to this.  Didn't even know what was in it nor would I want to know.  And....... I sure hope the guy serving the ice cream was not named Jesus.

It's places like this that is making the mission more and more attractive to visit.  I personally am not a dessert fan but sarah d will swear to it that this place has the best ice cream.  I really can't disagree with her because I don't know any better.  She made a comment that kinda stuck to my head.  She said that I have this overweight friend that loves this place and that they come here often on their breaks.  She goes........it's by choice that she is overweight. Because she is over weight and she chooses to come to this place it has to be good.  

Between that comment and the Jesus Juice.............let's just say it was a solid four star establishment and we'll leave it at that.
author: jason g.

description:
Very unique flavors, although some were a little too unique. $3.25 gets you 2 big scoops. Really great ice cream shop atmosphere, with bar stools looking out to the street and several outdoor tables.

I did get a scoop of Secret Breakfast, but I'll probably stick to the more conventional flavors next time, like Malted Chocolate and Tahitian Vanilla. The Prosciutto and Salt & Pepper were too weird for me, and I can't imagine eating an entire scoop of those flavors.
author: Grace Y.

description:
I am sorry. I have to write against the grain here. While I really respect the adventurous flavors and I love the atmosphere I just did not care for the quality of their ice cream. I found the textures and flavors to be a bit inconsistent and over the top. 

I went here twice. The first time I thought the textures were off and while I liked the flavors I felt that they were so over powering that you could not appreciate the flavor of the cream itself. 

The second time I went i got a pint of the secret breakfast for my family to try. My dad in particular is a great fan of ice cream and my parents make fabulous ice cream them selves, so I thought they might like to try a new place that has a modern twist on an old classic. It was incredibly salty and the bourbon was really weak tasting compared to the first time I tasted it so the consistency once again was not there. 

When there are places in the city that have been around for my entire life time like Mitchell's and Swenson's I feel that the novelty of the unusual flavors is not enough to inspire longevity. However, I am one of the few that was not blown away by their ice cream so what do I know?

So I suppose I need to try them once more to see if they have improved since opening. Once again I like the unique flavors and the aesthetics of the place and really want to like the product, but need a little more convincing.
author: Esa Y.

description:
I was really skeptical about trying Humphry Slocombe as I am a regular at Bi-Rite Ice Cream.

My boyfriend and I tried
Blue Vietnamese Coffee: very good
Lemon Thyme Vanilla: good
Chocolate Malt: ok
Secret Breakfast: good

it was a much shorter line than Bi-rite's block-long line, the servings are slightly larger, and it IS cheaper. ...as for the flavors i think the two local ice cream shops are equally weird, but good.

I'll still be sticking with Bi-Rite though. Its right next to dolores park, and Id feel like a traitor if i switched over to Slocombe. sorry!
author: Tessa P.

description: I got the Vietnamese coffee ice cream. The ice cream was delicious -- strong coffee flavor with the right amount of creaminess.
author: Susan c.

description: Not much to say other than VERY good ice cream.  I recommend Secret Breakfast and Jesus Juice.  Lines can get long at times, but it's worth the wait.  All this is coming from someone who's not really for or against ice cream.  My friends think this place is the greatest.  I don't care much for overly sweet ice cream and this place delivers unique and delicate flavors rather than a sugar high.  Will check it out again if I'm in the area; I suggest you do the same.
author: Christopher L.

description:
I'll throw my admiration on the pile here; humphry slocombe is pretty solid.  the creativity factor is definitely what makes it.

I've sampled most of the standbys...but today tried Elvis; the fat years for the first time and was into it--peanut brittle plus bacon plus banana. Also dig the Brown Butter and the Harvey Milk and Honey Graham Cracker (or some such).

I can say it's pretty damn trendy/crowded--but you can't really fault the joint for that. 

And anyway the line moves pretty fast so shut up.

(extra points because you can enjoy a Philz from around the corner while you're standing there.)
author: Robert K.

description: My friend and I trekked across the Mission to check out the ice cream. I was glad they let us sample a variety of flavors before settling on one. I am not glad that I ordered before I actually tried the Secret Breakfast. My friend got it and I was quite envious. I did enjoy my olive oil and sweet corn (both separate flavors, mind you...) We were fortunate that it was the middle of the week at a random time, so no lines to contend with.
author: Renee E.

description:
Just as amazing as everyone says. The Ancho Chocolate is not to be missed. Spicy and chocolaty, what's not to love?

Take advantage of the two flavors for one scoop deal, since you'll want to try as much as possible. I loved the combination of peanut curry and chili lime sorbet. 

A bit pricey, no doubt, and arguably pretentious right in the mission. But no less delicious because of it!
author: Megan D.

description: This is creatively good ice cream. I went on the recommendation of a friend (thanks Heather !!), and it turned out to be some of the best ice cream I've had.  The neighborhood is a little sketchy, but the ice cream makes up for it. I settled on a double scoop of the sea salt chocolate and the basalmic caramel.  So delicious !!!  Also, the place was packed.
author: Todd D.

description:
I haven't tried the offerings of Bi-Rite or Mitchell's (the rest of the SF ice cream trifecta - are there more?  please enlighten me), but our visit to Humphry Slocombe was definitely ice cream heaven.  

I tasted the peanut butter curry and the secret breakfast flavors.  I always tend to try a few flavors and then order something completely different, but the secret breakfast was too good to pass up.  I loved the bourbon flavor with the SUPER creamy ice cream and random corn flake crunches.  The PB curry was really good too, but the curry aftertaste was a little strong so I ventured out and replaced it with banana pecan - a safe bet, but excellent.  Carmelized pecans dotting a smooth lightly banana-flavored cream.  I like that HS is taking an adventurous approach to ice cream and appreciate their innovative flavor combinations.  I'm up for anything if it involves frosty sweet cream, really.

I worked in ice cream retail in high school and have used the oops-I-accidentally-screwed-up-your-order-so-I-can-eat-it-later tactic, so I could relate when one of the girls behind the counter made a Blue Bottle Viatnamese Coffee + Oolong Tea creation TWICE when my friend had ordered the Coffee + Dulce de Leche.  An innocent mistake, and after eating our four creations, we offered to buy both of those off her anyway....

I WILL be back.  Is it a guilty pleasure if you never actually feel guilty about it?
author: Laura B.

description: Cool, hip little spot in The Mission district. Small shop so u may wait in line for a bit out the door to get a taste. Reasonable prices, 3 scoops for like $5.25. So many unique flavors. We had Peanut Butter Curry, Chocolate Smoked Sea Salt & Blue Bottle Coffee. The coffee was da bomb...big fan. U could really taste the curry in the peanut butter. Interesting, not overpowering,  but decent. Also sampled some Jesus Juice (red wine & coca cola ice cream), wow it really tasted like red wine! U can checkout their website & check out the flavors before u go. Definitely a must try if you're looking for ice cream in the city.
author: Amanda M.

description:
This is my first time here and wow does this place seem constantly crowded.  My friend and I checked this place out on a sunny sunday.  I ordered one scoop of the delicious secret breakfast (bourbon + cereal) and my friend ordered 1 scoop of the same + 1 scoop of this peanut butter flavored ice cream with a really weird name.  My friend enjoyed the secret breakfast flavor the most out of the two.  My friend also tried a taste of salt and pepper and said it tastes exactly like that (I wonder if that really sells). 

I LOVE that the cups and spoons are both compost friendly.  They also provided a tank of free water along with washable cups in the corner of the shop for customers.  Our bill for a total of a 1 scoop cup and a 2 scoop cup was $6.50.  I would definitely come back here again.
author: Mel L.

description:
Vinegar ice cream with balsamic and caramel??  Huh?  What crazy, amazing mad scientist created this deliciousness?  And bourbon ice cream with carmelized corn flakes?  Wha, what?   

After reading about this place in what we thought was the latest Bon Appetit (turns out it was from June) we hiked all the way across town to try it out and man we were happy we did.  We almost didn't need to buy a scoop, because the mad scientist employees let me and my friend try not 1, or 2, but all 12 flavors.  Creamy, salty, rich---it was totally worth the cross-town trip any day.
author: Ali L.

description: The ice cream is not good. They have all these strange flavors. I rather have more classic flavors and be good than going with strange but not good ones.
author: Luca R.

description:
Went at night, about an hour or two before closing. That said, most of the good flavors were gone. I was pretty sad, but was still looking forward to having new flavors. I got the peanut butter curry and that was what it tasted like.....peanut butter and spices. I liked how each ingredient didn't overpower each other and that it was a very subtle taste overall.

Their ice cream texture was consistent. In fact, that's one of the main reasons why I love Humphry Slocombe's ice cream so much!
author: Grace C.

description:
I happened to see this place out of the corner of my eye when walking back from lunch down the street. I remembered the name from the food network. A really special place to pig out.

Breakfast ice cream consisting of Bourbon whiskey and cornflakes in ice cream. Another flavour was  Olive oil with sea salt in ice cream. Yes! In ice cream. What am I talking about? How about a mouth full of joy! That's right. You would think it would be the most revolting thing you have ever had. Well guess what? It's not. So good and a little goes a long way. I normally can put away a pint of ice cream easily. I had a scoop of each the breakfast and the olive oil and it silenced my sweet tooth for the day.

The attendants are so nice, helpful and don't flinch when you ask them to sample every single one of the flavours. Will always go back here for some goodness!
author: ryan n.

description:
Yeah, so I gave into the hype.

I kept thinking to myself after all the Ice Cream places I've been to, there will never be a better one. Unfortunately, I was wrong...very wrong. 

What Scoops is to the common LA foodie/Yelper/Chowhounder/Zagater whatever the hell you are. Humphry Slocombe is it's rival in diversifying flavors with hipster attitude. There were a couple of things, that reaffirmed the need to try this spot. First off, many of my Bay Area friends were in need of a new dessert place. Fortunately one of the Bay Area Yelpers, who I follow reviewed it and enjoyed it. Secondly, whenever there's a line for something chances are (overhyped or not) the quality of the product is worth trying, at least once. 

Here's what I sampled and ordered at this spot:

Samples:

-Tahitian Vanilla
-Something mixed with Prosciutto (couldn't recall the other flavor in hybrid)

Orders:

-1 Scoop of The Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee
-1 Scoop of The Secret Breakfast

The Tahitian, was decent had Vanilla, with a bit of spicyness. The Prosciutto mix was alright but a bit too salty for me to enjoy.

So far, I was becoming disappointed then I asked them what the popular flavors were and first came up the Vietnamese Coffee. It was right on the money, sweet with that Caffeine rush after taste. Made me feel like I was in a Vietnamese Coffee house without the Blue Balls attached. Next up the Secret Breakfast (which was really Bourbon and Corn Flakes) surprisingly, I didn't think this combination would make sense at all. After one lick, I was hooked like a crack addict. The bourbon hits first, strong but the subtle corn flake bits balance out with the creamy waves splashing on the tongue.

The line wasn't too ridiculous and the service was surprisingly friendly to my non-hipster/artist self. I guess it helps having messing hair and a random panda t-shirt to fit the bill. Speaking the bill, It only costs me about $7.00 dollars plus tax and tip. The seating could be better, but hey the business just started and rent must be a pain in SF. Overall, the Mission definitely has one neighborhood spot that shouldn't be going away for a while. 

Probably on a future trip, I'll check out Bi-Rite Creamery (a spot a few Yelpers and friends urged me to go). Overall, great job Humphry, now survive the business Hump year and recession to become more of a winner. On a side note, there are some really good Hawaiian Corn Flake Cookies (can't recall the name) but it would go well with the Secret Breakfast that's for sure.

P.S. What gives with the Fishbone Sign the Google Person donated in the front?
author: Ryan M.

description: I'm a sucker for unique ice cream flavors, so this place is right up my alley. This was the last of the popular SF ice cream places to try. I've been to Mitchell's and Bi-rite before but never Slocombe. I was not disappointed. I shared two scoops, secret breakfast and blue bottle vietnamese coffee. Yum yum yum! I usually am not a fan of coffee ice cream, but this particular flavor was so rich and decadent that I couldn't resist going back for more. The secret breakfast was great as well. If I didn't read the description I wouldn't be able to tell that the ice cream was bourbon flavored but I loved the corn flakes in it. I don't know how they manage to keep them crispy in the ice cream but that unexpected crunch was great. I will definitely try to come back for some of their other flavors.
author: Sannie L.

description:
Inventive, fun, whimsical. 

Sure, they don't do their own ice-cream base, (according to the employee I talked to) but the flavors are awesome. 

Try the secret breakfast and (if they have it) brown butter or salt and pepper. 

Much to love.
author: Bo J.

description:
Unfortunately they didn't have the prosciutto flavor on the day I visited, but did get to try some awesome and not so awesome flavors. Loved the Secret Breakfast (bourbon and corn flakes) and will now eat my corn flakes with bourbon for breakfast forever. The Peanut Butter Curry is definitely a must try. The Banana Pecan is hella to die for. But the Balsamic Caramel? It was cool the first couple of bites but I'm guessing because it was kinda melted it seemed as though I was drinking balsamic vinegar straight up. 

Can't wait to go back and try the other adventurous flavors.
author: Rommel N.

description:
I don't think I've ever been so intruiged by ice cream flavors as I was when I went to Humphry Slocombe's.  The first of two dessert stops in my List crawl with Alea G., S.K., and friends (see pictures here: http://pineapplebread.wordpress.com/2010/05/25/the-list-an-8-restaurant-marathon-through-the-mission/), this was the one place that we all decided to get our own flavors.  Maybe because none of us were willing to risk having to share with someone who wanted the Boccalone Prosciutto flavored ice cream (weird-- I think we all decided to pass on this flavor).  Or the Jesus Juice flavor (red wine + coke-- surprisingly tasty!).  

The Secret Breakfast (from The List) was pretty good, and there was a distinct flavor of bourbon.  But I settled on getting the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee scoop in a cone.  Strong coffee flavor, which was great.  I may not be a coffee drinker, but when it comes to ice cream, coffee is my flavor of choice!  Why does such a seemingly small amount of ice cream end up being SO much?  And by that, I mean so MUCH DELICIOUSNESS?  I was with friends, so I got to try carrot mango (carroty, but since carrot is a sweet root to begin with, not too outlandish), and honey thyme (yum-- light in flavor but sweet enough to satisfy).  

With the summer months fast approaching (granted, it's SF so it's never going to become broiling-ly hot, but still), Humphry Slocombe is  the perfect place to get that cold sweet ice cream we all crave.
author: Jeanne Y.

description: I ordered the secret breakfast, blue bottle Vietnamese coffee and salted watermelon.  Secret breakfast was solid.  I'm a sucker for coffee flavors and the blue bottle vietnamese coffee was delicious.  Salted watermelon might lack a little bit in flavor but refreshing factor is off the charts.
author: Steven U.

description:
I would DO the Secret Breakfast/Balsamic Caramel combo, and I'm not even really a 'fan' of ice cream in the regular world (or having sex with food). I have, however, tried nearly every boutique ice cream shop in the area-Bi Rite, Bombay, Xanadu, Three Twins, etc.-and have found that Humphrey's kicks their collective asses.

I know they hate it, but if you like Humphrey Slocombe, you will LOVE Jasper Slobrushe: http://www.jasperslobrushe.com/
author: Stephanie P.

description: Secret breakfast and Guiness gingerbread were delicious! I decided that the miso pear was more of a stunt flavor; perfectly nice fruit ice cream ruined by miso (which I love, just not in dessert).
author: M.K. C.

description:
I tried the Secret Breakfast and Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee ice cream.  Both were really good, but not mind blowing.  

I think the Salted Carmel from Bi-Rite spoiled my ice cream standards and took them to a whole new level...
author: Matt S.

description:
I was having dinner with a friend in Noe Valley and asked the waiter for directions to Mitchells Ice Cream, the rumored local spot for ice cream lovers. But, instead he suggested Humphry Slocombe a slightly farther drive. I'm really glad he did. 

What a charming place with a rather basic set-up -- a guy and a gal behind the counter, several stools out front facing the window toward the street and a few pieces of framed art. The menu is short and to the point. But, it's the freshness of the ice cream and the uniqueness of the flavors that makes this place special. 

Their ice creams are made daily on the premises. I couldn't resist ordering the balsamic caramel and it was delicious. I'm looking forward to the next visit, will either try the Golden Beet Saffron or Thai Chili Lime, or both.
author: Briar F.

description:
Another SF ice cream shop with interesting one-of-a-kind flavors.  The difference between this place and Bi-rite is that the flavors of this place stand out soooo much more.  You can really taste the distinct flavors of each combination.  There was:
- White Miso Peach - sounds good.. but a little too salty for my flare
- Balsamic Caramel - too much balsamic and caramel tasted burnt
- Beet sorbet - really tastes like beets!
- secret breakfast (bourbon and corn flakes) - definitely taste some bourbon in there
- Thai Chili Lime (tastes like Hot Cheetos with Lime)
- Tahitian Vanilla
- Black Sesame
- Jesus juice
- Olive oil
....just to name a few.

Now, that's not to say that they all taste good.  In fact, of all the flavors that I tried today, I would of have liked to pass on all of them, except that I felt bad for trying so many flavors that i felt inclined to buy something.  They really only have 12 flavors to choose from each day, so not all the flavors listed on the website are available.  Between us 4 girls, we decided to buy a pint of the Vietnamese Iced Coffee ice cream ($7.50).  This ice cream tasted just like how vietnamese iced coffee should taste.  No weird flavoring added.  The ice cream melted pretty fast, so we had to constantly keep eating it before it melted away. 

The staff were very nice and patient with us, but I think I will stick to Bi-rite or Mitchell's ice cream from now on.

CASH ONLY.
author: Diane L.

description:
If you want to be safe just go for a double scoop of Secret Breakfast. As with all the Ice-cream at Humphry Slocombe, it is incredibly creamy, and you might even get a little buzzed by the time you're done.

If you want to try something new and different when it comes to ice cream, just try any of the other flavors here. The lavender ice cream is amazing. I came here once during beer week and they literally had six different kinds of beer ice cream (which is actually not all that bad)

There is usually a line out the door on weekends/ some evenings so be ready for that. And this is SF in the Mission District so it might take a little bit of time to find parking if you drive  here.

It used to be only cash at one point but they have since started taking credit cards which is great - no more ATM fees. :) 

It might take them a couple of tries to read your card though. They have this card reader on an iPad which looks a little flimsy to me but hey at least it works!!
author: RAHUL D.

description:
Ya betta Stop, Drop and Roll on this one! This place is nuts (sometimes and if they are feeling like it.) 

There is a debate in my casa about some of the 'aggressive flavors' but make no mistake - the place is spectacular. 

The smarties behind this make a few flavors a day and you either happen upon what you want or you don't and have to come back. Well done.

Personally, I like ALL the goodness but some of my friends aren't crazy about Thai Chili that gives them a fake-out of lime and then burns their mouths with chili. Reaction = fantastic and worth the price. 

Others like the staple Secret Breakfast (Jack Daniels and corn flakes - genius) are delightful. Peanut butter-curry is great too but the unusual flavor combo is like a POW-KICK-REACHAROUND and can be a bit much for lame-o's or the unsuspecting. 

The Coup de grâce is their recent pairing of Manischewitz sorbet and Prosciutto ice cream in a single sundae during Hanukkah! I mean... really? That is leet. And amazing. And tasty. 

Well done folks. I hope you make billions.
author: Clint B.

description:
I really wanted to like this place, and yes it was ok, but not as good as the hype makes it out to be.  I had the lemon buttermilk sorbet and it was just average.  Maybe the butter beer flavor would have been better (sadly they weren't offering it). 

The staff was helpful and gladly gave me samples.
author: Elizabeth R.

description:
Where have I been hiding?  I am an ice cream whore and yet I haven't worked this little corner of the Mission until today.   I was so excited about this little find, that apparently at least 555 other people in SF know about already.  I completely got mesmerized by the amazing flavors to the point that I skipped the line and went right to the front.  Not knowingly I did this but no one seemed to mind.  I just stood there looking into the cooler asking all these strangers around me what flavors they were enjoying.  After hearing a few opinions I went for the Ancho Chocolate.  Boy was this the perfect choice.

I am inclined to go back and get the Salt and Pepper later today. It really intrigues me.  I love new combinations and this place is where to find them all! 

I love you Humphry I will be working your corner again in the near future. 

xo
SAP
author: Scott P.

description:
I was super excited to try the Vietnamese Coffee ice cream, but it left a weird film in my mouth and there was just something off about the texture. Hopefully it was just a tweaked batch because everyone seems to rave about it!  Sad.

My brother got Secret Breakfast, which I kept stealing bites of because it was so much better than mine.  =P mmm bourbon..mmm corn flakes..

I sampled the corn, which was pretty good, but I wanted something more unique.

As another reviewer mentioned, prices here are lower than other high end ice cream places. 

Our server was really friendly, woo! 

Until I come back, 3 stars it shall be.
author: Lydia W.

description:
This is a solid ice cream spot. 

I went with some amigas after the food fest yesterday. We waited in line for about 40 minutes. As long as I have good company it's usually not a big deal to wait for some good food. 

The harvey milk was delicious, courtesy of me jacking a bit from my friend. I had the viet coffee with the cinnamon something or other. I wanted to try other flavors but alas the line was long. 

The mix of flavors they use sound odd, but they work well together. Definitely will come back here, though I don't find myself in the area much. Maybe that'll change...
author: gabby m.

description:
Peanut butter & curry? Check. Bourbon & cornflakes? Check. Red wine & coke? Check. Prosciutto ice cream??? Hmmm I'll pass on that one. 

This place has some amazing ice cream flavors. So amazing that you'll most likely be grossed out by a few of them. The best that I tried were the peanut butter & curry and the hibiscus beet. Unfortunately the 2 of them did not go together, so I had to pick one. I wanted to try a taste of them all but i didn't want to be obnoxious about it so I stuck to 3. Next time I'll try the coffee and the salt & pepper, but not necessarily together. 

I also love that everything there is reusable or compostable.  Nice!
author: Erin S.

description:
Felt like an ass driving from Palo Alto to the Mission solely for a scoop of ice cream. But I couldn't stay away after reading the article in the NYT Mag. 

Genius. Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee was mind-blowing. Peanut butter Curry, Maple Walnut, and Secret Breakfast all excellent. But what I crave is the Bourbon Caramel sauce. I want it on my ice cream, vegetables, turkey - anything and everywhere. Straight. All the time. It's liquid gold.
author: Leah A.

description:
There is nothing left for wanting.

Ice cream with infused booze (if you fancy) - the much lauded "secret breakfast"
Ice cream with infused coffee (blue bottle of course)
Ice cream that tastes like tart yogurt (because it is!)
Ice cream that tastes like vanilla ice cream (because it is!)
Ice cream with unexpected combinations of flavors (ie balsalmic vinegar and caramel - winning tangy/sweet combo!)
Ice cream with lots of spice (pepper anyone?)
Savory ice cream (pig parts)

Flavors are first here, but the ice cream also boasts fantastic texture (notably creamy, low air, significant elasticity).

Great product.  Interesting 'hood.  Cute shop.  Crowd pleaser.
author: Jennifer B.

description:
Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee. 

Best scoop of ice cream I have EVER gotten. EVER. And the sugar cone it came in was SO. DAMN. GOOD. If I could, I'd eat it for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. But good thing I can't, or else I'd get really sick of it. Remember kids, moderation is your best friend.

Minus one star because the shop itself seems a bit janky and dirty, especially when compared to Bi-Rite.
author: Carolyn K.

description:
The first time I was here I tried peanut butter curry. Oh man, was that strange! It seriously tasted like peanut butter AND curry and the same time. My taste buds were confused! haha 

I went again today with my aunt and decided to try a safer flavor. Chocolate hazelnut was really satisfying considering I am a chocolate lover. 

Yay for the interesting flavors. Nay for the alright customer service compared to that given to the more attractive customer ahead of me and being a bit over priced.
author: Tiffany P.

description: You know you're putting out a fabulous ice cream when its 45 degrees out at 9pm and still have a long line out the door. That's exactly the case when I tried this Yelp favorite. I ordered the Vietnamese Coffee flavor ice cream and another in our group got the Secret Breakfast (taste like Bourbon and Cornflakes) how creative! You gotta try this place for an interesting San Francisco dessert.
author: Harold L.

description:
Just finished a pint of Secret Breakfast.
This has to be my favorite flavor in the world!! 
I am not really an ice-cream person, because for most of the time it's too sweet and creamy for me.
I love how they have bourbon in secret breakfast, gives it a little twist of bitterness.
Being under 21, I could only taste liquor in desserts, and I love them!
It kinda reminds me of tiramisu at bucca di beppo, and cabernet raspberry sorbet at the cliff house.
Deliiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiish!
author: Marlis T.

description:
Humphry Slocombe has weirdo flavors, but I feel like it's their only selling point & why people flock to this place... Because the ice cream itself is not that great! Its not as creamy as gourmet ice cream should be & the flavors are not that intense (e.g., limoncello was really mild & not tart at all, & this is seriously THE EASIEST FLAVOR IN THE WORLD to get right). 

Out of the entire display, the only stand-out flavors for me were secret breakfast & Blue Bottle coffee. Not worth the trip for me, but if I'm in the neighborhood, I'd stop by.
author: Ruby H.

description:
I've pretty much tried all the flavors and yes, I'm a fan!  They also have one of the friendliest staff in the Mission.

3/1/11 update:  I just watched Bizarre Foods today with Andrew Zimmerman and Humphry Slocombe got a nice segment.
author: Ricky M.

description:
saw this place on food network and decided to try it when visiting San Francisco. 

atmosphere: It's a small place that doesn't fit many people. There are some stools on the inside and some chairs on the outside but not TOO many places for seating. Expect long lines unless you go at the right time. I went at around 8 or 9PM and there weren't that many people but right after we arrived many other people arrived as well. 

You get to taste the different flavors. I believe they let you taste as many as you want but I'm not sure about that.

The secret breakfast was great! It has bourbon and cornflakes in it. If you don't like alcohol so much then it might be a lot for a whole scoop. Your breath smells like alcohol after tasting it as if you just drank alcohol. 

I also tried the "Salt and Pepper" which tasted just like salt and pepper. If you like salt or a lot of pepper then this might be for you. I personally love food with a bunch of pepper but this ice cream was not appetizing for me. It felt like I just put a bunch of salt and pepper on my hand and ate it :/ The pepper was overpowering. 

The Jesus juice was good but I liked the secret breakfast better. 

Also beware of the two headed calf on the wall =/
author: Michelle W.

description:
Wanna be a ice cream hipster?  Bi-rite is so not hipster anymore.  Everyone goes!  Avoid the ridiculous lines.

Try this place..with its original, fresh, funky, laffy taffy-like flavors

Two flavors I tried:
Secret Breakfast - Bourbon with some cereal.  This should be in everyone's brunch diet.
Vietnamese Blue Bottle Coffee - Have yet to try actual blue bottle coffee.  But I love Vietnamese coffee so this one gets a thumbs up.

I'd like to think the portions are a little more generous than Bi-Rite.  Not as generous as baskin robbins or my favorite, Thrifty Ice cream (throwback ice cream I'd like to say)!  But you know...how un-hipster would it be if you gave a lot.  Plus, I gotta fit in my skinny jeans.
author: Yup S.

description: I used to live right next to Bi-Rite so I'm kind of an ice cream snob. I finally had the chance to make my way to Humphry after hearing rave reviews about it. It's odd that ice cream shops are actually a hit in cold ass SF. Anyway, I had the Secret Breakfast and it was kind of awesome. I don't even like the taste of Bourbon but it grows on you with every bite. I love the combination of textures in all foods esp the cornflakes in this ice cream. The crunch made a fun surprise and the cornflakes were not soggy what so ever. Honestly, this place was bomb but I don't think I would come out here unless I was already in the area.
author: Grace Y.

description: Secret Breakfast = Bourbon ice cream with corn flakes. Bought me a whole pint. Do it!!!
author: Kristina W.

description: After trying both Humphrey and Bi-rite, I would have to say that I'm a Bi-rite fan. I had the Secret Breakfast and also the Blue Bottle Vietnamese coffee, both of which had strong flavors. The Blue bottle vietnamese coffee had a strong coffee bean flavor and the bourbon definitely was distinct in the Secret Breakfast. Did appreciate the crunchiness of the cereal inside the Secret Breakfast. However, the texture of the ice cream, especially the Blue Bottle one was a little powdery, and would like the ice cream more smooth and creamy.
author: Ellin C.

description:
i never knew this place existed until my friend brought me here today, they have such an interesting selection, not a big one, but definitely interesting.. 

my favorite is the oolong tea flavored, it really really tasted a lot like tea! 
i thought they were all interesting but i dont think i would try all of them.. 
they have salt and pepper, coke and red wine, pumpkin spice, peanut butter curry??? oh jeez, it was a great experience though.. 

coming back for more soon! try a bit before buying your ice cream to get a full experience!
author: Jessica C.

description:
Good ice cream - it's just an odd place.  Are they charging tax on take out ice cream?  

I ordered an ice cream, one scoop, and they requested $4, when the board said $3.75. 

I asked m "why is it $4 when the board said $3.75?"

The counter person said, "Oh, it's $4 now."

 I asked "Why don't you change the board to say $4."  (It's written in chalk)

And the other counter person with an intricate tatoo on his neck said "oh it's tax.  It's actually cheaper than it used to be. It used to be $4.08 with tax".

I said "please give me my money back."

It's just annoying.  If they'd given me my $.25 back, and said.  "Oh, sorry, I made a mistake." or "Do you plan to eat here, we're charging tax on food eaten on premises."

Take out ice cream has no tax:

Sales And Use Tax Regulations
Article 8. Food Products

Regulation 1602. Food Products.

Reference: Sections 6091, 6353, and 6359, Revenue and Taxation Code.

California Constitution, Article XIII, Section 34.

(a) IN GENERAL. Tax does not apply to sales of food products for human consumption except as provided in Regulations 1503, 1574, and 1603. (Grocers, in particular, should note that tax applies to sales of "hot prepared food products" as provided in Regulation 1603(e).)

(1) "Food products" include cereal and cereal products, including malt and malt extracts, milk and milk products, including ice cream, ice milk and ice cream and ice milk novelties, sherberts, imitation ice cream and imitation ice milk, dried milk products, sugar of milk, milk shakes, malted milks, and any other similar type beverages composed at least in part of milk or a milk product and requiring the use of milk or a milk product in their preparation, oleomargarine, meat and meat products, fish and fish products, eggs and egg products, vegetables and vegetable products, including dehydrated vegetables, fruit and fruit products, spices and salt, coffee and coffee substitutes, tea, cocoa and cocoa products, sugar and sugar products, baby foods, bakery products, marshmallows, baking powder, baking soda, cream of tartar, coconut, flavoring extracts, flour, gelatin, jelly powders, mustard, nuts, peanut butter, sauces, soups, syrups (for use as an ingredient of, or upon, food products as defined herein), yeast cakes, olive oil, bouillon cubes, meat extracts, popcorn, honey, jams, jellies, certo, mayonnaise, and flavored ice products, including popsicles and snow cones. "Food products" include candy, confectionery, and chewing gum.
author: Henrietta S.

description:
This is the real deal.....dee-lish .....I am glad I do not live very close...if it was within walking distance to my house....it would be BAD NEWS for me. 

Be warned if you are wanting some "Vanilla" (funny) or conventional ice flavors- this is not the place for you.
author: jennifer t.

description:
If I had to choose something that always makes me feel better, no matter how sad or depressed I am, I would have to say ice cream. In my mind, ice cream is the cure-all for anything that brings someone down, a sort of magical mood lifter of sorts. And for the most part, it doesn't matter whether the ice cream is served at a fancy restaurant with an acclaimed pastry chef or from Rite Aide, I love it all (there are a few exceptions though, Indian style ice cream being one of them). So when we decided to stop by Humphrey Slocombe for a quick treat while we were in SF this past weekend, I was looking forward to something cold and delicious. What I got was mostly just cold... and sort of weird... but not that delicious.

Humphrey Slocombe is touted for their unique flavors (Secret Breakfast- Bourbon and Corn Flakes, Chocolate and Passion Fruit, Salted Licorice, Balsamic Caramel, Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee, Olive Oil, Creme Fraiche...) and seems to have quite a following in the city. I wanted to make sure I got the perfect flavor so asked for a taste of 5-6 varieties that seemed the most interesting. After tasting each one, I had a really hard time deciding which one I wanted, which is normal since I usually want everything, but this time it was because I didn't really like any of them and couldn't fathom finishing a whole scoop (I can finish an entire gallon of ice cream in one sitting sometimes, so this was definitely strange). I finally settled on a kid size single scoop of the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee, only because it seemed to be the most harmless choice.

I think the overall impression I had was that the flavors were unbalanced. Most of them had at least two flavor components but one always overwhelmed the other. The Balsamic Caramel was too vinegary and you couldn't really taste the Caramel... The Secret Breakfast tasted mostly of Bourbon (I actually hated this one) and I wasn't sure there were even any Corn Flakes in the ice cream itself. Olive Oil had a citrus-y taste with a denser texture but the only part of it that was reminiscent of Olive Oil was that it was sort of unctuous, like Indian Ice Cream (which is not a good thing in my book). The Vietnamese Coffee was overly sweet with none of the soul-stirring richness that is a main characteristic of a well made Cafe Sua Da.

As I stood there licking my spoon and trying to pinpoint what was wrong, it became very clear to me what that was. We were at Humphry Slocombe, and not at Bi-Rite Creamery. Of course. It finally made sense.
author: Bora K.

description:
This ice cream is punch you in the face good. 

These are not wimpy, I can sort of tell this is "insert flavor here", flavors. If it says its Peanut Butter Curry, it is PEANUT BUTTER CURRY, YEA! 

So far I have tried:

Peanut Butter Curry- super smooth, peanut butter goodness, with a curry heat finish

Secret Breakfast- Yummerific- however don't drive home directly after consuming- you may not pass a breathalizer ;)

Balsamic Caramel- wow! This is probably my favorite, it's all about balance here, not too acidic or sweet, just right

Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee- very good, but I'd be more adventurous if you are only going to try one flavor

Miso White Peach- pretty darn good, but I would have liked more miso

Cinnamon Brittle- NOM NOM NOM! but that may be because I really like cinnamon

Jesus Juice- Coke and red wine- sounds cool, but not so much- too gooey from the high sugar content of the coke and also tastes flat- the only loser that I've tried so far

Also, the line when I've come has always been pretty long and sloooow because everyone wants try a gazillion flavors. It's worth the wait though, so be patient and get in line! Jog in place so you don't feel guilty afterward :D
author: Sarah B.

description:
I won't waste your time, here's what I thought very briefly:

Secret Breakfast: good... if you're an alcoholic (well, I liked it)
Tahitian Vanilla: good... you boring dude (I liked this too)
Caramel Balsamic: two good things... that don't belong together
B.B. Vietnamese Coffee: ...F'in delicious
Chestnut something: kinda nutty
author: Joseph L.

description:
A romp around the mission yesterday landed us at Humphry Slocombe! 

There was a Latin festival going on, so parking wasn't easy, but we got super lucky finding meter free parking just down the way from our destination! Yippiee! 

Humprhy's is small, white and clean with blue trim inside. And just like the pictures, smack dab on the left side it the two headed goat/baby cow, just staring straight ahead. A little off putting, but you get over it when you peer at the flavors. 

I didn't see too many flavors: jesus juice, blue bottle Vietnamese coffee, secret breakfast, chocolate stout, chocolate with sea salt, and tangerine sorbet. Might have been more, but I wanted to try the secret breakfast that everyone raves about. 

I tried the chocolate with sea salt, and was not impressed. No saltiness was even detected, so pass! 

Then I tried the secret breakfast. The guy behind the counter was shocked when I asked for a sample. He said, "be prepared to be blown away" or was it "your life is about to change." 

Was I blown away? Did my life change at that moment? Ummmmmmmmmmmmmmm............no. 

But it was good. Really good, 

I paired it with the Vietnamese coffee for what they guy said was a complete breakfast. 

Alrighty then! 

I thought it was funny when the guy first scooped my friend her tangerine sorbet and commented he scooped a big one. I think he was showing the new girl how to scoop it correctly. When it came to my two flavors, he again commented, "I'm scoopin' pretty big today! Don't expect that the next time." 

OOOoookaaaaay! 

I loved the secret breakfast: bold flavor of bourbon without tasting the alcohol. I didn't really taste the cornflakes though. And the Vietnamese coffee was spot one: just like the real thing! 

My friend pointed out a mini individual duck fat pecan pie. I picked it up to smell it, and it smelled heavenly! 

I regret not buying it....maybe next time!
author: Rachel N.

description:
Duck Fat Pecan Pie!
With a scoop of Secret B'fast!
Orgasmic!

OK, i have to admit...I bought 1 pecan pie, tried it and it was SO amazing, that i had to get another one and split it with my friend. We decided that it'd be better ala mode...and we were NOT wrong. 
*dreaming of it*
author: Jocelyn L.

description:
The whole city smells like a damn sewer and you need something cold and comforting, fast. You don't want to suffer the lines, but it's too HOT out to do anything else...

Plus two stars for having another standout flavor - oolong tea.  Minus star for still having to taste through the gimmicky ones to find the rare gems.
author: Nikki F.

description:
Made quite the trek to get here, but when I arrived the reward was worth it.  There was a great list of flavors and a line out the door. Inside, the place looks an old fashioned ice cream store with red swivel chairs placed at a bar against the window. 

The ice cream is nice and creamy, exactly what you'd expect from homemade ice cream. They also had an Ice cream flight that I want to come back and participate in. Check it out and enjoy!
author: John F.

description: I love Vietnamese iced coffee. This place hits the spot. Not a huge fan of the breakfast ice cream though. I thought it tasted weird. Line was super long and I probably won't stand in it again.
author: Jeanne C.

description:
I love coffee ice cream in general so I had to order  a scoop of Blue Bottle Coffee ice-cream... Also tied the Olive Oil which was unique and kept me guessing on what was actually in it. 

Overall, I love the creativity and adventure that Humphry Slocombe does so well. However, I don't have a huge sweet tooth, so it was way to sweet for me.
author: Elisabeth K.

description: Its like ice cream for adults. All the flavors are richer and more intense (even tasting of alcohol). Definitely a different ice cream experience. We tried the Harvey Mill and Honey Graham, Secret Breakfast (definitely try), Cinnamon Brittle (tastes like Golden Grahams) and Kurios.
author: Sandra S.

description: maybe i'm not as adventurous as I thought, but some of the flavors were too bizarre for me. i have to say though, the vietnamese coffee flavor is pretty darn good! With so many great ice cream shops in the bay area I can't say Humphry Slocombe is my favorite, but its definitely one of the best and worth a try--if only to say you've had jesus juice.
author: Christine K.

description:
The short:
-Unusual flavor pairings in ice cream that really work together (i.e., Balsamic caramel)
-Very nice service
-They'll let you taste stuff (essential when you can't decide)
-Small selection (only 12 flavors were out when I was there)

The long:
Got there and grabbed a scoop of Balsamic caramel which was outstanding.  Also tried the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee ice cream, which too was exceptional.  Service is quick, and I could taste things before I settled on a single one.  NOTE: door is tucked away on Harrison north of the coffee place, so it's easy to miss if you aren't looking for it!

As a mooninite would say, ice cream is coming back, in a big way.  As more places open, the more creativity there is in flavor pairings.  HS is no exception; with its creative use of sweet and savory ingredients (the Tin Roof: hot fudge and sea salt over vanilla with frosted peanuts? Um, yes please) it's sure to make you think twice about ice cream as a self-standing dessert (vs. xxxx a la mode).
author: Stacey H.

description: I'll preface my review by saying that I'm limited to the sorbet selection. I was very excited to try Humphry Slocombe after seeing it on the Food Network and researching all its unique creations online, but sadly, I think the flavors are a little too outrageous for me. Maybe I am just not adventurous enough, but they offer very radical combinations i.e. lemon basil, salted licorice, and olive oil, without any of the standards to fall back on. However, they unquestionably use authentic and fresh ingredients, because I could definitely taste every component of sorbet. For example, the Jesus Juice emanated powerfully of red wine and Coca-Cola. Stupidly, I went for a scoop of Szechuan Strawberry without tasting it beforehand and realizing that the "Szechuan" part denoted spicyness. Thus, an unexpected and very odd hot herb-y aftertaste while eating a cup caused me to become very puzzled and uncomfortable, until a friend pointed out my oversight.
author: Amy G.

description:
Dude. Talk about an unassuming little shop on Harrison. I land here with Sue and she proceed to tell me all about these amazing flavors. Jesus juice - red wine and coke. Their breakfast special (bourbon and corn flakes). A rich creamy vanilla. 

I settle on dulce de leche and Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee and my life is simply never the same. The dulce de leche was smooth and evoked rich images and flavors of both Spain and Latin America - and i've never been to either!

Already a huge fan of Blue Bottle, I took a lick and the rich flavor of both the coffee and the condensed milk seeped out of the cone as the ice cream melted. 

The medium size was $3.25 (a bargain compared to Naia or Gelato Classico or other ice cream shops) and allowed me two VERY generous scoops. It took me about 15 minutes to finish it, but I savoured each lick (I spelled savour in deference to the British founder). 

I will note that the line exploded behind us, so cross your fingers and hope for a short line!
author: Aaron F.

description:
I liked it.  I didn't think it was anywhere close to worth waiting inline for 45 minutes.  I think bi-rite is better.  the ice cream seems creamier there.

Peanut butter curry was interesting, but a whole scoop of it is too much.  I feel the same way about the Secret Breakfast flavor.  Favorite of the day was cinnamon brittle
author: Lawrence C.

description:
Feh. So overrated. This place is the Toyanese taco truck of local ice cream. I seriously don't get the hype. And I've been underwhelmed by everything I've ever gotten here (I've been multiple times and have just given up). 

Just because you can throw a lot of disparate flavor profiles together and make ice cream out of that mess, doesn't mean that you actually should do it!  

Bi-Rite and Ici are much better...
author: Kim C.

description: secret breakfast! want  some bourbon and cornflakes in ice cream? YES! Holla. Finally an ice cream that satisfies a liquor like craving.
author: Jason W.

description:
Are you a flavor tripper? Then Humphry Slocombe is your kind of ice cream shop. These aren't your ordinary ice cream flavors.

I love that the staff is super patient with you and let you taste every flavor if you want to. Not that I wanted to. I wasn't adventurous enough to try the Balsamic Caramel or Olive Oil but I actually had a taste of the Salt 'n' Pepa... *blech!* My tastebuds were horribly turned off by this. The Secret Breakfast (corn flakes and bourbon) and Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee were very intense. The Milk Chocolate Passion Fruit was the winner in my book. I love chocolate and fruit combinations, and this was extremely pleasing to my palate. The downside was that the scoop was really small.

Their menu has some crazy flavors that weren't available when we were there: Strawberry candied jalepeno, Cream Cheese, Salted Licorice, Foie Gras, Pistachio-Bacon, Peanut Butter Curry??? 

If you want to pull a mean trick on someone, get them the Salt 'n' Pepa and tell them it's vanilla bean. I'm sure their reaction would be priceless!

(Cash only)
author: Connie C.

description: I am usually not a fan of ice cream but geez this place is so good!!! I live in so cal and my brother introduced this place to us.  I've been here twice and look forward to going back again when I come back to SF! delicious!  Both times I got the secret breakfast! oh man, I'm craving it now!
author: Wendy H.

description:
Before all the New York Times articles and etc, I was an avid follower to Humphry Slocombe on Twitter. In fact, I got a a Twitter acct just because I wanted to know what creative concoction they would come up with next. That and I was really intrigued by what the heck did foie gras ice cream taste like (to this day, I have yet to sample it). With that said, this review is long overdue! 

Flavors sampled: 

1. Secret Breakfast: Bourbon and cornflakes. WHA?! really? Bourbon ice cream? Not for those who aren't crazy about a little zing in their afternoon scoop because yes, its ice cream laced with bourbon and pieces of crunchy cornflakes. I personally liked it and as my Yelping buddy Olivia said, "It is a breakfast of champions!" 

2. Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee. What else is there to say except I love everything Blue Bottle. And this was no exception. 

3. Chili thai lime: interesting but maybe not my type of scoop. 

Conclusion: if you're looking for something inspired, definitely, this is the place for you. Humphry's changes their flavors on a daily basis so I recommend that you check out their Twitter. Lines get long but its worth the wait. Note: I believe it's closed on Mondays.
author: Wendy L.

description:
Oolong Tea & Blue Bottle Viet Coffee!

I've only been here once, but my boyfriend got seconds of these flavors. It's the best ice cream flavors I've ever tasted, seriously! All of their flavors are unique but I'm sad to say not all of them are good. The Jesus Juice isn't bad either. My friend actually bought a pint of that one. It's a far drive for me and pretty pricey but it's surely something you'd want to treat yourself or someone else to every here and there.
author: Annie S.

description:
What I like
-Secret Breakfast
-Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee
-Curry with Peanut Butter
-Strawberry Jalapeno

What She Liked
-Tahitian Vanilla
-Coconut...?

What we both hated
-Passion Fruit with dark chocolate..BLECK

Great place to go hang out on during hot days, rainy days, cloudy days, sunny days, sad days, happy days...ok basically everyday~
author: phillip w.

description:
Strangely delicious "intellectual" ice cream.
