I tried: Secret Breakfast, Balsamic Caramel, Maple Walnut, and Salt&Pepper.  The Salt&Pepper was the most surprising taste just because I wasn't expecting it to be so fragrant.  The winner, however, was the balsamic caramel.  The flavors work amazingly well together.  The secret breakfast was a close runner up.  It tastes exactly as described -- like bourbon and cornflakes together. Yum!

This is definitely a great ice cream place to go to once in a while, or to take visitors/out of town people.  Myself.. I'll stick with classic ice cream flavors. :)

One thing I really don't understand is the double-headed cow logo.
author: Jenny S.

description:
I was so disappointed after we strolled down to HS on a sweltering Sunday afternoon. The line was short- a bad sign, but great not to have to wait. The service was somewhat apathetic, not warm like at Bi-Rite. The flavors were hard to mentally put together, so I ended up with a Tahitian Vanilla/Blue Bottle Viet Coffee combo cone. It was okay.

The vanilla was icy!! Tsk tsk. The coffee one was STRONG but tasted nice and had very deep flavor. I got a little buzzed off the coffee ice cream, but overall the experience was a let-down.

I'll tell you what really sent me over the edge: Behind us was a couple chatting it up with their buddy behind the counter. I ordered my vanilla/coffee combo to instantly hear "Stupid bitch stole my idea!" muttered from one of the girls, who for some reason was disturbed by my decision to combine 2 of 8 available flavors. What are the odds?

So she got all huffy and made me feel really uncomfortable as her friend behind the counter was completely indifferent... I know, who cares.

Just sayin', the whole experience was kind of meh. Probably won't be going back for a while and that new Xanath place looks like a mental institution, so I think I'm going to stick with Bi-Rite for now.
author: Jeannie C.

description:
Ok, for the 50th time (to myself), you are not interested in having Heathcliff Slocumb (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Heathcliff_Slocumb) ice cream.  That would probably be two stars, tops. 

I came here with friend, Kat H, after seeing both her and yelper Charmain D review this place.

Very nice, neat little store with crazy flavors.  Crazy.  Bourbon and cornflakes  That sounds like something from the movie The Hangover.  It must be good, though, as they ran out while we were waiting to figure out what to get.

I had the Balsamic Caramel and Cinnamon Brittle.  I tasted too much balsamic and not enough caramel, but the CB was perfect.  Almost tasted like I was having apple jacks!

I sampled the Miso Pear, and didn't taste enough pear to warrant it as one of my scoops (two scoops in a sugar cone, $3.25... not bad).

Love the server with the ice cream tats on his arm.  Servers were great... they must get tired of dealing with the undecided waffling between the flavors and just sampling the heck out of the store.  But, they never broke from smiling.

I don't throw out many 5 stars, so don't take that this place didn't get one as a huge issue.  It is the top 5 of ice cream places in the Bay Area.  Probably the unbalance in a couple of flavors (caramel and pear enhancement would ear 5 stars, easy) is the main reason for the pas-de-cinq etoile review.

Um, and they had a RIP sign for Mrs. Slocombe out today (7/2)... My condolences.  They also had a Michael Jackson candle out on their counter, too.

So, seriously, give this place a whirl, knowing that Humphrey makes way better ice cream than Heathcliff makes effective relief appearances.
author: Will A.

description:
In brief:
- Simple, fun interior with window fountain chairs and outside seating, although the two headed calf did creep me out at first
- Ice cream flavors are adventurous, daring, risky and fun. Whoever is in charge is really creative. 
- They let you taste as many as you need to make up your mind, which is a total plus - from those I tried, I got Milk Chocolate Malt and Cinnamon Brittle. They were a gift for my post-dinner pallet. 

In depth:

- More than the off-hand and funky flavors, the ice cream itself was special. Creamy and thick, I felt like I was getting some quality stuff. I tried two and got a small with two flavors. In the end, I got to tast 4 or their 8 flavors, so I feel like I got a good feel for things. You should, too. 

- Milk Chocolate Malt is probably the least exciting flavors they offered, but it was absolutely delicious - especially if your into a soft creamy chocolate. It was my fav, for sure. 

- Cinnamon Brittle was not too strong, but tasted kind of like Fruity Pebbles (weird, I know - but others agreed with me). I wouldn't get it alone, but it was the perfect complement with my chocolate. I recommend getting a small, cause it was the ideal amount after dinner. 

- I also tried the Peanut Butter Curry, which was fantastic. I just wasn't feeling like eating curry after BBQ, so I skipped it. My other test flavor was the Secret Breakfast, which is a mix of corn flakes and burbon - definitely not my cup of tea. If you want something with a kick, go for it. Just not on my list of best ice creams ever. 

- Overall, loved it for many reasons, but mostly cause the ice cream was quality and filled up. It gets a solid 4 stars and a :| cause that burbon left me wincing.
author: Jeff M.

description:
(Listen to Moto Blanco club mix of "Paparazzi" in the background when you read this)

Yallz that know: bein' in drag ain't easy. 
Ya WORK to juice that glam from your inner soulz to a flawless matte'in, hip-struttin', attitude'in, bedroom-eye'in, boob-stuffin', bubble-poppin', hair-weavin', crystal-shinin', 7-inch-dancin' performance on a 3X3 stage...

Honeychil', it ain't easy...makin' reality so hard to believe, in the form of an exaggerated Queen. But the glory is there for all to share, one-dolla-dolla-bill-in-a-Gee-strang at a time...

Hunphry Slocombe is the DRAG-QUEEN of them all!
Not everybody will understand, but she will command some attention dammit!
Not everybody will love her, but there will be some kinda deep-seated admiration!

A Queen of many styles I say, versatAAL, LushUSS, and on top of some kind of wild-night imagination.

The following flavors will be described to a corresponding Rice Rockette (Asian Drag Group Sensation in SF):

Secret Breakfast - BEYONSOY: Down to earth textures of corn flakes meet the mystery of liquor; we are all fans of that!

Peanut butter Curry - DONCHA: Hella unconventional, but familiar. Some thick peanutty spice - makes an impression, lingers.

Olive Oil - ESTEE: Savory, Cool, Luscious

Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee - SAIGON: cuz she's vietnamese

Pistachio Bacon - MARIJOY: Ghetto-ness of Sunday fryin', and bushi-ass snackin in the PM...

Lychee Rose Petal - CEEYALIS: The FACE of the Rockettes - pretty

Strawberry Candied Jalapeno - GHEENA: FIRE core, with the front of editorial fruity perfection

RedHot Roasted Bananas - AVIEYONNE: Novelty of tropical heat sublime, with lashings of laughter, red with candy-coating

Thai Chili Lime - CHI CHI: High-strung tart meet spicy glamour...hold that pose

Performances held everyday.......
author: Jay M.

description:
secret breakfast + jesus juice = BOMB COMBINATION

get it =]
 
Every time i've been, the people were patient and willing to give me all the samples i needed before making a decision.
author: Rachelle T.

description:
Humphry Slocombe's is the new San Francisco staple. 50 years from now we are going to be taking our grandchildren their to pet the double headed goat. 

Great Ice Cream. Unique Flavors. Brilliant. 

Definitely try the Secret Breakfast & Vietnamese Coffee. Today.
author: Nathan M.

description: This was the crazy ice cream combo's ever. I got three scoops, one scoop was Tahitian vanilla, Bourbon & Cornflakes, and I can't remember the third scoop. Then I had a marshmallow fluff topping with bananas and caramel. I'm from Los Angeles and it was worth the 365 mile drive to go
author: Derek W.

description:
Don't let its unassuming facade fool you -- this place is full of amazing frozen treasures.

Here are the flavors I sampled (yes, you can get samples!):

Secret Breakfast (bourbon & cornflakes) - When my friend, who happened to live in a frat, enlightened me on the concept of "Beereal", I was totally disgusted.  So you can probably guess my hesitation in wanting to try cereal with liquor.  Yet, this flavor is amazing!  I actually don't like whiskey, but there's just enough in there that you can taste it without it being overpowering.  If anything, try it for its uniqueness!

Dulce de leche - Delicious, but so rich, I don't know if I could have had a whole scoop of it without feeling like I was suckerpunched in the pancreas.

Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee - Picks you up and won't let you down!  This coffee-flavored treat was pretty spot on.  By the time my friends and I made it here after a morning full of running/walking/hard cardio, we were exhausted and hungry.  This kept me awake and kept me going without a nap the rest of the day!

Oolong tea - If you like green tea ice cream, I think you'll like this one.  This actually ended up being my favorite because it tasted "light", but in a refreshing way, not a "all the fat and sugar has been taken out, gross" kinda way.

I will definitely be fat kidding my way back here to try the rest of the rotating crazy flavors they offer!
author: Alice C.

description: I like places with unique ice cream flavors so I thought I'd really like this place. I sampled the curry flavor and thought it was interesting but not really what I'm looking for in ice cream. I ended up choosing the black sesame since they were out of olive oil. I thought it was pretty good but not really anything to rave about. Maybe someday I shall return, for now you will stay on my bookmarks.
author: Richard S.

description:
Yes, I went here because of the Food Network and New York Times coverage, but that doesn't make the ice cream any less tasty. BF got a scoop of the Secret Breakfast and I got a scoop of the Pepper & Mint. They were both delicious!

Also, it was 50*F and overcast when we went, so there was none of the line about which my fellow Yelpers warned. We knew the San Franciscans were freezing, but we loved eating our cones at the cafe tables out front in what would be spring weather for us.

Finally, the two guys behind the counter were totally chill, gave us the samples we requested, and made correct change. I'm sorry previous customers have faced attitude, but we didn't.
author: Hillary C.

description:
Thanks to my favorite tiny friend Mari C, I finally ventured down here after a downright disappointing burrito up at Papalote.

What better way to turn my frown upside down than these creative concoctions!  I sampled half, the bf sampled the other half, we settled on a sundae of Secret Breakfast and Peanut Butter Curry.  YUM! 

Can't wait to come back and try the rest!
author: Gabrielle J.

description:
Crazy flavors!! They are all...interesting.  I wasn't able to finish my entire cone because one can only eat so much balsamic-flavored ice cream.  Don't get me wrong, it was delicious paired with their olive oil flavor, but I reached my limit fairly quickly.

While everything was tasty, I'll go to Bi Rite before I'll go back here.
author: Alyssa W.

description:
Oh Humphry Slocombe, the newest ice cream craze on the block. How will you compare to the popular kid, Bi-Rite Creamery? Will you show them who's boss?

On my first visit to the Humphry Slocombe (gotta love the name) I noticed the array of outstanding and outlandish flavors. You've got Vietnamese Coffee, Balsamic Caramel, Olive Oil, Oolong Tea, and Secret Breakfast that conisists of Bourbon and Cornflakes. Awesome! I'll try that one morning. But I digress. You also have flavors like cream cheese, FOIE GRAS!, pistachio-bacon, and cucumber ice milk that weren't on the menu that day. Interesting flavors to say the least. 

So I would love to critique all the flavors we tried, but I just kept on thinking of the oh so cool original popular kid. I'll say the only lasting impression of Humphry Slocombe was the Secret Breakfast. That stuff was genius! But after we were all done, we went to Bi-Rite. No, we really did.
author: Al L.

description:
"Oh, I am SO cool.  

I know the LATEST, MOST AMAZING ice cream place eva!

It doesn't matter that I can't actually stand the taste of bacon, pistachio and soap ice cream.  It doesn't matter that i puke in my mouth when I sample the Olive Oil ice cream.

I've BEEN there."

Ugh, this place sucks.  Go for a sample, see what people are saying and leave for that new doughnut shop down the block if you want bacon in your savory treats.
author: Krissy M.

description:
i have been wanting to try this place for a while.  their ice cream is not that creamy but more refreshing. it doesnt have as much chunks as i would like. for example my cinnamon brittle didnt have that many bites with cinnamon brittle in it ... felt like it was missing some crunch ... cash only and the b of a atm is 5 blocks up.

the guy recommended cinnamon brittle but said that secret breakfast and the blue bottle vietnamese coffee were most popular.  i chose cinnamon brittle on a cone and also tried the secret breakfast.

other flavors in the case included strawberry candied jalapeno, peanut butter curry, balsamic caramel, fudgesicle, thai chilli lime, and more ...

they provide water.  outside seating.  indoor counter seating
author: claudia y.

description:
Having three checked off this list (http://www.gourmet.com/restaurants/2009/08/ice-cream-parlors-in-san-francisco), the description for Humphry brought me here on a late Saturday afternoon. Having about two hours before dinner reservations, we decided to risk ruining our appetite for this petite ice cream shop.

The place was very modern, with paintings on the wall that have their ice cream flavors cleverly integrated into. On the wall above the window and seating is the bust of a two headed siamese calf (calves?)

I love that the flavors are written on the glass of the fridge, and quick discription of what it was in parenthesis. I was pretty set on trying the blue bottle vietnamese coffee flavor, but upon reading "jesus juice," i had to try it. Didnt quite knock my socks off--not what I imagined, so I ordered a single scoop of the coffee. It is amazing good. The best coffee ice cream I've everrrr had. If it was more accessible to me, it might be my favorite.

I forgot what flavor the guy got, but the flavor was a bit odd and strong for me. He seem to really like it though.

There's parking on the street. We parked a block down, but right in front is a quick park area for you to run in, order and take a few licks/finish your ice cream. Its well into the mission, which is always fun to explore.

MmMm.. blue bottle vietnamese coffee... now I want a cup.
author: Rena Y.

description:
Bi-Rite cannot compete. Or any other ice cream shop! Humphry is the best, hands down. 

Just imagine it. Warm, but a little breezy day in the City. You spot a cute place with a blue awning and bike over. A short line is out the door so you wonder what the big fuss is about. Once seeing all the ice cream flavors, you are confused whether to feel disgusted or excited. The flavors are so exotic and unconventional! You give them a try and order the peanut butter, vanilla, and ancho chocolate. One bite and you are in HEAVEN. The creamy ice cream melts in your mouth and is one of those foods you can't help but smiling after eating! You feel like a young kid again! 

After tasting Humphry's, I am hooked. Ice cream is now never the same for me. I can never fully enjoy my big ice cream from Safeway without being reminded of how Humphry's is waaaaaay better. It's the most elite ice cream of all. In my opinion, the ice cream makes up for the so-so service. Delicious and highly recommended! It's the perfect treat for any day!
author: Rachel M.

description:
yeah, its all that n a bag of chips.

vietnamese coffee - amazing.  best coffee ice cream i have ever had

chocolate covered potato chip - sounds weird but its actually pretty great

cinnamon brittle - again, very tasty.  goes well with the coffee.

honey thyme - VERY sweet (almost too sweet for me) but the thyme really livened things up.  i really liked this flavor combination.

can't wait to go back.
author: Christian C.

description:
A year ago before I'd tried Ici, Rick's, and Bi-Rite ice cream was low on my list of desserts options, but now that I've had all of the above and humphry's, I will gladly eat my words.  

I think that what differentiates Humphry's is the variety and creativeness it offers.  Who comes up with flavors like Jesus Juice (coke and red wine--reminds me of a Spanish botellon), Sweet Summer Corn, Salted Carmel and makes them taste good?  The Maple Walnut and the malted Dulce de Leche are wonderful. Compared to some of the other fancy ice cream places, serving sizes here are very generous, prices are a bit cheaper, and options abundant.  If it wasn't for Riconella's at Bi-Rite, I'd choose Humphry and day, esp bc parking is easier, and that way you can try the pupusas at the Salvadorian/Mexican food place across the street.
author: mar m.

description:
I was having a few VERY difficult weeks. I spent way more time in bed than I should have... To turn that around, a silly request made became a reality. 

I said to him in my mopiest voice, "Drive me all the way across town for ice cream."

He said, "Sure!" and made the treacherous drive down one of the steepest streets in the city to get to Humphry Slocombe. 

When I awoke from my nap in the car [I had slept the entire way and missed the steep hill that is 21st Street near Noe Valley], I wasn't ready to hop out. After a little more napping [because a day of sleep and then sleeping during the ride wasn't enough], I was ready to face the day [and the half a block walk to the ice cream]. 

After sampling a few flavors [Balsamic Caramel and Jalapeno Strawberry included], I decided on the Pear White Miso and Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee. He had the Secret Breakfast and Vanilla. This delicious combination soothed my soul and also woke me up. Yum yum. Not as creamy as I normally like my ice cream, but still very delicious and refreshing in flavor.

On this particular ice cream trip, we also ran into some friends [Hello, A and S!] who had even mentioned the place to us. 

In conclusion: 

1) Humphry Slocombe Ice Cream is the perfect way to turn a bad few weeks around. 

2) The friends mentioned above must have ice cream ALL the time because we also ran into them at Sketch in Berkeley a few weeks prior. 

Oh, and 3) the boyfriend isn't so bad either...
author: Tinna H.

description:
All I can think about is the black sesame ice cream! Just so you know, I love the taste of sesame seed....i love sesame candy. So this was right up my alley.  The sesame seed flavor was tasted throughout and was not toned down.  That, mixed with the creaminess of the ice cream was just perfect.  

My BF had the secret breakfast, which is bourbon with cornflakes (i think).  He loved it! Note, he is a big bourbon guy.  He did say it was a bit sweet, but the bourbon-i-ness help even the flavors out.  

I'm glad I have some self control, cause this place is about 2 blocks away from my place.  Otherwise, I would have a ice cream problem!
author: Lesliegh H.

description:
I love ice cream, but I'm not sure I love this place. Went last weekend and stood in that long line that moves at a glacial pace and got secret breakfast and fudgsicle sorbet (?). I don't really like my ice cream to taste like bourbon but if that's your thing, this is the place for you. It really does taste like bourbon though! My friends got Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee and that was good. 

What I liked best: 
- the texture of the ice cream... it was just the right amount of light and fluffy to creamy ratio.

What I didn't like: 
- It DOES leave a funny taste in your mouth afterwards.
- The flavors aren't as good as say... BiRite
- Slowest line ever... I never knew how long it took to scoop ice cream until I went here.
author: Abbey S.

description: bf surprised me with a pint of blue bottle Vietnamese coffee flavor. i personally am addicted to Vietnamese coffee.  so i was super excited to try it. anddd it wasn't bad. it tasted nothing like Viet coffee but it had the same sweetness. i do love sweets so i didn't. mind that it was sweeeter, it wasn't sugary sweet but like a milky sweet? like condensed milk....what we use in Viet coffees lol i would love to try other flavors int the future!
author: Kristina L.

description:
I wish I could say that we knew HS before it was famous, but we actually came here after reading the New York Times magazine article (:hangs foodie head in shame:). We had Secret Breakfast and tried a few of the other flavors (Szechuan Strawberry, Jesus Juice, Chocolate smoked sea salt) and were pretty happy with our final choice.

As we were eating our dessert by the bathroom, I happened to look up and saw an arm covered with ice cream tattoos --Jake Godby was in line for the bathroom. Knowing it was gauche to stare, I glanced up once and then adopted a nonchalant look in a direction away from him. Inside my chest, my fangirl heart pitter-pattered -- Secret Breakfast and a Godby sighting all in one day?! Holy sh$t!
author: Annie M.

description: Wow. Very creative, inventive flavors and a friendly staff. They let you try lots of flavors even when there is a line and they don't roll their eyes and look at you like you're a 'tard. I think it was $2.75/scoop or something like that. I had the olive oil and it was sooo good (hints of meyer lemon in it I believe). Yumm.
author: Shira O.

description:
Secret breakfast?  In the South bourbon and cornflakes isn't a secret, it's a coping mechanism.  Can I get an Amen?

I do love Slocombe.  The ice cream doesn't have quite the cleanness of Bi-Rite's but the audacity of it and balance always works.  I could eat the SB or the Blue Bottle Vietnamese coffee forever.

Minor quip is that the service is slow.  I think that's because good ice cream places are usually both understaffed and over-demanded.  Folks love sampling ice cream and it holds up the whole line, especially when flavors are this interesting.

Angel investors, please, seed-fund some startup to solve this problem with Silicon Valley's finest.  Until then I'll be waiting patiently in line for my not-so-secret breakfast.
author: J W.

description:
Alcohol and cereal, my two absolute favorite things-- mutually exclusive...  until I discovered the Secret Brekkie.  Say what?  Bourbon and cornflakes in a perfect union?!  YES PLEASE!  Needless to say, that has been my fave.  However I've also tried:
Peanut Butter Curry: Tastes true to its name, intense peanut butter, intense curry, the flavors didn't mesh well for me upon first taste though...  and I usually like odd things.
Vietnamese Coffee:  Delicious, not too sweet, has a little tang to it.  I normally hate all things coffee, but this and Haagen Daaz's coffee ice cream have eluded the Deliciousness Police, for now.
I'll make the extra trek beyond Bi-Rite for the funky flavors, I'd say same quality, but a lot more variety.
author: tiff g.

description:
This seems like a place people love to talk about, and rightfully so, but I can't see how anyone could become a regular.  Yes, they have the craziest flavors (salt & pepper, peanut butter & curry, etc.) and they were fun to sample and order, but can you really see yourself eating brandy-and-cornflakes-flavored ice cream on a regular basis? 

Still, this place is pretty neat.  I'd definitely bring my friends and out-of-towners here.
author: Chiara H.

description:
The World According to Noelle
~Allergic Girl's Guide to Life~

"My love affair with ice cream has been a long time standing." Noelle W.

I love ice cream. We came here for a little something sweet after eating Rosamund's. It was pretty empty when we arrived. Immediately we were greeted by the friendly gentleman behind the counter. I sampled Salt and Pepper. I selected Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee and Secret Breakfast,  He decided on Balsamic Caramel. After he purchased our ice cream; I noticed a plate of cookies near the register, these cookies for sale were not covered or protected and out in the elements, I was under the impression that food for sale should be covered. The Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee was good at first bite, the Secret Breakfast had cornflake clusters and had hints of Bourbon- second bites of both combined proved to be more intense than I anticipated (to the point that I decided not to finish my ice cream). The ice cream seemed to be light and airy- anything but creamy. I had a taste of his Balsamic Caramel and found the taste overpowering- after the one bite I felt dehydrated and was in need of water. In conclusion I found the ice cream not to be creamy and the flavors overtly overpowering. While the ice cream is one star worthy in Allergy Girl's notebook, I found the customer service to be five star worthy.

If you're wondering what Allergy Girl's Favorite Ice Cream Shops are here is the list:

Ice Cream Shop          Jewelry Store Equivalent

Ici                                 Harry Winston 

Mitchell's                      Tiffany & Company

Bi-Rite                          Bailey Banks and Biddle

Lappert's                      Na Hoku


Noelle's Notes
Skip it

Noelle's Post Secrets
bubbly
http://www.imeem.com/people/Wsyd3b/music/tHfgwJCg/colbie-caillat-bubbly/
author: Noelle J.

description: It's okayyy...everybody always raves about the Secret Breakfast. I tried it and it was nothing to tell the world about. I've also tried their Tahitian Vanilla, Thai Chili (EWW), Orange Carrot (refreshing), and Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee. I don't even want to imagine how prosciutto or salt & pepper would taste like. I do like how they have marshmallow fluff as a topping though! They are indeed very innovative with their combinations. But INNOVATIVE doesn't just mean coming up with bizarre flavors and adding them to the menu for customers to be guinea pigs! I mean I like inventive new flavors of ice-cream but they have to WORK for me...and Humphrey's so far, hasn't. I guess I'll still come back just to check up on what up and coming new inventions you crazy people will come up with next. Or just for marshmallow fluff.
author: Elaine L.

description:
This was a weekend of sugar, booze and cured pork for me.  First off I stumbled across a recipe for an Old Fashioned that called for bacon infused bourbon.  BACON INFUSED BOURBON?!?!

So yes I fried up some bacon and added an ounce and a half of the grease to a fifth of Four Roses and let it sit for 4 hours, then froze it for 2 hours, skimmed the solidified grease off the top and strained it through cheesecloth.

2 ounces of bacon bourbon, 1/4 ounce of maple syrup, 2 dashes of bitters and an orange twist later and I'm in cocktail heaven.  Yes folks, this is how WASPs drink.  No Jaeger bombs for us.

So that's my one pork/booze/sugar combo of the weekend.  The other was the Humphrey Slocumbe Prosciutto Ice Cream with the Secret Breakfast...Prosciutto and Bourbon Ice Creams?  Wow.

I really didn't think I'd be as impressed with Humphrey Slocumbe as I was.  The ice cream itself isn't as dense as I'd like so it melts really fast, but those flavors...Oh. My. Dear. God.  

Next trip I'm trying the Foie Gras, because I am making a point to eat Foie Gras more often to counteract the hippies who keep trying to ban it.
author: Jay W.

description:
If you manage to find a parking space, have the time to stand in line, and are a bit adventurous in your taste, this place is definitely a must-try for any ice cream aficionado who visits San Francisco.

While we were there, we tried raspberry creme fraiche, cinnamon brittle, secret breakfast (corn flakes and bourbon), and peanut butter curry. So, not that unusual really. I thought the secret breakfast was very bourbony but a bit sweet for me. I wouldn't have thought I'd enjoy peanut butter curry, but maybe my taste in ice cream has gotten more eclectic :-)
author: MaryFran L.

description:
Finally, finally, the stars aligned yesterday and I had my first taste of Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee, Secret Breakfast, Salt and Peppa, Olive Oil, Cheese and Rice, and Balsamic Caramel ice cream.  2 scoops $3.25 and 3 scoops $4.50.  Sundaes are $6.00.  Cash only.

They definitely push the envelope when it comes to flavors and textures, so don't expect anything ordinary.  Strong, distinct tastes emanate from each ice cream.  I didn't like it as much as I thought I would, but I can see the appeal.  Line moves fast and you can try as many flavors before choosing.
author: Jennifer H.

description:
Blech.  I've gone to this place twice, and besides the general distaste I feel for the hipster taliban, I'm willing to give it a try.
  Their flavor combinations are generally nauseating.  The ice cream is not terribly complex, just sort of fatty tasting.  Ok, that by itself would not bring it one star, but the flavors!  Vietnamese coffee doesn't taste like vietnamese coffee.  It's bland.  Then today, I got some milk chocolate combo that tasted exactly how my cat's litter box smells when I clean it.  I'm brave, so I tried to eat more, but that was the only flavor it had - it perfectly captured the bouquet of our cat Ship's poo box.  That's just not a flavor you want in ice cream.  Never again.
author: jean m.

description: I love the flavors. And the people working there are nice and patient. And there isn't that insanely stupid line that wraps around the block like at Bi-Rite. Which is great, because Bi-Rite only has one vegan option ever (coconut chocolate) while Humphry always has at least two. It's a bummer that they don't do gluten-free cones though. And it's a bummer that every time I come in, I have to wait for the people in front of me to try every single flavor before making a decision. But I guess that's what happens when everything offered is not standard.
author: Will R.

description:
So my friends wanted to go and ignored my protests, so I decided to try to give it another chance.

I was ready to pass altogether - but I tasted the Chocolate and Candied Orange.  The flavor was lovely.  So I ordered a scoop.  Bad move.  Taking bigger bites revealed that the texture was gritty and sand.  Um excuse me, why is there sand in my ice cream?  

Ugh.  Again.  Bi-Rite Bi-Rite Bi-Rite!
author: Linda L.

description:
This place is extremely popular.  We came 45 minutes before closing and they had sold out of all their ice cream!  They only had pints available for sale, so we picked up three.

Humphry Slocombe is the ice cream equivalent of what happens when two good-looking people who look nothing alike get together and have a fugly baby.  Case in point: balsamic caramel.  I love vinegar and I love caramel but these two things do not go together!  The result exactly like you picture it: caramel made with dairy that's gone bad.  The "Secret Breakfast" was a lesser evil - bourbon ice cream with cornflakes.  It's only good if you like boozy ice cream.  The Vietnamese coffee was really good but that's only because it tasted like creamy coffee ice cream.

This place needs to work on creating harmony instead of cacophony.
author: Sonia C.

description:
Oh Elvis, how you still rock my world. Even in ice cream form (by way of Banana Ice Cream with Bacon Peanut Brittle), Elvis is King. On point banana flavor, and subtle bites of brittle and definitive taste of peanut butter. The bacon is the last lingering note I had on my tongue, you can really taste the richness of the porkie essence. 

Husband had the Butterbeer, which is brown butter almost like a caramel taste doused in an ale. Also rich in cream and would do Potter fans proud.

After a jaunt about the Mission, we made it to HS and the staff was friendly, great to offer samples and suggestions. Fairly priced, more so than Bi-Rite in my opinion. Humphry Slocombe is definitely worth a try for a foodie at heart, this ice cream outside the box.

Can't wait to try the Prosciutto Ice Cream!
author: Jacquelyne L.

description: After my visit to Marlowe, my cousin and I were in need of something sweet! What better to satisfy our sweet tooth than Humphry's Ice Cream! I sampled a couple of flavors including: secret breakfast (Watch out for the bourbon punch!), brown butter and chocolate with sea salt. I was in the mood for some chocolaty goodness, so I went with the chocolate with sea salt. The first few bites were delicious! There was so much depth of flavor. Then it began to get really salty so i couldn't have more than a few bites. In the future I'm going to stick with the brown butter! The brown butter ice cream is amazing!
author: TJ B.

description:
Eh I don't think this place is worth the hype. I mean I will give the staff major props because they're always smiling and super friendly.

However, the ice cream itself is not as great as Bi-Rite. They don't seem to let it set long enough, so as soon as it's out of the freezer, it begins to melt. You have to hoover down your ice cream before it's all over your hand. 

Again, interesting flavors, but if you want yummy ice cream I'd go to Bi-Rite.
author: Rana A.

description:
I just love SF for all these boutique ice cream joints. Humphry Slocombe is exceptionally delicious. I wasn't even that impressed with the secret breakfast because i was slightly shocked by how strong you can taste the bourbon but i still enjoyed it! THis joint is a must try when you are in the 24th-Mission area. 

Strangely enough the weirdest flavor i want to get a scoop of next time is the olive oil flavored ice cream. It totally reminded me of the (vegetable oil based) ice cream of the Philippines. I'll be back.
author: Jason S.

description:
RED HOT BANANA
Hey!  Finally got to try this one!  Very tasty.  

BOCCALONE PROSCIUTTO
You have to sample it, right?  Well, sometimes a sample leads to a scoop, and that's how it went.  Yum!

TWITTER SNACKS
Oh SNAP!  You can follow the latest flavor updates on Twitter!  That is so beautiful.
author: Dan M.

description:
One day I was craving for some ice cream so badly, I looked up some ice cream shops in SF and found this place. I was like what's all this fuss about Humphry Slocombe Ice Cream?

So, one day I brought my mom here. We got the blue bottle coffee and the Tahitian vanilla. they were quite yummy! my mom disliked the coffee but i liked it. she said it tasted like weed hahaha. i loved the vanilla. it was quite rich in flavor.

There's always a line for this place.
author: Annie H.

description: Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee ice cream taste just like a iced Vietnamese Coffee.  I like Vietnamese coffee so I liked this ice cream.
author: Pete C.

description:
100% shock and awe
30% flavor.

On a surprisingly non-crowded Saturday I stood at the counter and sampled every single flavor they had. I wanted to spit some out. The only one I decided on was Vietnamese coffee.

Its good, fairly creamy, overall enjoyable. The rest aren't worth the salt they are adding into their hipster concoctions. 

Go to Bi-Rite, Mitchell's, or squeeze in at Beretta's community table and order the panna cotta with sea salt/EVOO.
author: Sara K.

description:
Avoid the short & grouchy old man (probably the owner)!
If you want friendly service, make sure you get Sean (tall young guy) to help you.

I made the "mistake" to ask the old man to taste 3 different flavors. Somehow 2 was all he thought I needed. And just when I want to place my order a "regular" customer walks in, so he ignores me to go help her. Sean came out from the back, so I placed my order with him. I could have asked Sean to taste more flavors but I had lost all interest then.

The ice cream is not that cheap for the little portions you get, and the location is out of my way. That owner needs to learn better people skills, if he wants more customers.

Personally, I like Bi-Rite Creamery & Mitchell's ice cream better.
author: George M.

description: Oolong tea ice cream is very good -- not too sweet and the taste is minimal. Secret breakfast was too sweet, but I guess every ice cream shop needs to have a flavor that satisfies the general American crowd.
author: Diana C.

description:
Secret breakfreast is an ice cream org@sm in your mouth. This is probably the best ice cream I have ever had.

Parking can be a bit of a pain.
author: Chris K.

description:
Really excellent, friendly, and great ice cream.  I tasted the peanut butter curry which I thought was great but went for the secret breakfast instead (bourbon and cornflakes). It's no secret that I've dined on similar but worse combinations of cereal and alcohol in the morning so I couldn't resist reliving old memories. 

However, I was pleasantly surprised at how well it went together (far far better than Beerios). I was truly happy. 

So why only four?  Because I don't really love ice cream and so I save five stars for things I truly love (like the dry cleaner that returned the $20 bill in my shirt...Humphrey Slocombe just gave me free samples)

Great ice cream though!
author: Darin G.

description:
I sampled the secret breakfast and had a scoop of blue bottle vietnamese coffee and a scoop of brown butter. I loved my choices and although I am not  bourbon fan I thought the secret breakfast was great. You can't taste the alcohol just a little bit of the flavor.

The vietnamese coffee actually has coffee grinds in it which I didn't think I would like (I can't stand the coffee grinds in the compost cookies at milk bar!) but it gave it a grainy texture that worked really well and it was impossibly creamy. 

This is a great stop in the mission. I loved it!
author: Julianne B.

description:
I had the curry and peanut butter ice cream.

And it was good.
author: Tony L.

description:
Word on the street is that you can skip the line if you're buying a pint. That's the final straw. 5-stars!

But seriously. You. Hipster. Yeah you, working on your 3rd tasting spoon. There's a line behind you, asshat. Be considerate and either make a decision or take a step back!
author: Ian H.

description:
Humphrey Slocombe is an ice cream designer, whom I think made one too many tie-dyed T-shirts or tasted too much of Elmer's Glue, growing up.  

HS is like the Jelly Belly of ice cream.  I give the company credit for creating high quality, bold and quirky flavors, like Salt and Pepper, Secret Breakfast, Olive Oil, Red Hot Banana and Guinness Soda Bread Ice Cream.

The staff is nice and patient enough to let me taste the MANY not-so-good creations:  Government Cheese, Foie Gras on Ginger Snap, Passion Milk Chocolate, Bloody Mary, and Hibiscus Beet Sorbet.  

I am glad they didn't make EARWAX flavor.  That would be disgusting!

Call me old school, but I still like my Strawberry from Bi-Rite, Lychee from Polly Ann's, and Cherry Garcia from Ben and Jerry's.  

If you want something to move your trunk, try my favorite flavor, the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee, which has a smooth presence of condensed milk along with a strong coffee taste.  My second runner up is the Balsamic Caramel.  Third is Chocolate Chip Cookie.

I have yet to try their Bacon Peanut Brittle or the Thai Chile Lime Sorbet, and I look forward to returning for some more fancy ice cream, if my frozen yogurt craving doesn't get in the way.

A single cup or cone costs under $4.  The bad news is that their ice cream melts quickly on a normal day in San Francisco.  The day that I buy more than a quart of ice cream from HS is when I shall change my ratings to 5 stars.  I am sure HS will come up with something brilliant to surprise me.

Meanwhile...

I scream.  You scream.  We all scream for

Blue Bottle Coffee Ice Cream!

* I dedicate this local ice cream review to my first fan, Michelle K from NY, who is an Elite in my book.  Hint, hint to the Yelp Gods.
author: CT L.

description:
How can you go wrong with fresh, homemade ice cream? 
Humphry has an array of weird but amazing ice cream flavors to choose from. 
You read the name of some of these flavors and think "ewww...gross!" But just ask for a sample and you will completely change your mind!
The ice cream is so creamy and fresh and delicious!

I got the breakfast special & Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee!
I can't wait to go back for more.

Tip: Arrive early before your favorite flavor is gone! 
They only make enough ice cream for the day!
And don't forget your cash, they do not accept credit cards/ATM cards!

The only negative thing I will say is that the parking sucks on 24th & Harrison! But the ice cream is sooo worth it! YUM!
author: Stephanie M.

description:
You should really go here. No you should. Why? Well beside the fact that I'm recommending it with 5-stars? They have outrageously adventurous ice cream and sorbet flavors. Where else can you get "Salt & Pepper" or "Strawberry Jalapeno"? Sundaes, cones, and toppings too! But since the ice cream and sorbet are so packed full of flavor you don't really need any additions.

My first time here I didn't feel ready to plunge into the deep end of ice cream exploration, I chose a cup of "Poppyseed Kumkwat" and "Coconut Sorbet". It was devine! The Sorbet was smooth and addicting while the Kumkwat was buttery. The flavors are so satisfying I wouldn't recommend getting anything more than a cup. But I definitely have to check if they sell their frozen treats by the quart.

Slocombe's hides behind a minimal blue and white facade. The ice cream will surprise you when it explodes in your mouth.
author: Michael H.

description:
Amazing!  

My friend suggested that I try the Secret Breakfast and I am SOOO glad I did!  Cornflakes and Bourbon will now be my special morning treat.  Who knew this combo would go so well together?!?!

This place is busy (like most of the ice cream shops in SF) so it's a good thing they are close to where my friend lives in the Mission, or maybe that's not such a good idea...
author: Cassandra H.

description:
Let's not shit ourselves, when my wife relayed to me that she could not finish her ice cream it wasn't as if I was irritated that we just spent three dollars fifty on the scoop. I was actually happy that I was going to polish off her scoop of Olive Oil ice cream . Of course, I had already eaten my share but my love of the frozen stuff would not have stopped me from eating hers. 

I love it so much that I often have debates about it. By debates I mean internal monologues as I am sure that 99.9876% percent of the population could care less about what I would want to discuss. Who is the better Delicious Vinyl era MC: Tone Loc or Young MC? What superhero would you most like to have a beer with? What is the best culinary creation: pizza, the sandwich, or ice cream? 

Yes, Ice Cream (notice the capitalization) rounds out the trifecta of best culinary creations Of. All. Time. San Francisco being the food-stuff capital that it is, it's not surprising that a spot like Humphry Slocombe (pronounced hump-ree slock-jaw) with its olive oil, miso pear, I.P.A. beer flavored creations exist. At first the flavors sound like a novelty or a dare or just a bad idea, but after tasting them I dig 'em. 

I had the Secret Breakfast (Bourbon & Corn Flakes) with a scoop of Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee ice cream. She had Miso Pear & Olive Oil. All were great. Already I am looking forward to sampling some more of their wares. 

While we are on the topic of all things Ice Cream, have you noticed the Red Triangle of this glorious stuff that has emerged in the Mission/Bernal Area?? Humphry, Bi-Rite, Mitchell's, Maggie Mudd. I know this is four points and triangle is made up of three, but the Red Parallelogram just doesn't sound as bad-ass.
author: Bucky K.

description:
Excellent,  off the beaten path flavored ice cream!  This establishment boast some of the most creative flavors of this common dessert.  The ice cream here is intense, silky, and wonderfully poignant to the taste buds.  

Give yourself a treat and drop by this place for some enlightenment!

Btw, you can get this stuff at Falletti's market on Fell.
author: MTBer I.

description: Cool little neighborhood.  Reminded me of Sesame Street for some reason.  Tons of interesting flavors.  Small neighborhood place.  Amazing Salted Watermelon Sorbet!!!  Try it if your in the area.
author: R L.

description:
You know you found an AMAZING ice cream parlor if you can drag your anti-carb friend to HS to eat 2-3 scoops of the heavenly flavors.

The texture of the ice cream is solid creamy with low air bubble content. Very similar to my other favorite joint - bi rite creamery.
The main difference between HS and Bi Rite is the selection of the flavors.

Humphry Slocombe dares to put things you dont expect to exist in ice cream as a subtle or "in your face" flavor.


MUST TRY
Secreat breakfast: A+
Chocolate w/ Candied orange A+
Jesus Juice (red wine and coke classic) A+
Balsamic caramel: A
Milk chocolate passionfruit A 


TRY WHEN YOU ARE NOT FULL AFTER SCOOP #2
Nectarine yogurt: B+
MeEvoy Olive Oil B+ (tastes more lemony than olive oily)
Pistachio-bacon B+ (I wish there were more bacon flavor)

GET SAMPLES BEFORE YOU MAKE FINAL DECISION
Blue Bottle Coffee C- (average coffee flavor, nothing too sensational)
Thai Chili Lime C- (Refreshing but a bit spicy)
Peanut Butter curry D (I love them separately but not when combined)
Salt and pepper D (they should never exist in any ice cream flavor)
author: Fred F.

description:
I like the concept of Humphry Slocombe - twelve crazy and original flavors are offered each day (except Mondays when they are closed), and they try to rotate flavors pretty frequently.  TIP: This place is cash only.  Had we done our research, we would have brought cash.  If you need an ATM, there's a Mexican restaurant with an ATM inside about a block away.

What works in theory doesn't always pan out in reality.  I tried the Thai Chili Lime which was just plain weird.  Call me old-fashioned, but I'm not really one for spicy ice cream.  I tried the Pepper Mint as well, not to be confused with Peppermint.  This one had cubes of pepper in it.  Again, not down with spicy ice cream.

My bf got the Blueberry Nectarine Yogurt and the Chocolate.  Both were passable in my opinion.  The Blueberry Nectarine was too tart and the Chocolate was too rich, though, my bf, a chocolate fiend, seemed to like it a lot.

I ended up getting a scoop each of the Secret Breakfast (cornflakes and bourbon) and Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee.  The SB was too alcoholic for me, which says a lot because Lord knows I love my bourbon.  But I ended up not being able to eat it, and it made my tongue feel weird.  But the Vietnamese Coffee redeemed Humphry Slocombe, and it was almost as refreshing as the real thing.  I'd come back again just for this flavor, but probably not before getting Birite's Strawberry ice cream to which I've developed an addiction.
author: Kira K.

description: Amazing ice creams!! Don't miss the secret breakfast!! It's a small place and expect it to be crowded.. But apart from that it's absolutely awesome
author: Vinay P.

description:
To be honest, I'm not a huge fan of the ice cream.  I tried a smidgen of the Secret Breakfast, (which is apparently made with bourbon and corn flakes...obviously, I can't be trusted with a secret) and thought it was decent.  

The chocolate non-dairy sorbet was a little too dark, salty, and close to savory.  I am not the ice cream aficionado, I admit.  These flavors were a little too sophisticated for my simple, Mitchell's ice cream palate.   

Although I didn't care for the ice cream, I can appreciate the care and consideration that goes into every artisan scoop.  These people love their craft, that's for certain.

However, the CHOCOLATE CHIP COOKIES were to die for.  Chewy, delicious, and perfectly fresh out of the oven.  I ate six.

I'm eating for two, so that's ok....let's just agree to agree and move on.
author: Kristina R.

description:
yes yes ya'll, I must agree, the lines are much shorter than Bi-Rite, the flavors are much more exotic. When was the last time you had Spicy Thai ice cream!?! I hope the shop does not get over exposed lose its humble roots. The price of a scoop is $3.25 but you get what you pay for, a good quality product.

I don't know if they use whole milk here but my stomach was OK after my cone. If you know what I mean.

Secret Breakfast, a must try for Bourbon enthusiasts.
author: Tony N.

description: Very creamy! Unusual flavors, some excellent others ok. There is something for everyone. Flavors change frequently.  Today  I tried sweet corn ( tasted like cream of corn) , tried Vietnamese coffee- absolutely my favorite, with a scoop of rum raisin ice cream made with golden raisins. They also have a nice selection of sorbets- some made with habanero, cayenne, and peppers...all good if you like something less creamy.  Outstanding customer service. Will definitely come back
author: Serita M.

description:
Yum! A bit out of the way for me, but well worth the trip. Tried samples of almost all of their flavors and decided on I believe it's called a tin roof sundae, with vanilla ice cream, peanuts, sea salt, and fudge sauce. Followed that up with an hibiscus ice tea sorbet (one scoop). They've got pints for sale as well in case you want to take some to go. 

Service was fast and nice, which was nice. My sweet tooth and I will be back! One suggested flavor....egg nog and Jack Daniels!
author: David G.

description:
If you're looking for a spot that serves up ice-cream flavors dreamt up from someone on LSD then look no further than this place. I'd say 50% of the flavors here are fantastic, 30% are pretty good, and the remaining 20% are 'interesting'. 

The menu changes frequently but here are my favorites (and I guarantee you will like them):

- Secret Breakfast 
- Tahitian Vanilla
- Coconut Sorbet
- Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee

If you'e going on a hot day (hot for San Francisco is anything over 70 degrees) then plan to wait in line anywhere between 15-30 minutes. The staff folks are extremely friendly and are accustomed to people trying nearly everything before they buy something.

A great way to change it up if you belong to the Bi-rite club!
author: Ranier G.

description:
Don't hate me, but I was kind of underwhelmed by this place.  
After jonesing to come here for months, I finally made it up there while they were open (FYI they are closed on Mondays).  Between me and my ice cream buddy, we tried a bunch of flavors.
Balsamic caramel - Too intensely balsamic for ice cream.  No thanks.
Yuzu with black sesame - Interesting salty/sour/sweet combo.  Good as a taster, but a whole scoop was a bit much.
Oolong - like sweet oolong tea.  Good, not great.
Secret breakfast - Really??  I honestly don't get the hype.  Maybe because I'm not a bourbon drinker, but not my favorite.
Olive oil vanilla - Not very exciting. Tastes like it sounds.  
Strawberry with black olive - probably my favorite of the bunch, but only because it tasted like fresh strawberries and you couldn't really taste the olive.

Overall, I felt they were trying to be too ambitious with their funky flavors and just ended up with funk, kind of like the Harry Potter Jelly Bellies.  It's worth a visit, just to try something new, but next time, I'll probably just hit Bi-rite Creamery instead.
author: Cindy W.

description:
excellent and tasty!  Flavors change frequently, but it would be more lovely if they have more selection at one time.  Could be a tactic so people keep returning since not many flavors at a time.

Clean and very friendly atmosphere, and they even take credit cards now.  Excellent!
author: tomcat f.

description:
It's a tiny ice cream shop with almost 3,000 yelp reviews--isn't that enough of a reason to try it out??

It was SOOO very good, with such interesting flavors!!  I knew I HAD to have the balsamic caramel...so I had to taste a couple of others to audition for the supporting cast.  Salt & pepper--definitely interesting, not overly sweet.  Hot Nanna (red hots and banana)--not sure what to think.  Secret breakfast (bourbon & corn flakes)---WE HAVE A WINNER!

Loved the interesting and unique flavors, and I also enjoyed the texture of the ice cream.  Definitely worth the trip (and searching for parking and waiting in line.)  Oh, and at 4.25 for two scoops--I thought it was an awesome value!
author: Amy M.

description:
RY @Amy C. 1 Scoop of Amazingly Good Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee + 1 Scoop of Uniquely Interesting "Secret" Breakfast = The PERFECT excuse to have Ice Cream for Breakfast (not that I needed one really...)

THANK YOU Humphry Slocombe!

****  I've adapted Twitter-speak for the Yelp world.  I found Amy C.'s review of Humphry's to reflect my own thoughts.  For the uninitiated:

"RY" = Re-yelp 
@Amy C. = I am Re-yelping Amy C.'s yelp
*Her Yelp Review* = *Her Yelp Review*
author: Swarup B.

description:
Four stars, but only because I've tasted better in Ohio (Jeni's Ice Cream, go check it out, they ship, too)...it comes the closest on this coast. 

Hands down the best ice cream I've had in the Bay Area - love the peanut butter curry, coffee...pass on the balsamic caramel for me. Great people work here - they are so friendly and great, making the experience all the better. We were the last customers a couple weeks ago and they sent us off with the unsold chocolate chip cookies. ;-)

Can't wait to go back here and glad I'm on Facebook so I can know what the flavors are!
author: jenn w.

description: I love it when genius' come up with new, creative and tasty imaginative combinations.  This place always has long lines and its 100% worth it.  They allow you to taste all the flavors and you will never be disappointed.  Their flavors are also like non other on this planet.  This should be the deemed the "ICE CREAM" of San Francisco.
author: Joseph C.

description:
I've had regular ice cream all my life.  I'm excited to further explore Harry Potter-esque flavors such as Thai Peanut Butter Curry, Vietnamese Coffee and Secret Breakfast (bourbon + corn flakes). 

Some have thrown down the gauntlet; they claim Humphry dethrones local ice cream champ Bi-Rite. I think that's unfair, if Bi-Rite is Queen, then Humphry Slocombe is David Bowie. Both are iconic, but only one really went the extra mile to achieve strangeness. And that strangeness includes flavors such as "Foie gras"...
author: Alan F.

description:
This place has a line at all times and you wonder why? With almost, 300,000 followers on twitter, this ice cream spot is one of the hidden treasures of San Francisco. 

I will admit that some of the flavors are a bit out there. Talk about the Prosciutto ice cream.... that is some salty pig parts as ice cream! YUMMM! But overall, this place is original and yummy at the same time. 

Their menu ranges from your typical fruits and flavorings, to candy, to beers, to herbs, to even oils! Interesting choices but worth trying. Check them out! It's worth the experience. 

Secret breakfast, Pink grapefruit and their bourbon ice cream are some of my favorites.... i got another 100 flavors to go!
author: Marcela R.

description:
sweet mother of all things amazing.

this place is freaking awesome.

the flavours are all so interesting and different and omg yum.

last time i was in SF i was staying a few blocks away and man, can i tell you... danger will robbinson! danger!

so good.

the balsamic caramel is orgasmic. 
secret breakfast is so major win.
the salt and peper was interesting, but it got a bit much by the end. 
olive oil and white misa - holy hell.

the list could go on.

and the staff is so excited about what they do, it just makes it all that much better!

till we meet agin....
author: Haley F.

description: I know that everyone talks about the Secret Breakfast flavor but My favorite one is the Vietnamese Coffee. So good! You can definitely taste the condensed milk and that strong flavor of coffee. These two flavors mold together coat you mouth in a creamy goodness that is deliciousness. It is to say the least a really good place for ice cream but there is always a line so dont come hungry!
author: Luigi B.

description:
Balsamic caramel.
Blue Bottle Vietnamese coffee.
Valrhona fudgesicle.

One scoop of each, in a cup - $4.50. Yeah, that's how I roll.

(ok, lame review...but Humphry Slocombe features some of the most interesting flavors of ice cream that I've ever tried. Speaking of which, the staff at HS are more than happy to let you taste away. Go ahead, try the olive oil or the salt & pepper...I won't tell anyone.)
author: phil h.

description:
Lord have mercy, this is ice cream heaven! I've never experienced so many amazing combinations of flavors that sound odd, but work. 

The peanut butter curry is sublime, the olive oil is mild, nutty and creamy at the same time and the balsamic caramel really tasted like vinegar melded with caramel. 

The day we went they didn't have the infamous secret breakfast, which is fine by me because it gives me an excuse to come back and taste my way through the amazing flavors Humphry Slocombe has to offer.
author: Lee H.

description:
I freak'n love this place & every city goer needs to hit this place up at least once to try all the flavor, that said, here's a couple quick tips:
1) Follow their Tweets b/c they change their flavors daily & reading their daily tweets will tell when your favs or new flavors are availble
2) When you get be sure and try as many flavors as possible, trust me they won't get mad, oh and don't be scared off by the names of flavors
author: Sean V.

description:
if you read harry potter, humphry's ice cream is comparable to bertie bott's every flavor beans. you never know if you're going to get something delicious or something outrageously disgusting...but you want to take the risk all the same.

some examples of flavors that grossed me out - the secret breakfast...when i sampled it, the intense bourbon flavor made me feel like i was taking a shot of alcohol - i'm trying to enjoy some ice cream...not have my tongue assaulted by alcohol!

and the curry with peanut butter ice cream - wow. no. 

other flavors are just "fancy" classic flavors, flavors like vietnamese coffee, tahitian vanilla. i still didn't feel any desire for  them even after sampling them. 

i wanted none of the ice cream even after standing there for a while, debating. i was saddened. that NEVER happens to me. i finally ended up getting "brown butta" because i did not want to walk out with nothing, after making such an effort to get here. 

and you know what was a MAXIMUM disappointment? the brownies! they were dry, hard, bland, not fudgey at all...this was a huge letdown because brownies are the best pairing with ice cream. the bad quality of the brownies demonstrated to me that they don't really care about the quality of everything that they share with us. details, people!! details.

if you ever want to have an adventure and try some unheard of (and bizarre) ice cream flavors, humphry's will fulfill you. you might even like it...
author: Jessica C.

description:
The flavors offered here veer far off from your conventionals.

While I found a couple intriguing ingredient combinations working incredibly well together, others were hit-or-miss.

There isn't a 'best flavor', it's going to come down to personal preference, so use your samples well!
author: Chase C.

description:
I read a Yahoo article from a very misinformed writer stating that Humphry Slocombe was the best ice cream parlor in San Francisco.  To be quite frank, NO.

On a day of an "U-turning" tutoring session for Kder, the one blemish on her otherwise steller Earnhardt-esque driving resume, we decoded to cool down at Humphrey Slocombe nearby.  I had spent a good 10 minutes trying to get her to flip a bitch at various junctures, however, her stout fear and refusal led way to stubborn resolve and we drove in a straight line for nearly a mile, with her ignoring my every command.  My throat was horse and parched and her armpits were in need of cooling and more importantly, NAPKINS.  Humphry Slocombe does not have an extensive library of flavours.  I assume they have a couple staples and flavours that change daily.  I tried to erase the endless hype this place received and used jedi mind tricks to delete comments I have heard over the years from my memory banks.  i tried the flufferbutter (penut butter and marshmallow) which tasted alrite.  It was like eating penut butter.  I could not really taste the marshmallow.  I tried the watermelon sorbet which was also average.  It tasted like icy watermelon smoothies my mom makes.  It was very light on the tongue and you could tell they used natural ingredients  I settled on the sea salted chocolate while Kder got a scoop of McEvoy olive oil.  

The verdict - They gave very generous single scoops of ice cream.  They are not stingy at all.  I have to note, for KDer's sake and her passion for waste management, that they have a green ideology.  Instead of giving out plastic disposable spoons, they use metal spoons which can be washed and reused.  Despite their generosity and tree hugging ways, their ice cream is average.  The sea-salt chocolate was so salty.  After dragging my tongue across the surface of the ice cream, I thought I was eating a scoop of whiskey ice cream for some reason.  However, the trick with Humphy Slocombe is not to take breaks between licks.  You have to continually lick and soon, your tongue becomes numb and everything tastes good and sweet.  When I tried KDer's olive oil, I bert stared her.  It was as if I was eating frozen virgin olive oil.  However, she advised me again to not take dainty licks.  Stuffing my face in it as one would do a clean shaven box, I began to see the different flavours.  I tasted orange and some floral flavoring.  Overall, I was less than impressed.  Some people may like this place just due to their unique flavors.  They have an ice cream that has bourbon and cornflakes.  Some people just love shit that is just "weird" aka i'm so indie because I wear toms and sperrys as my night slippers and I listen to bands nobody knows like Mumford and Sons (which I love btw...their album is one of best I've heard in a while..just wanted to give them a little advertisement) when in fact, everybody knows or has them.  I am sure if they advertised an ice cream blended with organic grass (blades of grass plucked from the shrubs outside), that would rapidly become an SF top flavor.  Call me boring, call me old fashioned, but good 'ole Dryer's ice cream is more savory for me.  Try their caramel delight.  I'd rather have that any day of the week save one...that day is reserved for Bi-Rite salted caramel.
author: Brian V.

description:
One of the greatest pleasures in life is to try an ice cream flavor that you've never had before.  As time goes on, it gets harder to experience that "first time" thrill.  

Not at Humphry Slocombe!    When my brother hinted that he was up for ice cream, I coerced him to come with me to try out Humphry Slocombe.  We managed to find parking on Harrison about a block away which is closer proximity than I ever get going to Bi-Rite!   

The staff were super friendly, helpful, and enthusiastic.  I called earlier to ask what time they closed and what flavors were offered today and they couldn't be nicer or more helpful.   We sped down there and got in line a half hour before they closed.  My picks were:  Special Breakfast, Vietnamese Coffee, and Balsamic Caramel.  All 3 went splendidly together!  I highly recommend the combination.  Out of the three, my favorite was Special Breakfast.  I found the bourbon component to be more subtle than my yelping peers, but maybe it's because I rather enjoy booze in my desserts.

** Changed to five stars for improvement in service since opening and adding another day to being open!  Yay!   Also changing my favorite flavor to Jesus Juice (red wine and coke classic sorbet, holy crap, it's good.)
author: Courtney Y.

description:
Weird ice cream flavors, they're amazing! I had the Secret Breakfast (bourbon and corn flakes) and who ever named all the flavors of the ice creams ("Here's your damn Chocolate!") is probably one of the funniest people ever.  
This is my new favorite ice-cream place of all time.
author: Beatriz A.

description:
Came here after a extreme work out at Sky High. They have a very interesting selection of flavors. I tried every one of them. Sorry for holding up the line guys... Just to let you know, the name of the flavor pretty much sums up the taste. My favorites were Jesus Juice and Secret Breakfast. Interesting how they were the only two infused with alcohol. Hmm, there's no trend here right? 

Worth a try. I'll probably be back in a couple of months when I'm feeling adventurous again.
author: Tina Y.

description:
known for their inventive flavors, you really can't go wrong with whatever flavor you choose at humphry's.  they use high quality ingredients and you can tell.

my personal favorite combination is one scoop of secret breakfast and one scoop of chocolate.  there's something really winning (a la charlie sheen) about those two flavors together that does a little something magical to my face.

be warned though, patrons... when it's moderately warm outside the line is ri-dic-u-lous, which means that when it's a legitimate nice day, you could be waiting for over 30-minutes.

but if you like ice cream, just man up and wait in line.
author: Lauren P.

description:
Great in house made ice cream. have tried many of their flavors and I have loved them all. most recently I tried Elvis, the fat years ( Bacon, PB, and Banana) very good. wish they were closer to my house but then again I probably need the 4.5 mile bike ride if I am going to eat a pint over a two days (sometimes one) :)
They also sell Giant Tubs (call ahead) up to two gallon? Great for parties or commercial use
author: Jonathan G.

description:
Secret Breakfast, YOU ARE THE WEAKEST LINK.
Heidi C. has officially booted it from one of Humphry Slocombe's top picks. 

WHY?

It was TOO SWEET!! Last time, the balance between sweetness and bourbon was perfect, this time, it was just way too sugary. Plus, the amount of corn flakes went down, like the stock market.

BUT

Oolong Tea has taken over. It's light, refreshing, and somewhat of a palette cleanser. Have you had Bi-Rite's Honey Lavendar? If so, I'm referring to how refreshing it is, not the taste. It's the same refreshing-ness. I like it. Humphry Slocombe needs to put Oolong Tea as their staple flavor alongside BB Viet Coffee and Secret Brekky, I suppose. 

Don't forget to try the Pistachio Bacon flavor. Definitely something not to pass up!!
author: Heidi C.

description:
Order the Blue Bottle Vietnamese coffee flavor. I am not even a coffee fan, but I LOVE it. I wanted to try out other flavors as well, but they were getting ready to close, so I didn't want to be annoying. 

Next time, will definitely try the other flavors!

I even got a pint of the Blue Bottle Vietnamese coffee to bring home =)
author: Willa L.

description:
I'm going to keep this brief because it's pretty much been all said and done but if you are in the area, this is one of those places you just need to check out.

My sister had the Secret Breakfast and I had the Peanut Butter Curry.  We both enjoyed the unique flavors.
author: Mary F.

description: My husband I stopped here on the way to dinner lol I know but we were trying a new place so I wanted to have a little something on my stomach. We a few flavors but the red hot banana and beet lavender wer by far my favorite full of flavor and rich cool and creamy ice cream and tart fruity sorbet. The have a list of wild flavors and I definitely want to come back for more. I would suggest this place if you want good ice cream and a little adventure
author: Darin Christi F.

description:
It is truly as good as everyone says it is. Your tastebuds have never had anything like the ice cream flavors here.

Secret Breakfast is a must. I don't even like bourbon, but I absolutely adore the Secret Breakfast. 

Blue Bottle Vietnamese coffee and white miso pear and honey thyme are also fabulous. 

On my first visit, I sat at the counter licking my spoon and embarrassing/annoying my boyfriend by exclaiming: "MMMMMM. MMMMM. MMMM this is SOOOOO GOOOOD. MMMMM. Isn't this SOOOOO goood??? MMMMMMMM" for a solid 20 minutes. On my second visit, I repeated the exercise, this time to my roommate. It's so good that you can't help but spontaneously burst out with MMMMMMs.
author: Deb I.

description: Daring flavors and fun decor, this place is great.  I loved the salted licorice and their malted chocolate is great.  They only 4 stars because sometimes the consistency of the ice cream isn't perfect.  Overall, not to be missed.
author: Mel H.

description: I first tried Humphry Slocombe at the Ferry Building farmer's market and shared little scoops of a few flavors with my cousins.  I thought it was good so I took some friends to the shop in the Mission and we each got our own Secret Breakfast (famous flavor) ice cream cones.  Really good and very different, because it didn't have a creamy texture! But good nonetheless.  My only complaint was that halfway through, we all started getting a weird filmy taste in our mouths, or as my friend describes it, like putting a stick of butter in your mouth.  So...yeah, it's good, just not my favorite.  I'd definitely pick Bi-Rite or Mitchell's any day.
author: Tanya P.

description: Mmm.....lemon sorbet. The best I've ever had. As a lactard, sorbet availability is extremely important to me, and I've tried most kinds from the grocery and always get it when it's an option at fro yo places and the like, but this was just amazing. Creamy and fluffy almost like actual ice cream, impeccable flavor, adorable little shop. Delightful.
author: Lauren C.

description:
If you don't like vanilla, Humphry Slocombe Ice Cream is the place for you!

The flavors created here are bizarre and quirky. Thankfully enough, free samples of each flavor is a must.

The last time I came here I had the Curry Peanut Butter ice cream. It may sound a little odd but was actually quite delicious.

Humphry's is a quaint gem of an ice cream shop perfectly nestled in San Francisco.
author: Frankie W.

description:
"For my birthday, my husband took me to San Francisco for a day of museums and lunch. I couldn't decide whether I wanted to try the ice cream at Bi-Rite or at Humphry Slocombe, so he took me to both because he is really just the best."

That is quoted from my review of Bi-Rite. Let's redo it like it was a Mad Lib!!! 

For my *Ash Wednesday*, my *mother-in-law* took me to *Detroit* for a day of *garden sheds* and *milk*. I couldn't decide whether I wanted to *throw* the *tacos* at *McDonald's* or at *Bejing, China*, so s/he took me to both because s/he is really *marvelous*.

Wow, that was fun.

Humphry Slocombe is also a good example of something that is fun. The bubbly, flamboyant, well groomed, attractive man behind the counter was really nice, allowing us to try lots of flavors, and giving us a discount because our last name is Humphrey even though we don't spell Humphrey "Humphry" like they do.

I could eat Secret Breakfast for breakfast and any other meal every day. It is extremely bourbon-y and has corn flakes in it, which give me that sweet and salty combo I appreciate so much in a food. I also got Vietnamese Coffee and Coconut Sherbet, but I wished I had just ordered a bathtub of Secret Breakfast.

I'd like to say I'd go back and order their other tantalizing flavors, such as Olive Oil, Balsamic Caramel and Honey Thyme, but I will certainly not do that. I don't get out this way very often and when I do, am I sure I will want Secret Breakfast, and only Secret Breakfast.
author: Rachel H.

description:
Their Secret Breakfast is what it's hyped up to be.  Their Blue Bottle Vietnamese coffee is too.. and the two go very well together since the SB helps to balance out the overpowering espresso in the Viet Coffee. 

BUT, don't take for granted that all their flavors are just as delish.  Ask for samples!  Because their Jesus Juice (red wine and other stuff) was horrible.

The place is surprisingly efficient too.. I remember pouting at the long line but it moved quickly.  Good size scoops too =)
author: Beatrice T.

description:
destined to be an institution if not already. the fact that not everything is dead on makes it that much more endearing. you can taste before you buy, anyways. the store itself, minimal, unfussy, no branding, crackles with unpretentious energy. and i like the fact i have to misspell it to spell it and my girlfriend definitely can't pronounce it.

jesus juice (red wine and coke) was bad. but for a free taste, hell.

balsamic caramel sings, but then again, i practically gargle with vinegar. 

secret breakfast is a wee overrated but just a wee.
author: Henry Y.

description:
I love my ice cream. Heck, I worked at an ice cream shop in high school. I take my ice cream seriously. Sampling ice cream at Humphry Slocombe will make you giddy as a schoolgirl with their infamous array of flavors. Their most popular flavors (Secret Breakfast and Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee) are always winners. I don't even like bourbon, but who knew I would love it with corn flakes in ice cream?! My favorite is honey thyme - the first time I tried it it made my whole body tingle. 

This place serves honest to goodness tasty scoops of ice cream with deliciously unexpected twists. The ice cream is light and creamy, but makes you think twice how something like pumpkin and five spice could really be an ice cream flavor, and a good one at that!
author: Jac C.

description:
I went here at 7:30 (they close at 8) on a random freezing cold Tuesday so found parking easily and didn't have to deal with a line.

I was excited to try all the "weird" flavors...but sadly, most of them didn't work for me. 

Balsamic caramel was icky!!!! Yikes! The balsamic portion was really strong. I was hoping it would be more of a hint.

White chocolate lavender sounded like it would be good but it was all lavender, no white chocolate. Felt like I was munching on some Bath and Body Works lotion.

My cousin tried the Jesus Juice + Coke one and said it was gross.

Vietnamese coffee was really good, but hey I was at a weird-flavor-ice-cream shop I wasn't about to get coffee flavor!

After trying these three I felt like I needed to make up my mind. The hipster dude behind the counter was totally nice and patient with giving me samples, but I felt bad anyway. Then I tried Secret Breakfast. My sample was really good! It had a huge, crunchy, bourbon-soaked cornflake in it and I was like man, this is the sheeeeit!

However, when I ordered the full-size scoop, there was nary a cornflake to be found. Okay, maybe like 2 crumbs of cornflakes. It just wasn't that special without the cornflakes...like alcohol-tinged vanilla ice cream and then it got too sweet after a while.

I think this place is good to go to once or twice for the novelty of it, but I'll be buying my overpriced ice cream at Bi-Rite.
author: Keli B.

description: There is no parking!!!! That's the only negative. Viet Coffee and Special B'fast are crazy good. Oh yah, the ice cream is so rich that it can leave you with a creamy film in your mouth which is kinda gross. They have a big bottle of filtered water with cups to help you cleanse your palette - you'll want to take advantage of that.
author: Natalie L.

description:
I read about this place on Daily Candy's SF Weekend Guide, so I've wanted to check it for some time now. I was in SF a few weekends ago and happened to be in the area for the Carnaval (Brazilian Carnival), so my friends and I decided to head over. Little did I know that it wasn't as close as I expected and was huffin' and puffin' as we reached our destination.

Entering the ice cream store, the sweet smell of sugary goodness filled my senses. My sister had warned me that their ice cream was sweet, but her scale of sweetness and mine don't compare. I went up to the counter like a little girl at a candy store and asked for their Secret Breakfast, which is bourbon and corn flakes, and a scoop of the vietnamese coffee. Both were delicious, but yes, in fact, they were really rich. I think I could've shared one serving with a buddy, but my buddy got the coconut sorbet, which was really light and frothy. It almost tasted like....coconut nothings. Weird. 

Anyhow, after walking all the way to Slocombe, I realized we had to walk ALL the way back to our car. Sadness. Probably walked a good three to four miles that day. Exercise of the year!
author: Sharon O.

description:
To justify stopping in for the little container of this rich and delicious ambrosia, I decided I was going to workout all morning, then go for a bike ride and ride the bike all the way out to Humphry Slocombe's.  Well I needn't have worried because the serving sizes are perfect!  A single is about a half cup, maybe a little more in the two small scoops...I am guessing about 350 calories??? 
I can burn that in about half hour of jogging... Either way, its totally worth it

I had the Blue Bottle coffee and the Secret Breakfast.  The combo was heavenly.  My boy had the Honey Thyme and the Chocolate Tarragon...lets just say that as delicious as mine was, it took all my self constraint not to steal his and run away with it! 
We tried most of the flavors and they were all amazingly creative and oh so tasty. 
So I guess as a personal trainer, going out for ice cream makes me a bit of a hypocrite, but if you live as far as I do, just run down and back or ride your bike around the city to get there and you'll burn enough calories to deserve this treat...as long as its a small size and you dont go everyday...but know that you will wake up craving this ice cream the next day!
author: Nilu r.

description:
I think this is my new favorite Fun Ice Cream place.. it was birite.. and there is this place on valencia btw like 20-21st? but this one takes the cake! 

The vietnamese ice coffee (blue bottle) and Cinnamon Brittle is an awesome combo! The Thai Chile is awesome! reminds me of eating Tom Yum soup.. with that kick from the spice down your throat... Can't eat a whole lot of it though.. i'm weak! :P The olive oil one sounded really weird and nasty.. so i tried it.. and OoOoo it's kinda good.. it reminded me of days working at Jamba Juice.. I don't know why! :D but definitely coming here again!
author: Kristina L.

description:
The Blue Bottle Coffee and Special Breakfast definitely deserves 3.5 stars but the problem is that the ice cream is a bit too sweet for my preference.  I still prefer Marco Polo's ice cream any day of the week.  

I also tried the following flavors.
-Wetzel's Root beer (taste more like licorice than root beer)
-Jesus Juice (red wine + coke) interesting flavor good actually
-Cinnamon Brittle (not Cinnamon enough for me)

Long slow line, be prepared to wait.  
Street parking only.
Cash only!

Price $3.25 for two flavors (fairly generous scoops, I couldn't finish it)
author: Mel S.

description: Love the place. I just wish that there were a few more flavor offerings at a time....(I think there are about 12-16 at a time).  The workers are always nice and patient with samples.  I want the fois gras flavor! (In fact I think it was promised as a ice cream sammy in between ginger snaps).  I WANT IT.
author: Amy W.

description: So this place seems to be an either you hate it or you love it.  The flavors are all interesting but are definitely not for me.
