Regardless I got a scoop of the Secret Breakfast and tried the Vietnamese Coffee. Really like that the corn flakes in SB stayed nice and crunchy. I'm a crunch person so this gets high marks in my book. Love the taste of the bourbon too - not too strong but you def know it's there. The Viet Coffee was really nice and flavorful too. But a gal's gotta watch her figure. ;)
Overall I enjoyed their product. At this point I couldn't say if I liked HC or  Bi-Rite better. Guess I'll just have to go both places for some more!
author: Lena W.

description:
I have yet to visit their store, but I have had the pleasure of enjoying several flavors of their creamy tasty treats.  In my opinion, it is better than Bi-Rite, which I find to be too heavy and rich.

At the last potluck two different friends independently brought three different  flavors for us to sample.

The first flavor I tried, as soon as I heard there was some in the freezer was the Secret Breakfast.  Bourbon flavored vanilla ice cream with corn flakes added for texture.  It is as delicious as it sounds. The pint went fast.

The second flavor was the Vietnamese Coffee made with Blue Bottle Coffee.  Rich, creamy, and full of flavor.  This makes Haagan Daz's coffee ice cream taste like decaf.

The Salt & Pepper was odd at first bite, but very compelling.  After the other flavors were gone I kept returning to the salty, spicy, sweetness.

I can't wait to check out their store in the Mission.
author: SteveTwentyThree S.

description:
4.5 stars!

I can see Humphry's from my kitchen window. How can I not love it? Overnight, the 24th St area has become the new hotness and everyone is suddenly okay with venturing into our gang-ridden, homeless explosion streets. I'm cool with it - welcome to the neighborhood!

Gingerbread Guiness and Secret Breakfast are my current faves. They make some cute little ice cream cookie sandwiches as well, which can be a mess to eat but oh-so-tasty. Humphry's loses half a star because it's pretty annoying when there is a line. Even when it doesn't look long, it takes forever because people want to try every flavor before buying. What happens is when it's finally your turn, YOU want to try every flavor too to spite all the people in front of you. It would be awesome if they could somehow create a separate tasting line and buying line so that those who have already tasted can shoot straight to the register.
author: Susan L.

description: My friend took me here and I had the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee. First off, Blue Bottle's got the best coffee around. Secondly, that in ice cream form?? HEAVEN! Small, but great place! Would love to try more flavors!
author: Cristina D.

description:
I figured going in that I was going to like this place, but the ice cream was even better than I'd imagined. I had to try the Secret Breakfast (bourbon and cornflakes), because I'd heard so much buzz about it. It was fantastic. Who is the creative lush that came up with it? I want to party with that guy or gal. 

I had a taste of the Red Hot Banana, and it was good, but it left me wanting more banana and fewer red hots. My daughter had the fudgsicle sorbet and she loved it. It was very rich and put "real" fudge bars to shame. 

The other offerings looked promising, but I can only eat so much ice cream in one day! I can't wait to see what other crazy good combos these folks will come up with next. The staff here are very nice and the store is spotless. I can't wait to try the Thai Chili Lime or the Jesus Juice next time!
author: Raina S.

description:
hot day = long line = lots of people

wait time = 15 mins

ice cream flavors for muah = secret breakfast & jasmine tea

taste = delicious

me = happy : )
author: Fran N.

description:
You should go to this place even if just for the pure novelty of the flavours!

I had the salt and pepper ice cream and the balsamic caramel which were both interesting and yummy.  I definitely couldn't handle any more than one scoop of any particular flavour though. 

The flavours constantly change, but when I was there I sampled guinness and gingerbread, secret breakfast (which is cornflake and bourbon), olive oil, Bluebottle Vietnamese coffee and there was a peanut butter curry one too!  I checked out their website: http://www.humphryslocombe.com and I'm just disappointed that they didn't have the fois gras flavour, because as weird (and slightly gross) as it sounds, I am very VERY curious to try it!

Oh, also, the girl behind the counter was very friendly and helpful.  Given that I pretty much wanted to sample every flavour they had (I'm curious and indecisive, plus I wanted to make sure I got the right flavour!) she was also very patient!

Go and try it!
author: Melanie B.

description: Very cute and unique flavors. I sampled the lavender, jesus juice, and the secret breakfast and ended up going with a cone of secret breakfast (though it was a difficult choice). I only wish I hadn't had brunch before because I definitely could have had more!
author: Emily T.

description:
Amazingly good ice cream. I would like to eat there daily....seriously, all meals. 

Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee (best coffee ice cream EVER!)
Secret Breakfast
Milk Chocolate Passionfruit

Next visit:
Cinnamon Brittle (yum although not too cinnamon-y)
Balsamic Caramel
Oolong (oohh la la I love you)
Could not leave without the BBVC (SO YUMMY I WANT TO BATHE IN YOU!)
author: Romeo And Lola K.

description: Drunken breakfast and blue bottle Vietnamese coffee yummy in my tummy
author: Ro B.

description:
I was hooked from the time I heard makers mark and corn flakes!!! Hearing all the flavors you would've thought i was at a fine dining restaurant: Olive Oil, Fois Gras, Boccalone Prosciutto, Black Pepper and JESUS JUICE.  Hands Down this is my favorite place for ice cream.  For the true foodie at heart they have everything you have from savory flavors to some that just makes you say REALLY? you could do that!  My ultimate favorite is the Double Scoop of Special Breakfast and Blue Bottle. 

If you want ice cream that makes your heart sing . . . .go here!!!
author: Tiffany B.

description: ok.. this place is alright. it's a bit too hyped up. i'd much rather prefer bi-rite anyday. i'll have to admit though... the secret breakfast isn't too shabby. but that's probably about the only thing i'd get from here. the waiting though.. just isn't worth it in my opinion.
author: Ann T.

description: San Francisco has some great Ice Cream Parlors and this is one of them.  Humphry Slocombe is one of those ice cream makers that makes very unique ice cream flavors.  Its so much fun to come here and taste something new and different each time.  I'm so glad its only a few blocks away from work.
author: Dimps I.

description: Blue bottle VN Coffee Ice Cream = Yummy.  The Jesus Juice almost made me puke, but generally when I can taste the alcohol in anything I almost puke.  Interesting flavor combinations for sure and there are some where I would love to try and will probably come back and try.  But in generally, this is certainly not the bee's knees as people make it seem.
author: Kim L.

description:
I had the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee + Secret Cereal, courtesy of Jonas T. (Thanks, Jonas!! :D)  I LOVE Blue Bottle coffee, so you can imagine how amazing this scoop of BBVC was for me--heaven in a cup.

However, I seriously think I got drunk off of my scoop of Secret Breakfast (corn flakes + bourbon).  In any case, the alcohol tasted stronger than my usual cup of Tom Collins--and one Tom Collins is about all I can handle on any given night.  Dislike.

I also tried the Peanut Butter Curry--the curry aftertaste is almost UNBELIEVABLE!!  Definitely interesting. 

They occasionally have Candy Cup Mushroom--a must try!!

But, bottom line--Birite over Humphry!
author: Yvonne P.

description:
The most interesting ice cream you'll find anywhere!
Secret breakfast (bourbon & cornflakes) weird, but good.
Thai pepper lime, delicious!

Can't wait to go back and try more flavors!
author: Chris Y.

description:
Salt and Pepper Ice Cream - a must TASTE but not necessarily a must BUY. A wee bit salty for me (well what did you expect?) Salt, but not SO salty it overwhelms the flavor.

Yellowbeet Ice Cream: Mind blowing

Sweetcorn Ice Cream: Undeniably delicious.

The rest of the flavors: Beyond tempting to go back and try.

Despite the Salt and Pepper experience, this place gets a 5. They're just so darn creative.
author: Max A.

description:
This shop is tiny and more of a grab-and-go location. There are several stools inside and a few chairs and tables outside if you come when it's not as busy (or if you're lucky enough to snag one). And as typical SF, parking is a luck of the draw.

Ice Cream:
Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee: Absolutely LOVE the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee ice cream. THE best coffee ice cream I've ever tasted. This flavor alone is pretty much why I consistently come here.
Secret Breakfast: a signature flavor of theirs that has bourbon and corn flakes. Not my favorite but something different try
Tahitian Vanilla: not that potent of vanilla flavoring unfortunately :(
Black Sesame: doesn't have enough of the roasted sesame flavor that I would like but still fairly decent
Oolong: the oolong flavoring they have isn't one that I liked which was a major disappointment since I'm a huge tea drinker
Candy Cap: when I found out this was candied mushrooms, needless to say, I was a bit scared to try it. I love mushrooms, but candied? Hmm.. not sure how I'd like it but the employee just told me to give it a shot. I actually ended up really enjoying this one as well. It pretty much tastes like maple syrup ice cream.

The foie gras is not longer served (because of the ban) which is such a loss. I got to try it right before the ban came into effect as an ice cream sandwich where they used their own spiced cookies (they also sell other cookies and candies they make themselves by the cashier). It was so creamy and tasted fairly close to vanilla bean. The spiced cookie with the ice cream just made it even better!


Sorbets:
Earl Grey Plum - light and not overly sweet
Hibiscus Beet - a bit too sweet for me
Jesus Juice - kind of tasted like Welch's grape juice but very refreshing
author: Kitty K.

description: Fantastic creative ice cream. Salt-n-Pepper & Fluffer Nutter are favorites.  haven't been brave enough to try a sundae yet but across the board, everything is ice cream done right!
author: E.R. F.

description:
This new ice cream joint was a great find. The ice cream is very good tasting and on the whole, the texture seems to be on the softer, meltier side. 

The fellow at the counter mentioned they try to source (as often as possible) many of their great ingredients locally. (i.e., Straus Family Creamery) This is cool!

They have innovative flavor choices that are exciting and complex. It's good, but I don't know how many scoops I could eat before feeling nauseous. (very rich and flavor-packed) And for the less adventurous types, I don't know if there is much option here for you. "Valrhona Fudgesicle" would be the most "conventional" flavor. It's very beautiful and delicious too.

1. Valrhona Fudgesicle:
Yeah, they really do use VALRHONA chocolate to make this dirty-colored little bad boy. Rich and dark.

2. Secret Breakfast:
Favorite. Refreshing, crunchy (corn flakes), and the rummy kick is really an exciting exit kick of flavor. 

3. Cream Cheese Chocolate Chip:
Not a big fan of cream cheese, but the cream cheese flavor was slight. The bittersweet chocolate chips were delicious. Rich.

Coconut Sherbet:
Pretty rich (seems like "rich" is the theme word this entry) for a sherbet! Coconut flavor is very full and true. 

Malted Dulce de Leche:
Very creamy and flavor-packed. 

It's premium ice cream asking premium prices. But the prices are not that much more than what's becoming more and more usual in these kinds of higher-end ice cream shops. 

Spend a little bit more than usual and enjoy!

love ezra
author: Ezra Justin L.

description:
Flavors range from "heritage" to "lifestyle-magazine" (herbed and salted fruits), right down to multiple options in the trendy "happy-hour-for-naughty-10yr-olds" genre (like amber spirits with breakfast cereal).

I had Butter Beer and Cantaloup Cayenne. I also tried my friend's scoops and as far as I can tell all flavors are done reasonably well and the product alone is a happy 4-star ice-cream, but my low enthusiasm 3-star review considers the whole experience.

I don't mind long lines in good company, but unlike Bi-Rite's sunny park-side line, HS's line is in chilly San Francisco shade during prime ice cream hours. Not a huge deal -- the star-popper for me was the staff attitude. They adequately carried out their physical duties but 2 out of 3 served the kind of mildly disgusted ennui too cliché for Portlandia to parody without seeming woefully at the end of its momentum (or did that happen?). Endless sample scooping to bourgeois treat seekers would exhaust any of us, but the expressions performed here seemed crafted to defy, "I am better than this." Yeah, we know -- you're not the only one working under your degree. That's the current norm and most of us are growing past the bitterness. Your almost audible sighs make me suspect a trust-fund entitlement and I hesitate to tip.
author: Ham G.

description:
In my opinion the best gourmet ice cream place in the bay. I've taste tested a handful of the flavors but I've only ever ordered 3. Well that's even good enough for me!

Vietnamese Coffee - Best coffee ice cream I've had (2nd best is turkish coffee at Poly-Ann. It's very strong so if you like your coffee ice cream with a strong coffee flavor you will like this

Balsamic Caramel - Very interesting and great caramel flavor. You can definitely taste the balsamic vinegar as an aftertaste which is quite nice, even if it sounds strange.

Secret Breakfast - It's bourbon+vanilla flavored ice cream with cereal bits inside. Very interesting and very nice. 

I think actually my favorite here is the balsamic caramel, super good. Each flavor has a good consistent creamy texture which I think is slightly better than that at Bi-Rite.
author: Mastiff B.

description:
After seeing this place on the "Best of" for so long and being the fatty that I am, I had to try this place. 

Went right after work on a Friday and had to circle the neighborhood for about 15 mins to find parking. ugh. I was thinking about just double parking it and having my friend run in and just order. Thankfully, we found a spot that my car could barely fit into. 

The place is cute; kinda small with about 8 stools facing the street. I like how they have recycleable ice cream cups and spoons; the spoon doesn't have their weird plastic taste to them. 

I knew what I wanted right away- Secret Breakfast. I've read and heard so many things about it, it was on my "must try" list. The other flavor I got was the Balsamic Caramel. My friend for the Kumquat Poppy Seed and McEvoy Olive Oil. 

I think I may have expected a little too much of the Secret Breakfast. The bourbon was strong at times; but I loved the corn flakes. I would get all excited everytime I found a huge chunk of it in my scoop. 

Wasn't too big a fan of the Balsamic Caramel- balsamic was a little too strong for my taste; kinda salty. 

Tried my friend's Kumquat Poppy Seed and McEvoy Olive Oil- I thought the Poppy Seed was refreshing and the Olive Oil was just eh. According to my friend, it was kinda salty towards the end and she had a really strong after taste of the olive oil when she was done with her scoops. 

Overall, a place I would most def come back to try the other flavors when I'm in the area, don't think I'll be going out of my way to go there since parking sucks.
author: Krystal T.

description:
Verrrrry interesting ice cream flavors.  Must sample (but don't get) the Salt & Pepper flavor (or was it Salt & Peppa, like the female hip hop group? Can't remember).  Anyways, it LITERALLY tastes like salt and pepper, a bit too much.  Like... I wouldn't use that much salt and pepper to season my food.  But it's definitely worth trying for kicks, even though I would think it's too much to get a whole scoop of that flavor.  

Instead I got a scoop each of the Guinness Gingerbread (tasted more like gingerbread, less of Guinness... that could be a good thing or a bad thing, depends on what you like) and the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee (I thought it tasted just like it).  Also had a taste of Pink Apple which tasted very applesaucy.  

The appeal of this place is their crazy flavors and I want to go back and try them all, mostly out of curiosity...
author: Christy I.

description: Vietnamese Ice Coffe Ice cream, made with I blue bottle beans.  It's awesome. Sweet, lots of flavor and creamy. I'd rank this flavor as one of the best ice cream I've ever had.
author: Peter P.

description:
flavors are out of this world and require a forward and adventurous palate.

i sampled quite a few concoctions before deciding. the infamous secret breakfast (bourbon and cornflakes) was not up my alley. im not a fan of alcohol in my ice cream so that ruled out the house favorite as well as the jesus juice (red wine and coke). i appreciated the staff's patience as i went on to try a few other flavors. finally chose a scoop of the flutternutter (peanut butter and marshmallow) and a scoop of the jasmine-green tea. my initial sample of the flutternutter made me want more but I slowly realized that a scoop was way too much. the flutternutter was salty and the marshmallow seemed to be MIA. the jasmine-green tea was better but similarly a scoop was too much. the jasmine and green tea flavors were apparent which was great but overall it was sweeter than i expected. 

i need a second round and a visit to Bi-Rite to decide which SF ice cream parlor ranks supreme.
author: Ryan E.

description:
Just b/c you can make ice cream w/ beets and hibiscus flowers doesn't mean you should.  But it was an "interesting" experience for what it's worth.

Same thing goes for the McEvoy Olive Oil flavored ice cream.  Guess what?!  It tastes like flippin' olive oil.  The nice lady behind the counter described it as, "pleasant" .... and it was.  Can't argue that.  
But riddle me this - who the heck wants to eat "pleasant" ice cream when you can have "amazingly delicious" ice cream?!
How about no one!!

On the brighter, less stuffy, fun-filled side of Humphry Slocombe are flavors like Honey Thyme, Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee, and Secret Breakfast (Bourbon and Cornflakes - BRILLIANT).  These guys.... they make me feel like a big kid all over again.  And that's definitely worth a second trip!
author: Karlo A.

description:
Incredible ice cream, awesome staff~

We had long awaited the opening of Slocombe watching it being built from scratch. My house mates and I are still amazed by the style of the little place, and the sweet vintage seats. 

My latest favorite flavor: milk chocolate passion fruit...amazing.  Try some - You'll thank me later. 

Go for the ice cream. Stick around for the friendly staff. After chatting with ice cream workers, Emily and Shaun I am confident that Humphry Slocombe will be around to stay (if not expand soon). Their friendliness is unlike anything I've experienced. They'll hook you up with as many free samples you desire along with a big smile. Also, Jake the owner/ice cream mastermind is always switching up the flavors to stimulate your palate. Yet another reason for my frequent visits. Even with the current recession I'm always amazed to see a flow of satisfied customers in the shop when I pass by... LONG LIVE SLOCOMBE!!!
author: Esteban R.

description:
Can't resist*v*
There was a long line when we arrived, but who cares? as long as the Ice-cream is good, and it was such a lovely day today, we didn't to spend more time in the area:)
 we ordered oolongtea and Blue bottle flavor, they tasted so good!!!
very strong flavor, yet not too sweet, the sweetness matches with the flavor *v*
I LOVE IT!!!
but one thing I really want to say, just my opinion, I think the employees there work pretty slow, and I believe this is the reason why there is always a long line.
author: Christy Y.

description:
Got the highly recommended Secret Breakfast + Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee.  Was good, no doubt.  I actually do not like the taste of alcohol so the taste of the bourbon in the Secret Breakfast was like O_o.  Also wished there were more cornflakes, but props to creativity and ability to spread this flavor like wildfire by word of Yelp.

The coffee flavor was good, but not as creamy as I expected.  When you're talking about Vietnamese coffee, you're talking about half a cup of condensed milk.  I didn't get the flavor nor texture of the condensed milk.

And inevitably, I must compare Humphry Slocombe to BiRite.  Humphry Slocombe is good but if you like creamy flavor that just blossoms in your mouth, you will like BiRite more.
author: L Y.

description: I was taken aback by the unapproachable nature of the lady working that day, and she seemed like she really didn't want to be there. With ice cream flavors like Jesus Juice, you need to expect people to want to try different flavors before purchasing. I think Humphry's relies a lot on the shock factor of unusual ice cream flavors, as opposed to actual taste. The Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee and the Secret Breakfast are two of my favorites. Shop, however, felt trendy and intimate, which was nice. It's a quaint little place to excite your tastebuds for a moment, but a little overhyped, in my opinion.
author: Travis L.

description: I am happy to see that they took my breakfast and made it into ice cream.  Secret's out, I guess.
author: Thomas M.

description: San Francisco is a mecca for ice cream, and this one is tops. Secret breakfast. OMG. McEvoy olive oil. OMG. So creamy and fresh it tastes like you are on a farm. I can't believe it. I am not even really an ice cream person. Just go.
author: Andrew K.

description:
Yummy!!  When we got here we beat the line and so I got to taste almost all of their flavors which was great.  They're selection is very unique which I really enjoyed though I probably would not have been able to handle a whole scoop of many of their ice creams as they were a little TOO unique for me.  

After tasting a bunch, I ended up going with the Blue Bottle Vietnamese coffee and Secret Breakfast (bourbon, vanilla and cereal) on a waffle cone.  I personally thought the flavors were absolutely delicious.  I liked how the coffee wasn't too sweet and complimented the Secret Breakfast which was on the sweeter side.  

It is definitely creamy, heavy, ice cream full of calories so be prepared to consume lots of calories!
author: Jessica T.

description:
Oh Humphry Slocombe how do I love thee, let me count the ways...
1) You have cool chairs from the 50's so can sit and people watch out the window.
2) Your Vietnamese Blue Bottle coffee ice cream saves me a stop at Blue Bottle to get a little caffeine.
3) Your shhh breakfast has actual rum in it.
4) Your Salt and Pepper ice cream helps to cleanse my palate after some greasy burritos.
5) Your ice cream names play with words as my tongue plays with the flavors.
author: Chris H.

description: Ice cream here is so exciting and creative, it's a treat going into the shop just to see what flavors are in store. It's truly a Willy Wonka experience. Secret Breakfast and Jesus Juice, yes please!
author: Merri K.

description:
Is it wrong that I like "normal" ice cream flavors?  I like ice cream that tastes like "childhood," "carelessness" and "happiness."  Give me strawberry, cookies 'n' cream, anything sweet and/or fruity, really.  Call me closed-minded, but the appeal of bacon or olive oil flavored ice cream is completely lost on me.  Who's with me?

And the ice cream itself was not that good!  It tasted mealy and watery.  I could swear it tasted "low fat" without actually being low fat.  It was the first time in a long time that I didn't finish my ice cream.  Neither did my sister.

I should have known I was in trouble when I drove right by this place.  The blue awning simply said "ice cream" on it, and the Humphry Slocombe name and logo was inconspicuously displayed on a tiny metal sign on the sidewalk.  I should have known I was in trouble when the first thing I saw were the Campbell's Soup painting a la Andy Warhol, except the flavors read "fetal kitten" and "salt -n- pepper."   I should have known I was in trouble when the place was completely empty at 6:30 on a Wednesday night, although people did show up a few minutes later.

We ordered Fudge-something, Creme Fraiche and Vietnamese Blue Bottle Coffee flavors.  I got mine in a cup, and my sis - in a cone.  2 single servings, which included a total of 4 generous scoops, only cost us $6.50.  Cheap, to be sure.  Fudge-something flavor tasted kind of blah, not too chocolate-y and none too memorable.  Creme Fraiche tasted like tart frozen yogurt, but saltier.  I saw my sister grimace when she tried it.  The Vietnamese Coffee flavor was good, but it was hard to enjoy it on account of the ice cream being so bland and watery.

I proclaim "Humphry Slocombe" to be "Hungry No-Cone," as in I'd rather go without ice cream than eat theirs.  Mitchell's and Bi-Rite cost a little more, but they are, oh, so much better.  

Of course, if you're in the market for ice cream that tastes like pork rinds, thousand island salad dressing, Buffalo Ranch Chicken Sandwich or turnip, check www.HumphrySlocombe.com for future updates.
author: Yan G.

description:
OK. Mrs. Sloclobes pussy would be proud!
I take back what I said about my last experience here! I have had nothing but great service and amazing product from HS!
author: David H.

description: The Secret Breakfast was DEEEEEEELICIOUS!  Strong bourbon taste with the crunch of cornflakes.  mmmmmm...  My sister was a fan of the Jesus Juice.  The line was not THAT long and it was a relief to see that they accepted credit cards!
author: Janel Marie M.

description: We had an ice cream challenge and when we got to Humphrey's the ice cream flavors were limited and they were all out of their speciality sundaes.  There was about a 10 min wait here and when we got to the counter you could just tell the staff was ready to close it up and go home.  I understand it's tough to work on a holiday but if I am waiting in line to make a purchase I hope to get good service.  Alas, the negative vibe won and I ended up only sampling three flavors the secret breakfast, peanut butter curry (ewww) blue bottle Vietnamese coffee (meh).  I was happy with the secret breakfast: creamy ice cream with the sweetness of bourbon and crunchy cereal bits....good but it's not something I will crave to come back to.
author: Lea G.

description: Wow, incredibly good ice cream at a decent price.  Both the cinnamon brittle and the surprise breakfast were amazing and could have been a whole meal.  Just wish it was in a better neighborhood and I'd go there more often.
author: Adam R.

description: Sigh. I feel sad for SF. Yet another place that gets more repute than deserved. Everything is overly sweet and simply doesn't taste good. I'll candy my steak for dessert any day, but I think they try too hard to be creative and different. This place is only popular for the novelty, because in the end, it doesn't have much to prove.
author: Nicole L.

description:
YES!

Took a break from moving and unpacking to grab some lunch and hit this place on the way back.  I was grinning the entire time I was in there and enjoyed the hell out of my cone of secret breakfast.  

'Twas a good day.
author: Rachel N.

description: 5 stars for the Valrhona fudge sorbet!! The fudge sorbet was incredible and is definitely the best sorbet that I have ever had!! The service was great both times that I visited! The only reason Humphry isn't getting 5 stars is because there are not enough basic flavors to choose from. The two days that I went I'd say the breakdown of wacky/ creative/ non typical flavors to basic flavors was 70% to 30%. In my opinion it should be at least 50/50. I get that lots of people like all of the interesting flavors but I am not one of them!
author: Chrissy D.

description:
I liked the decor of this place, except for the snarky comments written under the flavors on their display case. 
The person working was sweet and had great hair.
The ice cream was--- not great. We had the balsamic caramel, which I could not finish. It was like drinking straight vinegar. The secret breakfast was like drinking alcohol- which I do not do. The coffee was pretty great. After not being able to finish the balsamic caramel, and wanting to try their cones I ordered a scoop of the hibiscus iced tea in a cone. They won't serve sorbet in a cone. I ended up with a cone on the side and the scoop in a cup. The sorbet was great, the cone was awful. They definitely don't make their own cones, it tasted like cardboard. 
I also bought a bag of bacon peanut brittle which was pretty good.
author: Ela F.

description: The flavors are very inventive and original. Between the two of us we got, Peach Sake sorbet, Secret Breakfast, Tahitian Vanilla and Vietnamese Coffee. The Peach Sorbet was mild yet Delicious. Secret Breakfast was packed with flavor, but after half a scoop left an odd mouth-feel.  The Vanilla, failed for me the mouth-feel was all wrong and it lacked flavor, depth and was grainy. The coffee flavor wasn't strong enough for me. Overall I'd give it 3 stars, but I'll give it an extra for the originality of their flavors.
author: Sharon R.

description:
Background to legitimize my review: I grew up in the Midwest and went to school at the University of Wisconsin. Ice cream has always been a big part of my life. If you travel to WI you will understand the difference in ice cream quality from the rest of the country. 

Humphry Slocombe is damn good ice cream. It is creamy and inventive. The consistency is such that it rolls smoothly onto your tongue but does not melt too rapidly. I walked around the Mission on a very hot day, licking two scoops for about 30 minutes before I had to finish my cone off because of melting. The flavors offered are nontraditional. For example Secret Breakfast contains cornflakes and bourbon and Jesus Juice is wine mixed with coke. 

Secret Breakfast can also be found at the Blue Bottle in the Ferry Building. They'll serve it to you with a shot of espresso on top! 

About the Environment: 
The staff was extremely friendly and answered questions about the flavors. They were also fast and generous scoopers. The location has some inside and outside seating, but if it is a nice day you can walk around the neighborhood. They also sell pints to go!
author: Jessica P.

description:
This is the weirdest ice cream you can find in SF. The flavors are bizarre but pretty dang tasty. Example: Secret breakfast contains cornflakes and bourbon. It's a fun experience. It's a fun experience. 

The folks who work here are super nice!

Downsides: Gets crowded. It's small. Pricey. Parking is a pain. Decor is atrocious. Really. Dead animal head on wall. Crazy clown painting on another. Not cool, Humphrey. Kind of iffy part of town.
author: O. K.

description:
Three words: BACON PEANUT BRITTLE. Oh, wow. I could make love to it if it weren't so pointy. Which is fine because that bacon peanut brittle belongs IN MY BELLY. 

However, if you're some sort of heretic that doesn't dig on swine or peanuts, you're sure to find a flavor of ice cream that tickles your fancy. Or fancies your tickle -- whichever way you swing.

I loved the malted dulce de leche; my other choice, the Honey Thyme, was too cloying for me. I wish i'd tried the Government Cheese... but then again, I've never actually had *real* government cheese. (The only thing I know about real government cheese is that it's rumored to make people constipated, so maybe it's a good thing I didn't try it.)

Fancy ice cream is fancy ice cream, but really... don't overlook the magical bacon peanut brittle. It's bacon-tastic!
author: Avitania B.

description: This place is amazing. I don't live in the Bay Area anymore but when I came through San Francisco last time, i had to check out the buzz I read about in the NY Times. Secret Breakfast is fantastic. It puts Ben & Jerry's to shame and reminds us that putting more crap in your ice cream doesn't make it taste better. You get the slightly sweet, caramelized taste of the bourbon without the bite and the corn flakes add a nice crunch. My sister had the Vietnamese Iced Coffee which was pretty good. Sampled the Salt & Pepper--which just sounds and tastes wrong. Can't wait to go back!
author: Sean E.

description:
I had to be physically restrained from returning to this place for the third consecutive day. And I sampled 6 (!) flavors on the first visit-- balsamic caramel, ritual vietnamese ice coffee, and olive oil were all fabulous. 
salt and pepper was a little odd, frankly, and some even i was a little afraid to try (jalapeno-jelly -type flavors, for example).
 
but this secret breakfast (boubon  ice cream with cornflakes)? unbelievable. 
you'll instantly regret ever eating cornflakes with milk ever again.

malted dulce de leche. strawberry chevre. pineapple 5 spice. government cheese. how can you not love an ice creamery that serves a flavor called government cheese?

p.s. this place should institute a frequent buyer card, like bi-rite. please.
author: Kathleen G.

description:
People often go to get ice cream on a hot and sunny day. Unfortunately, in San Francisco, these are not that frequent, so even overcast days are ice cream days, which means, that even on those days, for a place like Humphry Slocombe, the lines are long.

So, usually I tend to get a hankering for ice cream when the weather is most inhospitable. like 8:30pm on a Wednesday night, when it is windy and foggy for most of the city.

Humphry Slocombe is conveniently tucked away East of Mission on 24th Street and Harrison, where it's like a little beacon of light in an area that is relatively lacking in light. Even catching it right before closing time, the place was full, but the line was short. Perfect.

The ice cream is made on site (you can view the equipment through a window), the decor is clean, spare and quirky, with counters and stools to sit at to enjoy your creamy treasure and a two-headed calf to oversee the proceedings from above.

The place is a predictable hipster heaven of gourmet and unorthodox flavor combinations, which is the charm. I didn't try the coffee, since there's plenty of words spent on it. I tried instead plain old vanilla (well, actually, Tahitian), "rosemary's baby" (pine nut and rosemary), and peanut butter and curry.

The peanut butter and curry ice cream while intriguing, was a failed experiment. I decided to skip that one, and order as scoop each of the others. The vanilla was divine. Why have vanilla here? Well, I think there's something to be said about simplicity. The rosemary, however, was the surprise of the night. It was a symphony of flavor. By itself, it might be too much, and perhaps with only vanilla, it might have been too little. The two were a winning combo.

However, don't come for any particular flavor. That would defeat the purpose. The reason for coming is spontaneity. It is about feeling like an ice cream, going there, and getting what strikes you. No plans, no preconceived notions about what you "should" or "shouldn't" get. The servers are infinitely patient with requests to taste the flavors. Just ask, and choose. Enjoy!
author: Boris C.

description:
If you are into weird ice cream flavors you MUST come to this place.  I tried the following. 

Jesus Juice - FUN flavor! totally try it. 
Dulce de leche - good! very dulce!
Secret Breakfast - OMG! amazing!!! order this one. My friend ordered it and I took it away from her and finished it myself. Awesome!

Oh yeah.. I tried that Thai chili something... was not a fan.
author: Claudia H.

description:
Not even enough butterfat in this ice "cream" to coat my lips. Even inventive and over the top sugary flavors cannot distract from their alarmingly low butterfat content.
Hope it improves.
author: Nan L.

description:
My friend took me to Humphry Slocombe Ice Cream for my birthday!  Lucky me.  After trying a few of the flavors (Carrotmango! &Salt-n-Peppa!) I ordered the Secret Breakfast (yum!!!) and the Vetnamese Blue Bottle Coffee and my friend ordered Fudgesicle and Balsamic Carmel.  We shared of course and I loved everything.

I think I prefer the HSIC over the Birite creamery flavors.  More complex and interesting flavors, fun twists and crunchy surprises (corn flakes etc) whereas the Birite flavors are just very rich.  That being said I don't know if HSIC has a banana split that can compare-with freshly carmelized bananas.

I can't wait to go back!!!  Inclement weather or sunshine, I'm down with Humphrey Slocombe Ice Cream.
author: Shannon B.

description:
I took my husband here for valentine's day after reading about the olive oil ice cream (he LOVES olive oil). I was pleasantly surprised that they had some sorbet for vegan me. I had the beet hibiscus sorbet, which was strange but pretty good and the fudgsicle, which I LOVED. But best of all my husband LOVED the olive oil ice cream so it was a valentine's success! 
Plus even though it was a cold, rainy day it was toasty warm inside Humphry's.
author: Jaime R.

description:
Worth the hype?  You bet.  This place takes the cake as the most unique and yummy ice cream I've ever had.  I mean, where can you get salt n pepper, prosciutto, or peanut butter curry ice cream flavors?

I tried the salt n pepper and it was quite interesting... don't know if I could eat more than one scoop.  The prosciutto was also quite tasty but I love any kind of pork product.
author: Clifton T.

description: Read the reviews and had to see for myself...I'm a sucker for strange ice cream flavors.  I tasted several, but ended up going with Secret Breakfast. I should tell you that I hate bourbon, and the initial taste almost shocked me....but it was so good! I know it sounds like a weird combo...bourbon and corn flakes..but it was fantastic. There was some sort of buttery goodness binding the cornflake clusters.  I only gave it 4 starts because the neighborhood was sketchy and parking wasn't the best.
author: Robin R.

description:
3.5 Stars

Now what is up with ice cream places coming up with funky, unpronounceable names?  Humphry Slocombe? Bi-Rite? Ici? Okay, its name gets a 9 on quirkiness but a 3 on concept.  But moving on, what really makes Humphry stand out are their ridiculous flavors!  All of these gourmet ice cream places are known to have unique flavors but Humphry really would make ANYTHING into a flavor.

Now I really dig the decor of the place.  With its blue awning and white floor, it really feels like an old ice cream parlor.  The walls are decorated with interesting Campbell soup can paintings of the Andy Warhol variety but with a twist.

When we got there, Orange Chocolate and Vietnamese Coffee were out, which made this Viet boy quite sad.  Instead, I got the famous Secret Breakfast and Olive Oil.  The breakfast was cornflakes and the secret was bourbon!  And yep, this is the ice cream for alcoholics because you really do taste the bourbon.  I thought it was good but the alcoholic taste got tiring after a bit.  But Olive Oil was awesome! Fruity, light, lemony, and delicious!

My friend was even more adventurous when she went with Peanut Butter Curry and Tahitian Vanilla.  The vanilla was good, it had some kind of spice that gave it a kick and made it taste a bit exotic.  The curry on the other hand tasted...like curry, but in ice cream form.  Again, 8 on creativity but 3 on actual taste.  Humphry's servings are HUGE so you definitely get your money's worth but overall the ice cream texture was not as good as Bi-Rite or Ici.  It was a bit too icy and not creamy enough.

So props to Humphry for taking ice cream flavors where they never went before, but a minus because some things still aren't meant to be ice cream.  I would come back to see what other creations them have come up with but would probably limit myself to just samples of the more interesting flavors.
author: Alex T.

description:
In the great San Francisco Flavors Arms Race, some wonderful foods have been born (cactus and tamarind roasted pork pizza??!) and then there is the dark side of this arms race. Where mad flavor scientists slave away to try and create something even more wild and imaginative to entice the choosy foodie residents of SF. The dark side is strong at Humphry Slocombe. 

When I walked in, my friend demanded I get the "Surprise Breakfast" flavor. When I asked it was, she said; "You'll see." Upon taking a bite of it, I realized the surprise is that it's pretty bad, and I just spent way too much money to eat bourbon and cornflakes ice cream. While I welcome creativity in most places, there are times when it can go horribly, horribly wrong.
author: Donald B.

description:
Unique flavors and quality ice cream! 

If you like to try new ice cream flavors and don't want to have the regular vanilla or chocolate then go to humphry slocombe. The girls working were super nice and friendly and answered all of our questions and let us try tons of flavors!

Their vietnamese coffee flavor is the best coffee flavor that I have ever had.
author: Kelsey B.

description:
heard about this from a show called bizarre foods. so naturally i wanted to try something bizarre when i got there instead of typical ice cream flavors. they did not have the prosciutto ice cream- closest they have was bacon brittle nut (the elvis years). it was OK. although my nephews and niece loved the lemon something ice cream and my mom tried the thai-something  and they liked it, too. 

well, at least i can say i've tried their ice cream.
author: Russell C.

description:
friendly and funny staff. i really liked the fact that they give you generous sample scoops, which allow for better tasting. the guy that was helping me took the liberty of giving himself a sample while i was sampling some flavors, quirky but funny. 

i like that they're flavor selections aren't what you'd normally expect. for example, foie gras flavored ice cream! wow, now that's unique. didn't get to try it but it sure got my attention.

i sampled the secret breakfast (bourbon, vanilla and corn flakes), which i was told is their most popular, and although, i found it tasty, i think the amount of bourbon that was in it... i could have very much gotten drunk from it! ok, a little exaggered, but seriously this was packing some liquor... but recommended for those who like that taste with their ice cream.

anyway, i walked away with a scoop + cone of their blue bottled vietnamese coffee. delicious! cone is light and crispy too.

texture of the ice cream is a bit reminiscent of ici in berkeley, but i give them an extra star for their creativity with the flavors.
author: Sharon L.

description:
This was my second visit here. Very friendly service. My cousin dropped his cone and it was replaced no questions asked.

It's not an everyday place for me. For ice cream I could eat everyday, I'm still a Mitchell's fan at heart. However, for unusual flavor combinations, this place is it. I still haven't made it when they had a stout ice cream so maybe one of these days, I'll get lucky.

The group's favorite included the ancho chocolate.
author: Glenn G.

description:
I would have given this place 5 stars but because I had to Trek through the mission on Carnival to get here I will subtract 1 star for having to deal with all of the idiots that happened to be loitering in the vicinity.

One Flavor that deserves a mention is the Dulce de Leche.  It is quite possibly the best I've had outside of Argentina and well worth the small fortune for a cup.  It even pairs well with the English Breakfast which is another must have.
author: Joshua J.

description: What a treat this place is! A San Francisco fav in the Mission, Humphry Slocombe Artisanal Ice Cream... "Secret Breakfast" (Bourbon and Cornflakes), so rich it leaves your mouth coated with butter fat! Jeeze, I'd drive for this any day of the week! We lived in Tierra Linda, close enough to walk to Three Twins, thought their ice cream was great... But oooh my, Humphry Slocumb popped off the hook!!!
author: David O.

description: I went to Humphry Slocombe mid-afternoon on a cold, rainy Saturday surprised to find no line, and the workers were actually friendly, letting me try as many flavors as I wanted. I tried the Brown Butter Thyme, Tahitian Vanilla, Secret Breakfast, and Vietnamese Blue Bottle Coffee before settling on the flavor that rocked my world: Pistachio Brittle. I have not seen this flavor mentioned heretofore in Yelp reviews, but WOW. This ice cream was so good, I thought I was having relations with it. My only regret was not buying a pint before leaving. Since ice cream is my misery elixir of choice, this place could actually make me look forward to eating my feelings.
author: Josh J.

description:
Rich, velvety, delicious.
I went for salt and peppa with balsamic caramel. It was so decadent that I couldn't finish my cup. I know, what a weenie. The Salt and Peppa cuts through the richness of the balsamic caramel and makes for a savory sweet treat.
I tasted my husband's choice of Secret Breakfast and that was delicious. It will have to wait for next time.
author: Bethany G.

description:
Holy smokes, I love this place. Secret breakfast, peanut butter curry, balsamic caramel (a little rich), salted licorice, and on & on for days. I have to restrain myself from yelling at all the ice cream flavors, "GET IN MY STOMACH NOW!"

Instead, I just place an order and savor savor.
author: Anna O.

description: The first place you should go for weird ice cream flavors, more inventive than berkeley's tame-in-comparison Ici, and without all the bourgeois chic stuff that ici has. Much cooler.
author: Mike L.

description: This is seriously good stuff!  Worthy of the drive and the search for parking, and lack of places to sit.  Secret Breakfast... that alone makes it a worthwhile trip across town!!!
author: Dee Dee C.

description:
Fabulous and daring (I hope they will expand the list of flavors).

And god knows I know about ice cream and how generically suburban and unsophisticated Mitchell's is...
author: Bobby T.

description:
Alright, so I made it back here again and had the pleasure of tasting the kumquat poppyseed ice cream.  This stuff is fantastic!  I immediately bought a pint and the nice guy working behind the counter handpacked a pint ($7.50-good deal) of kumquat poppyseed and olive oil for me.  It's sitting in my freezer right now with that cheery, blue and white label on it and I'm seriously considering ripping off the label and writing "frozen pigeon" or something horrid like that on the carton so no one devours the whole thing.

ALERT:  They had the foie gras ice cream sandwich (on ginger snaps) for $4 on 2/25.  I didn't give it a taste since I really wanted to buy that pint, but if you're been waiting for that flavor, call the shop to check its availability and visit ASAP.
author: Krystle S.

description:
Tis was the day of the $60 ice cream cone... no it wasn't a parking ticket. That was my oh-mi-god I'm going to pass out behind the wheel desperate Starbucks stop on Bush street. This was something else all together.

So we had a Zipcar for a few hours, with about 45 minutes to spare on our reservation we decided to swing by Humphrey Slocombe to see what all the hype is about (EEEEE WRONG ANSWER). 

Truth be told, I can eat ice cream every day. Twice a day in fact. Personal favorites definitely include Mitchell's chocolate dipped buko in a waffle cone, Bi-Rite's balsamic strawberry and salted caramel... and the (more than) occasional Klondike bar (best when stolen from sister's personal stash).

Humphrey's however wins for most interesting flavors. Peanut butter ice cream was amazing. As was the Olive Oil (its infused with orange and lemon I think, so don't expect it to taste like pasta boiling water) and the Oolong.

The place is cute, the staff is super friendly and patient with the "can I try..." requests, I didn't have trouble finding street parking (just jinxed myself right there), but that area has been known to be difficult at times.

Anywho's... this place is definitely worth a shot. Not just because you're curious as to what a peanut butter curry ice cream tastes like, but because it's just good, and something pretty unique to add to your list of experiences.

Oh yeah, so back to my story. We were so preoccupied with the fabulous ice cream tasting session that we forgot to extend the zipcar, boom $50 late fee plus the extra $10 for the hour that we cut into, plus two very grouchy people waiting for our car (which by the way, I'm truly truly sorry, cause I know what a pain in the ass it is).

Usually I'd be cursing up a storm by such an outcome, BUT, something about good ice cream on a perfectly sunny Sunday afternoon, well, it made it all just fine.
author: Jane H.

description: Wonderful as everyone says --  I tried a variety of flavors, including prosciutto (creamy and savory), the candied kumquat (intense flavors), the miso pear (yummy unami flavors) but settled on the most popular -- Blue Bottle vietnamese coffee and Secret Breakfast.  The server was patient and super friendly.
author: Vanessa H.

description:
HOW DO YOU DO THAT WITH ICE CREAM!?!?!

Secret Breakfast. Bacon. Chocolate Sorbet that doesn't taste like sorbet! I don't know why it's been so long since I've gone back....

If they want a real S experience, always bring out-of-towners here.
author: Kiki C.

description:
A fun place to come back to often to and see what's new. If I only cam once I'm not sure how I would have rated it, as some flavors are so good while others can be a bit of a let down after the shock-value wears off. If you do come only once make sure you at least sample the gamut of what they have (they are pretty patient about this). If you ever see the oolong tea flavor, get it, its amazing. I also have enjoyed the Vietnamese coffee flavor and secret breakfast. As far as the weirder flavors go the only one I've really enjoyed a full scoop of was the peanut butter and curry flavor, it works.

If you're feeling like a fatty pick up a chocolate chip cookie too, they're great!
author: Alex D.

description:
My housemate treated me to this place after my car got broken into a few weeks ago, and it made my day so much better! Jake (the chef and owner) was so nice and let us try all the flavors, from Secret Breakfast to guiness gingerbread to Red Hot Banana (yum!)... this stuff is so good. i don't have a huge sweet tooth but i would go back here every day if i could. Plus, there are several tacquerias around -- get a burrito and then head over to Humphry Slocombe for dessert!

I'm so glad this place opened.. we will be coming from Pac Heights to have this ice cream all the time now.
author: Danielle C.

description:
Usually I'm disappointed by places with so much buzz, but Humphry Slocombe lives up to the hype.  First of all, the guy behind the counter was super-friendly without being syrupy, and he was so willing to let me try as many flavors as I wanted. 

In retrospect, I should have tasted them all. Since I live a block away, I have time to check it all out.

The Breakfast Surprise is so good... bourbon and granola in a rich vanilla base. 

The Fudgesicle was the most intense chocolate ice cream I've ever had. It was ALMOST too much... walking that very fine line that made it so exceptional.

Coconut, you ask. Damn fine. It had a really nice texture and flavor. Complemented the Fudgesicle perfectly.

I highly recommend you check it out.
author: cindy p.

description: So delicious.  I came with a friend on a rainy afternoon and they were still busy, though not packed.   The guy behind the counter was great--he would have let us try everything and was happy to make suggestions.  On his recommendation, I decided to have Browned Butter Sage.  It was fantastic!  Like butter pecan, but more complex and adult.  My friend had salted chocolate and a scoop of a special flavor for the beer festival--something with blackberry honey.  The texture wasn't quite as creamy on that last one, but still really tasty and unique.
author: Ariana W.

description:
it's 9 parts ice cream and 1 part hype.

Yes they have funny flavors that you can tell your friends.  It's a great idea.

But in the end, I thought their ice cream was a bit on the icy side. The cream didn't taste creamy, something lacking I have to say.  Bi-rite is better.   I'm betting bi-rite has a higher fat cream.
author: suckafree c.

description:
WOW - is the best word to describe this place (Well, not literary the place but the flavors they serve.)
We went this weekend and we decided to share two scoops. I wasn't able to go inside because we had our dog so I stayed outside with Dubee while he went inside to pick the flavors. He got Fluffer Nutter(SP?) and Secret Breakfast. I didn't really like the Secret Breakfast, bourbon just isn't a flavor of choice for me but the Fluffer Nutter was really good - peanut butter marshmallow flavor. 

We will definitely be coming back to try some more of the crazy flavors they have.
author: Katie J.

description: Vastly overrated. Pretentious flavors (lavender-chocolate-something or other?) (taragon-olive-oil?) that honestly aren't that great...and the simple ice-creams (vanilla, "vietnamese" coffee--I mean, how pretentious is that, what's so vietnamese about highly-sweetened milky-coffee-as-ice cream, other than it's served in Vietnamese restaurants?) are fine but nothing special at all. There's a lot of cognitive dissonance going on, as with many another hip Mission foodie place where you have to wait in line for ages.
author: l x.

description: I just had to come here after seeing this place featured on the Food Network. The Secret Breakfast ice cream is absolutely amazing. I've also had their chocolate chip cookie. It was soft, warm, and filled with gooey chocolate chips. I can't wait to go back and try some of their other unique flavors! Can't beat it!
author: Aaron W.

description:
Popped my Humphry Slocombe cherry today and tried a bunch of different flavors:
~ Peanut Butter Curry: subtle curry flavor...I thought it was pretty good but not sure I would enjoy a whole scoop of it
~ Secret Breakfast: very strong bourbon flavor...I was afraid I'd get buzzed from it ;x
~ Milk Chocolate Passion Fruit: it was alright...but it didn't hit the spot
~ Carrot Mango: ummm...pass on this one
~ Cinnamon Brittle: yummy cinnamony flavor...reminded me of Cinnamon Toast Crunch especially when you bite into the crunchy brittle
~ Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee: intense coffee taste...best coffee ice cream ever!

Their ice cream is very creamy and the flavors are interesting.  I just wish they offered more flavors at a time but I guess that could create sensory overload for one's taste buds, especially if they're as indecisive as I am.  It took me a while but I finally went with the Cinnamon Brittle and the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee...can't wait to try their other flavors though ;)
author: Katelynn L.

description:
I can't decide whether Mitchell's or Humphry Slocombe is my favorite ice cream place in SF because they are so different.  Mitchell's serves ice cream you can really dig into.  HS serves up flavors so unique and so intense that you really can't have more than a small scoop of it.

Flavors like Thai Chili Lime.  Salt & Pepper.  And Balsamic Caramel (very balsamic-y, not like Bi-Rite's balsamic strawberry, which tastes mostly like regular strawberry).  I didn't think I was going to like Secret Breakfast (brandy and corn flakes in vanilla), but it was delicious and, as one of their milder, more mainstream flavors (ha!), complements their more extreme flavors quite nicely.  Can't wait to see what flavors they come up with next.
author: Leslie L.

description: SECRET BREAKFAST. TOP 5 BEST ICE CREAM I'VE EVER HAD. BI-RITE WHO? Seriously though, this place rules. Despite the long lines they still are super friendly and offer up samples like it's nobody's business. I'm sure they have tons of great flavors but I'm in a strict monogamous relationship with SECRET BREAKFAST.
author: Cori W.

description: I don't get the line around block. It was ok. Ice cream was savory, more like a meal than dessert.
author: eric b.

description:
Yepadoodle.  Come in for the Secret Breakfast and be charmed by a double headed calf plaque and feral kitten soup can art.  Your stomach might be turning from the sights by the time you're up in line, but the McEvoy Olive Oil will soothe you into bliss.  

Tasting the Jesus Juice, however, made me feel like Faye Dunaway herself getting slapped silly by Jack ("my sister! my daughter!").  I feel warped and converted and (week later and counting) still want that flavor's autograph tattooed on my face.
author: Max L.

description: Holy bajesus.  I got the brown butta, and the sidekick got the vietnamese coffee or something...I was blown away.  I love me some Bi-Rite roasted banana, but these were just as good.  No point in starting ice cream turf battles people, it's all good, we can use more than one killer shop so the lines aren't around the block ok.  The brown butta was so good I got a pint...why pay $4 for a scoop when a pint is $7?!  It's by my house, and I'm going to put on 5lbs of fat by the time summer is over...I don't care, it's too good to resist.  I'm actually eating some out of the pint as we speak.  YUUUUUM.
author: A A.

description:
who on earth pays 7 bucks for a pint of icecream or 7 bucks for an ice cream sundae?
do you SF folks really have too much cashola to be spending this kinda dough on desert??
author: Kai G.

description:
Someone asked me tonight which I liked best, Bi-Rite or H.S.? I answered: Both. I guess it's hard to mess up ice cream. I am obsessed with ice creameries that serve fresh, off-the-wall flavors and offer a fun and clean environment to romp around in. H.S. gets it. I think their flavors are slightly more unique than Bi-Rites but Bi-Rite has more that I like.

Tonight I tried: 
Secret Breakfast (very Bourbony)
Milk Chocolate Passion Fruit (not a good combo for me)
Vietnamese Coffee (tastes like fresh coffee beans)
Coconut Sherbet (very coconutty-not overly creamy)
Cinnamon Brittle (my fave so far)

I wasn't brave enough to try the Salt and Pepper or the Balsamic Caramel. Next time!

The customer service was above par. We were greeted with smiles and courtesy. I felt almost rude asking to taste so many and after the third I mentioned it would be my last and the guy behind the counter said I could taste as many as I wanted. Wow. Just what every girl wants to hear. My heart went pitter-patter.

The place is clean, well-lit and has indoor and outdoor seating. It wasn't too crowded tonight and the line moved quickly. One important thing to note: it's CASH ONLY!

I highly recommend this joint. It's as good as Bi-Rite and the flavors are wacky, just like they should be. Why is ice cream suddenly so popular in San Francisco? Maybe it's because we have all these amazing ice creameries opening up and competing with each other.

One last note. I wonder if you can order the ice cream by the catch-phrases below each flavor? In that case, the next time I go in there I'm just going to say, "Bitch, Please!" and they will serve me up a scoop of cinnamon brittle!
author: L. L.

description: Delicious.  Vibrant, vivid flavors in the typical SF format - i.e., atypical.  I had the salted watermelon sorbet, and my husband had the brown sugar fennel and malted milk chocolate.  I loved mine, and my husband and I agreed the brown sugar flavor was better than the malted.
author: B. Y.

description: the foie gras ice cream is just so ignorant and dumb.
author: Kelly M.

description:
I'm not in the Mission all that often, but the first time that I came here, I LOVED it. The secret breakfast was amazine and the blue bottle vietnamese coffee was by far the best coffee ice cream that I had ever had.

I finally came here for the second time a couple of weeks ago and got the same flavors. And I was disappointed. =( The bourbon in the secret breakfast was overpowering and the blue bottle was very bitter. The staff was very friendly and had offered to give me samples beforehand, but I had turned them down, because I knew what I wanted. But because of this inconsistency (which I guess is to be expected since it's handmade) in the future, I would recommend always getting samples before ordering.
author: Tammy L.

description: Second time here and the ice cream actually tasted better if that's possible! It wasn't too busy so I was able to sample more flavors. I ordered the Vietnamese ice coffee flavor, my husband got the smoked sea salted chocolate and my daughter got the coconut sorbet. These were all super good!
author: Selina S.

description:
This place was pretty cool.  I went in the middle of the day and there was no line at all!  Whoa!  I didn't know what to expect with their cooky ice cream flavors but I was very impressed.  The secret breakfast was bomb.  The corn flakes tasted really good. The chunks resembled cookie dough.  Super enjoyable.  The other flavor I tried was the olive oil.  Yet, it tasted a bit too much like orange at the end.  But all in all a good experience. 

For the price, my 2 (single size) scoops of ice cream were pretty ample.  I was thoroughly impressed and I can't wait to go back and try some new flavors.
author: Cara D.

description:
OK, I get it. Some flavor meisters really get off on coming up with flavors like Peanut Butter Curry and impressing the seeming throngs of people who walk by this place as an odd tourist attraction. Mitchell's has the history and the corner on the non-savory flavors. Really, "pistachio-bacon"? But Humphrey Slocombe succeeds because it doesn't take itself that seriously. At least the staff seems friendly enough to let you try the flavors, though you feel like a glutton when you've asked for your fourth flavor!

I had the cream cheese chocolate chip and honestly, it was too rich after about three bites. Again, I understood the concept but the bits of cream cheese just didn't seem to blend well with the ice cream. Ditto the balsamic caramel. I dig caramel and I am a big fan of BiRite's salted caramel because of the natural and tremendous flavor combination that this is, but....balsamic vinegar? Again, for the first two or so bites it's compelling, it really seems like a mini festival for the taste buds. But I cannot fathom why someone would order more than one scoop, let alone a sundae or milkshake unless the flavor was so incredibly delicious that it would work. For me I just haven't yet found a super delicious flavor, after two visits. But that doesn't mean I will give up trying!
author: Alfonso L.

description: Best and most original ice cream in SF. I wanted to try the prosciutto ice cream, but the didn't have any the say I went. It was though because they did have cinnamon, which is my favorite!
author: Danielle F.

description: Out of all the San Francisco ice cream spots Humphry Slocombe is the best. Located in the real ungentrified section of the Mission, it's a cool little spot with nice servers and a creative selection of creamy delights for the lactose tolerant. Get 'The Secret Breakfast' (rum flavored with cornflakes.) Make sure you ask them to top it all off with the bourbon sauce! I don't get the Bi-rite hype. Salted Caramel? WTF? Go here. Tell them I sent you. They won't know what that means, I just love it when my name is bandied about. Make me the Banksy of ice cream recommenders.
author: Lianne S.

description: Just because a place is in the Mission and has bourbon cornflake kind of ice cream, does not make it good.  The establishments' goal seems to be to come up with the strangest flavors and the hipsters flock to it like a vintage bike giveaway.  I've been dragged here three times, and wanted to like it.  I got different flavors each of those times and after a spoonful, made my friend James eat the loser reject ice cream.  James, who has also tried a variety of flavors also finds them "pretty awkward" except for the bourbon russian imperial stout ice cream (of course, he is a boozehound).  Anyways, I know it's way uncool, but Humphry Slocombe does not make me happy, like ice cream should
author: Diane R.

description: Was in town visiting family and had heard about Humphry Slocombe on the Travel Channel (I think) like a year ago. I'm from Ohio, land of Jeni's Ice Cream (look them up if you're ever in Columbus - SO GOOD!), and Humphry's sounded kinda similar. We went and I got Secret Breakfast. Oh man... took me right back to Jeni's - quirky flavors and nothing but the best ingredients. Doesn't get much better than that! Also tasted Tahitian Vanilla, Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee, and Chocolate Roasted Sea Salt. I don't think you can go wrong at Humphry's. Also heard a rumor that the camera crew who was there when we were, were taping an episode of "The Best Thing I Ever Ate".
author: Cookie H.

description: Two words- Secret Breakfast. My first taste of adult ice cream and definitely not my last!
author: Julia K.

description:
some of the flavors are just weird.
i mean.. out there.
foie gras? salt and pepper? curry? no thanks.
what's with all of these super hip/swanky places taking good ol' fashioned things and turning them into unfortunate, sad wannabes?

i too, like previous reviews, prefer my ice cream milky.
ya know, 'cos that's usually what ice cream is made with..

but if you stick to what's normal..
for example, the sea salted caramel (very rich), the tahitian vanilla, secret breakfast..

the cookies. YOU NEED TO TRY THE COOKIES. 
wonderful, just wonderful.

the place is tiny, and the location isn't one that is well-known, which i like considering i live 6 blocks away.

let's just say i wouldn't frequent this place nearly as often if it wasn't for my roommate working there and getting to have whatever i want whenever i want.
author: Jena R.

description:
I'm a big BiRite fan, but I don't like freezing my t*ts off for half an hour while I wait in line for my ice cream and eat it outside. So I rarely make it to BiRite.

Humphry Slocombe is just as good, more fun (how can you not laugh at flavors like Hibiscus Beet and Fetal Kitten), more creative, has shorter lines, has cooler servers, and has an area inside where you can scarf down your dairy treat du jour on days when it's 57 degrees with a 20 MPH wind, like it was this afternoon.

Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee is about as good as it gets. Paired with Oolong Tea, it's caffeine heaven. I've tried a lot of the other flavors, but so far haven't goner astray from my winning combination of all-caffeine dairy treat.
author: David G.

description:
It's pretty rare I think that you get a genuine smile from servers these days, where you actually get the feeling that these people enjoy doing what they're doing.  Especially at ice cream shops.  Well that's what caught my attention here, and that's before I even checked out the flavors or tried the ice cream.

Albeit, it's Pride weekend so everyone's a little more chipper and a little more wacky--our server had bright yellow hair and cute accessories on.  Either way, all I know is that I'll probably never have a flavor of ice cream as interesting and as fun sounding as "Jesus Juice", a mix of coke and red wine.

Thank you, Humphry's.

Oh yeah, they also have a twitter for announcing their new flavors.  I'm so on top of that.
author: Diana C.

description:
There's nothing I can say that hasn't been said already.

My, and thousands of others, favorite:
- Secret Breakfast
- Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee

Always try to stop by here when in the neighborhood.

Loves it.
author: Jimmy N.

description: i tried a whole bunch of different flavors. not really my thing. i would rather go to bi rite creamery. this place has good service and pretty bomb artwork. not to mention in the mission district. so it's a cool place, but i've had better ice cream
author: Kristine D.

description: I'm an ice cream junkie, and I know that Bi-Rite and Humphry have pretty unique flavors, but it's hard to choose one over the other. Humphry's flavors, however, are a little bit more on the wild side compared to Bi-Rite's. Secret breakfast has to be my all time favorite along with honey thyme. And besides, it's right by Mission so it's a great spot to go too after a burrito run.
author: Mirabella C.

description:
Public Service Announcement: I'm the chick at the counter trying out every single flavor. Sorry. but I have to try everything in order to commit to a scoop. 

Prosciutto ice cream? I had to try that. it was there. Hmmm forgive me for not being cool enough but I like my dry-cured meats to be well, meaty. 

The other flavors were interesting but not mind altering enough for me to comment. 

My two favorites were the kumquat poppy seed-I dig anything that has poppy seeds really-and the olive oil. I would stop by again if I were in the neighborhood but I if I want to make a special trip out, I would go for a sundae at bi-rite.
author: Monica L.

description: We tried the Secret Breakfast, Salt N Pepper, & Vietnamese Iced Coffee. Secret Breakfast is the BEST hands down!
author: Yan N.

description:
Secret Breakfast ice cream: If they actually put a lot of bourbon in it, the alcohol would prevent the ice cream from freezing properly.  So instead they've made an ice cream that tastes mostly like vanilla with tiny crunchy bits that might be cornflakes. I'm not sure why this made the Big Eat list, but I wish I'd gotten one of the more interesting flavors. 

I threw my ice cream away half-eaten, which was tragic because I really wanted the cone.
author: Caroline O.

description: Not sure how you could possibly rate this place less then five stars!  Amazing ice cream, and all the people that work here are really nice.
author: Kat H.

description:
AMAZING. Love this place so much! Stop by every time I'm in San Francisco. Great flavors and friendly service. A little pricey but definitely worth it!

Try Secret Breakfast & Salt and Pepper for sure...these are my top favorites!!
author: Cassidy L.

description: I love this place's wacky flavors! I've only been here twice and so far I've tried the Brown Butter, Crab Apple Butter, Honey Thyme, and the Secret Breakfast. I love any of the flavors that have the word "butter" in them. They're just so... buttery and good. I sampled the salt and pepper ice cream and that was... insane. It really does taste like salt and pepper. Bizarre. Definitely try some of their non-traditional flavors - they're a trip. Next time I go, I'm going to try some of their sorbets.
author: Christine L.

description: This ice creamery had some interesting flavors. They let you sample them. Secret Breakfast was my favorite. It was unique. This place did not seem too busy, although it was a Friday afternoon. Been to all the creameries in Mission and this one is as good as the others. There are a few seats inside.
author: Felecia W.

description: On my one week of ice cream-venture, Humphry's was my #2. I loved (loved) the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee, and even enjoyed the Fluffernutter. I didn't like the Gabba Gabba Hey, but next time, I will have the urge to try the other weirder mixtures, and will need call ahead to see if they have the Boccalone Prosciutto. I can't wait to come back.
author: Eunice M.

description:
Wow just as good as Bi-Rite creamery, but way better selection of flavors. Sorry Bi-Rite, I love your salted caramel, but that's all you got going for you. Humphrey's got some major game with an awesome variety of flavors. I've been a glutton and try to come here whenever I get a chance. I have tried Secret Breakfast, Vietnamese Coffee, Kumquat Poppyseed, McEnvoy Olive Oil, and a few others just as little tastes. ALL AMAZING. Also, who could say no to Foie Gras Ice Cream Sandwich!!! Trust me, you can't die without eating a Foie Gras Ice Cream Sandwich!!!

I hope I get to go back tomorrow..... I am an ice cream fiend.
author: Karen C.

description: Wow, and I really mean WOW!  I can't wait to go back and have some off the wall flavors.  Burbon and corn flakes, come on!  Awesome!
author: Anthony R.

description:
Humphrey Slocombe is a little gem on Harrison St. I just had to try as many of the unique flavors as possible. Luckily, I was w/ 2 friends so we managed to try quite a few different flavors by passing them off to one another. (They use tiny little silver spoons that are super cute and environmentally friendly!) 

Secret Breakfast: Bourbon flavor was too strong for my taste, but one of my friends LOVED it. 
Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee: sooo good. I regretted not ordering it. 
Pistachio Bacon: Couldn't really taste the pistachio but the bacon flavor was very pronounced and yummy at first. I ended up picking this flavor and got tired of it half way through the scoop. I wished there were bacon and pistachio pieces. 
Kumquat Poppy Seed: studded w/ poppy seeds which was nice, but the kumquat taste was too sour for me
Oolong: very mild, but had a nice lingering taste
Ginger Wasabi: tasted exactly like it sounds. Way too weird/intense for me, but one of my friends loved it and got a scoop of it. 
McEvoy Olive Oil: mild but I guess that's olive oil for ya!  

All in all, I enjoyed their interesting flavor combinations and creamy texture. Service is OK, but the ice cream makes up for it! Will definitely be back the next time I'm in the Bay!
author: Jennifer W.

description: Meh is right. Hey- I love me some ice cream, but this is just OK. I've been several times, and maybe ordered the wrong thing, but its inedible. There, I said it.  I am an ice cream expert (self appointed of course) and I get that the ice cream cone is the new cupcake, and that its incredibly creative to do flavors with cute names and interesting combos - but the net/net , its gotta be creamy, flavorful in a good way.  Pass me some Bi-Rite please.
author: Sylvie L.

description:
Pretty damn good ice cream. Went late last night (15 minutes before closing) and it was thankfully not full. The guy behind the counter said there was no limit on tastes so...I tasted half the flavors! Delightful stuff. 

Ended up doing the milk chocolate passion fruit w/coconut. 

Best parts - since it was closing we got some free cookies! Mmmmm...
author: Madeline N.

description: Absolutely great ice cream and random candy. Similar flavors and layout to "Ici" in Berkeley, and similar clientele. Be prepared to wait in line and, I recommend, tasting at least 3 flavors before deciding. If it's there, try the proscuitto or the fluffernutter - both are amazing! The Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee is a safe bet too! But don't stop there... definitely worth the wait and the calories and a trek (walking recommended as parking is scant) from anywhere nearby.
author: Vittorio L.

description:
This isn't your mom and dad's typical scoop shop.  The quality and selection of flavors here is one of a kind.  I came here to cap off an awesome feasting adventure that started at Mitchell's Ice Cream before a dinner at Mission street food.  It only felt right that we brought things back full circle and finished with more ice cream.  

The staff was more than accommodating as my friend and I made our way tasting just about every flavor before finally settling with pancetta boccalone and the McEvoy olive oil.  The boccalone was so rich and sweet and savory all at the same time.  It just completely flipped all preconceived notions of what ice cream is supposed to be on its head.  The olive oil ice cream was surprisingly refreshing and a fantastic way to cleanse the palate after a long day of eating.  

While I enjoyed my halo halo at Mitchell's, HS just offers a completely different ice cream experience that really has no peer.  Suffice it to say that now that I know about Humphrey Slocome, I'll be getting really fat really soon.
author: Gary L.

description:
just ok.  its a small little specialty ice cream shop in the mission.  expect no parking, long lines, and if you're there on a friday night, drunkards passed out on the floor.

did i hate it? no.  maybe it was the flavors that i tasted.  the names of the flavors were catchy but i just didn't think the flavors actually worked - except for Secret Breakfast (bourbon and corn flakes).  

i'll come back and hopefully they'll have more flavors.
author: Ray R.

description: Ice creamery with tasty, unusual, and delightfully odd flavors. Brown Butter, Lemon Buttermilk sorbet, Chocolate Smoked Sea Salt were our choices. Strange two-headed cow mascot. Hoping for the rumored Butter Beer next time we return.
author: Molly R.

description:
i keep wanting to like this place because the quirky vibe is great, their flavors can be adventurous, the people who work here are nice, and the line goes quickly--but i keep finding its ice cream and sorbet underwhelming. most of the flavors i've tried are "too" something... salty, frothy, melty, cooked, sweet, you name it. also they favor egg-white sorbets, which are not really my thing, though the texture is nice before it starts melting. i recently ordered their grape sorbet without tasting it first, pretty much hoping for a fresh and icy concord-grape flavor (how amazing would that be!), and it was a dead ringer for ordinary grape jelly, with that same cooked taste. i was surprised they hadn't put a peanut butter swirl in it! i ended up eating a few spoonfuls and throwing it out, sadly. actually, i'm not sure i've finished any of the ice cream i've gotten here.

this year i started making my own ice cream and sorbet, and that certainly hasn't helped. my Vietnamese coffee ice cream based on their own published recipe with a couple tweaks (including less salt and less sugar), tastes yummier, with a far richer and more aromatic coffee flavor. i also make a triple-vanilla bourbon ice cream that i prefer to the base of their Secret Breakfast. sigh!
author: Yelp Y.

description:
I like this place. read about it and decided to give it a go instead of dealing with the long ass lines and expensive prices at bi rite.

I would say this place has more unusual flavors and not the run of the mill ice cream shops compared to bi rite, mitchells, etc.

They have wierd flavors like summer corn, boccolone prosciutto, tahitian vanilla, miso peach, blue bottle vietnamese coffee, burbon and cream...peanut butter curry...the list goes on. at $1.50 for a cup and $2.25 for a single scoop in a cone its not bad at all. My favorite so far is the vietnamese coffee. The lines are also not as long as bi rite as well, although bi rites burnt caramel is still a fav of mine. Definetely worth a try for the more adventurous! Next thing to try is xanath ice cream on valencia!
author: Petri Y.

description:
Love the crazy flavors!
Secret Breakfast - revolutionary!
Salted Chocolate - daaaaaaaamn!
Balsamic Carmel - WINNING!

Salt & Pepper  ... weird ... exactly as advertised
author: Jeffrey H.

description:
OMG!!! Some of the best and most unusual ice cream flavors I have ever tasted and I LOVE ice cream!
Secret Breakfast and Peanut Butter Curry are awesome but the award for the most amazing ice cream flavor goes to SALT and PEPPA!
