I know it sounds really weird but it is amazingly good! I tell people about it all the time and most of them say Yuck! but seriously it is my favorite.
Humphry Slocombe is my new favorite ice cream shop. YAY!!!!!!!!
author: Scott C.

description: Hella good!!!! Brown sugar and butter was bomb and the secret breakfast
author: Anthony A.

description: The secret breakfast has hints of bourbon and the cornmeal that's also the highlight of all the flavors there.  Also, don't be fooled with the sea salt chocolate. A sample bite of it is great, but eating a whole scoop is just too salty.
author: Kinman H.

description:
4 stars for quality of ice cream, but 5+ for originality.  I've been hearing about this place for a while and finally got a chance to make it there.  After sampling the Olive Oil (surprise favorite), Vietnamese Coffee (also great), Balsamic caramel (not impressed), and Secret Breakfast (delicious), I was definitely hooked.  

I think that bi-rite's ice cream is of slightly better quality, but HS's use of non-traditional ingredients is outstanding.  Really, who would have ever expected a prosciutto based ice cream?  Additionally, under each flavor is a little humorous phrase that is bound to make you smile.....Honey Thyme (Bitch Please!).  A single scoop is about $2.25 and it's cash only, so come prepared.
author: Thor M.

description: I've only tried their secret breakfast (bourbon and cornflake) ice cream at the recommendation of many, but it was absolutely divine. Tempted to not even try any other flavors when I next go back.
author: Stephen C.

description:
Oh, hipster hype, when will I stop falling prey to you?

Was glad that Humphry Slocombe had something to satisfy my whole family - traditionalist, ice-cream lovin' dad, vegan cousin, "tastings-be-damned, I'm trying the weirdest thing on the menu" mom.  Enjoyed my Jesus Juice sorbet.  But you know, no one in my group of 7 was floored by the actual ice cream itself.  Some flavors - salt and pepper, black sesame - were really strong.  Others - proschuitto - not so much.  The prices weren't as insane as some of the other "it" ice cream parlors - yes, Ici, I'm talking to you.  But nor was the base ice cream itself so amazing, once stripped of its self-consciously bizarre flavors.

Good for one visit, but I'll skip the lines and pretension and keep going to my East Bay faves.  When I find something to replace my darling, $1.25-a-scoop Cinco de Mayo in Fruitvale, I'll be yelping up a storm.
author: Gloria B.

description:
Best ice cream in the City - hands down. We tried the Secret Breakfast, Jesus Juice, Blue Bottle Coffee and Balsamic Caramel; all of which were divine.

Asked them to "lick it" and had some decadent butterscotch drizzled on top at no cost...these folks are brilliant.

The folks here are friendly and patient, even as we prepped for Dia De Los Muertos festivities and were probably the most annoying patrons of the day. This place rocks! With new flavors constantly rolling in, we will definitely be back!!!

I heart Humphry S. .
author: Kim P.

description:
I'm giving it 3 stars because the quality of the ice cream is good, and they offer exactly what they claim to offer (interesting flavors), but I just wasn't that into it. For some reason I thought their flavors would be on the sweeter side, even though most of them are savory. For example, the PB and curry ice cream tastes exactly like curry and peanut sauce in an iced form, with a little bit of cream and sugar.

Long story short, if you go there expecting Cold Stone you'll be disappointed, but if you go there with the expectation of unique savory flavors, you'll be pleased. I felt lame getting the Tahitian Vanilla (too plain a selection for such a unique place), but it was all I could handle.

Setting is super cute, and staff is friendly.
author: Shirin M.

description: Good ice-cream, although a tad on the sweeter side. I had the candied ginger and also got a taste of secret breakfast and jesus juice. Both the secret breakfast (bourbon + cornflakes) and jesus juice (wine + coke) had strong alcohol tastes to them.
author: Aaron L.

description: Holy mouthgasm. I had secret breakfast and thai chili lime sorbet. Frickin' fantastic. I can say nothing more....
author: Kimberly N.

description:
The flavours at Humphry are awesome.  Ant they'll let you try just about all of them before you order.  

Super yummy!
author: Adrian L.

description:
My good friend turned me onto this place...
Kind of a low profile joint that one would likely not notice unless rather observant.

Show me an ice cream spot with more creative flavors and I'll rewrite my review.
Looking forward to trying their Hibiscus Beet and their Carrot Mango sorbets. Every one of their ice cream flavors I sampled were unique and tasty.
Kind staff... no line when we went.
For now, this place takes the cake... or ice cream
yummm
author: Dusty M.

description:
service was great, very nice ppl here

i got the malted milk chocolate, very nice and creamy, hint of saltiness, cone was yummy

friend got the spiced pumpkin, too spicy for me and not enough pumpkin, but still good

other friend got the balsamic caramel, not my thing, a bit too much salty sour, i dunno how to describe it

maybe i came on an off day, wasnt really impressed
from this initial tasting, i prefer birite...
author: Mimi Z.

description: I think this place has some delicious flavors, but overall I think they're sort of jerky and just cater to Mission hipsters.  They don't do a whole lot for the local community and I think their ice cream is overpriced.  My friend tried to get them to donate to her school in the Mission and they wouldn't, but then they donated TONS of ice cream to a hipster event at the Roxie--not so cool. I hope they learn better business practices.  Go to Mitchell's instead!
author: Julia D.

description:
Unusual "adult" flavors, incredibly well done.  Somewhat small portions, but with the depth of flavor, less can be more.  

The bourbon in "Secret Breakfast" was a bit overwhelming at first, but I was surprised at how quickly I got used to it (and loved it).

I don't like cash only places, but on the flip side, it does make the line move that much more quickly.
author: S B.

description: Secret Breakfast. Also had this one flavor that was rich and salty some kind of Butter (not Peanut butter)... Definitely want to try the other flavors sometime...
author: Jamie T.

description: The vibe - cool hipster. the vanilla - bland and kinda icy. The root beer - almost no root beer flavor. The Blue Bottle coffee - nice and strong. Not among my top five City creameries, though I've only been once.
author: Nick C.

description:
WOW.

I LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE the McEvoy Olive Oil flavor!!!! Creamy, rich, subtlely sweet. omggggg soooo gooodddd.

Secret Breakfast (bourbon and something) was very very bourbony. I think it goes well with a sweet ice cream or else the bourbon overpowers your palate (at least for me). You kind of grow to love this flavor.

Jesus Juice (red wine and coke) was icier (like more sorbet) than the others and literally tasted like subtle red wine and coke. I liked it. Again, I think it goes well with a sweeter ice cream to bring out its flavor.

I had a taste of the Salt and Pepper. I don't like it. Literally tastes like a spoonful of salt and pepper.

Overall, the ice cream texture is lighter (less creamy) than Bi-Rite Creamery and the flavors are definitely more original and unique (this is why I think it's better than Bi-Rite).

This is my new favorite ice cream shop!!!!!

Cash only, close at 9pm on Saturdays (but they were open after 9 yesterday, I guess because there was a long line).
author: Angela H.

description:
I love this place!  However, I do have to warn those who are non-adventurous, that this place carries very unconventional flavors!  

My curiosity got to me, so I tried to sample everything I could without holding up the line. I tried the Balsamic Caramel, Strawberry Jalapeno, Olive Oil, Peanut Butter Curry, and a couple others.  I ended up going with the Secret Breakfast and the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee, both were equally delicious!  

You can tell that this place puts out a really high quality product.  Their ice cream has great taste and texture, and all their flavors tasted exactly as how their unusual names describe them!  I applaud them for their originality! 

Also, their prices are very reasonable.  I paid $4.50 for 3 scoops.
author: Henri W.

description: Honestly this Ice cream is very good BUT in my opinion it doesn't compare to any of the ice creas from the East Coast. Maybe because they don't use as much BUTTER FAT? :D. I do like the secret breakfast and that one flavor hibiscus beet and I appreciate the creativit. I would never wait more than 5 minutes for it though because in my opinion I don't think it is that worth it to wait for ice cream for too long.
author: Nir B.

description:
Finally made it over to sample the creative flavors of this mission ice cream joint. And wasn't disappointed. Although Bi-Rite wins in straight up ice cream quality, the happy vibe and imaginative flavors here will bring me back a few more times this summer.

Follow them on Twitter to get flavor updates: http://twitter.com/humphryslocombe
author: hunter w.

description: I'm all at about Mitchells and Bi Rite.  I guess I'm all about H. Slocombe.   Ever since I had Secret Breakfast, I've been dreaming about it.   Yeah its that good.  I didn't think it would be, but it is.   I'll be coming back to try all the other crazy flavor profiles they have to offer.
author: Norm P.

description:
Saturday afternoon - a beautiful day in SF, great day for ice cream.

They were out of a few flavors I wanted to try - Coffee, Special Bkfst.
Oh well- the balsamic caramel was interesting and pretty good - it was kinda tart. The peanut butter curry was a bit much though - it tasted like peanut butter ice cream with a curry aftertaste.

The coconut and sour cherry were really good.

CASH ONLY - and be sure to sample your flavor first!!!
author: Chili B.

description: There are flavors I love and other flavors that I can't hack but each one that I try is a delightful experience. The ice cream is packed with flavor and super creamy at the same time. Can't wait to come back.
author: Shum S.

description:
Honestly, this is as good as ice cream could possibly get. The flavors are gourmet and different without being disgusting or gimmicky. Even standard flavors like vanilla, chocolate or cherry a twisted into a beautiful gastronomic experience.

One interesting element that sets Humphry Slocombe apart from other ice creameries is their affinity to combine flavors. This aspect is built into their ordering system (a "single" means 2 scoops; a "double" means 3). 

Oh, and the staff is always super helpful, attentive, and patient.

Bravo Humphry Slocombe!
author: Tim B.

description: You had me at bourbon! Secret breakfast (cornflakes & bourbon) sounds disgusting but it's delicious. Can't wait to try other flavors.
author: Nicole W.

description: I was not impressed. I tried several flavors (I thought the almond peach butter was great, but they did not have enough left to give me a full scoop) so I settled on the secret breakfast. I liked the bourban mixed with the corn flakes, but overall I thought the ice creams were too creamy and rich. With all the great ice cream options in SF, I don''t think this is worth the wait.
author: Jordana M.

description:
SO GOOD.

Be adventuresome - order something fun-sounding.  

Wait in line for it.  It's a beautiful day!  Even if it isn't, take a chance to chit-chat with your friends.
author: Sara P.

description:
Just came back from Humphry Slocombe

HONEY THYME and ALMOND PEACH BUTTER was  good!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
author: Roland R.

description: I'm in love with Secret Breakfast. There's enough Bourbon in it to give you a buzz! But the other flavors are inventive, sophisticated and quite delicious. I discovered Secret Breakfast at Star Belly Restaurant, so today I made my way to the Mission to experience it once more. The staff were all very friendly. Nice atmosphere. I'll be back, but I'll be damned if I take MUNI. It'll be on my bike.
author: Geoffrey B.

description: Really fun flavors, pretty good selection of sorbets. I love taking people here!
author: Addie S.

description:
OMG, I have NEVER tasted infused ice cream flavor like what I did during my recent visit to Humphry Slocumbe at 24th and Harrison.

WOW WOW WOW, the Balsamic Caramel (to die for) and the Secret Breakfast (Bourbon and Cornflakes) were beyond describing.  I read that Jake came from Coi and Fifth Floor fame so now I understand his special detailing of the intense flavors. It totally works and truly was best in my book. I will go back again for sure. Flavors change daily from what I've been told.
author: SFCAFOX S.

description:
Secret Breakfast. Had it for dinner. Scratch that dessert. UNBELIEVABLE.

This was delivered to me. Haven't been in to the actual physical plant of this place but I hear its an experience. Hipsters scooping ice cream. I like it and I will soon be in to see the spectacle for myself.

Note: Do not feed the hipsters as they may then attempt to impress you with their knowledge of Nietzche.
author: Monty B.

description:
Hipster gourmet ice cream. Similar to Bi-Rite but edgier. "Secret Breakfast" (bourbon and toasted corn flakes) is excellent.

NYT article:
http://nyti.ms/ayFZnU
author: Andy K.

description:
double yum!! this is a really charming place. I ordered what everybody else gets--vietnamese coffee with secret breakfast. absolutely delish! i tried some other flavors and they were also fun to try like olive oil and salt and peppa. love it!

if you like conventional flavors, go to baskin and robbins. why even bother going if you're going to complain about the unusual flavors?
author: Thanya S.

description: Inventive flavors, creamy, creamy ice cream. Not overly sweet, yeah! Secret Breakfast is a favorite.
author: Scott R. D.

description: Ice cream is one of my favorite treats. I wouldn't say that I'm an ice cream expert or anything, but I've tasted my fair share of the ice cold wonder. I even worked at Baskin Robbins during high school and college. And I can tell you, Baskin Robbins is complete crap compared to Humphry Slocombe's unique and flavor-packed ice cream. You have to try the Secret Breakfast! This ice cream has bourbon and cornflakes. BOURBON. The real stuff. The Blue Bottle Vietnamese coffee is also delish. It really, really, really tastes like coffee. The lines can get long, but on a nice day, it's totally worth the wait. If you're looking for more than the usual ice cream flavors, you really should check out Humphry Slocombe's. Learn about Humphry's new flavors via their Twitter feed: http://twitter.com/humphryslocombe.
author: Staci B.

description:
Shocking. I love nearly everything about this place.  

The 'secret breakfast' flavor combines about seven of my favorite things in life- cereal, sugar, bourbon, dessert, breakfast, combining weird dishes, cold, and clever names- it's kind of like everything great about being a kid AND an adult.

It's like getting a snow day and I don't have to go to school so I sleep in 'till like 10:30.  When I get up, mom already has my Wheaties ready with the sugar bowl too 'cause what kid likes plain Wheaties? and then I decide to have a side of ice cream for breakfast 'cause I'm actually an adult and I can do what I want and then REMEMBERING I'm an adult I pull out my old friend Maker's and start taking a few nips early 'cause, hey, it's cold out and I don't have to do ANYTHING except maybe go sledding and enjoy my delicious, flavorful, creamy, icy, joy of a dessert from my old friend Humphrey.  God Bless this joint.  Try everything, even though you might be embarrassed like me, because they're patient and they'll let you and you're using metal tasting spoons(!) so you don't have to worry about filling up the great pacific gyre with your gluttony.  

Also, this is a quieter, lovely corner of the Mission to sit outside and compare surprising flavors with whichever new friends you happen to make because such novel experiences lend themselves to efficiently crossing the normal social barriers.  Wine and coke? don't mind if I do! Balsamic vinegar? hell yes. Do it people, go here and enjoy immensely.  Unless you're stuck on green mint chocolate chip from Baskin Robbins (not hating- also my childhood) 'cause this ain't that.
author: David M.

description:
PROSCIUTTO ICE CREAM?? BACON PISTACHIO??? FOIE GRAS (on saturdays)???  
Five stars because the flavors are so unique and awesome. And also because chef has the most awesome ice cream cone sleeve tattoo on his arm.
I've tried a few of the flavors; standouts include the Guinness/gingerbread, kumquat poppyseed, olive oil.
Parking on street isn't too bad. Super simple set up with a few counter seats and not much else.
Definitely a gem worth checking out!
author: Jasmine O.

description:
4.5 stars if i could because they dont always have root beer floats or the option of using different ice creams in a float (see my review at mr. and mrs. miscellaneous ice cream)  

Pros:  the BOMBdiggty ice cream made with Straus Organic milk, located within an hour from the city. 
THE FLAVORS will blow your mind, you will be creamy your way out that door, head spinning and you'll forget almost all the flavors you tried but you dont care, honey badger dont give a Sh^t, you'll be back fo sho!!!
-friendly staff, not a big line, worth the wait.

cons:  need more interesting combo suggestions and or floats.  but they probably want to keep it simple, unlike Bi-rite. 

overall:  its a great place for serious unique ice cream.  this place is getting talked about all over the US and has probably influenced many many great successful businesses that will come in the future. 

PROPS!!

TRY AS MANY FLAVORS AS YOU WANT!!!  

favs: Vietnamese blue bottle COFFEE, Secret Breakfast.  and some cinnamon brittle mouth watering explosion!  crap i want someone rightnow at 11pm!
author: Zach S.

description:
I went here a couple weeks ago during the January "heat watch" we were experiencing, and I've gotta say, it wins the weirdest flavors competition hands down. I sampled probably everything they had available, from olive oil to balsamic caramel. In fact, I had so many samples, that I wasn't even really hungry once I bought my scoops! (business suggestion to HS: charge a smaller fee and just let people sample all the flavors you have available!). 

What I ordered:

Blue Bottle Vietnamese coffee - very very good coffee ice cream

Secret Breakfast - tasted like a bowl of cereal in ice cream form, including the milk and everything. It was really creamy and innovative, but I don't think I'd say it was amazing ice cream in itself.
author: Keyvan R.

description: I came here coz I love prosciutto, and any other kind of swine variation for that matter. So I tried a bunch of flavors and ended up with the peanut butter curry and a scoop of prosciutto on top. I think both flavors would have tasted better as gelato. If I would have known it was an ice cream joint I probably would have passed. Best thing about the experience was the peanut butter curry had a cool aftertaste that lasted a long time. It's just one of those things you need to check off your list. It's different, but once you've satisfied the curiosity regarding the hype the thrill is gone.
author: Carlo X.

description:
Saw it on TV - HAD to go! I stood in line for the better part of 15 minutes (that's being nice, it might have been more but I was too excited to watch the clock). I had honey thyme ice cream (SUPER GOOD) and the malted chocolate. Both had great sweet and savory aspects and went well together. My friend ordered the Secret Breakfast, while I definitely picked up on the bourbon immediately, the crunch was interesting and overall I thought it a bit too sweet. VERY good, but I'm glad I didn't have to eat his whole scoop or I might have gotten a sweet overload. 

I saw a lot of people eating the strawberry szechuan sorbet - I was intent on having ice cream so I passed but I'm sure I'll be back again to try more new flavors later :)
author: Ariel G.

description:
I had the Vietnamese Coffee and Kumquat with Poppy Seed Ice Creams. Ahhhh so good! I love the bits of kumquat zest I could taste with each bite of my ice cream. And the Vietnamese coffee was dead on point. 

I had a sample of the Secret Breakfast and I think it had some alcohol in it. It was good, but not what I was feeling at the time. This is not the place to come if you want your typical flavors. 

Next time, we'll have to ask for an ice cream sandwich or a sundae because they just looked oh so yummy!
author: Angela L.

description:
I am obsessed with Secret Breakfast. 

Bourbon. Corn flakes. In ice cream. MY. GOD.

They make all their ice cream in house, and their staff is always cheerful and great! Nice little place to visit. 

TIP: Some coffee places in SF have their ice cream to make affogatto's with (ice cream with espresso on top) such as Four Barrel and Blue Bottle.
author: Tyler D.

description: How did it take me sooo long to find this place? Seriously good ice cream! We decided to venture out to find it in the rain. Now ice cream may not sound appealing on a cold rainy day. However, not having to stand in that crazy line for Humphry Slocombe that everyone else is yelping about is wonderful! And once you are inside tasting samples of all the fun flavors you will forget how cold and miserable it is out there! Enjoy!
author: Marissa P.

description:
This is just as good as Bi-Rite Creamery but with better flavors.  

Flavors I tried:  Salt and Pepper, Green Tea with Sesami (Konichiwa B**$$#S!), Blue Bottle Coffee, Secret Breakfast, Olive Oil, Vanilla.

Secret Breakfast (Cornflakes and Bourbon) was THE S**T!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  OMG, where have you been all my life Humphry?!?  

Ample Seating inside and outside, no long lines, fast service, you don't feel guilty for trying everything because no one's behind you getting pissed that you're sampling everything (unlike dumb A** Bi-Rite), different flavors that are surprisingly delicious, minimalist decor, everything is just right about this place.
author: Nezza F.

description: I love ice cream, i love this place, i love there selection of funky flavors the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee might be my favorite but I'm yet to try them all ... :)
author: Anthony S.

description: Ever since I learned of this place's existence, I've been itching to go here and finally my dreams came true one Saturday evening. Worth the wait in line! It was better than I could have hoped for. I sampled the Secret Breakfast, Cinnamon Brittle, Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee and the Black Sesame. All amazingly creamy and heavenly for ice cream lovers. I've had BiRite as well and I think both are good but I would slightly edge out Humphry for the texture and creaminess of the ice cream.
author: Amy N.

description:
I scream...you scream...we all scream for Vietnamese Ice Cream!

...I need to try the Secret Breakfast next time!!!
author: Nancy T.

description: I love the Harvey's milk & graham crackers. Other flavors are fun to sample, but you probably don't want to order the scoop. Some of my friends randomly ordered some flavors they didn't like, so be sure to sample before buying.
author: Lynn P.

description: Eh -- just another ice cream place, but with interesting flavors.  I really don't think they're worth a special trip and/or a wait in the usually sizable line out the door.  But worth a try.
author: moosedog i.

description: I like the very creamy texture of the ice cream here.  Don't miss out on the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee and Secret Breakfast flavors.  It is best to come on the weekdays, the weekend lines tend to be long.
author: Hugh Y.

description:
4 1/2 Stars just as good as Bi-rite ice cream with more creative flavors!
I might even say it is better than Bi-rite. Take the challange!

Hard place to find and hard place to find parking. Well for me.
The ice cream (base) is very good. When combine with different ingredients... vary from basic to outragously creative...
 
Andante chevre-strawberry jam
Balsamic caramel
Black walnut
Blue Bottle Vietnamese coffee
Bourbon
Candied chestnut
Candied ginger
Chocolate orange
Cinnamon brittle
Cream cheese
Dulce de leche
Foie gras
Gingerbread
Government cheese
Green tea-black sesame
Honey thyme
Kumquat- poppy seed
Lychee -rose petal
Malted vanilla
Maple walnut
McEvoy olive oil
Milk chocolate passionfruit
Oolong
Peanut butter curry
Pecan sandie
Pink grapefruit tarragon
Pistachio-bacon
Salt and pepper
Salted licorice
Secret breakfast
Sour cream
Strawberry candied jalapeno 
Sweet corn-blackberry
"Red hot" banana
White chocolate lavender

I did not bother listing the ordinary flavors...be bold... don't be a wuz.

SF did not become culinary destination by not exploring possible combination of flavors.

Ferran Adria, Thomas Keller, Grant Achatz, Jose Andres,...etc ...would not be where they are without being bold and try new combination and flavors!



HEY...you can't lose FREE SAMPLING...
I was surprised that some flavors actually TASTED GOOD!!!

You would think peanut butter and jelly, salt & pepper, sweet & sour pork, grilled pork and roasted fruits,... GOTTA try it some will make you a believer.


  @humphryslocombe - follow us on twitter for live flavor updates!
author: S.K. Y.

description: I chose the malted chocolate flavor when I dropped by this place because I was craving a malted milkshake. I'm glad that they let you try different flavors because I really enjoyed the secret breakfast and the white miso and pear flavors. I only slightly regret my decision for the malted chocolate because all the flavors were good! Have to come back next time and try some more!
author: Eli P.

description:
Going for the feel of an old fashioned ice cream parlor, but with modern flavors.

The olive oil & balsamic caramel are a good combo, and the ice cream was soft & creamy.

The Breakfast Surprise is a MUST try, Bourbon & Cornflakes, it was freaking delicious. The Breakfast Surprise was definitely my favorite flavor, I wish I could have that for breakfast every day!
author: Elaine S.

description:
A great place for ice cream! Oh man. They make some super funky flavors. My favorite is the Vietnamese Ice Coffee Ice Cream, and then the Stout flavor is great, when they have it!

That's one downside to this place, they run out of their flavors quite frequently it seems, so getting exactly what you want is sometimes impossible. I had started to give them 5 stars, but then i remembered going two or three times and having had them just run out of the flavor that I wanted...it made me sad, almost cry...sorta =)
author: H B.

description: Thai Chili Lime Sorbert, thas wassup!
author: Christina B.

description:
I visited Humphry today with some friends for a not-so-guilty ice cream pleasure. 

The location is easy to find and there's plenty of free and metered parking. Outside, you'll see three to four tables for couples, while the simple well-lit interior has counter seating for about eight. The employees were friendly, helpful and patient (a must when adventurous customers ask for tastings). 

I ordered the Secret Breakfast and Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee, not particularly enterprising I'd agree, but highly recommended nonetheless. The ice cream was impeccably textured: soft, creamy and smooth. The flavors were equally impressive. Both featured a vibrant, memorable taste that will keep you coming back for more.

Unfortunately, I can't DEFINITIVELY say that Humphry is the best ice cream in the City, but its definitely in the running and my new personal favorite. I highly recommend anyone with a penchant for sweets to give Humphry Slocombe a go.
author: Danny H.

description: The place is good. I haven't tried my duck fat cupcake yet but the flavors were alright. Just a warning-If you're not from the city or familiar with the city and you're coming here just to get the raved about ice cream you're in the wrong neighborhood: Mission gets really dicey which is something that people should tell you.
author: Joycelyn A.

description: On Valentine's Day 2010, I met a new love: Humphry Slocombe's Vietnamese coffee ice cream. It's absolutely the best coffee ice cream I've tasted: rich, fresh, creamy. A scoop in a cone is only $2.25, far cheaper than other high-end ice cream places in the Bay Area.
author: Ada T.

description:
WOW!  This has leaped up to become my top ice cream place in SF.

Balsamic caramel was absolutely delicious, with a fuller caramel flavor than Bi-Rite's salted caramel, my previous favorite flavor.  

Secret breakfast (corn flakes + bourbon) was delicious, but if I were a parent I wouldn't want serve this to my kid solely for the fact that kids shouldn't take such an enjoyment from bourbon at such an age.

I can't wait to taste every other flavor, order those home-made chocolate chip cookies, and if I'm daring enough order the 20y aged balsamic as a topping.

The interior had the charm of a childhood lost and rediscovered.
author: Jeff A.

description: Great ice cream.  Got the Brown Butter, was very good.  Tried the Secret Breakfast, was very...strong, don't know how I feel about alcohol in ice cream, maybe I don't party hard enough.  The atmosphere is fun, and the people are really nice.  I would definitely suggest you check it out.
author: Rob M.

description:
after seeing it on food network and reading good reviews about the place, i had to check humphry slocombe the next time i was in SF.  so last month, i took a trip to the Bay and made sure that i was getting some of that "secret breakfast" everyone was raving about.

we get there: it's a small shop in the mission area,  the staff's helpful & friendly.  and the flavors... interesting to say the least: "jesus juice"??  well, i knew what i wanted so i got two scoops of some of that "secret breakfast".  right off the bat, the bourbon hits you.  thank goodness for the cornflakes; they were nice little treats between the licks of liquor. maybe i should have stuck to just one scoop of the "secret breakfast"?  regardless, i enjoyed it anyway.  i'll try the other flavors next time i find myself in SF.
author: Ro R.

description: Came here a few weeks ago and had the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee with Tahitian Vanilla ice cream. The line is totally worth waiting for, as this is some of the best ice cream I've ever had. Totally on par with Bi-Rite ice cream, if not better!
author: Morris C.

description: I would only go back for Blue bottle vietnamese coffee. It's a cute and unique place for a show like bizarre foods or something. A cool place to try and say, "ive been there!".
author: Tiffany L.

description: This spot reminds me of Ici in Berkeley. It's got all the mix of original flavors. If you're looking for your regular 31 flavors then this is not your spot to go. Expect eclectic flavors. I definitely recommend the Vietnamese Coffee over the Tahitian Vanilla. Parking is free after 6pm. The name of the ice cream place isn't readily visible. So you basically want to go into the side entrance where there are blue shade curtains (i don't know what those things are called). VIETNAMESE COFFEE ICE CREAM. Portions aren't huge but price is very doable and you can easily grab seconds without burning an impact crater in your money clip.
author: Jon H.

description: DELICIOUS and very very CREATIVE!  Come during the week when the line won't stretch down the block.  If you can't make it, the line is well worth the wait.  This weekend I enjoyed salty chocolate, black sesame vanilla, Tahitian Coffee and fluffier nuttier flavor ice creams.  YUM and ENJOY!
author: T W.

description:
The ice cream is incredibly innovative with fresh ingredients and a very rich, sweet flavor. The flavor combinations are extremely creative and they seem to work.  I'm not a fan of all the flavors but that is just a personal preference.  Some of the ones I don't really like, my husband and friends love.  Since they encourage tastings you can find something you like. Even classic flavors are great, the rocky road has homemade marshmallows and their own toasted nuts and chocolate, probably the best rocky road I've ever had.  The downside is they don't have all the flavors available, the menu changes a little every day. The shop has got character with the old counter and stools and some outdoor seating.

I say Mitchell's is an institution with great classic flavors, lots of tasty tropical flavors you can't get many places, and great seasonal flavors.  A big selection of flavors and a diverse crowd of hipsters and families.  

Bi-rite is also excellent with a solid consistent selection.  A bit of a scene sometimes and on a nice day the line is too long for me.  You can always grab a pint to go.

Humphry Slocombe is the most creative and innovative, great place to explore if you're up for a tasty adventure.  Keep an open mind and try some flavors that seem a little odd. I think the place and neighborhood has a lot of character and the line is usually much shorter than Mitchell's or Bi-rite, at least for now.
author: D. P.

description:
similar to a drink mixologist, i think of humphry slocombe as an ice cream mixologist.  meaning that, yeah, the flavors are pretty out there, but their craft is to ensure that their ice cream is still of the highest standards, both in quality and taste.  i can't really attest to all their flavors, but considering they have 1,400+ reviews and a four-star average, i think they're doing alright.

i had the ancho chocolate, which is probably one of the tamer flavors at HS.  the first couple of bites tasted like regular chocolate; but after a while there was a subtle kick to it, and by the end of it, the ancho definitely creeped up on me.  it was actually kinda an amazing experience, to start out tasting one thing, and end up with another flavor all together.

it's hard to compare humphry slocombe to other ice cream places out there, since it really depends on if you're in the mood for something traditional or daring.  when i feel the latter, i'll definitely come back to try the secret breakfast or one of their other concoctions they're more known for.
author: stefanie h.

description:
To everyone who has been giving this place 4 or 5 stars: you guys have no idea what quality is.
I have been waiting to visit this place for quite a while, and had high expectations. To begin with, it was extremely dirty and not well-kept. As someone who works in the food business, I know that keeping the place clean is important. But let me get to the actual ice cream: it was crap. I wanted to gag. I sampled the Limoncello Sorbet. It was watery, too sweet, and practically fell apart. There is nothing special about this flavor. To redeem some hope in the place, I tried the chocolate smoked sea salt. I felt like throwing up after trying it. Incredibly salty and overwhelming. 
As someone who knows good ice cream and gelato when I try it, this was crap. I'd rather buy Ben and Jerry's from Safeway than this. 

If any of you want REAL quality ice cream, check out Lush Gelato in Piedmont Ave, and Shattuck in Berkeley.
author: Camila M.

description: YUM! My bestie and I have decided to hunt down the best of the best (as reported by 7x7's Foodie List). We popped by here and had to try everything! It was delish! We tried the Olive Oil (a bit lemony with an olive oil aftertaste), Earl Great (YUM!) and Secret Breakfast were among the faves. So good. So worth the try!
author: Elizabeth T.

description: My friends and I had just eaten at Pizzeria Delfina and decided to make the trek over here to see what people were talking about.  After a lengthy walk, my friends were cold and annoyed with me, but I assured them I wouldn't let them down.  Sure enough, this place delivered some good ice cream.  The great thing about dining with friends is you get to try so many more flavors.  Secret breakfast, Vietnamese coffee, Fluffer Nutter, and Salt and Pepper were my favorites.  The ice cream was creamy and the flavors stood out.  The ice cream flavors are so incredibly unique, making this place a real winner.
author: Elizabeth K.

description:
Excellent ice cream in an unexpected location. For better or for worse, though (and that depends on where you live and how much money you have), the stretch of 24th Street this place is near seems to be gentrifying with fancy food places at a quick pace.

That issue aside, the ice cream is yummy. I liked the Valrhona fudgesicle flavor the best, and the malted dulce de leche was good as well, although it could've been more strongly flavored. The balsamic salted caramel was good, though, if a bit odd, a bit too sweet (designed to be that way, I'm sure). Maple walnut was standard. I'd like to try the secret breakfast and Blue Bottle coffee flavors.

The brownies and cookies looked good, although we didn't try any. Decor is minimal, not necessarily a bad thing. I think I still prefer Bi-Rite Creamery -- I'm into more traditional flavors, on the whole.
author: Tara M.

description:
This was different.

A newbie might want to commit to one flavor before diving into the Gabba Gabba Hey: Balsamic caramel ice cream, brownie,
Amarena cherries, whipped cream.  It just seemed too high brow to be punk--It didn't conjure up Joey, Johnny, and Dee Dee in my head...that is stretching it, A LOT.

MANY hipsters so wear your shrunken everything AND a scarf.  If you have that APC Gabba Gabba Hey T, you belong here.
author: Donut Cak e.

description: Humphry Slocombe is as good as it gets in my opinion!  Which is the reason I am giving it 5 stars.  I love the blue bottle coffee and their limoncello sorbet is amazing.  They switch their flavors all the time so you never know what flavors you are going to get.  Which is part of the fun but if you want the limoncello sorbet it may not be there.  Also lines can be long but they always let you taste as many flavors as you want.  If you are in the mission it is worth a stop!
author: Deborah R.

description: Sea Salt chocolate ice cream, just the right amount of salt so good
author: Ryan B.

description:
The waft hits you as you cross the threshold of the rather small door -- but your nose doesn't know how to identify that smell. When you've scanned the list of hand-scrawled flavors, you know that Humphry cannot simply be an ice cream maker, but a mad scientist above all, concocting truly bizarre ice cream combinations such salt and pepper and curry peanut butter. Although you still cannot place it, the smell begins to make sense: ice cream and waffle cones mixed with coffee and curry and olive oil and bourbon and fois gras! Yes, Humphry's is the Dr. Seuss of ice cream.

As for the flavors, the Secret Breakfast -- corn flakes with a good, strong kick of bourbon -- is divine. It is both unique and comforting, frankly the way ice cream should be.

The only thing I hate about Humphry's has nothing to do with the ice cream. The name (which apparently originates from a low-brow British sitcom) is both unmemorable and hard to spell. Thankfully the memorable ice cream makes up for the unmemorable name.
author: Dan V.

description: Secret Breakfast is a favorite but I can't wait for their seasonal Summer Sweet Corn! Limited but unique selection of flavors.
author: Stephanie D.

description:
I definitely enjoyed my ice cream here, don't get me wrong, but it didn't knock my socks off.  Bi-Rite is still my number one scoop.

I had Buttermilk Strawberry Yogurt and Balsamic Caramel.  Tasty and they complimented each other well, but they couldn't touch a similar combination that Bi-Rite offers, Balsamic Strawberry and Salted Caramel.  My girlfriend's ice cream was the hit of the evening: Blue Bottle Coffee (yum) and Pine Nut Rosemary (also yum).  Again I couldn't help comparing the Pine Nut Rosemary to the Honey Lavender offered by Bi-Rite, which is a stronger combination.  A friend of mine ordered the Jesus Juice (coca-cola red wine sorbet) and Miso Peach.  He was less lucky.  While I enjoyed the novelty of a couple of bites of each of these flavors, I wouldn't have wanted to be stuck with a whole cup.  I also tried the Summer Corn Ice Cream which was just terrible.

All and all, I would go here again if I walked by and had a sudden desire for ice cream, but I wouldn't go out of the way.
author: Richard N.

description:
tahitian vanilla icecream and henry weinhart rootbeer float (you can pick up a case at safeway).  aside from this being the best vanilla icecream i have ever had, toss it in some rootbeer and you have a PB&J type combination.

foie gras sammy, this was maybe my second favorite ice cream from this place.

chocolate chip cookies are good also, so if they have any left, pick it up.
author: Wayne L.

description: The gourmet creamery is the new new thing.  This is as good as Bi-Rite and Mrs. Miscellaneous.  Much more longevity than Tart frozen yogurt and Tapioca milk tea as cost are fairly high for this operation.
author: Laurence H.

description:
I was impressed from my first taste of Secret Breakfast. But you keep surprising me with deliciousness, Humphry's. Eightball Stout ice cream? Really? Beer and ice cream together? Straight up wonderful. Real talk. 
Anyway, sometimes the flavors get a bit too intense for me. (Ex. Balsamic Caramel, Thai Chili Lime) But I have to admire the creativity and love put into every flavor of ice cream at this fine establishment. Please, go. Go and taste Secret Breakfast. It's good for the soul.
author: Sarah M.

description: mmmmmmm....curry peanut butter!~
author: Lisa M.

description: My wife and I went here on the recommendation of a friend and Yelp. I sampled a few of the flavors and decided on the Secret Breakfast. I give Humphry Slocombe credit for the interesting flavor combinations, but it loses stars on the texture and creaminess of the ice cream. It tasted more like ice milk. Overall, I had better ice cream.
author: Jimmy T.

description:
There are some unique flavors at this place. I had a sample of the olive oil and salt and pepper. It tasted exactly like it sounds, pretty cool... but not my sort of thing for ice cream. 
I had a scoop of Balsamic caramel which I thought was a bit strong on the balsamic with the caramel being a small aftertaste. I wished it were a bit stronger on the caramel and more subtle on the balsamic. I didn't enjoy the secret breakfast as much as others have, but I liked it better than the balsamic caramel. The corn flakes were still fresh which provided a nice crunch. The burbon was a tiny bit overpowering. 
My friend had the vietnamese blue bottle coffee, which was a far better flavor than the ones I had.

It was an okay experience, if I were more into some out of the ordinary ice cream flavors I'd give this place a much higher rating.
author: Colin H.

description: Not exactly my cup of tea.  I had one of the beer flavored ice creams.  I must say I liked it better than I thought I would, but I wouldn't eat it again.  Well, maybe I will eat it again because I still have $10 in gift cards.  But after that I won't eat it again.  For me, choosing an ice cream here is like choosing the lesser of evils. I commend the uniqueness and creativity so give it a try, you might like it.
author: Robert S.

description:
The escapades of Salt & Peppa, Foie Gras, Balsamic Caramel or Pistachio Bacon are not what I can personally say are the best choices for delectable ice cream flavors but now i can say I've eaten them! Where else can you venture beyond the 32 flavors you normally encounter?

The true genius of Humphrey Slocombe are the deliciously unique flavors like Valrhona Fudgesicle, Rhubarb, Sour Cream, and, finally -- while you should still try one of the other absurd varieties -- you had better not leave before you've had a Secret Breakfast!
author: John B.

description: All the flavors I've tried here are wonderful.  Balsamic strawberry is a favorite.  Bourbon breakfast is a great way to kill a hangover.  Worth standing in line.  You won't be sorry.
author: Russell D.

description:
gotta give it up to humphrys by incorporating 2 of my favorite beverages in their ice cream:

- secret breakfast - bourbon ice cream with corn flakes and caramel
- blue bottle vietnamese coffee ice cream - nuff said

humphry's is probably 4th best ice cream in sf by my standards but deserves 5 stars for those 2 ice cream flavors alone! go get some breakfast for dinner... or should i say desert?
author: Brian L.

description: Tried the Jesus Juice and the Meyer Lemon sorbet (I think) and was not a fan. Probably the combination of those two together, but I don't think I'd be a fan of these flavours separately. Wish I got the browned butter, which I sampled which was omgsogood.
author: Deanna L.

description: I give them 3.5 stars. I had the breakfast flavor and that was good! I love the bits of cornflakes in it. The olive oil was good the first 5 licks then I got sick of the flavor, that is not good, it's icecream, it should be goo to the very last lick! There are so many good icecream parlors in SF I don't think I would go out of my way to come here. If I'm in the hood I'll go.
author: Karen T.

description: i gave humphry only 4 stars because my heart belongs to bi-rite. lol i really do admire their bizarre gourmet flavors like the secret breakfast, i think it was interesting but good, however i dont think id order it again. it definitely is a flavor you MUST try tho. i was impressed with the blue bottle vietnamese coffee ice cream, im not a fan of coffee ice cream at all, but this was THE best coffee ice cream i ever had! so good job! i also like it here because it is just cute & they have the cutest cups for water. hahaha
author: Tiffany C.

description: Yummy!!!  First time I went I had "Fluffnnutter: and "Smoked Chocolate Sea Salt" - ya ... the line is a bit long - but worth it!  Try the Secret Breakfast ... it was good - but the Chocolate was amazing.  The second time I went (the following night) I have the Vietnamese Coffee....  yummm!  The folks working there were very nice and don't rush you - which I liked  and yes, it causes the line to move a little slow, but still I liked that.
author: Jill Z.

description: First time visiting Humphry's after hearing all the hype and the guy behind the counter seemed to be hating his life on this sunny sunday. He was not very friendly, did not really speak to the customers and made the overall experience horrible.
author: Thomas J.

description:
Inventive flavors, outstanding ingredients and a great staff.   We have tried to get here the past few Saturday nights, but haven't been able to make it by their 9pm closing.   However, we planned better last night and it certainly paid off.   We tried 4 flavors - Secret Breakfast, Balsamic Carmel, McEvoy Olive Oil and Milk Chocolate Passion Fruit.   All were wonderful - but I wish I had ordered 4 scoops of Secret Breakfast.  

The ice cream is served at a perfect temperature.  Its completely solid, but not so cold you can't taste the flavors.   

The only two complaints I have are; 1) they close too early and 2) while the location is fine, it is generally a destination.  There isn't too much else nearby that would have you there already.  

But with that said, its well worth getting there early and going out of your way.
author: Jonathan W.

description: Unique combination of flavors!  The strawberry margarita sorbet had just the right amount of sweetness and felt like taffy.  The coffee ice cream tasted like blue bottle coffee.  The milk chocolate malt was better than chocolate with sea salt.  I like my chocolate without salt but I had to try the ice cream version.   And finally, the Secret Breakfast is definitely not for breakfast.  Cornflakes and bourbon is an interesting mix, though I can only eat a very small scope at a time.
author: Rose C.

description: I was so excited to try this place tonight after my birthday dinner.  We got there exactly at 9PM.  The lights were on and they had customers  and the door was still open.  We begged to be served and were very nice about it but the girl at the counter refused and just offerred to sell us a pint but she wouldn't serve us a cone.  I guess business must be great that they wouldn't serve paying customers.  It wouldn't have been nearly as disappointing had the place not been open but it was.  We won't be going back to this place since they obviously have more than enough customers and don't need to have a heart!  I don't need to find out how good their product is....Happy Birthday to me!
author: Antonio B.

description:
i could see how a lot of people would love this place. they do a good job with their ice cream. but for what some people see as "deliciously unique", favors, i see as just plain weird and not all that appetizing. 

i much prefer the more unique but not crazy flavors of mitchels (which is officially my favorite ice cream shop in the city now).  

still three stars because this really is just a personal preference thing. i'm sure i could find a good flavor amongst their many, but their mainstays are not for me. 

the line can get ridiculously long though, but not longer than the other mainstays of the city: mitchell's and birite
author: James W.

description:
I actually tried this place the very first time it opened a few years back. I remember it being good but I since I just moved back to the Mission, I had to try it again. I had Elvis the fat years, which is peanut brittle, bacon, and bananas. It was delicious, the peanut brittle dominated my taste buds but you also got a hint of the saltiness of the bacon and the sweetness of the banana. 

I went back two days later and it was no longer offered. Instead of being disappointed I saw this as a great opportunity to try other flavors. I got the Blue Vietnamese Coffee, delicious! (Warning: It's strong coffee and will keep you up at night if you eat it after 5 PM.). I also got a scoop of the Secret Breakfast, which is corn flakes and bourbon, delicious as well.

The only downfall this place has is the line, which tends to be out the door, but it's worth the wait. I suggest you get there early and often! Enjoy.
author: El N.

description: I had the secret breakfast, bourbon and cornflakes, and the jesus juice, red wine and coke, ice creams.  Both were delicious and I could taste the alcohol in them.  If I ate a gallon would I get brain freeze or drunk first?
author: Matthew P.

description: Secret Breakfast! All I can say is... yummy. Thank goodness I don't live in the Mission anymore! It could be a problem.
author: Angel P.

description: Came here after lunch.  We had the salted watermelon sorbet, lime basil sorbet, Vietnamese coffee, secret breakfast, and creme fresh.  Of course the sorbets were in a separate bowl.  This is a small place with a tiny sign.  Look for the line out the door.  People were friendly and best of all, the ice cream and sorbets were amazing.
author: Maricelle R.

description: I have no idea what's in the Secret Breakfast ice cream, but it's damn good!  Also, a close second is the Vietnamese Coffee.
author: Harry T.

description:
AMAZING
great flavors--made the day before they are served, which is why they sometimes run out.

They also work with local companies and farmers- which is rad
Sometimes there is a line, but that is because it is a small place

some flavors might be too crazy, but hey--- just don't eat those!

I like that this place reps the salty sweet creamy flavors
Also the workers get benefits which is rad!

this place isn't trying to be Bi-Rite, so comparing them seems wrong
if you want vanilla ice cream for tonight, go to BiRite, if it's your day off and you feel like something new, go venture to HS and try something
author: Sarah M.

description:
I've had some amazing and odd flavors of ice cream here and I've enjoyed them all. I need to go to this place more often.

This is not the same old mint chocolate chip selection.

YUM!!!!!!!!!!!!!
author: Robert V.

description: I do not go out of my way for ice cream, but on my recent SF trip, my sweet-tooth pal made it her mission to check this place out. AND it was well worth it. Fresh creamy ice cream in a delightful selection of random flavor combinations. I thought the red wine/cola flavor thingy was sensational. I went w/the Olive Oil and loved it. And the prices weren't ridonkulous, which is always a plus.
author: Lans S.

description: Secret breakfast is amazing. I particularly enjoy the alcohol aftertaste. There was line but worth the wait. Bring cash as it's cash only.
author: Amir S.

description:
This stuff is good. 

Being a fan of mint juleps/ Maker's Mark, I thought Secret Breakfast would be my all time favorite. It's good, but I like H.S.'s hibiscus beet sorbet and olive oil ice cream the best. 

Honestly, the thought of olive oil ice cream completely grosses me out, but the taste is more like a creamy vanilla with a light lemon scent. It is divine!

My man always gets the Blue Bottle Vietnamese coffee with Guinness or Valrhona fudgesicle. 

On the must try list are the cucumber ice milk, salt and pepper, malted vanilla, foie gras, and government cheese.  (Here's hoping that those last two terrifying flavors are as pleasantly surprising as the McEvoy olive oil!)

The last time I stopped in, the friendly girls behind the counter were also giving out fresh dates right off the branch. I hope they concoct something with those caramelized goodies next.  Yum!
author: K L.

description: The ice cream was good, but it didn't change my life. Maybe my expectations were too high, as my friends who are locals kept raving about it. I mean, it was good, but just not stellar. The Vietnamese ice coffee flavor was actually disappointing, as the ice cream was sort of dry and crumbly and the flavor was too subtle. The ancho chocolate was better with a richer flavor and a nice consistency. Good thing the line wasn't long when we went. If I had waited in a block-long line, I would have been annoyed. Also, the price was right--not too spendy.
author: Jamon B.

description:
My palate takes on a whole new role at this place.  

Bi-Rite is similar in approach but Humphry's boldness and shock-value for what they've done to ice cream is out of this freaking world!  The Thai Chili Lime is hot, really hot.  Ice cream doesn't typically do that.  

I want to try every flavor.  Just thinking about it now on my couch after eating two scoops 40 minutes ago, I want desperately to go back and indulge some more.  Each trip is a fantastic adventure!!
author: Colleen C.

description: Staff are lovely and the Chocolate with Sea Salt is the bomb.
author: Emma C.

description:
A recent transplant to the Bay Area, I still have yet to catch the ice cream craze.  Nevertheless, my curiosity immediately piqued when I saw the bizarre array of flavors.  After sampling the secret breakfast, peanut butter curry, and a few others, I settled on the summer corn, which sounds a bit boring but worked surprisingly well - a subtle flavor that allowed the creaminess to come through unobstructed.  

Yes there are lines, but they move fairly quickly.
author: Jeremy C.

description: After seeing this place on Bizarre Foods, I wanted to check it out. At 8pm on Sat, the line was out the door and grew even longer by the time we left. Worth it? I think so. I had malted chocolate, which was the most normal of the selection. There was an olive oil, Jesus choice, breakfast concoction, etc. Very strange! There were a ton of flavors sold out, as well as all the sundaes, but that's part of it I guess. First come, first served.
author: Julia S.

description: Five stars is for "oh hell yes" flavor. "Secret breakfast" was good but pretty strong I think I got drunk. Try everything... Even the ones that sound weird, they're funky but delicious.
author: Vanessa V.

description:
I dont really like sweets, unless it is something to do with peanut butter. However, friends were in town and wanted to check this place out.

I have only a few words left to say..

BOURBON & CORN FLAKES.
author: Christian K.

description: OMG...This place is amazing. I had 3 scoops the Salt and Pepper, Jesus Juice (Coke and wine flavored) and Government cheese which is better then they sound. It is a unique experience which will have your taste buds begging you for more.
author: Shelley M.

description: My boyfriend and I came in today for our first time ever. I have to say that everything about the shop is incredible. From the customer service to the ice cream itself, Humphry Slocombe is nothing short of incredible. There was a guy with a yellow hat with a red ribbon around it, that helped serve us our flavors. He was so genuinely kind - taking a couple minutes to help us discover our perfect ice cream flavor. His overall attitude left us pleasantly surprised. It is a rarity to be helped at any store in San Francisco with such a joyous staff!  Because of his great service and hospitality, my boyfriend and I felt compelled to leave a yelp review. We left with our two delicious scoops of salted carmel ice cream!
author: Mary P.

description:
Secret Breakfast = Awesome! Combines two of my favorites, bourbon and cornflakes!
Hibiscus Beet = Not so awesome (thought it tasted like cold sweet Borscht)
Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee = Awesome (and I'm not a coffee ice cream fan)
Coconut Sherbet = Love (I love coconut)
Rosemary's Baby (intense)
Miso Peach (more peach than miso)
author: Jeff X.

description: The flavors can be a bit out of the box, or even the block, but you cannot go wrong with Secret Breakfast, Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee, and my personal favorite, "Red Hot" Banana. It's banana ice cream with little red hots candy in it. It sounds weird, and I'm not even a big fan of bananas or red hots candy, but this combo is worth the trip to HS. The flavor is not always available, so good luck. The lines can be a bit long especially if it's a weekend and the weather is warm.
author: Mike C.

description: You'll come here for their unique flavors like Oolong tea, curried pumpkin and all the other unconventional flavors. I think I'll come here more often for inspiration. With it being on Harrison street I thought that parking would be a pain but there was plenty of parking in the area.
author: Daniel C.

description: Loved the original flavors they offered. By far the best flavor was Fluffernutter. Combo of savory and sweet was just right.
author: D M.

description: Most people seem to be on one side of the fence or the other about this place.  I think for the most part it's not really a place to go if you have a craving for your standard ice cream.  It's definitely the type of place to test your palette and try something off the wall.  This place is not for the play it safers, definitely for the inner daredevil in you.
author: Andrina H.

description:
This place will give Bi-Rite a run for it's money any day of the week. As long as it's before 8PM when it closes, which is a bit early for me, so sometimes I rush home for work just to get a scoop. Sad, I know...

favorite flavors: secret breakfast, thai peanut butter, balsamic caramel; good, good stuff.

hop on over to the other side of the Mission and see for yourself.
author: Frank B.

description:
Meh-

Creative may be, but just too weird for me.  

My problem is actually the ice cream base itself rather than flavor combinations.  Their base is cloyingly fatty and very salty.  They just don't make good ice cream.  Even more traditional ice cream flavors are not that good here.  You can enjoy for the experience of eating eating ice cream with odd ingredient.  But to me that doesn't instantly make it good.  

I really want to get behind their concept but honestly their ice cream is not that good, so I can't give more than 3 stars.
author: Suze W.

description:
When I first heard of Humphry Slocombe, read articles, and tried some flavors at Mission Street Food, I thought it would win my heart (or tongue) over Bi-Rite.  Such was not the case, but I still like Humphry for what it can offer - flavors you can't get anywhere else.

I'll have to update with another review after I've made more visits.  My favorite flavors so far are V. Fudgesicle (just what you want when you think fudgsicle), Prosciutto (nice and salty sweet), Milk Chocolate Passion Fruit (this achieves a perfect balance between the two flavors---i feel like a lot of the combo flavors i've tried here are usually unbalanced), Secret Breakfast, and Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee.

I also very much like Balsamic Caramel - it tastes like cheesecake to me!  I liked Olive Oil at first, but on second try, the citrus zest throws me off, and it started tasting just like lemon ice cream to me.

Flavors that didn't win me over were Hot Banana aaaaand...i can't remember what else.  

I am interested in the Foie Gras ice cream sandwhich!  I overheard the ice-cream maker talk about how quickly they sell out.  

I've had a mixed experience with those working at Humphry Slocombe--once they were really cold/robotic/non-receptive and another time they were really nice and seemed like they were actually happy to be there - these were different people each time.  shrug

Lastly,  they just extended hours to 9 PM which is very good because there have been many a time when we've wanted to visit and their short hours made it difficult to make it there on time, especially if you want some ice cream after dinner!  

And they're kind of out in 'the boonies', but I like the neighborhood they're in.  If I lived anywhere around there, I'd probably visit more regularly.  Even if I'm hanging out in the Mission, it's a bit of a walk just to get over there.
author: Liz C.

description: Love love love Humphry Slocombe for one reason only - MCEVOY OLIVE OIL!  The zest of the citrus in this recipe is WONDERFUL.  It reminds me of Mitchell's Lemon Chiffon, but not so sweet.  My husband had the chocolate with the smoked sea salt, and one of their fresh and warm chocolate chip cookies.  DOUBLE YUM!  Can't wait to go back again soon...
author: Jennifer V.

description: I loved Humphry Slocombe Ice Cream, we used to drive from San Jose on pure cravings just for their secret breakfast and a couple of other flavors, but the last couple of times we've been there within the last 2 months, something happened to their flavors... not sure if they are cutting back on the ingredients or they are changing the recipes, but their secret breakfast doesn't taste the same to me nor to the hubby the last 2 times we order it. There's no bourbon flavor anymore, it almost taste just like pure vanilla ice cream, and the flavor is off from what it used to be. We just tried their burnt butter flavor, which is one of my husband's favorite, it used to be so rich and flavorful, but this last time it was also super mild in flavor that it almost tasted like pure vanilla flavor.  Their scoops used to be cheaper and bigger, they are now more expensive and smaller... is it just me or are they starting to cut corners? I might give them another try, 3rd time since the first dissapointment, but that might be it if the flavors are not there anymore. =(
author: Crystal M.

description:
Came here on a hot day, the line wasn't too long but out the door. The staff is not that friendly but the ice cream flavors are unique! I tried the Salt & Pepper, it was different but I didn't get that one. I eventually ended up with the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee with Tahitian Vanilla on a cone. My friend had the Tahitian Vanilla with Coke float. Their floats are very interesting, they pour the coke from a small glass bottle and give you the rest of the bottle. Very cute!
Their seating is awesome, at most ten stools along the window.  But I can see how it can get filled really easily. Parking wasn't too bad, a lot of street parking, it's in the Mission area. 
Four stars because it's a really cute place, definitely a charm in the city. But I'm more of the sweet strawberry ice cream kind of girl and there was  nothing fruity and sweet on the menu this time around. I went on their website to see what other flavors they had and they actually have a large list that they rotate around. So I will definitely come back to try more of their flavors!
author: Miffy Y.

description: So creamy that it makes all other ice cream just taste like ice.  The secret breakfast especially puts all other non HS ice creams to shame.  Perhaps its the bourbon, but it seems like the perfect solution to all of life's problems.
author: Tara C.

description:
Perfect place.
Perfect San Francisco moment: sunny Mission walk and talk and tacos and then, unexpected sublime creamy totally bizarre deliciousness.

Thank you to the crazy mad genius who combines flavors with the wit of it's British sitcom namesake. Secret Breakfast.... Blue Bottle.... Salt n Peppa. A wonderful cup of tiny bursting joys.
author: D. B.

description: We tasted shamelessly - Secret Breakfast (way too bourbon-y, but hey that might be your thing), rhubarb, malted milk (pretty good, but too sweet), and in the end settled on McEvoy olive oil which was deliciously refreshing for an ice cream. It was a fruity olive oil undertones with citrus zest flavor as well as vanilla.
author: Sasha H.

description: A friend saw an ad for this place and wanted to visit.  So we all piled in on a little adventure to find this place.  A small shop that you could almost miss if you weren't looking for it.  The guys behind the counter were very nice and obliged our every ice cream taste request.  I ended up with Muscat Wine Sorbet and Tahitian Vanilla.  Great combination.  I could eat a pint of the Muscat alone.  Yum, yum.  Their prices are also quite reasonable.  About 3 or 4 bucks for 2 scoops. Best ice cream I think I've ever had.  Cash only!
author: isabelle j.

description:
The ice cream quality is good and the strange flavors actually taste pretty good, I like the peanutbutter curry the best.  My only problem with slocombe's is the service. I don't know if they think they're awesome, or just over tired, but  I sense that hipster supiority vibe going on. But then again maybe I'm just in on the wrong days.

Side note: who cares which places Michael Mina likes? Are we sheep, do we not know our own taste buds people?
author: Ryan C.

description:
Pretty awesome. Its odd going somewhere after reading Yelp reviews, you get all sorts of expectations. Secret Breakfast was better than I expected; I expected the Bourbon to be overwhelming, but I found it to be balanced just right and the cornflakes are as good as reported. I'd probably get drunk off this stuff if you left me alone with a pint.

On the other hand, while I love Blue Bottle, the Vietnamese Coffee was just OK. I mean, don't get me wrong, this was certainly high quality, delicious and sophisticated ice-cream, but the Blue Bottle just tasted like coffee ice cream to me. I sampled the salt-n-pepper too. Very interesting, I think a little heavy on the salt though.
author: Zac H.

description: Of course Humphry's is great, but If you factor in the "Great Ice Cream" to "Wait in Line" ratio, this place would win hands down!  I love their Olive Oil ice cream and I don't want to wait in a mile long line to get it :)
author: Mick H.

description: Eureka! A short line at HS!  I'm a sweet and savory girl, so I ran in and got a single scoop of the Balsamic Caramel.  Can't wait to go back and try the Peanut Butter Curry, Secret Breakfast, etc.  The names are genius.  I heard about one called "Feral Kitten"--- Urban legend?
author: Lisa R.

description:
i'd always passed by humphry's and have always seen the long lines, and was curious about it. i came here soon after my coworker told me that the secret breakfast was her most favorite ice cream, ever. 

i was actually originally skeptical about the bourbon part, but damn, this ice cream is good! it's not super overwhelming, so i don't feel like i'm going to get drunk after eating one scoop of ice cream. it also mixes in super well with the corn flakes and caramel for a pretty awesome combination of flavors.

the vietnamese coffee is super good, too (and hellooooo! blue bottle!). now that one is STRONG.

humphry's is giving my love for bi-rite for a run for its money, that's for sure...
author: Caroline I.

description:
I've been avoiding trying this slightly new addition to the neighborhood just because I always see crowds of people and was determined not to get caught up in the hype.  After a long, hard day selling wares at my garage sale, we decided we deserved an extra special treat.  "Let's try that Slocombe something ice cream place on Harrison and 24th!" I exclaimed. 

We arrived almost half hour after closing time and yet, we were greeted with smiles. 

5 stars for the super friendly service, the non-begrudging meting out of samples and the Strawberry Jalapeno ice cream.  Whoa.  Delish. 

I treated myself to the gabba gabba hey sundae.  The brownie was amazing, the cherries superb and the whipped cream was perfect, the only spoiler was the balsamic caramel ice cream.  So, so tasty the first few bites (nice combo of sweet and salty) but it quickly became "too much" after that.  Unfortunately I couldn't finish the entire sundae as it gave me that overly sweet, too much flavor weird sensation at the back of my throat.  

I tried my girlfriend's strawberry jalapeno scoop and can I just say that it was the perfect marriage of sweet strawberry and spicy jalapeno?  Well, it was. Imagine yummy, creamy, strawberry ice cream and tangy, not overly spicy, bits of jalapeno...can't imagine it?  Then go try it.  

They'll give you a taste of whatever you like.
author: Ames P.

description: HS definitely provides the most unique offerings out of all the artisanal ice cream joints, but I just couldn't get into any of the flavors.  I've tried scoops of the secret breakfast and blackberry, but I'd much rather have a ricannelas at Bi-Rite.
author: Ernest S.

description:
1) An "A" for flavor creativity.

2) A "D" for their Tahitian Vanilla.  

3) A "C" for San Francisco yelpers falling victim to the hipster gentrification of the Mission.  Therefore making an establishment "a must have".  There's your slap on the wrist.

4) Have you tried Ici on College Avenue in Oakland? Excellent ice cream and kicks HS to the curb and w/o the mispelled sharpie flavour signs on the glass ice box.  I love exotic flavored ice cream, but I always start with an ice cream parlour's vanilla w/a side of hot fudge (as I feel it is the "true test" of an ice cream maker to make a great vanilla).  Don't try this vanilla/hot fudge idea at HS as the hot fudge isn't hot, it turned to stone once it hit the ice cream and the vanilla was weak flavoured.  It almost tasted like I had a cold, which means no flavour.

5) A "B" for the Cinnamon Brittle.
  
6) I believe in the Yelp effect, but I think the reviewers of this parlour have it wrong.  I reacted to the hype without tasting it 1st.
author: Riley O.

description:
This place rocks my socks!  There was a line all day, which deterred me at first but I decided to wait in it after dinner.  The friend I was with had never been there, what a treat to bring a first timer!  I was telling him that I really want to try the Hibiscus Beet Sorbet and maybe someday I will be lucky enough to be there at the right now.  And what is this?! As I walk up to glass an employee is coming over to change the signs for the flavors.  Hibiscus Beet Sorbet is coming out with perfect timing. Woot!  Other flavors they had available were the ever popular Jesus Juice (wine and coke) and Secret Breakfast (cornflakes and bourbon), plus Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee, Tahitian Vanilla, Strawberry Margarita, Peanut Butter Curry, Butter Beer and a few others.
I was impressed at how friendly the employees were.  Even with a non stop line out the door they smile and acknowledge every customer.  They'll give a tasting of as many flavors as you like.  They use washable taster spoons and green friendly compostable cups and spoons.
This was not my first visit and it certainly won't be my last!
author: Hillary J.

description:
Sampling flavors at HS went like this:

Sesame: This is seriously the grossest thing I've ever put in my mouth.
Vinegar Caramel: Mortgage the house, I need to buy 30,000 pints of this right now.

HS is all about extremes.  I either love or hate each flavor.  There are no in betweens.  And I find that strangely satisfying.
author: April G.

description: With all the reviews already out there, all I can say is my family is a fan of the blue bottle coffee, and I'm also a fan of the jesus juice. :)  But damn those lines...
author: ML N.

description:
2 words (one sort of abbreviated) and 1 really abbreviated word: Salt 'n Peppa.

Save your money, kids! This place is a foodie's dream come true!
author: fatty m.

description:
I've had the olive oil and balsamic carmel, vietnamese coffee and salt and pepper flavors.

all are delicious. the ice cream here are high quality, innovative and addicting. 

the only thing i would do differently is to pick flavors that are more complementary and/or stick to one flavor instead of being the greedy bitch that i am. flavors such as the salt and pepper are overwhelming when paired with others. 

this is good stuff.
author: None o.

description:
Yummers! My goodness: the Fluffernutter ice cream. Delish!

They definitely have some funky flavors here and some are, as you'd expect, hit or miss. Me? I don't want sorbet that tastes like beets. Not my kind of thing. But when you get ice cream (or sorbet, for that matter) this well made, you at least are getting what you expect (i.e. the Beet Sorbet will taste like beets and the Cucumber ice cream will taste like cucumber). And, I've got to appreciate their adventurous spirit. 

In case I've scared you off, they do have more traditional flavors here as well, so you can at least go home happy you've tried some unique flavors and filled up on some substantial goodness. 

The staff here are really friendly and let you try as many flavors as you'd like, even if there's a line, which I appreciated because you never know... maybe this time I would like beet sorbet...
author: Amy L.

description: Secret breakfast is the best ice cream that I've ever had.  The ice cream at HS is rich and has an amazing texture.  The place is a little over hipster'd for me, but since it's the best ice cream in SF that's what you can expect I guess. Jesus Juice is also out of this world - It's Coke and red wine sorbet.  Had it on a hot SF day and it totally did the trick. Yum!
author: Nicholas H.

description: For whatever reason, I like to try things when they aren't cool anymore and no one gives a hoot. This review would have been relevant about 6 months ago, but now everyone and their dog has been to this ice cream shop. Yes, they have ice cream for dogs. Dogs will eat anything anyway, including their own poop. Dogs are hysterically disgusting. I love them so much!
author: Mitsi M.

description: If I had a thousand bucks to spare, I'd ship the Big Gay Ice Cream Truck (NYC) over to SF and see what sort of wacky ice cream magic these two can create together!!  Let's pass around a collection jar.  Who's with me??
author: Joan C.

description:
the ice cream: 4 stars.  pretty good, interesting flavors but servings are a little small.

the wait in line: negative billion stars. we spent more than an hour of our sunday in this beast.

the name of the place: 1 star.  clever, a name no one can seem to pronounce correctly!


i had a cone with black sesame and the secret breakfast. i dont see what was so secret though... everyone has bourbon for breakfast.

black sesame tasted like.. well, an asain black sesame ball.  except i was hoping the color was going to be completely black - it was white with speckles.  how much cooler would BLACK ICE CREAM have been?!

the gf thought both of mine were disgusting, but i wouldnt trust her stupid opinion... she had vanilla and malted dulce de leche (booorrrriiiiiiing)

i'd probably come back if the line weren't so long.  so i guess i wont be coming back...
they are victims of their own success!!
author: eric f.

description: In the ice cream wars, I think HS is 3rd (#1: bi-rite, #2 mitchells).  Had the Vietnamese Coffee but it left a weird coating on my tongue which was neither ice cream or coffee.  The special breakfast was tasty.  HS isn't as creamy as Bi-rite but the flavor choices are great.
author: Sheetal S.

description:
Who loves indulgent, adult-driven ice cream?  I do!  I do!  My girlfriends and I had the brilliant idea of entertaining our ice cream fix at Humphry's...wow...it's difinitely Eclectic San Francisco at its best!  
The variety of choices available are impressive...not necessarily always "good" impressive, especially with all the um..."different" flavors to try.  
My favorite was the Secret Breakfast...what a way to wake up in the morning, the afternoon...well hell...even at night!  I'm not big on bourbon, but it actually was really good.  It's a toss up of either the Secret Breakfast (#45 on 7X7's Must Eat...) or the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee as my favorite.  I think I'll take the Secret Breakfast for originality but BBVC for the strong and bold coffee flavor.
The Olive Oil was pretty good, too...with the orange zest sprinkled in, it tasted like an orange creamsicle, reminiscent of the popsicles we used to have back in the day...I definitely would not recommend the smoke salted chocolate...try it?  Yes.  Get a scoop of it?  No.  
I'm a fan...AND I definitely will never forget my de-virginized Humphry's moment with Row and Veronica!
author: Jennifer L.

description:
Literally the best ice cream I have ever had, sorry Bi-Rite. Secret Breakfast- who knew an ice cream could satisfy my deep love of booze and breakfast cereals. 

Great atmosphere and super nice staff too!
author: Alexandra S.

description: Came in right before a huge crowd, so I didn't have to wait too long. The flavors are inventive. I got a beer flavor of the week which was great, but then again its beer how can it not be good. Its out of the way, but when I'm in the neighborhood, and the line is bearable I'll try some more flavors. Til then I'll stick to Swensen's for my daily dose of ice cream.
author: Trang P.

description:
Sure, everyone compares Humphry to Bi-Rite. Does it really matter which is slightly better when you're standing right in front of Humphry Slocombe?

Read everyone's reviews- the ice cream is interesting and great. Absolutely worth going to.
author: Dan k.

description: Mmmmm.  With weird flavor names like Secret Breakfast & Jesus Juice and weird flavors like Salt & Pepper...I'm in love.  Even if I did get the malted chocolate which kinda felt like a pussy move but whatever.  I wanted chocolate.  I also wanted to taste every flavor but felt like a dork asking for too many.  Guess I'll have to return soon.  :)
author: Emily T.

description:
Just went to Humphry Slocombe today. The shop was empty, but their cartons of ice cream were full, the service was friendly and helpful, and I got to sample as many flavors as I liked!
I had the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Iced Coffee and the Secret Breakfast (shh) in a small cup. It was delicious! My best friend got the Valrhona Fudgesicle and the Secret Breakfast (shh), and since her cup was empty and her face was smiling, I guess it went over pretty well.
Bonus points for using metal spoons for tasting, compostable cups and flatware, and offering free water in a BEAUTIFUL pitcher near the door.
