All in all, I was pleased. It's places like this that make me sad I live all the way out in the Inner Sunset, but then I remember I'll be moving soon.
author: Colleen M.

description: Saw them on TV, so had to go check them out. And they did not disappoint. Debated two flavors beet and hibiscus or the jesus juice (coke and red wine)  flavors. In the end chickened out and got the ancho chocolate and malted dulce leche. Sorry Prestons, but OMG! top notch creamery. This is sweet tooth snobbery at its finest.
author: Chris W.

description:
There is the friendliest gentleman behind the counter ever, who was very kind in letting everybody try practically every ice cream behind the counter before buying anything. Of course, this causes the line to hardly ever budge.

The flavors are unique and exotic, and to be honest, most I didn't care for because they are so unusual.  I found the "Secret Breakfast" to be the best by far, and I'll definitely return for that one. 

It's better than Mitchell's, but not quite as good as Bi-Rite. Yet.
author: Adam Z.

description: Finally got a chance to check this place out. The girl working there asked me of it was my first time and after responding with a yes she grab a bunch  of taster spoons and started making me try all the flavors. I settled with secret breakfast and guinness gingerbread. If I could have a scoop if them all I would have :)
author: Lillian B.

description: If you're looking for standard flavors like cookies and cream, mint chocolate chip, etc, then you've probably come to the wrong place. This place makes their own original flavors with quirky names like "Jesus Juice." You may not like everything you have here, but you may find something you like that you just can't find anywhere else. I tried 2 flavors: "Secret breakfast" and Peanut butter curry (okay not all the names are quirky). I thoroughly enjoyed the secret breakfast (rum ice cream and corn flake pieces). The taste of the rum was pretty strong--it was definitely there. The strong rum flavor helped to cut through the richness of the ice cream and the corn flakes added a nice crunch. The peanut butter curry was a little too unconventional for me, but maybe not for others. I generally am not a fan of salty/sweet combinations in desserts ala, salted caramel. But for those that do, this might actually be an enjoyable flavor. To each, his or her own. But all in all, I thought the quality of the product was pretty good, and the originality of the flavors is worth at least a try.
author: Eugene C.

description: This was amazing ice cream people!  When it comes to ice cream I am generally unimpressed - it's cold, sugary and mostly too creamy, but this ice cream had real flavor!  I had the Candied Ginger paired with the Black Sesame - hello delicious.  The ginger scoop was bursting with ginger flavor and then every few bites I had bits of course salt that made for a real treat.  The sesame was good - very good, but put the two together and enjoy!
author: Beth W.

description:
Part 1 of 2 of the ice cream tour in SF: Humphry Slocombe

One word to describe Humphry Slocombe: Meh

Pro:

- Decent wait
- Pretty cool ambiance
- Interesting flavors (ie: Jesus Juice, Peanut Butter Curry)
- Fairly cheap (1 scoop $3.25)

Con:

- I was not impressed with any of the flavors here, including the famous Secret Breakfast. It was just so-so for me.
- Most of the flavors were quite dominating, (ie: Balsamic Caramel). I usually like caramel and balsamic vinegar, but I didn't quite care for the mix as the ice cream was way too sour. I also had a taste of the Jesus Juice (wine + coke) and it was just OK. as were Miso Peach, and a cinnamon based ice cream.

Based on flavors, I'd say Humphry Slocombe is more of a 2.5 stars, but I do like the various flavors that they offer and I'm still intrigued with a few flavors that were not available when I went last week. However, when I tasted a few of the flavors, there weren't any that stood out as a must try, in fact, I had a hard time picking out the 2nd flavor that went along with my Secret Breakfast. Not because there were so many flavors I wanted, it was sadly the opposite. With Scoops in LA and Bi Rite in San Francisco, these are much better choices for your ice cream cravings. Unfortunately, I think Humphry Slocombe is quite average, if not just overrated.
author: Danny C.

description: When I heard that there was an ice cream shop that rivaled Birite, I know I had to try it out. The area was sketchy looking and yet there was a line down the block....always a good sign! By the time we made it up to the counter, I knew it was going to be well worth the wait. The secret breakfast is now one of my favorite flavors ever. I also had the fluffer nutter, which was delicious and my boyfriend had the coffee flavor. The coffee was made using Blue Bottle coffee. It was delicious, I could get into having that for breakfast. The one downside of Humphry Slocombe was that they were limited on flavors that I wanted to try. The flavors that we did try were delicious, but I have found coffee or peanut butter ice cream aren't overly unique. I have to say that in the end I still prefer Birite due to that, but Humphry Slocombe is a close second and I  have been craving the secret breakfast ever since I left.
author: Kari G.

description:
At first I was skeptical.  I like my old fashioned ice cream flavors and really, I'm not a huge fan of things like Olive Oil, miso, and some of their other flavors in real life, so I walked in just hoping to find something I would like.

We walk in and all of the choices are "odd" - so we tried almost every flavor.  The staff was great!  They are obviously used to people tasting lots of the flavors, and even though it was really busy (it was a 90-degree day), they were patient, friendly and helpful.;

Most of the flavors were amazing and surprising.  Tasty and (I keep using this word, but...) surprising. 

The best part is that its kind of a total adventure to make your way out to this great neighborhood on a sunny day and try to determine what whacky flavor of ice cream you're going to get.

If you're not adventurous, you may not like it.  There's nothing wrong with that.  But if you want a new experience that's relatively inexpensive and very San Francisco - definitely check it out.
author: Daniel H.

description:
Really different, and really good ice cream.

Humphrey Slocombe makes some of the most interesting (and tasty) ice cream I've tasted.  I wasn't expecting to like the Surprise Breakfast, but the combination of the breakfast cereal crunch with the bourbon aftertaste was surprisingly good.  The "Blue Bottle Vietnamese coffee" was really tasty, but kinda plain next to the other creative stuff on the menu.  The "Guiness ginger bread" was great - another weird pairing that seemed to work well.

They were super friendly, the place looks very clean and well designed.

It won't be long til they have super long Bi-Rite-esque lines down the sidewalk...  I'm sure it already happens at times.

Totally a great addition to the hood.  Big thumbs up!
author: Jon B.

description: San fran is a city with many boutique ice cream shops.  The collaboration with Boccolone to create a prosciutto ice cream is ingenious.  Every day at humphry's there are new flavors to try, the only constant is the secret breakfast.  For me this was a must, it is bourbon ice cream with pieces of a cornflake cookie running throughout it.  It was delicious, the bourbon wasnt so strong, you tasted it more on the back end. The cornflake was good, it stayed crisp, while some add ins generally become soggy.  Another collaboration was with a local favourite, Blue Bottle Coffee.  Sometimes coffee flavoured ice cream taste artificial, but this was probably th best coffee ice cream i have had.  That paired with the secret breakfast was perfect.  As good as the flavours were, they lose points for the texture, it tasted slightly melted, and didnt hold its shape.  My sis had the Harvey Milk, along with the Jesus Juice.  She loved the creaminess of the Harvey Milk, but the Jesus Juice should not have been served.  It was along the bottom of the pail, and right after hers was scooped, the bucket was pitched.  It was gummy and not appealing.  Overall, very popular place for an icy treat, and i love the creative flavours, will definitely be back.
author: Amy D.

description: Secret Breakfast is the best thing that has ever touched my taste buds, no other ice cream compares.
author: Mimi X.

description: As far as quality of ice cream flavors go, this place takes the cake.  They have such unique flavors and all of them are delicious.  Hearing all the hoopla about the Secret Breakfast I still would have never thought it could be that good, but it is amazing.  As long as you don't mind the taste of alcohol, you have to try it.  Next time I'm in SF, I'll definitely be back!
author: Bubba B.

description:
My friend has been raving about this place for weeks and she swore up and down it was better than Bi-Rite..and I think she's right!  Usually, I stay away from chocolate ice cream (except rocky road), but was pretty impressed by the richness (and not too sweet) of the dark fudge.  I was told that the balsamic caramel was a good pairing with the fudge, but I found the caramel waaaaay too sweet for me.  The Vietnamese coffee flavor was perfect, semisweet and bitter with the ahh so yummy coffee taste.  

Other flavors I tried from my friends scoops:
Olive Oil - to my surprise it wasn't that bad..Still not my favorite.
Gingerbread Guinness - Pretty good.  I didn't taste much Guinness, but maybe it was suppose to be a faint flavor of Guinness? 
Honey Thyme - Pretty good, but a bit sweet after a while.
Secret Breakfast - Pretty damn good, i have to get it next time!

All this place needs is balsamic strawberry that's more yummy than bi-rite's and it would absolutely be better!
author: Dee S.

description:
siamese baby cow taxidermy on the wall? check
whimsical andy warhol spoof on the other wall? check check
hipsters asking hard hitting questions like "what is cool" when asked whether they want a cone or cup (duh dude your shaggy prince valiant is getting in the way of good horse sense. cone is clearly the most boss) check check check

i hate to be beleaguered about ice cream joints because i basically live for them, but it's starting to feel a little like i'm a junkie. i am one ice cream place short of carrying my own baby spoon and wee sanitizer.

1. delicious ice cream. 
2. i got the secret breakfast which was cornflakes and burbon (my hot redheaded date went for broke and got fudge drizzled on hers. wild thang!)
3. it tasted like sometimes mommy drinks and does MDMA at the same time
author: Alysia A.

description: This place is incredible!!! Who ever heard of salty licorice ice-cream? I. Have and it is amazing at this place! All of the flavors are incredible. Very similar to your favorite restaurant that you can order anything on the menu and it is amazing!
author: Elizabeth R.

description: creative flavors.. but need to be consistent on ice cream consistency most especially when alcohol is used. Its the true test for ice cream makers - on how proportions can change the end result.. but A for creativity. C for consistency.
author: Mark R.

description:
yes, yes i will give you four stars for awesomeness. 

i had three types of ice cream as well as a bunch of cute little samples (which, might i add, they use real metal spoons for ya).

thai chili lime sorbet was awesome. so was the peanut butter curry. the candy cap (mushroom ice cream) sort of did not have any flavour really.  the ancho chocolate, i sort of wished had more oomph of spice to it.  the secret breakfast (bourbon and frosted flakes) was scrumptious, with its balles of flakes and tasty bourbon flavour.  the cream cheese was nice too.

they also had flavours like olive oil, and i hope to come back when they have things like foie gras and salted caramel.

it's kinda cool- as you're in line, they're changing flavours, so you really never know what you're gonna get.

awesomeness. :)
author: Tracy L.

description: Walked over here after eating at El Metate based on the raves of someone in the group. Got a scoop of the Breakfast Special, was quite delicious. Lots of great creative flavors like Blue Bottle Vietnamese coffee, Coconut Sherbert, etc.  Cash only and rather small inside.
author: Ryan D.

description:
humphrey slocombe's might have found the only way i could care about the royal wedding - by offering a menu celebrating british desserts like strawberry meringue, butter beer and spotted dick.  delicious stuff and the kind of crazy variety that you expect at such a place.

a cucumber ice cream and shortbread sandwich was lighter, at least in flavor, and not overly sweet.

credit them too with very affordable prices and fun staff.
author: Justin B.

description: Worth the wait. Try the Magnolia Stout. Surprising delicious... im not a fan of stout.
author: Do L.

description: I like coming here for a taste of something different. The Secret Breakfast does it for me all the time. My sis told me about this place when they opened a few years back and have been coming here since; so if you are in the mood for something cold yet unique and pretty darn good,  give this place a shot.
author: Dennes H.

description: i'm sorry Bi Rite.
author: Susy C.

description:
All I can say is, sample the flavors before getting a cone. On that note, DEFINITELY sample the flavors before getting a pint (I didn't break this rule, I swear).

Good: 
- Fudgesicle for the chocolate lover. Chocolate ice cream tends to be a hit or miss with me, but Humphry Slocombe's Fudgsicle flavor is second only to Bi-Rite's chocolate soy flavor.
- Lemon, which is a rich and perfectly smooth sorbet. Good stuff.

???: 
- Jesus Juice
- Thai Chili

H.S. is a pint-sized shop with a comfortable ambience. Not much sitting space inside, but the tables and benches right out the door are awesome in warm weather (must make for an efficient business setup..). It's a good place to take a friend who wants a flavor of San Francisco's eccentricity, but it wouldn't be a go-to ice cream place for me.
author: Anita L.

description: this place is pretty small but it has a lot of unique different flavors of ice cream like secret breakfast, balsamic caramel, oolong tea, etc. i highly recommand their balsamic caramel ice cream.
author: Jenny H.

description:
When I was a kid (i.e. until a month ago) I didn't understand why anyone ate any ice cream flavor other than chocolate.  Occasionally I would try to be adventurous and would get double chocolate or chocolate chocolate chip ice cream, but that's as far as I would venture.  Humphry Slocombe has expanded my horizons.  I now refuse to eat any ice cream but their Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee Ice Cream.  Freakin' amazing. 

(ok, I am lying.  I still eat chocolate ice cream but that's only because Humphry Slocombe isn't open 24 hours a day.)
author: beth m.

description:
So many choices. Good thing for a reasonable $3.50 you get two generous scoops. Mixing and matching is encouraged. The secret breakfast delivers on the hype (as in amazing), and I also really enjoyed the fudgesicle sorbet.

It very well could have been the dancing induced hunger after six hours at ETD Pop, but this was the perfect snack once I got home.
author: Jason B.

description: The day I came I was not impressed with the flavor selection. Tried three different kinds: run raisin, Tahitian vanilla, and something else I don't remember. All were just okay. I actually sampled a Vietnamese coffee flavor and olive oil, I should have ordered the olive oil one I think. There was a line so people definitely enjoy this place. I guess it is just not for this ice cream lover - but I am particular about my ice cream
author: erika e.

description: So I am eating this as I type...WOOOOO-WEEEEEEE! This is good stuff! I will admit that I have never been inside of this place so I cannot account for its decor, service, etc...but my co-worker brought some of their product (ice cream) back for me to devour. And I love it!!! So good! I'm eating Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee & Secret Breakfast ice cream. Apparently they are into the unconventional. You vanilla types beware! The Secret Breakfast has some booze in it. Yay! A way to sneak in my daily alcohol intake. What a treat this was...my two scoops are gone now. I am currently licking the bowl.
author: Rachel W.

description: 4.5....deeeeeliscious!  Not only is the ice cream amazing, but the duck fat pecan pie was out...of...this.,..world.    Heated it up at home and smothered it with a scoop of malted chocolate frozen love!
author: Brye L.

description: Creative ice cream concepts (one example is the bourbon- corn flakes mix). Really, really, really, good.
author: blake s.

description: omg this place serves up some inventive and mighty delicious ice cream! They only had about 8 flavors, but each one was calling my name. I decided on a sample taste of Secret Breakfast, and then ordered 2 scoops of Balsamic Caramel and Oolong. SO GOOD. I tried my friend's brown butter and vietnamese blue bottle coffee. YUM! The ice cream here is so creamy and has such intense flavors. I will definitely come back again, and again....
author: Carol L.

description: Good stuff all around. Cool kids making it happen on their terms and serving some freaky, yet tasty, treats. I wish they would make more chocolate based flavors but I could say the same for the entire city of San Francisco.
author: Selino V.

description:
Brought some out of towners here once.  They were freaked out by the inventive and unusual flavors.  The guy at the counter went to the back and got them some vanilla with nary a sneer or an eye roll despite the fact that it probably went against everything he stood for as a Slocombe employee.  That's some good service. 

Not all the flavors I've tried here were ones I'd order again, but it's always a fun adventure.
author: saru k.

description: I really didn't know of this place until I saw the line around the block on the day of the Food Festival back in August. A line that long around the block is a sure sign of something that must be good...so that was when I've got this placed bookmarked and I'm glad I had finally tried it. Similar to Bi-Rite's, they had their little creations of flavors. They all seem so interesting that it was sucha tough choice to pick just one. Which means that this is another one of those places that's require me to go back many times to get a decent load of their selections. Anyhow, we went on a Friday night around 8pm thinking that parking will be a pain but it wasn't bad at all. We were able to park a block awhile within just five minutes of looking. We got there, stared at the many unique flavors in confusion for a bit...tried a couple and I settled with "Elvis: The Fat Years". I think it was more of the name that attracted me to the flavor than anything...I found it really cute...heehee. The flavors of Elvis consisted of bananas, bacon, and peanut brittle. It was a pretty cool combo with bacon. I am typically not a bacon fan but ever since I had tried Dynamo's crunchy bacon-bits on a donut, I have been sold to try bacon with other types of sweets. In this case, my ice-cream. I was expecting the ice-cream to be more of a banana tasted to it, but instead it was more like peanut butter ice cream...I think the peanut brittle really overpowered the taste of the bananas. There were chunks and bits of peanut brittle in the ice -cream, so that was yummy. However, not much bacon...only a few pieces here and there...I was barely able to taste it. It was almost as if it didn't made a difference if it was in the ice-cream or not. It's not bad though overall, but just didn't deliver the same amount of excitement as it did when I saw it's name. My friend that was with me was a bit daring...he didn't sample any of the ice-cream flavors. Instead, he asked the server what was their most popular flavor and just took that. He ended up with "Secret Breakfast", which was made with bourbon and cornflakes. Interesting. Not knowing what was in his ice-cream at the time, I took a spoonful and tried it. My first impression was like ewww...why the hell does this taste like really strong alcohol?? I was expected something sweet, so this took me by surprise a bit. I am really sensitive to the taste of dark liquor so immediately I knew there was something unusual to it. When I was told it was bourbon, in my head, i was like...of course it had to be whiskey...nasty. I didn't try any of the cornflakes in it...I didn't want to. That bourbon flavor in the ice-cream was so intense...like BAM! I did have a second spoonful of it a little while later to be fair and I still didn't like it. I guess I really prefer my alkie and sweets separate. I can see how other ppl that does like it though...it's very tasteful indeed. There will definitely be next time...perhaps for their Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee...
author: Winnie L.

description:
ok, they get props for being creative. But don't come here wanting what you think of as ice-cream. It's good in that it's fresh and super creamy and all that but the flavors just didn't do it for me. Like half of each combo was something that was supposed to be good mixed with something that is supposed to be part of dinner. I get it - sweet and savory go together often but not on my ice cream cone! Sweet - maybe sour - but no savory on my ice cream cone ok? 
Peanut butter (yum, my favorite) with curry - What? on a cone? Curry? No thanks, i'll keep that to my thai food. 
Or pig parts?! On my cone!? No way. 
I got the secret breakfast without tasting it first because it was on my mission list of the 100 top eats and i was hoping i would not be let down. 
i was not let down, thank goodness it was good. I really did like it, but really all this hype? I know i know, cereal and bourbon is unique so yes it's different. But am I crazy or does it just taste like a rich vanilla? 
So, I'm not knocking it, it fills a spot in a weird ice cream world. But I don't think I'll ever get a craving for what they've got.
author: Audrey V.

description:
how they make ice cream flavors the way they do is beyond me, but i'm not complaining.  the flavors are so original and flavorful.  the gal at the counter was patient enough to let me try many tasters, and i was able to narrow down my options.  she let me choose two flavors for my to-go pint, and i went with the smoked chocolate and sea salt and the blue bottle vietnamese coffee. both flavors were sinfully divine, and made for a wonderful dessert after a couple of our meals.

i wouldn't be the biggest ice cream fan, but with these flavors i've become a huge fan of HS.
author: Sheri N.

description: Sampled their olive oil ice cream .. it had a weird taste to it .. the cinnamon brittle was too sweet.  I ended up sticking to a favorite of mine, Vietnamese coffee!! YUMMMM!!!
author: Jen P.

description: Not a big fan of ice cream and this place didn't change my status. Sure they have strange flavors, but I ended up with the common Blue Bottle Vietnamese coffee flavor, which seems to be the most popular there. I think it tastes delicious, but you can get the same flavor from Starbucks ice cream "coffee" flavor in grocery stores. The ice cream portions are WONDERFUL! One scoop (kid size) is just perfect. The service is good too-- very patient as you are standing there holding up the line trying out each of the flavors.
author: Lisa T.

description: So I finally got the chance to try Humphry- EHHhh.. it was okay. Expect to wait in line for at least 20 minutes. I tried their popular flavor, secret breakfast- it's heavy in bourbon and rich, when I say heavy I mean HEAVY like you can smell your breath bourbon heavy. It has some clusters of crunchy flakes? If you like whiskey you'll love this ice cream. A lot of people seem to like it, but it's just not my cup of tea. I also tried the black sesame, which was pretty good.  I would say compared to the other popular creamery, Humphry is definitely cheaper, offer some pretty interesting sundae concoctions and scoop hefty portions! BUT they don't offer as many flavors as I had hoped for. Most of the flavors available were the rich, heavy creamy type and one tart. I'm assuming the flavors change quite often because based on the reviews I couldn't find a lot of the flavors that were mentioned here. Sorry but BR is still my fave.
author: Kim R.

description:
they have all sorts of flavors which is pretty cool. 

However, i found their ice cream to be way too creamy/thick. i have a hard time finishing a small cup of it. Maybe is the wrong flavors. i tried their secret breakfast, balsamic caramel, coffee ice cream. but not a single one i liked. 

i prefer bi-rite personally.
author: Catherine T.

description: Unique flavors, such as curry peanut butter, carrot mango sorbet, spicy red hot banana, etc. But it's one of those things that you have to try.
author: Ngo P.

description:
I was looking forward to bacon ice cream but they didn't have it.  But I love this place.  Their ice cream is so damn good.  I had secret breakfast, its has bourbon flavored  in it.  

definitely coming back for more.
author: food lover t.

description: Ice-cream heaven! Absolutely love their 'Secret Breakfast' (cornflakes and bourbon) and Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee flavors. Other cool flavors- red hot banana and olive oil.
author: Shweta V.

description:
The character "Louie" from MTV's The State (aka: best tv show evar) always wanted to dip his balls* into something every time he was with a group of people. If I were Louie, I'd definitely dip my balls into a cup of Humphry Slocombe's ice cream. Imagine the ball-dipping possibilities of bourbon and cornflakes in the Secret Breakfast or olive oil flavored ice cream...talk about a taste bud adventure! But truth be told, after sampling a bit of Peanut Butter Curry (tasted like peanut sauce but with creamy curry sweetness), I ordered a small cup of Balsamic Caramel and Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee (I nixed the opportunity to sample the salt and pepper, but I'm sure they're ball-dipping worthy too). The ice creams were outstanding, you can really taste the caramel and the tanginess of the balsamic and the vietnamese coffee really does give you that coffee aftertaste in your mouth. Definitely glad to finally have tasted this stuff!

*ahem. they're not THOSE kinds of balls, in case you were wondering...though I guess it wouldn't make a different either way!

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gR1hI_Ikuv8
author: kristin e.

description: I was pleasantly surprised by the Secret Breakfast. Cornflakes in ice cream seemed like a desperate move, but it was well-executed. The cornflakes didn't actually look like cornflakes at all, but looked and tasted more like granola or candied nut clusters. The bourbon worked well. It perfumed the ice cream with a nice flavor. The ice cream was a little on the sweet side, but still tolerable.
author: Michael F.

description:
Order the Hot Mess sundae and substitute vanilla for Secret Breakfast. This is officially my favorite new bad habit. My husband had the Tin Roof sundae and it was also delicious.

I can't wait to go back and have another sundae. The service is excellent and  friendly. They are happy to let you try multiple flavors.

Hurry up and get over there before the line gets too long!
author: melissa n.

description:
Another rave review.   Only the location will keep me from being a regular.

The staff was so lovely - encouraging me to try every flavor.  Good thing there were only about ten - any more and the decision making would have been too difficult.

Yes, these are unusual flavors, but they do carry a just plain vanilla and the yogurt flavor was also "normal" so don't be afraid to take kids or unadventurous friends.
author: Bay G.

description:
Although my review might be a bit premature (they aren't offering all flavors they intend to offer yet ) Humphry Slocombe is a winner. There are ten or so flavors currently available that the friendly staff is more than willing to offer samples of. 

The Blue Bottle Vietnamese coffee flavor is a promising upstart compared to the incumbent Ritual coffee toffee offered at Bi-Rite creamery. Secret breakfast is an ambitious bourbon and corn flakes flavor; it tastes like a bartender at Phone Booth poured a few shots of Maker's Mark in the mix. The corn flakes are an appropriate crunchy addition. 

The Thai chili lime sorbet and caramel balsamic are worth a try. I don't think that the olive oil flavor is quite there yet as the consistency was off and it didn't feel cold enough.

The great flavors, friendly demeanor of the staff and location leads me to believe that Humphry Slocombe will become a neighborhood institution. It's well worth a visit and I only expect it to be an even more worthwhile ice cream destination once the full flavor line is available.
author: Adam L.

description:
If ever a place needed 4.5 rather than 5 stars or 4, this would be the place. 

the ice cream is quite good...I had the coffee, the secret breakfast, and the proscuitto...very good..

Ice cream was served too cold, so flavors didnt come thru as much as expected.

I expected I would prefer this place to Bi-Rite, but I think Bi-Rite is substantially better. Hence the 4.5 or 4 stars here.
author: J M.

description:
It was Sunday afternoon and we were looking for ice cream place. We decided to go and try Humphry ice cream. Shortly, we arrived at the place, a few line and we got our turn! The server was so friendly and we tried some of the ice cream! 
I tried:
-blue bottle Vietnamese coffee, if you ever drink Vietnamese coffee then this is a ice cream version
-jesus juice, tastes like cola and wine
I ended up getting the secret breakfast (didn't even have to try it), I love the Secret Breakfast and blue bottle coffee.  It was a pretty good combination. I would back to Humphry for their Secret Breakfast! My friend bought the fluffernutter, it was good too. But personally, I prefer Bi-Rite though..lol..
author: Immanuel L.

description: We all know i'm an ice cream whore.  Don't know why it's taken me so long to try this place, but I finally did the other day on my birthday.  We had the two most yelped flavors :)  the vietnamese coffee and the secret breakfast.  The flavors were awesome and I had no idea how good burbon flavored ice cream would be, but for me and my hubby we felt the ice cream there was just too sweet.  Hard to find parking around that area too.  But, I'm giving the place 4 stars for awesome creative, tasty flavors and for the price.  For 2 huge scoops of ice cream, it's only about $3!  can't beat that!
author: Sharon T.

description:
One of our favourite places to bring out of towners for dessert. Great and innovative flavour combinations keep bringing us back; my favourite was a salt and chocolate combo, and second was a melon with cayenne.  A trifle sweet, but prices are decent, and it's REALLY tasty.

One caveat - I don't know where they hire their staff, but man, they are some of the least customer-service oriented people I've ever met.  They are seriously poker-faced, bored by having to work, and the sighs and rolling eyeballs when asked questions are a bit much.  Lose the attitude, folks.

Also, post somewhere, please, that you are cash only.  We forget every now and then, and have to rustle up cash when we could easily bring it with us.
author: R.B. W.

description:
Humphry Slocombe prides itself on unique ice cream flavors, like McEvoy Olive Oil and Salt & Pepper. If you're looking for vanilla or rocky road, you're better off going to Baskin-Robbins.

I had a single cup with two flavors: Secret Breakfast and Blue Bottle Vietnamese coffee. I have to admit, when I had my first spoonful of the Secret Breakfast, I didn't see what the big deal was. However, as time went on, Secret Breakfast grew on me: the tastes of bourbon + corn flakes surprisingly go well together. By the end, I was craving more.

As for the Vietnamese coffee flavor, it tasted bitter, like black coffee. Whenever I drink Vietnamese coffee, I always think of something sweet...so I didn't think the ice cream flavor reflected the taste of actual Vietnamese coffee. I also felt the coffee taste was really strong, which could be bad or good depending on how much you like coffee.

Mitchell's is still my favorite ice cream place in SF. However, HS is worth a try and reminds me of Bi-Rite in terms of their flavor variety and taste.
author: Christine T.

description: Omg. Gabba Gabba Hey sundae is so tasty! Amarena cherries are awesome.
author: Davis V.

description: Olive oil ice cream! YES!!! Blue Bottle Vietnamese coffee! AWESOME!!!!! Ancho chocolate! BWAAAHHHHHH!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
author: Andrew F.

description: These guys do Ice Cream like no others.  Yes, its very sweet, but amazing at the same time.  Incredible diversity of flavors.  Best in the city.
author: Roberta W.

description:
ohhh how i love to be the one coming up with the flavors at this place... Fernet-Branca flavor anyone?

i tried samples of everything they had (and they were cool with that) - from brown butta, olive oil, salt and pepper to secret breakfast with bourbon and cornflakes - and i decided on the vietnamese coffee... bf and i shared the small cup and it was a just the right amount for après dinner delight. 

i will definitely have to check back for some more unique flavors.
author: Dot K.

description: I came in and I thought I wanted the salted caramel.  The girl at the counter insisted that I test taste first.  She said it was really strong and I might not like it.  I test tasted it and she was right. it was a bit strong and that was not what I was looking for at that moment.  Good nevertheless.  I also tried the secret breakfast.  that was good too! I eventually ended with the gingerbread one.  Maybe it was christmas eve, but that def. hit the spot.   I will def. come back, except that I think I like Bi-Rite just a bit more.
author: AhLin C.

description: Deliciousness.  Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee ice cream with almond crunch on top.  Get it.  I went around 8 pm on a Sat night and the line was pretty short (I didn't realize they were mentioned in the Times until afterwards).  Friendly, patient service, very decent prices.  A win-win!
author: Karen C.

description: Peanut Butter and Curry Icecream! Amazing! Enough said.
author: Katie S.

description: This place has fantastic and very creative ice creams, and consistently superb service. I'm very lucky to have it in my neighborhood.
author: Jen O.

description: Nothing special and certainly not worth the 20 minute wait.  I guess it's worth a try.  The kids working the counter were very nice and tried to move the line along rapidly but the ice cream was just "eh".
author: L M.

description: I like my Secret Breakfast with Blue Bottle Coffee, mmmmmmm!!!!!!!!!!
author: Aaron I.

description:
while the flavor combos *are* interesting, they don't have the basics down.  the ice cream is inconsistent in texture, and is icy.  

learn to walk before you run.  after the novelty wears off, the flavor isn't enough to support the price.

back to bi-rite for me...
author: Dora F.

description: I can't pickkkkk.... After some solid thought I went with secret breakfast because well, it was that good. I'm not an alcoholic and that was my first taste of bourbon. I'm aware bourbon may not always be this delicious but if it did, I'd be an addict. And I always like texture in my ice cream so the cornflakes, perfect. Also to note, the bacon peanut brittle was fantastic. I don't think they always have it but if you see it, get it. Bacon? Peanut brittle? Yes, please!
author: Anna H.

description: I want to love this place and the take on flavors... I love its location, and I try not to let the snobbery of much of its fan base make me hate it ( ok I admit it loses a star just for them)... you know who you are!... but overall the flavors are great and creative ...
author: Ricote F.

description: I love the Secret Breakfast, bourbon flavored ice cream with cornflakes.  If you need a Secret Breakfast fix but can't get to 24th and Harrison, get a pint  of  Haagen Daaz Rum Raisin.  Tastes very similar.
author: Wakako U.

description:
let me start by saying that i was dead set on coming here. 
actually, i kept waiting for the opportunity and the entire day today, I just couldn't get it out of my mind, so right after Pride09 I sped my bike over, ran inside and was so enthusiastic that I was unable to decide on two flavors and therefore took three.

And what a disappointment. 

A. what's up with the amount of sugar they are using? It's as though they are embarrassed in their own selection of flavors and so they cover everything up with sugar coating. For example, the Balsamic Caramel tasted like sugar cotton wool. You would think it would taste of Caramel and Balsamic vinegar, right? Then no.
B. the people working there weren't nice, and trust me, I was acting like a person who is about to have ice-cream. I.e., I was a sweetheart... 

I really have no idea why people like this place so much.
author: tal n.

description: Secret Breakfast + Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee = Happy Me.  I heart the corn flakes in my ice cream and the explosion of coffee flavor is amazing.
author: Nina L.

description: When lost in SF on a sweltering summer day, you think to yourself gosh in a city with innovation there must be something thats unheard of and tasty, to fit that lifestyle. Humphry Slocombe fulfills that interesting taste you have been craving for with flavors that fancy you and flavors that might even disgust but trust me give it a try and you won't regret it. I found this place when getting lost on the scenic drive in san fran, just as a friend had text me about this place i passed right by it and was like lets give this a try. I was eager to try Vietnamese Coffee, being from SoCal near little saigon i just had to compare. What I tried was purely remarkable in terms of how the ice cream was done. Ice cream comes in quite soft not super soft but firm enough to lick with ease and having tried pepper and sesame and a couple of their flavors that sounded disgusting i was amazed, that they could taste so well done and flavorful. Humphry Slocombe I shall see you once i head back to SF
author: Melvin G.

description: blue bottle Vietnamese coffee and the breakfast surprise were both unique and good. wish i had tried more flavors. was very intrigued about some of the ice cream. i need to try more flavors when i come back. shop was very nice in a residential surrounding. enjoyed it.
author: Russell I.

description: I have been coming here ever since this place opened a few years ago- probably over 50 times.  I love ice cream and they are conveniently located in my neighborhood. But, I can honestly say, I keep coming here over Bi-Rite and Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous b/c Humphry Slocombe keeps knocking it out of the park time and time again. They keep bringing in new flavors, new ideas, and new textures. I have seen the same flavors at Bi-Rite over the years with little fluctuation in their variety ( I must admit I love Bi-Rite too, so Bi-Rite, step it up).  The hours at Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous make them very inconvenient, but they have some very creative flavors too. I love that Humphry has many sorbets- chili lime sorbet and chocolate fudge sorbet- both AH-MAZ-ING and diary free- I don't know how they do it.  Today I went in and they had a pale ale with orange sherbert- wow- it was like I was enjoying a beer with an orange slice on it. Another fav- Fluffernutter- (Project Open Hand Peanut butter with Marshmallow fluff). I am a fan of Eaton Mess too. In the summer- they have a Sweet Summer Corn too. All of it done so well. I have never been disappointed.
author: Anne B.

description: amazing! wow - never been so blown away by ice cream.
author: Abhi M.

description: Wow, talk about overrated!  This place may have a line out the door, but the ice cream here really isn't very tasty.  They have funky flavors like the "secret breakfast" (bourbon, corn flakes) and the balsamic caramel, but I guess there's a reason these flavors haven't hit the mainstream ice cream stores yet.  (Hint: It's because they are bad).  The only flavor we tried that was mildly tasty was the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee, and only because it just tastes like regular coffee ice cream.
author: Robyn F.

description: It's pretty far out and didn't quite meet up to expectations.  If you're all about original flavors, go.  But if you're looking for quality taste, I'd venture elsewhere.
author: Alice Y.

description: oh my! Humphrey is to icecream what an orgasm is to sex.  If you haven't tried Humph, how will you ever know!?  As a bona fide ice cream whore (with love and humor), THIS IS THE BEST ICE CREAM in the City.  One slight complaint:  I'm not down with pork with my cream, MANY others seem to love it.  With that (not so Kosher) caveat, try one, try all, and get down with your bad ass ice cream loving self at Humphrey Sloecombs with GOoD speed!
author: Alyssa B.

description: Peanut topping was way tooo salty
author: Vinod S.

description:
flavors here are actually perverse
makes me think of that amusement ride that pins fast and the bottom drops out and you feel like laughing, screaming and barfing all at once... then you want to do it again... 

my vote for a new flavor- fried eggplant cubes in a marscapone and parmesan ice cream
author: Sid V.

description: One thing I love about my husband is that he LOVES ice cream... when we were around the corner getting cookies at a bakery, I told him that there was an ice cream place near by that was raved about he was down to go in a heartbeat... and it was barely noon. lol.  It was already about 75 degrees in the city at noon so there was a little line going on for the place.  They definitely have very original flavors.  I decided to try the Secret Breakfast and Oolong and both were very good... I was skeptical about the Secret Breakfast... bourbon and cornflakes??  but it turned out to be SOOOO good!!  The hubby got the blue bottle and balsamic caramel which were also really good... he was satisfied and definitely loved their ice cream.  I had to use the restroom and they had one there that was actually pretty clean!  They also have vintage feminine product machine and condom machine in there that looked cool so I had to take a pix, haha.
author: Kymberli C.

description: They obviously don't need another review, but what's Yelp if not a place to put your bloggings that no one else really needs to read? I was prepared to be disappointed compared to BiRite, or ooged about by the weird flavors. But here's what it was: totally delciious ice cream, probably the best in the city.
author: Syd S.

description: Coming from Utah, I do net the opportunity to try many foods that are unique or bold. Of course, a trip to the Mission remedied this. I like Humphry Slocombe because of the bizarre but tasty flavors.
author: Michael G.

description: Since, I'm a big ice cream eater. I need the list for my back up, and this is my second choice.
author: Elisa C.

description:
OK, for the people who are checking out reviews of this place for the first time. You all will notice almost every single yelper said they love Secret Breakfast and Blue Bottle Viet Coffee. Well, I am gonna say this one more time:

I love Secret Breakfast and Blue Bottle Viet Coffee flavors!!

Alright kids, gear up, head to Humphry Slocombe, and try these two amazing flavors. You won't regret it.

Other flavors are also very unique and interesting, like the Olive Oil and candied ginger. I have only been there once, so I didn't try out all the flavors yet. But I am dying to try Oolong and Peanut Butter Curry.

A solid 5-star!
author: Samuel L.

description: LOVE LOVE LOVE this place!  It's addiction gone mad.  Know that once you take your first bite...you'll be coming back time and time again!
author: Jenny G.

description: Interesting flavors, to say the least.  Great for those that like to take their palettes on a roller coaster ride.  A few of the flavors are best left to sampling - peanut better curry, Jesus Juice (wine + Coke), while others are definitely worth scooping - Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee, Chocolate Smoked Sea Salt, McEvoy Olive Oil, Secret Breakfast (bourbon + cereal), Tahitian Vanilla.  Absolutely recommend trying some of the funkier flavors as they aren't always what you think they will be.  The staff there have tons of patience given the number of people that seem to want to try EVERY SINGLE FLAVOR.  Note that it's cash only and they close sharply at 9 pm.  No amount of begging, pleading, funny faces or puppy dog looks will get you in the door after they lock it.  Seating is available inside and outside.  Spoons, bowls and napkins are earth friendly.  The line moves pretty quickly so don't let that deter you.
author: Melissa L.

description:
Candied ginger that melts on your tongue....

I visited Humphry Slocombe on a cold rainy Sunday and was pleased with the warmth of both the inside climate and the friendly staff.  I was handed sample after sample and had to stop myself from trying every flavor!  The Slocombe ice cream fairies have found a way to make you crave crazy combinations, including all those foods that your mother wished you would like.
author: Heather H.

description: OMG! This place is so damn good that i nearly had an oral orgasm. All the flavors I tried were delicious and unique so it was hard making a selection but we opted for the brown butter and chocolate smoked sea salt. It's awesome by itself but so much better together. Love it!
author: Michelle B.

description: I love the the name, the font, and the art! I think I like the fun, hip aura more than the ice cream. Though the flavors were unique, exotic and tasted exactly as they're called, they were a bit too literal for me. After trying every single flavor (the scooper was so generous and nice), I just settled with the sorbet fudgsicle and wasn't disappointed. I usually rarely go with the vanilla or chocolate, but I didn't groove too well with the jesus wine nor secret breakfast. Even the "salt and pepper" tasted too salty and peppery (what else was I expecting?!). Hopefully they'll come out with some more flavors next time I swing by, although it is a little out of the way.
author: Hana J.

description: Parking is a bit hard to find, but they have pretty good ice cream here.  Unfortunately they didn'g have the BBC nor the salt & pepper that I wanted, so we had the special breakfast (good!), stout, and tahitian vanilla.  The special breakfast was pretty good, but the others were OK.  Cash only.
author: Durif M.

description:
Love it, great workers (especially Lydia), great ice cream. 
They don't seem to have my favorite very often -- an intense dark chocolate gelato or sorbetto. But I get by with a little help from my friends. Friends = Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee and a couple of other flavours. 
Don't let the lines discourage you. Go and enjoy. (And say hi to Lydia)
author: RE P.

description: Best ice bream I've ever had, hands down. Salt & Peppa rocked my world, and Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee was perfect.
author: Sassy B.

description:
I ended up here after seeing it on The Best Thing I Ever Ate, and then realizing that it was only a few blocks away from my new tutoring spot. So, after doing my good tutoring deed I rewarded myself with some ice cream. I'm going to go with 4 stars for now, but after I go back a few times, I may up it to 5. 

Today I tried Secret Breakfast (not going to lie, I was not feeling the alcoohl taste), malted dulche de leche (I probably wouldn't have enjoyed a whole scoop of it), and the cinnamon brittle! I decided on the cinnamon brittle! Each flavor was very creamy, but I especially liked the flavor of the cinnamon brittle, plus the crunch that it had... no need for toppings. 

Lucky for me I went on a Wednesday evening so there was no crowd. They have a few seats inside, some more outside, and then across the street there are some little bench things. I would say this place is a hidden gem because it is not on a main shopping/eating street, but seems like everyone has somehow found it! Hidden, but not secret. Can't wait until next time
author: Caitlin B.

description:
Loving the secret breakfest! The best ice cream I've tasted so far. It's no doubt that I will come back for this. It was actually a tv show on food network that made me come here for it. But the Thai chili killed it. Sorry but I hate the Thai chili flavor. I thought it might be that special so they didn't put it for tasting. 

You've been warned!
author: Jimmy T.

description: I've tried them all (I used to work in the ice cream biz) Best Ice cream place in San Francisco and I didn't even attempt to extort them for a discount in exchange for a good review.
author: Jason B.

description: Dear Jake and Sean.  It was awesome being your upstairs neighbor.  I'm glad your business has taken off and you have commanded the loyalty of the 24th and Harrison crowd.  I wish you the best in the years to come.  Also, your ice cream equals delicious.  -Chris
author: Chris C.

description: My friends and I made our way out to the Mission to get some ice cream here. It was around 6:45pm and there was a line coming out of the door. It must be really good since there was a long line! Made my way inside 5-10 minutes later and decided to order Secret Breakfast because of the reviews. Well... I didn't like it. The Bourbon was too strong for me. I literally felt like I was drinking it instead of like eating a hint of it. My friend ordered the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee, and it was really good! Very creamy, and you could've tasted the strong coffee taste with the condensed milk. Yum. I'll probably be back for other flavors, but Secret Breakfast was a no-go in my book.
author: Vivian L.

description: By far some of the best flavors of ice cream in the city. I've never waited in a long line either! Maybe I'm just not going on the weekend rush time. I love the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee and Secret Breakfast, but who doesn't? The sorbets are good too when you want to go easy on the cholesterol, I've had Cayenne Cantaloupe and Salted Watermelon. My ex-boyfriend lived around the corner from the place so we would often get ice cream and watch Mad Men, those were the days! :)
author: Delilah G.

description:
I was not even hungry when I made a trip down here, but the friendly scooper behind the counter kept giving me tastes until I relented.

Guinness Gingerbread + Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee = yum
Cream Cheese Chip + Balsamic Caramel = yum yum
Secret Breakfast (corn flakes + bourbon) + Red Hot Banana + Thai Chili Lime = so so (though Secret Breakfast was awesome)

Definitely going to go back to see if I can get the McEvoy Olive Oil or Sweet Corn - Blackberry.  And highly intrigued by Government Cheese.
author: carolyn c.

description: SECRET BREAKFAST!!! Amazing assortment of flavors at this hipster ice cream shop. The long line is worth the wait for flavors like root beer, thai spicy lime, and jesus juice. Humphry Slocombe has mastered the spicy ice cream, but I'm true fan of their Secret Breakfast flavor - Soco bourbon with corn flakes! yummy!!
author: Sara A.

description:
I have yet to taste a flavor here that I haven't enjoyed, but Secret Breakfast is still my favorite. 

The staff is always really friendly and helpful- regardless of how long the line can be.  I'm always curious what they are going to come up with next.
author: Kate O.

description: If Birite makes me play the Go Team in my head, well, then, Humphry Slocombe's is like turning up Joanna Newsom really loudly.  Yes, you're not quite sure what you're listening to, and whether it should really be listened to, but it tastes, uh, I mean, sounds so good.  Sure, people may complain about your preference, but do you care?  The answer is no.  Go eat their ice cream now.  I command it.
author: Leon K.

description: Yum Yum Yum!! Finally got to come and try the ice cream year after years if people telling me it was delicious. I got the secret breakfast and vietnamese blue bottle coffee. Both were delicious, but the secret breakfast was my favorite, for sure!! The taste of bourbon was perfect and the corn flakes added great texture/flavor! The ice cream was creamy and definitely tasted home made and fresh. I would recommend this place to anyone and is definitely a must go!
author: Conrad A.

description: They had Young's Double Chocolate Stout as a flavor!! I was so happy as it is my bf's favorite beverage of all freaking time.  My beloved was in heaven!!  He ate 3/4 of the pint!!!
author: Emily W.

description: Secret Breakfast. I purchased a tub of this and ate it with my friends...you can get drunk off Ice Cream, then really sick. Needless to say, Humphrey is the best Ice Cream in SF
author: Adam C.

description:
I wish I was more adventurous! I ended up getting Tahitian Vanilla and Malted Dulce de Leche. Both really good, but I chickened out last minute. Next time, I promise I'll be brave! 

Final Verdict: My shy-ass doesn't deserve to give a final verdict this time.
author: Dana F.

description:
Honestly I don't even want to review this place (or I could just give it a terrible review, which would be the ultimate untruth) because I would love for it to remain my little secret so that the lines never become like those of Mitchell's or BiRite. But as a loyal customer and huge Humphry Slocombe Ice Cream fanatic I believe I owe it to this little shoppe to give it the review it deserves. Humphry's has replaced Mitchell's and BiRite as my favorite ice cream place in all of San Francisco. Although they only have about 12 flavors a day, they rotate their flavors daily, and you are bound to find a surprisingly, extremely unique, yet oh so delicious flavor no matter what day you decide to drop by. The Olive Oil ice cream was simply lifechanging. I love Mediterranean food, but who thought the delightly smooth savory flavor of Olive Oil could be transformed into a deliciously sweet ice cream? This ice cream took on the most beautiful shade of yellowish cream, and it contained slivers of lemon and orange zest, the ultimate finish for this flavor. On the following day, I knew I had to return and see what was awaiting me. Cinnamon Brittle, once again, perfect. Just the right amount of kick from the cinnamon, crunchiness from the brittle, and creamy sweetness. The best part of this ice cream is that after you eat it, you do not feel like you need to spend hours and hours in the gym working it off (exercise? who does that?). It makes me feel young and hip, and like I can eat 1928012983 more. Perhaps it is just my stomach speaking.
For those who are into savory flavors, this is THE place to be. There is an extensive list of flavors on the website, among them salt and pepper, jalapeno strawberry, etc... Whatever floats your boat, Humphry's will have it. Now stay away from my favorite ice cream shoppe please, do NOT tell your friends about it or else the lines will stretch for miles throughout the lovely city of San Francisco.
author: Shawna C.

description: Vietnamese coffee was delish! Sampled some of the others and they were a little to wild for me
author: E T.

description:
I've only been here once, and that single isolated incident was a couple weeks ago, mind you, but I REMEMBERED, yes, I remembered to write a review...

Let me explain this through contrast: I recently visited Bi-Rite Creamery remembering that it was absolutely delicious, but as I licked my delectable two scoops of salted caramel and brown butter pecan ice cream, I couldn't help thinking about the scoop of chocolate that I'd enjoyed at Humphry Slocombe.

Yes, it was that good.
author: Kim F.

description: Very yummy. To me, the ice cream tasted like a cross between Bi-Rite's creamy texture and Ici's strange flavor choices. So far, the ice cream ranking is: 1) Bi-rite, 2) Humphry Slocombe, 3) Ici. Will I be back again? Yes. The ancho chocolate was divine.
author: Susanna W.

description: i've been wanting to see what the hype was about...i can't say that humphry is my favorite creamery in san francisco, but it was good, quality, flavorful ice cream. the oolong was nice & light!
author: Marjie T.

description:
i was having one of those sugar-craving, binge eating days and decided to scooch my way over to humphry's for some zing to my taste buds. the interior reminded me a lot like bi-rite creamery. small, cozy, with a small selection of exotic flavors. the first one that caught my eye was the elvis flavor. brace yourselves, it's peanut butter and...bacon?! yup, bacon. i had to ask for a sample. verdict? not bad at all, although one full scoop might have been overkill. i ended up getting cinnamon brittle and candied ginger. i was expecting some ass kicking ginger bites, but was left with more bland ice cream than substance. the texture of the ice cream was not as rich and dense as i've come to expect from creameries serving "premium" ice cream. the cinnamon brittle was better, but nothing haggen daz can't deliver.

FYI: CASH ONLY
author: Melissa Y.

description: Interesting flavors to be sure, but the quality of the ice cream itself leaves a lot to be desired. Either their freezer doesn't work that well or they just aren't that good at what they do because both times I've had ice cream here there were pieces of hard ice in the ice cream. As other people have said, the ice cream also tends to be very sticky and sweet. Also, personally I find a lot of the flavors here more interesting than actually delicious -- they're okay for a one time sampling, but I can't imagine ever actually craving Secret Breakfast on a hot day.
author: Luke A.

description:
The flavors are definitely cutting edge. They are strange and some make you wonder, really? And, though I can't say I love every flavor that they have, there are a lot of hits. I have to go back for secret breakfast as I've heard too much about this flavor to not have had it before.

In a nutshell, Humphry Slocombe is a small ice cream parlor with weird inventive flavors. It's gourmet ice cream at it's best.
author: Andrew C.

description: Lose the line, and you'd get five. I like going here for the variety of odd choices. It brings adventure to dessert. Its not bi-rite in the quality of the creamy base, but it is so inventive and interesting that it makes up for it.
author: Sean Q.

description: Asked for a sample of secret breakfast. I can only describe it as booze ice cream. Delicious but I did not want a whole cone. The other flavors did not compel me to order. The sample satisfied me and I strolled over to Philz Coffee.
author: Bleep S.

description: Run. Don't Walk.  And stop by often.  These guys know ice cream!  I've been a fan since they opened.  Though I can never remember who the heck is Humphry Slocombe anyway?
author: Brendon K.

description: First off, hats off to the creator of those outrageous and interesting taste of ice-cream at Humphry Slocombe.  It's probably one of a few places you can go taste unconditional ice-cream flavors.  Really appreciate the effort.  Now did I "really" enjoyed my ice-cream?  So-So.  Had the Vietnamese Blue Bottle Coffee ice-cream - as good as other top brand coffee ice-cream at a supermarket.  Tried the olive oil, Thai chili sorbet, brown sugar, etc... they were ok.  Taste different but I really didn't get the taste of "the" ingredient like bacon in one of the flavors that I have tried.  Anyway, will I make a special trip to go back to have another scoop?  No.  If I am in the neck of the woods, will I go back?  No cause not worth to stand in line for me.
author: Carmen W.

description: WEIRD AND AWESOME.  That's how I would describe Humphry Slocombe's ice cream.  Make that WEIRD and CRAZY AWESOME!  We felt somewhat bad that we sampled almost all of their ice cream flavors before settling on one measly scoop in a cone (because we were full from the samples by the time we ordered our scoop).  We finally settled on Peanut Butter Curry and Balsamic Caramel, which were both crazy awesome.  Next time, we're going to get the Salt and Pepper flavor, because it just blew our minds and palattes.  We have also previously tried Secret Breakfast and some kind of stout/beer flavor from our cool friend Gary, who is 'in the know,' and those flavors were also....you guessed it, CRAZY AWESOME!
author: Beth K.

description:
great stuff here!

when you order a single scoop, you actually get two flavors, so that is very nice!

i ended up with the thai chili lime sorbet as well as some kind of chocolate (i was actually pretty drunk at this point - like 6pm). even though i may not remember the details, i definitely remember loving what i ordered.

also, if this isn't enough to satisfy your sweet tooth (it didn't mine), dynamo doughnut is just a few short blocks away (mmmmmmm).
author: Tyler b.

description: Oh man!!! Where do I begin...Slocombe Ice Cream was amazing! I went with my friend. He had the Secret Breakfast and it was pure Awesomeness!! I had the Olive Oil and Balsamic combo and that was really good. Although the Balsamic was a little too rich for me, I have to say, it was everything I had hoped. I liked the store front too. It was unpretentious and small.  I thought it would be expensive, but it was really only a couple of bucks more than buying a regular ice cream.  Yeah...check it out!!! I will definitely do it again when I'm back in SF.
author: Krista P.

description:
well. . we're getting married. . .that's it!  If a girl can marry a dog in India and a guy can marry himself in China, then it is feasible that a girl can marry an ice cream shop.  

Humphry Slocombe had me at Milk Chocolate Passion Fruit.   One of my utmost favorite flavor combos.  I jumped on the couch for the Malted Dulce de Leche.  

It's true love in a biodegradable cup!

Oh, and I held up the boom box playing "In Your Eyes" for the bacon peanut brittle candy.  

I am stone in love!
author: Lainie L.

description:
Unique and fresh flavors!  

After seeing an article from the SFgate about this place, I googled the website and saw the amazing list of flavors.  I immediately knew I wanted to try the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee Ice Cream.  So on one of the few hot days in SF, I came down here with my wife on a lazy Sunday afternoon.  Inside, we found a small ice cream store with no A/C and boiling.  Each week, there are 12 flavors that constantly rotate - although I'm sure the favorites stay.  

I had the blue bottle and secret breakfast (bourbon and corn flakes).  Two amazing flavors.  This has to be one of the best ice cream places in the city.  You also have to love their portions.  A regular cone contains two large scoops.  I was very happy with the serving size.  My wife had the coffee and the balsamic caramel.  We do not recommend the balsamic caramel.  It's too salty and the not what we expected.  

I'd be happy with two scoops of coffee ice cream.  i'll come back for this.
author: Scott L.

description: Went here last weekend because I heard good things...eh..balsamic caramel tasted like salty vinegar..not impressed. There is a difference in throwing random food into ice cream and in making flavors that actually taste good together. I'll stick to bi-rite for my ice cream.
author: Alana L.

description:
It appears that the boutique ice cream shop craze is here to stay in San Francisco and Humphry Slocombe is another entry in that genre. I want to love each new place, but I didn't LOVE this one. It was good, but not great. 

First, the positives. The shop is located in that newly hip area of 24th Street east of Mission and west of Potrero (on Harrison Street). Even on a warm day, the line was manageable, which is more than can be said of Bi-Rite on a cold day. The flavor names are clever, and I tried two. Special Breakfast (bourbon and cornflakes) and balsamic caramel.  Special breakfast was tasty, but not outstanding. 

Now, the not so positive: I was not a fan of balsamic caramel. Too much vinegar flavor, not enough caramel. If you are looking for caramel flavor ice cream, Bi-Rite's salted caramel is the flavor to beat, and this wasn't even close. And, granted, it was a warm San Francisco Saturday, so their freezers were probably working over time, but the ice cream was too soft for my taste -- it was dripping before I even got out the door. 

There were other flavors that seemed worth a try, so I'll probably return. It's ice cream after all, so it's never really BAD and it's not expensive. There's not the investment factor of returning to a 3 Yelp star restaurant for a dinner, only to be disappointed again. 

I still love Bi-Rite and Mitchell's, so anything new is really going to have to be special.
author: Robert M.

description:
After hearing Humphry Slocombe clumped together with the other ice cream giants in SF, I decided I had to come try it out. Unfortunately, I missed it a number of times because I eat dinner relatively late and the place closes at 9pm. Boo.
But last Saturday after an early dinner, we high-tailed it over here... and they were out of Secret Breakfast... noooo. I was super disappointed since that was basically what we came to get. Regardless, I ended up with a single of Vietnamese coffee and balsamic caramel, and the boy got tahitian vanilla (they also wrote out phonetically how to pronounce tahitian on the window.. I thought it was hilarious) and brown sugar. We also sampled the prosciutto ice cream, which was straight-up DISGUSTING. Not to mention, getting balsamic caramel was a mistake. It was interesting and good when I sampled it, but since I got a scoop, it was nastyyyy; it's way too much after one bite, mostly because you get the strong balsamic taste and then the sweetness of the caramel (which doesn't really balance out correctly). I love ice cream, but I've never been disappointed with a flavor like this one. Yes, the other three flavors were fine, but I was just grossed out by trying to dig around that scoop.
Not to mention, the girl behind the counter was kind of unpleasant to deal with. An example would be when we asked her about one of the flavors, and she answered INTO the freezer, and then was short in tone with us when we asked her to repeat it.  I've never had such a mean person serve ice cream ): 
Overall, 3.5 stars (closer to 3) for the interesting flavors, but I think they do try too hard with some of them (there's a thin line between interesting and nasty). I might be back to try Secret Breakfast, but I'm not super gungho about it. I'm sticking to Bi-rite for now.
author: Jen T.

description:
OMG! i had a whole video recording my whole experience today at HS but when I put it on the computer it got deleted. how depressing, I wanted to relive the moment I put the spoon in my mouth. I had secret breakfast and vietnamese coffee. It was delish! I crave for another bite. AT wished his was more dark, cause that is how he loves his coffee but I didn't care! I didn't! no lines, the sun was out and my smile was shining as I skip back onto 24th into the car to enjoy my ice cream! D: I love their metal tasting spoon I wanted to take it home! I tried their balsamic I didn't really like it cause it had this weird taste on my taste buds so I just stuck to what people say might just be the greatest combo EVER. SECRET BREAKFAST+BLUE BOTTLE VIETNAMESE COFFEE! while AT had the tangerine sorbet but didn't care to share. I wanted to try the Salt and Pepper but I was too creeped out so I didn't want to. AT tried the jesus juice he said it was weird, cause it was made out of wine and coke maybe. But it's so close to my dad's I'll be back offer! You can count on it too HS!  This time with my Diana F+ to capture the moment of  savory. BTW, it's not creamy but the blue bottle is extremely creamy. My sensi: PC said it was going to be sorbetish like and to me it wasn't. So its up to the world to decide. But this beats the rest with the exotic flavors can't wait to try their GUINNESS! D:

CASH ONLY.
author: Carolyn Y.

description:
yum.yum. it was a hot and the ice cream hit the spot. i tried the fudge sorbet...it was delicious and hard to believe something so delicious could be sorbet. yum. and of course had to get the rosemary baby on a cone. rosemary and pinenuts with creamy vanilla ice cream. heaven. i walked home a very happy!
love the creativity...cant wait for next ice cream craving.
author: Rachna P.

description: Great ice cream, awesome flavors, close to my house.  Love it.   Especially the beet sorbet, salt & pepper, and red hot banana.  YUM.
author: Jane A.

description: I honestly didn't expect that it would live up to all the buzz, but damn, these guys make a damn nice lot of ice cream.   The two flavors which I had, Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee and Secret Breakfast (Bourbon+corn flakes) were both awesome.   This is how ice cream should be done.  Smooth, rich, and delicious.    Whenever I'm in the area from here on out in the future, I'll make sure to stop by HS.
author: chris c.

description: Love all the weird flavors. The Balsamic carmel grew on me, but absolutely loved the Secret Breakfast. The experience was worth the wait. Line was out the door, 20-30 min wait. I wish they still had the Procuitto ice cream featured on 'Best Thing I Ever Ate'
author: Siwei L.

description: 'Secret Breakfast' = It's kinda like forcing yourself to eat a bowl of frosted flakes the morning after a wild night at The Hemlock, but way better.
author: Katelin H.

description: Humphry Slocombe ice cream served as the dessert for our wedding reception, and I am so glad it did. The ice cream was affordable in bulk. We were able to purchase our favorite flavors (e.g. the famous Secret Breakfast, Vietnamese coffee, Tahitian vanilla), and our guests loved it. The ice cream stays frozen for 4 hours without freezing/refrigeration, and that was also very convenient. Only negative, which was quite inconvenient during the planning process, was that the representative whom I was communicating with was quite unresponsive. (I did wait for up to ~3 months to get a response via email with them.) Rest assure that they will get back to you and come through. I recommend working directly with Candy who can take care of your needs asap. Would have also been much more convenient if they offered delivery. Make sure to request prices per gallon if the catering package is out of your budget. Thank you Humphry Slocombe for making our wedding memorable.
author: Danessa L.

description: I had the "secret breakfast" ice cream: cornflakes and bourbon. The mere existence of this flavor practically earns Humphty Slocombe five stars. And then, it was delicous.
author: Amanda S.

description: Salty chocolate?!? OMG, I'm there. Creamy, creamy rich & dreamy.
author: Emmy M.

description: Incredible!  Don't miss this.  Harvey Milk and Graham Cracker is my favorite flavor of any ice cream anywhere
author: Joshua M.

description: self a non-sweet tooth...but, lured by unusual tastes....finding vietnamese coffee ice cream unique...balance between sweet and ultra roasty coffee flavors....excellent ice cream dessert experience....
author: Hen A.

description:
Delicious.  Go there.  They'll let you try as many flavors as you want before you decide (all of which are delicious!) The guy who was working last time I went was super helpful and even gave me some restaurant recommendations for the area. 

Plus the mission is awesome.  I like to call it mexican hipster.
author: Grace O.

description: With all the buzz about this place and the reference to one of my favorite British shows growing up, I had to visit and move beyond my love of vanilla ice cream.  Exotic flavors do sound good on paper and HS did not disappoint.  However, I did stick with a "simple" flavor and was over the moon about the taste.  Yum!
author: Marjorie G.

description: Uniquely delicious!  This place offers a variety of gourmet flavors such as honey thyme, milk chocolate passionfruit, chocolate tamarind, balsamic caramel, ... The list of flavors is expansive and they rotate 10-12 flavors daily.  So imaginative and out of the ordinary.  If you are daring...or just curious, have a sweet tooth, and don't mind the calories, than stop by.
author: Suzanne C.

description: This place is beautiful in all aspects. Could just stand there and eat up all those tiny samples all day. Any place that serves an ice cream flavor with "Jesus" in the name, is a winner in my book. We had the Surprise Breakfast...can't go wrong with liquor in ice cream. Enjoy!
author: Ramin R.

description:
So I went to Humphry Slocombe and Bi Rite Creamery on the same day....that's how dedicated I am to ice cream!

At Humphry- I had the Vietnamese Coffee ice cream with the fudge sauce as a topping. My sister had the "Gabba Gabba Hey" sundae (which I ate most of)- Caramel Balsamic ice cream, marshmallow topping and a brownie)

The Caramel Balsamic ice cream is the perfect balance of sweet, tangy, sour- really unique and delicious. The coffee ice cream is very strong and fresh tasting. And the fudge is divine. 

Sampled plenty of other flavors- the breakfast, the cabernet, the oatmeal stout- all delicious.
author: Swetha S.

description: Step aside Vietnamese Coffee and Secret Breakfast, make room for their Salted Chocolate ice cream, awesome!
author: Peter H.

description: UPDATE: Two new non-dairy sorbet flavors have been on the menu lately, Golden Beet Saffron and Jesus Juice, which is wine and Coke.  Unfortunately neither is that good.
author: Doctor L.

description: Amazing good quality Ice Cream!  I don't care how weird the flavors sound.  I will try just about anything from here.  :)
author: Delilah B.

description: Everyone went ape over my Fudsicle and Eight Ball Stout combo. Get your own suckers...! And they did - balsamic caramel, Boccalone prosciutto, Skull Splitter Root Beer. We were pretty greedy.
author: Mariangela S.

description: I finally got to try Humphry Slocombe Ice Cream this Sunday. The staff was generous and patient and allowed everyone to "try as much as you like." They were out of the milk chocolate passion fruit which sounded good so I tried the new kumquat and poppy seed (I love kumquats!). I also tried the McEvoy olive oil which was good as well but I decided to stick with the kumquat and poppy seed with blue bottle vietnamese coffee. I ended up waiting a bit as they were letting everyone sample and took the order of the couples in front of and behind me first. Jake Godby the owner (who has ice cream tattooed on his forearm) also just popped open a bottle of champagne to celebrate their 3-month anniversary - congratulations! - and they gave me a free topping on the house in celebration. I ended up getting a free third scoop - secret garden (bourbon and cornflakes!) - instead of a topping which was an awesome pairing with the Vietnamese coffee. Their ice cream has a nice balance of milk and cream making it deliciously creamy and dense. I'll definitely be back for the milk chocolate passionfruit and I'm curious about the other unique flavors: salt and pepper, government cheese, and balsamic caramel. I'll pass on the foie-gras gingersnap ice cream sandwich though! I'm excited to see what Jake comes up with next. Humphry Slocombe is my new favorite ice cream shop - better than Bi-Rite. Take a walk down Balmy Alley when you visit to check out the mural project rooted in the Chicano Art Movement.
author: Diana B.

description: I went with my roommates who have been here numerous times and I was amazed at the variety of items mixed in to make ice cream.  You would think it would taste nasty, but it was soooo good!  I don't recall what I had specifically, but it had bacon in it...  I highly recommend this place
author: Brian C.

description:
This place is always BOMB! The flavors are just so intricate, flavorful, and unique. I went with my bestie after we ate at Chez Maman, and it wasn't hard to find parking. Before making our orders, we tried a couple of flavors like Jesus Juice (coke and red wine sorbet), Secret Breakfast (bourbon flavored ice cream with corn flakes) and candied ginger. Jesus Juice definitely had a kick to it, but was really refreshing. Secret Breakfast was super strong and a little bit too much for our palates. Candied ginger was really good, creamy with a hint of ginger candy, so good that I bought a pint home for my momma. 
We both ordered the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee ice cream, which extremely strong and flavorful. It tasted like we were drinking super strong Vietnamese coffee. My bestie felt like it was too sweet, but I liked it just fine because I love the condensed milk in the Viet Coffee.
Next time, I plan to try more flavors because I usually stick with the Blue Bottle. A lot of the other flavors are too intense for me :p. Oh, and another good thing about Humphry Slocombe is that it's cheaper than Bi-Rite!
author: Fiona N.

description: Humphry Slocombe is definitely the adventurous ice cream shop in San Francisco with their exotic and different flavor combinations. I sampled the  Sichuan Strarberry, Balsamic Caramel, Boccalone Prosciutto, but I ended up getting the Secret Breakfast and Huckleberry Creme Fraiche. The SB had crushed up pieces of cornflakes and a bourbon flavor that won me over immediately.  The HCF was ok. It tasted like any other berry flavor. The creme fraiche gave it a little off taste, not like normal milk ice cream flavor, so that was differently good. Too bad they only have 12 flavors at a time, or else I would have been there sampling all of them. Hopefully next time I return, they will have all new flavors that I havent tasted.
author: Marcus L.

description: Great ice cream and super funny staff.  Can't wait to go back there on a sunny afternoon.
author: Y K.

description: Ugh, cash only!  Amanda and i would have gotten more if not for that, but I guess it's probably for the best.  Ordered the gabba gabba hey, which was caramel ice cream with cherries, whipped cream, brownie, and balsamic.  Excellent.  The brownie was crisp, and not too fudgy like a lot sundaes usually have.  Lots of great, interesting flavors
author: Phil J.

description: All the new rage within the world of ice cream is now happening with Humphry Slocombe.  Within one summer I've seen lines increase 4-fold meaning that some days you have lines that weave down the block.  I guess its because of their unique flavors like brown butter, secret breakfast and vietnamese coffee which makes it popular.  Being in the new hipster neighborhood helps too.
author: Jay A.

description: This was so much fun!!! I tried a few things, but the most memorable flavor for me would be vanilla bean with chocolate covered potato chips :))))  Just thinking about that place puts a huge smile on my face, definately worth trying at least once (or ten times). It is so amusing to see adults standing in line for ice cream!!
author: Bella F.

description: This place is funky, but not necessarily in a good way like Bi-rite or other ice cream places like that.  I tried a few different flavors.  The secret breakfast was kind of gross, but kind of good.  It had way too much bourbon in it.  The sweet corn was interesting and enjoyable.  The blue bottle vietnamese coffee was really good.  The peanut butter curry was pretty gross.  All in all this place wasn't bad, but i felt like it was just trying to be weird to be weird.
