Other places that are similar have weird sounding ice cream flavors, but they actually end up tasting good.  As negative as my review may sound, I would actually go back if I was in the immediate area.
author: Aaron L.

description: OK so the weird flavors I found...just weird. The sort-of-regular flavors were quite yum, but think Bi-Rite is still my fav for interesting combos!
author: Leslie C.

description:
CASH ONLY BEWARE!

I entered the shop and probably stood there for at least 5 minutes trying to decide which ice cream I should taste first. All the flavors except Coffee sounded out of this weird. It was like some alien abducted some cows and a mad chef with a degree in chemistry and made some ice cream. How the hell did they come up with these flavors???

Secret Breakfast - bourbon and cornflakes - When I first saw it I was totally like WTF? I tasted the bourbon and I tasted cereal, my mind was blown away. The first thing that came to my mind was probably "Man, I wonder if underage kids come here all the time."
Jesus Juice - red wine and coke - It's more like a sorbet but still smooth and not icy at all. You can really taste the wine but I didn't taste the coke. Maybe the coke just made the wine less overwhelming. 
Peanut Butter & Curry - Awesomeee. You taste pb and then after you think that was it, you taste the curry. I normally don't like pb that much, I loved this. It wasn't overwhelming at all.
Balsamic Caramel - I asked the guy behind the counter what his favorite was and he said this, so I gave it a try. Whabam! Balsamic is strong! After your taste buds are overwhelmed by the balsamic, you taste the caramel. I ended up getting a scoop of this but regretted it after 3 bites. It was only good in small doses.
Candied Ginger - Sweet and simple. No crazy dances on your tongue but creamy and smooth.
Vietnamese Blue Bottle - I don't know how you can go wrong with coffee ice cream. It's a safe bet.

I really like the interior. It's super cute but a lot of people like enjoying the weather and eating outside. I have to say I'm still a Bi-Rite fan through and through. Getting Humphry now and then is nice but Bi-Rite will always be my go-to ice cream place.

And damn their cash only policy.
author: Lucy D.

description: Awesome ice cream in interesting flavors.  My only wish is that I lived closer to the place.  I bought a couple pints to go with cake, and both were delicious!  I got fudge (which was very yum despite my general dislike of chocolate...) and olive oil (which was amazing).  I've also tried honey lavender at a friend's party, which drew me to Humphrey Slocombe in the first place.  Will definitely be back to try other flavors.  I'm just glad that I've found something that will rival my other ice cream fave - Ici in Berkeley.
author: Fontane L.

description: They do a good texture ice cream in regards to lack of ice crystals or keeping them small.  The crazy flavors are fun your first 3 or 4 visits.  They have the delicious Italian wild cherries to top it off, only when you hit visit 4 or 5 you just wish they had something in the line of a more common flavor the crazy "shouldn't be or not imagined as ice cream" flavors wear off on excitement around then and you just want a really good basic flavor which they don't have much of. Great place to take people who haven't been or to surprise people with the odd and often pretty tasty flavors. Just find the two headed dead animal head on the wall and the dead kitten or something like that art work not the most appetizing when going for ice cream.
author: Joseph F.

description:
it was super crowded... i rather stand under the hot sun than deal with people. total mood killer. so we waited for a friend to order...
1 scoop miso pear
1 scoop white peach
__________________
= eh.... thank god we're sharing!

white peach was ...forgettable (actually took me awhile to remember what we had). 
and miso pear had little bitty bitty itty witty pieces of pear bits in it...which made for an interesting texture. but only 2/5 of us actually like the flavor itself. Ok we came, we tasted... we're done here.
actually come to think of it...im not even sure if this is what we had. probably will have to edit this one later
author: Lynn T.

description: I am not a fan of ice cream because it's sweet and my stomach doesn't enjoy dairy but last night I devoured my scoops of Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee and Secret Breakfast in seconds.  I thought I would prefer the coffee flavor but I was mistaken.  I want more Secret Breakfast.  Now.
author: Seong P.

description:
very good ice cream, but i think bi rite is better. sorry...

i got the blue bottle viet coffee...yummy and excellent staff.
author: Karen H.

description: i've been here 4 times already and they say they rotate their flavors but each time i come, they have the same thing! i've been wanting to try the Pistachio Bacon but i''ve never seen it on the board! I do order my default, the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee. Flavors are interesting if you're will to go out of the box. This place is fun and innovative!
author: MiSa S.

description:
i think i started off on the wrong foot with this place.

i walked in and said to the counter person, 'oh, this is kind of like bi-rite'. 

i got a look from the counter person (who was a dashing looking homosexual) that was slightly short of an eye roll, and a brief explanation about how the two places were nothing alike.

alike or not, i still feel like they are ice cream shops doing something a little differently-- both going for the organic locally made specialness of ice cream. 

the owner came out and explained that he made all ice cream flavors in small batches in the little room in the corner. i liked how he had ice cream cones tattooed on his arm (now that's some dedication!).

i inquired about the flavors, 'you don't have cookies and creme?' i asked. sadly, they didn't. he explained how his approach was more sophisticated, he wanted to make adult ice cream flavors. i realized then that i'm a little kid at heart and each time i go for ice cream im really just celebrating my youthful spirit. that sounds a little woo-woo, but really- i love child-like flavors i guess. 

the aesthetic left a little to be desired-- very plain and white with little distractions from the product- they have a row of bar stools that look out onto the street which i thought was nice, but their ice cream display was obviously for adults, you have to be tall to look inside and peer downward. they have about 12 flavors, all of which are of the  snobby-foodie variety. i wasn't inspired by any of them. they did give samples on real spoons (which bi-rite also does), i ended up sampling the maple pecan and got a child size scoop for $2.25 (does anyone else think it's ironic that they make 'adult' ice cream and offer a 'child' size? hrmm...). the ice cream wasn't very delicious. it was okay, but really-- ice cream should be delicious, its sugary and sweet.

i walked by a few hours later and noticed a line going out the door-- all of the patrons were fancy, mission hipsters that looked very adult like. i think their marketing campaign is really feeding into their desired niche-- good job! 

i don't want to knock it too much, because i do support places that provide a culinary adventure, where the food is an experience in itself, an art piece, something devastatingly delicious and special. i think this place is striving for that (and perhaps succeeding). i'll definitely pop back in for another try- maybe i'll be in a better mood, and maybe they will have a sophisticated cookies-n-creme available?

yummmm
author: Grant D.

description: Not impressed. We got there around late Sunday afternoon and most of the flavors have sold out. I sampled the balsamic caramel and it wasn't for me, so I got Tahitian vanilla and some peanut flavor. Both were just alright, a bit too much salt. I much prefer Bi-rite.
author: CS L.

description:
$3.25 for two scoops.
blue bottle + secret breakfast sure hits the spot. 

olive oil is surprisingly good.

They're more than happy to offer samples so don't be afraid to ask!
author: chris s.

description: Holy hell, Batman!  One of the new corners of SF I was delighted to discover on a recent visit, taken there by an in-the-know foodie friend.  Bold and inventive, sometimes unapologetically.  I thought about serving the prosciutto ice cream with a small side of asparagus, and the fennel-brown sugar is definitely on my list of things to try making myself.  Very friendly staff.  [It didn't hurt that they were playing the Depeche Mode Violator album while I was there, either.]  With the decline of Jake's in Atlanta we don't have anything this adventurous outside of restaurant dessert menus.  This is one to go out of your way for.
author: Joel M.

description:
This is a favorite for people who don't care about quality and go gaga over "unique" flavors. They have odd, unusual, interesting flavor combination but the quality is only so-so....Given the other two amazing ice-creameries in the area (Mitchell's and Bi-Rite) there really is no reason to go here more than once.....

You will love it extra if you are a hipster and enjoy riding the latest trends....
author: Audrey L.

description: This place definitely has the weirdest ice cream flavors I've ever tried. As weird as the flavor combinations are, they still work on some level. I tried several flavors before settling on the safe bet of Blue Bottle Vietnamese coffee. The olive oil was better than I thought and had a buttery taste at the end. Even the bacon and pistachio wasn't that bad. I liked how I could only taste the bacon flavor initially and the pistachio flavor at the end. The balsamic caramel was a little too extreme in terms of bite and acidity. I also actually thought the secret breakfast was way too sweet. I liked the oolong; it reminded me of green tea ice cream, but not. My favorite was the Vietnamese coffee. Why do they call it Blue Bottle? Anyways, it tastes exactly like Vietnamese drip coffee but in ice cream form. Regardless of how weird some of the flavors are, they are all spot on in terms of being what their name suggests.
author: Bailey Z.

description: Not sure what the big deal is here.  Their ice cream isn't all that.  Secret breakfast was too boozy and the corn flakes were soggy.  Vietnamese coffee was too bland for coffee ice cream.  Malted dulce de leche had the consistency of Cool Whip.  I wanted to like this place because the people are nice and I like the location, but I'm not a fan of their product.
author: Reality Check S.

description:
finally visited the store after checking out the bring your own big wheels madness in the afternoon... and what a perfect way to cap off a funny sunday! some of the flavors had run out by 5pm, and we should have tried more flavors first but we didn't want to hold up the line.

ended up sharing a double with the bf of blue bottle vietnamese coffee, balsamic caramel, and of course the secret breakfast! LOVED the coffee and secret breakfast (does bourbon + corn flakes = cookie dough-like chunk to you? i don't care, i loved it still!) and probably should have tasted the balsamic caramel first... wow that stuff is pucker!

humphry's is a little cheaper than birite, but birite by far has the best caramel variant ice cream, hands down. but with several more fun flavors in rotation, humphry's is well worth a slot in my ice cream fave 5!
author: Andrey C.

description:
Get Secret Breakfast. You won't regret it.

The Olive Oil flavor is a bit strange... Salt and Pepper tastes like it sounds. It also had Honey and Milk and Graham (? I can't remember the names exactly) which was lovely, but Secret Breakfast overpowered it.

The store itself is a bit cramped; they should have separate exit and entry doorways, especially for the heavy flow of customers. Therefore it's not really ideal for seating, but hey, you're there for the ice cream, and I'm sure enough people have vouched for the quality of the products.
author: Vivian W.

description:
It is good.  I mean it is obviously a high quality product.  It tastes like it's not even bad for you.  And I like the compostable cups.  The portions are solid and you can get two flavors in a small, which certainly broadens the experience.  

But with the flavors, they lose me.  Sometimes it feels like someone is hanging out in the kitchen throwing darts at a flavor chart.  I love ice cream, but I go there and it is hard for me to pick two flavors to get in my small.  Believe me, I do not shy away from strong, novel, or unusual flavors, but with ice cream I suppose I draw the line.   

Last time I went a week or so ago, I got chocolate passionfruit and vanilla.  The former was interesting, but chocolate and fruit is a tricky thing.  They did it well, but the upside was just not so great.  The vanilla was really good, that  I will say.

The true test of the place is to what extent you go back there first before going somewhere else.  So, will I forgo trying new places or going back to other known good places to go back to Humphrey Slocum?  No, I am way more likely to go to Mitchell's or head down to Westlake for some frozen yogurt in Daly City.
author: Mokje K.

description: Anyplace that serves Fluff and has a 'Hot Mess' on the menu; automatic 5 stars!
author: Sherie R.

description: Unique flavors clean atmosphere a bit trendy but a good stop on a hot day. They have a fois grois sandwich!
author: April Chelses M.

description: I had the ancho chocolate and blue bottle vietnamese coffee.  Yum!  Decent prices too.  I'm definitely coming back to try the other flavors.
author: Janice Y.

description:
if you are ever in this hood you simply must check this place out. in fact, i'm going to say it's worth a trip just for the secret breakfast flavor. apparently developed especially for southern alcoholics. bec who else would have bourbon with their cornflakes? just get it. your tongue will be oh so happy. 

p.s. i also had the basalmic caramel, i mean, i couldn't go all the way out there and just have one flavor. it was good, but not as good as bi-rite's salted caramel.
author: rachel p.

description: It's just awesomely good (the deep authentic flavors), so creatively cute -the names, and just too sweet sometimes, but I could endure that. My favs: Jesus Juice, Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee, Secret Breakfast, McEvoy Olive Oil, Ancho Chocolate with a hint of chili (the heat - whoo!)... will definitely continue to try it all.
author: Sheue L.

description: I was taken here on a super horrible first date, but it was worth it! I have since come here to pick up goodies for get togethers and it is always a hit. The latest was a trip to the beach with my friend for her 30th. I got her the Secret Breakfast (my favorite), Blue Bottle Coffee (can't go wrong) and the Olive Oil (the gamble). They were all so good! Surprisingly the Olive Oil was, by far, the richest of the three. We killed off half of each pint, just the two of us.
author: Pam J.

description: Just tried this place for the first time.  Sooooooo tasty!  I had Bourbon with  Corn Flakes and Malted Milk Chocolate.  Divine.  I personally liked it better than Bi Rite or Mitchells because I found it to be a little lighter but no compromise on flavor.  Drooooooool
author: Mariana B.

description:
my friend suggested stopping by this spot when i mentioned bi-rite.  he was like have you had humphry slocombe ice cream and i was like huh?  i never heard of it.  needless to say, we were there pronto. 

the guy there was friendly and happily offered samples of the unique flavors.  i tried the salt and pepper, which i wasn't fond of.  also tried the balsamic carmel, which was a bit too much balsamicky.  i didn't end up with either of them.  i went with the guiness gingerbread (my fav) and the secret breakfast.  the consistency of the later was uber creamy and i like a cornflacks infused with bourbon.

i'll be back on my next visit for the i have a dreamcicle and the famed blue bottle vietnamese coffee.  oh yes, dont' forget the bacon peanut brittle.
author: Sharlene C.

description: This place is so conveniently walking distance from the 24th Street BART station, and right by Dynamo Donuts so you can double indulge in your sweet tooth fix. I definitely suggest Secret Breakfast. I think I sampled three other flavors before trying secret breakfast, and this one just won my heart.
author: Samantha M.

description: This place is amazing. I thought nothing could take the place of Momofuku's cereal milk soft serve but the Harvey Milk ice cream just may have done it. On top of that this place serves boozey ice cream (Secret Breakfast...YUM) so this place gets 5 stars. Will def come back and try some more flavors next time I'm here. Yes, the line is long, but totally worth it IMO.
author: Jan K.

description:
My boyf mentioned this place, and how weird it was that we'd never been here before- even if we scour mission on foot A LOT. Weird.
Anyways, after some hearty mexican food, we came craving something sweet. It's a very cute ice cream parlor. The flavors were really bizarre and out of this world. Salt n Pepper, Jesus wine?, Spicy chocolate, Olive oil, etc... Since we really have never tasted such weird flavors, we wanted to try them. But the girl seemed annoyed and reluctant to give us tastes. But how else are we supposed to know??? Most of the flavors really do taste like their names. The alcohol ones really reek of alcohol, and the salt and pepper one is really salty and peppery. Let's just say I was craving sweet...and none of them were really what I wanted. I ended up with the Vanilla. (Secretly I longed for Bi-Rite or Ici.) Maybe I'll give it another try...when I want weird buttery salty ice cream...
author: yeana j.

description: This place is good.  It's similar to Ici and Bi-Rite; however, I still slightly prefer Bi-Rite over Humphry.  I really like the clean simple design of the place, and the people are really nice.  I had the malted dulce de leche and the vietnamese blue bottle coffee, while Mike had the secret breakfast and vietnamese blue bottle coffee.  All the flavors are quite good, we sampled a lot of them.  If I were in the area, I'd come back, but Bi-Rite is closer to me and I still like their roasted banana and salted caramel over the flavors here.
author: Joann C.

description: Been hearing about this place from the BFF who talks about it all the time. BFF and I decided to have date night together and she took me here. We came in the early evening so there werent very many flavors left. However, I did get to try Secret Breakfast and Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee. OMG... Talk about fatty! The Blue Bottle tasted exactly like Vietnamese Coffee and left this fatty rich residue in my mouth. The ice cream was so creamy and flavorful! I actually got Jesus Juice ( coke and red wine sorbet!) and the Blue Bottle. BFF got her Sercret Breakfast and i thnk Maple Pecan, both were delicious as well!!!
author: N T.

description: The curry peanut butter was yummy.  I like all the different and creative flavors.  If you want chocolate icecream you get it in the super market.  If you want something you've never heard of before, you go to Humphy's.
author: Sharon M.

description: WOW.  The Blue Bottle coffee ice cream was well worth the trek.  I will certainly be visiting this place again.
author: Bryan H.

description: Yep, better than Birite. You should definitely get an ice cream float. And if you don't want a float, get a float.
author: Laci W.

description: OMG..I had been dying to check out this place after reading about it on a food blog. It is truly a fantastic place! The lady there was very friendly and let us try just about all the flavors. I appreciated that since some of the flavors sounded funny to me like: Balsamic caramel, hibiscus beet, secret breakfast (bourbon with corn flakes). They all tasted great! My fav there is the Vietnamese blue bottle flavor. Another plus about this place is that they are very generous with their portions. I would say this is my new fav ice cream join in SF now. Be sure to check out some of the Bacon peanut brittle..it is YUMMY! I'm going to try the foie gras flavor with ginger snaps next time.
author: Vanessa W.

description:
Stopped in for the first time tonight after reading all the great yelp reviews. On my way there I had decided that I wasn't going to try the Secret Breakfast since that's what EVERYONE tries and reviews. I wanted to be different. Once we arrived, (BTW- parking Karma was in full effect and we found a spot right in front) and looked at all the flavors (I think around 8-ish) the server asked what I would like. Unlike my original plan, I froze and then blurted out "Secret Breakfast! please" . So much for be different, but it's the thought that counts. Anyway, we all ended up with the secret breakfast and we all ended up loving it. I do agree with some of the other yelpers- It is very bourbon-y but I like bourbon so that wasn't really an issue. If you don't like bourbon I suggest you try a sample before ordering a scoop. I also would have liked more cornflakes in the mix. I enjoyed their somewhat chewy/sweet texture. As for the ice cream itself, I found it to be creamy (one yelper used the term light and airy which I thing is a great description) and sweet. Overall it was worth the trip and the three times we circled the block waiting for my parking Karma to kick in. 

P.S. When we went the staff was very friendly.
author: Michele H.

description: I am not a big ice cream person. However, if I want ice cream I want it to be fresh and not full of air.  That was my experience at Humphry Slocombe Ice Cream.    I had blue bottle vietnamese coffee and the sea salt chocolate; delicious!!!   I like the fact it is not so crowded like Mitchells or Bi Rite.  This was recommended by a friend.  I will definitely be back when I have a craving for ice cream!!!
author: gayle w.

description:
Absolutely delicious!  Just the right amount of sweetness, just the right amount of creaminess!

We got a pint of balsamic caramel and sweet corn.  The sweet corn tasted like the purest milk you could ever have.  The caramel in the balsamic caramel was neither bitter nor too sweet (I think they put in a little salt to make it a caramel au beurre sale' type thing).  And the hint of fruity and slightly acidic balsamic went perfectly. Mmmm! 

For all of those who are ice cream makers, it is definitely worth a trip here to get some new inspiration!
author: Fiona A.

description: I swear I got drunk off the Secret Breakfast ice cream, made with bourbon and corn flakes.  Or maybe it was just the amazing taste that had my head delightfully spinning.  So crazy good.
author: Ryan L.

description: I don't think they make the best ice cream but definetly the craziest flavors.  I tried sczheiun chili strwberry sorbet, Vietnam coffee, and black sesame.  Defintely worth to go if you want something different.  Will go back to try all the flavors!!
author: John L.

description:
i came by to check this new ice cream place out last night.  my friend was making dinner and chocolate cupcakes, so i thought ice cream would be a great complement to the cupcakes.  

the staff here is super friendly.  the guy let me try a bunch of flavors, and he thought that the secret cereal would great w/ the chocolate cupcakes.  he was right!  that bourbon and cornflake combo is ingenious and really works!  i also loved the blue bottle vietnamese coffee.  i didn't try the malted dulce de leche, but i will next time!!  my friends and i all really enjoyed the ice cream w/ the chocolate cake.

pints are $7.50.  cash only.
author: Helen T.

description: I'm leaving room to really love them. I was expecting the secret breakfast to have chunks of cornflakes but there are only tiny bits (I'm the kinda gal that needs lots of Oreos in my cookies n cream), but it made up for it with lots of bourbon. The surprise favorite was the hibiscus beet sorbet-- tart, sweet, and berry-like. Beets aren't fruits, right? I had a taste of the foie gras which came in a gingersnap cookie sandwich. It was a sweet cream with ginger but I couldn't taste foie gras at all but it may have been hard to taste after sampling 6 other flavors =). Looking forward to trying other flavors from the website.
author: Mimi L.

description: Let's get something straight here, Humphry Slocombe is no Bi-Rite. The flavors are unusual and unique, but not nearly as addictive as the ice cream at Bi-Rite. I settled on the malted dulce de leche and the coconut sherbet - both were tasty, but neither left me craving more. The woman at the counter was very nice and allowed me to sample several flavors before I finally made my selection. This stuff is high quality, so I understand the $3.50 for a single scoop (two flavors). But I did not even finish my scoop and in the end all I wanted was the salted caramel and snicker doodle from Bi-Rite. Also, from what I could see there is no frequent buyer card at Humphry Slocombe - come on folks, if we are going to spend $3.50 per scoop, at least reward us every 10-12 purchases with a free cone!
author: Dana H.

description: Word on sfist.com is that a Yelper tried to pressure the folks at HS for some kind of discount and were promptly shown the door. If I didn't already love HS' ice cream, I'd love 'em now!
author: alex j.

description: They have the most creative ice cream flavors I have ever seen. The time I went, they had: Jesus juice sorbet (awesome), blue bottle coffee (awesome), Harvey Milk (awesome), browned butter (awesome -- It helps to go with a lot of people and try what they get), smoked salt, peanut butter curry, salt and pepper, rosemary baby, olive oil, secret breakfast, and chocolate passion -- these are the only ones I remembered.  Parking sucks, but it's worth it.
author: Jo Y.

description: What is the hype about? Seriously, I do not get it. I would not go back. This is so nothing to rave about. Sorry but I was seriously hoping for something deliciously amazing after hearing my coworker talk about it but I won't be back. The combo's are crazy and they aren't great. Stay away from the curry one. I knew curry would be weird as an ice cream but since they are known for these crazy combos I tried a sample and ended up getting something completely different. I thought it would magically taste good but nope.
author: Lenni R.

description:
In the words of Chandler Bing: "Oh sweet Lord, new realms of pleasure".

I really thought I was gonna be "ehhh" about this place but oh my.. until you try it for yourself, you really don't understand!  I've already been here twice after school & got Secret Breakfast.  It made my tongue numb!!  

McEvoy olive oil.. Vietnamese coffee.. Rosemarys baby.. etcetc.. I love you & I'll be back soon..
author: Aubrey M.

description: I love this place.  The unique flavor combos are amazing.  I've tried boccolone prosciutto, chocolate and sea salt, peanut butter curry,  and the salt and pepper ice cream.  All delicious!  My favorite so far is the chocolate and sea salt.
author: Yvonne C.

description:
After so much hype I've been wanting to try this place.  I do love my ice cream, but here- not so much.  I found the texture to be very icy.  Second, I can't say that I enjoyed the flavors at all.  The best one we tried was the fudgesicle sorbet, we got it for my son and it way too chocolatey for him but I did like it.  

I found the Secret Breakfast and the Vanilla to be overwhelmingly salty.  I do love the sweet/salty combo in desserts, but this was just too much.  You should not be able to taste salt in your ice cream unless it is a salted caramel, otherwise it should really just be there to balance the flavors.  We also tried the Peanut Butter Curry which I have nothing good to say about.  It tasted all wrong.  Other flavors just sounded gross like the salt & pepper...I cannot imagine how salty their salt flavored ice cream would be.

I'll stick with Bi-Rite and good ole' Hagen Daaz.
author: jackie r.

description: This place has the tastiest, most interesting flavors that I have ever tried. The "Secret Breakfast" (Cornflakes and Bourbon in vanilla) is my favorite (I've already had it twice in one week and normally I eat ice cream no more than once a month!), but they are all very good - including "Salt and Pepa", which is very peppery. The texture of the ice cream is very smooth and creamy. This is now my favorite ice cream joint in the city - sorry St. Francis and Bi-Rite. I can even pick up random free internet while sitting in the window at the counter. A very clean and friendly addition to the neighborhood. Just make sure that you stop at the ATM first - there are Bank of America ATMs on Bryant at 24th.
author: Stephanie C.

description: Came here when my girl friend was craving some wine flavored ice cream. Being an ice cream lover myself I decided to try the salted chocolate and their vanilla. The vanilla was super good, but the salted chocolate was so damn salty! I would give this place another chance tho just out of my love for ice cream. haha
author: Jackie M.

description: Dropped by here after a day of continuous eating. This was my last stop for lunch which happens to be right before dinner! This place claims to have exotic ice cream flavors that is superb. Line was not too long when we went and were served immediately. You get to sample any flavor you wish and trust me, you should. The selection is overwhelming because the flavors are so uncommon but very luring. Vietnamese coffee, peanut butter curry and secret breakfast just to name a few. If you are stuck on a choice, the secret breakfast will not disappoint. Bourbon with crunchy cereal bits! It is great. The Dulce de Leche is delicious as well.
author: Cathy L.

description: As we speak, I am eating my way through a pint of Maple-Walnut and trying not to spill it in the keyboard. Mos of the other reviews say it all, but their ice cream is absolutely lovely. I have tried Vietnamese Blue Bottle Coffee, Balsamic-Caramel, McEnvoy Olive Oil (taste like like liquid gold!), and the Honey Thyme. They were helpful with recommendations and patient with the tasters (but speedy). I would very much like for them to hire me to sing their praises throughout the Bay Area. All their service is compostable, btw. We love Humphry.
author: J A.

description: Although I still prefer Bi-Rite, Humphry Solocombe is an excellent alternative when you crave odd flavours, and don't want to wait in line. Last time I went I had Honey and Thyme, and it was subtle perfection. I am also told the Blue Blue Bottle Coffee ice cream is amazing, and I will be going back soon to find out.
author: Jessica S.

description:
First time going to this ice cream shop.  First impression; shop is in a sketchy neighborhood, surrounded by bums trying to grab you and talking to themselves. My lil niece whom is 4 years old said, "mom, I'll stay in the van, this place scares me!" Thought that was a red flag.  The shop is very tiny, but there are outside seating, which was were we decided to indulge.  The flavor profile was unusual. I had the secret breakfast, which was very heavy on the bourbon, my wife had the gaba gaba hey, which was the basil, balsamic ice cream with cherries, and brownies. 
Thanks goodness my sister had cash on her, because all I had was my debit card, and type of payment is cash only. I don't understand cash only places, especially in a sketchy neighborhood, like seriously, getting robbed is imminent there, since everyone knows that it's a cash only business, they also close late, like around 9p. 
Overall the experience deserved 3 stars due to the area, type of payment and heavy bourbon flavor on the secret breakfast ice cream, I think I would have to try Bi-Rite Creamery or stick with frozen yogurt.
author: Juicy C.

description: Funky weird but interesting tasting ice cream. It was cool to try out all the different flavors but I think I'm just a simple ice cream girl. I ended up getting the pumpkin and vanilla (see how adventurous I am?) while my friends made up all kinds of combinations. A friend who doesn't even like ice cream thought this was the best ice cream he's had.  I do agree with other reviewers that the texture of the ice cream is really good though so it's worth a try. So for me, I'd go again if a bunch of friends wanted to go check it out, but I'd probably stick with simple concoctions and then taste theirs :)
author: Mochi L.

description: I was there i few weeks ago playing a show at Yoshi's in Oakland. My dear friend wanted me to check this place out.... Amazing! After waiting in line for 30 minutes, I finally  had the Secret Breakfast, Bourbon and cornflakes ice cream! Off the wall flavors! Next time you are in the city, check it out!
author: L. C.

description: I think this place is over-rated. Yes, they have unique flavors, but they are not very tasty. I tried like 3 types of ice cream from there, 2 of them were too sweet! and one of them was weird. And a little bit over-priced too. Won't go there anymore
author: Min Z.

description: Have the "Secret Breakfast" ice cream flavor.  You won't regret it!  I'm sure you won't regret trying anything else on the menu either, but that one is my favorite.
author: Denis Y.

description: Had the Vietnamese coffee, and yes I would have to say that it was one of the best coffee ice creams I have had.  The wifey had the coffee ice cream and the Thai Lime Chile ice cream, which I wouldn't say was bad, it was pretty good, actuallly.  I can't wait to go back and try the other unusual flavors.  I would also like to say I haven't been to that neighborhood in a loooong time.  It wasn't like I remembered it but still somewhat the same.
author: Jesse M.

description:
Not a fan.

I've been here a few times and keep trying to give it the benefit of the doubt. Sadly, I've come to the conclusion that it's overrated, the ice cream's not really that great, and the owner is kind of a douche. I haven't really found the employees to be too friendly either, but I haven't met all of them so that might not be fair.

Also, I was pretty annoyed the other night when people who had been waiting for 25 minutes for ice cream were turned away once this place closed. I've worked at a couple restaurants for several years, and there are really only two solutions to dealing with people who stick around during closing time.  You can either continue sitting people until closing time and then serve them, or stop taking names for the wait list if you don't think people will be able to eat and order before the kitchen closes. 

For an ice cream shop, one could either cut off the line at closing time and serve everyone waiting (a la Ike's place) or cut off the line early to ensure everyone who is waiting will get ice cream before closing time. 
This place did neither, resulting in dozens of poor souls walking home ice cream-less, despite waiting in line for 25 minutes.  Kind of douche baggy in my opinion...

Yes, the ice cream is pretty unique, so it's worth checking out if you've never been. But for a regular ice cream place with better ice cream and friendlier service,  I'd go somewhere else.
author: Alec W.

description: Finally got around to trying Humphry Slocombe during SF Beer Week a while back.  (A good Belgian) Beer, yum-o.  Ice cream, double yum-o.  Beer ice cream, blech.  I won't be making that mistake ever again.  The Secret Breakfast was pretty good, and the Blue Bottle Vietnamese coffee was delish, but I gotta say I'm still a Bi-Rite girl.
author: Elaine F.

description: If Secret Breakfast is so secret, then how come the whole world seems to know about it already?  How is it that a "fluffy" ice cream stays so cold? I bet that's a secret too.
author: Val U.

description:
its a great place for ice cream, but they do sometimes have some funky flavors that i don't appreciate - they had an ice cream when i was there - made from the left over meat of prosciutto !  interesting to say the least

however, they need to have a more powerful freezer.  my ice cream was kind of a slop and melted very quickly
author: Jh M.

description:
really creative and unique flavors at this spot.  i've only been here once so am writing a review of just the 2 flavors i had. one scoop of secret breakfast (bourbon & cornflake) and one scoop of guinness & gingerbread. at first i was a little iffy on the whole acohol in ice cream thing but i'm telling you it was an unexpected delight.  and both flavors tasted exactly what their descriptions entailed.  i have to go back again when i'm in the bay and try ALL of them!

i'm only taking 1 star off because i tried a pc of a friend's Boccolone Lard Caramels.  they have little goodies on the side besides the ice cream.  this may be ok for some people but the texture of caramel candies made with bacon lard is just not right for me.  sorry.
author: maret r.

description: By far the most interesting/unique/taste-bud-popping ice cream you'll ever put in your mouth.  With flavors like Balsamic Caramel, Salted Chocolate, Brown Ale Ice Cream, and Olive Oil how could you resist a dabble?  At first you may be disgusted or deterred by the names of these concoctions but, seriously, just sample the f*ck out of some of them and choose your destiny!  You'll become an ice cream snob before you know it.
author: Scott G.

description: Since they're not fully operational, I can't certainly say anything quite yet, but on the ice cream, which, of course, is their primary product, I can say it's very creative, and well played. The flavors are excellent, needing a touch of polish on some, and inventive as all get out. Secret Breakfast is my favorite, and has certainly made it on my top 10 list of all time best ice creams I've had. I combined it with their Valhrona Fudgesicle, and the pairing was delightful. There was a teasing aroma of hot fudge, swirling through the air as I waited in line. Imagine my surprise when it was not yet available. Instead, home made brownies sat temptingly at the register. I hope that next time I return, I can experience some of their topping extravagance.
author: Shannon F.

description: This place is awesome and completely something unique to San Francisco that I know of.  Obviously, the flavors are incredibly creative and adult - ex. secret breakfast has bourbon.  You also gotta love the fact that they constantly change the flavors so much, that everything is written in erasable marker on the glass case.  My sister had Jesus Juice sorbet (coke and red wine), my bro-in-law had the anchove chile chocolate, and I had the peanut butter curry (the last 2 were hard ice cream).  All were delicious - the curry seemed to last forever in your mouth, which I could see bothering some people.  A must stop when I am in town again.
author: Paul K.

description: very creative flavors!! i had sea salt with chocolate and it was quite salty and chocolately for me at times. i'll definitely comeback to try other flavors!
author: Ange G.

description: We stopped in this place on our way to Bi-Rite Creamery in the Mission District.  Interesting, creative flavors like curry/peanut butter and salt&pepper, and they were happy to let you sample everything you wanted.
author: Jennifer S.

description: Yummy, yummy ice cream. We got the 'Jesus Juice', a cola and red wine sorbet, and it was fantastic. Everyday there are new creations to try.
author: Justin G.

description: Didn't have foie gras or anything with bacon or prosciutto that day, so i was really dissapointed.... but the bourbon cornflakes (secret garden) and olive oil were pretty good. For more reviews visit my blog.
author: Cindy C.

description: Maybe I came on a bad day.. Cloudy and cold on a Sunday. But at least, there was no line.  We came here because I saw HS on the travel channel. 1536 reviews and still maintaining 4 stars on yelp too! BUT this place is really nothing to rave about. The thought of nontraditional ice cream flavors totally stirred my curiosity though but the names were kind of weird for me but don't judge a book by it's cover, right? Sampled Secret Breakfast, Jesus Juice and a couple other flavors that didn't leave any impression on me so I didn't bother to remember their names nor how they tasted.  All I remember was that there was way too much bourbon for my taste in the Secret Breakfast. Jesus Juice was alright but I probably wouldn't have been able to finish a cone filled with it. I played it safe and decided on a peanut butter flavor (the name was fancy but the flavor was just peanut butter) and the bf went with vanilla.
author: Amy Z.

description:
hottest flavors right now:
kumquat poppy seed and olive oil
author: Jane L.

description: with all the favors i couldn't chose half the time i'm here, hahaha lolz my favorite's so far are peanut butter curry,skull splitter root beer and
author: jonathan h.

description: Nothing else I can say about the ice cream...it's pretty tasty, and affordable given the quality of ingredients and the huge serving size. Only complaint: the flavor board is a cocktease. All of these delicious flavors are listed, and I stood in line dreaming about tasting each and every one...only to find out that not all listed were available in the case, by the scoop. In reality, some were only available in pre-packed pints. Major bummer, but nothing better signage can't fix.
author: Beth T.

description:
many interesting flavors, but kinda salty.  i like my ice cream sweet, less salty.  but the secret breakfast and blue bottle viet coffee were craaaaazy good... 

wait, is that alcohol im tasting in the sb?
author: Ethan L.

description:
Curry peanut butter ice cream on a sugar cone that is so crispy and delicious you have to believe it's made in house. Seriously. The best sugar cone I've ever had. 

The nice employees will patiently give you a taste of any flavor you want till you make your choice. Vintage condom machine in the bathroom was funny, but too bad it didn't work. It was cash only when I went, and I don't know if they'll allow credit cards anytime soon.
author: Crystal L.

description: Their ice creams have great and unusual flavors, soft texture, served by friendly workers.  Lines are not as bad as at Bi-rite or Ici, especially on a weekday.  I concur with other reviewers that Vietnamese Coffee and Secret Breakfast are super.
author: Thomas C.

description: weird flavors are not cool, they're gross.  probably my fault for getting salt and pepper, but seriously, it's gross. next time i go back i'll order only normal flavors, and possibly revise my rating. in the mean time, go to bi rite where all of the flavors are delicious
author: Geoff B.

description: Thank you Yelp! for this tip.  This the best ice cream I have had in San Francisco and for $2.50 for a cone of ice cream...what a bargain!  Think similar unusual flavors as Bi-rite but without the crowds, the line and the higher prices.  I loved the "Breakfast surprise" flavor (I think it was Bourbon and brown sugar)...amazing!
author: foodiewithadrawl S.

description: Okay the chocolate and sea salt not their best. Waaaaaaay too salty. I had to toss mine, but just about everything else is divine.  Don't let that one bad chocolate salt concoction ruin it for you. Their sorbets are so refreshing. I love the watermelon sorbet. And my new fav is the cantaloupe cayenne (it def has a spicy kick, but I totally dig it).  I love that Humphry's is so close to work. Boy I look forward to warm days so I can indulge in their creations.  Although cool SF weather hasn't stopped me before.
author: Alexandra R.

description: Be sure to call ahead, apparently they like to close for "private parties"  WTH?!
author: Kyle R.

description: they have some pretty unique flavors at humphry slocombe. i was able to try out a few of them, but i ended up getting a scoop of the blue bottle vietnamese coffee flavor and it was really good. i will be back to try a scoop of the secret breakfast next time!
author: Gordon F.

description: I wonder how they pack so much flavor into a single spoon of ice cream.  I will say, that they broke a stereotype I had that everyone working in an ice cream parlor is naturally jolly.  Maybe they don't get tipped enough.  But with those pouty moutheys they never will.
author: Wayne C.

description: Man.... there's a reason why the secret breakfast flavor is one of top flavors... the bourbon.  Yum.  I have a new favorite ice cream joint.  I also loved the McEvoy olive oil.  The blue bottle coffee was really strong by my hubby loved it.  The balsamic caramel was just too tart for my palatte.  I like this place better than bi-rite creamery, but that just my opinion.  Still my favorite ice cream joint is Marco Polo on Kirkham (i think, well it's somewhere around there)
author: Lauren S.

description: Olive oil and secret breakfast ice creams did not disappoint. I'm sure I will spend many dollars here as it's so easily accessible from my casa. I have to say though, that after reading so many reviews about the wonderful service and generous tasting opportunities, I felt somewhat slighted by the service. We were the only customers and it was our first time in the store today. I asked for two tastes and got the impression that I was pushing my luck. Frankly, I felt like our 5 minute exchange was a huge annoyance to the man with the scoop. Kind of sucked.
author: Lisa L.

description:
the star rating says it all! amazing
there is still room to open other ice-cream places in the city.. anyone want to go into business??
author: Jippers C.

description: It's no secret  that Secret Breakfast is delicious! They'd mopped just before I walked in and it kinda stunk lik not-so-fresh mop water as we sat at the window and enjoyed some amazing ice cream.
author: Michael R.

description: Chocolate Malted Ice Cream...I Scream!  I loved it..  The ice cream here is crazy original and totally delicious, need I say more.  One more thing for me to love in the Mission.
author: Veronica L.

description: Note to anyone who's looking for Humphrey Slocombe: it is located under a blue awning with the words "ice cream" on it.  There's a small street sign too, but you can't really see it that well from afar.  In any case, I liked the secret breakfast ice cream here, but it wasn't amazing.  You can taste the liquor, and the cornflakes in it are pulvererized, so you can't really taste it.  I prefer chunkier ice creams, so please pour on the cornflakes, and actually if you guys can add peanut butter cups too, that would take it to "amazing-land."  I also tried their bacon peanut brittle, which is VERY bacon-y; I think they must use the bacon fat along with large peices of bacon.  Not for the faint of  heart or someone who only kinda likes bacon.
author: Grace M.

description: They are expensive.  They are good.  Sometimes I wonder if I can make the same flavors, grab some ice-cream and mix hot sauce and stuff in there.  Haven't tried it yet, but it's tempting.
author: see y.

description:
ice cream for grown-ups!

many flavours perfect for those of us without much of a sweet tooth. dangerous that this place is walking distance from my new flat, i'll be working my way through all the flavours. from my first visit:

secret (shh) breakfast - bourbon and corn flakes - breakfast of champions? i concur, i've a pint in the freezer.

boccalone prosciutto - tasty, salty, pig ice cream - best in small quantities, i need to experiment with some food/drink pairings.

tahitian vanilla - vanilla? - didn't get to try this one as the visiting 8-year old nephew wolfed it down in what seemed like seconds.
author: Friedrich G.

description: WOW!!!!  I am amazed at all the flavors this ice cream parlour has created.  My friend and I went here on a mildly rainy day.  It was a lovely experience.  We tried many of the flavors they had to offer that day.  I tried the Secret Breakfast, and it was okay but the bourbon came accrosss strong.  Also tried the black sesame and it had a weird texture to it.  I did enjoy the honey thyme and wonder why I didn't order that instead of the balsamic caramel.  My friend had the pistachio bacon and olive oil, the pistachio bacon didnt have much of a taste but the olive oil was nice and smooth.  I wann go back to try all the flavors.
author: Cindy V.

description: Ice cream is pretty much ice cream to me, but I do appreciate the interesting concoctions Mr. Humphry comes up with here. Secret breakfast? Olive Oil? HUH? I stuck with the semi-regular Fudgesicle and topped that off with some Ginger. Both were good, both were fair interpretations of their real life match. I will be back.
author: Cindy H.

description: Worth the effin' trip from East Bay - SF - via BART to "I have no clue" side of the city. I thought I got lost but found it in near time. If you are unsure...just try the Secret Breakfast. Loved it. Wish I could take a pint home with me. No way will it survive back to the East Bay. OHHHHHH! I could eat Secret Breakfast for every meal. Anyone opting for less than 4 stars just has issues. Please do not let the summer pass you buy without taking a walk on the wild side. I did and they effin' got me. Wish you open up somewhere closer to downtown ;-/ However, I will be back to try some more. Nice work on awaking me from my Haggn Das slumber. Thanks for giving me something that's fresh and doesn't make my stomach turn (I have a strange lactose problem...I can only eat natural dairy, I run from that "processed" crap) Do not waste these hot days (because we barely have them) at the park, take a walk down the unbeaten path and see for yourself :-)
author: LaKeisha S.

description: This place was my introduction to delicious, gourmet ice cream.  I had made it as a child and tried some stuff in stores, but this blew me away.  various flavor combos get a bit silly at times, but usually are spot on.  Organic ingredients, really creamy ice cream; I seriously want some right now.  The Mission definitely has a few places like it, but this place is probably the best.  Ancho chocolate was probably my favorite.  I wouldn't consider it cheap just because I will go to Rite-Aid and be content with my $1.29 rocky road.  But that is the City for you.
author: Cole M.

description: This place was excellent. Interesting flavors like Peanut Butter curry. Try as many as you can before deciding! Can't wait to go back.
author: Joshua S.

description:
The big draws for me have, sadly, been tempered by a lack of professionalism at HS.

Big draws: Innovative, new flavors almost every week, and close to where I live. I was visiting every week and recommending them to all my friends.

Not cool: Be careful if you offend their Twitter manager; one lukewarm review and you're blocked. Also, one of the staff (the short guy) has been helping his friends to the front of the line, and the last time I was there, the line was 15 customers long.

Quality: Very good. I'd give Bi-Rite and Mitchell's higher marks for the quality and texture of their ice cream. HS has the innovation but the execution is only very good (often, the ice cream is flaky instead of creamy), and sometimes, especially the "sorbets," are below average. 

Sublime: Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee, McElvoy Olive Oil, Salt and Peppa, Secret Breakfast, Honey Thyme, Rosemary's Baby, Cherry Blossom (seasonal, I think), Peanut Butter Curry.

Eh: The plain chocolate and vanilla ice creams. Sorbets (too sweet, with a strange gumminess that bizarrely prevents them from melting completely).
author: Greg T.

description:
aghhhh.. im sad that i only did this right now.. :( but then again, what the heck?! 

anywho... i've been going here for quite some time now, and it never disappoint me. to know humphry slocombe is to be a follower on twitter, and try to visit this joint at least once or twice a month, because they keep on changing their flavors, adding to their repertoire of fantabulousness. :D

their signature shits are: viet blue bottle coffee and secret bfast (people call em THE BFAST OF CHAMPIONS!)... then they have other odd flavors, but all of it works. i love this PRETTY IN PINK flavor, which was dedicated to john hughes (RIP) ... then they have JESUS JUICE (red wine and coke)--very grown-up!, and curry ice cream, licoriche, etc....... can't really keep up with their fabulousness, but my tongue is pleased! :D 

OH YA NO CREDIT/DEBIT CARDS please..... this is why i love em too.. not just they crank up great flavors, but they have a great and savvy business sense..... no credit/debit cards, to keep their prices LOW for ice cream gourmet lovers out there! :D 

this is where the cool kids go and kick it, so COME HITHER y'all! ;)
author: Marc K.

description: Wow its ridiculously good.  We tried 3 of the flavors: Balsamic Caramel, Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee and Malted Dulce de Leche.  All three were fantasticly great.  Rich, creamy and delicious.  Only draw back is you have to go early to get the best selection.  We went around 6 p.m. on a Friday and by that time they had ran out of several but really the ones we had were so good I'm not mad at them.  Can't wait to go back.
author: Sally W.

description: 5 stars for the Vietnamese iced coffee ice cream. Haven't tried the other flavors yet.
author: ryan c.

description: Tried a few flavors and didn't find our the fits me just right but ice cream is ice cream. Curry one tasted very strange...pretty large servings though..
author: Tiff W.

description:
Flavors: Incredible.
Service: Incredible.
Location: Incredible (full disclosure, I live a half block away. I'm going to get fat [fully full disclosure, I'm already fat. This place will put me well on the way to Gilbert Grape's Mother level.])


So I live around the corner. I heard about this place opening up on Mission Mission, and had to get over there. I mean, the Secret Breakfast's secret is my FAVORITE THING IN THE WORLD. (ok. Bourbon. There. I told you. Happy?)
So I skee-daddle on over there, and try every flavor Sean's dishing out. Because he lets me. And every time I go in there (6 times since they've opened, people. Not kidding. FATFATFAT. Anyway...) He lets me try them all again.
I love the...
Secret Breakfast (mmm, bourbony...), 
Vietnamese Blue Bottle Coffee (ohh it's strong and lovely... like a Turkish Coffee Milkshake from Barney's), 
Balsalmic Caramel (it's like Salty Caramel, but tangier. And smoother. And... full of magic.), 
Red Hot Banana (Not Banana with chili or something spicy in it, but actual, crushed up, hand-to-god-RED HOTS in it),
Malted Dulce De Leche (Oh man eat it with the Coffee and die happy),
and the Strauss Yogurt, which I love, but I'm waiting for toppings to eat more than (okay two) sample spoonfuls of. Or, I'm going to buy a pint (He can make you a pint with two flavors in it people! SIDE-BY-SIDE!) and take it home and dip strawberries in it.

I especially love to get the ice cream and a coffee from Sundance and sit in the sun. Or, like I did on Thursday, take a friend who hadn't been yet, and meet him on my front steps with a cup of coffee I'd made, and walk over with our mugs and sit inside sipping coffee and chatting with Sean and eating cookies and Ice Cream.

I love my life, and I'm sure I'll love being fat.
author: Rhiannon C.

description: Secret breakfast and Blue Bottle Vietnamese coffee were muy delicioso. I'll definitely be back. Totally not crowded either on a sunny, Sunday afternoon... And much more polite than the spiteful hipsters at Bi-rite.
author: Tamara M.

description: After reading all the raving reviews on Yelp, I finally decided to make the trip. I was not disappointed what so ever. I had the balsamic caramel and the secret breakfast. the secret breakfast was so good. everytime i got one of those crunchy thingys, my mouth just felt like it was in heaven. the balsamic caramel was a little strange at first but in a good way. overall i couldn't be happier with the flavors.
author: Heather S.

description:
instead of opting for our default creamery (BI-RITE), we decided to be a little more daring and searched for the famous "foie-gras flavor" at humphrey slocombe. we panned the outer mission for this clandestine gem, and finally made it when we hit the corner of 24th and harrison. like bi-rite, the line was out the door...but no worries, it was supposedly worth the wait. 

of course when we got closer, the hipster server crossed off "peanut butter curry", and the infamous "foie-gras" off the menu, which left me slightly crestfallen. but my heart perked up when they replaced the dwindling "secret breakfast" (bourbon & cornflakes) with a new cannister. my bf opted for "olive oil, secret breakfast, & chocolate tamarind"---an amazing trifecta, and i went the safer route and had "vietnamese blue bottle coffee & secret breakfast".

sure enough, it was as delightful as the sf chronicle claimed, and i will be back for the foie gras. and the peanut butter curry. and the choco passion fruit. and the stout.
author: Ivy R.

description: It did not dissapoint at all! Well worth the drive and will pay a visit every time I am in the city! We tried about 4 different flavors and all were great! The chocolate smoked sea salt was delish! I love the taste, texture and richness of homemade ice cream and this was it!
author: Nicole C.

description: it's ok for ice cream shop. the line was too ling and the staff are not so happy... i'll never come back here again
author: B H.

description: Amazing thai chili lime sorbet...that's all I have to say.
author: Lib H.

description: Words cannot describe how amazing this ice cream is-pure delight.  Not only is it organic and delicious, they have very creative and unusual combinations like Chocolate Salty...one of my favorites.  You guessed it, salty sweet combination.  Oh, not to mention their homemade sugar cone....if you like ice cream, you gotta go!  See for yourself, you will not be disappointed.
author: Judi O.

description: 4.5 stars. their secret breakfast ice cream is my favorite in the city. every time i go, i HAVE to buy a pint to take home and stash in my freezer. when i overindulge, the bourbon flavor starts to give me a tingly sensation on my tongue that follows through to my stomach. i just finished my pint today and now i am sad...must make my next trip out to the mission to procure more!
author: Suana W.

description: Even on a cold rainy San Francisco day, the ice cream was oh so yummy.  First of all, they let you sample practically every ice cream flavor -- and there are so many it is so confusing!  The secret breakfast with bourbon and crunchy cornflakes --  a strange combo, but, it hard-core works.   I settled on a "single" with two flavors: blue bottle vietnamese coffee and malted dulce de leche. All I can say is -- WOWIE!
author: Anu Y.

description: I scream, you scream, we all scream for Humphry's ice Cream. Tucked away in the heart of the mission lies an oasis of cold and creamy heavenly delights. My favorite flavor, by far, is the aptly named, "Secret Breakfast". It tastes like bourbon with a hint of cornflakes. Sounds yucky I know....but please, I beg of you, give it a try. The one and only negative about HS is there is very little room to sit inside. But once you've tasted their goods, you won't want to sit down. You'll want to jump for joy...and yes...scream!
author: stan s.

description: This was the first time I have ever eaten ice cream that was so hot it burned! If you like it hot, get the Thai chili lime!
author: barry s.

description: Four words.  Chocolate.  Smoked.  Sea. Salt.  Four more words.  Extra.  Virgin.  Olive.  Oil.  These are apparently flavors.  Good flavors, in fact.  So good that they'll haunt your dreams and force you to concoct evil plans to move to San Francisco where the ice cream is fresher, creamier, and more original than the ice cream in your own po-dunk town.  Okay, okay...Denver does have good ice cream, they've just been on vacation for the month of January.  So...back to Humphry.  You can sample each of the flavors - like the lively and intense balsamic vinegar or the naughtily nice butter beer.  But for me, it is all about sweet and salty.  The extra virgin olive oil is wildly delicious.  It tastes like...um...olive oil!  Really good olive oil with loads of fat and sugar.  It also comes with the ever so slight hint on lemon that gives it a nice touch.  On the other hand the chocolate smoked sea salt is so OMG good.  I'm about to freak out over its rich, creamy, sweet and salty deliciousness.  Since I can only get to SF a couple times a year, I have dedicated myself to cracking its code of yumminess.  In the meantime, if you find yourself near HS, drop on in for a scoop of heaven.
author: Thomas S.

description: It's great, the second you walk in the guy at the counter asks you what would you like to try so we tried 5 flavors which were great! I ended up having the secret breakfast which i thought was the best they had there and i also had the malted luche de leche which was very good. My partner in crime had the valrhona chocolate which was good and yogurt which was yuck for me (too yoghurty) but good for her (depends what you're into). I'm a bigger fan of Bi-rite but they definitely have some very creative flavors... I'll be back to try more.
author: Chris D.

description: Love going in and seeing what crazy flavors they have. I like salt & pepper, olive oil, balsamic caramel
author: A S.

description: Oh my goodness the Oolong Tea flavor may be the most amazing ice cream flavor in the world.
author: Abby Z.

description: WTF?  I actually ate HS on its grand opening day (12/29) and reviewed  it.  Cristofer P. - NOT!
author: Cassie G.

description: What an odd location for a place like this.  In the land of taquerias and other -rias, I found it interesting to see an ice cream spot...named "Humphry Slocombe"??  This is San Francisco after all, so I give it a go.  Quite nice, the Secret Breakfast is very soft and easily fell off my cone onto the sidewalk :( The Vietnamese coffee is equally yummy and strong how I like it.  This is a cute place, and for it to be a warm day I'm surprised it didn't have a line around the corner like the other two shall-not-mention famed creameries in the city.  Two thumbs up!  Unique and cute, with its own special offerings.
author: Jennifer P.

description: Wow, this place is amazing!  Each flavor is unique and innovative, and delicious to boot!  The ice cream is extremely high quality.  The owners are friendly and patient and don't bat an eye if you request to sample every flavor.  My favorites are Secret Breakfast, Dulce de Leche, and McEvoy Olive Oil.  And if you are in for a splurge, try the hot mess!  Definitely worth stopping by.
author: Amie V.

description: If there is a heaven...this place is right at the front gates to greet you. Delicious ice cream, friendly staff and the lines move quickly! Go there if you want the best ice cream of your life!! Sample everything!
author: Paula V.

description: Definitely unique. Came here with my family and waited in the long line. Luckily, there was a few of us that ordered something different. The Secret Breakfast was unique, but I'm not sure I would get it again. I wasn't expecting the alcohol taste. I would come back if I was in the area. The  Pumpkin, Vietnamese Coffee, Tahitian vanilla, and malted chocolate was good. Parking was a pain!!!!
author: Amy M.

description: Delicious.  Maple walnut ice cream....so mapley, so walnutty, so good :)  Def coming back.  Also, the girl behind the counter was very knowledgeable and gave us some fun facts!
author: Allie L.

description:
Oh god yes! Secret Breakfast and Balsamic Caramel with cherries. Every other flavor is also the bomb, especially peanut butter curry. They also have caramels, marshmallows, brittle, and other stuff.
Love!
author: Naomi O.

description:
this place has amazing flavors. i live in los angeles where we have scoops which i just love to death. but scoops has met it's norcal counterpart. i will, for sure, make this ice cream shop a regular stop-in when i return to SF. the secret breakfast sounded so weird to me (bourbon and cornflakes) but tasted devine. the peanut butter curry was really good as well. if i hadn't had a slew of coffee prior, i probably would have wanted a bit of the blue bottle vietnamese coffee flavor as well. 

man. just thinking about this place makes me yearn for more as i sit at my keyboard 380 miles away with blistering heat outside. damnit humphry slocmbe. look what you've done to me!
author: jen m.

description: Their ice cream is pretty much an orgasmic flavor explosion in my mouth. Enough said.
author: Kelly L.

description: So, I'm going to be honest: I've only had the balsamic caramel. This is not because there's a lack of other appealing flavors. Everything sounds great. But I'm so in love with the balsamic caramel that branching out just seems like a waste of money to me. Just wanted to let you know that my 5 stars are based on this single flavor. But go. Get the balsamic caramel. Get anything else. And, if you have any reservations, just ask for a taste!
author: Caitlin M.

description: Absolutely incredible.  Salt 'n pepper (you heard me), secret breakfast (shh), olive oil, spicy thai... who knew these flavors were destined for ice cream.  Adorable place, friendly staff, great prices, and the best ice cream I've ever tasted.  They must have Oompa Loompas in the back.  Move over Willy Wonka.
author: Kevin L.

description: After having some pie at Mission Pie, Hue L. and I decided we needed to get some ice cream to cool us down from the super hot day.  So off to Humphry Slocombe!  There was a tiny line when we got there, but not too bad.  I decided to try Secret Breakfast and the McEvoy Olive Oil.  They were both a little different, but really good.  I liked the Olive Oil more than Secret Breakfast.  It was kind of light and a little zesty.  They have some tables and chairs set up outside so we took our ice cream and sat in the shade while enjoying our ice cream.  It was perfect.  I'll definitely have to go back to try some of the other flavors they didn't have yesterday!
author: Kris L.

description:
wow... this is AMAZING!

i dont even go our for ice cream... yet i went to 'support' a friend. after a few samples, i was lured into 2 scoops. 

the balsamic caramel is insanely orgasmic. it leaves a certain tang on the palette that you never want to go away. 

strawberry jalapeno really allowed you to focus on the actual flavor of the pepper rather than the heat.

salt & pepper was so unique and interesting.

java coffee was like eating a whole bean. the flavor came through with time. 

out of the 4 flavs.... balsamic caramel is a must!!!
author: SF U.

description: I wish I lived in SF just so I can try every flavor! I came here with the intention of getting the Balsamic Caramel. I tried a sample. It was interesting - but a bit too strong, so I opted to for the Black Sesame. Yum! My bf got the Bourbon w/ cornflakes. The bourbon was pretty strong, I probably could have gotten drunk off that. But it was really good. I'll definitely be back the next time I'm in SF!!
author: Carmen C.

description:
deserves the praise for unique flavors.
chaulkboard lists only about 12 at a time, and the popular ones might be sold out, i.e. there was no more secret breakfast, malted dulce de leche, balsamic caramel, cinnamon brittle
there was a new red jesus juice.
double chocolate stout+blue bottle vietnamese coffee, strong flavor, a tad more icey than my beloved bi-rite (which i still prefer)
back again and big news -- now they have a catering cart that you hire for events!
enjoyed the harvey milk and honey with frosted almonds
also the tahitian vanilla with bourbon caramel still a classic
author: Rob C.

description: Exotic flavors. Caramel balsamic was tangy and good but I'm not sure I want a whole scoop.
author: Foodie Y.

description: Lots of interesting flavors; staff is happy to let you try them all!
author: jonathan s.

description: The ice creams/sorbets were interesting and tasty.  I chose the Chocolate Malt (pretty standard), Olive Oil (REALLY delicious) and I had to try the Special Breakfast (oh oh...bourbon in the cereal) but really really luscious!  My honey's selections weren't as nice: Jesus Juice (red wine w/cola) was an interesting concept with a terribly odd taste. The Peach Sake was good but too delicate to follow the Jesus Juice.  Didn't really like the Thai Chili Lime...the skin of the chili was too dominant a flavor and imparted a petroleum after taste. BUT...we'll be back to try other exciting concoctions.
author: Frankie G.

description: What  a disappointment to this long-time ice cream lover.  The store is pleasant enough, and the staff is nice, but the ice cream is essentially very average (despite the self-consciously "clever" flavor combinations).  When I was there, the only ice cream that had chocolate in it was the Ancho Chocolate, which is an unfortunate combination of spicy pepper with otherwise good chocolate; the aftertaste was so unpleasant, I couldn't eat more than two bites.  The Tahitian vanilla was good, but far from great; certainly no better than plenty of store-bought ice cream.  As somebody else mentioned, the texture is especially a letdown: neither creamy nor rich, it's more like ice milk than ice cream.  This place can't hold a candle to Mitchell's.
author: Lucie B.

description:
I gave HS 4 stars though they probably deserve 5. The only reason I knocked them down a bit is because of price. $7.50 for a pint of ice cream, even wonderful ice cream, is a bit much in my opinion. The bacon peanut brittle is to die for, but at $6 for a little bag, I have yet to go beyond the sample dish. 

However, all my experiences there have been terrific. The staff is very friendly, helpful and accommodating., but who cares right? they could be ice cream nazi's and the line would still be out the door like it usually is. 
It's all about the ice cream. 

So far I have tried: (little stars!) 

Secret Breakfast ***** (best flavor yet, great balance. Eat it fast) 
Blue Bottle Viet. Coffee ***** (terrific flavor) 
Olive Oil **** surprisingly good 
Hibiscus Beet **** (my first sorbet there, and very good) 
Balsamic Caramel *** (grows on you, tastes a bit too burned imo) 
Salt & Pepper *** (surprising, but I can't imagine more than a few bites) 

It's a unique place with unique flavors, so the price is bound to be higher than other places. I'm glad they are here, and I hope they do well.

UPDATE July 2015.

I'm so sorry to say, but my recent experience was so bad that I had to return to Yelp to change my initial review of 4 stars down to 2.
 I had two unacceptable issues with my order, a scoop of Fluffernutter and a scoop of Root Beer.
1. Fluffernutter; completely melted ice cream. It was soup, grainy soup. They should never serve ice cream in this condition. It was terrible.

2. Root Beer; full of ice crystals. Ice crystals in ice cream mean the product has been left out to melt considerably and then re-frozen and served again later. For premium ice cream this should never ever happen. It's Ice Cream 101 and it was really disappointing.

I'm willing to stand in the long lines, I'm willing to deal with most of the menu being sold out, these are just how it goes. But I am completely unwilling to deal with being served a sub-standard product that has been treated in an unprofessional manner.
author: Brandon M.

description: It smelt like cream cheese and tasted like cream cheese but it was icecream instead, reallly good icecream I might add!  If I'm craving some good old fashion chocolate or mint chip icecream I am obviously not gonna go here, but if I want something interesting and new this is my new adventurous stop in the mission.
author: Rebecca D.

description: Crazy selection! I assure you no matter how outlandish some sound they are ALL good! The secret breakfast (bourbon and cornflakes) is so good it should be a controlled substance!
author: J E.

description: Six stars, if I could give six. It's 2:10AM, and just seeing the name of this place makes me want ice cream NOW. The Secret Breakfast Ice Cream is KILLER, and I will never forget about it, for as long as I live. I cannot wait to go back and experience the delightful culinary treat that is HSIC's secret breakfast. Goodness.
author: Michelle G.

description: YUMM!  Had lemon thyme sorbet, blue bottle vietnamese coffee, and Jesus juice.  Our toddler loved the lemon thyme.  Is it better than Bi-rite or Mitchells?  I'd have to say each provide unique experiences and are equally as DELICIOUS.
author: I have something to say... A.

description: Not quite Bi-Rite, but pretty darn close. The secret breakfast is everything that's promised - sweet, boozy, with crunchy cereal clusters. Also sampled pretty much everything else - the balsamic caramel and olive oil are the next on my list. The cream cheese chocolate chip was surprisingly good as well.
author: Purnima M.

description: honestly, not worth the long wait. the texture of the ice cream is good, and the flavors are interesting in concept, but all the flavors i tasted were subtle, and not as good as i was hoping. with all the other great places to get ice cream in the city, i'm not sure i'll be coming back here.
author: Whitney G.

description: GREAT PLACE... Love the frosted almond crunch topping.
author: Keisha C.

description: not a fan, out of all of the highly rated ice cream places at sf. the flavors are way too strong/sweet. i think the secret breakfast is pretty special, but the flavor is too rich/creamy for me. other flavors were interesting, but i didn't find it that great.
author: Joyce B.

description: mmm miso white pear! chocolate smoked sea salt!
author: Mika D.

description:
This place was good enough to get me to write my first review.

Went there yesterday and sampled at least half of their flavors.  WOW!!!  I'm not really a dessert person but this place is completely worth it, and worth making an extra stop.

Thought the secret breakfast and Valhrona Fudgesicle were the best of the ten they had out.
author: Jon Q.

description: My new fav place to go for ice cream! Bi-rite is still great, but you can't the beat Balsamic Caramel at Humphry Slocombe! I wan't too sure if I'd like it as I was used to the Ricanela's at Bi-Rite and my first bite/lick was heavenly!
author: Glenn M.

description: Just had an ice cream lunch at Humphry Slocombe.  Still have the gravitational force of balsamic caramel vinegar--can't break that orbit yet.  I did orbit for a new flavor--peanut butter curry; a great compliment of flavors--I enjoy curry everything but if you have a more sensitive palette this might linger a bit.  I love the irreverence on every flavour--and that is great--completely unapologetic for unconventional flavour combinations.   When I was there a customer was explaining to the Humphry Slocombe staff member how passionfruit is uncommon in the United States--I would say a bit pedantic. I almost said really?!?
author: Jaime Patricio M.

description: LOVE LOVE LOVE this place. So delightful. Thankfully the ice cream makes up for the two grumpy rude guys working the counter. I guess when you make ice cream this good you can afford to have mediocre service.
author: Erin D.

description:
ugh...never again am i getting three scoops of ice cream for myself again. i think half a scoop or a quarter scoop of each would have been fine...can't handle a full scoop of each flavor.

the ice cream was really creamy and tasty! i got malted milk chocolate, blue bottle vietnamese coffee, and brown butter. i should have sampled brown butter first 'cause i didn't really like it. the first several spoons of it were alright, but then it just started getting kinda disgusting. i'm actually not a big fan of butter, or at least raw butter. there's a disgusting-ness to it. it was also not as fragrant as i thought it would be. malted milk chocolate and vietnamese coffee flavors were good though. but eating even 1 full scoop left me feeling gross...too much sugar and HORRIBLE feeling in my throat. i finished (most) of it over half an hour ago, but there's still that nasty throat feeling.

tried secret breakfast, carrot mango sorbet, and jesus juice sorbet as well. not a big fan of alcohol, so the first and last were alright. didn't like carrot mango sorbet.

i think i like bi-rite creamery more...but until i try more flavors from both places, that's not certain :)
author: Victoria L.

description:
this would be my 2nd choice if bi-rite was closed.  2 flavors that i like: secret breakfast and the blue bottle viet coffee.

service was great!
author: Dorothy L.

description: THIS PLACE IS AMAZING. I might even like it better than Mitchell's... they have amazing and unique flavors, even beyond the ones at Bi-Rite. Cream cheese chocolate chip anyone? Balsamic Caramel? Miso Pear? And all of them are the best flavors you've ever tasted!! I particularly like their Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee and Valhrona Fudgesicle. I can't wait to go back and try the rest of their flavors. It's located in a cute and not too crowded part of the Mission. Love!
author: Cathy T.

description: Super good!  Believe the hype.  I had two flavors together as per the clerk's suggestion- McEoy olive oil and honey thyme.  It was really yummy, great combo.  I'm stoked because this is near my house so I don't have to go anywhere near Valencia Street or Dolores Park.  Phew.  I can be myself at Humphry Slocombe ice cream.
author: Ann C.

description:
I was visiting family in the bay area and went into the city. After spending a lazy early afternoon at the Golden Gate Park we made a mission to find this Ice Cream shop and get a cool, creamy sugary treat. 

They had just been open a week so they did not have any sundaes or toppings available which they kindly posted an apology for. No problem. The ice cream and it's unique flavor combos were worth it. 

I sampled the Special Breakfast which was rum and cornflakes and something with Guinness and they were pretty good. I ended up with Coconut Sherbet- very good and the Maple Walnut - excellent! Their ice cream is light and almost icy as you let it melt on your tongue and it wasn't too sweet and sugary. I loved it! Would go back in a heart beat!
author: E S.

description: Often people describe ice cream as "sinful" but Humphry Slocombe provides a new twist on this appellation with flavors such as "Secret Breakfast" which is a mixture of Bourbon and Corn Flakes.  And it IS sinful in the traditional confectionery way and for the grandma's got a secret way.  Other flavors such as Blue Bottle (*yes, that hipster San Francisco coffee dream blue bottle*) Vietnamese coffee, Thai Chili and some more standard like Coconut are all a delight.  Definitely try the flavor before you commit as they are quite wonderful but could be polarizing.  This gem of an ice cream shoppe tucked behind Sundance Coffee in the Mission will delight you with their mix of a planned 8-12 flavors at a time all crafted in the little booth right there in the shop.  Nice stools from an old Woolworth lunch counter are a great and inviting touch.
author: Craig S.

description: like bi-rite creamery with more twisted flavors, kinda like a party-happy experimental pregnant girl at a psychedlic picnic came up with them.  I liked the secret breakfast and the balsamic caramel.  I think i'd like all.
author: Today Y.
