description: First trip today, had a scoop of the secret breakfast...and it was delicious.  Any time you can find corn flakes and bourbon in an ice cream, you've got something great.  I'd definitely go back another time for a repeat or to try something new.
author: Matt N.

description: FULL OF FLAVOR. 12 flavors a day--SECRET BREAKFAST is a must try...Jesus Juice tasted too syrupy and almost too gooey for me...however, maybe cause i'm just not a fan of sticky sorbets! However, I loved the texture and the flavor of SB! Browned butter also was delish!  Will be back for those!
author: Veg F.

description: This place is great, the employees are awesome and nice and the ice cream is delicious. I came here and bought a pint of Secret Breakfast as a housewarming gift for a friend who lives near the shop. I was immediately jealous of her proximity to this place after we tried it. I can't wait to get back here and try something else!
author: Matt F.

description: I stopped by over the weekend and tried the salted chocolate. It was amazing if you like novelty flavors and are into salted caramel like me, but even I couldn't finish a kids size scoop because of how seriously salty it was... But I'll definitely be going again.
author: Lilah B.

description:
bourbon cornflake ice cream will get your 5 stars from me any day. 

Just like gramma used to eat for breakfast....
author: Johanna w.

description:
The best ice cream place EVER. I love all the creative flavors because if I wanted boring vanilla, I'd get a pint from Safeway. I tasted a variety of flavors, but I couldn't get enough of the Secret Breakfast (bourbon and corn flakes), the Vietnamese Blue Bottle Coffee, and the Jesus Juice (Coke Classic and red wine... hehe). All were EXCELLENT. 

I suggest that you try before you buy --- sometimes the flavors will surprised you!
author: Cecilia W.

description:
McEvoy Olive Oil & Secret Breakfast.
Never fail.... rain or shine!
author: kyla g.

description:
Now, why didn't I think of combining my three LOVES?!!

Blue Bottle Coffee + Vietnamese Coffee + Ice Cream = YUM! YUM! YUM!

Go here to try combinations you wouldn't think of!  Seriously worth the trip.
author: Ruby F.

description:
I LOVE THE ICE CREAM HERE. 

My family and I came here in the middle of the day on a Thursday? and it was PACKED. There was a line straight out the door. I thought it was just slow service but ends up they are so nice to let everyone feel totally comfortable in asking for samples and explaining the ingredients. I know I tried everything I was curious about in the case :D

The creme fraiche was tart and tasted like a cross between sour cream and the plain yogurt at Pinkberry. Good but not what I was in the mood for. The coconut sherbet had the perfect amount of coconut flavor but since it was a sherbet it was very light. The secret breakfast was perfect for my dad since it was a vanilla ice cream flavored with bourbon with crunchy cereal bits but it was a bit strong for me. The blue bottle vietnamese coffee ice cream was awesome creamy and so intensely coffee flavored it was like 3 cups of cafe sua da  condensed into a scoop of ice cream. I ended up with the McEvoy olive oil, so creamy with bits of citrus zest, it was refreshing and creamy and paired perfectly with my new favorite ice cream ever, RED HOT BANANA. Banana ice cream with pieces of red hots blended in. It was sweet and creamy from the bananas with crunchy cinnamon bits that accentuated the banana flavor. I never thought about half the crazy combinations of flavors they have here, peanut butter and curry? So crazy. Can't wait to try it :D
author: Samantha T.

description:
Great Olive Oil Ice Cream!
Whenever I come to SF I'll Go.
author: Keenan B.

description: Did an ice-cream tasting day and went here and Bi-Rite.  Did the balsamic caramel and it's nothing compared to Bi-Rite's Salted Caramel.  Sorry.  I'm a discerning caramel eater.  Humphrey's is great if your close by.  If you are questing for ice cream, Bi-Rite wins.  However, if you want dipped, MItchell's all the way.
author: T L.

description: i'd love to give this place not just 5 stars bur 555!!! in my understanding that's how ice-cream lover heaven should taste like
author: moa m.

description:
i was wowed by the curious and colorful flavors of ice-cream served at this boutique on the edge of the mission. my cone consisted of two large flavorful scoops: secret breakfast (cereal and bourbon) and vietnamese coffee. 

ironically, the ice-cream parlor is not air-conditioned and lacks ventilation. it was a very hot day, so my cone started melting almost as soon as i got it. we stepped outside, sat down on the planters and had no problem devouring our cones before they melted. my friend went back in for a scoop of red hots ice-cream which she said was tip-top.
author: annie l.

description: mmmmmmmmm.....jalapeno and strawberry ice cream?!!! i love how they create such unexpected flavors.  Must try!
author: Tadaa T.

description: WOW!!!  Different!!!  Secret Breakfast was great - yes - cornflakes (tasted like frosted flakes) and burbon.  Vietnamese Coffee tasted pretty good.  Jesus Juice (wine and coke!  - not that kind of coke Van!!!) was different!!!  Will try other flavors!!  Next time:  Olive Oil or Balsamic Caramel - or heck! whatever they have that I haven't tried yet!!!
author: Ray Y.

description: I like that HS doesn't go overboard on their flavors like a lot of gourmet ice cream joints these years... They tend to be fairly simple - even if unusual - and you can really taste the ice cream, which is delicious. The Secret Breakfast (bourbon & corn flakes) is my personal favorite (no surprise there) and I highly recommend a kid's scoop size. The regular scoop is just too much; too sweet...though tempting b/c you can get two flavors. Still, I say resist and come back another time to try more.
author: Aimee G.

description: It is still early, so not all of their ambitious list of flavors are available yet, but mmmmm! Five Ms. The scooper will tell you that Secret Breakfast is the most popular, but his favorite (and mine) is Balsamic Caramel. Valrhona Fudgesicle is good but that doesn't seem hard to do, when this place can make even Olive Oil ice cream taste great: are they taking flavor dares? I cannot wait to try the Foie Gras. Forget Bi-Rite -- Ici in Berkeley has some stiff competition now, minus their pretension!
author: Ian G.

description: Original, delicious and nice place. Who wouldn't want corn flakes ice cream? Have been back and not a fan of the wine ice cream, but the others are good.
author: sinclair w.

description:
Amazing ice cream + different flavors every day + friendly staff = one happy ice cream addict.  As the other reviews say, the Secret Breakfast is hands down the best flavor.  Other favorites include: Blue Bottle Ice Cream, Root beer, Coconut sorbet, Pumpkin, Toasted Almond, and Tahitian Vanilla. 

Also, do not forget about the toppings! They have the best hot fudge EVER. Today I had the Vanilla with hot fudge and it was scrumptious. Normally the high-end ice cream places make super bitter dark chocolate fudge sauces that IMHO, ruin the sweet, sugary creaminess of the ice cream.  But HS makes this rich, dark chocolate fudge sauce with enough sugar to make it scrumptious, but not so much that it tastes like Hershey's.
author: Melissa E.

description: the only place we must stop at when we visit the city.  seriously!  amazing and they always have a few new flavors.  start with secret breakfast (the coke, bourbon caramel, and secret breakfast float is even better)- you'll thank me.  in the mexicanville part of town, so you can get good tacos/tamales around there, then have ice cream!  sadly, the 2 headed calf wasn't on the wall the last time i went.  the staff wasn't sure where it was, but i have dibs.  always a line so bring an umbrella if it's raining.
author: rosalinda f.

description: i crave secret breakfast when i least expect it, like now. 3:04pm on a wednesday in sunnyvale - where's the h-s ice cream truck when you need it!?
author: Domenique B.

description:
h. slocumb knocked my effen socks off, man.  

the parking gods in the heart of the mission were definitely looking down on me that day when i scored prime time parking half a block away.  but that's not what warrants my 5-star rating.

the blue bottle vietnamese coffee played with my mind.  after ordering, i said to myself, "what the hell?  i'm getting a sample of jesus juice."  that one really rocked my socks and my flip flops - which i wasn't even wearing at the time!  haha!

i also had the balsamic caramel and the surprise breakfast, which were, EH.  i was expecting more corn flakes in the suprise breakfast, but i guess is was a off day.

i look forward to combo'ing their bacon ice cream, with the olive oil flavor and salt and pepper.  maybe they'll do a pancake maple one and i can combo that with coffe.  then i won't have to stop by mc'ds for a big breakfast meal.

oh humphry!  your twitter updates keep me interested, but i just have to let you know - i adore you.
author: Christine P.

description: Went for the first time! I've always been meaning to try this and I was seriously not disappointed! I had a scoop of Secret Breakfast and Cinnamon Brittle! Amazing!
author: John K.

description: yes, yes, yes!!! i had a small, which came with two scoops and i will have to say that i ordered the best two flavors, even better when combined! blue bottle vietnamese coffee and secret breakfast (bourbon and cornflakes) was a great big partay in my mouth! delish flavors apart and pure excitement together. i would like to thank the patron of secret breakfast, such a wise person to come up with a combination like that, utter bliss!!
author: Pamela s.

description: Better than Bi-Rite. Cute and comfortable seating - though I imagine you'll have to fight for one once the word spreads!
author: Emily M.

description: It is an ice cream shop.   The place is clean and organized.  I didn't feel rushed even though there was a line of 20 behind me.  I did not try everything I wanted because seconds earlier I was in this line waiting.  Inventive flavors, but sometimes too inventive on its own.  Salt and pepper was a little too inventive.  The sour cream also fell into this catagory, until the day I had it with fried buttermilk cornbread.  It was a match made in heaven.  The #1, without doubt, best flavor in the entire world of ice cream: Secret Breakfast.  It is so good Blue Bottle uses it for their affogato.  The flavors are always changing, which is when I found myself lucky enough to get a cone of Jesus Juice (red wine and cola).  Even on a cold day, I stop in for a scoop or two when I am in the neighborhood.
author: Justin N.

description: Well I was all excited to try this place out for the first time on the hottest evening of the year and right as we walked up to the line one of the employees plonked down a sandwich board in front of us and said they were closed. At 9:03pm!!! With lots of other people starting to appear. After the cold summer we've had one would think that they'd be grateful for any business at all. The employee was nice enough but it seems like poor business practice to me.
author: James W.

description:
Damn you Humphry Slocombe...

I went to Starbelly for lunch the other day (yummy) and on the dessert menu they had several items featuring Humphry Slocombe ice cream.  I keep hearing about this place...So, today, on one of the hottest days of the year, to hell with the diet...I had a killer ice cream sundae with Buttermilk Strawberry and Wexler Root Beer.  Damn you Humphry Slocombe.  Now I have to decide between you and Bi-Rite.  How will I ever lose this damn weight.  ;-)
author: Eli B.

description: ewwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwww, a bit too weird for me.  my palette is just not that sophisticated i guess to enjoy bacon with my ice cream
author: Chaz N.

description: Very good ice cream... the chocolate with a chili mixed in was amazing, and the cinnamon brittle was also good.  A semi-limited selection of flavors at any time [seemed to be about 16-20] but they covered all the bases and had the more random flavors [Secret Breakfast] as well.  Quite an enjoyable ice cream cone.
author: Alured P.

description: This place has some truly wacky flavors, but most of them are really great. This probably isn't the place for everybody, since the flavors are definitely unusual. But if you are adventurous and like to try new things you're going to love it. My fave at the moment is Peanut Butter Curry, with big chunks of curry spice tossed in. SUPERB!
author: Becky P.

description: A very interesting (and delicious) ice cream shop.  I came here with my friend who is an aspiring pastry chef.  She hadn't warned me of the unique flavors this place offered so I was a bit surprised when I saw the candy capps, prosciutto and olive oil ice cream.  Beneath each flavor they wrote creative phrases such as "Prosciutto - real pig parts."  I ordered the olive oil and the secret breakfast.  Both were very good.  I really liked the texture of the olive oil.  And the secret breakfast had very good flavors too.  I will look forward to coming back to try more of these unique flavors.
author: Brent G.

description:
this place is more bi-rite than bi-rite.  it's all about novelty - wacky sounding flavor combinations and exotic names.  

but unlike bi-rite, the wacky flavors lack subtlety and don't make you think "of course that should be a flavor!"  and the exotic names, well if you want to call it "blue bottle vietnamese coffee", go ahead, but it still tastes like coffee ice cream.  

i am an equal-opportunity ice cream lover, and would gladly eat ice cream here anyday, if i were in the neighborhood.  but now that i'm over the novelty, it's not worth the effort to go out there - the hours are limited, and parking is too impossible for a spontaneous visit.
author: Amy H.

description: Been here a few times and tried a few of their flavors, all the ones I tried were pretty awesome!  Also, they do close at 9 pm so beware of that !.. I 've never really had to wait in a very long line like at Bi-Rite and Mitchells so that is a major PLUS.   My favorite is of course.. the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee.. the coffee flavor is strong and bitter the ice cream is not too sweet which is good.  They also have some really "unique" and difference flavors.  Their most popular is the Secret Breakfast.. what's secret about it is the strong bourbon taste with crunch sweetness of cornflakes!  What a surprise taste it was!   The Boccalone Proschutio was a bit WIERD in my opinion.. however if you're a bacon ice cream or bacon toffee lover .. that is you love the flavors of sweet maple or sweet toffee and salty/smoky meat flavor together.. you'll really like this ice cream flavor.. not my kinda thing.  Peanut Butter lover?... make sure you get the flutter nutter.. tastes like a liquid nutter butter !  Another unique yet delicious flavor is the Honey Thyme... I always thought Honey ice cream was so refreshing (try the Haggen Daaz Honey Bee ice cream).. but with the Thyme, it really took this ice cream to another dimension! Was very much a summer treat.  Most people come here for their really one of a kinda flavors but if you love your plain ice cream flavors, there's something for everyone.  Try the Meyer LEmon sorbet, Tahitian vanilla or Chocolate.. you won't be disappointed!  The great thing about this place is the rotating flavors so everytime you go there, you always find something new to try with so many flavors I still look forward to trying.. Guinness gingerbread, basalmic caramel, butter beer, russian imperial stout, pom coconut ale, "collaborative evil ale"..?  GOSH I sound like more than a ice cream monster... I am an alcoholic ...
author: Margie C.

description: Really good ice cream and priced rather fairly for an ice cream shop in the city. Came here after we found dynamo donuts were out and we needed to eat something sweet. Thank you humphry slocombe.
author: Joel J.

description: Came here for a meeting and the ice cream is to die for.  Love the Vietnamese flavor one.  I do suggest sampling before you start ordering.  I order something called balsamic caramel and that one tasted a bit funny.  Breakfast was good.  The place is cute.  It's a cash only spot so bring your cash and your sweet tooth.
author: Mimi S.

description: This place was good.  Large scoops for a single, but even better was the exotic tastes that blended well. Secret Breakfast, what a interesting mix but awesome execution. Place is small,  one row of seats, but otherwise non-descript on a side street.
author: Alan P.

description: Very unique flavors. was excited to get the breakfast flavor i think its a flavor mix btw corn flakes and rum. was good at first, but i got tired of the flavor real fast. the alcohol flavoring was too strong for me. I had a sample of the vietnamese coffee one and that one was really good! cute place and really cheap.
author: krystina ann r.

description: OH YEAH! Loved the Jesus Juice and the Secret Breakfast. Also liked visiting with the Dead Head who seems to have replaced his penchant for drugs with HS ice Cream! He said he had been there three times already that day and would be back yet again.....he had also taken home a few pints for in between.  Would give this a five, but was one star short due to flavors that did not appeal to me....but hey......go get some and enjoy!
author: Karen W.

description: Hello, these people sell weird ice cream flavors and it's not as crowded as Bi-Rite, and the flavors aren't as weird there anyway. I recommend olive oil and honey & thyme.
author: Amy Z.

description: this place is soooooooooo good! i first tried humphry when they had a booth at the ferry plaza farmers market.  then they stop showing up so now i make weekly trips to their store in the mission to get the secret breakfast! one of the best flavors of all time.
author: Michael E.

description: Guinness Gingerbread, Balsamic Caramel, and Secret Breakfast...amazing. I can only describe each experience as a long, deep, sexy kiss! ;-D I've got to go back and try something edgier, I can only imagine what the prosciutto or strawberry and black olive taste like *?* . If anyone has suggestions, let me know!
author: Julia F.

description: got the secret breakfast...a lot of bourbon.  great rich ice cream...it worth waiting in line
author: JAN I.

description:
Oh yeah!  So good!  Yum!

A simple little ice cream shop with a few stools and one counter.  Extra seating is outside under the awning.  What sets it apart is the imagination in the flavours.  In the ice cream and in other treats like lard caramels, HS is creating goodies that you can't get anywhere else.  In fact, I expect that most places don't have the cojones to put some of these foods together.

The staff is friendly; the servings are perfect portions for a treat; and the two-headed calf is awesome.
author: Ryan T.

description: Although the variety of flavors was good and texture nice, every flavor I had was just too damn sweet except for the viet coffee. I also tried Jesus Juice and Secret Breakfast. I wondered why there are so many damn twitter followers for this place and we waited 20 minutes. Jeni's Ice Creams from Columbus is richer, smoother and the flavors will knock you out without the sugar punch I felt with Humphry Slocombe. Luckily they now carry this at a few stores in the Bay Area.
author: Lee E.

description: I think the Secret Breakfast flavor at Humphry Slocombe is genius. Absolute genius. I crave it - I think about it at the strangest times and calculate how long it will take to run down to the shop and grab a scoop. Bourbon in ice cream?! Bourbon in anything is a good idea to me, but paired with cornflakes it is so delicious. The Vietnamese Coffee also is a favorite - not too sweet, sugary, so balanced. I think that is the key to the consistency of flavors here - balanced. Humphry Slocombe has found a way to get under my skin. Jake Godby named his mecca of flavor after two characters from the popular British farce Are You Being Served? And that in itself endears this already very popular ice creamery to me. Clever, cheeky, delicious, original. I hope this business stays in San Francisco's Mission forever. I heart you Humphry Slocombe.
author: Tom R.

description: this place is pretty awesome. when i went i got the vietnamese blue bottle coffee ice cream and it was so goooood. the only thing is that my friend found a hair in her ice cream but when she told the workers they were glad to get her another cup of ice cream. i am most def coming back here again.
author: Jessica C.

description:
O yum! I follow what special flavor that they have on twitter, but its the posting that cracks me up!!!

I am on a personal mission to try ALL the flavors!!!

Personal favorites:
-Peanut Butter Curry
-White Miso Pear
-Balsamic caramel
-Cream Frachise (dont know how to spell)

Tried:
-Salt and Pepper (yeah, it taste like salt and pepper, well how 'bout that!)
-Blue Bottle Vietnamese coffee (yums...best coffee ice cream i tried)
-McEvoy olive oil (surprisingly good! not overwhelming and oily LOL)
-Oolong (like licking cold solidify tea, captured the flavor perfectly)
-Peanut butter curry (more peanutbutter than curry, its the after flavor that is curry and its settle without be too strong)
-Secret breakfast (too strong for me)
-Red hot banana (shit was spicy, can't feel my taste buds so I can't review! i dont like spice but i tried it anyways)
-Tahitian Vanilla (basic, but done better than most places. Great with off  the wall flavors)
-Thai chili lime (SPICY! tried because it was free)
-Valrhona fudgesicle (kinda thick for my taste)
-Balsamic caramel (Taste like caramel when first enters mouth, but ends with the BANG of vinegar)
-Honey thyme (taste like honey to me)
-Milk chocolate passionfruit (dont remember what i thought)
-Hibiscus beet (overwhelming flavor of beet, i dont like)
author: Winny L.

description:
despite being my second home for a year, the 24th street side of the mission is largely uncharted territory for me.  i was definitely in awe (and hunger) as i meandered past the options (countless mexican) to our destination - humphry slocombe.

walking into his ice cream shop is like walking into a well-kept secret.  sampling his ice cream is a creative journey that hits quite possibly every dimension of your palate. salt & pepper, thai chile lime, olive oil - oh yes, ice cream CAN taste like this.  they rotate through their unique flavors, so i'll have to come back for gingerbread.  ...and GREEN TEA BLACK SESAME.  omg, it's like chinese dessert in ice cream form i can't wait!  

for now i'll make do with the secret breakfast - one bite and you will never look at corn flakes the same way again.  MMM yummy.

btw if you want go on a culinary adventure and eat your way through the other end of the mission, let me know! you can start with the foie gras ice cream :)
author: Dee C.

description: weird ice cream -- yum! long freakin line -- boo!
author: ray m.

description: My first taste of Humphrey Slocombe consisted of the Special Breakfast (bourbon and cornflakes...yeah, you read that right) and the Malted Dulce de Leche. My roomies had the Vietnamese Coffee and Salt and Pepper. All were delicious, although I thought the SB was a little too light on the bourbon. Otherwise, give this place a shot when the allure of Bi-Rite Creamery, Mitchell's, and Bombay Creamery don't beckon as strongly.
author: Raffy E.

description: Pure bliss!  After eating this stuff, you'll never want to eat Dreyer's or anything from the grocery store!  So rich and creamy, this is how ice cream should taste!  With flavors like balsamic caramel and olive oil, your taste buds will be so happy!  I've yet to try the foie gras ice cream cookies because they sell out so fast, but now I know to call in advance in the morning (usually mid-week) to have some saved for me to pick up later in the day.
author: Lily S.

description: interesting flavors, i particular love the salad dressing with strawberry flavor. normally i am a safeway select vanilla fan, but humphrey brought me out of my creamy shell into experimental tongue sensations. plus one star for decent looking females
author: Merland S.

description:
This place is tight and outta sight!! I mean I am a girl that loves her some Bi-Rite creamery Salted Caramel but Humphry you had me at Bacon Peanut Brittle.....yes you read that right!! Bacon Peanut Brittle...it was gooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooodddddddddddddddddd as hell!! Salty and Sweet nuff said.....

A co-worker told me about this place and after having healthy lunch at Whole Foods we decided to drive by and check this place out. Our ice-cream maven Lori was sweet and took her time with us and our need for taste after taste. We did not feel rushed even as a line began to form. She was even nice enough to tag up some of the bacon brittle right away so we could purchase it (she was in the middle of bagging them up as we walked in) I tasted the Olive Oil and Secret Breakfast both were creamy and good. I am not sure about the texture of the secret breakfast but it was intriguing to me since I love to add cereal to my ice-cream...i know I am freak..... I opted for a scoop of the Balsamic Caramel and initially I thought that it replaced my beloved Salted Caramel but upon additional licks I realized that it was too much for me...it was good but not great!! I will for sure return with the Hubbz to get his thoughts and to try new flavors...anything with bacon will do me right!!
author: T H.

description: I love ice cream, but my favorite flavor is Mint Chip and I'm fine with having it every time I have ice cream. They change flavors every day and they didn't have Mint Chip that day. I'm not really attracted to the unique flavors they offer, like Secret Breakfast and Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee. I ended up getting the Strawberry Shortcake, since I waited all that time in line. Although it wasn't bad, I just couldn't finish it. The staff is very friendly and helpful though. Maybe it's just because I'm not attracted to these unique flavors with interesting names.....
author: Kimberly N.

description:
I just moved from living a half a block away from this place and it's sad. Their ice cream is delicious and worth every penny. 

This is the kind of place you walk to, grab your ice cream and head out with your family/friends and walk to your next destination. The inside has a few seats but isn't meant for sitting. There are a few seats outside so you could chill there...  but really, it's a get-the-ice-cream-and-go type place.

Great flavors, realistic prices, biodegradable spoons/cups and washable tasting spoons... and great flavors :)
author: Eric W.

description: It's been less than a year, but already Secret Breakfast is my perennial favorite.  And their Jesus Juice?  Lord have mercy!  I'm finishing up the pint right now.
author: Tijanna E.

description: Came here for dessert after having dinner nearby.  I heard about all the crazy, creative flavors they whip up there, so I was super excited to give it a try.  You can see the glow of the ice cream shop from a block away. It was around 9pm and the place was packed, line out the door.  A chilly SF evening wasn't enough to deter people from ice cream, I guess. So we got in line and looked at all the options on the wall.  They had some pretty unique concoctions, like the secret breakfast (bourbon & corn flakes) and strawberry margarita. For some reason, I just wasn't feeling the flavors.  Maybe I'm just a simple ice cream eater and prefer flavors like vanilla or chocolate.  So, after looking long and hard and sampling a few things, I settled on the malted chocolate.  My hubby got the secret breakfast, which he really enjoyed.  I tried it but couldn't really taste the bourbon.  It was also a bit too sweet for me.  My BFF got the tin roof sundae, which was surprisingly good.  She got one scoop of the tahitian vanilla and one scoop of the black sesame, topped with fudge and crunchy nuts.  The ice cream flavors were good (because I like classic flavors), but the nuts were awesome.  They were crunchy with a hint of saltiness, so perfect with the sundae.  I would come back again to give their other flavors another try.
author: Kat M.

description: The obvious comparison is Bi-Rite, but I think the two are pretty different. I get more of a homemade sensation from HS. The beet hibiscus and the kumquat poppyseed are both very good, as is the vanilla and, yes, the secret breakfast.
author: Maximillian M.

description: Pretty good.  Some of the choices are a bit too sweet and adventurous but I fully recognize its a personal preference.
author: K C.

description: I love LOVE LOVE this place!  It is SO much better than Tara's or can I say it . . . Bi-Rite!  They give you generous scoops, and are super-generous with the tasting samples!  My goodness, I just discovered their beer-flavored ice cream and the tart yogurt with apricot!  I am never disappointed with the options even when my first choice is sold-out.  The people behind the counter are so nice too -- and know how flavors complement each other.
author: p. w.

description: I walked into HS today for the second time ever. My first experience last week was phenomenal so I couldn't wait to go back again, this time with my fiancee and 2 sons and I had been talking it up all week to all my clients. Then i got my scoop, and it fell on the floor as to no fault of my own...  just was a small mishap. When i asked the man behind the counter for a second scoop, he got very rude, was sarcastic, and gave me a scoop about half the size of the previous scoop. My fiancee was so shocked by this mans attitude toward me, he no longer wanted the ice cream we had  looked forward to all day. Because of the customer service, I will not only never go back, but I will never recommend it to any more of my clients. It's too bad, all the other workers seemed happy and kind. Not the tall guy with the shaved head! He must have just had a bad day. But please don't take it out on me. Small mistake turned into a bad review and no more business on my end.
author: christina p.

description:
The olive oil was good, but kinda crumbly -- which is weird for ice cream -- it was difficult to keep it on my spoon. That said, it was really tasty, which is why I ordered a scoop (perhaps they were inspired by the sundae at Bi-Rite that includes sea salt and Bergamot Olive Oil? I'm not saying, I'm just saying...).  The Guinness Ginger Cookie was really tasty, and I am also a big fan of the Balsamic Caramel -- the balsamic vinegar cuts the cloying sweetness of the caramel, which usually turns me off in other caramel-based ice-cream flavors. I think they will eventually give Bi-Rite a run for the money (though they cost about the same) once they iron out some of their consistency issues (i.e., as in the literal consistency of the ice cream, not the quality). I also tried the Cream Cheese Chip, which was okay, but didn't seem interesting enough to merit adding cream cheese, or highlighting it in the name. 
Definitely nice that it's not so crowded this time of year, so they're happy to let you sample 'as many or as few flavors as you would like'. (That's what the very friendly server told me. So sample to your heart's content! (Oh, and their sample spoons are very cool, if a bit awkward to transfer from one person to another. They're tiny!)
And I almost forgot -- the Secret Breakfast is really tasty, too!
I'll def be back for more. Looking forward to the launch of the sundaes. (Sounds like a movie, no? The Launch of the Sundaes. Be Prepared. Bring Your Own Spoon.)
author: Tal R.

description: An incredibly delicious ice cream shop three blocks from my house that plays The Cure, is enviromentaly friendly and serves ice cream with flavors such as Burbon and Cornflakes and Bluebottle Coffee. It's so ridiculously cool that I'm nearly embarrassed.
author: bonnie b.

description: I just tasted their Blue Bottle Coffee, Salted Licorice and Olive Oil, and those flavors are to die for! Though the names sounds exotic and very salty, Jake does an awesome job in creating great flavors! I tasted the Salt and Pepper flavor, and it really tasted of salt and pepper! The ice cream here is definitely made in the store! Jake and Sean are almost always there, and you can catch Jake making ice cream in his room on the side of the counter. I am so glad that this ice cream parlor opened in my neighborhood!!!!!
author: Helen L.

description: Friendly, helpful staff that hands out free samples. My favorite: Hibiscus Beet! Such a crazy, but really tasty flavor!
author: Dani S.

description:
I heard about this place while living in San Diego and within the first week of my moving back to the city, I found myself at Humphry Slocombe! My parents, brother and I decided to split two two-scoop cups. Luckily, my parents waited in the car, leaving us to pick the flavors! We chose fudgesicle (a super rich version of the childhood treat), Tahitian vanilla (creamy and a bit bland, but what do you expect with vanilla), black sesame (delicious, nutty and creamy) and Vietnamese coffee (great, strong coffee flavor). 
I'd definitely go back for the Vietnamese coffee and to try their other, more exotic rotating flavors. when we were there, they highly rated secret breakfast was not available :(
author: Lauren K.

description: I'm hooked on Humphrey Slocombe. Their ice cream and sorbet flavors are intense and lusciously rich. During my first visit I tried the Secret Breakfast and enjoyed the drunken cornflake flavor. Also sampled were the Valrhona sorbet-  decadent and deep-lick-the-roof-of-your-mouth-after-a-bite. The strawberry jalapeno was a balanced blend of sweet with a spicy finish. I found myself savoring every thimble-full of ice cream tried, my mouth rediscovering the flavors as if the first time over and over again. Totally worth a two bus trip for a scoop!
author: Annelies Z.

description: Very unusual and fresh ice cream combinations.    We loved the creativity, freshness and excellent service.    Will definitely be back -- thanks for giving us such a great choice in artisan ice cream!
author: Jim S.

description: A truly great place to ruin your appetite. The 8 ball stout was pretty good, but to be honest, I wasn't going to stand there trying each and every flavor to find the best one before I finally decided to make a purchase. I'm sure there are better ones to be had. I'll have to check this place again. I really liked that there was no silly line going around the block. Easy in and out and a more or less friendly staff. We'll see how this place holds up visit after visit.
author: rob k.

description: Everyone goes here for the ice cream, but man the cookies are really good!! Try one.
author: mindy s.

description: I love this place! The ice cream is different. I love the strawberry, but I tried almost all the flavors. There was a salt and pepper flavor that tasted just like salt and pepper! and it wasn't half bad! The other flavors were innovative and delicious, but I loveloveloved the strawberry one. It's kind of expensive for ice cream, though. The location is also a little out of the way.
author: Shizuka L.

description:
very very very good ice cream!
it isn't just any ice cream or typical ice cream (vanilla, chocolate..etc. ) you got the point.  Their flavors are very unique that once you tried it, you will want to go back!

Sesame ice cream is as good as i tried it in Kyoto, Japan!
I also got the Secret Breakfast that everyone was prattling about and you know what, they are CORRECT!  Secret breakfast ice cream is top rated ice cream in the world!

Parking might be hard, but it's worth the walk.
author: James L.

description: The best ice cream I've ever had.  I don't even like ice cream, and I force anyone who's never been here to go with me.  My favorite is the balsamic caramel.
author: Shirin O.

description: Been meaning to add my voice to the choir of how wonderful this ice cream truly is. The Secret Breakfast is of course awesome, but the Beet/Hibiscus sorbet is a revelation. It's quite possibly the best sorbet I've ever eaten. Try it after rich beef dinner as a palate cleanser, you won't be disappointed.
author: Richard R.

description: Balsamic Caramel. Best ice cream of my life. Period.
author: Jess F.

description: exquisitely crafted ice cream in never-before-heard-of flavors served by cute hipsters.  i can't really think of anything better :)
author: Rebecka J.

description: Sweet Summer Corn was surprisingly good! I don't see the appeal in salt n' pepper. Secret Breakfast is a treat for bourbon enthusiasts. I hate sweets, but these unique flavors sounded so interesting I had to try them. Definitely a fun spot to visit. Can't wait to try goat cheese strawberry!
author: Jessica O.

description:
I'm not a huge ice cream fan by any means, but this place is ridiculously good.  It's probably good that I don't live in SF, because I would get fat from eating here all the time.  

Came here on a Friday afternoon.  If feel like this is a place that you would never find without very specific directions because the building is so poory marked and kinda hidden away on the corner.  Parking is also a pain, but that's SF for you.  However we were lucky and there was hardly any line.  Got 2 scoops, the special breakfast and brown butter (or something along those lines), and the gf got special breakfast and coffe.  Ok so...best ice cream experience of my life.  The special breakfast is amazing...delicious but not too sweet vanilla with corn flakes soaked in bourbon?  Yeah, sign me up.  And the brown butter had little bits of actual creamy butter in it.  Wow.  What a combination.  The coffee ice cream was great as well...actually tasted like coffee, but not too strong.  Price is fair, 4 bucks for two scoops of ice cream this good is fine with me.  Would have to try Bi-Rite to compare...but I dunno how it could possibly be better.  I'm sure it's annoying if you have to wait in line though.  But I'm also sure it's worth it.
author: Andrew L.

description: simply delish. Great, unique flavors, some more successful than others. I will always have room for humphrey!
author: marc S.

description: I  really like the ice cream here... went on a sweltering day and had the balsamic vinegar flavor, and tried my friend's Vietnamese coffee and curry flavors... If you live near 24th bart, just walk down to Harrison Street and hang a left. Delicious ice cream awaits..
author: Heleena H.

description:
definately better than bi-rite i think and they just might be nipping at mitchells heels depending on what one feels like that day.  more sophisticated flavors than mitchells for sure but when it comes to weird south east asian flavors and variety then mitchells is it.  although right now i'd say this would be the place i'd go next few times i'll feel like ice cream.

the secret breakfast - bourbon and corn flakes was heaven!  i love ice cream with booze in it.  this might be my favorite ice cream yet. same with the kumquat with poppy seeds with biggish chunks of kumquat.  skyscraping glucose levels be damned this is good stuff.  

balsamic caramel and the olive oil go really well together.  they have a flavor called vO*U@#! or something like that.  its really good - sesame seeds and black tea i think.  reminds me of drinking tea and eating those dim sum sesame balls together with dairy.
author: X X.

description: I grew up on British television - so I was tickled to see the reference to a couple of my favorite characters on Are You Being Served. Doubly tickled about the fact that they are within walking distance from our loft. I had Vietnamese Coffee with my Secret Breakfast the first time. It was wonderful! Tried Rosemary's Baby with a scoop of Olive Oil the next, and they were also great. My partner can't seem to get enough of the Tahitian Vanilla. Can't wait for the trendies to go away though. I hate waiting in line for my ice cream.
author: Rey L.

description:
One time and I am hooked...this is going to be somewhat expensive and fattening addiction.

I love the bluebottle coffee flavor.....and the secret breakfast, so great!  Their menu of flavor is a little unconventional, but I guarantee, the combinations are awesome.
author: Lara F.

description:
4.5 stars...my first visit so maybe i will give it 5 over time?

secret breakfast (8/10): i wont spoil the secret, but its a pretty decent combo.  i got a pint of this but the whole damn thing melted on me in just a few minutes!

red hot banana (9/10): i dont really like red hots, but this flavor is surprisingly good.  red hots broken up with banana ice cream.  who knows how this combination came to be...

guiness gingerbread (7/10): i think this flavor sounds better than it tastes.  its good, but nothing to write home about.  little chunks of gingerbread with a little hint of beer.

straus yogurt (8/10): it was what i expected it to be.  true yogurt flavor here, not like your safeway yogurt.  acidic, tangy, sharp.  pretty good as a base flavor.

blue bottle vietnamese coffee (9/10): this is their best flavor.  i put this on the bottom of my guiness shortbread and they went well together.  im not sure why its "vietnamese".  does this mean the coffee was prepared viet style?  really strong and left to drip slowly?

balsamic caramel (5/10): this flavor just didnt work.  i dont think balsamic vinegar goes with caramel.  sorry.  i wouldnt ever put them together in the kitchen either.  the balsamic flavor was just too strong.  and of course i have to compare to bi-rite's salted caramel flavor, which is the best ice cream flavor in the entire universe.
author: Robert S.

description:
OMG! Whoever thought that I, a certified chocoholic purist, would have tried, let alone loved balsamic caramel ice cream! Decided to live on the edge the other night & Balsamic Caramel sounded so interesting and unimaginable, so I tried it, loved it, and ordered  a cone. Being the choco-fiend I am, I couldn't pass up a scoop of Chocolate Candied Ginger on top. 

One word: Heaven. 

Some more words: the best twenty minutes (or however long it took me to chow down) I've had in a long long time! 

Bonus:  a "single" size cone can be 2 flavors!

I can't describe Balsamic Caramel. You just have to try it. Also had a lick of the Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee and I'm not a coffee-ice cream fan, but that was awesome.

Bottom Line: go here, now & often. that's my plan.
author: Lisa M.

description:
Great "foodie" ice cream shop that combines many new-fangled flavors into basic ice cream.

Be sure to try "Secret Breakfast" - cornflakes & bourbon flavored ice cream or "Jesus Juice" - red wine and coca-cola classic flavored ice cream.

HS is not open on Monday, and be prepared for a line (athough it tends to be shorter than Bi-Rite at the moment).
author: Ben M.

description: when i was age 13 licking my $1 vanilla ice cream at thrifty's, never would i imagine that 15 years later i would be experiencing flavors like "salt and pepper" and "secret breakfast" (bourbon + cornflakes). i didn't like the salt and pepper but i loved the secret breakfast and pepper + mint. very inventive and original!
author: Marian C.

description: I had my first adventure to Humphry Slocombe's this weekend... It's such a random ice cream shop in the midst of taquerias and warehouses. I took a look at the place from the car...lots of people were there waiting in line--that's always a good sign. My friend then told me about bacon ice cream. I like bacon chocolate...let's give bacon ice cream a try. I gave it a taste. Not my cup of tea, so I went ahead with a couple more tastings thai chile, balsalmic vinegar + caramel, olive oil, and finally secret breakfast. My tastebuds were definitely working overtime. I decided on the secret breakfast (something something with bourbon?)...delish!
author: Carrie W.

description: Crazy interesting flavors of ice cream and sorbet,  I tried the McEvoy olive oil, and burbon and cornflakes (I think it was called surprise breakfast?). On their website they list all the flavors they make, which is a lot. but they only offer 10-12 a day. - I wish I could find out when they were going to have certain flavors - I'd love to try the sour cream.
author: C D.

description:
caramel and balsamic ice cream sounds disgusting. olive oil? i bet it's vile.

but then, i tried some, and oh it was so so tasty. also sampled secret breakfast, which was superb. i'll definitely be stopping by again when i'm in the neighborhood.
author: Dana D.

description: Great concept, friendly service, creative flavors. See my review on my blog at my blog (see my profile for the link).
author: Danielle S.

description: Bleh, way overrated by these 5 star people. It's ok for one visit just to see what the hype is all about but I wouldn't go back. The chocolate was the only flavor I'd even consider, the rest are just faux sophisticated mixes of obscure ingredients. Kind of seems like a joke is being played on you with the weirdness. This would make a great SNL skit situation about how dumb foodies can be. Would you really go back for another scoop of peanut butter/bacon?
author: Shay L.

description: Good ice cream.  Probably 3.5 stars but I rounded down instead of up because people seem a little overly exuberant.  Tried secret breakfast and hibiscus beet sorbet.  Both were quite good.  I like their edgy flavors, but some are useless unless you're trying to meet an Iron Chef special ingredient requirement (olive oil?  salt-n-peppa?).  I look forward to seeing their flavor offering evolve.  Overall very solid, I recommend you try and I wish them well, but if you walk in expecting to be blown away you won't be.
author: Al K.

description: Delicious and lovely flavor options.  I had the Szechuan Pepper Strawberry sorbet and honey thyme ice cream - both were amazing.  Some of their flavors are nice and subtle while some is sharp and pronounced.  I recommend taking a taste first to figure out what you'll like.  I loved most of the flavors I tried.
author: Vila B.

description: Hands down if you like ice cream you have to try this place - it's blissful and refreshing, rebellious change for people who frequent Bi-Rite Creamery.  I've seen some people on Yelp tripping out because of truly outrageous (meaning awesome) flavors -- don't fall into this trap -- the proprietors here are very generous with providing tastes so explore what they have and find something you like - personally I don't know how you can go wrong with cornflakes and bourbon (Secret Breakfast), Strawberry Balsamic, or Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee (beats the socks off of Bi-Rites Ritual Coffee Toffee!).  I've even had a flavor with Guinness and ginger - actually quite nice...
author: WW R.

description: Love it.  Just got back, like 5 minutes ago.  It's a real good thing I don't live in the Mission, or else I'd be here a lot.  I'm getting chubby enough without their help, thank you very much!
author: Ian M.

description:
ice cream (out of 3 stars max) = 0.5 - found a piece of plastic in my ice cream, poor quality control, too sweet in general, texture not the best

location/vibe = 0.5 - smelly area!

service = 1 - offered me a refund due to the plastic - ok overall

Would not return - too many other good ice cream shops!
author: Ben P.

description: This ice cream was amazing and it is not just hype.  I thought I would try some weird flavor and end up just getting a basic chocolate, but the olive oil was really good.  I did end up going pretty basic because I love Blue Bottle coffee and was excited about getting it in ice cream form.  My husband got prosciutto and it was good too!!  You really can't go wrong and even the "odd" ones are actually quite tasty!  Plus they are very liberal with the tastings and don't make you feel guilty, so you can really decide which is best for you.
author: Suzanne E.

description:
Went here today and I liked the ice cream a lot! I had the Tahiti Vanilla and my girlfriend went for the olive oil. Both were not very sweet but tasted fabulous and got better the more you ate of it. It was not cheap but the great taste compensated for that.
The atmosphere in the place is pretty retro and the interior is pretty spartanic.

That being said, this place is not as good as Bi-Rite. I decided to give this place 5 stars anyway since it still deserves them although Bi-rite is way up there. I wouldn't give The French Laundry 3 stars because El Bulli is way better either.
There also is less of a line and I find the location convenient since it's only 2 blocks away from the El Tayonese Taco-truck and therefore makes a perfect desert opportunity.
author: Alexander M.

description: if you're going to come here, don't bother trying to count your calories, just seize the moment and order the "hot mess" (note: I prefer to sub chocolate for the butterscotch). You will thank me later and realize that sometimes you have to indulge to understand how great life can be...one spoonful at a time.
author: Leslie T.

description: I love ice cream. And Humphry Slocombe was a definite highlight tonight. I've been to Bi-Rite and fell in love with their Salted Caramel. Now I'm trying to decide if I love Humphry Slocombe's Balsamic Caramel even more. Special Breakfast was very good, but I'm a fan of alcohol in dessert, period. I had the Vietnamese Coffee, which was probably the best coffee ice cream I've had in awhile. I tried the Salt n' Pepper, which was really interesting, but don't think I could have an entire scoop of it. Like the simple, bright interior, and the fact that they keep it very warm inside ;-) They're great about letting you taste as many flavors as you'd like. A definite must-visit if you're in the Mission.
author: Lily Y.

description: Humphry's ice cream is amazing! Vietnamese coffee ice cream is strong but not overwhelming. Olive oil was tasty.  I usually hate vanilla ice cream but here at humphrys, it's fantastic. I had their vanilla ice cream with hot fudge and FROSTED PEANUTS. It is to die forrrrr :) make sure to check this place out if you're ever passing through south city!!
author: Katie H.

description: the first time I went here, I had the safe Blue Bottle Coffee flavor.  I went back and tried out a few more, whoa. whoa yuck and whoa yum.  I hope they get more options bc I'm totes into trying different things. I just can't get with the balsamic whatchallit or the salt one that tasted like cold creamy wet pizza on a spoon. whoa.
author: aleks k.

description: I've only been there once, but I'm already scheming about how to get back.  We got browned butter and chocolate mango, and hubby and I nearly came to blows over the last few bites.  Good stuff!
author: H A.

description: still love the secret breakfast. happy to say they changed the blue bottle vietnamese coffee so that it is not gritty and more smooth in your mouth. mmm... the red hot banana was an interesting combination of flavors...
author: Annie c.

description: If your palate favors beer and meat and ice cream that's super sweet and rich, this is the place for you! I appreciated the denseness of the ice cream, but I prefer ice cream that's less sugary.
author: Aiko S.

description:
We went there this weekend since I've been wanting to try it out for awhile.  The flavors and textures were really creative --Cheese and Rice (mascarpone and arborio), Secret Breakfast, Salt and Peppa and McEvoy Olive Oil and Balsamic Caramel were some I recall on the menu.  

The McEvoy Olive Oil was fruity with bits of lemon and orange peel (very tasty) and Blue Bottle Vietnamese coffee had a smoothness to it, like no other.  I like what they are doing but still prefer Bi-Rite Creamery.  Thanks for pushing the envelope and opening our taste buds, Humphry Slocombe!
author: Carol K.

description: very unique flavors. The costumer service was very helpful and friendly. My friend and I tried just about every flavor before we ordered.
author: Sarah W.

description: Service was quick and friendly and it surprisingly wasn't hard to find seats, considering the line was almost out the door. I appreciate that right off the bat they offer samples of whatever. I had the Secret Breakfast and the Vietnamese Coffee which were good. This is the kind of place I'd go to if I wanted ice cream but didn't know exactly which flavor I wanted.
author: Micaela G.

description: Just because it's possible to do something, doesn't mean it's good to do it. The flavors here are bizarre. I tried several of them, and didn't like any, except for Coconut Sherbet, which was the only item that didn't have a crazy flavor combination added to it. I give this place two stars based on the flavor of the ice cream I tried, but I'm giving one extra star because the owners are so nice and trying so hard. This is not a 5-star experience.
author: Eater S.

description: It was a nice treat to visit this ice cream shop in the Mission.  The line was out the door and we wished they would have a menu outside listing the flavors of the day, but once we were close enough to peak inside at the menu we were glad we had waited 30 minutes in the cold ;)  I had the fudgesicle and cream cheese chocolate chip.  Both were divine!  I can't wait to see what other flavors they come up with.  I also tasted the Surprise Breakfast and the Vietnamese coffee.  The coffee was spot on!  I wasn't expecting the bourbon taste in the surprise breakfast, but it was a nice "surprise". Terrific!  I'll definitely be back for more...
author: Kat L.

description:
DEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEELICIOUS! Yes!!! I LOVE IT! 

Not to be too repetitive (which it will be) - Vietnamese Blue Bottle Coffee Ice Cream + Secret Cereal + Guiness Gingerbread are the favorites - Cream Cheese Chip was good as well. How does this compare to Bi-Rite? Tough call - I honestly like the texture of Bi-Rite better (and I still love Orange Cardamom), but I like the unique-ness of the flavors better at Humphrey Slocombe. I went daring & even tried the Thai Chili Lime Sorbet - and as unique as it is, it's really not that tasty - unless you want spicy icecream/sorbet. However, isn't the reason you go to get ice cream is to cool down or calm the spices from the Mexican food you just had in the Mission a couple streets down? So going the spicy route wasn't my thing - maybe if they tried Mexican Hot Chocolate (not the Bi-Rite Mexican Chocolate which I do not like).

Anyways, overall a great place - I love this 24th Street Corridor - Yats', Dynamo Doughnuts, Humphrey Slocombe, and more to come. :)
author: Jeannette L.

description: Why is there such a long wait at most of SF's ice cream shops, especially this one?  The flavor names and descriptions sounded amazing, then I tasted a few which didnt live up to all the hype everyone on yelp is talking about.
author: LT B.

description:
Everything about this place is good. The people who work here are a joy to interact with--and I always am gladly offered to try every single flavor out every time I go. Never mind that I've already tasted half of them a few days ago--they always delight in my tasting joy. And I delight in them for it!

Please try: Secret breakfast and Olive oil.
author: Daniela P.

description: i'll only be back if i'm in the neighborhood...it didn't blow me away and it did leave a greasy feeling in my mouth.  never had that with double rainbow or joe's.  if i want to go out of my way for ice cream, i'll make the trek to pollyann's or mitchell's.
author: Jennifer D.

description: We just walked by and noticed the shop but they were closed. Instead we stood in the doorway reading the menu. One of the (presumed) owners spotted us while cleaning up, unlocked the shop and invited us in because he wasnt sure if we raced across town to check it out. We thanked him for being so thoughtful as to not completely ignore us and truthfully I felt bad for interrupting his closing routine. The flavors looked awesomely creative. I am salivating at the chance to go back and try it. You know a guy that gets ice cream tattoos all over his arm is passionate about ice cream.
author: aaron f.

description: Who needs a great location when you have an amazing product!  I have rode my bicycle across the city for Kumquat poppyseed.  This is my new ice cream flavor...sorry Balsamic Strawberry.  Humprey Slocomb has redefined ice cream....How can you not trust a guy that has 31 flavors tattooed on his arm!
author: Matt T.

description: Delicious. Some flavors are kind of odd. But definitely a fun flavor experiment. The parlor is really cute. I have only gone once, and I had licorice, honey thyme, and vietnamese coffee. I hope to go back every couple weeks to try new flavors. The staff was really nice. Parking is a pain there, but that is the only drawback.
author: sadie r.

description:
OMG OMG OMG HEAVEN

THEY MAKE THE BEST ALCOHOL FLAVORED ICE CREAM IN THE WORLD HANDS DOWN HANDS DOWN I ONLY WISH I COULD GET DRUNK OFF OF IT. Secret Breakfast is woooowowowowowow and their whiskey flavor is unspeakably good. 

weird stuff like salt n pepper is worth tasting, if a Russian Roulette. The olive oil is unexpectedly heavenly.
author: C. C.

description: Secret breakfast rocks my socks... And anyone I try to describe it to makes a confused expression, so just go try it. The employees are rad, and even encourage my giddyness when I take forever to chose my flavor. Sorry to anyone standing behind me, but if I make a unsure decision I can't live with myself and will be consumed by the thought of what I could have had until I am distracted by something sparkly or in a whiskey bottle.
author: Brandy E.

description: Great ice cream...perfect portions...decent prices.  I'm a fat kid from the Midwest and very familiar with frozen dairy products. Definitely the best ice cream I've had in California.  Skip the line at Bi-Rite and take a walk to 24th & Harrison.
author: Jon F.

description:
I love that we are in the middle of an ice cream renaissance!

Best time to go - weekday afternoon.  Tons of street parking, and no wait.  Also, they had every flavor in stock.  Tried balsamic caramel, but I like Bi-Rite Sea Salt Caramel better.  Ordered secret breakfast + peanut butter curry and both were outstanding.  My daughter had chocolate passion fruit, and decided after a few licks that she preferred my peanut butter.  I did not care for the choc/passion fruit.

Staff is patient and lets you try flavors which is great.  I wonder how that works when there is a line?  I would be annoyed to be behind the person who could not make a decision until he/she tried 10 flavors.  I tried about 5 flavors, and as soon as someone came in behind me, I placed our order.

Went back on Sunday about 6pm and they were out of ice cream.  They had a few pints left, but nothing to scoop.  

So they get 4 stars instead of 5 because they ran out of ice cream (all of it), and because when I went the first time, they only had one "traditional" flavor (vanilla bean).  I love the exotic combinations, but if I am going to get my purist husband to go with me, he's going to need a choice between a couple of straight up standards.
author: Cindy C.

description: Great ice cream!  Crazy, but delicious flavors.  Very friendly service.  The only disappointment was that there were only a few choices of flavors (many fewer than outlined on their website) on the days I visited.  They need a second freezer to expand selection.
author: p w.

description:
HEY YOU! The weather is beautiful and it is the perfect time to stop in and have some delicious ice cream at Humphry's! I really love this place...
For some time now I could be found staring longingly at the empty structure which would be the new light of my life. What can I say? The flavors are all really original (secret breakfast: bourbon and corn flakes-hangover joke, thai chili lime: refreshing and spicy, etc.) and the website (http://www.humphryslocombe.com)says they will carry even more amazing flavors such as blood orange sorbet, sweet corn blackberry, honey thyme, and pistachio-BACON!! 
Not only that, but the boys who run it are quite cute and charming. Sean with sparkling eyes, and Jake with a variety of ice creams tattooed on his arm (they're in it for the long run). No matter how many times I ask for samples, they oblige. 
Finally, the cookies are delicious! Nothing goes better with fresh baked, warm chocolate oozing cookies than ice cream, especially if you're lactose-intolerant...some things are just worth it.
author: ariana t.

description: Where to start.  Went in because of all the hype and we were really dissapointed.  My kid wanted to try a couple of flavors but the female employee didn't seem to want to allow her any more then one sample (which was a mere speck).  She settled on "tahitian vanilla" without trying it.  It tasted artificial, it was icy and the the vanilla bean flecks were crunchy.  My partner and I decided to share a double scoop which allows you to mix up to 3 flavors.  We decided on ancho chili chocolate, cinnamon brittle and caramel with balsamic vineger, all without sampling because of the poor attitude of aforementioned female employee.  The caramel was so repulsive I had to ask for an extra cup just to get it out of the bowl.  Some guy who was working there commented that it was a strong flavor, I said no, it is actually just gross.  The cinnamon seemed to be lacking in anything remotely tasting like cinnamon.  The ancho chocolate was just weird.  We threw out the entire $8 worth of ice cream after tasting a tiny bit of each flavor.  The employees offered no apologies nor did they offer us any other flavors to try.  There is no way they didn't know we were unhappy.  We will not be back.  Next time we want ice cream we will head back to Bi Rite or Mitchells.
author: Stephanie G.

description:
Best ice cream in SF!

Check out my review on my blog...

http://sweetladysass.blogspot.com/2009/05/hippster-ice-cream-showdown.html
author: alex K.

description:
While the seating is limited here, the ice cream flavors certainly are not!  We sampled several flavors.  Secret Breakfast (aka Bourbon & Cornflakes aka Breakfast of Champions, as I have dubbed it) is definitely a winner.  Fudgesicle is true to its name.  And Maple Walnut is simple and delicious.  My friend Jenny who went back there recently (cuz darn that lucky bastard actually lives in the bay area!) said the olive oil was also surprisingly good.  So that's to try next time, along with foie gras, which I was sad they didn't have available when I was there.  But the winner for me was the clean Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee Ice cream, which I had fancied up as a "tin roof" sundae, which means it was fancied up with fudge, frosted peanuts and maldon salt.  Deelicious!  It was pleasant to have a nice play between the smooth coffee flavor and the saltiness of the peanuts and the sweetness of the fudge.  I was a trooper, making it through my whole sundae while my friends stuck to small cups (regular scoops range from $2.25-4.50).  Sundaes are $6! which ain't bad, they give you a lot of scoopage!  
   One of my fave things about Humphrey too though is that they have fluff as a topping option.  Heck yes!  Bring on the fluff!  I think a fluffernutter type sundae is on my list for next time I go up to the bay.  
  The servers were friendly and chatty, the decor simple, a little too simple almost.  All the walls are white and I think they could use some more splashes of color though.  Other than that and a lack of much seating (small stools at a counter, but there are only about 5 or 6 of them) this place is great and you won't be disappointed with your ice cream!
author: Emily S.

description: I love this place & would have given it 5 stars if the staff were a bit more pleasant. In spite of that, this place is great. No, not every flavor is going to be mind-blowing amazing. But be adventurous - give em a shot. You can taste every flavor they have on hand before you buy, which is the only reason why the line takes so long to move (and it really doesn't take that long anyways).
author: Hotdogger G.

description: This place is creative, welcoming, and delicious   I recommend the olive oil ice cream and the hibiscus beet sorbet - they go well together!
author: Jon S.

description: Get a junior/mini (I can't imagine eating more than this--very strong flavors) and flee for your lives--the two-headed calf taxodermic monstrosity mounted on the wall will ruin your appetite.
author: e a.

description: although the flavors here have unique combinations, you can distinctly taste each ingredient. outstanding flavor and consistency. served in cute little biodegradable cups. i could skip dinner and just eat here. i've sampled some of the other flavors, but secret breakfast keeps me coming back for more. also good are the autumn harvest corn and the blue bottle vietnamese coffee. there are different flavors on a weekly basis.
author: Lisa A.

description: bi rite aint got shit on slocombes !!!!
author: Micah W.

description: Everybody has reviewed the ice cream which, yeah, is pretty damn good, but I don't want to be redundant. I've followed them on Twitter and kept trying to make it in for the Duck Fat Pecan Pies. Yeah, you read that correctly. Finally, I moved literally a block away from the place (coincidence? I think not.) and got to try it out. Holy shit! That D.F.P.P. was so freaking amazing tasting I'm just sad it's $5 a pop. And no it's not enough for two. It's more of a tartlet sized pie, so you've got to savor every single bite because in like three bites, it's gonna be gone. Just go in already, try it, and then spend the next month praying they won't announce that the D.F.P.P. is back so you can pay your taxes or whatever bills are on the horizon. Whatevs. LOVE the D.F.P.P.
author: J F.

description: We just went for the first time tonight and I must say the service was great!  No attitude like you get at Bi Rite sometimes!  The chocolate is outstanding.  Good location to people watch while eat'n the dreamy creamy ice cream.
author: Heith M.

description:
Jakey and his partner (with a nearly rhyming name I can't recall) will let you try every flavor, even if you already have every other time you've been there.

Try the Secret Breakfast or Salt and Pepper.
author: Matthew H.

description: I live right across the street from this place and it's like kryptonite. It is probably the best ice cream you will ever have and the owners/employees are so friendly and hospitable. There is always a line, but even with tasting they move customers very quickly. My favorite flavors are the blue bottle Vietnamese coffee, valhora fudgesicle, and secret breakfast. yum, yum.
author: Eric W.

description: Delicious ice cream! They have the unique flavors similar to those of Bi Rite, but far more unique.. stuff like salt and pepper, lemon buttermilk, etc. (wasn't a fan of them though). I stuck with the malted chocolate and it was great. There's a line out the door too, so it just tells you the ice cream is that great.
author: John S.

description: The craziest flavors! These guys are great! Adventurous flavors one would never imagine in ice cream and surprisingly delicious!  The Secret Breakfast may not be a secret much longer!
author: Steve K.

description: Wow this is some good ice cream.  I had Secret Breakfast with Vitenamese Coffee and it was to die for.  They are giving Bi-Rite some serious competition.  Also tasted the Valhrona Fudgsicle and Guiness Ginger Bread.
author: suzanne c.

description: Secret breakfast with blue bottle coffee ice cream is the BOMB. This is my new fave. I also tried the olive oil and the rose pedals which were spot on. When eating out skip dessert and check this place out. You wont be disappointed
author: Jay M.

description: I just ate the most interesting (and deliciously rich) ice cream I've ever had: "Balsamic Caramel" with a bit of "McEvoy Olive Oil".  Oh and the "Blood Orange" was fantastic too.  I can't wait to go back and try the "Secret Breakfast" and "Peanut Butter Curry".
author: Suzanne D.

description: Took some friends here for a Saturday night after dinner dessert. Delicious!! I had the vanilla which was the most wonderful vanilla ice cream I have had in my life. My husband had the olive oil ice cream which was rich and delicious. Our other friends had the secret breakfast which for sure has actual bourbon. The Vietnamese coffee was fabulous. Fun place, service is ok.
author: julie q.

description: the foodies like to go here and talk about this place. the crazy flavors (peach miso, elvis the fat years) aside, the ice cream really is quite good. so don't be scared, they make it and sell it because it's good. at least get some tastes. it's also very high quality ice cream
author: Dave Y.

description: On my first visit I tried the Olive Oil, Secret Breakfast and the Blue Bottle Vietnamese coffee. All three had great flavor. With a nice consistent creamy ice cream as the base, I am excited to work my way through the 50 flavors they have planned. Also, being able to get two flavors in a small cup is a nice touch. Humphrey Slocombe is a welcome addition to 24th Street.
author: Brendan R.

description: This place is fantastic! The selection of flavors are so interesting and unique--definitely gives Bi-Rite a run for its money. The ice cream here is much more varied and doesn't require a 45 minute wait in line like Bi Rite does. I waited about 3 minutes before I got to order. I had Almond Date Ice Cream with Amarena Cherries on top. It was a great combo of flavors and left we wanting to go back and try every flavor they had. The place is located in a much less travelled area of Mission,  which makes it a very "sweet" find!
author: S A.

description: all I have to say is....DUCK FAT PECAN PIE.....oh yeah....you read right.....thankyouthankyouthankyou HS
author: Phaedra E.

description: Secret Breakfast was super.  Val-howeveryouspellit-ona fudgesicle was fine - not fabulous.  I still prefer Mitchell's.
author: Miss M.

description:
i'm still dreaming about the secret breakfast icecream. this place makes me want to live in the city, and i've never wanted to live in the city; berkeley has suited me just fine.

4 stars for now, i'll have to go back and try more flavors for that last star.
author: Amanda C.

description: I love ice cream and am a groupie for creative takes on it. I had the Vietnamese Blue Bottle coffee ice cream (delicious, but kinda made my mouth buttery afterwards) and the salted licorice, which completely made my day! Secret breakfast was also really good! (So were all the other flavors, which I all sampled)
author: Mary C.

description: Humphry's unique flavors are what keeps making me come back to try more. I recently discovered this place a few weeks ago with a coworker & I tried all of the flavors they had to offer that day. The staff was really friendly & patient with my indecisiveness, and they remembered us the other times we came in. "Jesus Juice" & "Thai Chili Lime" both taste really interesting, but  I don't think I could eat a whole cup of that. "Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee" tastes like regular coffee to me. But "Cinnamon Brittle," "Secret Breakfast," & "Oolong tea" has to be my favorite flavors (that I've tried so far). They also offer sundaes, toppings, brownies, fudge, ice cream sandwiches, & bacon peanut brittle (what is that?!). Humphry's rotates their flavors everyday, which I think keeps their crowd coming in. It's a cute neighborhood ice cream shop with about six countertop seats. Don't forget to have some cash in hand; they're cash only!
author: BrendaJoy G.

description: Ok this is one of the most awesome ice cream places on the planet, very possibly the best thing on earth.  Go there.  All the time.
author: Elizabeth v.

description: Divine ice-cream. We'd jut had brunch so I wanted to go for something on the lighter side. I tried the very dark and delicious Vahlrona chocolate fudgesicle, balsamic caramel, fragrant beet and hibiscus sorbet, the McEvoy olive oil and something with walnuts. I went for the chocolate fudgesicle and the balsamic caramel - a yummy combo. My next-door neighbour went yesterday and is raving about the gingerbread and Bluebottle Coffee! Will go back soon. The husband still prefers Bi-Rite Creamery, though!
author: Writer G.

description: Crazy, unique flavors of ice cream ! Good ice cream..enjoyed their balsamic caramel. Ice cream at Humphry is a little bit more to the melted and soft side tho. Try to go early if you want a bigger selection....cuz we went there at 3pm and alot of flavors were out.
author: stephanie n.

description: This place gives Scoops (Ice cream spot down in Hollywood) a run for its money.  They have very unique flavors and they are always changing it up.  Some flavors are a hit or miss, like the thai chili lime one i just HAD to try.  Didn't expect too much going in, and i was correct not to...although it's very true to it's name...tasted just like thai chili and limes! The service there was excellent...they patiently waited for us to try almost all the flavors (we divied it up btwn the 3 of us so we wouldnt take forever) even tho there is a constant line out the door.  Also sampled the peanut butter curry which was surprisingly good, but i didnt think i could stand a whole scoop of it.  My favorite was definetly the olive oil flavor! has a great fruity taste to it and i wish i had some right now!  I will definetly be back next time im in the bay area. i took off a star because they actually forgot our order (but they were very nice and apologized when they found out) and the floor is a sticky mess...but hey, it's ice cream!
author: A L.

description: Had my first taste of their ice cream at Mission Street Food and was delighted by the Secret Breakfast!  Had to visit the place to get another fix of it!  Only complaint was that they were out of almost half of what was on the menu, probably didn't help that it was 10 minutes until closing when I stopped by.  I'll try again earlier in the day next time; "breakfast" for lunch anybody?!?!
author: D. E.

description:
ice cream?  misnomer, i says

this stuff is barely ice cream!  but maybe not in a bad way... if you actually like regular food in ice cream form.  i mean, the SALT AND PEPPER ice cream... tastes exactly how it sounds, as did the BALSAMIC CARAMEL.... very vinegary.... and the SECRET BREAKFAST, which is bourbon and corn flakes, tasted very bourbony... 

interesting.... but nothing i'd want a whole scoop of..

so i stuck with chocolate, coffee, and dulche.  however... the CHOCOLATE was a little grainy, not creamy enough, but extraordinarily chocolatey... it was kinda like dark chocolate brownie mix.  the DULCHE was very sweet, but i like sweet ;) i think the COFFEE was the best.... strong but rich and sweeet

interesting.... but i think i'll stick to bi-rite (http://www.yelp.com/biz/bi-rite-creamery-san-francisco#hrid:hDB2_w-FgQbc3el-aUvhVQ)
author: Christina L.

description: Sorry but the flavors are a little too hipster for me.  I tried Secret Breakfast and really don't see what the big hoopla is about. Give me Bi-Rite or Mitchell's over this any day.
author: Heather W.

description: I went here for the first time today. Pretty awesome. I had the fudgesicle sorbet and the malted dulce. Delicious. What I don't like is the no cone thing, the teeny tiny tasting spoons, and the fact that they are obvi biting off Bi-rite. What I do like is one of the guys working there has awesome tattoos of  little ice creams and cakes on his arm, the flavors that keep it interesting (although some I can't imagine someone wanting to eat an entire scoop of some of them), and it's nice they have some seating inside. It's in a cool area, but they don't have Dolores Park:) I'd go back often if in the neighborhood but if Bi-Rite and Humphry Slocombe were right next to each other, I'd pick Bi-Rite.
author: AM L.

description: i like the balsamic caramel and they have other interesting flavors.  unfortunately, bi-rite has my heart when i'm craving ice cream in the mission.
author: Helen T.

description: I don't know what's up with the unusually hot weather in SF right now, but at least it's given me a legitimate reason to get some ice cream. So after grabbing some Mexican food with my dad, we came to Humphrey's. I ordered the small size with one scoop of the vietnamese coffee and one scoop of the secret breakfast. My dad got the balsamic flavor and the vietnamese coffee flavor. Comparing Humphrey's to Bi-Rite, Humphrey's definitely gives bigger scoops of ice cream. My dad didn't really care for the balsamic flavor, but he enjoyed the vietnamese coffee. I agree with him on the coffee flavor, it's just really good, my words will not give you the full experience of actually tasting it. Secret breakfast is tasty as well, you can taste the flavor of bourbon which is okay with me because I love the crunchy texture that comes with it. The creaminess of the ice cream is something I'm not used to but  that's not a bad thing. I'm definitely going to come back to try the Prosciutto flavor!
author: Lauren L.

description:
How can you take intense flavors such as thai chilli & lime and sorbet it just so delicately?  Humphy Slocombe knows how! 
Yes, we strolled into this on our 24th street post-dinner hunt for dessert! 
And no kidding we were pleasant surprised by this new find!  Enough bite for me to remember to cry for yelp!

Their Olive oil icecream is my personal favorite (& I'd rate this right up there alongwith other top picks such as the Ginger Flavor @ Birite Ice creamery and Lucuma or JackFruit  at Mitchell's.)
author: Sri S.

description:
the downsides: 
a. long line -  about 45 minutes total - granted, I visited post-the latest NY Times lauding,
b. running low on flavors, and totally out of the ones [cinnamon brittle + malted dolce de leche] I wanted by late afternoon on a Saturday.

outweighed by the upsides:
a. amazing balsamic vinegar,
b. creative flavors, but some so much so that a single bite'll do you,
c. Edison light bulbs,
d. stellar Tahitian vanilla with phenomenal texture,
e. two-headed calf on the wall,
f. friendly kids dishing the scoops.
author: Allie H.

description:
I was feeling a little guilty about going to try this place, since I love Mitchell's, but that guilt quickly dissipated with one little sample of the Secret Breakfast (Shhh...) ice cream. I was delighted to find this new ice parlor, just a few blocks from my place. I was warmly greeted by the staff and was generously offered sample after sample. A single serving ($3.25) includes two scoops. I chose the Secret Breakfast and the Vietnamese Coffee, a perfect combination. The name alone intrigued me, but upon finding out what the secret ingredients are, I had to try it. My guess was bacon, but I was wrong...and you'll have to find out for yourself.

The ice cream is delicious, the staff is friendly and the shop is cute. I will definitely be back. I'm kinda scared that it's so close to my house.
author: Marilen G.

description: In the pantheon of great ice cream, this has got to be at the top.  It's beyond ice cream, but more of a tourist destination.  This is where I take friends from out of town, and I live in the south bay -- it's that good.  All the reviews on Secret Breakfast are true.  Doesn't sound interesting, until you try it.  Just a perfect ice cream.  I lived in the midwest for years, and this is up there with many local creameries out there (except HS has better flavors).  Treat yourself and go here.
