author: michael d.

description: Mmmm... SECRET BREAKFAST.... Well, we got there at dusk-ish, of coarse like everywhere else in frisco, it was impossible to find parking. We circled 4-5 times then just decided to block a driveway. There was about 10 people in line, and 5-6 people standing around eating their ice cream. Flavors...Jesus Juice, Olive Oil,  Blue Bottle Viet. Coffee, Balsamic Caramel, Honey Thyme, Walnut Maple, PB & Curry, Tahitian Vanilla Secret Breakfast and Milk and Honey  or Honey graham (I think there was graham cracker in that mix I Don't remember) I tasted all except for the vanilla and coffee. The woman behind the counter was not at all pleasant, she was not happy giving me samples, hello... you guys have flavors with names like Secret Breakfast and Jesus Juice among the few, how am I suppose to know how it tastes, if I don't ask for a sample. She was passing me flavors so quick I wasn't able to keep up, and it wasn't like there were a million people in line. Sheesh!!! Please be nicer.  I ended up with two scoops of the SECRET BREAKFAST...YUMMY. The flavors are unique and totally cannot be judged for you. They were a tad too sweet, but hey its dessert. My SECRET BREAKFAST did leave a lardy feel in my mouth after I was done, do they put lard/shortening in ice cream? there was wax like, flavorless flecks in the ice cream I dunno? But it was heavenly...Mmmm... went great with the sugar cone... Mmmm...
author: guppeee p.

description: Julie told me about Humphrey Slocombe ice cream parlor recently, & we got to try it out over the past week-end.  I had to run down the block barefooted to retrieve my two socks because this ice cream's awesomeness blew them clean off my feet, not to mention my sneakers!  I chose creme fraiche & Blue Bottle coffee, a combination that I most mightily recommend to the san francisco latte sipping set.  Divinity!  That coffee ice cream tasted positively Guatemalan!  Who woulda thought one could take a perfectly flavored cup of coffee and make a perfectly flavored cup of coffee, only miraculously chameleonated into cold cream form?  And what's more, they do it in house!  I enjoy watching.  I enjoyed watching the cream get churned in that little frozen windowed room  in the parlor.  I liked Humphry's out of the way location along a strip of 24th street that I hope to explore soon.  I liked the absence of parking, I liked yellow hair and smiles and excellent, freshly scooped ice cream.  And I do indeed love the brown recycled cups in which they served.  Serve it up again, Slocombe.  Be my ineffable Florida!
author: Roland C.

description:
mainly i just like that they have weird flavors like jesus juice and curry peanut butter.  i think creativity in and of itself deserves attention.  and i liked my ice cream.  if you're not an adventurous eater you probably won't like this place.  but if you are, you will.

i got jesus juice (coca cola + red wine) and secret breakfast (bourbon + corn flakes) together.  they were both great.  the breakfast could have been improved by more corn flakes (i only found one in my scoop) but it still tasted good. 

and yeah, the people who were working definitely had that unfortunate combination of being kind of unfriendly plus kind of incompetent (the latter is what really bugs me though).

i disagree with someone's assessment of the neighborhood.  if you think this is in a scary neighborhood you should move to a real city.  

the worst part was that there were these yuppies and their children in line in front of me.  they were annoying.
author: Enid S.

description:
i really love ice cream.  i've tried them all.  slocombe does not do much for me.

this place sucks.  here's why:

the flavors are way too strong.  the rose water flavor is literally disgusting.

secret breakfast is O.K., but can you really carry an entire business on one flavor??  i guess we will find out.  

decorator please!  the scene inside is so bleak that i had plenty of time to think about how i should be exercising instead of eating ice cream.

and who advised them to close for the after dinner crowd?

good luck slocombe!  try something new and lighten up on those flavor crystals.
author: will h.

description: foi gras ice cream sandwich was awesome.. i wonder if they still have it
author: Cindy L.

description: the best ice cream cone ever to grace my lips. it is all about secret breakfast and the delicious bourbon caramel sauce. the pumpkin 5 spice was also amazing, as was the tahitian vanilla bean. honey and thyme was third. the lavender one not so much. if i lived nearby i would weigh 100000000 pounds.
author: laura c.

description: I just came from there and I had several taste and ended up getting 1 scoop of Blue Bottle Vietnamese Ice Cream. I will definitely come back! Loved the different flavors!
author: Jen T.

description: still 5 stars but i'd go to bi-rite before i go to humphry slocombe. i like the flavors better.
author: Regina C.

description: I really appreciate unusual flavors when they taste good, but all too often the flavors here are weirder than they are delicious. A lot of them also tend to be overly salty for my taste. I actually had the salt & pepper on purpose, combined with half a scoop of something chocolaty to balance it out, but the chocolate was ALSO salty. No good. I prefer the simpler fruit flavors here.
author: Emily F.

description: if you ever wondered what an angel shits, it's humphry slocombe vietnamese coffee flavored ice cream.
author: Arlene S.

description:
this place is a perfect example of how dumb people are.  wrap mediocre quality ice cream in a slick package with a catchy/ obscure name and blindingly terrible flavor combos, and you've got the mission's latest addition to yuppie ice cream madness: Humphry Slocombe. two stars for nice decor, friendly service and purportedly tasty baked goods.

don't get me wrong, I'm a slave to ice cream goodness, and a huge fan of both bi-rite creamery (salted caramel!) and mission classic, Mitchell's (ube dipped!).   I've fallen for the lure of Slocombe's on 2 occasions, but NO MORE.  

ice cream should be creamy, not ice chunky.  it should taste good, sweet even. well- let me tell you, pistachio bacon, olive oil, balsamic caramel, and (overly) salted licorice are as bad as they sound.  in fact, they are worse.  i tried, and then i tried again, but the assault on my senses must stop. haagen dazs caramel cone will do just fine.  i don't need boring or basic, but i do need creamy and tasty.
author: kaye C.

description: nothign exciting, expensive icecream. i had the chocolate flavor and the viet coffee one. they are supersuper strong. need some water afterward.
author: just k.

description: Interesting concept here, but better in theory, than in reality. Samples are given on little "sustainable" steel spoons. Cute, but beware, one was dirty! Bright goopy lipstick on a so-called clean spoon. Gross. The place was slow. We were the only customers in there. The girl behind the counter was very condescending. Having driven across town to experience Humphry's ice cream for the first time, we were disappointed to learn that they did not have any of the most unusual flavors Yelpers have written about. Oh well, it was a beautiful day outside. Typically I would simply chalk this up to another SF adventure, but the service was really terrible. We were spoken to as if we were stupid, and as though we should already know the answers to any of our questions. So strange! Back to the ice cream though, the Surprise Breakfast was good. Without such peculiar attitude from the ice cream clerk, I might consider going back. On second thought, why give good dollars away to a business that does not place high value on customer service.
author: Sarah B.

description: I love this place. It's always good and the people are always nice. But here's the deal, people: it's not the kind of place where you can expect everybody to like everything. They're not trying to be "safe" about the flavors here. Yeah, they have vanilla, but they also sell flavors like balsamic-caramel. I personally love this one, but I have a couple of friends who don't like vinegar so they won't like this flavor. Some people don't eat pork, but some folks are going to enjoy the prosciutto ice cream. The fact is, there is something for everyone and they are happy to let you sample flavors. I see too many people complaining about the 'weird' flavors... well, if you don't want 'weird', don't get it. Get the excellent vanilla or coffee ice cream that they have pretty much all the time. And I don't understand the people who say that they've encountered rudeness... are you sure you weren't at Bi-Rite, because every time I go there, I feel like the Soup Nazi is behind the counter. At HS, the peeps are ALWAYS super cool. It's a big reason why I go here instead of there. Whatever... both places have a superior product, but I like HS better for the more adventurous flavors and rad people that work there... as for Mitchell's... yeah they're really good too, but I wouldn't put them in the same category as HS or Bi-Rite, so I kinda don't get the comparisons. Just try this place out. You won't be sorry, and if you are, then you're probably just a really bitter person. It's ice cream. Eat it and be happy.
author: Zoe K.

description: I want to love this place, but the servings are very small and not all of the flavors work. Cute place though in a great neighborhood and it is ambitious!
author: B.M. B.

description:
the balsamic really tastes like balsamic. i bet you could eat it with your tossed salad.. if you like creamy dressing that is. dot dot dot

anyway, the breakfast flavor with bourbon reminds me of my rumcake, and really tastes like bourbon for your alcoholic cravings. and the coffee is what i bought a fat pint of. sweeter than haagen dazs 

creamier than cool whip. the coconut was also as pleasant as the winter snow on your trees at christmas

friendly staff, but the door doesnt close by itself. think im a doorman or something!? also "small bills are the bomb" blow em up!
author: Porkers T.

description: Try these unique flavors with catchy names.  I liked peanut butter and curry and salt and pepper with hot fudge.  I'm going back to try other  flavors, 'secret breakfast' (cornflakes and Bourbon), frois gras ( I heard it's $40 bucks a pint), olive oil and balsamic vinegar  and more.  The ice cream is rich and creamy.  Don't be a woos, the area is fine.  Afterwards, check out Philz coffee. The barrista knows her stuff.
author: Carole L.

description: Nice staff.  Interesting, unusual flavors.  A bit pricey.  I like the outdoor seating.  Long line sometimes.
author: Tuesday J.

description: Tried Humphrys for the first time. I sampled a few different flavors but the one that really stood out was the tahitian vanilla. Lots of parking out front, has a bit of a line but well worth it.
author: Yvonne N.

description: It's too much like Bi-rite, but they have weirder flavors. I tried at least 7 flavors (secret breakfast, balsamic caramel, olive oil, thai chili lime, valrhona fudgesicle, vietnamese coffee, salt & pepper) but none of them really satisfied me as much as Bi-Rite's coffee toffee or salt caramel.
author: Retired B.

description: While I'd have to go more than once to give Humphry Slocombe an out-and-out five stars, all I can say is, the first time around was sublime. Humphry Slocombe is ice cream with a twist; they have the oddest flavors you can possibly imagine(don't ask for anything "normal". you won't get it) and switch up most of their flavors on a day to day basis(the day I went most of theirs revolved around beer, for instance), and yet somehow, their extremely odd flavors seem to turn out to be delicious. I had the Tahitian Vanilla and Backwater Belgian something-or-other and while the Tahitian didn't appeal to me(I'm picky with food) the Belgian was possibly the best chocolate ice cream I've had, and I also tasted my friend's coffee ice cream which was excellent.  They only take cash and serve only in cones or small cups, but it's bustling for a reason. The line when I was there was enough to prove popularity but not dauntingly long, and the decor is lovely; some really exquisite food pictures line the walls. Quirky, stylish, and delicious - I highly recommend Humphry's. Mmm.
author: Claire H.

description: with flavors like foie gras, pistachio bacon, salt and pepper, and hibiscus beet....need i say more?  this place is a gem of an ice cream shop with fantastically whimsical flavors that are creative yet delicious!  i've tried the secret breakfast (bourbon and cornflakes), and i think i got buzzed off it, which makes me like this place even more hahaha.  they only have about 10-12 flavors available daily, which they rotate.  i wish it wasn't so far away, so i could try it every day :(  i also tried the panut butter curry, which tastes like satay sauce, and the buttermilk strawberry, which is slightly salty.  can't wait to go back!
author: Angie L.

description: i gave this place a second go and mmm im in love. blue bottle coffee, secret breakfast and my friend got the "hot mess" that was deeelicious.
author: Britney K.

description: I am in love, people, and his name is Humphry Slocombe.  I was overwhelmed with the flavors but I was patiently helped by the person behind the counter.  I left incredibly happy with a pint of half Secret Breakfast and half Balsamic Caramel and a little scoop of Cream Cheese Chip.  Simply amazing!!
author: Rebecca F.

description: Hmm Bi-Rite has got some competition now. I like that it's not shi-shi cutesy, doesn't have a mile-long line outside, and is new enough to still be daring with its flavors and not take itself too seriously. Sometimes the flavors don't always work--the Balsamic Caramel was a little too strong for me--but most of the time, they are really delicious and interesting, like Olive Oil and Secret Breakfast. The Blue Bottle coffee flavor is THE BEST coffee ice cream I've tried. Counter girls were nice, there was good music over the loudspeakers, it was just really laid back. Price is comparable to Bi-Rite. I would definitely come here again.
author: Tammy C.

description: They have very unique flavors and the price is reasonable. Definitely going back again... Keep up the good work!
author: A H.

description: Take one part heaven, one part sugar, one part cream, and one part creativity. Say hello to Humphry Slocombe icecream. With flavors ranging from jesus juice (red wine and coca cola) to thai chilli lime (!) you might not know what to get but you surely know  what to expect. Probably the most innovative icecream i have ever set my tongue on. Personal favorites: valrhona Fudgesicle, Balsamic caramel, red hot banana. If you are lucky and willing go for the olive oil icecream. Somehow, the much acclaimed secret breakfast flavor was meh. I usually end up going to Humphrey's pre-dinner and Bi-rite post  -dinner when I am in the mission.
author: Eatie N.

description: i had a bit of trouble finding this place the first time around because the sign for it is really small, and it is placed on the sidewalk, but i'd say the small bit of effort it took to locate humphry was worth it. i tried almost all of the flavors there today, which admittedly were a little strange at first, but turned out to be quite delectable. the proprietor (i think?) recommended the secret breakfast, so i paired that up with milk chocolate and berries. the combination was great, and the secret breakfast really was as good as advertised. the bourbon taste is very subtle, but still present enough to give the creamy ice cream a bit of sting. the crunchy flakes were definitely a nice touch. ya, it was the middle of the afternoon, but it's always a good time for a touch of liquor and some good dairy. i still stick by bi-rite, but humphry slocombe comes in high on my list of creameries. it cost about 3.25 for a cup with two pretty generous scoops of ice cream, so prices are definitely reasonable. i wish they had more variety though. most combination flavors have a berry involved. don't get me wrong; i love berries, but i could do with some variety.
author: Danny C.

description: Next stop on the mission food fest! I was craving some ice cream and really wanted to come back to Humphry Slocombe. The first time I came and had the candied jalapeno strawberry and thai lime chili, loved it. Even the samples of olive oil ice cream or salt and pepper were tasty (never really got into the breakfast one, I'm not a cornflakes person). The flavors intrigued me. However, the last 3 times I came back, I was hard pressed to find an ice cream that I actually wanted to eat more than a taste (I'm a fan of fruit flavors over chocolate for ice creams). And this time was the same - I should have gotten the thai lime chili (but at the time, forgotten that I had it before). The Guinness gingerbread was interesting (such that I want to actually make a gingerbread from Guinness) and the pink lady sorbet was really odd tasting (tasted like pepto). So in the end, I didn't get anything but a spoon and chomped on a few bites of my hubbys hot fudge sundae with vanilla. Their fudge is pretty good, the vanilla ice cream, nothing special. I am still intrigued by their flavors (which is why I gave them 3 stars) and would come back, but i think BiRite will be my next ice cream stop.
author: Cammy H.

description: secret breakfast(corn flakes and bourbon).... enough said.
author: Clodel G.

description: Seriously, class all the way.  From the stainless steel tasting spoons to the 1920s stools from a Boston Woolworths, there is nothing wrong with this place.  Much artistry went into the creation of this place- unique, delicious flavors and an excellent use of space (including but not limited to the viewing room where you can see the ice cream chef creating the delicious flavors).
author: pauline e.

description: I had the Secret Breakfast and black sesame. I was done. I love the unctious mouth feel and the creaminess of the whole thing! I love how it's not hard and crystalized, just perfect for licking! Thank you Mr Ice Cream Man!
author: gaspar v.

description: very interesting flavors. i had secret breakfast (bourbon ice cream with corn flakes) which had an excellent rich bourbon flavor. very warm atmosphere and though they were busy it wasn't overcrowded and i could find a seat both inside or outside.
author: Leuwam T.

description: very creative flavors but the taste didn't quiet develop well , had the secret breakfast and the  juicy something , maybe next time i 'll try something else . cheers
author: NAEL K.

description: love the unique flavors--especially balsamic caramel!
author: Andrew M.

description: Move over Bi-Rite Creamery, there is a new super adventurous ice cream sheriff in town. This ice cream is to die for, the flavor combinations are insane, Salt and Pepper? Olive Oil? Secret Breakfast? CRAZY? Crazy delicious that is! You owe it to your self to step out of your Neapolitan box and give these guys a try. Additionally they are super friendly guys, and a great addition to the neighborhood. I can't wait to try the new flavors they think up next!
author: Nick H.

description: really good ice cream, i love it!  they have very unique ice creams.  when i stepped in this place, i think, hmm, what would be my delighted surprise today?  i can't wait to go back!
author: Sophia L.

description: Salt n Pepper ice cream - that alone should tell anyone enough about the flavors and creativity behind this little joint. Now I hail from Custard Town - Custardville - Wisonsinites are fond of the heavy, creamy, eggy, custard for a chill pill (and the associated caloric bomb).  I've become less of a custard fan as my palate ages...gracefully.  On my last visit to my brother (fellow Yelper) in San Fran I asked if we could go here for ice cream. HAD to know what the talk was about. Well, I'll tell you it was a fine fine FINE place to recover from the plane ride out to San Fran. On the suggestion of the most helpful scooper - I had 2 scoops - 1 coffee and 1 Salt n Pepper. Odd combination to the ear. But holy cripes - is it a sensation to the taste buds. So much so I had to go back the next day and have some more - - (but be aware the flavors change).  In a nutshell - its not gimmicky, its a simple formula with some inventive flavors. No frills. I appreciate they are not in some commercially place - its a neighborhood. Its not pretentious. Its ice cream. Its good. Oh and you can walk off any guilt you may feel for over consumption.
author: Amy G.

description: Great ice cream, if you're into exotic flavors. Surprisingly, the parking and line was not an issue on one of the city's hottest days. Perhaps, it's because this place is still a bit of a secret. Enjoy!
author: Joe C.

description: Bi Rite will always be my favorite. But this place is a fun venture if the lines at Bi-Rite are too long or you are in the mood for more adventurous ice cream flavors.
author: Kevin K.

description: tasty ice cream - line can be intimidating, but they move you along pretty fast. i only really go for two flavors there: blue bottle vietnamese coffee and secret breakfast. nice spot for tasty ice cream. a good way to finish off a heavy burrito from el faralito around the corner. w00t.
author: Brian L.

description: this is what ice cream should be. both high quality and adventurous flavors. i love the vietnamese coffee, mcevoy olive oil and balsalmic. i've had a couple of flavors that i didn't jive too well with (thai chili, no thanks) but i suppose that's the cost of all the bold and creative flavors they have. yum...
author: cyrus t.

description: After several failed attempts to try Humphry Slocombe in the evening (they close at 9pm on Fri/Sat, making it a mad dash to get there after dinner in the Mission), I met a friend here mid-day.  The staff was fantastic - suggesting we try almost all flavors before committing.  The McEvoy Olive Oil was grassy and fresh...the Secret Breakfast is already a legend...and to mix it up I tried the Peanut Butter Curry.  It was REALLY good - better than Bi-Rite Creamery, but not quite as good as Tara's Organic Ice Cream in Berkeley.  I would give it 4.5 stars.
author: Lori G.

description: finally came here last month.  the flavors were intriguing but i played it safe and got coconut and  vietnamese coffee. i tasted and liked the olive oil flavor, which was mild and yummy, kind of an updated/2009 version of vanilla.
author: Elle B.

description: this place is decent.  the olive oil and the salt and pepper were quite interesting.  but the flavors were mostly not super memorable to me.  which doesn't make sense because they're all so original.  it's all just ok.  i'll definitely go back to try other flavors but there was nothing that wowed me
author: a g.

description: I finally made it down here after reading all the incredible reviews. I sampled the milk chocolate passionfruit, the balsamic caramel, the miso pear and Vietnamese coffee. I loved them all except the pear. I am not a fan of bourbon, but the secret breakfast looked yummy. I wish they were closer to my home - it's a bit out of the way.
author: Keromi K.

description: This ice cream is good. I'll admit, I do have a special place in my heart for Bi-Rite. It's so fun to get ice cream and walk over to Dolores Park especially when it's sunny, but I think I could grow to love this place too :) I sampled the Olive OIl (interesting, and surprisingly good), the Balsamic Caramel (I may like Bi-Rite's Salted Caramel better), the Secret Breakfast, and the Vietnamese Blue Bottle Coffee. The coffee was my fav. Tastes just like an iced coffee. I also tried a chocolate chip cookie (couldn't resist). It was okay, but not great. I was sad about that because anyone who knows me knows I love cookies. They also had brownies and cute little carrot cake cupcakes that looked yummy. The shop is cute, and clean. I love that they have little tables outside. They'll come handy when the weather gets nice. The only thing is that there isn't much to do on this street yet, but I'm sure there will be. But I do have one question...If I eat a scoop of the Vietnamese Blue Bottle Coffee and Secret Breakfast can I consider that a complete meal?
author: Holly E.

description: this place has crazy flavors which is good cuz its not like every other  ice cream places and maybe only 15 to choose from. my uncle discovered this place on yelp and i can say that we werent dissappointed when we went for the first time. i had the vietnamese coffee and the breakfast special which is made with corn flakes and burbon. yum! bomb! it had a lot of burbon which im not complainting about haha. try it out good place if you are looking to try crazy flavors.
author: stacy l.

description: I finally got a chance to try in out this weekend. I got Balsamic Caramel, which was good and Peanut Butter Curry that was mouth watering DELICIOUS! It's great to grab a cone and walk around and check out all the beautiful murals nearby. ENJOY!
author: Robb P.

description: I've just discovered the gourmet ice cream thing that seems to be happening lately.  I just tried Bi-rite the other day and while in their line I met someone who recommended that I try Humphrey Slocomb's, they said it was just like Bi-rite but without the line, this turned out to not be true.  In any case,  I must say that I absolutely loved Bi-rite but I kept my flavor choice traditional with coconut and banana, while at HS I tried a somewhat crazy flavor choice of peanut butter curry, coupled with Tahitian Vanilla.  I thought the peanut butter curry was interesting but it didn't knock my socks off but I really enjoyed it.  I'm excited to return and try other crazy flavors, I love this place.
author: L G.

description: Balsamico Caramel might top both Salted Caramel (Bi-Rite) and Burnt Caramel (Ici).  I did not try Hibiscus Beet, but I'm glad it was there.
author: Rob P.

description: So, I was a complete hater before coming here. One of my friends told me about this place and said they had olive oil and bacon ice cream. I was disgusted. When i got there, I was like is this it. The place is so plain and theres not even a lit up sign. BUT then i tried the ice cream flavors. AMAZING. The staff was very friendly and let me try all the flavors I wanted to my hearts desire. Olive oil turned out to be really good. It had a certain sweetness to it that cant be described. Standouts are definitely the secret breakfast and the Vietnamese coffee. I am officially a convert! Love the unique flavors. Now i only wish it wasn't so far out in the mission!
author: Kush P.

description: I love this place! I admit that I was skeptical about flavors such as olive oil, but I absolutely fell in love with the unique ingredients. The service was very friendly, and I was able to taste a handful of flavors before making my final decision. I will be going back often!
author: Lane S.

description: I love the unique flavors. I wish that the ice cream had more chunks, but it was a nice creamy consistency. I had the secret breakfast (bourbon and corn flakes) and Vietnamese coffee...really good, but they actually gave me too much ice cream for a single! I was really overwhelmed but happy that it was only $3.25.
author: Cassie C.

description: i want you all to understand that I LOVE ICE CREAM.  i came here knowing they were gourmet, and tried the beer ice cream.  a bit gross.  there was nothing acquired about it.  so i got that and the vietnamese coffee which was good.  but here's the thing: i had to stop eating it.  i dont know what it was, but it was like too heavy or creamy or something. i always finish ice cream.  i just don't get it.  i'll stick to bi-rite or joe's.
author: shar d.

description:
Everytime I come to Humphrey's or Slocombe's as it is affectionately called, I Tweet a new fave flavah of that day! Every Day! HA HA I Wish! I live in Excelsior so it's a two muni bus trip but TOTALLY WORTH IT it is my FAVE creamery such amazing sophisticated unusual flavahs! It's like Willy Wonka Ice Creamery [the cornflakes really taste like CORN FLAKES!] The staff are really sweet and patient you can literally try every kind and I love that the flavors change daily/weekly...My Faves are Secret Breakfast, Salted Licorice[really good black licorice flavah], Cream Cheese Chocolate Chip, IPA Beer w/ Rye Brittle!, Oolong Tea [go to bed Green Tea we sick of you], Gov't Cheese [yow cheese ice cream!], Rose Petal Creme Fraiche, Salt n Pepper and the Vietnamese Coffee is the creamiest coffee ice cream I ever had! and who knows what tomorrow will add to my faves list...I have yet to try Faux Gras!!! I am sure I will love it!
Thankyou Humphrey Slocombes for coming to the heart of the mission and bringing me back to it as well!!!
author: Tryntje R.

description: Blue Bottle Coffee in the form of ice cream?  Genius.  My hubby and I finally made it down to the much-anticipated Humphry Slocombe this afternoon.  We got 1 Scoop of Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee + 1 Scoop of "Secret Breakfast" (bourbon and corn flakes!).  The Blue Bottle Vietnamese Coffee was rich in flavor and had great depth of flavor.  Your typical run of the mill coffee ice cream starts off with a bang of delightful coffee flavor but screeches to a disappointing halt when it comes to elevating your tastebuds to another level of creamy bliss - not Humphry Slocombe's. If you're a Blue Bottle fiend like we are, the aroma alone will win your heart, but the creaminess of the condensed milk leaves you with a smooth milky finish.  The "Secret Breakfast" demands your attention because of the bourbon and keeps you interested with the corn flake clusters.  Definitely tasty and unique, but halfway through, I found the bourbon to be too overpowering versus the initial enjoyable zing.  If you want to play it safe, you can't go wrong with the coffee.  I'd have to agree with other yelpers that the texture and consistency of Bi-Rite edges out Humphry Slocombe.  But if you're looking for variety and over-the-top flavors that keep you guessing, try Humphry Slocombe.  Happy tasting!
author: Jana H.

description: This place is wonderful.  Many flavors and they have the patience to let you try alot of ice cream before deciding on what you want.  My favorite is the combination of Blue Bottle Coffee with the Maple Walnut. But also the Cream Cheese Chocolate Chip is extremely good.   Cookies are excellent.  I have lived in the mission on my life and this is the best ice cream i have tasted.
author: Edna T.

description: Yum.  Bi-Rite has some serious competition.  Flavors are a little funkier than Bi-Rite, but all that I tried (and they happily let me try nearly all of them) were delicious.  I had the Thai chili lime sorbet and the coconut sherbet.  Kind of weird to have my mouth on fire after eating ice cream, but I liked it.
author: Laura S.

description: 2 days in SF impelled 3 crosstown visits. it's not even remotely conveniently located, but it's that good. and the flavors change daily.
author: Rebecca L.

description: it's no longer a secret breakfast...but it's soooo delicious even a chocolate lover will love it
author: Bingo T. K.

description: mmm so creamy! i actually don't like coffee ice cream, but the blue bottle vietnamese coffee here won me over. this flavor and the secret breakfast (cornflakes + bourbon + vanilla ice cream) are must-haves! i tried the salt and pepper and even that was good. i hate to say it, but i think this place may be better than bi-rite... shhhh!
author: EY L.
